description: Season 3, Episode 10: Chapter 36

title: Taxi Flings Take a Back Seat to Uber
description: It started innocently enough: Rachel Rabbit White, a journalist in her 20s who writes about sex, was hailing a taxi with her boyfriend at the time and a female friend after a Lower East Side party.

title: Split Over Obamas Affordable Care Act
description: Outside the Supreme Court on Wednesday, supporters and opponents of the Affordable Care Act gathered ahead of the arguments over the fate of President Obamas health care law.

title: Washington Fights for Its Right to Sled
description: News from the nations capital: Let there be snow! And sledding!

title: Yale Report Clears Police Officer in Encounter With Student
description: An internal investigation by the Yale University police found that one of its officers did nothing wrong when, with his gun drawn, he approached a student matching the description of a burglary suspect and ordered him to the ground.

title: Review: Keith Jarrett at Carnegie Hall, Precise and Aglow
description: In his improvised solo piano concerts, Keith Jarrett has made it a custom to save a familiar song or two for the encores  a gleaming prize at the finish line. But of his three encores at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night, just one fit that bill: Im a Fool to Want You, an abject cry of romantic despondence introduced by Frank Sinatra in 1951.

title: Frozen Yoga? Its Snowga
description: It seemed as if yoga should have exhausted its opportunities for expansion by now, considering it has already made such unlikely alliances as marijuana, dogs, karaoke and stand-up paddleboards. But the yoga creep carries on with what may be the practices strangest bedfellow yet: snow.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Iraq, South Africa and Nepal.

title: Youth Symphony Cancels Program That Quotes Horst Wessel Song
description: Jonas Tarm had won the kind of opportunity most young composers can only dream of: the New York Youth Symphony had commissioned a piece from him and planned to play it this Sunday at Carnegie Hall. But the youth symphony pulled his piece this week after learning that it includes a musical quotation from the Horst Wessel song, the Nazi anthem.

title: The Ferguson Police Department: The Justice Department Report, Annotated
description: The Justice Departments investigation into law enforcement in Ferguson, Mo., found that the police and courts meted out illegal and unduly harsh treatment, particularly to black people.

title: Ice Cream as Health Food? This Bar Comes Close
description: When Alexander Soros, a son of the billionaire hedge fund manager George Soros, hosted a charity dinner in the Hamptons on a hot summer evening in July 2012, Michael Shoretz parked an ice cream cart just outside the dining area to offer samples of his new Enlightened ice cream bars.

title: Review: Yonatan Gat Shreds Protocol in a Rampant Concert
description: For six years, until 2011, the guitarist Yonatan Gat was in Monotonix, a kind of garage-punk incursion unit from Tel Aviv. Generally, Monotonix set up on the floor of clubs, or in the middle of crowds in outdoor places, and ran rampant. The singer Ami Shalev set fire to things, swung from pipes, charged out of the room with the microphone, climbed on the audience and the other band members; the drummer Haggai Fershtman pummeled and crashed. Mr. Gat had to be the steady center of it. He had to keep the riffs going.

title: An Eye for an Eye at Rochas
description: If spring/summer 2015 was the moment of no-makeup makeup, then fall/winter may be the season of Can you see me now? In a move that echoed other runways prominently featuring shapes and symbols painted onto the face (Anthony Vaccarello, Jacquemus, Gareth Pugh, Vivienne Westwood), Lucia Pieroni added paisley motifs to the models browbones for todays Rochas show at the Palais de Tokyo. Using matte black Cl de Peau Beaut Intensifying Cream Eyeliner, she added accents above the eye and on the lower lid to create a bold look that made last seasons doe-eyed girl seem downright grown-up. To offset the groovy statement shape, Pieroni skipped mascara and brought a natural glow to the skin, ever so slightly groomed the girls brows and finished off the look with a barely-there pink pout. We didnt want strange, she says. We wanted just a little something slightly off.

title: Natalia Revuelta Clews, Fidel Castro Ally And Mother of His Daughter, Dies at 89
description: She was the emerald-eyed knockout of Havana society, and everyone knew her as Naty. She belonged to the Havana Country Club and lunched aboard yachts. She was married to a distinguished surgeon, and they lived in one of the best neighborhoods in the city.

title: A Fashion Magazines Successful Business Model (Hint: Its Free!)
description: Every Thursday evening, attractive young men and women gather outside select Mtro stations in Paris to hand out free copies of the fashion and beauty magazine Stylist to specific commuters.

title: Shelf, iPad, Bed Table: Reading, February 2015
description: How can you rely on someones opinion of a book if you dont know what else that person likes?

title: Vionnet: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: March 4, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Ukraine, South Africa, Nepal and the United States.

title: Shopping with Antonino Buzzetta
description: With smartphones as alarm clocks, the timepiece near your pillow can simply be attractive.

title: Childrens Lung Health Improves as Air Pollution Is Reduced, Study Says
description: For the first time, researchers have shown that reducing air pollution leads to improved respiratory function in children ages 11 to 15, a critical period of lung development.

title: Are Manhattanites Becoming Brooklyns Bridge-and-Tunnel Crowd?
description: Im a two-time bridge-and-tunnel person. Having regularly fled my native Brooklyn because it wasnt fun enough, Im now insinuating my way back in there because my adopted borough isnt fun enough.

title: Jerry Saltz, New York Magazine Art Critic, Suspended From Facebook
description: For the last eight years the veteran New York magazine art critic Jerry Saltz has built a lively and enviable following on Facebook, which he has described as his 21st-century version of art haunts like the Cedar Tavern or Maxs Kansas City. But on Wednesday, Mr. Saltz was seized by the elbows and shown the door, digitally speaking.

title: The Supreme Court: A Full Hearing
description: Covering a big Supreme Court argument presents special challenges. There are no cameras in the courtroom, and the court does not release audio recordings until the end of the week. No electronic devices are allowed. Reporters bring only pen and paper, as in the old days.

title: Spray Deodorants Are Rehabilitated, With Help From Europeans
description: The underarm area is about the size of a Post-it note, but our individual notions about what keeps it dry and decent smelling are as impassioned as if it were a more substantial patch of skin.

title: Brocade Ankle Boots to Complement a Girl-Power Message at Dries Van Noten
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Review: Malpaso Dance Company Presents Two New York Premieres at the Joyce
description: Last spring, New York received a gift from Cuba: a premiere by Ronald K. Brown courtesy of Malpaso Dance Company. For its return visit to the Joyce Theater on Tuesday, the troupe, formed in 2012 by Osnel Delgado, Daile Carrazana and Fernando Sez, hosts another impressive guest choreographer, Trey McIntyre. This prolific and much-admired dancemaker expresses playfulness without settling into a frivolous place.

title: Raising an Artists Colony
description: An artists community has sprouted upstate among disused industrial buildings. If it continues to thrive, there will be pizza and beer for everyone.

title: Howard Hughes Slept Here
description: The 9,000-square-foot house in Los Angeles with a pool and a past was an impulse buy.

title: How to Wear Nude Lips Without Looking Washed Out
description: Celebrities like Jennifer Lopez and Kim Kardashian have finessed the beigey lip so expertly that it feels timeless and seductive  a signature. And nude lips are everywhere at the fall runway shows: Vera Wang, Altuzarra, Rodarte, Burberry, Prada.

title: New Tracy Letts Play Coming to Steppenwolf Theater Next Year
description: Steppenwolf Theater Company in Chicago announced on Wednesday that two notable world premieres would be part of its 2015-16 season: a new play by Tracy Letts, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of August: Osage County, and a new adaptation of John Steinbecks East of Eden by members of the Steppenwolf team who won acclaim for an earlier staging of Steinbecks Grapes of Wrath.

title: Justice Departments Report on the Ferguson Police Department
description: In a scathing report released Wednesday, the Justice Department concluded that the Ferguson Police Department had been routinely violating the constitutional rights of its black residents.

title: Van Hollen to Run For Mikulskis Senate Seat in Maryland
description: The race to replace retiring Senator Barbara A. Mikulski in Maryland is officially on.

title: At Evening Bar in TriBeCa, a Homey Feeling
description: A new TriBeCa spot tries something different from the usual high-end hotel bars: a feeling of home. Evening Bar, tucked off the lobby of the Smyth, is a tiny but inviting place that looks like a stylish friends studio apartment. A handful of leathery love seats and midcentury modern chairs is scattered around a fireplace that competes with the backlit glow of the mahogany bar.

title: Review: On USAs Dig, a Murder Investigation Takes an Apocalyptic Turn
description: A red calf is born in Norway, an eerie 12-year-old boy is raised in captivity in New Mexico and a young American archaeologist is murdered in Jerusalem. The connection? Too early to tell, but all signs point to the world being saved 10 weeks from now.

title: The Forgotten Emancipation
description: March 4, 1865, is remembered as the day of Abraham Lincolns Second Inaugural address, but it was also a moment that has been forgotten in the long history of slave emancipation in America.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: On Thursday, Dressbarn will unveil DRESSBAR, a curated collection of spring frocks available in stores and online. For the occasion, the high-street retailer will also open a New York City pop-up where youll find pretty numbers like a Luxe by Carmen Marc Valvo floral print fit and flare ($58). At 102 Fifth Avenue.

title: The 20-20 Hindsight of an Instructive Deal
description: Steve Conrad of Manhasset, N.Y., teaches bridge on cruise ships. Teachers usually have a good eye for an instructive deal. Conrad sent one to me, modestly acknowledging that he had misplayed, immediately saw what he had done wrong and wished he could have taken a mulligan.

title: Bank of England in Money Market Inquiry
description: LONDON  The Serious Fraud Office, the British agency that investigates and prosecutes fraud and corruption, is investigating whether the Bank of England played any role in rigging money market auctions during the financial crisis in 2007 and 2008.

title: A Pop-Up Dinner Series With an Artsy Edge
description: Theres absolutely nothing about exclusivity in what we do, explains Wal Mechri-Yver, the founder of Babl, a New York events program he created in 2013 that has collaborated with Queen of the Night, Sleep No More and the Bowery Hotel and has just launched a monthly pop-up dinner series titled Escena Magica. What we try to cultivate is word of mouth, and theres no barriers. We sell our tickets online. Everything is open.

title: Lung Cancer Treatment Using Immune System Wins F.D.A. Approval
description: The first immune-based treatment for lung cancer won approval from the Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday, and it could displace more conventional chemotherapy for certain patients, at least.

title: World Press Photo Revokes Prize
description: PARIS  Following days of intense controversy, the jury of one of photojournalisms top awards, the World Press Photo contest, stripped an Italian photographer of a first prize after it found that he had misrepresented the location of one of the atmospheric images.

title: Trailer: Rendez-Vous With French Cinema
description: A preview of the series.

title: Review: Erik Larsons Dead Wake, on the Sinking of the Lusitania
description: The Lusitania is about to sink  and sink, and sink  all over again. This May is the 100th anniversary of the attack on the grand British ocean liner by a German submarine, and the expected crop of books will commemorate the occasion. But the most attention-getting of the bunch is guaranteed to be Erik Larsons Dead Wake, because Mr. Larson is an old hand at treating nonfiction like high drama. As he demonstrated with In the Garden of Beasts and The Devil in the White City, he knows how to pick details that have maximum soapy potential and then churn them until they foam.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Csar Winners Fill Roster at Rendez-Vous With French Cinema
description: For most of its 20-year existence, the annual film series Rendez-Vous With French Cinema has promoted a vision of France as the most civilized and sophisticated country on earth, one ruled by a benign, eternal beauty, Catherine Deneuve. The very expression rendez-vous evokes a dream world of delicious secret liaisons in Parisian haunts.

title: Where Howard Hughes Was Underfoot
description: As a house tour enticement, Do you want to see Howard Hughess vault? is pretty irresistible. Of course you want to see Howard Hughess vault. Who doesnt?

title: AbbVie to Pay $21 Billion for Pharmacyclics, Maker of a Promising Cancer Drug
description: AbbVie announced late Wednesday that it had agreed to buy Pharmacyclics, maker of a cancer drug that some analysts predict will eventually become one of the best-selling treatments for the disease, for about $21 billion.

title: The Wassaic Project: A Festival, a Beautiful Flood and Now Art
description: WASSAIC, N.Y.  When Bowie Zunino is interviewing candidates for residencies at the Wassaic Project, she spends a lot of time trying to talk them out of coming.

title: Bruce Willis to Make Broadway Debut in Misery
description: Bruce Willis will make his Broadway debut this fall as the bedridden novelist in a stage adaption of Misery, best known from the 1990 film thriller that starred James Caan and, in an Oscar-winning performance, Kathy Bates as the psychotic fan who holds the writer hostage.

title: Committee Investigating Benghazi Subpoenas Hillary Clintons Emails
description: The House committee examining the 2012 attacks on American outposts in Benghazi sent a subpoena to Hillary Rodham Clintons lawyer on Wednesday, requesting all emails she had in her personal account as secretary of state that relate to Libya.

title: The Value of a Chair
description: Scott McGlasson uses organic materials to build heirloom furniture pieces. But is his method sustainable?

title: Associated Press Threatens Legal Action Over Request for Hillary Clinton Information
description: The Associated Press said Wednesday that it was considering legal action over unfulfilled Freedom of Information Act requests for government documents covering Hillary Rodham Clintons tenure as secretary of state.

title: The Feds vs. Ferguson
description: On Wednesday, the Department of Justice released the utterly devastating results of its investigation of the Ferguson Police Department.

title: When Profits Can Become Sawdust
description: ST. PAUL  What is the value of a dining-room chair? You cant eat it. And you can sit on the floor free, as millions (billions?) of people do.

title: Reading The Times With David Axelrod
description: Now director of the Institute of Politics at the University of Chicago, David Axelrod was senior adviser to President Obama and is the author of Believer: My Forty Years in Politics.

title: Should I Remove Sports Memorabilia Before Showing My Home?
As Hope Solo Returns to Field, U.S. Rallies Past Norway in World Cup Tuneup
description: VILA REAL DE SANTO ANTNIO, Portugal  About four minutes into Wednesdays Algarve Cup game between the United States and Norway, a Norwegian player lofted a cross toward the area in front of the Americans goal.

title: The Story That Came From a Dog
description: Over the last two decades, the ceramist Rae Dunn has attracted many admirers with her intentionally imperfect handmade pieces: pared-down tableware with subtle details, whimsical teapots, earthy vases with wobbly forms. So when she published her first book, Wilmas World (Chronicle Books, $15.95), it was natural to expect that it would be about ceramics.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Vionnet Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Vionnet Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Seeking Drugs and Weapons, Rikers Locks Down Inmates for 34 Hours
description: New York City correction officials this week took the unusual step of locking down more than half of the inmates at Rikers Island in their cells for 34 hours straight, as part of an effort to curb escalating gang violence.

title: Stylish Bedside Clocks
description: Daylight saving time begins at 2 a.m. on Sunday, and in the spirit of springing forward, the interior designer Antonino Buzzetta, 30, went looking for stylish bedside clocks.

title: Holders Report Describes Racial Tension
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. described the Justice Departments searing report on Ferguson, Mo., which found deep distrust between police officers and residents.

title: Family Wedding Forces Rubio to Skip Iowa Candidate Forum
description: And then there were 10.

title: Not a Banister Was Changed
description: Fifty years ago, the New York City Landmarks Preservation Law was enacted to ensure that important buildings survived the whims, greed or cultural indifference of developers and city officials. Among the 31,000 properties designated as landmarks, only 117 are interiors, like City Hall, left, and the New Amsterdam Theater, right. This small fraction gets special treatment in Rescued, Restored, Reimagined: New Yorks Landmark Interiors, a show opening on Friday at the New York School of Interior Design.

title: Sales at Love Adorned, Waggo, Ladies & Gentlemen Studio and Design Within Reach
description: Love Adorned is discounting some bedding and home furnishings by 20 percent through March 12 (wool Pendleton Navajo Water blankets and Hidatsa Earth blankets, regularly $375 each, are $300); 269 Elizabeth Street (Houston Street), 212-431-5683, loveadorned.com.

title: A Timeless Portrait of Nepal
description: Kevin Bubriski arrived in Nepal as a Peace Corps worker. He has returned over the decades to capture its stark landscapes and resilient people, reminders of a vanishing world.

title: Mark Lippert, U.S. Ambassador to South Korea, Is Hospitalized After Attack
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The United States ambassador to South Korea, Mark W. Lippert, was attacked Thursday morning by a knife-wielding man who said he opposed joint American-South Korean military exercises, according to the South Korean police and journalists who were at the scene.

title: Taubmans New Firm, PJT Partners, Starts to Take Shape
description: A fledgling investment bank run by Paul J. Taubman, the former Morgan Stanley deal maker, is getting ready to make its Wall Street debut.

title: A Return to Nepal
description: Kevin Bubriskis 2015 Smartphone Photos from Nepal

title: Etsy, Online Bazaar for Handmade Goods, Files for Initial Offering
description: Etsy was born in 2005 in a Brooklyn loft as a way for one of its co-founders to sell his handmade wooden goods.

title: A Harmonic Convergence of Apples and Oranges
description: In a rare instance of graphic-design geekery intersecting with furniture, the Italian company Cassina is adding a new frame color to Franco Albini and Franca Helgs 1959 Tre Pezzi (or Three Pieces) armchair to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Milan subway system that they also designed together.

title: Putting a Mattress Through the Rinse Cycle
description: For anyone worried about dust mites or bedbugs, or about cleanup after bed-wetting, conventional mattresses have a notable weakness: Theyre not washable. Thats one reason Michael Rothbard, the president of Sleep Studio, created Newton Rest, a mattress company that does away with springs and foam. Its mattresses are made with a zip-off casing containing Wovenaire, a spongy, porous block of food-grade polymer developed in Japan. Once unzipped, the casing can be washed, and the Wovenaire can be hosed in the shower. The mattresses are recyclable (the company plans to accept used-mattress returns) and highly breathable. Air passes easily through it, Mr. Rothbard said. Any body heat or perspiration you have during the night dissipates. A crib mattress ($295) is to be introduced in mid-April; adult mattresses ($1,350 to $2,450), a month later; 212-679-6679, newton.rest or newtonbaby.rest.

title: One Sofa With the Works, Please
description: Rob Royer believes there is a yawning abyss in the furniture market between the inexpensive cookie-cutter couch and the luxury lounge. So last year he founded Interior Define to bridge the divide. The company works with factories to manufacture its own sofas, each made to order. Customers are pampered with a degree of customization (sizes, fabrics and a few other features can be selected), but the prices reflect the savings the company makes by dispensing with warehouses and middlemen. Mr. Royer estimated that his sofas cost 30 to 40 percent less than comparable ones sold by conventional retailers. (The Sloan sofa, shown here, starts at $900.) Customers can see the collections in a Chicago showroom, where Interior Define thriftily has its offices, or peruse them online. Not all of the customization options are posted on the website, he said, so be sure to ask. Information: 872-802-4119 or interiordefine.com.

title: Clinton Hires Campaign Lawyer Ahead of Likely Run
description: While attention around Hillary Rodham Clinton has been focused on her email use as secretary of state, her team quietly brought on a new lawyer for her campaign-in-waiting two months ago.

title: Lets Give Color a Big (Early) Hug
description: Colorful prints for spring cant come soon enough; footwear from Band of Outsiders; a new label showcases the work of artists and more.

title: With Guccis New Creative Director, Accessories Designers Come Into the Spotlight
description: Bags and shoes have become the fulcrum of fashion house sales. So those who design them are being promoted to bring their sense to creative direction.

title: Andrew Lack Leaves Broadcasting Board of Governors After 6 Weeks
description: WASHINGTON  Andrew Lack is leaving his position as chief executive of the Broadcasting Board of Governors, the agency announced on Wednesday, one day after it was reported that he was in advanced discussions to return to NBC to lead its news operations.

title: In Turkey, Testing the Presidents Food Not for Taste, but for Poison
description: ISTANBUL  In a modern twist on a self-preservation tactic used by cautious kings and pharaohs, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey is having his food tested before he eats  not by a human taster, though, but in the lab.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Dries Van Noten Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Dries Van Noten Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Report: What Happened in Ferguson?
description: The Justice Department cleared Officer Darren Wilson of civil rights violations in the shooting death of Michael Brown. Here is the sequence of events as described in the departments report.

title: Jawbone Fossil Fills a Gap in Early Human Evolution
description: On the morning of Jan. 29, 2013, Chalachew Seyoum was climbing a remote hill in the Afar region of his native Ethiopia, his head bent, eyes focused on the loose sediment. The site, known as Ledi-Geraru, was rich in fossils. Soon enough, he spotted a telltale shape on the surface  a premolar, as it turned out. It was attached to a piece of a mandible, or lower jawbone. He collected other pieces of a left mandible, and five teeth in all.

title: Scene After Attack on Diplomat
description: Video from Yonhap Television, a South Korean news agency, shows the attacker being subdued and Ambassador Mark W. Lippert being escorted from the scene.

title: Dillon Gee Falters in Spring Opener, but Mets Still Prevail
description: After the Mets sorted out the lunch incident between Noah Syndergaard and David Wright, along with Daniel Murphys comments on homosexuality, they had an actual (sort of) game to play on Wednesday  their first Grapefruit League matchup.

title: Ezra Laderman,Weaver of Eclectic Marilyn Opera, Dies at 90
description: Ezra Laderman, an American composer who became widely known for his 1993 opera, Marilyn, which chronicled the waning days of Marilyn Monroe, died on Saturday at his home in New Haven. He was 90.

title: Lumber Liquidators Plunges After TV Report of Tainted Flooring
description: While shares of Lumber Liquidators closed up slightly on Friday, investors could barely wait to sell their stock by Monday morning.

title: Chief of National Cancer Institute Resigns
description: Dr. Harold E. Varmus, a Nobel Prize winner and former director of the National Institutes of Health, announced Wednesday that he would step down as head of the National Cancer Institute on March 31. Dr. Varmus, who presided over the institute during a government shutdown, cuts in funding and significant advances in cancer research, was appointed by President Obama in 2010, after advising Mr. Obamas campaign and serving on the White House Council of Advisors on Science and Technology. He said in a letter of resignation that he would establish a research laboratory at the Meyer Cancer Center at Weill Cornell Medical College in New York. His deputy, Dr. Douglas R. Lowy, will become acting director of the institute.

title: California: More Drug-Resistant Cases Are Linked to Medical Device
description: Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles announced on Wednesday that four patients had contracted a deadly, drug-resistant infection linked to a hard-to-clean medical device. The device, called a duodenoscope, also has been implicated in an outbreak of infections at Ronald Reagan U.C.L.A. Medical Center. The device, a long tube inserted down the throats of anesthetized patients, has microscopic crevices that may have harbored a superbug known as CRE, or carbapenem-resistant Enterobacteriaceae, officials say. Cedars-Sinai said four patients contracted the infection after undergoing procedures between August and January. One later died, but the cause was an unrelated disease. Hospital officials said they had mailed letters to dozens of other patients who had had the procedures out of an abundance of caution.

title: The San Diego Padres Dont Feel Like Themselves. Thats the Point.
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  The San Diego Padres scored the fewest runs in the major leagues last season, and their fewest in a full schedule since 1972. So you could understand Bud Blacks enthusiasm for filling out his lineup card Wednesday, when the Padres opened their exhibition season. He put Matt Kemp in the third spot, and Justin Upton cleanup.

title: Pharrell Williams Acknowledges Similarity to Gaye Song in Blurred Lines Case
description: LOS ANGELES  How closely does Robin Thickes hit Blurred Lines resemble a classic by Marvin Gaye?

title: China Lowers Official Economic Growth Target
description: HONG KONG  China on Thursday lowered its economic growth target for this year to approxmately 7 percent, a significant if widely anticipated development that signals the Communist Partys determination to shift to more sustainable development.

title: Beach Dogs, a Bitten Girl and a Roiling Debate in Bali
description: KUTA VILLAGE, Indonesia  The controversy began a few weeks ago when a small, cream-colored mutt named Sheila bolted unexpectedly from under a beach hammock and bit a 10-year-old Australian girl in the leg.

title: Christies Office Drove Exxon Settlement, Ex-Official Says
description: For more than a decade, the New Jersey attorney generals office conducted a hard-fought legal battle to hold Exxon Mobil Corporation responsible for decades of environmental contamination in northern New Jersey.

title: In Eye of Economic Storm, the Fed Blinked
description: WASHINGTON  When Ben S. Bernanke walked into the Federal Reserves ornate boardroom in December 2009, the officials who were gathered around the long table gave the Feds chairman a standing ovation.

title: Alex Johnson Dies at 72; Deft Batter Won a Key Ruling
description: Alex Johnson, who in a mercurial baseball career won the American League batting title with the Angels in 1970, edging out Carl Yastrzemski, only to be suspended by the team one year later for not hustling, a move that led to a landmark ruling in his favor, died on Saturday in Southfield, Mich. He was 72.

title: Shortchanging New Jersey by Billions
description: THE decision by the administration of Gov. Chris Christie to settle an environmental lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corporation for roughly three cents on the dollar after more than a decade of litigation is an embarrassment to law enforcement and good government.

title: Democrats in Congress Give Obama Breathing Room on Nuclear Talks With Iran
description: WASHINGTON  In a reprieve for President Obama, Democrats in Congress who support legislation that gives Congress the authority to review his emerging nuclear deal with Iran pledged Wednesday to wait to press their case until after a March 24 negotiating deadline between the two nations.

title: To Bring Virtual Reality to Market, Furious Efforts to Solve Nausea
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Few technologies have generated more attention than virtual reality, which promises to immerse people in 3-D games and video.

title: A Chilling Portrait of Ferguson
description: The riots that erupted in Ferguson, Mo., last summer after a white police officer shot and killed an unarmed black teenager named Michael Brown were partly about his death. They were also deeply connected to a lamentable history of abuse suffered by African-American citizens at the hands of local police and court officials.

title: McConnell Urges States to Defy U.S. Plan to Cut Greenhouse Gas
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnell, Republican of Kentucky and majority leader, is urging governors to defy President Obama by refusing to implement the administrations global warming regulations.

title: Effort to Curb Immigration in Britain Hits a Bump
description: LEICESTER, England  Thabata Martins says she sent out her rsum more than 100 times in the year after finishing her studies to become a nurse in Spain in 2013.

title: Next Step for Anirban Lahiri, Indias Top Golfer: U.S. Debut
description: DORAL, Fla.  First came Jordan Spieth, who won his first PGA Tour event as a teenager. He was followed by Patrick Reed, 24, who became the youngest winner of a World Golf Championships event here last year. Last month, Brooks Koepka, 24, won the Phoenix Open, and Daniel Berger, 21, lost in a playoff on Monday in the Honda Classic.

title: Elizabeth McCracken Wins $20,000 Story Prize
description: Elizabeth McCracken won the annual Story Prize on Wednesday night, for her collection Thunderstruck and Other Stories. The prize, which comes with an award of $20,000, was announced at a ceremony at the New School.

title: The Fed Knew the Economy Was a Disaster in 2009. Heres What They Talked About Instead.
description: The winter of 2009 was the worst, scariest time for the American economy in modern memory. Employers were slashing jobs at a frenetic pace; another major bank failure seemed to lurk around every corner; and the newly installed Obama administration was having a hard time finding its footing to fight the crisis.

title: Making Room for More Slush
description: Workers shoveled the dirty residue of the previous nights precipitation in Times Square early on Wednesday. The forecast called for more snow on Thursday in the New York region, and a return of colder temperatures after a brief warm-up.

title: A City Where Policing, Discrimination and Raising Revenue Went Hand in Hand
description: A 32-year-old black man was sitting in his car, cooling off after playing basketball in a public park in the city of Ferguson, Mo. Then a police officer pulled up.

title: Uneasiness at Erskine College
description: It was jarring to many last week when Erskine publicly condemned same-sex relationships, calling them sinful, in what was widely interpreted as a response to two volleyball players.

title: Lagging
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  There are so many ways to describe this puzzle by Jim Peredo. Yet I can discuss none of them in the kind of detail this puzzle deserves.

title: A Charter School Rally Duels With Teachers Unions in Albany
description: ALBANY  With the political winds seemingly at its back, New York Citys charter school movement staged a splashy rally in Albany on Wednesday, with an enthusiastic mix of thousands of students, a raft of state leaders and a pinch-hitting pop star.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 4, 2015
description: March 4, 2015

title: M.L.S. and Union Reach Deal Giving Free Agency to Veterans
description: Major League Soccer agreed to a five-year collective bargaining agreement with its players union Wednesday that gives veteran players a measure of free agency for the first time. The agreement in principle, reached two days before the start of the leagues 20th season, prevented the first work stoppage in M.L.S. history.

title: Zetas Leader Is Arrested in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  The leader of the Zetas  a Mexican criminal group notorious for its brutal murders  was arrested Wednesday without a shot fired in northern Mexico, as the authorities toppled yet another kingpin in a long and aggressive campaign against the group.

title: Argentine President May Face More Scrutiny
description: BUENOS AIRES  An Argentine prosecutor on Wednesday appealed a federal judges decision to dismiss a criminal complaint against President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner that accused her of conspiring to hide Iranian officials involvement in the deadly bombing of a Jewish community center here in 1994.

title: Halloran, Ex-Queens Councilman, Is Sentenced to 10 Years
description: WHITE PLAINS  Daniel J. Halloran III, a Queens Republican once on the City Council, was sentenced on Wednesday to 10 years in prison for his role in two corruption schemes, including taking thousands of dollars in bribes to help Malcolm A. Smith, a Democrat and the former State Senate majority leader, run for New York City mayor in 2013 as a Republican.

title: Membership in Clintons Email Domain Is Remembered as a Mark of Status
description: Just before Hillary Rodham Clinton was sworn in as secretary of state in January 2009, she and her closest aides decided that she should have her own private email address as Mrs. Clinton moved away from the Blackberry address that she had used during her 2008 presidential campaign.

title: Nets Say Every Game Counts, and Then They Lose
description: When the Charlotte Hornets returned to practice after the N.B.A.s All-Star break, their coach, Steve Clifford, put the league standings up on a bulletin board for his players and his staff to see.

description: A workout designed to help firefighters stay heart-healthy focuses on functional fitness exercises like stair climbing. Heres how members of the New Brunswick, N.J. fire department stay fit.

description: BEIJING  Premier Li Keqiang, in his annual speech to the nation, warned Thursday that China would have to overcome economic inefficiencies, excess capacity and impediments to private enterprise if it were to maintain healthy rates of growth.

description: Graffitist, painter, actor, poet: The late artists rarely seen personal writings and sketches are expressions of 1980s downtown New York, and, perhaps, of his truest vision.

description: Nerds love Orlando, according to public relations materials I received this week from the city of Orlando, Fla. But as Orlando seeks to rebrand itself as a high tech hub for innovation, it faces a lot of competition.

title: Untreated Dental Decay Is Falling Among Children
description: Cavities in preschoolers appear to be declining and fewer young children have untreated dental decay, federal health authorities reported on Thursday.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 6:35 P.M. (Starz Cinema) FAREWELL, MY QUEEN (2012) Sidonie Laborde (La Seydoux), the reader to Marie Antoinette (Diane Kruger) at Versailles, watches as the French monarchy falls in this drama directed by Benot Jacquot from a novel by Chantal Thomas. Nomie Lvovsky portrays the queens lady-in-waiting; Virginie Ledoyen is the woman rumored to be the queens lover. If the rules and the players of this continuing, increasingly dangerous court intrigue remain obscure, its because Farewell, My Queen is told through Sidonies eyes, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. Tapping her palace sources, notably an archivist (Michel Robin) and a dressmaker (Anne Benot), Sidonie learns of news known only to the nobility and their trusted stewards: that the Bastille has been seized. Mr. Jacquot, she added, has always been a sensitive director of actresses, his sympathies evident in his caressing, sometimes ogling camerawork and the time and space he gives women and their stories. That sympathy is evident here too, though crucially, while he doesnt demonize Marie Antoinette, he doesnt turn her into a spurious feminist martyr. In French, with English subtitles.

description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Seen in this context  amid a highly toxic environment, defined by mistrust and resentment, stoked by years of bad feelings, and spurred by illegal and misguided practices  it is not difficult to imagine how a single tragic incident set off the city of Ferguson like a powder keg.

title: Hillary Clinton Asks State Department to Vet Emails for Release
description: WASHINGTON  As State Department lawyers sifted last summer through a new batch of documents related to the Benghazi attacks, they repeatedly saw something that caught their attention: emails sent to and from a personal account for Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: What to Expect on the Second Day of Paris Fashion Week
description: The music stops and starts in fashions endless game of musical chairs. The places are rarely set for long. In the fall, a new rotation was set in motion again when it was announced that Nina Riccis Peter Copping would go to Oscar de la Renta in New York; Carvens Guillaume Henry to the vacated spot at Nina Ricci; and to Mr. Henrys empty slot at Carven  who?

title: A Timeless Portrait of Nepal
description: In Katmandu, the pollution is visible, touchable, intimate. You start seeing it as the plane lands: a thick gray and yellow haze that swallows up Nepals capital during the dry winter months. The city is inexorably spreading across the valley, devouring the shrinking farmland in a wave of unregulated, chaotic Nepali-style modernity.

title: A (Manic Depressive) Mans Best Friend
description: On our second date, eight months before my nervous breakdown, I met her 85-pound pit bull mix, Pavlov. Id just parked my blue motor scooter in her driveway, feeling jittery but intent to woo, when I noticed the beast galloping across the lawn at me  eyes wide, hackles raised and an Im-going-to-disfigure-you huff with every trampling of the grass.

title: Steps Against Juvenile Sex Trafficking
description: The impression that Americas sex-trafficking problem mostly involves young people smuggled from overseas has given way to broad recognition of a cruel homegrown reality: the tens of thousands of juveniles who are exploited each year by traffickers in this country.

title: When Things Happen That You Cant Explain
description: I WAS sitting in a commuter train to London the first time I felt supernatural power rip through me. I was 23, and one year into my graduate training in anthropology. I had decided to do my fieldwork among educated white Britons who practiced what they called magic. I thought of the topic as a clever twist on more traditional anthropological study of strange native customs.

description: In October, two young Americans set off on the most daring and foolhardy wilderness expedition since, oh, maybe Lewis and Clark.

description: The Davis Cup is still officially in Switzerlands possession with another campaign set to begin on Friday, but the Swiss have already given up any real chance of defending their title.

title: Mario Draghi of E.C.B. Predicts an Improved Economy When Stimulus Program Begins Monday
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  The European Central Bank will begin its big new stimulus program on Monday, the banks president, Mario Draghi, said. He predicted improvements in the economy and in the eurozones inflation picture as a result of the effort.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Ferguson Police Routinely Violate Rights of Blacks, Justice Dept. Finds
description: The questions below refer to two articles related to the events in Ferguson, Mo., last August: U.S. Calls On Ferguson to Overhaul Criminal Justice System and Darren Wilson Is Cleared of Rights Violations in Ferguson Shooting.

title: Christopher Wheeldon Directs An American in Paris on Broadway
description: Paris  This is tricky, said Christopher Wheeldon. Robert Fairchild and Leanne Cope, the leads in his new production of An American in Paris, looked at him expectantly. The production team, sitting in a row in the auditorium of the Chtelet theater here, waited quietly.

title: What Are Your TV Habits?
description: A recent article points out that For all of the changes in television, none is more profound than the sheer volume of material available now. From NBCs About a Boy to SyFys Z Nation, there were 352 original scripted series shown in 2014 on broadcast, cable and streaming services. That doesnt count news, sports, talk shows, documentaries, movies or reality shows.

title: Chinese Advisory Bodys Proposals Address Divorce, Illicit Cash and Holidays
description: The Chinese Peoples Political Consultative Conference is an advisory body consisting of delegates from a variety of political groups and social sectors, including the governing Communist Party; the United Front parties aligned with the Communist Party; organizations representing labor, women and young people; and dignitaries with no party affiliation. Every year about this time it convenes alongside the National Peoples Congress in Beijing, where delegates gather to discuss and propose new legislation or other policy changes.

title: Erik Larsons Dead Wake, About the Lusitania
description: One day seven years ago, while on a magazine assignment, I found myself on a boat off the coast of Ireland, bobbing in dark, heavy seas 300 feet above the slumbering wreck of the R.M.S. Lusitania as sport divers returned triumphantly to the surface. When they came aboard, the gleeful explorers, part of a marine archaeology expedition sanctioned by the Irish government, produced a piece of history  a plastic container holding a handful of .303 rounds theyd found inside the plankton-hazed ruins, rounds that had been manufactured in America and bought by the British to kill Germans during World War I. One of the divers peeled back the lid, and the corroded ammunition greeted fresh air for the first time in 93 years. Theres thousands of cases of ammo down in that hole! one of the Irish divers cried out. You could just scoop the stuff up! But then he turned somber. Even though he had dived the great wreck dozens of times before, the expression on his face was that of a spooked man. It will always be a scary place, a daunting place, he told me. Theres a lot of lost souls down there.

title: U.S. Strategy in Iraq Increasingly Relies on Iran
description: WASHINGTON  At a time when President Obama is under political pressure from congressional Republicans over negotiations to rein in Tehrans nuclear ambitions, a startling paradox has emerged: Mr. Obama is becoming increasingly dependent on Iranian fighters as he tries to contain the Islamic State militant group in Iraq and Syria without committing American ground troops.

title: As Part of Political Elite, 5 Colored Girls Carry A Torch for Inclusion
description: WASHINGTON  Donna Brazile and Minyon Moore were field directors for Michael Dukakiss 1988 presidential run when the campaigns top operatives moved them and the other midlevel staff members to a different area of the Boston headquarters. The result was that white men were almost exclusively on one floor and blacks and most of the women were exiled to another.

title: Solairedirect Moves to File I.P.O. in Paris
description: LONDON  Solairedirect, a solar energy provider based in Paris, said on Thursday that it had filed preliminary documents with the French authorities for an initial public offering on the Euronext Paris stock market. The company plans to raise 175 million euros, or about $195 million, by next summer.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: The Firefighter Workout
description: Four out of five firefighters nationwide are overweight or obese, and roughly half of all firefighters who die in the line of duty each year are killed by heart attacks.

title: New York Today: Morning Storm
description: Good morning on this flaky Thursday.

title: A Former College Lineman Now on the Streets, Looking for Answers, and Help
description: LAKELAND, Fla.  With sunset minutes away, the man in the neon yellow knit hat took his usual spot here at a busy intersection. Across from a Publix supermarket and on the edge of a Circle K parking lot, he sat against a streetlight holding a worn cardboard sign with dirt-stained hands that could easily palm a basketball.

title: Kazuo Ishiguro: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Buried Giant was obsessed with Sherlock Holmes as a child. Id go to school and say things like: Pray, be seated or That is most singular. People at the time just put this down to my being Japanese.

title: Citigroup Sells Stake in Turkish Bank for $1.16 Billion
description: LONDON  Citigroup said on Thursday that it had sold its 9.9 percent stake in Akbank of Turkey for about $1.16 billion.

title: Daily Report: To Bring Virtual Reality to Market, Furious Efforts to Solve Nausea
description: Few technologies have generated more attention than virtual reality, which promises to immerse people in 3-D games and video, Nick Wingfield writes.

title: How the Auto Bailout Helped Save the Economy
description: Austan D. Goolsbee and Alan Krueger, two former chairmen of the Council of Economic Advisers in the Obama administration, are presumably not eager to relive the harrowing experience of the Great Recession. Yet the history of the bailout of General Motors and Chrysler is important enough that they have taken a close look at it in a paperfor The Journal of Economic Perspectives.

title: Where Credit Is Due
description: The obituaries, at least the ones I saw, for Dr. John C. Willke, the former president of the National Right to Life Committee, featured his kooky (and politically toxic) notion that rape cant lead to pregnancy. But this hugely effective strategist of the anti-abortion movement, who died on Feb. 20 at 89, deserved a better send-off. Thats the purpose of this column.

title: How the Army Jacket Became a Staple of Civilian Garb
description: Half the people on the street are dressed to kill. Every second woman on the avenue and every second man on the town and every other kid on the jungle gym has his or her back clad in army green. Challenging the ubiquity of black outerwear in the cities and lending a flavor of the PX to the suburban shopping center, the color has conquered the national wardrobe. The history of getting dressed is in large part a story of borrowing combat garb  cravat and cardigan, bomber jacket and pea coat  but the proliferation of the army green jacket is different in kind and in degree.

title: Is Most of Our DNA Garbage?
description: T. Ryan Gregorys lab at the University of Guelph in Ontario is a sort of genomic menagerie, stocked with creatures, living and dead, waiting to have their DNA laid bare. Scorpions lurk in their terrariums. Tarantulas doze under bowls. Flash-frozen spiders and crustaceans  collected by Gregory, an evolutionary biologist, and his students on expeditions to the Arctic  lie piled in beige metal tanks of liquid nitrogen. A bank of standing freezers holds samples of mollusks, moths and beetles. The cabinets are crammed with slides splashed with the fuchsia-stained genomes of fruit bats, Siamese fighting fish and ostriches.

title: Seattles First Downtown, Reimagined
description: Known as Seattles first downtown, Pioneer Square was settled in 1852, then rebuilt after a huge fire in 1889. After World War II and the major earthquake of 1949, the area fell into decline. In 1970, preservationists successfully fought for its designation as a historic district. In the heart of todays bustling city, steps from Elliott Bay and two sports stadiums, Occidental Avenue and Jackson Street are blossoming with upscale restaurants, galleries and shops. Artists, designers and game developers contribute to the vibrant, creative energy of what used to be called Skid Road, where timber workers skidded logs down steep hills.

title: The Mora River Valley Faces a New Battle
A Cold War Missile Base in the Heart of the Everglades
description: Everglades National Park is famed for its colorful  and often savage  wildlife. But rangers at the Florida park also take visitors to one of its equally fearsome man-made attractions: the HM-69 Nike Missile Base.

description: Paris

title: Today in Politics
Same Anger, Different Ideologies: Radical Muslim and Neo-Nazi
description: LONDON  Born and raised in leafy West London, Ibrahim Ahmed always supported the local soccer club and listened to what he called white music. But in school he was a Muslim, and he became increasingly disaffected with British society. When recruiters approached him in a mosque 18 years ago and told him that he could fight a holy war right here at home, he readily agreed.

title: Morning Agenda: Etsy Files for I.P.O.
description: ETSY FILES FOR I.P.O. | Etsy, the online bazaar born in a Brooklyn loft in 2005, filed its first prospectus to go public on Wednesday in what promises to be one of the more closely watched market debuts of the year, DealBooks Michael J. de la Merced and Peter Eavis report. The company, which sells a wide range of whimsical and handmade goods, disclosed a preliminary fund-raising target of $100 million but will most likely seek much more.

title: North Korea Reopens Borders in Time for Marathon
description: BEIJING  Foreigners wanting to compete in the Pyongyang marathon next month can now get ready to pack their running shoes since North Korea has reopened its borders this week after a four-month closing over Ebola fears.

title: British Regulators Fine Bank of Beirut $3.2 Million
description: LONDON  The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain said on Thursday that it had fined the Bank of Beirut and temporarily banned it from signing up new clients in high-risk locations after the lender misled regulators about efforts to prevent money laundering and other financial crimes.

title: Review: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel Ups the Ante
description: Beyond its blindingly colorful palette, the pleasures to be gleaned from the sequel to the 2012 hit The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel derive from watching its eminent, mostly British cast ham it up while trying to inflate dramatic molehills into mountains. To get away with pretending that less is more, strenuous overacting is required.

title: How Men Can Succeed in the Boardroom and the Bedroom
description: ITS easy to see how women benefit from equality  more leadership positions, better pay at work and more support at home. Men may fear that as women do better, they will do worse. But the surprising truth is that equality is good for men, too.

description: A little more than two years ago, when John McQuillen moved to New York for work, he used Facebook and friends to find a place to live. He ended up as a roommate in a two-bedroom in Washington Heights, paying just $800 a month.

Barnum bought his first one, no animal has been so closely identified with the circus as the elephant, starring under the big top, adorning posters and ritually announcing the circuss arrival with a gawk-worthy parade into town  in the case of New York, through the Midtown Tunnel.

title: The Dilemmas of King v. Burwell
description: I havent commented much on the issues at play in the latest Obamacare case to reach the Supreme Court, mostly because there are so many lawyer-bloggers and health care pundits on the internet offering more informed takes than mine. But now duty calls, so here is my pundits view of things:

title: Review: Merchants of Doubt, Separating Science From Spin
description: Late last month Senator James M. Inhofe, Republican of Oklahoma, brandished a snowball on the Senate floor, suggesting that the ugly winter weather afflicting the Eastern Seaboard was evidence that global warming is a hoax. This moment of political theater was widely ridiculed (by Jon Stewart and others), but Merchants of Doubt, Robert Kenners informative and infuriating new documentary, ought to remind us that the denial of climate change is hardly a joke.

title: U.N. Rights Chief Criticizes World Powers
description: GENEVA  The United Nations rights chief on Thursday delivered a blunt critique of global powers, including the United States, in a report warning that many measures adopted by governments in the name of protecting national security violated human rights.

title: Jeb Bush May Be One Bush Too Many for Rank-and-File Iowa G.O.P.
description: JEFFERSON, Iowa  Sheryl McDonald, a retiree, voted for both Presidents Bush. But Im finding out they did some things we got stuck with, she said. I do not want to see Jeb Bush run, she added. He turns me off.

title: Impertinent Collection
description: Great art speaks to us, but its rare that we are able to talk back. Armed with a sketchbook and a camera, our Abstract Sunday columnist stalked the halls of the Museum of Modern Art for a week this winter, using a lo-fi technique that allowed him to transform the museums masterpieces. By holding up his drawings between his camera and the painting, he could extend them outside their frame or highlight visual confluences among the artworks and their surroundings, creating a whole new gallery in the process.

description: This Poetry Pairing features Elinor Wylies poem Wild Peaches and the article Their Own Museum by Penelope Green.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: A Mishap Sheds Light on an Ebola Vaccine
description: The moment he felt a needle jab into his thumb in September on an Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, Dr. Lewis Rubinson knew he was at risk of contracting the deadly disease. What could he do but wait to see if he got sick, and hope that treatment would pull him through?

description: SEOUL, South Korea  The chief pastor from a Korean church in suburban Toronto who failed to return home from a humanitarian mission to North Korea is reportedly being held by the government there.

description: The United States is pushing the United Nations Security Council to condemn the use of chlorine as a chemical weapon in Syria, and impose unspecified measures against those who use it in the future.

title: Plane Avoids Disaster as It Skids Off a Runway at La Guardia Airport
description: For passengers flying into La Guardia Airport, the majestic New York City skyline cannot help but command attention.

title: 1890: A Diabolical Plot
description: NEW YORK  The arrest of Mr. J. Burchell, at Niagara Falls, for the murder of Mr. F. C. Benwell, has, it is claimed, disclosed one of the darkest and most diabolical plots ever chronicled in this country. Mr. Douglas Raymond Pelley, a young Englishman who was in company with Mr. Burchell, made a statement in Court yesterday [March 5], that indicates that there had been a deep laid plot, concocted in England, to lure the unsuspecting young men into an agreement to come to this country in order to engage in a large and lucrative business.

title: Accounts of Heartbreak in Tsarnaev Trial as Victims of Boston Marathon Bombings Testify
description: BOSTON  It was, said Jeffrey Bauman, pure carnage.

title: Digital Learning Companies Falling Short of Student Privacy Pledge
description: Last month, as part of an article about data security lapses by digital learning companies, I wrote about security vulnerabilities with Raz-Kids.com, a popular reading program for elementary school students. Since then, the service has upgraded its data security by, among other things, encrypting its student accounts.

title: M.L.S. Set to Begin 20th Season With New Lineup
description: There is much that is new about Major League Soccer as it begins its 20th season this weekend, with one team shuttered and two new ones joining, but the best news for the league and its players could be that there will be soccer at all. The new collective bargaining agreement hammered out Wednesday night clears the way for Friday nights opening game (the defending champion, Los Angeles, will host Chicago) and a full weekend schedule highlighted by a meeting Sunday between the leagues two expansion teams, New York City F.C. and Orlando City. Surely no one was happier than they were to welcome labor peace and a chance to get started.

title: Balmain: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Paying Homage to Burgundy and Michel Lafarge
description: It was a seemingly incongruous scene: 55 worldly gastronomes who had traveled to New York from all parts of the country rising to applaud an 86-year-old farmer at one of Manhattans best restaurants. Only in wine do the worlds of agriculture and conspicuous consumption collide with such joyous reverence, especially when the wine is Burgundy and the farmer is Michel Lafarge.

title: Scott Walkers Electoral Record Is Less Impressive Than It Looks
description: Gov. Scott Walker is the rare conservative favorite who emphasizes electability. He won three contests in four years in Wisconsin, which hasnt voted for the Republican candidate in a presidential election since 1984. He did so without compromising on the Republican Partys core principles; instead, he prevailed in a high-profile fight with organized labor.

title: Bravo, Ringling Brothers, for Taking Elephants Out of Circuses
description: Circuses can be entertaining and wonder-filled without relying on confined, prodded and abused elephants. Thats long been the argument of animal welfare campaigners and elephant-free circuses.

title: New Publisher for German-Language Edition of Martin Amiss The Zone of Interest
description: PARIS  The Swiss publisher Kein & Aber has picked up Martin Amiss concentration-camp satire, The Zone of Interest, months after the authors longtime German and French publishers rejected it.

title: Balmains Diamond in the Coif
description: At Balmains fall 2015 fashion show, the designer Olivier Rousteing sent the houses signature brand of no-nonsense foxiness down the runway. For the hair, the stylist Sam McKnight took cues from Lauren Hutton in American Gigolo and Michelle Pfeiffer in Scarface, but wanted to modernize the gloss, he says. McKnight started by ironing out any wave in the hair, squared off the edges for a blunt, clean line and then went for a deep side part. The real key, however, was to have one side slicked back and tucked behind the ear so that the single, enormous agate earring that accessorized many of the looks was properly shown off.

title: House of Inasal
description: Filipino comfort food in Woodside, Queens.

title: Straight From Filipino Streets
description: Unlimited rice: It is a siren call. At House of Inasal, a Filipino restaurant that opened last year in Woodside, Queens, its the happy surprise waiting on the first page of the menu, announced by a speech bubble cut out of kraft paper and taped in the margin.

title: Barcelonas Mobile World
description: Many of the worlds top smartphone makers  with the notable exception of Apple  converged at the Fira Gran Via complex in Barcelona this week with the aim of enticing buyers around the globe.

title: Peter Madoffs Former Home Sells for $3.5 Million
description: The Long Island estate of Peter B. Madoff, the younger brother of Bernard L. Madoff, has been sold for several million dollars less than its original asking price, after years of efforts to find a buyer.

title: Andrew Solomon Named President of PEN American Center
description: The author Andrew Solomon has been elected to be president of the literary and human rights organization PEN American Center.

title: Larger-Than-Life Advertising Imagery, Brought Down to Size
description: Natan Dvirs Coming Soon photography series captures the collision between aspirational commercial displays and the mundanity of everyday life.

title: South Korea Says Attacker of U.S. Ambassador, Mark Lippert, Acted Alone
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The South Korean police said Friday that they were seeking to bring attempted murder and other criminal charges against an anti-American activist who slashed the United States ambassador to South Korea, Mark W. Lippert, with a kitchen knife.

title: 1977 | Home Opens Its Doors
description: David W. Dunlap is a Metro reporter and writes the Building Blocks column. He has worked at The Times for 40 years.

title: Bertrice Small, 77, Writer of Risqu Romance Novels, Dies
description: Bertrice Small, a convent-educated writer whose dozens of bodice-ripping romance novels titillated readers for decades, died on Feb. 24 at her home in Southold, N.Y., leaving her 57th novel unfinished. She was 77.

title: Chef Lineup Announced for Dan Barbers Food Waste Pop-Up, WastED
description: A high-profile experiment in wasting nothing will start on March 13 at Dan Barbers Blue Hill restaurant in Greenwich Village. Thats when the restaurant will turn into a pop-up called wastED, to run through the end of the month, with a menu of dishes devised from leftovers like stems, peelings, rinds and bones, by a roster of guest chefs who will change each evening.

title: Last Known Ebola Patient in Liberia Is Discharged
description: Liberias last Ebola patient was discharged on Thursday after a ceremony in the capital, Monrovia, bringing to zero the number of known cases in the country and marking a milestone in West Africas battle against the disease.

title: Boehner Sticks to Foreign Policy, Pressing to Arm Ukraine
description: Days after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel spoke before Congress at his invitation, Speaker John A. Boehner deepened his focus on foreign policy on Thursday by urging President Obama to arm the Ukrainian military.

title: Explicit Artwork on Display in London, but Not for Everyone
description: LONDON  Jake and Dinos Chapmans sexually explicit artwork Bring Me the Head Of   a video, played on loop, of a 10-minute lesbian sex scene  was banned by the police when it was first displayed at the Ridinghouse Editions gallery here in 1995.

title: The Red Carpet, Fashion's 5th City
description: Fashion month marches into its homestretch. And yet, despite the recreating of Diana Vreelands apartment at Marc Jacobs in New York, a waterfall at Hunter in London and a giant boom box at Moschino in Milan, its hard not to think the most headline-grabbing show of the season may have already happened in a town not generally known for its ready-to-wear cred.

title: After Menopause, Female Killer Whales Take Lead in Finding Food
description: Despite no longer reproducing, postmenopausal female whales play a crucial role in the survival of killer whales, researchers have found. With extensive knowledge of their environment, female whales in their 70s and 80s lead younger whales to food in times of scarcity.

title: LVMH Celebrates Its Designer Search
description: PARIS  Is this the god of London? Kanye West exclaimed to the English designer Craig Green before hopping into Mr. Greens booth and gamely strapping into one of his armor-like, tunic-cum-breastplate designs.

title: In Paris, Affairs  La Mode
description: PARIS  The thousands of cadenas damour, or love locks, attached to the Pont des Arts are hidden by graffiti-covered hoarding these days, there to discourage anyone from adding to the wishes that are endangering the bridge, but along the sides the locks poke out, impossible to contain. Its not that dissimilar from the situation on the runways.

title: Julien Dossena on His 10 Most Prized Possessions
description: In just a few seasons, Julien Dossena has made Paco Rabanne new again. The young Frenchman, who spent several years toiling under Nicolas Ghesquire at Balenciaga before his appointment, has created a high-tech, athletic-inflected style thats true to the houses space-age spirit yet free of mod clichs. (Even the brands signature material, chain mail, looks new  and feels light  under his direction.)

title: Out There | Einsteins Telescope
description: From 2015: A century after Albert Einstein proposed that gravity could bend light, astronomers now rely on galaxies or even clusters of galaxies to magnify distant stars.

title: Astronomers Watch a Supernova and See Reruns
description: Its Groundhog Day in the cosmos.

title: Patricia Arquette and Mary J. Blige Starring in Films Added to Tribeca Festival Lineup
description: New films featuring Patricia Arquette, Oscar Isaac, Jessica Biel and Matthew Broderick will screen in the Spotlight section of the Tribeca Film Festival, organizers announced Thursday.

title: Ancient Mars Had an Ocean, Scientists Say
description: After six years of planetary observations, scientists at NASA say they have found convincing new evidence that ancient Mars had an ocean.

title: Iowa Radio Hosts Call to Abandon G.O.P. Falls on Deaf Ears
description: In Iowa, the power of deeply conservative talk radio hosts on the powerhouse station WHO-AM is fabled. A drive-time host in 2008 who relentlessly criticized Mitt Romney was partly credited with his poor caucus showing.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: blood letting, attention deficit and sleep risks. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: In Germany, an Ugly Past Rears Its Head
description: BERLIN  The past lurks here like a tripwire.

title: El Nio Forms, but Forecasters See Little Weather Impact
description: Federal government scientists say that a long-anticipated El Nio weather pattern formed in the Pacific Ocean last month, but that it will most likely have little significant impact worldwide.

title: Gerhard Richter, Damon Albarn and Bjrk Among Highlights of Manchester International Festival
description: Gerhard Richter, Arvo Prt, Bjrk, Douglas Gordon, Charlotte Rampling and Damon Albarn are among the artists participating in this years Manchester International Festival, which announced its schedule on Thursday.

title: Indians Find Ways to See Rape Documentary Despite Ban
description: NEW DELHI  A British-made documentary about a grisly gang rape in India spread throughout social media on Thursday, thwarting official efforts to block it and gaining a wide audience despite a government ban.

title: Rick Owens: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Google Introduces Long-Anticipated Insurance Shopping Site
description: The United States insurance industry has been anticipating  or dreading  Googles entry into insurance shopping for the better part of a year. The wait is over.

title: Bjrk, a One-of-a-Kind Artist, Proves Elusive at MoMA
description: The prodigious Icelandic musical phenomenon Bjrk is the most avant-garde popular artist of her time, the creative force behind extraordinary music videos and also one of the most instinctive of talents. So she probably should have trusted her first response  No thanks  when the Museum of Modern Art came calling.

title: Sacred Space
description: The photographer Massimo Vitali lives with his wife and son in Lucca, Italy, in a 14th-century church that lay empty for 17 years.

title: Egypt Replaces Minister Who Helped Quell Dissent
description: CAIRO  Egypts interior minister, who played a central role in the military-backed governments far-reaching and ruthless crackdown on political dissent, was removed from his post on Thursday in a cabinet shake-up announced by the presidents office.

title: Attacks Cripple 11 Oil Fields, Libya Says
description: CAIRO  The Libyan national oil company declared 11 oil fields nonoperational because of theft, looting, sabotage and destruction by unidentified armed groups, the company said in a statement late Wednesday.

title: Christie Administration Officials Praise Deal With Exxon
description: The administration of Gov. Chris Christie offered details for the first time on Thursday about its settlement of a legal battle with Exxon Mobil Corporation over contamination in which the company agreed to pay a fraction of the damages that the State of New Jersey had sought.

title: Fastest Star in the Galaxy Got an Unusual Start
description: Hurtling through the galaxy at about 1,200 kilometers per second is a compact helium star with an unusual origin. Unlike most high-velocity stars, scientists say this one  thought to be the fastest unbound star in the galaxy  was set in motion not by the black hole at the center of our galaxy, but by a former companion.

title: Heavy Politics
description: A few days ago Bloomberg had a great story about the politicization of pizza  which is part of the broader pattern in which nutrition and obesity have become deeply partisan. Big Pizza is now an industry as dedicated to the GOP as coal or tobacco.

title: The Ferguson Nightmare
description: The Justice Department report on the bigoted law enforcement practices used in Ferguson, Mo. illustrates two things very clearly. First, that racism tainted virtually every decision local government made. Second, the citys decision to raise significant revenue through fines transformed both the police department and the courts into instruments of white supremacy and economic repression. These excerpts give a sense of the nightmarish conditions under which black citizens of Ferguson and nearby St. Louis County municipalities have lived as a result.

title: Eaton Vance Charts Exchange-Traded Future
description: Thomas E. Faust Jr. does not come across as an industry disrupter. He is the chief executive of Eaton Vance, a midsize fund company in Boston that has carved out a solid yet unspectacular niche as a provider of investment funds and advice.

title: De Blasio and Developer Are Close, but Not on Lower-Cost Housing
description: Unlike many of his more wary real estate brethren, Rob Speyer moved quickly to build a strong relationship with New Yorks liberal mayor, Bill de Blasio, after his election in 2013.

title: Glacier to Yellowstone on a Bike
description: Cycling from Glacier National Park to Yellowstone might seem like an intense endeavor, but to guides at the Cycling House in Missoula, Mont., its just a chance to take off work, see some beautiful scenery and get to know people, Shaun Radley, the companys director of operations, said of its new summer excursion.

title: Big Donors Are Asked to Encourage a Civil G.O.P. Primary
description: Foster Friess, the businessman who helped finance Rick Santorums 2012 presidential campaign through large donations to the outside group supporting his candidacy, is asking his fellow multimillionaire donors to press the Republican field to be civil during the partys primary in 2016.

title: Live Chat About Finding That Sweet Spot in Life and Work
description: Join me and The Sweet Spot author Christine Carter for a live chat about finding your groove at home and work. Christine coached three readers with three very specific problems: finding more time to exercise, ending an email obsession, and focusing on work in a home office where distractions are just a kitchen away.

title: House of Cards Season 3, Episode 11 Recap: Every Seven Years
description: Season 3, Episode 11: Chapter 37

title: Cardinal Edward M. Egan, 82, Dies; Led New York Archdiocese in Trying Time
description: Cardinal Edward M. Egan, a stern defender of Roman Catholic orthodoxy who presided over the Archdiocese of New York for nine years in an era of troubled finances, changing demographics and an aging, dwindling priesthood shaken by sexual-abuse scandals, died on Thursday in Manhattan. He was 82.

title: Broncos Peyton Manning to Play in 2015
description: Quarterback Peyton Manning, a perennial Pro Bowl selection and a sure shot for the Pro Football Hall of Fame, will return for the 2015 season after he reworked his contract with the Denver Broncos.

title: Success Runs Deeper Than All the 3-Pointers
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  About an hour before the start of an afternoon practice last week, Kaneisha Atwater shot dozens of 3-pointers as a wall-mounted computer called the Noah Instant calculated the trajectory of each attempt.

title: Why AbbVie May Have Overpaid for Cancer Drug Maker
description: AbbVies chief executive may have overpaid once again.

title: Letters: Chasing the Scream
description: Chasing the Scream

title: California Senate Race Gets a Republican Contender
description: California now has a Republican contender for its soon-to-be open Senate seat.

title: J. Crews New, Very French Stripes and Address
description: Come tomorrow, J. Crew will be the new American in Paris when it opens its first shop in the Marais, the brands second location in Europe apart from its four London posts. The 1,800-square-foot space, housed inside a restored storefront made of lacquered brass, antique oak and marble, will be dedicated to the womens collection (a mens boutique is set to debut in the City of Light later this year). In celebration, the design team has partnered with Saint James, famous for its Parisian chic sailor stripes, on a 33-piece collection of one-of-a-kind tees exclusive to the new address (85  250). We thought about Brigitte Bardot, baguettes and berets, the creative director Jenna Lyons explains about the tops. She sums them up as being unique and a bit bonkers.

title: Guest Post | Analyzing the Elements of Art: Six Ways to Think About Shape
description: March is National Youth Arts Month, and were collaborating with KQED Art School to explore one of the seven elements of visual art  shape  and suggest ways to apply the ideas to images and articles found in The New York Times.

title: A Wink at the Quirks of a Famed Collector
description: Now that the Barnes Foundation has weathered its move from Albert Barness home in suburban Merion, Pa., to downtown Philadelphia in 2012, it seems newly game to look at itself with a bit of irreverence.

title: Nasdaq Changed in Its Climb to 5,000
description: That the Nasdaq composite index closed over 5,000 this week for the first time in 15 years is not just a reminder of the virtues of patience. Its even more a testament to the transformative power of capitalism.

title: States Weigh Legislation to Let Businesses Refuse to Serve Gay Couples
description: ATLANTA  As it looks increasingly likely that the Supreme Court will establish a nationwide right to same-sex marriage later this year, state legislatures across the country are taking up bills that would make it easier for businesses and individuals to opt out of serving gay couples on religious grounds.

title: Review: The Last Flight of Poxl West by Daniel Torday
description: In summary, the plot of Daniel Tordays evocative first novel, The Last Flight of Poxl West, may sound a little schematic. A 15-year-old boy named Eli worships his uncle Poxl, who writes a well-received memoir about his heroic exploits as a bomber pilot during World War II. But in the wake of the books success, Eli discovers that Poxl is not exactly who he has pretended to be.

title: McDonalds Asks a Band to Play for Free Food, but No Money at SXSW
description: With each passing year, raging against the invasion of brands at the South by Southwest music festival feels more futile. Once known as a pre-Internet launching pad for emerging independent musicians, the industry bacchanal in Austin, Tex., taking place this year from March 17 to 22, has grown into a sometimes uncomfortable hodgepodge of acts still striving to make it big and more established stars performing amid an onslaught of hashtags, according to some veteran observers.

title: ISIS Is Adept on Twitter, Study Finds
description: The Islamic State, the violent extremist group that espouses a return to a seventh-century caliphate, has been astonishingly successful at spreading its message using 21st-century social media, according to a study released Thursday.

title: A Different Kind of Protest in Washington
description: Many used Thursdays snowstorm to hold a Sled-In, openly defying a ban on sledding on Capitol Hill grounds.

title: In Ellen Paos Suit vs. Kleiner Perkins, World of Venture Capital Is Under Microscope
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Speak up  but dont talk too much. Light up the room  but dont overshadow others. Be confident and critical  but not cocky or negative.

title: Review: Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt Features a Midwestern Fish Out of Water
description: There was a time when just being from the Midwest was funny. That was the joke of Wonderful Town, the 1953 musical about two sisters from Columbus, Ohio, who move into a basement apartment in Greenwich Village with eccentric neighbors and a kooky landlord. (Why, oh why, oh why, oh  why did I ever leave Ohio?)

title: First Draft Focus: Civil Disobedience, by Sledding
Events at the Brooklyn Museum and the United Palace Theater
description: In a city like New York, having countless entertainment options to choose from on a Saturday night can lead to paralyzing indecision and the strange feeling that theres nothing to do.

title: Young Designers Revive Sweater Dresses on the Runway
description: Ah, the sweater dress: an easy piece to dress up or down, and a year-round, lazy-day staple. But thanks to this seasons new ribbed knit dresses, updated by a trio of cool, new, young designers, the garment will become less of a throw-on-and-go piece and more of an I-have-arrived look by fall. In London, Thomas Tait and the design duo at MarquesAlmeida both introduced dresses in bright, poppy colors and asymmetrical silhouettes. And today in Paris, Sbastien Meunier presented a darker version on the Ann Demeulemeester runway. Each drapes the body for a cozy yet sophisticated feel even when matched with a pair of chunky white sneakers.

title: Florida Gulf Coast Women Aim High
