description: Images from a day with the womens basketball team at Florida Gulf Coast University, which is 27-2 and ranked No. 20 entering the quarterfinals on Friday of the Atlantic Sun Conference tournament.

title: Art of Internment Camps Will Head to Auction
description: ART OF INTERNMENT CAMPS

title: A Giant Picture of Snow Across the United States
description: These composite satellite images compare snow cover in February from 2013 to 2015.

title: McConnell Changes Course on Iran Vote
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican majority leader, changed course Thursday in the face of opposition from Democrats and opted against pushing ahead with a bipartisan bill that would give Congress the authority to review any nuclear deal with Iran.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Rick Owens Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Rick Owens Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: A Year After Flight 370s Disappearance, Grief and Anger Endure
description: Nearly a year ago, on March 8, Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 left Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, for Beijing. The Boeing 777 was due to arrive with 239 crew members and passengers, among them more than 150 Chinese citizens. About 40 minutes after takeoff, contact between the aircraft and air traffic controllers ceased. Hundreds of relatives of the Chinese passengers traveled to Beijing and waited for weeks in a hotel for news of their loved ones.

title: How Not to Be That Sports Parent
description: There really is a right way and a wrong way to watch a childs sporting events. Whether its soccer, hockey, baseball or dressage, the best parent-spectator is the one whose biggest concern is his child. Not whether his childs team wins. Not his childs performance on the ice or the field. Not his childs playing time, his childs penalties, his childs coaches or his childs teammates. Just the child. The one out there playing a game and (one hopes) having fun.

title: Court Upholds Right of Reporter to Publish Excerpts From Diary of James Browns Wife
description: In a freedom of speech case, South Carolinas Supreme Court ruled Wednesday that Sue Summer, a reporter for The Newberry Observer, could publish the diary of a woman recently recognized as the wife of the singer James Brown. Ms. Summer had published excerpts from the diary as part of her coverage of the continuing dispute over the distribution of Mr. Browns estate.

title: Mail Trucks of the Past
description: A look back at postal vehicles of the last 120 years.

title: Review: Ennion, at the Met, Profiles an Ancient Glassmaker
description: If the name Ennion is familiar to you, you probably are a scholar or collector of ancient glassware, and youll appreciate the significance of Ennion: Master of Roman Glass, a small exhibition of ancient glassware at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. But you dont have to be a specialist to profit from this lovely and informative show.

title: To Explain Missing Malaysia Airlines Flight, Rogue Pilot Seems Likeliest Theory
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  The retired chief pilot of Malaysia Airlines is torn between logic and loyalty to an old friend. Nik Huzlan, 56, was one of the first captains to fly the 12-year-old Boeing 777 that disappeared over the Indian Ocean a year ago this Sunday. He has known the pilot who flew the plane that day, Zaharie Ahmad Shah, for decades.

title: Organic Ice Cream for Tongue-in-Cheek Types
description: If the two new flavors being introduced by Three Twins Ice Cream this week, in honor of its 10th anniversary, sound a little familiar, its with good reason: Weve heard these flavors remind some people of those two guys up in Vermont, the brands founder, Neal Gottlieb, says slyly. Banana Nut Confetti and Cherry Chocolate Chunk were designed as winking homages to Ben & Jerrys beloved Chunky Monkey and Cherry Garcia, respectively  but with the distinction of being fully organic, which Ben & Jerrys is not. Even the packaging is in on the joke: Were not monkeying around with this combination of banana, walnuts and chocolate, declares the Banana Nut Confetti pint, while Cherry Chocolate Chunk insists, Youll be grateful that this sumptuous combination is available in organic. Both ice creams are smooth, rich and fruit-driven, a fitting tribute to  dare we say improvement upon?  their inspiration.

title: Fed's Stress Test of Big Banks: Part One
description: The nations largest banks have adequate capital to withstand a severe economic downturn and market turmoil, the Fed has found in its latest annual stress test.

title: Search at Sea for Flight 370 Yields Optimism Amid Disappointment
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Despite months of disappointment, toughing out seas lashed by cyclonic winds and thousands of hours of searching for debris thought to be on a seabed almost three miles deep, Paul Kennedy is determined.

title: Big Banks Pass Muster in Latest Stress Tests
description: The nations largest banks appear to have the financial strength to survive a nightmarish world where unemployment soars, house prices plummet and Wall Street crashes, the Federal Reserve said on Thursday.

title: Jonas Kaufmann Withdraws From Second Met Performance
description: The star tenor Jonas Kaufmann has withdrawn from Saturdays sold-out matinee performance of Carmen at the Metropolitan Opera, citing illness  meaning that Mr. Kaufmann, who was scheduled to sing only two performances there this season, will miss both.

title: ISIS Attacks Nimrud, a Major Archaeological Site in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  The Islamic State militant group attacked the ancient archaeological site of Nimrud in northern Iraq and damaged it with heavy vehicles, Iraqs Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities said Thursday.

title: Yulia P Transforms at Rick Owens
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Yulia P before (left) and after (right) makeup by Lucia Pieroni and hair by Luigi Murenu.

title: Jeff Koons: Jim Beam  J. B. Turner Engine and Six Individual Cars
description: In 1986, Jeff Koons produced Luxury and Degradation, an exhibition at International With Monument Gallery in the East Village. It featured reproductions of ads for alcoholic beverages and cast stainless-steel copies of novelty liquor decanters made by Jim Beam. Among these was a set of seven model railroad cars on a single track. Within each car was a fifth of Jim Beam whiskey with a tax-stamped top.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: Photos from New York, Ukraine, Russia and India.

title: Review: Musica Sacra Highlights Living Composers
description: Musica Sacra, the notable professional chorus and mainstay of the New York choral scene, has a strong reputation both for its interpretations of the classics, such as the annual performances of Handels Messiah, and for its commissioning of new works.

title: March 5, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from New York, Ukraine, Russia and India.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Balmain Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Balmain Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Lanvin Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Will New York Have a Clinton-Like Email Problem?
description: The furor over former Secretary of State Hillary Clintons use of a personal email should be a warning to New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo.

title: Weekend Entertainments From the Archives of The New York Times
description: 80 YEARS AGO

title: Passenger and Official on Plane Skidding
description: A passenger on the Delta Air Lines flight that skidded off the runway at La Guardia Airport described the scene and an official from the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey gave a statement.

title: Frank Talk on Race
description: I am an experienced public relations consultant in business for myself. Usually I am hired sight unseen after clients review my portfolio, speak with me on the telephone and check my references. But occasionally, after positive conversations, would-be clients ask to meet me in person. When they discover I am black, I almost never get the work. How can I avoid wasting my time with these meetings and alert people in advance about my race? I send my LinkedIn profile, but they rarely look at it. (And for the record, people find me affable and attractive.)

title: Reveling in a Role
description: As the number of remaining regular-season games dwindles, ushers reflect on their experiences at Nassau Coliseum, where their jobs often felt more like a family reunion than work.

title: A Long Island Goodbye
description: The ushers at Nassau Coliseum are institutions at the arena, which is the home rink of the Islanders until next season.

title: Review: Handels Semele Comes With Sumo Wrestlers at BAM
description: Knowing nothing about opera should disqualify a director from being invited to stage one. At least you would think so. Yet many companies boast of recruiting neophyte directors as a way to shake up the art form. Alas, a lot of trendy, clueless productions have resulted.

title: Joan Waltemath: One does not negate the other
description: Painting and architecture used to be much closer, such that at least during the Renaissance artists sometimes practiced both. Joan Waltemath is a painter, although she taught at the architecture school at Cooper Union for many years, but her works are planned and constructed almost like buildings.

title: Once Upon a Time and Now
description: In 1989, when AIDS and the culture wars were slamming the art world, the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Community Center in New York mounted a big morale-boosting group exhibition on the 20th anniversary of the Stonewall riots. Of the 50 pieces  half by men, half by women, gay and not  in that show, a few were site-specific murals and remain visible, even as the interior has changed. A current show, Once Upon a Time and Now, highlights and adds to them.

title: Claudia Comte: No Melon No Lemon
description: Since opening in 2008, the Gladstone Gallerys space on West 21st Street has emphasized large sculptures or environmental installations. In December, for example, the painter R. H. Quaytman put abstract painting and architecture on a collision course with challenging, if decidedly confused, awkward results. Now the Swiss-born, Berlin-based artist Claudia Comte makes her American debut with roughly the opposite: a sculptural-architectural ensemble resembling a designer boutique, home furnishings store or art fair stand. This totality makes a delightful first impression, but its sources and references are startlingly obvious.

title: U.S. Auction Suggests Lingering Interest in Bitcoin
description: The falling price of Bitcoin has not entirely quashed investor enthusiasm for the virtual currency.

title: Pablo Helguera: Strange Oasis
description: Social practice, a recent term developed to describe art projects often staged in distinct communities and concerned with social justice issues, is hard to translate into a gallery in Chelsea. You might not even know this was a social practice-type show, except that Pablo Helguera, who also works in the education department at the Museum of Modern Art (museum education departments are hotbeds of social practice activity), is well known in the field.

title: Lanvinrtw: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Review: Sara Baras in a Flamenco Whirlwind
description: In Voces, Suite Flamenca, the Spanish flamenco star Sara Baras pays tribute to six luminaries of her art who have influenced her. Their likenesses appear on mobile flats that suggest monumental headstones. Their voices can be heard in recordings, expounding in Spanish on the meaning of flamenco. Live singers and guitarists add resonant voices of their own. That most of the show rings hollow is the fault of Ms. Baras.

title: 11 Little-Known Facts About John Galliano and Alexander McQueen
description: Shocking and endearing anecdotes culled from Dana Thomass new book, Gods and Kings, about the rise and fall of the fashion designers.

title: Thomas Struths Entanglement
description: The German photographer Thomas Struth, who was recently the subject of an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, seems to work at the descriptive limits of photography. His eye is meticulous, and each of his images contains a tremendous amount of information. He is perhaps best known for his large-format photographs of people in art museums. Those photographs thrill the eye with double vision: We are looking at people who are looking at something. In fact, it gets more reflexive than that: We are generally looking at these pictures in a museum, and the images are usually of people who are themselves looking at something in a museum.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Fair City
description: Scenes from the Independent and other art fairs in New York.

title: At Rick Owens, a Sculptural Hairstyle Among the Many
description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: Madonna on Rebel Heart, Her Fall and More
description: Madonna was perfectly turned out and running nearly an hour late for an interview at her Upper East Side home on Wednesday evening. She looked tense as she apologized. Im late for everything now, she said.

title: Review: The Art Show at the Park Avenue Armory Covers the Creative Map
description: What you see on entering The Art Show, the annual fair of the Art Dealers Association of America, is yourself and other visitors reflected in a giant mirror. Displayed in Luhring Augustines booth, Cords, by the veteran Italian conceptualist Michelangelo Pistoletto, consists of four mirrored panels with a cutout, photographic rendering of stanchions connected by fat ropes. The ropes evoke the atmosphere of exclusivity fostered by high-end galleries like the 72 convened here. On the other hand, the mirror inclusively reflects viewers themselves and, by extension, the broader public they belong to. In art, the public might find reflections of itself and its own, ever-evolving cultural identity.

title: Review: The 2015 Armory Show Overlaps History and Cultures
description: Now in its second decade, the Armory Show  which in 1999 itself appropriated the name from the historic 1913 Armory Show  is far past its mythic origins of 1994, when the fair opened in the Gramercy Hotel and art was displayed on hotel room beds.

title: Review: Independent Art Fair Combines Less Is More and Growth
description: Six years ago, when it started out, the art fair called Independent really was sort of that. It had a cool guerrilla buzz. In the former Dia headquarters on West 22nd Street in Chelsea, it was tiny compared with the cattle-call Armory Show. More rebelliously, admission was free. And the look was new. Instead of booths the size of stockyard stalls, there were wide-open prairies of exhibition space on all three floors. Within these democratic vistas, you could hardly tell where one gallery ended and another began.

title: Furor Over Clinton Emails Tests Relationship With White House
description: The uproar over Hillary Rodham Clintons personal email account when she was secretary of state is the most public test of her relationship with the Obama White House since her book tour last summer.

title: An Ankle Boot with a Futuristic Heel at Paco Rabanne
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Audubons Aviary: The Final Flight Alights at the New-York Historical Society
description: JOHN JAMES AUDUBON painted many birds, but for sheer stage presence, his great gray owl is hard to beat. Perched on a rotten branch, it turns halfway, as though disturbed, and fixes the viewer with an imperious stare. The yellow eyes glow, their intensity magnified by concentric ringlike markings that spread outward, like a feathery vortex. The plumage is regal  thick drapery, in a gray and brown pattern, falling in soft folds. The owl exudes the heavy solemnity of one of Velzquezs popes or Holbeins portrait of Thomas More.

title: Review: In Buzzard, an Angry, Unkempt Antihero
description: Marty Jackitansky (Joshua Burge), the repellent protagonist of the bleakly amusing indie film Buzzard, is a slovenly office temp at a mortgage company in Michigan who supplements his meager income from a $9.50-an-hour job with small-time con artistry. The bank for which he works and the neighborhood where he lives are so drab that his daily routine of clerical drudgery, fast-food snacks and toxic junk-culture distractions is a living hell.

title: Theater Listings for March 6-12
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Reaction to Regulation: 1934 vs. Today
description: Last week, the Federal Communications Commission voted to regulate Internet service as a public utility, reclassifying broadband providers under Title II of the Communications Act of 1934 and subjecting them to stricterrules.Republicans and many broadband providers have criticized the decision, arguing that it was driven by the president and gives the federal government too much control, draws on datedlaws and will result in subjective interpretations of broad mandates.

title: Comedy Listings for March 6-12
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Movie Listings for March 6-12
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Pop, Rock & Cabaret Listings for March 6-12
description: Prices may not reflect ticketing service charges. For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: With Nemtsovs Killing, a Leadership Void Widens for Russias Opposition
description: MOSCOW  Among the motley collection of former ministers, retired spies, billionaire oligarchs, intellectuals and others who constitute Russias anemic liberal opposition, Boris Y. Nemtsov, the Kremlin critic fatally shot last week, always stood out.

title: Jazz Listings for March 6-12
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dance Listings for March 6-12
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Walker Says Clinton Should Answer Questions About Email Use
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, a likely Republican presidential candidate in 2016, criticized Hillary Rodham Clinton for using a personal email account when she was secretary of state.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | It Follows
description: David Robert Mitchell narrates a sequence from It Follows, opening March 13.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for March 6-12
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: David Robert Mitchell Narrates a Scene From It Follows
description: In this video, the writer and director David Robert Mitchell discusses the opening sequence of his teenage horror drama It Follows, opening March 13, about an evil force that steadily tracks its victims.

title: Spare Times Listings for Children for March 6-12
description: Letters From Anne and Martin

title: Spare Times Listings for March 6-12
description: Around Town

title: Opera & Classical Music Listings for March 6-12
description: Reviews of classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Making Egypts Streets Safe for Women
description: Eman Helal hopes to not only document the widespread harassment of women on Cairos streets, but also aims to spur changes in public attitudes and behavior.

title: Review: In Chappie, a Smart Robot Runs With the Wrong Crowd
description: Frankensteins monster gets a titanium makeover in Chappie, a science-fiction blood-spurter and would-be heart-warmer that wavers uncertainly between laughter and tears. Set in South Africa in the usual bummer future  yet again, its man against man, as well as machine  the movie imagines a scenario in which tin-can police march in lock step with their human analogues to roust the usual tattooed and dreadlocked gun-toting degenerates. All the aerial shots of the dangerously swarming and swelling multitudes suggest that such draconian tactics are necessary.

title: Lincoln and Douglasss Last Encounter
description: As the presidential coach plowed through thick mud on Pennsylvania Avenue, Frederick Douglass sensed danger. The editor and abolitionist activist began walking as closely behind as he could, studying every onlooker for a hint of conspiracy. When they reached the Capitol for Lincolns Second Inaugural without incident, a relieved Douglass joined the vast crowd, finding a place in front of the East Portico.

title: Review: October Gale Stars Patricia Clarkson
description: A woman alone in the movies is rarely alone for long. In October Gale, a low-key character study gives way to increasingly clamorous melodrama when a widowed doctor, Helen (Patricia Clarkson), finds a bleeding man making a mess on the floor of her lakeside vacation home. Having gone out to inspect a noise (and left her front door open), shes returned to find William (Scott Speedman), a handsome stranger  good looks being a prerequisite for gigs like this  with a bullet in his shoulder. While some women might run for a kitchen knife, this good doctor starts dressing his wound.

title: This Weeks Movies | March 6, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, Merchants of Doubt and Chappie.

title: Review: Kidnapping Mr. Heineken Revisits a 1983 Dutch Crime
description: The sole object lesson in the true-crime drama Kidnapping Mr. Heineken is that not every crime deserves its own movie. That much becomes clear in the director Daniel Alfredsons dreary, uninvolving fictionalized take on the real 1983 snatching of Alfred Heineken, chairman of the company bearing his familys name. A few years ago, the same story was turned into The Heineken Kidnapping, a Dutch movie with Rutger Hauer in the title role, which racked up some business in the Netherlands and is available on Amazon on demand.

title: Mayor de Blasio Urges New York Businesses to Raise Hourly Wages to Over $13
description: Facing resistance in Albany over his calls for a minimum wage exceeding $13 an hour in New York City, Mayor Bill de Blasio took his case directly to business leaders on Thursday, urging them to raise workers pay to that level voluntarily.

title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
description: The Times critic Stephen Holden reviews The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel.

title: Reinventing the Mail Truck
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  On a recent snowy morning, Michael Ellis prepared his mail truck for the daily route he has run here for the last decade, through a neighborhood in the Washington suburbs.

title: Movie Review: Merchants of Doubt
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews Merchants of Doubt.

title: Movie Review: Chappie
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Chappie.

title: Immigration Fight Shouldnt Stall Vote to Confirm Lynch, Democrats Say
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats on Thursday intensified their push for a vote on the confirmation of Loretta E. Lynch as attorney general, arguing that her nomination should not be held up because Republicans are angry with President Obama over executive action on immigration.

title: Alberto Nisman, Argentine Prosecutor, Was Killed, His Ex-Wife Says
description: BUENOS AIRES  The former wife of a federal prosecutor who died of a gunshot wound to the head after making explosive accusations against Argentinas president charged Thursday that he had been murdered  reviving a bitter debate here over the mysterious circumstances shrouding his death.

title: Lack of Diversity Persists in Admissions to New York Citys Elite High Schools
description: Amid calls for new admissions procedures to increase diversity in New York Citys elite public high schools, the number of black and Hispanic students winning seats remained virtually unchanged this year, according to statistics the Education Department released on Thursday.

title: Review: In Two Men in Town, a Parolee Is Hounded by a Cop
description: Paroled after serving 18 years in prison for the killing of a sheriffs deputy, William Garnett tries to build a normal life in a small border town in the New Mexico desert. William, who converted to Islam in the penitentiary, buys a used motorcycle, finds a job at a ranch and begins a romance. His peace is threatened by a grudge-holding sheriff and by an old friend who wants to drag William back into his criminal ways. His parole officer does what she can to head off what seems like an inevitably tragic turn of events.

title: Palestinian Council Questions Security Arrangement With Israel
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  A Palestinian leadership body called Thursday night for curtailing longstanding security coordination with Israel, but left decisions on when or whether to take such a step to President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority and the Palestine Liberation Organizations executive committee.

title: Vice Media C.E.O. Begins Move Into Washington by Meeting Senators
description: WASHINGTON  Shane Smith, the burly, bearded chief executive and self-described pit bull of the fast-growing Vice Media, rumbled into Washington on Wednesday for a tour, including his first private meetings with several senators.

title: Review: In Faults, Mind Games Dont End Beyond the Cult
description: Cult mind games  the cultivation of blind obedience from communal devotees  are entering their own as a dramatic staple. Sound of My Voice, from 2012, cast Brit Marling as the charismatic leader of a mysterious sect; Martha Marcy May Marlene, from 2011, offered Elizabeth Olsen as a shattered escapee from a gurus domination; and Paul Thomas Andersons The Master, from 2012, starred Philip Seymour Hoffman as a fraud sapping the free will of Joaquin Phoenix.

title: Review: An Honest Liar, a Documentary About the Debunker James Randi
description: Magicians are the most honest people in the world, the illusionist James Randi says at the beginning of An Honest Liar. They tell you theyre gonna fool you, and then they do it. Documenting a lifetime spent gulling audiences and pursuing con men, the directors Justin Weinstein and Tyler Measom have produced a jaunty, jovial portrait with a surprising sting in its tail.

title: Review: The Mind of Mark DeFriest Is a Documentary About a Prison Houdini
description: The indomitable personality and talents of the serial prison escapee Mark DeFriest outshine the weaknesses of this documentary that bears his name. Gabriel Londons The Mind of Mark DeFriest recounts how this Florida man landed in prison and kept breaking out through illegal (and often outlandish) means.

title: Review: Earths Golden Playground, a Documentary on Prospecting in the Yukon
description: Early in Andreas Horvaths Earths Golden Playground, a look at modern-day prospectors in the Yukon territory of Canada, an underground shot at a gold dig suggests an ultra-lo-fi variation on the opening of There Will Be Blood. But Mr. Horvaths procedural, increasingly dry documentary takes the rush out of gold rush.

title: Ed Modzelewski, Fullback for Maryland and the Browns, Dies at 86
description: Ed Modzelewski, the fullback known as Big Mo, who starred with his brother Dick, the defensive tackle called Little Mo, on an undefeated University of Maryland team, then collided with him in the N.F.L. of the 1950s when his Cleveland Browns faced Dicks Giants, died on Saturday in West Sedona, Ariz. He was 86.

title: Review: In Unfinished Business, Vince Vaughn and Sienna Miller Are Rivals
description: A EuroTrip with balance sheets, the slick, innocuous comedy Unfinished Business fails to seal the deal. Dan Trunkman (Vince Vaughn) is a St. Louis executive and father whose company is being restructured by Chuck Portnoy (Sienna Miller), a shark already demanding too many hours from employees. Enraged, Dan starts a rival outfit, hiring Tim McWinters (Tom Wilkinson), an older colleague forced into retirement, and Mike Pancake (Dave Franco), a young, pretty dullard.

title: Robert G. Dean, Whose Theories on Sand Saved Beaches, Dies at 84
description: Though they have probably never heard of him, beachgoers regularly see the work of Robert G. Dean, especially if they visit towns on the barrier islands that line the East and Gulf Coasts.

title: Schwabs Service for Investors Seeking Thrifty Advice Raises Eyebrows
description: Charles Schwab is poised to introduce an investment service for consumers who crave low-cost personalized advice but do not have a lot of money to invest. And it is dangling an attractive lure in front of investors, in a way that its competitors have not: It says its service is free.

title: Cardinal Edward M. Egan Dies at 82
description: Cardinal Egan was one of Americas most visible Catholic leaders.

title: Review: Deli Man Is a Documentary on Jewish Delis, Schmaltz and All
description: Deli Man examines the state of the Jewish deli through David Gruber, known as Ziggy, a founder of Kenny & Ziggys New York Delicatessen Restaurant in Houston. Trained in culinary school, he represents the third generation in his family to run such a restaurant, the film says; Ziggys grandfather was a source for many of his recipes and Yiddishisms. Since he was a little kid, hes been an 80-year-old Jew, says J. Mackye Gruber, Ziggys brother (and the co-director of the 2004 film The Butterfly Effect).

title: Harrison Ford Crashes Plane on Golf Course
description: The actor Harrison Ford was injured on Thursday when a single-engine, World War II-era training plane he was piloting crashed onto a golf course in Venice, Calif., shortly after takeoff from Santa Monica Airport.

title: Companies Turn Tables on Human Rights Lawyers
description: Over the past decade, companies doing business in Colombia, like Chiquita Brands and Dole Food, have incurred the wrath of Terrence Collingsworth, a lawyer who has accused them of mistreating workers or conspiring to kill labor activists.

title: AbbVie Wins Bidding War for Maker of Cancer Drug, Then Goes on Defensive
description: Robert Duggan, according to his many websites, has played basketball with Pat Riley of the N.B.A., taught his children to surf by the time they were 3 and made fortunes starting and selling companies in fields as varied as cookies and robot surgery. He is the largest donor to the Church of Scientology.

title: A League Full of Professionals, in Actions if Not in Pay
description: BOSTON  In the Canadian Womens Hockey League, job titles are often ambiguous.

title: Review: The Mafia Kills Only in Summer Is a Comical Look at the Mob
description: The best that can be said for the Italian television host Pierfrancesco Diliberto  as far as his comic, feature-film debut is concerned  is that hes not nearly as annoying as Roberto Benigni. Granted, thats a very low bar to clear.

title: Gov. Christie Goes Easy on a Big Polluter
description: The state of New Jersey invested more than 10 years in a lawsuit to recover $8.9 billion in damages from Exxon Mobil Corporation for environmental contamination of more than 1,500 acres of wetlands, marshes and meadows in northern New Jersey. Exxons liability was not in dispute. But just as a state judge was nearing a decision on damages, Gov. Chris Christies administration intervened and quietly agreed to settle the claim for a stunningly low $250 million.

title: With Eyes on His Vote in Health Subsidies Case, Roberts Lets on Little
description: WASHINGTON  Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. usually displays his supple intellect and competitive nature at Supreme Court arguments, where he makes points and punctures the positions of the lawyers who appear before him.

title: Pushing Limits of a Sport, and a Budget
description: GOODYEAR, Ariz.  You hear it from just about every major league hitter: Strikeouts are rising because pitchers throw really, really fast. Relievers trot in from the bullpen, one after another, and overpower the hitters.

title: Review: In These Final Hours an Imminent Apocalypse Incites Depravity
description: Every time the world ends, somebody has to learn a lesson, generally about Love and Whats Really Important. In These Final Hours, an Australian drama, its Jamess turn. The lesson may not be particularly original, but the film has some striking moments as it follows him to his destiny.

title: Iran Gains Influence in Iraq as Shiite Forces Fight ISIS
description: AWJA, Iraq  All along the green irrigated plains in the heart of what American occupying troops used to call the Sunni triangle, lampposts and watchtowers are flying the flags of the Badr Organization, a Shiite militia long hated and feared by many Iraqi Sunnis.

title: Review: Adam Carollas Road Hard, a Comedy About a Comic
description: Adam Carolla really wants people to know that he hates show business. And Los Angeles. And the road. And his audience. And any younger performer who gained popularity with the help of the Internet or social media.

title: In U.C.L.A. Debate Over Jewish Student, Echoes on Campus of Old Biases
description: LOS ANGELES  It seemed like routine business for the student council at the University of California, Los Angeles: confirming the nomination of Rachel Beyda, a second-year economics major who wants to be a lawyer someday, to the councils Judicial Board.

title: Back to a Short Putter, Adam Scott Is Happy With the Results
description: DORAL, Fla.  Adam Scott looked as if he were paying tribute to the recently departed Leonard Nimoy on Thursday on the greens of Dorals Blue Monster. Holding his putter in his left hand, Scott rested his right hand, palm down, lightly on the grip and gave his golf ball a modified Vulcan salute.

title: Mexico: Gunmen Kill a Navy Officer
description: A navy officer put in charge of Mexicos second-largest port in an effort to wrest control of it from a drug gang was shot and killed in what the authorities said Thursday was a robbery attempt. The officer, Rear Adm. Jos Luis Corro Chvez, was shot Wednesday after he refused to leave his vehicle when gunmen demanded it outside his house in the port city of Lzaro Crdenas, in Michoacn State. Two suspects have been arrested. Admiral Corro had served at the port since November 2013, when the navy began trying to root out the Knights Templar gang, which had been smuggling iron ore to China and extorting mining interests in the area. The authorities said the shooting was not related to organized crime, but it came nearly a week after the arrest of the former top leader of the Knights Templar, Servando Gmez.

title: 529 College Savings Plans in a State of Evolution
description: EARLY this year, 529 college savings plans stirred a lot of attention  outrage, really  when President Obama proposed eliminating the tax-free status of withdrawals from the accounts, which millions of Americans use to save for higher education costs.

title: Senate Will Postpone Debate on Iran
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, Republican of Kentucky and the majority leader, will postpone consideration of a bill giving Congress the authority to review any deal President Obama reaches with Iran on its nuclear program, bowing to opposition from Democrats who charged that he was rushing the measure. Mr. McConnell, who this week set the stage for a procedural vote on the legislation on Tuesday, decided on Thursday that he would wait to bring up the bipartisan measure. Don Stewart, a spokesman for Mr. McConnell, said that would give Democrats time to decide whether or not they believe they and Congress as a whole should be able to review and vote on any deal the president cuts with the leaders of Iran. The decision merely delays what promises to be an intense debate in Congress over whether Mr. Obama should be able to seal a deal with Iran aimed at blocking it from acquiring nuclear weapons and under what terms. A growing bipartisan coalition of lawmakers believes Congress must have a say over any such accord, and they are moving to lay out tough requirements for Mr. Obama that could shape any deal.

title: Success is a Great Deodorant
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  David Phillips goes into quite a bit of detail about his puzzle, so Im going to be brief and then get out of his way. The one point I would like to make is that I am starving right now.

title: Review: Fish in the Dark, Larry Davids Antic Broadway Debut
description: The fish itself  the one that figures in ads for the new play Fish in the Dark and can be seen on the drop curtain at the Cort Theater  is pretty great, a charming and maddening creature destined to capture your heart. O.K., if you insist: It is pret-ty, pret-ty, pret-ty great.

title: Is Boxing Dead? Some Are Betting Heavily That It Isnt
description: Al Haymon makes a habit of not speaking to reporters, but thats fine. What Haymon is attempting speaks louder than anything he might say anyway. Haymon, a Harvard-educated boxing manager and adviser, is challenging the pay-per-view model that has enriched a few people at the expense of an entire sport.

title: Brown Family Lawyer Announces Civil Case
description: Anthony Gray, a lawyer for the family of Michael Brown, a teenager killed by a police officer in Ferguson, Mo., said that the family would be filing a civil suit against the police department.

title: Some in Ferguson Who Are Part of Problem Are Asked to Help Solve It
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  When Mayor James Knowles III announced Wednesday that one official had been fired and two others were under investigation in connection with racist emails, he said that the behavior was in no way representative of the city or its employees.

title: When Clinton Joined Obama Administration, Friction Was Over Staff, Not Email
description: When President-elect Barack Obama invited Hillary Rodham Clinton to be his secretary of state, he did not just get Mrs. Clinton. He also got the extended circle of political aides she and her husband had collected over her years in the White House, the Senate and the 2008 presidential campaign.

title: Ferguson Report Puts Hands Up to Reality Test
description: They were four words that became the national rallying cry of a new civil rights movement: Hands up, dont shoot.

title: A Secret Indictment Over Errors That Have Rarely Been Crimes
description: If one of your ambitions is obscurity, being a staff worker for a City Council member is not a bad line of work. Sure, it comes with plenty of irregular hours, late evenings at civic meetings, weekend celebrations of something. But theres little risk of much public recognition.

title: Yankees Captaincy Is Open, and It May Stay That Way
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Didi Gregorius will replace Derek Jeter at shortstop for the Yankees this season because, well, somebody has to.

title: Tumblr 483  485
description: Tumblr 483  485

title: Prosecutor Denies Creating a Media Firestorm Over Sheldon Silvers Arrest
description: The office of Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, asked a federal judge on Thursday to deny a motion by Assemblyman Sheldon Silver to dismiss his indictment on grounds that Mr. Bharara orchestrated a media firestorm around the arrest of Mr. Silver.

title: Umbrella Cams View of Wintry New York
description: A camera mounted on an umbrella captures scenes of New Yorkers struggling through a late winter snow across the Brooklyn Bridge into Manhattan.

title: Bronx Woman Is Fatally Shot After Getting a Mystery Call
description: A mother of five, Michelle Cox formerly worked as a security guard. She also had run-ins with the law over the years, the police said.

title: Train Carrying Crude Oil Derails in Illinois
description: A train carrying crude oil along the banks of the Mississippi River derailed Thursday in a rural area of northwestern Illinois south of the town of Galena, starting a fire and leading the authorities to recommend that nearby residents leave their homes.

title: Mets Get Preview of N.L. Rival
description: VIERA, Fla.  Mets Manager Terry Collins was on a golf course in January when the news broke that the Washington Nationals had signed Max Scherzer. Recalling that moment, Collins joked that he shanked his next putt 10 feet past the hole.

title: Video: An Umbrellas View of Snowy New York
description: As the snow fell across New York on Thursday, a New York Times reporter mounted a video camera on the top of his umbrella and traveled across the Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn to Manhattan to capture scenes of weary city residents coping with what many fervently hoped would be the winters last major snowfall.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 5, 2015
description: March 5, 2015

title: Unlicensed Driver Who Killed Girl, 4, in 2013 Pleads Guilty to Manslaughter
description: Franklin Reyes Jr. tried to plead guilty without admitting his guilt.

title: Anthony Mason, a Former Knick and a Native Son of Queens, Is Mourned
description: They trudged through the flurries in a slow, steady stream on Thursday to pay their respects to Anthony Mason, the former New York Knick who died on Saturday at 48 after being hospitalized for congestive heart failure three weeks earlier.

title: Events on Long Island for March 8-14, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Westchester for March 8-14, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut for March 8-14, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Events in New Jersey for March 8-14, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: The Colossal Strangeness of Chinas Most Excellent Tourist City
description: Ordos, like so many of the countrys hundreds of new towns, is famous for being empty  a symbol, some would say, of the hubris of rampant urbanization. But the few people who live there see it differently.

title: Word of the Day | incandescent
description: incandescent  \in-kn-de-snt\  adjective

title: Maika Monroe Runs for Her Life in It Follows
description: Maika Monroe has spent a lot of time running for her life. Last year, in the thriller The Guest, she played a girl who must flee from the strange and dangerous man (Dan Stevens) staying with her family. In the horror movie It Follows, opening March 13, shes stalked by an evil force in human form that will kill her if it catches her. The only way to break the curse is to have sex with someone and pass it on.

title: New York City Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Rules Are Suspended on Friday
description: Because of snow removal, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Friday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Hemlines and Heartbreak in Fassbinders The Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant
description: Rainer Werner Fassbinder (1945-82) was a comet whose brief, productive career belied even as it blazed forth the decline of imported film culture. At the time of his death from a drug overdose, at 37, Fassbinder left some 40 features, a pair of TV mini-series and two dozen stage plays. But none were more Fassbinderian than this German writer-directors 1972 film, The Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant, part confession, part travesty.

title: Whats on TV Friday
description: 8 P.M. (Starz) MALEFICENT (2014) In this live-action back story to the 1959 Disney animated musical Sleeping Beauty, a happy young fairy (in a role shared by Isobelle Molloy and Ella Purnell) living in the moors becomes friends  and then something a bit more, involving a kiss  with a human farmhand (played by Michael Higgins and Jackson Bews). But eventually the boy grows into a man (Sharlto Copley) and helps wage war against the mossy wonderland of the fairy (now Angelina Jolie), whose wings are literally clipped. Now in an eternally foul mood, she retreats into a dark place, where years later she plots against his child, Aurora (Elle Fanning), who is destined to fall into a deep sleep after pricking her finger on a spindle. Ms. Jolie makes a fabulous monster as she breezes through the movie, part superstar, part superfreak, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. Consciously or not, coherently or not, Maleficent tells a new kind of story about how we live now, not once upon another time. And it does so by suggesting, among other things, that budding girls and older women are not natural foes, even if thats what fairy tales, Hollywood and the world like to tell us. And while that may sound drippy, its exactly the kind of hokey that, movie by movie, may finally make a real difference.

title: Revenge Movies Offer Mythic Middle-Aged Protectors
description: Time was, a prestigious actor midway through the journey of life would guest star on a cable show to get through the dark wood of his career. But premium television is no longer second-tier entertainment, and middle-aged actors, in contrast to their female counterparts, have no shortage of material from which to choose. Thats especially true with the booming subgenre of revenge movies made for, by and essentially about them.

title: A Team Whose Fans Are Few but Devoted
description: The Boston Blades are the only team in the Canadian Womens Hockey League based in the United States, and many of their players work part-time jobs to supplement their income.

title: In the Documentary GTFO, Female Video Gamers Fight Back
description: In the documentary GTFO, Jenny Haniver is relaxing in her living room in Wisconsin, thumbs on her Xbox controller, settling in for another session of Call of Duty. But when her fellow online combatants discover that the shooter in their midst is, to their chagrin, female, the comments commence. One player takes potshots at women  they are poor game players, they cant drive  before commanding Ms. Haniver to leave the game. Youre useless when your hymen is broken, he tells her.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: 2 seconds more we would have been in the water!

title: Corrections: March 6, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Making Egypts Streets Safe for Women
description: Like her male Egyptian colleagues, Eman Helal often dons a gas mask and helmet when she photographs protests in Cairo. But the protective gear provides her an extra level of security  from men in public. Her helmet and mask hide her hijab  the only hint she is a woman, as she otherwise dresses like a man while working  making it far less likely that she will encounter the verbal abuse or physical and sexual assaults that women have come to expect on Cairos streets.

title: Long-Term Care Crisis
A Trade Deal and the Threat to American Jobs
description: To the Editor:

title: The Temptation of Hillary
description: Hillary Clintons record is more moderate than the Democratic primary voter today. So it was always likely that she would move left as the primary season approached. Its now becoming clearer how she might do it. She might make a shift from what you might call human capital progressivism to redistributionist progressivism.

title: A New Twist in the Ferguson Case
Hillarys Step
description: On Mount Everest, just shy of the summit, the final rock-and-ice obstacle that stands between a climber and the highest point on the planet is known as the Hillary Step. It was named for Sir Edmund Hillary, who made the first ascent of the mountain along with Tenzing Norgay in 1953.

title: Alabamas Dangerous Defiance
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  ON Tuesday the Supreme Court of Alabama prohibited the states probate judges from issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples. This decision effectively throws down the gauntlet, challenging the federal courts to make earlier federal rulings stick  including last months refusal by the United States Supreme Court to stay a federal judges decision requiring the state to recognize same-sex marriages. It draws on a disturbing line of thinking in the history of American federalism, one that, were it to gain currency as a model, could compromise our entire system of law.

title: Pepperoni Turns Partisan
description: If you want to know what a political party really stands for, follow the money. Pundits and the public are often deceived; remember when George W. Bush was a moderate, and Chris Christie a reasonable guy who could reach out to Democrats? Major donors, however, generally have a very good idea of what they are buying, so tracking their spending tells you a lot.

title: The Presidents Weak Privacy Proposal
description: President Obama has said that the country needs a strong privacy law so consumers can protect personal information from advertisers, Internet firms, employers and other businesses. But the country is not going to get it from Mr. Obama. The bill his administration recently offered will do little to help individuals while giving companies great leeway in determining how they collect, use and share personal data.

title: Deferring Those Huge College Tuition Bills
Indias Careful Plan for Growth
description: Narendra Modi chose incremental pragmatism in proposing his first full budget since becoming Indias prime minister last year. The $288 billion budget did not fulfill the expectations for economic reform that he has fostered since his election. But he offered enough initiatives on spending, taxes and other areas of economic policy to satisfy many investors for now, and to keep alive hopes that he can guide India to greater growth and development.

title: Dont Kill Keystone XL. Regulate It.
description: BOULDER, Colo.  TWO years ago, I spent a month watching engineers inspect the Trans-Alaska Pipeline, one of the worlds biggest, most remote and most complicated pipelines. The endeavor entailed sending a five-ton smart pig  a rust-detecting robot  800 miles across the length of Alaska, like a spitball in a giant straw, as it hunted for signs of metal loss.

title: A Call From Selma
description: This short documentary explores how the murder of a white minister in Selma, Ala., helped catalyze the civil rights movement.

title: A Call From Selma
description: When many of us think about the civil rights movement, we remember the courage of the black protesters who risked their lives and livelihoods to push for equal rights. But obscured in this history is the fact that it took the murder of a white clergyman to trigger the national outrage about rights abuses in the South that led to real change.

title: The Excitement of Learning From Profit and Loss
description: Its often been said that the key to success is being able to handle failure. For example, from Winston Churchill: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm. Or C. S. Lewis: One fails forward toward success.

title: Test Yourself | A Celebration of Food Scraps
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 3 article, Starve a Landfill.

title: New York Citys Week in Pictures: Feb. 27
description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include images of bagpipers walking in the snow, a woman whose son was killed by a reckless driver and the first female chaplain for the Fire Department of New York.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Last Ebola Patient in Liberia Discharged From Treatment Center
description: In Last Ebola Patient in Liberia Discharged From Treatment Center, Norimitsu Onishi writes about a milestone in West Africas battle against Ebola.

title: In The Studio | Giambattista Valli
description: Giambattista Valli, an Italian fashion designer based in Paris, chats with Vanessa Friedman about his dream to have a maison dhaute couture that honors the past, but also feels contemporary.

title: Should Circuses Be Animal Free?
description: Is it cruel to use wild animals, such as elephants, tigers and bears, as traveling entertainers? Or would the circus just not be the circus without its animal stars?

title: After a Bounce, Wage Growth Slumps to 0.1%
description: The economy is adding jobs at a rapid pace, the Labor Department reported on Friday, but theres still one major holdout to the recovery: wages.

title: As Supreme Court Weighs Health Law, G.O.P. Is Planning to Replace It
description: WASHINGTON  The legal campaign to destroy President Obamas health care law may be nearing its conclusion, but as the Supreme Court deliberates over the laws fate, the search for a replacement by Republican lawmakers is finally gaining momentum.

title: Tom Udalls Unlikely Alliance With the Chemical Industry
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Tom Udall of New Mexico has earned a reputation as an environmental champion. He helped lead the fight against oil drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge and pushed through legislation for a new federal wilderness area in his home state of New Mexico.

title: That Howling? Just New Yorks Neighborhood Coyotes
description: On a cold, clear afternoon in Pelham Bay Park, the tracks were etched in the crusted snow, doglike but more oblong, the claws less prominent and, over all, more compact.

title: With Expansion, Brooklyn Childrens Museum Is Accused of Forsaking Its Community
description: On the Who We Are page of its website, the Brooklyn Childrens Museum  a mecca for hands-on learners and explorers-in-training since 1899  notes that it was founded in Crown Heights and still proudly calls the neighborhood home, embracing the rich diversity of its surroundings.

title: Basketball in Their Blood
description: The undefeated Kentucky Wildcats basketball team has only three players who hail from the state. Guard Dominique Hawkins, a sophomore reserve, is one.

title: Beloved in Kentucky, but Benched for the Wildcats
description: RICHMOND, Ky.  For many boys in the Bluegrass State, the ultimate dream is to one day play basketball for the University of Kentucky.

title: Giambattista Valli: The Birth of Ideas, and Happy Moments
description: PARIS  In the final episode of outtakes from the In the Studio video series, Giambattista Valli takes us behind the doors of his 17th-century Parisian atelier to discuss the public/private divide, the problems with fashion and the designers most fragile moments.

title: Loewe: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: New York Today: Sandwiched by Snowstorms
description: Good morning on this freezing Friday.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Ask Well: What Are the Benefits of Tai Chi?
description: Question:

title: Daily Report: Bias Suit Puts World of Venture Capital Under Spotlight
description: Speak up  but dont talk too much. Light up the room  but dont overshadow others. Be confident and critical  but not cocky or negative.

title: Netanyahus Iran Thing
description: Lets begin with Benjamin Netanyahus Iran logic. He portrays a rampaging Islamic Republic that now dominates four Arab capitals, Baghdad, Damascus, Beirut and Sana, a nation gobbling other countries on a march of conquest, subjugation and terror. Then, in the same speech, he describes Iran as a very vulnerable regime on the brink of folding.

title: How to Drive a Getaway Car
description: Never mind trying to outrace another vehicle when you need to escape, says Walter Farrer, a security consultant who teaches evasive-driving courses to business executives and wealthy Mexican families who want to avoid kidnappings. Disappear instead: drive a minivan, which is like an automotive duck blind, mobile camouflage for the road. They make you hard to follow, Farrer says. A newish minivan or midsize S.U.V. in gray with no bumper stickers is ideal. Make sure both taillights work, Farrer says. You dont want anything on your car that is easily identifiable. In particularly high-risk cities  kidnappings for ransom are a persistent problem in Mexico  he presses his clients to drive cars covered in dust bearing local plates.

title: Massimo Vitali Moves Into a 14th-Century Church
description: The photographer Massimo Vitali lives with his wife and son in Lucca, Italy, in a 14th-century church that lay empty for 17 years. The church was used mainly for storage, Vitali said. There were mice and birds in it, there was water. In Italy, when you purchase an ancient church, you have to keep it open; you cannot divide the space into smaller rooms. For additional living space, Vitalis architect, Paola Sausa, attached a former sacristy to the church.

title: Cover to Cover
Outside the Abandoned Packard Plant
description: There is a driving rhythm in this poem  the industry of crickets, the forward motion of the lines  even as there is no man-made machinery at work in the defunct auto plant. The contrast between the two heightens the tension between what is lost and the image, in the last line, of a possible future. Poem selected by Natasha Trethewey.

title: Birdman
description: The Pigeon King delivered his closing statement to the jury dressed in his only suit. His name was Arlan Galbraith, and he was representing himself. He had abruptly fired his lawyer nearly two years earlier, during the long lead up to the trial, and then ignored the judges who advised him to hire another. He seemed adrift but also supremely confident. One of his former employees, who testified for the prosecution, speculated that he must have watched too much Law & Order: I think he sat down one day and said, Yeah, I can do this.

title: Re: The Unimpeachable Manly Truth
description: It was a weird but productive sociological experiment, in the words of one journalist: Put Gary Shteyngart in a 600-square-foot luxury cage at the Four Seasons in Manhattan and force him to watch nothing but Russian television for seven days on three giant screens arranged around his plush, king-size bed. It was an (oddly) rare look at what [President Vladimir] Putin is actually telling the Russian people, tweeted Whitney Kassel, a columnist for ForeignPolicy.com.

title: Redefining Gender in Mexico City
description: When you see a person, how many seconds do you have to make a mental model? Immediately, the first thing you notice  man or woman? But I always had issues with my gender. And when people cant understand, they get uncomfortable.

title: Restaurant Report: Selfie in Moscow
description: Scoff if you want, but the name is perfect: Selfie, from the team behind the fashionable Moscow restaurant White Rabbit, is a pouty-lipped snapshot of the current insular moment among the citys cosmopolitan elite.

title: Hidden Gems on Ecuadors Emerald Coast
description: Reggaeton blaring, we zoomed along the coast of Esmeraldas, past a series of resort towns, white sand beaches spoiled only by concrete hotel towers. Our Ranchera, an Ecuadorean open-air bus, paused just long enough for schoolchildren to climb atop the roof before we veered slightly inland away from the jagged, rocky coast and into the remnants of a jungle canopy.

title: Discovering the Ruins of Italys Ionian Coast
description: It was my first day back in Metaponto in a decade, and I was anxious. As my train from Rome pulled into the station, after a six-hour descent past Vesuvius, the craggy Lucanian Dolomites, olive groves and pebbly streams, and finally the small hill towns and low, pale mountains (calanchi) of the Basilicata region, I wondered what had changed in this place since my last visit. My family was from this area originally, four generations back, and I had come here twice before to do genealogical research. But it had been a while.

title: Parliamentary Panel Urges Britain to Stand Up for Hong Kong
description: A British parliamentary committee has warned that Hong Kongs high degree of autonomy is at risk and called on London to take a stronger stand on behalf of democratic change in its former colony.

title: Today in Politics
Morning Agenda: Big Banks Pass Stress Tests
description: BIG BANKS PASS STRESS TESTS | All 31 of the nations biggest banks appear to have enough financial strength to survive a severe downturn in the United States economy, according to the results of the so-called stress tests that the Federal Reserve released on Thursday. But some banks fared better than others, DealBooks Peter Eavis writes.

title: Assignment America: Selma
description: This series will explore changes in American politics, culture and technology, drawing on the reporting and personal experiences of New York Times journalists around the country.

title: Selma Shows Challenges of Shifting Electorate
description: This weekends 50th anniversary of the landmark Selma, Ala., civil rights march calls to mind a famous line of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.

title: Whats On This Week Around The World
description: Florence

title: Venezuelas Currency Circus
description: In a faraway land, an eccentric king nailed an edict to the door of his palace that said: Henceforth, $20 bills will be sold here for $1.

title: Chalayan: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Prince Who Would Be King Challenges Sepp Blatter for FIFAs Presidency
description: LONDON  Sepp Blatter has been elected to four consecutive terms as president of FIFA, a run that dates to 1998. In his first election  the process gives every FIFA-affiliated country a vote  Blatter defeated a former head of the European soccer confederation. In the second, he defeated the leader of the African soccer confederation. In the third and fourth, he ran unopposed.

title: Teenagers in the Times | February 2015
description: Welcome to Februarys edition of Teenagers in The Times.

title: Retirement in a Community. but Which One?
description: SUE CANFIELD knew what she wanted: to have regular lunches with her young grandson, to be close  not too close  to at least one of her grown children, but to be in a place where she could also have an active, engaged life of her own.

title: What to Expect on the Third Day of Paris Fashion Week
description: Fashion Week is a fashionably late affair. Twenty minutes after the stated time is the norm. And yet Loewe, the first show on the docket Friday has let it be known that it will start at 9:30 on the dot, come what may. Loewes Jonathan Anderson is, after all, a busy guy. This week alone, hes been at the LVMH prize open house (as the artistic director of an LVMH brand, he sits on its 12-person jury) and celebrated a collaboration with Larry Clark for his own brand, J.W. Anderson, at Colette. Times a wasting!

title: Accused Rapist Is Dragged From His Jail Cell in India and Killed
description: NEW DELHI  A mob of thousands stormed a jail in the northeastern Indian city of Dimapur, seized a prisoner accused of rape, paraded him through the streets and beat him to death before they could be stopped by police gunfire, a police official said on Friday.

title: Your Turn: A Weekend Thread, Open for Comments
description: Welcome to Motherlodes weekly open thread. Do you have thoughts about the news this week, and how it affects families? A question to ask? A rant to share? This is your place. Go.

title: Glad He Peeked at a Riders Email
description: Dear Diary:

title: New, but Far From Perfect
description: It took just three years for balconies to crack and concrete to flake from the facade of one Brooklyn condominium. Another building was prone to flooding, because the storm drainage system was never connected to the sewage system. With buildings rising at a pace not seen in years, some fear that shoddy construction could be making a comeback, too.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Loewe Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Staples Reports Lower Sales and a Higher Loss
description: Staples reported a drop in sales in the fourth quarter, a decline it hopes to reverse through a merger with its rival Office Depot.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Loewe Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: South Sudan Peace Talks Stall
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Peace talks in the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, between the government of South Sudan and rebels ended with no agreement on Friday, even after a days extension.

title: When Rural Meets Resort
description: The tiny town of Amenia, N.Y., population 4,436, is perhaps best known for its hamlet of Wassaic, the last stop on the Metro-North Railroads Harlem line and home to an artists community that hosts an annual festival there. Bordering Connecticut in rural Dutchess County, Amenia has had a tough time since its largest employer, an institution for the developmentally disabled, closed two years ago.

title: Job Growth Was Fantastic Last Month. So Why Arent Wages Rising More?
description: First the good news. The American job market has truly, really, finally, unquestionably shifted into a higher gear.

title: Kate Tempest, a British Triple Threat, Crosses the Pond
description: LONDON  Kate Tempest  poet, playwright, rapper, cross-genre talent  took to the stage at Electric Brixton, a club in the historically working class neighborhood one recent Sunday night, and looked into the crowd of more than a thousand people. I dont want to see you hidden behind your phone screens! she called out in her unmistakable South London accent. This is real! This is happening! Being together in one room, living the same moment, she said, is as close to connecting as many of us ever achieve.

title: How to Find More Time
description: Want to add some hours to your day? O.K., you (probably) cant alter the fabric of time. But a new study suggests that the way you feel about your goals can alter your concept of time  and that some simple strategies could make you feel less rushed.

title: House of Cards Season 3, Episode 12 Recap: Their Only Child
description: Season 3, Episode 11: Chapter 38

title: Briton Arrested Over Cyberattack on U.S. Defense Department
description: LONDON  A 23-year-old British man has been arrested over a cyberattack in which data was stolen from the United States Department of Defense, the police said on Friday.

title: 11 Little-Known Facts About John Galliano and Alexander McQueen
description: Fashion-philes are on high alert: This evening in Paris, at the Grand Palais, John Galliano will stage his first ready-to-wear collection  and make his first on-schedule appearance at Paris Fashion Week  as creative director of the recently rechristened Maison Margiela. (Galliano was famously fired from his post at Dior in 2011 after a pair of anti-Semitic outbursts in Paris.) The designers extraordinary rise and sudden downfall, precipitated by the pressures of delivering multiple product lines for an international conglomerate  together with the similar trajectory of his contemporary and sometime rival, the late Alexander McQueen  is the subject of the T contributing editor Dana Thomass new book, Gods and Kings (Penguin Press, $29.95), an occasionally titillating and ultimately poignant read released just in time for the start of one of fashions most scrutinized third (or, more accurately, fifth or sixth) acts.

title: Letter From the Editor: Inequality at the Supreme Court
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots weekly newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Stuff We Liked
description: Here are a few things that the staff of The Upshot enjoyed on the web this week.

title: NBC Brings Back Andrew Lack to Lead Its News Division
description: NBC Universal reached into its past to chart a new path forward on Friday, hiring Andrew Lack to lead its news division after a series of missteps that culminated with the suspension of Brian Williams last month.

title: Introducing Motherlodes New Artist-In-Residence: Abigail Gray Swartz
description: Were thrilled to welcome Abigail Gray Swartz to the Artist-in-Residence role. Shell be accompanying essays and posts here with art thats like an essay in a different format. The longer I look at her work, the more it says. She first appeared in this space illustrating Margaret Gilmours essay, My Friend Has a Son Who Is Autistic. If you read a little further, youll get a sense of how that came about.

title: Before Starting as a Coach, It Helps to Go Into Training
description: LESLIE YALOF GARFIELD, 54, a professor at Pace Law School, faced an empty nest as her last child headed off to college. Ilona Shinkar, 42, is a former French teacher living in Larchmont, N.Y., with three children at home.

title: French Court Rules It Has Jurisdiction Over Facebook in Nude Painting Case
description: PARIS  A court ruled on Thursday that it had jurisdiction over Facebook in the case of a teacher who sued the company after he was suspended from the social network for posting a picture of a famous nude painting.

title: Wisconsin Votes to Limit Collection of Fees by Unions
description: MADISON, Wis.  The State Assembly on Friday approved legislation barring unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues, leaving Wisconsin poised to become the 25th state with what advocates describe as a right-to-work law.

title: In Boon to Its Stock, Apple Will Replace AT&T in Dow Index
description: Apple, the highest-valued company in the world, will be added to the Dow Jones industrial average next month in yet another sign of how popular the computer giant has become for investors.

title: Standing Till the End
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  Standing at ice level and facing the Islanders runway, Mike Artusa smiled broadly and had a handshake or a hug ready for all the familiar faces. And there was a seemingly endless supply of those.

title: 1915: General Receives Medal
description: LONDON  A communication from the British General headquarters, dated Thursday [March 4], says:  Sir John French was this afternoon presented by General de Lacroix, late Commander-in-Chief of the French army, with the Military Medal, the highest French military honor obtainable. Sir John French is the only Englishman on whom it has ever been bestowed, and King Albert of Belgium and Grand Duke Nicholas are the only other foreigners.

title: Ferguson Police Bias Not an Isolated Case, Obama Says
description: President Obama on Friday said that he thought the pattern of racial discrimination described in a report by the Justice Department about the Ferguson Police Department was not an isolated example.

title: The NAIRU Straitjacket and Cromwells Rule
description: Todays employment report continued the pattern weve been seeing for a while. Unemployment is falling, and is now very close to previous estimates of the NAIRU, the unemployment rate at which inflation begins accelerating. But inflation isnt accelerating; in particular, there is still no hint of wage pressure in the data. So what should the Fed do?

title: Christian Dior: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: BP Signs $12 Billion Deal to Develop Natural Gas in Egypt
description: LONDON  In a sign that Egypts strained relations with the international oil industry may be improving, BP said on Friday that it had reached an agreement to invest with a partner about $12 billion to develop natural gas resources in the country.

title: The Below-Zero Lower Bound
description: Further to my earlier post on negative interest rates: heres what may be a simpler way to think about it. When central banks push interest rates on government debt below zero, the effective lower bound is the return on cash held by people who would otherwise be holding that government debt  not people looking to expand their checking accounts. So the liquidity advantages of bank deposits over cash in a vault are pretty much irrelevant. Its all about the cost of storage.

title: At Museo del Prado, Blind Visitors Can Touch Masterpieces
description: MADRID  Guards make sure visitors to the Museo del Prado stay at arms length from its masterpieces. But here on a recent morning was Jos Pedro Gonzlez running his fingers over one of El Grecos most famous paintings, The Nobleman With His Hand on His Chest. He went back and forth over the noblemans eyes, rubbed his beard and eventually reached his hand, tracing the edges of each digit.

title: Game Over for the Astrodome, Stadium of the Future
Color-Coded Makeup at Christian Dior
description: Backstage at Christian Dior, Peter Philips created a beauty profile that mirrored the swoops and swirls of color printed on the houses fall 2015 collection. The creative and image director of Christian Dior Makeup carefully complemented each look with a single shade of eye shadow (deep green, navy, aubergine or brick),which he applied wet, to intensify the pigment, over the socket and up to the orbital bone. The unifying application on each face: four to five coats of mascara and heavy black kohl liner. We wanted graphic makeup with a little twist, Philips says. It is indeed a dark departure from the thin adhesive strips of pastel eyeliner he created for the houses spring 2015 runway.

title: Saints Owner Marches Out of Step With His Heirs Expectations
description: NEW ORLEANS  Tom Benson sat at the head of a wooden conference table unruffled in a dark business suit, with a crisp aqua necktie and a handkerchief tucked neatly in his breast pocket. One after another, the top executives who run his two teams  the N.F.L.s Saints and the N.B.A.s Pelicans  offered details about how their ad campaigns, ticket sales and digital signboards were doing.

title: F.D.A. Approves Zarxio, Its First Biosimilar Drug
description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved the first so-called biosimilar drug for use in the United States, paving the way for less expensive alternatives to an entire class of complex and costly drugs.

title: Daniel Von Bargen, Actor in Seinfeld and Malcolm in the Middle, Dies at 64
description: Daniel Von Bargen, a character actor who played both bumbling and menacing authority figures and was probably best known as George Costanzas thickheaded boss on Seinfeld, died on Sunday in Cincinnati. He was 64.

title: Finding Equilibrium in Seesawing Libidos (Updated With Podcast)
Video Reviews of The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, Merchants of Doubt and Chappie
description: In this video, Times critics share their thoughts on The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, Merchants of Doubt and Chappie. See all of this weeks reviews.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks featured property is a 1920 Victorian two-family in Greenwich, Conn.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured property in the New York Region:

title: First Draft Focus: A Snowy Departure
A Proper Stew for St. Patricks Day
description: With St. Patricks Day just around the corner, you may be thinking about corned beef and cabbage. Theres nothing wrong with it, but thats Irish-American. For something that may actually be served on Irish soil, have a go at a proper Irish stew.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties include co-ops in the Sutton area, Greenwich Village, Ditmas Park, and a house in Riverdale.

title: Through It All, Pelosi Keeps House Democrats Moving in One Direction
description: WASHINGTON  The quarterback Brett Favre has long retired. Cher shut down her most recent tour. Representative Nancy Pelosi  repeatedly written off and derided since her party lost the House in 2010  powers on.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: 1940: New Ship Secretly Sails
description: The Queen Elizabeth en route to New York in 1940. (britishpathe.com)

title: After a Fire, Learning to Cook Again, One Grilled Cheese at a Time
description: Four months pregnant, with my 19-month-old son at the kitchen table eating chicken fingers, it happened. Id been in full-on nesting mode, and no recipe on the Food Network was too big or too small. That night, I was experimenting with Sandra Lees corn dogs  a secret guilty pleasure for both my husband and me. Just like Sandra Lee instructed, I filled my pot with oil, and while it was heating up, I put the batter together for the hot dogs.

title: Selma Hosts Its Own Civil Rights Concert
description: It has been a big year for Selma, Ala., with the country renewing focus on the city, thanks to an Oscar-nominated film carrying its name, and the celebrations of the 50th anniversary of the civil rights march from Selma to Montgomery, Ala.

title: Exclusive | 285 Lafayette Street
description: A four-bedroom loft in a sought-after prewar condominium conversion is poised to enter the market at $11.5 million.

title: Roos Abels Transforms at Dior
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall 2015 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Roos Abels before (left) and after (right) makeup by Peter Philips and hair by Guido Palau.

title: Editors Choice
description: THE BURIED GIANT,  by Kazuo Ishiguro. (Knopf, $26.95.) Ishiguros exceptional seventh novel, a mixture of fantasy, historical fiction and myth set in a semi-historical medieval England, remains in the mind long after it has been read.

title: Girl in the Dark: A Memoir, by Anna Lyndsey
description: A reader trolling the bookstores memoir section, sampling passages from random volumes, finally encountering Anna Lyndseys melodic, penetrating prose among the drama-heavy movie-of-the-week wannabes, might be excused for any unbecoming public outburst: a fist in the air, say, and a bellow of Score! For although Girl in the Dark is based on the authors experience of a startling medical condition  full-body light sensitivity so severe that Lyndsey becomes largely restricted to a stifling blackout room  a spot-check of its paragraphs reveals the quiet, ingenious consciousness of a poet.

title: Found Fiction
description: I grew up in a Massachusetts town in which the recycling and disposal facility was a paragon of Yankee thrift and was restricted to members, like a country club.

title: The Last Good Paradise, by Tatjana Soli
