description: Ann and Richard, a married Los Angeles couple, have their own vision of the American dream  he wants to be a big-time restaurateur, she a big-time lawyer  but its crumbling before their eyes. Their goal, and that of their peers, was once to be so busy they could say, without irony, My people will call your people. Instead, theyre on a treadmill of anxiety. Their professions  and the people around them  have turned fickle. Ann realizes that she hates the law and her regimented life: Unable to become pregnant, shes being shot up with hormones in between meetings. Richard is struggling even to start a restaurant, let alone keep one running.

title: Inside the List
description: Death By Chocolate: The crime novelist Joanne Fluke has come up with a winning formula for her best sellers  think of a luscious dessert, then add death. Thus far in Flukes series of Hannah Swensen mysteries-with-recipes, in which a small-town Minnesota baker keeps stumbling across corpses, 10 titles have hit the list, including Cream Puff Murder, Cinnamon Roll Murder, Blackberry Pie Murder and the latest, Double Fudge Brownie Murder, new at No.13 in hardcover fiction. (The series has also spawned a best-selling cookbook, Joanne Flukes Lake Eden Cookbook, that might as well have been called Saturated Fat Murder.) Before starting the Hannah Swensen series, Fluke wrote more than 30 thrillers in a darker vein, but she dreamed of striking out in a new direction. I always wanted to write a cookbook, she explained in a 2013 interview with a Seattle television station, and I couldnt sell the darn thing. So, actually, what happened is, my editor said, Would you like to write cozy mysteries? And I said, Can I put recipes in them? ... I decided I would write something kinder, gentler, and use my baking.

title: MC Hamilton
description: Ron Chernow always knew his acclaimed 2004 biography of Alexander Hamilton would someday be turned into a hip-hop musical. Well, not always, but since 2009, when he first met the composer and actor Lin-Manuel Miranda, whose Hamilton has been a smash hit Off Broadway at the Public Theater. (The show will move to Broadway in July.)

title: Paying Tribute to Thomas Stanley and His Millionaire Next Door
description: The rich are different from you and me, though maybe not quite like we think they are.

title: Gods and Kings, by Dana Thomas
description: Karl Lagerfeld has a wonderful reply to those who think fashion could use more innovators. No doubt, he says, but in any period only a few individuals are crucial. The 1920s had Chanel and Patou, the 30s Vionnet and Schiaparelli. The 40s belonged to Dior. By the 50s, Chanel was back and her twin engine was the saintly Balenciaga. Genius is rare. It sustains the rest of the industry with ideas, energy and, of course, drama.

title: Paperback Row
description: SHOTGUN LOVESONGS,  by Nickolas Butler. (Thomas Dunne/St. Martins Griffin, $15.99.) Lifelong bonds are tested in Butlers big-hearted first novel when four boyhood friends  and the woman who has meant something special in each of their lives  are reunited in middle age in their small Wisconsin hometown. Butler has written an unmistakably American novel  and a good one, Jonathan Evison said in the Book Review.

title: The Tusk That Did the Damage, by Tania James
description: Tania Jamess impressive new novel, The Tusk That Did the Damage, brings a sharp and unnerving sensibility to bear on dismal and necessary events. A wild elephants post-mortem exam, for instance, finds that a poachers bullet has left a burn hole like a black star in its body; as officials search for the bullet itself, they took a saw to the animals side, the sound like a zipper going up and down. Such matter-of-fact yet startling associations make for the kind of unexpected fusions that can be found across these pages.

title: French Translation
description: GUYS LIKE ME

title: A Racy Silicon Valley Lawsuit, and More Subtle Questions About Sex Discrimination
description: A gender discrimination trial is gripping Silicon Valley this week with lurid details about an office affair, a nude photo book and a bathrobe-clad man showing up at a female colleagues hotel room.

title: Classic and Eclectic
description: A four-bedroom loft on the second floor of 285 Lafayette Street, a sought-after prewar condominium conversion, is poised to enter the market for $11.5 million.

title: Ben Jealous Considers Run for Maryland Senate Seat
description: Benjamin T. Jealous, a former president of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People and a veteran activist, is considering a run for the Senate seat in Maryland that Barbara A. Mikulski will be leaving in 2017.

title: Cutting Out the Meat With Mushrooms
description: A couple of years ago I gave you a recipe for a roasted mushroom base, a sort of vegetable Hamburger Helper that I had learned to make from Scott Samuels, a Culinary Institute of America chef. Chef Samuels combined it with ground beef to make delicious burgers. It has caught on among food service professionals who want to improve the nutritional profile of their offerings. Now they refer to it as, simply, The Mix, and they are keeping mushroom growers very busy.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Julien David Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Isabel Marant: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: During Bakery Break-In, Only Recipes Are Taken
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It takes three days to make a cruffin, a muffin-croissant hybrid that is the signature of Ry Stephen, a 28-year-old pastry chef. His shop, Mr Holmes Bakehouse, has been open three months and inspired a wild following, with customers lining up early to buy the ice-cream-cone-shaped cruffins, which reliably sell out before the line is gone.

title: Albert Maysles, Pioneering Documentarian, Dies at 88
description: Albert Maysles, the award-winning documentarian who, with his brother, David, made intensely talked-about films, including Grey Gardens and Gimme Shelter, with their American version of cinma vrit, died Thursday night at his home in Manhattan. He was 88.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Julien David Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Haitian Griot Is a Postcard From the Caribbean
description: Have you ever had griot?

title: Facts & Figures: Vaccines Under Fire
description: Americans are less likely to say vaccination is extremely important than they were in 2001, according to a poll released Friday. They are also much more likely to have heard about disadvantages of vaccines  30 percent said theyd heard a great deal about such disadvantages, up from 15 percent in 2001.

title: Down in North Carolina, One Family Makes Maple Syrup in Its Own Backyard
description: At the mountainside Waterfall Farm in the northwest region of the state, indigenous trees are tapped, and the sap is stewed in a handmade sugarhouse.

title: Troubleshooting Android in Safe Mode
description: Q. My Android phone just started freezing and crashing a few days ago. What would cause it to do so?

title: Putin Takes a Pay Cut, as Does Most of the Kremlin
description: MOSCOW  With ordinary Russians grumbling about the sharp rise in food prices, President Vladimir V. Putin made a populist move on Friday, announcing that he and almost everyone who works for him will take a 10 percent cut in pay.

title: Whiting Awards Celebrate 30 Years With 10 Winning Writers
description: The winners of the 2015 Whiting Awards were announced on Thursday night at the New-York Historical Society. Each of the 10 chosen writers receives a cash award of $50,000. The awards are based on early accomplishment and the promise of great work to come, according to the Whiting Foundation.

title: In One Case, State Dept. Criticized Use of Personal Email
description: The case of an ousted ambassador to Kenya who served while Hillary Rodham Clinton led the State Department has gained fresh attention in light of the controversy surrounding reports that she exclusively used a personal email account for government business.

title: Syracuse Basketball and Coach Jim Boeheim Hit Hard by N.C.A.A.
description: Members of the athletic staff forged classwork. Players were handed cash for appearances as volunteers. Others were allowed to skirt the universitys drug policy without consequence.

title: What I Love | Gilbert Gottfried
description: The gravel-voiced comedian and actor shares a recently decorated Chelsea loft with his wife, Dara, and their two children.

title: Alec Baldwin Selected to Be Mayor of New York on HBO
description: Several years ago, the actor Alec Baldwin told The New York Times that he was interested in being mayor of New York City. I am someone who is fully prepared for the fact that I could go into this and do it and completely have my ass kicked, he said at the time of the prospect of running for office. I could throw a party and no one could come. And it would be this staggering lesson for me.

title: Margherita Missoni Amoss New Childrens Wear: Meant for Mixing and Matching and Playing Dress-Up
description: For a little kid, playing dress-up can be one of the most thrilling forms of discovery. And for Margherita Missoni Amos, of one of fashions most storied families (shes the granddaughter of Ottavio and Rosita), playing dress-up has always been a way of life. Its no surprise, then, that the 32-year-old mom is launching her own childrens collection inspired by the possibilities of fun that exist in wearing clothes. Simply called Margherita, her first venture outside of the Missoni label was conceived for baby boys and girls ages 0-2, and for girls up to age 7. And all the pieces  washed-linen dresses with bright Balinese-batik inspired prints, color-blocked sweaters, seersucker striped tees ($30-$80)  are meant to be mixed and matched. I want children to express their creativity through choosing their own clothes, Missoni Amos explains. Thats why I didnt create any perfect matching outfits.

title: Madonna is Still Madonna On Rebel Heart
description: Jon Pareles and Ben Ratliff discuss Rebel Heart, the new album by Madonna.

title: A Prediction Market for Inflation, or Deflation
description: Something unusual is happening to prices right now: They are falling.

title: At Dior, Lanvin and Rick Owens: The Power Woman in Winter
description: PARIS  For a while there it looked as if the hair was going to overshadow the clothes.

title: Views at One57 for $29,329,100
description: A three-bedroom three-and-a-half-bath apartment on the 65th floor of One57, the glassy-blue skyscraper where the priciest transaction for a single residence in New York City recently took place, sold for $29,329,100 and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: MoMA to Host Wikipedia Editing Marathon, to Improve Coverage of Women in the Arts
description: This weekend, in conjunction with International Womens Day, the group Art + Feminism will be hosting its second international edit-a-thon, with the goal of improving Wikipedias coverage of women and the arts and encouraging more women to contribute to the online encyclopedia.

title: Los Angeles Police Leader Makes Outreach to Muslims His Mission
description: LOS ANGELES  On a damp and dreary Saturday two months ago, several hundred mourners gathered outside City Hall here for a memorial service honoring Dr. Maher Hathout. Born in Egypt and trained as a cardiologist, Dr. Hathout, 79, had devoted decades to espousing a moderate version of Islam and reaching across denominational lines to other faiths.

title: A Casualty of a Frigid New York Winter: Outdoor School Recess
description: Midmorning on Tuesday, several hours before snow would return in a ritual that now seems as consistent as receiving the mail, temperatures in New York were cold but not abusive. It was the kind of day, unlike so many others recently, in which forgetting your gloves did not necessarily mean you would feel as if you needed treatment at an urgent-care clinic before you got to work. And yet with the temperature in the 20s, under skies vaguely the color of moleskin, it was neither objectively comfortable nor pleasant.

title: Verbatim: Jeb Bush Says Hes Baffled by Clinton Emails
description: Jeb Bush, speaking to an Iowa radio station about Hillary Rodham Clintons use of a private email account.

title: Rare Mark Rothko Painting Leads Christies New York Auction
description: Mark Rothko once said that his formula for a good painting included a dollop of hope  10 percent to make the tragic concept more endurable. When bidders gather on May 13 at Christies to do battle for the next big Rothko to come to auction  a blazing red and black work, No. 36 (Black Stripe), painted in 1958, a banner year for the artist  they will have to bring a lot more than hope.

title: In Two Worlds
description: For young Muslims in New York, it is sometimes a struggle to balance religion and middle school.

title: Balancing Islam and Middle School in Queens
description: Somewhere between stepping off the school bus and climbing into the go-kart, Sandra Ibrahim, 14, took off her pink hijab. She was on a trip to an indoor amusement park in New Rochelle, N.Y., with her Islamic weekend school, surrounded by other Muslim children, parents and teachers. She knew the adults would like her to keep the head scarf on. But there she was, zooming along the track, her dark brown ponytail swinging freely behind her.

title: N.C.A.A. Infractions Committee's Report on Syracuse
description: The N.C.A.A. issued a 94-page report Friday on violations committed by the Syracuse athletic department.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Erik Larsons Dead Wake
description: This week, Erik Larson talks about Dead Wake: The Last Crossing of the Lusitania; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Orlando Patterson discusses two new books by black conservatives, Please Stop Helping Us and Shame; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: Robert Christgaus Going Into the City
description: Since nobody asked, whats my favorite piece of writing by Robert Christgau? His elegant 17-word assessment of the Beatles Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band approaches pure poetry, and his takedowns of sitting ducks like Emerson, Lake and Palmers Trilogy and Cybill Shepherds Cybill Does It . . . to Cole Porter are delectable morsels of schadenfreude. But nothing delighted me quite like the criteria he provided for the letter grades that accompanied his nugget-size record reviews in his long-running Consumer Guide feature.

title: To Explain the World, by Steven Weinberg
description: Steven Weinberg doesnt think much of Plato or Pythagoras. Nor does he hold Ren Descartes or Francis Bacon in especially high regard. But in his new book on the origins of science, To Explain the World, Weinberg casts particular aspersions on science historians themselves.

title: Nina Stibbes Man at the Helm
description: Nina Stibbe: Im trying to write a novel. . . . Was just about to show AB a little synopsis and a few pages. . . .

title: Theres Something I Want You to Do, by Charles Baxter
description: Some of our sturdiest atheists now allow that those inexplicable, ineffable, somehow enlarging experiences traditionally classed as religious also happen to people who adhere to no particular doctrine, lack acquaintance with the theologians and reject all deities.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Erik Larsons Dead Wake
description: This week, Erik Larson and Orlando Patterson.

title: Madonna Is Still Madonna on Rebel Heart
description: Madonnas new record, Rebel Heart, is the full version of the album that was partly leaked in work-tape form last December. Its a rsum of power and influence: a flex-rospective. In songs like Veni Vidi Vici shes essentially reminding you who she is. (Literally so, in the case of Bitch Im Madonna.)

title: ISIS Bulldozing of Ancient Nimrud Site in Iraq Stirs Outrage
description: News that Islamic State fighters had bulldozed and vandalized the ancient city of Nimrud in northern Iraq provoked outrage on Friday, as archaeologists despaired that the militant group was systematically destroying priceless antiquities in a wellspring of civilization.

title: At the Independent Fair, Art Not Quite on the Margin
description: The Armory Week satellite offers a trim, well-curated selection of up-and-coming and under-the-radar artists and galleries.

title: Off Court, Red Storms Fiercest Rebounder Is Anything But
description: When Amber Thompson arrived at St. Johns four years ago as the recipient of a basketball scholarship, her body language was not promising. She would hold her hand in front of her face when she spoke. She would look away from others to avoid eye contact. She was so painfully reserved it raised questions about her ability to assert herself on the court.

title: Revisiting Selma
description: Recollections from those who took part in the march for freedom.

title: NASAs Dawn Probe Begins Orbiting Dwarf Planet Ceres
description: NASAs Dawn spacecraft entered orbit around the asteroid Ceres on Friday morning at an altitude of just under 38,000 miles. Currently, the spacecraft is above the night side of Ceres, limiting the amount of information that can be gathered.

title: Apples Entry Will Help an Antiquated Dow Catch Up
description: Apples entry into the Dow Jones industrial average is a bit like polishing an antique. The average share price of 30 stocks selected by committee will finally include the worlds biggest company in place of AT&T. Its an overdue move for an outdated yardstick  one that, like landlines and checkbooks, lives on.

title: C.I.A. to Be Overhauled to Fight Modern Threats
description: LANGLEY, Va.  John O. Brennan, director of the Central Intelligence Agency, is planning to reassign thousands of undercover spies and intelligence analysts into new departments as part of a restructuring of the 67-year-old agency, a move he said would make it more successful against modern threats and crises.

title: Earning the Trust of Afghan Women: Reporters Notebook
description: In a March 1 article, Alissa J. Rubin, the Paris bureau chief, wrote about Afghan policewomen and their struggle against culture. The article was the first in a series that examined the legacy of efforts to help Afghan women and girls.

title: Short Circuits Reported in Mars Rovers Drilling Arm
description: The Mars rover Curiosity appears to be suffering intermittent short circuits in its robotic arm, which could limit its drilling of rocks, NASA said on Friday.

title: Why Not Retire the Circus Elephants Now?
description: If the welfare of elephants were truly its only concern, the Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus would stop using them in performances now, and put them on a train to sunny Florida, where they could enjoy a comfortable retirement. Instead, as The Associated Press reported Thursday, its 13 wrinkly troupers will be touring the country, doing lumbering tricks in costume for paying customers, until 2018. Then they will be sent to the companys park near Polk City, Fla., and perform no more.

title: Menendez Is to Face Corruption Charges, U.S. Official Says
description: The Justice Department is preparing to file corruption charges against Senator Robert Menendez, a scrappy 61-year-old veteran of New Jersey politics, after a two-year investigation into allegations that he accepted gifts and lavish vacations in exchange for political favors for a longtime friend and political benefactor.

title: Matt Harvey Has Cant-Miss Outing in Must-See Return to Mound
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Mets fans started applauding Matt Harvey as he left the bullpen Friday afternoon, before he threw a single pitch. The whole way, as Harvey made his way toward the dugout, fans stood and cheered him as he passed.

title: Millennials on the Homeownership Path
description: Besieged by the recession and buried in student loan debt, the so-called millennials, born from the early 80s through the late 90s, have largely lacked the financial wherewithal to buy their own homes. Even 30-year-olds were as likely to be stuck in their childhood bedrooms as they were to own their own place as of 2013, according to a recent report from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: Ontarios Beer Bottleneck Is Under Siege by Brewers and Buyers
description: OTTAWA  Brewers Retail has sold beer pretty much the same way since it opened 88 years ago.

title: The New Jobs Report Shows Janet Yellens Quandary in a Nutshell
description: The biggest decision that Janet Yellen has faced in her year-old Federal Reserve chairmanship was laid bare in a single report on the domestic job market released Friday.

title: China Blocks Web Access to Under the Dome Documentary on Pollution
description: BEIJING  Under the Dome, a searing documentary about Chinas catastrophic air pollution, had hundreds of millions of views on Chinese websites within days of its release one week ago.

title: The Ospreys Springtime Return to New York
description: Science may have branded the exact hour and minute of Earths entry into springs cosmic alignment (March 20 at 6:45 p.m. this year), but many prefer more personal markers of the coming season. Whether you find yourself staring at the pallid face of the full moon; listening to the first cold, unmusical trills of frogs; or considering Marchs swelling tree buds, it is comforting to discover the earthly evidence of what is clearly ancient magic. We are still connected to the timeless.

title: CaixaBank of Spain Pushes Ahead With Offer for Portuguese Bank BPI
description: MADRID  CaixaBank of Spain said on Friday that it would push ahead with a takeover bid for the Portuguese bank BPI, even after BPIs board rejected its offer of about 1.08 billion euros and one of BPIs largest investors urged it to consider another merger plan.

title: Mommy, Will You Marry Us?
description: Lori Cimino, left, and Julie Durden, right, were married Feb. 21 in a group same-sex ceremony at the James Royal Palm Hotel in Miami Beach.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Thinner Solved!
description: On Thursday we challenged Well readers to solve the case of a middle-aged woman with arthritis who developed a wasting illness after what looked like a simple cold. Her rheumatologist was worried that the immune suppressing medications the patient took to treat her joint disease had caused the new illness. More than 300 of you took on the challenge, and 17 of you correctly identified this rarity. The correct diagnosis is

title: A Modern Marriage With Multiple Parts
description: Growing up in Miami, Lori Cimino described herself as, stubborn and bratty and someone who dug my heels into whatever it was I thought I wanted.

title: Meet the Margiela and Louis Vuitton Alum Who Staged Paris Fashion Weeks Buzziest Show So Far
description: A mob scene gathered outside of the seedy Paris gay club Le Dpot last night, awaiting entry to Vetements fall/winter 2015 show. Inside, major critics and major stars  Kanye West and Jared Leto among them  were on hand to witness the Vetements creative director Demna Gvasalias third collection. Gvasalia, a Georgian-born, Paris-based designer, learned his skills at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Antwerp and honed his craft at Maison Martin Margiela and Louis Vuitton. After becoming frustrated with the business model of designers keeping established fashion houses afloat, Gvasalia stepped out on his own, making his own rules on the way.

title: Jets Will Acquire Brandon Marshall and Re-Sign David Harris
description: It will take far more than one bold move, one major trade and one critical re-signing for the Jets to contend again. But after an off-season of sweeping change throughout the organization, the Jets march toward respectability continued Friday with the biggest personnel decisions made so far by the teams new general manager, Mike Maccagnan.

title: Black Comedians in South Africa Put Power in the Punch Lines
description: JOHANNESBURG  It was a warm Friday morning in Braamfontein, a hip neighborhood here. Inside an airy loft with views of the Nelson Mandela Bridge, a young television crew was assembled around a conference table, in heated debate about the coming weeks broadcast.

title: Paul Taylor, at 84, Has a New Mission With American Modern Dance
description: So, how often does Paul Taylor attend dance performances?

title: Murry Sidlins Defiant Requiem Returns to Avery Fisher Hall
description: Can there be more than one way to think and feel about Defiant Requiem, the concert-drama based on musical activity in the Nazi concentration camp at Terezin during the Holocaust, conceived by the conductor Murry Sidlin? On the surface, at least, the production seems to represent only good  noble intentions, spiritual uplift and redemption  and it unquestionably holds profound meaning for many who are connected with it or have witnessed it.

title: 50 Years On, Association for Advancement of Creative Musicians Influences Jazz
description: Muhal Richard Abrams, the restlessly inventive pianist and composer, is a next-step thinker, not the type to rhapsodize about the past. But he has lately found cause to reflect on a time, 50 years ago on the South Side of Chicago, when he began to mobilize his peers in pursuit of originality and self-determination, ending up with a collective called the Association for the Advancement of Creative Musicians.

title: Germany Sets Gender Quota in Boardrooms
description: BERLIN  Germany on Friday became the latest and most significant country so far to commit to improving the representation of women on corporate boards, passing a law that requires some of Europes biggest companies to give 30 percent of supervisory seats to women beginning next year.

title: Heems Talks About Eat Pray Thug
description: Himanshu Suri, the musician and artist known as Heems, is an operator across worlds that may seem, at first, incompatible.

title: Maison Margiela: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Makeover, With Monsters
description: Gilbert Gottfried doesnt remember his parents ever owning furniture that matched. Thus, as a child growing up in Brooklyn, he found it strange to visit people whose sofa had even a nodding acquaintance with their easy chair or lounger. When the gravel-voiced comedian and actor was old enough to move to his own place, a two-bedroom rental in Chelsea, he outfitted it with a motley assortment of curbside castoffs.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Undercover Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: In Two Worlds
description: For young Muslim in New York, it is sometimes a struggle to balance religion and middle school.

title: Out of a Struggle With Infertility, Success
description: Fourteen years ago, when Robert Johnson, now 31, donned his navy blue trumpet jacket, he never thought that getting outfitted like a screaming nerd would attract anything other than an acceptance to the college of his choice, let alone a wife. The circle of young instrumentalists was small and exclusive, so meeting someone new was rare: Everyone just knew one another.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Undercover Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: An Old Friend Comes Calling
description: New York City is suffering from dive-bar-collapse disorder, with old gin mills either disappearing (Jackies Fifth Amendment, Blarney Cove), forced to move (Subway Inn) or sanitized beyond recognition (Mars Bar).

title: Menendez and Melgen, Florida Eye Doctor, Have a Long History
description: Senator Robert Menendez, Democrat of New Jersey, is expected to face federal corruption charges related to his relationship with Dr. Salomon E. Melgen, a Florida eye doctor who has been his longtime political benefactor.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: The Little Hotel That Couldnt
description: Pinched between behemoth buildings on East 61st Street and within earshot of the Queensboro Bridges stampeding roar, and most easily spied by looking down from the Roosevelt Island tram, is the Mount Vernon Hotel Museum & Garden, a fashionable resort in the era of Andrew Jackson.

title: Balenciaga: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Deaths Reported in Syria of Top Figures in Group Affiliated With Al Qaeda
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A loyalist of Osama bin Laden who trained fighters to battle American troops in Iraq and became a commander of Al Qaedas affiliate in Syria was killed there in the last week along with three fellow leaders, according to Syrian insurgents and a monitoring organization.

title: Hampton Creek, Maker of Plant-Based Protein Foods, Signs Distribution Deal With Foodbuy
description: Hampton Creek, the upstart maker of foods that incorporate plant proteins instead of eggs, has signed a deal that will significantly increase distribution of its products.

title: Book Review Podcast: Erik Larsons Dead Wake
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Hampton Sides reviews Erik Larsons Dead Wake: The Last Crossing of the Lusitania. Mr. Sides writes:

title: At the Independent Fair, Art Not Quite on the Margin
description: New York is literally a flurry. As yet another fresh blast of snow blankets the city, the art set has descended upon Manhattan for the whirlwind series of art fairs collectively known as Armory Week. As part of the lineup, the Independent fair, entering its sixth year, has once again set up camp in the former Dia exhibition space in West Chelsea. Compared to the vast pier complex housing the Armory Show itself, organizers of the Independent have opted to remain in the decidedly smaller location, featuring a trim and well-curated selection of 50 galleries  a welcome amuse-bouche to what can otherwise seem like a glut of exhibitors.

title: Lupitas Dress Returns, Left Sharknado and Gaultier at 7-Eleven
description: All the weeks fashion news thats fit to reprint.

title: La amistad de los animales
description: Videos de parejas de animales inverosmiles se han vuelto tan comunes que estn despertando el inters de algunos cientficos.

title: Investigator Admits Guilt in Hiring of a Hacker
description: A private investigator who has done work for small New York City law firms that specialize in personal injury and medical malpractice litigation pleaded guilty on Friday in federal court in Manhattan to one charge of conspiracy in hiring a hacker to help with his investigation.

title: Urging Persistence on Racial Gains, Obama Recalls Sacrifice in Selma
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  For the nations first African-American president, it was a week of two documents that told the story of a country still grappling with its own history.

title: What a College Stunt Says About Higher Education Today
description: In an age rife with disruptions to the higher education system, one man claims to have employed an appealingly simple one: Just show up on campus, and never actually enroll.

title: Families of Flight 370 Victims Fear Silence as World Moves On
description: PARIS  Most of the time, Ghyslain Wattrelos believes that his wife and two of his three children are dead.

title: U.S. Constricts Snake Trade, But Boa Wriggles Free
description: The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service today extended trade and import bans to four species of constricting snakes that can devastate native wildlife, but the agency dropped the boa constrictor from consideration because it is already so widely reared and kept as a pet.

description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: March 6, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Ukraine, Japan, Israel and the United States.

description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

description: For his staging of Handels opera Semele, the artist Zhang Huan filmed the destruction of one of his signature ash paintings.

description: Readers share the stories behind their passwords with Ian Urbina.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

description: Senator Harry Reid is trying to narrow the crowded field in Maryland Senates race with an early endorsement of one of the states House members interested in the seat.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

description: Me-Mo, a new tablet-based magazine, aims to offer thoughtful photo projects while creating a community among its contributors and readers.
