description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Donna Shalala to Lead Clinton Foundation
description: The Bill, Hillary & Chelsea Clinton Foundation has chosen Donna E. Shalala, a cabinet member in the Clinton administration, to lead the sprawling philanthropy, former President Bill Clinton announced on Friday.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Balenciaga Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Remembering Albert Maysles
description: Albert Maysles, the pioneering documentary filmmaker who frequently collaborated with his brother, David, died Thursday at 88. His influential career spanned nearly 60 years.

title: Klimt Work Should Remain in Austria, Panel Says
description: BERLIN  Gustav Klimts gold leaf and mother-of-pearl masterpiece, the Beethoven Frieze, should remain in Austria, a government panel said in rejecting a claim that its Jewish former owner had been forced to sell it. Austrias Art Restitution Advisory Board recommended unanimously that the 112-foot-long work remain in possession of the government, which bought it from Erich Lederer in 1972.

title: Coffee With Neighborhood Joes
description: DAmico Coffee Roasters in Carroll Gardens offers a rare equilibrium of old and new Brooklyn, attracting old-timers who are happy to chat with the younger customers bearing computers or strollers.

title: At DAmico Coffee Roasters, Old and New Brooklyn Meet
description: Late on a Saturday morning, a small flock of retired longshoremen settled around the low tables of DAmicos. A young woman with earbuds sat focused on her laptop as the old-timers took their seats around her, boxing her into a corner next to an enormous, gleaming coffee roaster. The old-timers bickered and dissected the days tabloids, cheerfully criticizing one another in vanishing Brooklyn vernacular. Occasionally, Frank or Tony would nudge the young woman for an opinion: Is this guy nuts or what? She would momentarily remove an earbud and nod, then go back online. Augie, a neighborhood electrician, punctuated the din with the stamping of coffee bags.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Christian Dior Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Review: Anna Caterina Antonacci Charms With French Art Songs
description: You think Im putting on an act? the distraught protagonist of Poulencs La Voix Humaine asks incredulously, trying to keep on the phone the lover whos leaving her.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Christian Dior Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Bates Motel Grows in Character and Creepiness in Season 3
description: When it began in 2013, the A&E series Bates Motel was an intriguing idea with uncertain staying power. As it starts Season 3 on Monday night, it has evolved into a deftly acted story of small-town dysfunction, creepy when it needs to be yet far more wide ranging than the movie that inspired it.

title: As Clinton Stumbles, Conservatives Stir Democrats Pot
description: The furor over Hillary Rodham Clintons private email account as secretary of state has delighted Republicans this week, but conservatives are not done trying to make the most of her misfortunes.

title: Adding Good Deeds to the Investment Equation
description: EVERY two years, the residents of Richmond, Calif., a city long known for some of the highest rates of violence in the United States, gather to discuss its priorities. For years, the No. 1 concern was crime.

title: Obama Announces Optimistic Jobs Figures
description: The president announced an increase in job creation but also said that the unemployment rate nationwide, especially among African-Americans, remained too high and that there was more work to do.

title: Sex Experts Secret Is Out, and Chinas Open to It
description: BEIJING  Li Yinhe, Chinas leading advocate of freewheeling sexuality, has been shocking this outwardly prudish nation for three decades.

title: Where Terrorism Research Goes Wrong
description: TERRORISM is increasing. According to the Global Terrorism Database at the University of Maryland, groups connected with Al Qaeda and the Islamic State committed close to 200 attacks per year between 2007 and 2010, a number that grew by more than 200 percent, to about 600 attacks, in 2013.

title: Winners of the Night of the Stars Charity Bridge Event
description: One of the most successful bridge charity events is the Night of the Stars. This years edition, the eighth, was played on Feb. 26 at the Royal Hospital for Neuro-disability in Putney, southwest London. This pro-am raised more than 50,500 pounds (about $76,760) for four charities.

title: For Zhang Huang, Loves Battlefield Is a Ming Dynasty Temple
description: Retold throughout Greek and Roman antiquity, the myth of Semele, consort to Jove and mother of Bacchus, has come to symbolize the amorous heights of love as well as the precipitous fall that so often follows; its a classic tale of love betrothed and betrayed, divine dalliance and mortal downfall. Indeed, for the contemporary Chinese artist Zhang Huan, whose restaging of Handels 18th-century operatic version of the myth opens for its first U.S. run this week at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, the constant of any opera is found in the attention it pays to the human desire. Speaking via an interpreter from his Shanghai studio a few days before the curtain was set to raise, Zhang freely admitted that he initially lacked interest in opera as an art form. Known for large-scale bronze statues of disembodied Buddhas and performance pieces entailing body suits made of raw meat, Zhangs appointment to direct Handels opera in 2009, for the Brussels-based opera house La Monnaie, raised the eyes of both opera and art-world aficionados. I had hoped people not only saw an opera, but also performance art, Zhang says. Semele,' he quickly adds, was my very first opera, and it will be my very last.

title: If Warren Beatty Is Directing, Shooting Can Wait. For Years.
description: LOS ANGELES  An incurable tinkerer, Warren Beatty was at work again last weekend, shooting a scene for a 40-year passion project whose status is almost as mysterious as its subject: the industrialist Howard Hughes.

title: Review: In Platform 2015, the Beauty of Ragged Edges at Danspace Project
description: If you mate a stellar ballet dancer with an adventurous postmodern choreographer-dancer, what do you get? A mix-and-match duet? When Claudia La Rocco, a freelance critic for The New York Times, organized six such pairings as part of Platform 2015: Dancers, Buildings and People in the Streets, she wisely imposed no format on her recruits.

title: Review: Augusta Read Thomass Spiritual Resounding Earth
description: Budding composers are well advised to write for standard instrumentation: The simpler and more common the forces required, the higher the chances of a piece getting performances beyond the premiere.

title: Holder Weighs Dismantling the Ferguson Police Dept.
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. vowed a firm responseon Fridayto what he called appalling racial misconduct by law enforcement officials in Ferguson, Mo., suggesting he was prepared to seek the dismantling of the police force there if necessary.

title: Yohji Yamamoto: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: The Feel-Good Gene
description: CHANCES are that everyone on this planet has experienced anxiety, that distinct sense of unease and foreboding.

title: Diors Patent-Leather Boots in Psychedelic Prints
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: A Chefs Tour of Cuba
description: The James Beard-award winning chef Douglas Rodriguez, who is the co-owner of the restaurant Alma de Cuba in Philadelphia, will lead a new tour of Cuba: the seven-night Art, History, Architecture and Cuisine of the Cuba of Today, Yesterday and Tomorrow with stops in Havana, Cienfuegos, Trinidad and Pinar del Rio.

title: Better Late Than Never
description: Gender transitions are difficult but rewarding for many, including Sheela-Marie Padgett, a former dancer.

title: House of Cards Season 3 Finale Recap: This Office Has One Chair
description: Season 3, Episode 13: Chapter 39

title: State of Change
description: As we were organizing this issue, we were struck  and rather hard  by the myriad confounding ideas and influences percolating right now in the world of mens fashion and style. Its as if a tectonic shift is happening beneath us  a bit destabilizing but full of possibility. Culture and behavior change slowly, so its not as though anyone is going to topple over from the force of the new ideas here, but the currents are strong nonetheless.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Bagels, Basketball, Banchan and Burrata
description: As co-owner of three restaurants in Brooklyn (Talde, Pork Slope and Thistle Hill Tavern) and two recently opened in Jersey City (Talde Jersey City and Carrino Provisions), the chef and entrepreneur Dale Talde spends much of his time putting out fires: a no-show cook, an inadequate bread delivery, the perpetual turnover of employees. Now Mr. Talde, a 36-year-old former Top Chef contestant, has a new project. He is catering his own wedding. In October, he will marry Agnes Chung, 28, a reporter for NY1, in the Hudson Valley. The couple lives in Downtown Brooklyn.

title: The Events Uses Local Choirs for Vocals, Minus a Script
description: Two hours before going onstage at New York Theater Workshop in The Events, by the Scottish playwright David Greig, Susan Glass had only a vague, fumbling-in-the-dark sense of what she and her Greenwich Village community chorus, the Glass Menagerie, were getting into.

title: An Argument for Hearing a Work With a Nazi Reference
description: The Germans who invaded the Soviet Union in 1941 are represented in Shostakovichs Leningrad Symphony by an unexpectedly bright tune that hardens into a bitter march. Recent Metropolitan Opera audiences may recognize it from Lehars operetta The Merry Widow as an echo of the melody to which Count Danilo sings Im off to Chez Maxim.

title: In a Dance Remix of Netanyahus Speech, Two Words Echo: Iran  Haman
description: As the debate continues over this weeks address to Congress by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, an Israeli video bloggers dance remix of the speech seems to suggest that it can be boiled down to two words: Iran  Haman.

title: Metropolitan Opera Board to Have a New President
description: The Metropolitan Opera, which has been grappling with serious financial challenges, will soon have a new president of its board of directors.

title: Inside Ts Spring Mens Style Issue
description: Ts latest issue examines the many conflicting ideas at play in mens fashion and style today. No one embraced those contradictions more than our cover subject, the legendary Jean-Michel Basquiat: We peek inside his closely guarded notebooks and shine a light on the painter as youve never seen him before. Shayne Oliver, the Hood by Air designer who likely would have rolled in Basquiats circle had he been born 20 years earlier, shares with us the many diverse influences behind his gender-fluid street wear. In an essay focusing on clothes like Olivers, Jon Caramanica traces how rap icons such as Raekwon and Kanye West have influenced not only street fashion, but the runway as well. Weve also dressed some of Frances most talented men in some of the seasons best clothes  proving that some things, like brooding-French-artist chic, never lose their appeal. Elsewhere, Andrew OHagan combs through the male overgrooming epidemic, looking for chaos amid the order; Jody Rosen travels to Ordos, China, one of the worlds most famous ghost towns that wants to be so much more; the artist Pablo Bronstein takes us inside his home in Deal, England, where antique glamour and campy kitsch live in curious harmony; and Marilyn Manson and John Waters test out an urban scooter and one-legged pants, with predictably weird results. See all stories from the issue >>

title: Memo to Therapists: Its Not Me, Its You
description: How should I tell my therapist, on Day 2 of our relationship, that we arent a good fit? Of all of therapys potential etiquette minefields  the client who unleashes his searing revelations three minutes before the end of sessions; the therapist who nods off, or whose picture keeps popping up on clients People You May Know feature on Facebook  termination seems like one of the more challenging ones. How do you skitter without scratching the parquet?

title: Review: Vladan Nikolics Allure Shows New York Through Immigrants Eyes
description: The complicated lives of four immigrant women casually intersect in Allure, a title that accurately reflects the seductive quality of its black-and-white images. The Serbian-born director, Vladan Nikolic, seems to have a knack for choosing dexterous cinematographers. (He has twice used his wildly gifted countryman Vladimir Subotic.) Here he passes the reins to Aleksandar Kostic, who turns New York City into a dreamy melting pot of conflict and yearning.

title: For Some in Transgender Community, Its Never Too Late to Make a Change
description: One Friday night last fall, 50 well-dressed guests piled into an apartment in Hells Kitchen for a party celebrating Sheela-Marie Padgett, a 57-year-old former dancer with the New York City Ballet.

title: After a Homecoming, a Son Finds His Muse
Evening Hours | Art Week
description: Three enormous art shows and other parties.

title: Bill Cunningham | A Breath of Fresh Air
description: Young members of the experimental art world and the unorthodox fashion world staged shows filled with new expressions and an audience to match.

title: Bill Cunningham | A Breath of Fresh Air
description: Young members of the experimental art world and the unorthodox fashion world are vividly shown here. The Spring/Break Art Show, in the dilapidated main post office on 31st Street, was filled with experimental ideas and conceptual displays. The show ($10) is open through Sunday; enter on the corner of 31st Street and Eighth Avenue. During fashion week, young designers staged off-site shows filled with new expressions and an audience to match. They often outshone the main runway shows.

title: Friday Night Music: The Lone Bellow, Button
description: Zach Williams usually sings lead for this Brooklyn country music trio, but all three are star-quality performers. They have a new album out, which is great  but I ran across this performance of a song from their first, and had to share.

title: Deriving From Photographs
description: Richard Estes: Painting New York City, an exhibition, opens March 10 at the Museum of Arts and Design.

title: From Snapshots Come Paintings: Work by Richard Estes
description: For every one painting I make, I probably take about 100 photos, said Richard Estes, who is neither a hyperrealist nor a photorealist, but a photo-derived painter, according to Patterson Sims, the curator of an exhibition titled Richard Estes: Painting New York City, which opens March 10 at the Museum of Arts and Design.

title: The Reality of Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
description: To the Editor:

title: Two Views of Testing, From the Front Lines
description: To the Editor:

title: South Sudan Conflict
description: To the Editor:

title: Medication Allergies
description: To the Editor:

title: Obama Discusses Ferguson Report Findings
description: The president said that he supported the Justice Departments decision not to charge Officer Darren Wilson in the death of a black teenager. He also discussed the racial problems in Ferguson, Mo.

title: Deport War Criminals?
description: To the Editor:

title: Bronx Teacher Faces Pornography Charges; Accused of Paying Boys for Photos
description: A teacher and debate coach at the prestigious Bronx High School of Science was arrested on Friday on charges that he persuaded teenage boys to send him nude or suggestive photographs via cellphones in exchange for gift cards.

title: Keeping Up With the Jones
description: The adventures of Socko Jones begin each morning in a strip mall on Forest Avenue in the Mariners Harbor section of Staten Island.

title: Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra Extends Contract of Its Music Director
description: The Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra announced on Friday that it had extended the contract of its music director, Louis Langre, through its 125th anniversary season in 2019-20.

title: Police Release Ottawa Gunmans Video
description: OTTAWA  A cellphone video made by a gunman moments before he opened fire in Canadas Parliament and at a war memorial, killing a soldier, was released by the police on Friday, more than four months after the violent events.

title: From the Archives:Wheres the Spirit of Selma Now?
description: This story by Gay Talese ran in The New York Times Magazine on May 30, 1965, almost three months after the attacks on demonstrators at the Edmund Pettus Bridge. In advance of the 50th anniversary of the 1965 march, he returned to Selma to report on Selma today and what has changed and what has not over the past half century.

title: Unlikely Allies in a Gay Rights Battle in Georgia
description: ATLANTA  Former Attorney General Michael J. Bowers of Georgia has already earned an enduring  his critics would say notorious  place in gay rights history.

title: Women See Themselves as Left Out Amid Talk of Change in Catholic Church
description: VATICAN CITY  In the first two years of his papacy, Pope Francis has stirred great expectations for change among Roman Catholics who believe that the church has not kept pace with the social transformations of secular society.

title: Resolution Censures Chemical Weapons
description: In an unusual display of unity over the divisive four-year-old conflict in Syria, the Security Council passed a resolution on Friday that condemned the use of chlorine as a chemical weapon in that country, and threatened sanctions that could include a military response to any further violations. The resolution, drafted by the United States, was approved 14-0, with one abstention, from Venezuela. The resolution followed a report this year by the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons that chlorine bombs had been used in the conflict, even after the Syrian government had signed the global treaty banning such munitions and had agreed to the destruction of its arsenal, which was basically completed by June. Like that report, the Security Council resolution did not specify which side in the conflict had used the chlorine bombs. But critics of the Syrian government, including the United States, have pointed out that the bombs had been seen dropped from helicopters, which are only possessed by the Syrian military.

title: The Labor Picture in February
description: The Labor Department said Friday the unemployment Rate in the United States decreased to 5.50 percent in February of 2015 from 5.70 percent in January of 2015. Thats the lowest unemployment rate since May 2008. This month 295,000 jobs were created, exceeding economists expectations.

title: A Thick Trail of Breadcrumbs Leads to Aspiring New York Police Officers
description: The union boss remembers meeting him two or three years ago, before the kid had turned 21. Must have been  the young man was, after all, heading out that night to try to buy beer at bodegas in Manhattan in a sting operation meant to curb sales of alcohol to the under aged.

title: Books on New Yorks Role in the Civil War, and Coney Island
description: The sesquicentennial celebration of the Civil War culminates next month with 150-year-old images of City Hall draped in black. The Nation Mourns, a banner proclaims from the portico, and thousands of curious and inconsolable New Yorkers queue up to view the body of Abraham Lincoln for the last time.

title: Iraqi Forces Said to Near ISIS-Held Tikrit
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqs largest offensive against Islamic State militants came a step closer to the city of Tikrit on Friday, with Shiite militiamen and Iraqi troops advancing into the town of Dour, according to Iraqi state television.

title: In Mexico, an Extreme Race in the Shadow of Extreme Danger
description: Josue Stephens, one of the organizers of the Caballo Blanco ultramarathon last week in Urique, Mexico, realized something was amiss when he was warned not to drive along the coastal route because so many people had been killed there recently. When he finally got to Urique, he saw armed men in bulletproof vests swarm into the local police station, take everyones guns and throw two officers into the back of a truck before barreling away.

title: A Third Blast on Oil Trains Stirs Scrutiny
description: For the third time in less than a month, a train carrying flammable crude oil has derailed and burst into flames, prompting questions over whether stricter measures being considered to ensure their safety will be enough.

title: Pakistan Honors Victims of School Massacre
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Education officials in northwestern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province have renamed more than a hundred schools in honor of the children killed last year in a Taliban attack on an army-run public school in Peshawar, the provincial capital.

title: The Boring Life of a Private Investigator
description: WHEN I first became a private investigator, I was enthralled by the idea of the brash gumshoe who was modeled on the American cowboy and incubated in the pulps  a lawless lone wolf.

title: After Rory McIlroys Shot Drops Into Water, His 3-Iron Suffers the Same Fate
description: DORAL, Fla.  Rory McIlroy fleetingly considered giving the 3-iron in his right hand a reprieve. Then frustration got the better of him, and he flung it into the same water hazard on the Blue Monster course that seconds earlier had swallowed his golf ball.

title: U.S. Attorney Keeps Talking, but Leaves Out Sheldon Silver
description: One day after the arrest of Sheldon Silver, the former State Assembly speaker, in January, Manhattans top federal prosecutor spoke at a local law school about public corruption, alluding repeatedly to Mr. Silver when castigating the way deals were made in Albany, by three men in a room.

title: U.S. Relied on Unarmed South Korean Officer to Protect Envoy
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The United States was relying on a lone, unarmed South Korean police bodyguard to protect Mark W. Lippert, the American ambassador to South Korea, when he was attacked Thursday, a senior United States official said Friday, adding to questions in South Korea about whether security had been too lax.

title: Asking Megadonors for Just a Million
description: The coffers of Jeb Bushs not-quite-declared campaign for president are filling at such a rate that fund-raisers have reportedly been instructed not to ask megadonors to give more than $1 million each this quarter. The concern is seemliness  that acceptance of multimillion-dollar checks from deep-pocketed supporters could bolster the impression that Mr. Bush, the former Florida governor, is in their debt, according to a Washington Post report.

title: Brian Carman, Surf Rocker, Dies at 69
description: Brian Carman, who as a high school student in the early 1960s helped write the instrumental surf-rock hit Pipeline for his band, the Chantays, died on Sunday at his home in Santa Ana, Calif. He was 69.

title: Jobs and the Federal Reserve
description: The latest jobs report showed that unemployment fell to 5.5 percent in February and that 295,000 jobs were added to the economy. But the labor market is not as healthy as those figures might suggest.

title: Better Bonding Through Telenovelas
description: Two people are unable to console each other during their mutual bereavement in Guadalupe in the Guest Room, the first of three world premieres being staged in the coming months by Two River Theater in Red Bank. There is a language barrier between the 30-something Steve (Charles Socarides) and Guadalupe (Socorro Santiago), his mother-in-law, as they mourn the untimely death of his wife, Claudia. A native of Mexico, the widowed Guadalupe possesses only a rudimentary knowledge of English. Steves command of Spanish is equally poor.

title: Harve Bennett, Quiz Kid and Star Trek Producer, Dies at 84
description: Harve Bennett, who navigated a rocky path from childhood stardom to youthful disaffection to adult success as a producer of four Star Trek films and an Emmy-winning TV movie, died on Feb. 25 in Medford, Ore. He was 84.

title: When the Elephants Exit the Big Top
Holidays That Reflect New Yorks Students
description: New York Citys decision to add two Muslim holidays to the public school calendar is welcome news  not just for Muslim pupils, an estimated 10 percent of the citys 1.1 million public school children, who will no longer have to skip school to celebrate with their families, but for all New Yorkers who believe that the school system is made stronger when it adapts to reflect the diverse and growing communities it serves. The holidays are Eid al-Fitr, which marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan, and Eid al-Adha, a commemoration of the willingness of Ibrahim, or Abraham, to sacrifice his son at Gods command.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 6, 2015
description: March 6, 2015

title: Republicans Set Up Shop in Iowa, Where Few Will Prosper
description: DES MOINES  There are so many reasons for Republicans to ignore Iowa.

title: Bullets Over Washington
description: In 1986, Congress passed, and Ronald Reagan signed into law, the Law Enforcement Officers Protection Act. It directed the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives to ban certain types of ammunition that could pierce the body armor worn by police officers. The National Rifle Association had originally opposed the legislation  which, in fact, was one of a series of events that caused a split between the N.R.A. and most police associations  but the logic behind it was irrefutable.

title: Around the World in a Song
description: In the age of the global village, a musician need not have vast experience living in a particular country to evoke its culture. Commitment and a connection to that countrys wider community  actual or virtual  can suffice.

title: Journeys in Gender
description: Gender transitions are difficult but rewarding for many, including Sheela-Marie Padgett, a former dancer.

title: Review: In Reverberation, Singles Adrift in the Big City
description: HARTFORD  Grief begets isolation, and isolation begets loneliness in Reverberation, a keenly felt, haunting drama by Matthew Lopez about two New Yorkers adrift in their lives who strike up a sustaining friendship. The play, making its premiere here at Hartford Stage, has the cool but precise observational feel of current television shows about singles in the city like HBOs Girls and Looking, at least until an ill-judged spasm of violence at the end shatters the elliptical mood.

title: Science as a Vocation
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Most people dont notice when a puzzle is a PANGRAM (the grid uses every letter FROM A TO Z, once), but you might have a vague sense of it while solving. Every time you fill in a rare letter, like J, K, Q, V or Z, you might wonder if youll eventually run into all 26 letters of the alphabet in your crossword puzzle.

title: Federal Court in Alabama Is Asked to Clear Way for Same-Sex Marriages
description: ATLANTA  Lawyers for gay and civil rights groups on Friday asked a federal court in Mobile, Ala., to force the states probate judges to once again issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, three days after the Alabama Supreme Court ordered them to stop.

title: In New Haven, an Exhibition on a Yale Professor Who Helped Rescue Art During World War II
description: As the Allied forces advanced north in Italy  during the last year of World War II, Capt. Deane Keller arrived in Pisa and found that the fighting had left much of the ancient city reduced to rubble.

title: Harlem Man Is Convicted of Murdering His Girlfriend
description: A Harlem man was convicted of second-degree murder on Friday in the death of his girlfriend, whom he stabbed 38 times before hiding her body in a plastic barrel in his bedroom.

title: Cardinal Egan Is Recalled Fondly at a Chapel He Called Home
description: As the leader of the sprawling Archdiocese of New York, Cardinal Edward M. Egan could be seen as a fierce defender of church doctrines and a no-nonsense administrator who closed or merged parishes and schools to help restore the archdiocese to financial stability.

title: Jeb Bush Kicks Off Courtship of Iowa
description: URBANDALE, Iowa  Jeb Bush, making his first visit to this presidential kickoff state as a likely candidate, began his bid to win the caucuses here by paying tribute to two Iowa touchstones and calibrating his message about why he supports education standards loathed by many conservatives.

title: Bridgehampton Chamber Music Festival Adds a Spring Series
description: The Bridgehampton Chamber Music Festival, a highly regarded summer event, will expand its offerings this month with a new spring series.

title: Yale Beats Harvard to Take Control of Ivy League
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  The basketball rivalry between Harvard and Yale dates to the 1900-1 season, whenJohn Kirkland Clark, a former Bulldog, introduced the sport to the Crimson athletic department while attending law school at Harvard.

title: Carlos Beltran Has No Hits, but No Pain, in His Return for Yankees
description: TAMPA, Fla.  What Carlos Beltran did Friday night against the Pittsburgh Pirates did not show up in the box score. Making his spring training debut, Beltran struck out twice, walked on four pitches and made one meaningful throw, corralling Neil Walkers double and getting the ball back in cleanly.

title: Readers Drawn Into Debate Over U.C.L.A. Students Jewish Background
description: In Kerckhoff Hall, the bustling student union building at the University of California, Los Angeles, a student council meeting was underway. Not exactly newsworthy, one would argue, if not for what came after.

title: Room to Breathe In the Mediterranean
description: Heres the question: In Armonk, a town chockablock with a range of dining spots, some highly lauded, how does newcomer Fattoria Dinner House distinguish itself, apart from its unwieldy name?

title: A Japanese Pub on the Saugatuck
description: The chef Bill Taibe began his gustatory takeover of Westport modestly, with the minuscule Le Farm. Then he opened the Welk. His newest venture is Kawa Ni, which is Japanese for on the river  it is at the bridge overlooking the Saugatuck River.

title: Where Mediterranean Leans Lebanese
description: When I walk into a Mediterranean restaurant, its hard to know what kind of food to expect. It could be Israeli or Syrian or Turkish or Egyptian. I could be looking forward to kofta and end up with a menu full of risottos or spinach pies, given the diverse countries that surround that sea.

title: Portuguese Flavors, and Plenty to Take Home
description: Here are two helpful hints on visiting Lisbon Cafe in Carle Place: Come hungry and dont be shy about asking for doggy bags. Generosity should be the middle name of this Portuguese restaurant, which opened in January.

title: Corrections: March 7, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I have always conducted myself in accordance with the law.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 9 P.M. (Showtime) INSIDE LLEWYN DAVIS (2013) Oscar Isaac portrays Llewyn, an aspiring folk singer mourning the death of his musical partner (the voice of Marcus Mumford) and leaving mayhem  a crying hostess, a pregnant woman, an escaped cat  in his wake as he bounces from couch to couch in Greenwich Village during a single week in 1961. Carey Mulligan, Justin Timberlake, Stark Sands and Adam Driver round out the cast as Llewyns fellow folk singers; John Goodman is a drug-addicted jazzman; and Garrett Hedlund is a Beat poet. And while Llewyns background and antics were inspired by the life of Dave Van Ronk, this is not a biopic, its a Coen brothers movie, which is to say a brilliant magpies nest of surrealism, period detail and pop-culture scholarship, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. Mr. Isaac, a versatile character actor here ascending to the highest levels of his craft, refuses the easy road of charm. One of the films lessons, as Mr. Scott sees it, is: We are, as a species, ridiculous: vain, ugly, selfish and self-deluding. But somehow, some of our attempts to take stock of this condition  our songs and stories and moving pictures, old and new  manage to be beautiful, even sublime.

title: What to Expect on the Fourth Day of Paris Fashion Week
description: Junya Watanabe is a strong, silent type. The man makes the Sphinx look chatty. So youre as unlikely to get a preview of his collection as you are to get an explanation after.

title: Grim Prospects Drive an Exodus From Kosovo
description: For months now, buses have been bringing Kosovo Albanians through Serbia to the porous land border with Hungary, which is in the European Union.

title: Kosovars Who Fought for Land Are Now Eager to Leave
description: STANOVC, Kosovo  The extended Cakaj family has built a few dozen homes here, along Tony Blair Street, between the Dubai supermarket and the French peacekeepers base, in a clannish faith that closeness would bring security. But recently the family of Kosovo Albanians has begun to splinter, as a disastrous economy, static politics and a newly created opening in the border with Serbia have enticed tens of thousands of Kosovars to leave their troubled land in search of opportunity and work.

title: Junya Watanabe: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Here Come the Employment Truthers
description: Ben Casselman reads an op-ed in the Wall Street Journal and declares,

title: Haider Ackermann: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Brazil Bribery Inquiry Targets Top Politicians
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils highest court on Friday authorized an investigation of dozens of prominent political figures, including the leaders of both houses of Congress, intensifying a sweeping bribery scandal that is bedeviling President Dilma Rousseffs government at a time when she is grappling with a sluggish economy.

title: 2 Suspects Are Detained in Killing of Kremlin Critic
description: MOSCOW  Two suspects have been detained in the killing of the opposition leader Boris Y. Nemtsov, the head of Russias internal law enforcement agency announced on Saturday.

title: Gunman Kills Five in Restaurant in Mali
description: DAKAR, Senegal  A masked gunman opened fire on a restaurant in Malis capital, Bamako, early Saturday morning, killing at least two Europeans  a Frenchman and a Belgian  and three Malians.

title: At Hotels, One-Day-Only Vacations
description: If the staycation was the travel industrys response to the Great Recession, the daycation is perhaps another sign of recovery from it.

title: Elie Saabs Fall 2015 Collection at Paris Fashion Week
description: The live stream from Elie Saab at Paris Fashion Week has ended. Watch the live stream here.

title: 1951: Department Store Celebrates 2,000 Years of Paris
description: PARIS is celebrating her 2,000th anniversary this year. It completely slipped our mind until the other day when we were invited to a luncheon at the Plaza-Athne to celebrate the occasion. The luncheon was given by Filenes, a Boston department store, well known for remembering birthdays and anniversaries. The stores executives had loaded down two of their representatives with 2,001 candles and instructions to bake a cake and throw a big blowout for the French capital.

title: Mugler: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: How Much Is That Doggie Affecting Prices?
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Remembrance of NAIRUs Past
description: More on the Cromwellian aspect of monetary policy: the Philadelphia Fed has a helpful summary of Fed estimates of the NAIRU reaching back to 1989. Heres what their numbers looked like on the eve of the great Clinton/Greenspan boom:

title: Obama, at Selma Memorial, Says, We Know the March Is Not Yet Over
description: SELMA, Ala.  As a new generation struggles over race and power in America, President Obama and a host of political figures from both parties came here on Saturday, to the site of one of the most searing days of the civil rights era, to reflect on how far the country has come and how far it still has to go.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Junya Watanabe Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Junya Watanabe Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: McDonalds Seeks Its Fast-Food Soul
description: McDonalds is having an identity crisis.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Haider Ackermann Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Haider Ackermann Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Secret Service Briefly Locks Down White House After Bomb-Sniffing Dogs Alert and Nearby Fire
description: WASHINGTON  The White House was put under a security lockdown Saturday morning by the Secret Service after a bomb-sniffing dog alerted its handlers to examine a car not far from the presidential residence and offices, a spokesman for the agency said.

title: Vivek Gupta of Zensar Technologies: Beware of Hiring People Just Like You
description: This interview with Vivek Gupta, C.E.O. of Zensar Technologies, a global software services company based in Pune, India, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Variety: A Fatigued Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Do you have trouble finding time to get to your daily crossword puzzle? I do, although I never miss a New York Times crossword, of course. Its part of the job. What I have trouble with is finding the time to do some of the other indie puzzles out there, like the ones listed in the Blogroll. Theyre fun and maybe, one day when the emus dont need as much care, I will have a chance to actually solve some of them.

title: Stagflation Predictions
description: Matt OBrien catches a piece by Dick Morris a few years ago predicting that Obamas legacy would be stagflation. But I say, oh yeah? Ill see your Dick Morris (who cares, really?) and raise you a  Paul Ryan: Thirty Years Later, a Return to Stagflation.

title: Jihadists May Have Wrecked an Ancient Iraqi Site
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi officials said Saturday that they were investigating reports that Islamic State militants had destroyed Hatra, an archaeological site that dates to the first century B.C., two days after officials confirmed that the group had bulldozed another nearby site, the ancient Assyrian city of Nimrud.

title: Yu Darvish May Need Season-Ending Surgery on Elbow
description: SURPRISE, Ariz.  Yu Darvish, a star right-hander for the Texas Rangers, may soon become the latest ace pitcher to have Tommy John surgery. The Rangers said Saturday that Darvish had a sprained ulnar collateral ligament in his right elbow and that their doctor had recommended the operation, which would cost Darvish the entire 2015 season.

title: In Iowa, Christie Highlights His Agricultural Credentials
description: DES MOINES  Gov. Chris Christie on Saturday sought to appeal to hundreds of Iowans at a farming forum at the State Fairgrounds here by reminding them that that he, too, is from an agricultural state: New Jersey is the Garden State, remember, he said.

title: Move Over Mao: Beloved Papa Xi Awes China
description: BEIJING  The must-see tourist sights of the Chinese capital form a grandiose circuit: the Great Wall, the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square and, for early birds willing to brave long lines, the mausoleum of Mao Zedong.

title: To Break In Their Gloves, Yankees Dunk, Tenderize and Lather Up
description: TAMPA, Fla.  When Alex Rodriguez played in Texas, he noticed that as the hot, humid summers dragged on, they would take a toll on the glove he used to play shortstop. It would become heavy and malleable, losing the firm shape that he liked.

title: At the Fed in 2009, Rolling the Dice in a Crisis
description: Ben Bernanke and his colleagues at the Federal Reserve Board have earned accolades from all corners for the extraordinary actions they took to rescue the financial system in 2009. While 2008 was the Feds annus horribilis, exposing how unaware the central bank had been of the risks building in the financial system, 2009 was its year of redemption.

title: Mike Huckabee Strikes a Populist Tone at Iowa Agriculture Summit
description: DES MOINES  The agriculture industry generally supports free trade and an immigration overhaul, but former Gov. Mike Huckabee of Arkansas made clear Saturday at an industry summit here that he is more of a populist than many of the other Republican presidential hopefuls.

title: Warren Buffetts Awesome Feat at Berkshire Hathaway, Revisited
description: Warren Buffett is taking a victory lap, and on the 50th anniversary of his reign at Berkshire Hathaway he is entitled to it. From a failing New England textile company, Berkshire became the vehicle for one of capitalisms greatest investing feats.

title: After Talks, Nuclear Deal on Iran Is Seen as Close
description: PARIS  Secretary of State John Kerry wrapped up a week of diplomacy in Europe and the Middle East within what many experts say is striking distance of an initial accord with Iran over its nuclear program.

title: Comme des Garons: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Unarmed Man Is Shot Dead by Police After Scuffle in Wisconsin
description: A 19-year-old Wisconsin man was shot and killed Friday by a police officer during a scuffle inside an apartment in Madison, police officials said. The shooting prompted protests that continued on Saturday and led officials to call for restraint while the shooting is investigated.

title: Bosses Who Love Themselves
description: Try to avoid working for a company with a narcissist at the top. Thats because narcissistic C.E.O.s tend to overspend on investments and deliver substandard results. On top of that, they are often paid more than their humbler yet better-performing peers, according to a recent study.

title: Zing and Talent Add Up to Hope for the Mets
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Pop. Pop! POP!

title: Lawyers Seek Reprieve for Killer Who Lost Part of His Brain Decades Earlier
description: In January 1972, Cecil Clayton was cutting wood at his familys sawmill in southeastern Missouri when a piece of lumber flew off the circular saw blade and struck him in the forehead. The impact caved in part of Mr. Claytons skull, driving bone fragments into his brain.

title: Hiring a Coach to Spark the Job Hunt
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Martin OMalley Steers Clear of Hillary Clinton Email Issue
description: Martin OMalley, the former Maryland governor who is considering a bid for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2016, took a pass on Friday when asked about the controversy over Hillary Rodham Clintons email use at the State Department, but called transparency required in the modern age.

title: Charter School in Miami Fails, but Proves Useful on Jeb Bushs Rsum
description: MIAMI  Thats where the classrooms were, said Katrina Wilson-Davis, pointing at the deserted building that housed the school where she was once principal. She climbed the chipped stairs that children used to race down at recess in their cherry-red school uniforms and walked past a street sign that still warns drivers of a 15-mile-an-hour speed limit on school days.

title: The Brands in Art Basels Orbit
description: When visitors arrive at Art Basel Hong Kong this month, they will be able to explore artwork by Richard Serra, Keith Haring and Ai Weiwei  along with a plethora of luxury brands decked out to show their artistic side.

title: Tangled Case of a Baylor Football Player Poses a Test for the Rules of Eligibility
description: An apparently homeless Baylor football player was recently declared ineligible because of N.C.A.A. violations, resulting in a spasm of outrage followed by bewilderment. One week later, there remain more questions than answers about this case and, more important, about the procedure by which college students are barred from playing sports, an increasingly significant topic as the N.C.A.A.s power to regulate its member institutions, from academics to amateurism, erodes.

title: Heartbreak in Gaza
description: In Gaza, Nicholas Kristof finds the place still in ruins after last years war with Israel.

title: Jeb Bush Stakes Out Contrary Position on Energy Subsidies in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  Jeb Bush said Saturday that he wanted to phase out federal benefits for renewable fuels and wind energy, using an agricultural summit here to side with his partys free-market advocates over the industry groups who staged the forum.

title: At Roger Vivier, Ankle Boots for Punk Sophisticates
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: The Week in Political Pictures
description: Netanyahu in Congress, health insurance subsidies, a sled-in and more.

title: Acne: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: In Greece, Desperate Times and Offbeat Measures
description: PARIS  Despite the European accord last month to extend a financial lifeline to Greece, Athens is rapidly running out of cash.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
A Sexual Desire Drug
description: Responses to an Op-Ed essay that criticized a drug aimed at women who lack sex drive.

title: Anne Curzan
description: Anne Curzan is a professor of English at the University of Michigan who specializes in the dynamism of modern language and gender differences in language use.

title: Christians Loving Jews
description: HE was almost lost in the whirl of lawmakers, pundits, plutocrats and other boldface names who showed up for Benjamin Netanyahus speech to Congress last week. But the presence of Pat Boone was a key to understanding why John Boehner was playing a smart game of party politics to stand so solidly with the Israeli prime minister.

title: The Case for Old Ideas
description: ONE of the anxieties haunting the 21st century is a fear that technological change will soon make many human lives seem essentially superfluous.

title: What Ending Health Subsidies Means
description: If the Supreme Court rules that no federal tax credit subsidies can be provided to Americans buying insurance on federal health exchanges in 34 states, the economic effects could be devastating.

title: Protect the Police From Armor-Piercing Bullets
description: The nations police forces should be the first to rally behind a federal proposal to ban the sale and manufacture of the 5.56-millimeter steel-core bullet. The bullet can be used in newly adapted handguns to provide lethal force to pierce the vests and body armor used by law enforcement officers.

title: Making Clinton Coverage Bulletproof
description: IN an open letter to The Times last week, the author David Brock claimed that a high-profile story about Hillary Rodham Clintons email practices had unraveled under scrutiny, and was riddled with innuendo. He demanded an immediate correction.

title: With the Clintons, Only the Shadow Knows
description: WASHINGTON  SOMEWHERE in Smithsonian storage sits a portrait of Bill Clinton with two odd features: He is standing next to a shadow meant to conjure Monica Lewinskys blue dress, and he is not wearing his gold wedding ring.

title: Winds of War in Gaza
description: GAZA  IT is winter in Gaza, in every wretched sense of the word. Six months after the latest war, the world has moved on, but tens of thousands remain homeless  sometimes crammed into the rubble of bombed-out buildings. Children are dying of the cold, according to the United Nations.

title: Warhead Checklist: 12 Issues, 11 Unaddressed
description: Iran has declined to give technical replies to all but one of twelve specific allegations about its atom-bomb development.

title: What Iran Wont Say About the Bomb
description: OVER the course of a dozen years, ever since atomic sleuths from the United Nations began scrutinizing Irans nuclear program, hundreds of inspections have uncovered a hidden world of labs and sprawling factories, some ringed by barbed wire and antiaircraft guns, others camouflaged or buried deep underground. Yet despite that progress, Iran has so far managed to evade a central question  whether it knows how to build an atom bomb.

title: America Needs Its Own Emojis
description: ALL I wanted to do was wish my fiance happy birthday using emojis. But I couldnt replicate the rebus of the classic Sandra Boynton greeting card: Hippo, Birdie, Two Ewes. My vocabulary was too limited.

title: Sabotaging a Deal With Iran
description: Congressional critics of an emerging international agreement to limit Irans nuclear program moved with uncommon speed last week to force a vote that could have blown up the negotiations, which are now at a delicate stage. Cooler heads prevailed, and action was delayed. But Congress could still sabotage the deal.

title: A Cable (and Girder) Guy
description: David Flores, 31, is a bridge inspection assistant team leader for HNTB, an architecture, engineering and construction firm. He is based in New York.

title: Turned Away From Iowa Ag Summit
description: The Iowa Ag Summit, which has drawn Jeb Bush, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin and other leading 2016 Republican presidential hopefuls, is billed as a bipartisan event, but organizers turned away some ticket-holders who were registered Democrats without explanation.

title: The Right Caddie? It Depends on the Golfer
description: DORAL, Fla.  After Adam Scotts high-profile split with his caddie, dozens of suitors reached out to him, including a man who enclosed a photo of himself and claimed to have ties to Japans Imperial House. A match made in Snapchat, it was not.

title: On the Case at Mount Sinai, Its Dr. Data
description: Jeffrey Hammerbacher is a number cruncher  a Harvard math major who went from a job as a Wall Street quant to a key role at Facebook to a founder of a successful data start-up.

title: The Cost of Paying Attention
description: A FEW years ago, in a supermarket, I swiped my bank card to pay for groceries. I watched the little screen, waiting for its prompts. During the intervals between swiping my card, confirming the amount and entering my PIN, I was shown advertisements. Clearly some genius had realized that a person in this situation is a captive audience.

title: Egypt Executes an Islamist Supporter of Ousted President
description: CAIRO  Egypts government carried out the death penalty for the first time against an Islamist supporter of the ousted President Mohamed Morsi on Saturday, executing a man convicted of murder during the political violence that followed the military takeover of the government in 2013, the Interior Ministry said.

title: Listeners Will Get the Birthday Gift
description: Longevity can assume a different order of magnitude in the jazz realm, where wisdom and experience are revered, and no one ever seems to retire. Still, theres something singular about the staying power of the redoubtable drummer Roy Haynes, who will turn 90 on Friday, celebrating the occasion on the bandstand at the Blue Note.

title: Amid Challenges, Humanity Arises
description: The annual ReelAbilities: NY Disabilities Film Festival is a workout for the emotions, full of both triumphant movies about overcoming adversity and sobering ones about struggle and loss. This years festival, the seventh, which runs from Thursday through March 18, is no exception.

title: Ravishing Works Too Rarely Seen
description: The Plains Indians: Artists of the Earth and Sky, one of the greatest exhibitions of American Indian art you may ever see, opens Monday at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The show was originated by the Muse du Quai Branly in Paris and the Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art (where I saw it) in Kansas City, Mo., and organized by the inestimable Gaylord Torrence, the Nelson-Atkinss curator in the field and also the orchestrator of its acclaimed permanent collection galleries.

title: A Company Debut Is Also a Salute
description: When Merce Cunningham died in 2009 (it seemed sudden, though he was 90), his company embarked on a legacy tour, as he had instructed, performing around the world for two years before dissolving in New York on the eve of 2012. During this time, the privilege and burden of maintaining the celebrated Cunningham repertory fell to Robert Swinston, a veteran of the company for three decades. He joined as a dancer in 1980, became Cunninghams assistant in 1992 and was named director of choreography after Cunninghams death.

title: Youth Isnt Always Wasted
description: The music director of the New York Youth Symphony is often a rising star, and the talented, energetic Joshua Gersen, who currently holds the post, is no exception. He was recently named assistant conductor of the New York Philharmonic, a prime steppingstone to a major career. On Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Hall, he leads his superlative youth orchestra in Beethovens Violin Concerto (with Elena Urioste as soloist) and Rimsky-Korsakovs colorful Scheherazade. The concert was also supposed to feature the premiere of Jonas Tarms Marsh U Nebuttya, but it was removed from the program when the orechestra discovered that it quoted a Nazi anthem. (2 p.m., 212-247-7800, nyyouthsymphony.org.)

title: Tourist Traps Stand No Chance
description: What if you detoured around the tourist attractions when visiting a place for the first time and ventured off the beaten path? In American Canvas, which makes its premiere on Wednesday on Ovation, Dave Holmes focuses on the culture and history, not always mentioned in guidebooks, that make three cities distinctive. His journey begins in San Francisco, where he watches the Spidey-esque members of Bandaloop dance on the faces of skyscrapers with the help of rock-climbing equipment; traces the footsteps of Jack Kerouac and Allen Ginsberg; tosses a coin into an antique arcade machine; and samples the fare at the countrys oldest Chinatown. He also tours @Large an exhibition at Alcatraz, the former penitentiary, centered on freedom and confinement. Its creator, the Chinese artist and activist Ai Weiwei, considers himself to be in soft detention, he told The New York Times, his own passport withheld by his government.

title: For Once, Expectation Returns the Cubs Embrace
description: MESA, Ariz.  David Ross has felt it once before, the euphoria of romping out to the mound as a World Series champion, bathed in the lights of an ancient ballpark in a flagship baseball town. He wants to do it again, which is why he picked the Chicago Cubs as a free agent this winter.

title: A Bittersweet Bow for the Elephant
description: ON Thursday, Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus announced that its 13 traveling elephant performers would retire by 2018, ending a storied tradition for the Greatest Show on Earth.

title: A Former Star Is Prepared for One Final Shot
description: These days, tennis comebacks arrive in all shapes and sizes, driven by injury, illness, burnout or suspension, sometimes after years away from the professional tours.

title: M.L.S.s Expansion Siblings Are Set to Begin Rivalry, and Central Florida Is Abuzz
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  With a threatened work stoppage seemingly averted and 2,000 standing-room-only tickets hastily added to a sold-out Citrus Bowl, Major League Soccer was set to introduce its two newest teams here Sunday.

title: Selma Commemorates 50th Anniversary of Bloody Sunday
description: President Obama and a host of political figures from both parties arrived in Selma on Saturday to reflect on how far the country has come and how far it still has to go.

title: Kentucky Finishes 31-0, but Thats Just a Warm-Up for the Ultimate Run
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  Last month, Kentucky Coach John Calipari garnered attention for seeming to root for Louisiana State to defeat his team in a close contest that Kentucky eventually won, 71-69, to push its record to 24-0.

title: Boko Haram Generates Uncertainty With Pledge of Allegiance to Islamic State
description: With thousands of fighters and some parts of northeastern Nigeria under its control, Boko Haram is believed to be the largest jihadi group to pledge fidelity to the Islamic State. But terrorism experts say that the practical significance of the move announced Saturday is as yet unclear.

title: Executives Are Jailed in Chile Finance Scandal
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Four executives of one of Chiles largest financial groups, a tax auditor and a former government official were taken into custody on Saturday after prosecutors filed charges of tax fraud, bribery and money laundering against them in a scandal that has shaken the economic elite and the main opposition party.

title: Nina Ricci: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Treated as Part of the Team, Regardless of Playing Time
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  The student managers walked through a heavy glass door, turned right down a hallway and stopped at a door to their left. One of them punched in a code and placed a hand on a handprint scanner. The door unlocked and they walked in.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Acne Studios Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: After Syracuse Is Stripped of Wins, Jim Boeheim Is Unable to Gain Another
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Jim Boeheim walked onto the court at PNC Arena on Saturday wearing a cheerful pink tie, sporting his standard smirk and carrying 108 fewer career victories than he had one day earlier. Television and still cameras surrounded Boeheim, Syracuses coach, following his every move, capturing every one of his pleading gestures with referees and recording every pep talk with his players in a 71-57 loss to N.C. State.

title: Did a Human or a Computer Write This?
description: A shocking amount of what were reading is created not by humans, but by computer algorithms. Can you tell the difference? Take the quiz.

title: Gay Talese: Legacy of Selma
description: Gay Talese reflects on how events in Selma, Ala., affected race relations in the United States.

title: If an Algorithm Wrote This, How Would You Even Know?
description: LET me hazard a guess that you think a real person has written what youre reading. Maybe youre right. Maybe not. Perhaps you should ask me to confirm it the way your computer does when it demands that you type those letters and numbers crammed like abstract art into that annoying little box.

title: Obama Speaks on Selma Anniversary
description: President Obama addressed a crowd of thousands on the 50th anniversary of civil rights demonstrations in Selma, Ala.

title: With Case Hanging Over Menendez, Democrats Lack a Clear Successor
description: For decades, Senator Robert Menendez has been one of the immovable objects of New Jersey politics. Even now, staring down expected criminal charges, the Democratic lawmaker has vowed not to give way.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Parents Need To Know Risks In Sports
SUNDAY PUZZLE  Guess what todays puzzle is about. Go on, guess. Nah, youll never guess.

title: How Other Missouri Cities Are Like Ferguson
description: Ferguson looks similar to some other Missouri cities in racial disparities in traffic stops and municipal fees.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Acne Studios Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: Back in Afghanistan, Modern Romeo and Juliet Face Grave Risks
description: BAMIAN, Afghanistan  After nearly a year on the run, a pair of star-crossed young lovers are back in the Afghan village where both their love affair and their problems began.

title: Despite Protections, Miami Port Project Smothers Coral Reef in Silt
description: MIAMI  The government divers who plunged into the bay near the Port of Miami surfaced with bad news again and again: Large numbers of corals were either dead or dying, suffocated by sediment.

title: The Men in the Masks
description: Russell Westbrook of the Oklahoma City Thunder has joined a long list of masked men roaming the courts of the N.B.A.

title: $5,200 or $5.2 Million? Its All in How Its Framed
description: The viscountess had decided to downsize.

title: African Troops Train With Urgency as Terrorist Groups Make Advances
description: Hundreds of African, Western and American troops joined forces in military training exercises aimed at warding off the expansion of terrorist groups.

title: African Training Exercise Turns Urgent as Threats Grow
description: MAO, Chad  An oath of allegiance from Boko Haram, the Nigeria-based militant group, to the Islamic State on Saturday reinforces Western fears that the terrorist group is growing beyond its base in Iraq and Syria. These worries have prompted American and allied commandos to rush to train African counterterrorism troops to fight extremists on the continent.

title: Kentucky Primary Change Would Allow Rand Paul to Run While Keeping Senate Seat
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Rand Paul succeeded on Saturday in persuading the leadership of the Republican Party in Kentucky to help him resolve a predicament that could threaten his plans to run for president in 2016: a state law that prohibits candidates from appearing twice on the same ballot.

title: Obama Says He Didnt Know Hillary Clinton Was Using Private Email Address
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Saturday that he had learned only last week that Hillary Rodham Clinton used a private email system for her official correspondence while she was secretary of state.

title: In Iowa, Jeb Bush Risks Support With Unpopular Stances
description: DES MOINES  Jeb Bush made his Iowa debut as a likely presidential candidate by reiterating his support for two issues unpopular with conservative activists and announcing his opposition to a pair of federal benefits prized by industry here, a risky wager in the state that kicks off the nomination process.

title: Dean Hess, Preacher and Fighter Pilot, Dies at 97
description: Dean Hess, a flying preacher who unwittingly bombed a German orphanage during World War II and six years later helped rescue hundreds of Korean foundlings endangered by Communist troops converging on Seoul, died on Monday at his home in Huber Heights, Ohio, near Dayton. He was 97.

title: Ferguson Became Symbol, but Bias Knows No Border
description: If the shooting of Michael Brown had taken place about 500 yards to the southeast, he would have died not in Ferguson, Mo., but in the neighboring city of Jennings. The court system there, which is overseen by a white judge but has almost exclusively black defendants, routinely sends people to jail for failure to pay minor traffic fines, a new lawsuit alleges.

title: Dirk Shafer, Playgirl Centerfold Who Revealed He Was Gay, Dies at 52
description: Dirk Shafer, a former Playgirl magazine centerfold who chronicled his experiences as a closeted gay man in a 1995 mock documentary, Man of the Year, was found dead on Thursday in West Hollywood, Calif. He was 52.

title: Bill Clinton Defends Foreign Donations to Family Foundation
description: Former President Bill Clinton spoke out in defense of his family foundations acceptance of donations from foreign governments on Saturday, after a series of news reports that raised questions about the practice, which quietly resumed after Hillary Rodham Clinton stepped down as secretary of state.

title: J. B. Holmes Leads Cadillac Championship by Five After a Round of Maintenance
description: DORAL, Fla.  J. B. Holmes is like the miler who runs a blistering first lap and tries to hold off the pack. In his first loop around Trump National Dorals Blue Monster, Holmes tied a course record with a 10-under-par 62. He has played the next 36 holes in one under, including a two-under 70 on Saturday to maintain his lead at the Cadillac Championship, a World Golf Championships event.

title: African Troops Train With Urgency as Terrorist Groups Make Advances
description: Hundreds of African, Western and American troops joined forces in military training exercises aimed at warding off the expansion of terrorist groups.

title: Winter Racing Is Staying at Aqueduct, but Not All the Horses Are
description: Barbara Banke, who owns horses competing at the highest level of racing, was so concerned about wintry conditions at Aqueduct Racetrack that she opted to have her two Kentucky Derby hopefuls oppose each other in Tampa, Fla. In the process, she scrapped plans to send one to New York for the $400,000 Gotham Stakes, held Saturday.

title: Twenty Years Later, Devils Toast the Men Who Hoisted the Teams First Stanley Cup
description: NEWARK  The N.H.L. experienced a few firsts during the 1994-95 season. The league went through its first lockout, which cost it 111 days of its season and pushed the playoffs into the final week of June.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 7, 2015
description: March 7, 2015

title: Review: Bjrk at Carnegie Hall, Heartbreak and Pathos
description: The one indelible moment in Bjrk  a worshipful retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art, which has met with something other than critical approval  happens in Black Lake, a sound and video installation commissioned for the show. Bjrk is depicted alone, in a stark Icelandic landscape, furiously pounding a fist against her chest. She seems riven with despair, possibly trying to jolt her heart back into its rhythm, as unseen strings sustain a restive chord for an eternal half-minute or so.

title: Kansas City Royals Sign Pitcher
description: The right-hander Chris Young, who won the American League Comeback Player of the Year Award last season, signed a one-year, $675,000 contract with Kansas City. He can make up to $5.325 million in incentive bonuses.

title: A Demonstration at the Armory Show Art Fair
description: One of the best known art fairs in New York became the site on Saturday of an unsanctioned performance demonstrating against the death of Eric Garner.

title: Andrea Bargnani Is Cheered in One More Knicks Loss to Mock
description: Late in a season of calamitous twists and weird turns, the Knicks have somehow found their nightly fortunes in the delicate custody of Andrea Bargnani.

title: Martin Brodeur Returns to New Jersey, Happy to Be Outside the Crease
description: NEWARK  Martin Brodeurs goaltending career is over, and he is perfectly fine with that.

title: The Beat Goes On
description: Leather jackets worn with turtlenecks, white jeans paired with ankle boots  this seasons pieces recall the edgy bohemia of the East Village in the 1970s.

title: Hooking Up
description: For years, the world of high fashion has ignored, flirted with and appropriated hip-hop. Finally, the style is as cool on the runway as it is on the street.

title: The Forever Allure of French Guys
description: Some of Frances most talented men in some of the seasons best clothes.

title: Allie Rubin and Jason Meizlish
description: Allie Rose Rubin married Jason Lowell Meizlish Saturday evening at the Waters Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens. Rabbi David E. Adelson officiated.

title: Katie Xia and Anthony Vargas
description: Katie Yang Xia and Anthony August Vargas were married Saturday at the Princeton Club of New York. Dorothy Muson, a pastor in the Church of Spiritual Humanism, officiated.

title: No Stone Left Unturned
description: Erin Paige Harkless, the daughter of Gerald B. Harkless and Dr. Lawrence B. Harkless of Pomona, Calif., was married Saturday evening to Charles Marques Gibson Moore, the son of Cheryl Gibson-Moore of Southfield, Mich., and Charles H. Moore, Jr. of Farmington Hills, Mich. The Rev. Jeff Maszal, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at the Whittemore House, the home of the Womans National Democratic Club in Washington.

title: Katy Chang and David Hsu
description: Katy Chang and David Allen Hsu were married Saturday at the Park Hyatt Georgetown in Washington. A cousin of the groom, Judge Theodore D. Chuang of the United States District Court for the District of Maryland, officiated.

title: All Relationships Go Through Hiccups
description: Yocheved Zivar Amrami and Rabbi Zachary Asher Fredman were married Friday at Wildcat Canyon Regional Park in Richmond, Calif. Rabbi James E. Ponet, the Howard M. Holtzmann Jewish Chaplain at Yale, officiated.

title: Dina Rudman, Austin Scherer
description: Dina Rudman and Austin Allen Scherer were married in Brooklyn on Saturday evening by Rabbi Roger Ross at Deity, an events space in a former synagogue.

title: Lindsay Blane, Joshua Farhadian
description: Lindsay Michelle Blane, the daughter of Amy C. Blane of Boca Raton, Fla., and Michael H. Blane of Port Washington, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to Dr. Joshua Andrew Farhadian, a son of Thea M. Farhadian and Keivan Farhadian, also of Port Washington. Rabbi Irwin Zeplowitz officiated at Capitale, an events space in New York.

title: Jane Meyerson and Jeremy Moskowitz
description: Jane Jacobs Meyerson and Jeremy Scott Moskowitz were married Saturday evening at the Mandarin Oriental hotel in New York. Rabbi Elliot J. Cosgrove officiated.

title: Jessica Ludwig, Michael Bertuccio
description: Jessica Marie Ludwig, a daughter of Beth A. Ludwig and John J. Ludwig of Westfield, Ind., is to be married Sunday evening to Michael John Bertuccio, the son of Candy Bertuccio of Lloyd Harbor, N.Y., and the late Joseph J. Bertuccio. Mark W. Faist, a minister of the American Marriage Ministries, is to officiate at Tiny Boxwoods, a cafe in Houston.

title: Alexandra Kirsch,  Adam Thompson
description: Alexandra Paige Kirsch and Adam Katoni Thompson were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Arnie Sleutelberg at the Dearborn Inn in Dearborn, Mich.

title: Freshman Guard Leads Duke to a Sweep of North Carolina
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  On senior night for North Carolina, it was the Duke freshman Tyus Jones who led the No. 3 Blue Devils to a season sweep of the No. 19 Tar Heels.

title: Mystery of the Murillo Artwork That Vanished at MoMA
description: When the Museum of Modern Art opened an exhibition of contemporary works in December, eight unstretched canvases by the celebrated young Colombian artist Oscar Murillo were not hung on walls, but were instead placed on the floor, where visitors were invited to handle them.

title: What to Expect on the Fifth Day of Paris Fashion Week
description: PARIS  Paris shuts down on Sundays. Just try to find a dinner reservation; half the world is closed. Fashion Week, on the other hand, is open for business. Neither snow nor rain will stop it, as the United States Postal Services unofficial motto goes.

title: Revisiting Selma
description: Recollections from those who marched for the right to vote.

title: Corrections: March 8, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Study of TV Viewers Backs Twitters Claims to Be Barometer of Public Mood
description: Twitter might not be a window into the soul, but it does provide a clear view into what grabs our attention on television, according to new research being published this week.

title: No Sign of Distress in Malaysia Jets Crew, Report Says
description: HONG KONG  The Malaysian government released on Sunday the most comprehensive report to date on the circumstances surrounding the disappearance of a Boeing 777 jetliner one year ago, revealing for the first time that the pilot and co-pilot of the plane had displayed no discernible signs of distress before the ill-fated flight.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Catch up on the weeks top stories.

title: Two Are Charged in Killing of Boris Nemtsov
description: MOSCOW  Two Chechens, one a police officer who fought Islamic insurgents and the second a security guard, were charged in a Moscow court on Sunday in connection with the killing of Boris Y. Nemtsov, a leading Kremlin critic, while three other suspects were jailed pending further investigation.

description: Paris

title: Short Hair: A First for a Daughter, and a Leap for a Mother
description: Mom, I want to cut my hair boy-short, said my oldest daughter, walking into the kitchen. Her long brown hair was twisted loosely in a bun on the top of her head.

title: China Detains Several Womens Rights Activists
description: BEIJING  China detained at least 10 womens rights activists over the weekend to forestall a nationwide campaign against sexual harassment on public transportation that was to overlap with International Womens Day, according to human rights advocates and associates of those detained.

title: New Commissioner Vows to Revitalize Agency That Fights Discrimination in New York
description: Every year, thousands of New Yorkers turn to the Commission on Human Rights, the city agency responsible for battling discrimination in the workplace, the housing market and beyond.

title: Cline: Fall 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: As Ebola Ebbs in Sierra Leone, Life Slowly Returns to Normal
description: A photographer sees residents of Freetown trying to return to daily life.

title: Tarin ODonnell and Andrew Teno
description: Tarin Paige ODonnell and Andrew Joseph Teno were married Saturday by the Rev. Roberto M. Cid at St. Patrick Catholic Church in Miami Beach.

title: Tao He and Stephen Covello
description: Tao He and Stephen Covello were married Friday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau by Edwina Townes, a staff member of the New York City clerks office.

title: Ryan Smith, Jesse Parley
description: Ryan Summer Smith, the daughter of Michele M. Smith and Jeffrey E. Smith of Dallas, was married there Saturday evening to Jesse Abraham Parley, the son of Sylvia J. Lavietes of Larchmont, N.Y., and the late Louis I. Parley. Rabbi David Stern officiated at the Trinity River Audubon Center.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Who Spewed That Abuse? Anonymous Yik Yak App Isnt Telling
description: During a brief recess in an honors course at Eastern Michigan University last fall, a teaching assistant approached the classs three female professors. I think you need to see this, she said, tapping the icon of a furry yak on her iPhone.

title: Threats to Voting Rights Remain, Selma Gathering Is Told
description: SELMA, Ala.  Echoing a speech given by President Obama a day earlier, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said Sunday that access to the polls was under siege by a flurry of recent state laws, and by a 2013 United States Supreme Court decision that weakened the Voting Rights Act, the landmark legislation that was the great prize for the civil rights activists who marched here a half-century ago.

title: Renowned Pianist Takes a Request and Adds to a Spirited Repertoire
description: A woman walks into a restaurant, sits down and orders a martini. Vodka, she says. Absolut. The gin-drinking man across the table smiles and says what he always says about vodka: How can you stand that rotgut?

title: Obama SaysNuclear Deal Offered to Iran Tests Whether It Is Serious
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said that he and other world leaders have offered Iran an extraordinarily reasonable deal that will test whether the leadership of the Islamic nation is serious about at last resolving the dispute over its nuclear program.

title: Slandering the 70s
description: I noted yesterday that back in 2009 there was a real division of opinion among leading Republicans: would Obama and Bernanke deliver Weimar-level inflation, or merely 70s-type stagflation?

title: Verbatim: Not One to Judge
description: Former President Bill Clinton, speaking in Miami at the Clinton Foundations day of action, on whether his wife Hillary Rodham Clinton is being treated fairly over her use of a private email account.

title: Feinstein Calls for Clinton to Explain Emails
description: Senator Dianne Feinstein, the veteran California Democrat, said on Sunday that Hillary Clinton must step up and explain why she used only a private email address as secretary of state, comments likely to ratchet up pressure on Mrs. Clinton to address the matter publicly.

title: In Paris, Jeanne Lanvins Sleeping Beauties
description: PARIS  In steel-and-glass boxes at the Palais Galliera, the city of Pariss fashion museum, were a number of dresses from the 1920s and 30s, as casually and haphazardly arranged as if theyd been tossed off at the end of a long night of parties.

title: Older Moviegoers Bolster Box Office of The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
description: An audience that Hollywood often ignores  older moviegoers  turned The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel into an immediate success over the weekend, while the director Neill Blomkamp and the actor Vince Vaughn fell flat in their pursuit of younger crowds.

title: 1940: Police Guard Judy Garland After Kidnap Warning
description: LOS ANGELES  Acting on a mysterious telephone warning that Judy Garland, the seventeen-year-old film star, was to be kidnapped, the police raced to her home and sent out radio cars patrolling the district. The telephone switchboard operator at the police station received an anonymous message asking if he knew who Judy Garland was and saying: Get to her house quick. She is going to be kidnapped. While the police kept guard outside her home, Judy went on with a party she was holding.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 9, 1940
