description: After a frigid winter, New Yorks first 50-degree day in months hinted at the coming spring.

title: U.S. Immigration Authorities Arrest Foreigners Convicted of Crimes
description: Immigration authorities said Monday that they arrested 2,059 foreigners who were convicted criminals during a five-day nationwide operation in early March, including more than 1,000 people who had committed felonies, among them 58 gang members and 89 sex offenders.

title: More Good News on the Deficit, This Time Because of Private Insurance Health Premiums
description: Estimates for government health care spending keep coming down.

title: Democratic Speechwriters See Obamas Selma Address as Among His Very Best
description: President Obamas speech Saturday in Selma, Ala., has proven to be one of the rare occasions in which he has won praise from allies and adversaries alike.

title: Reggie Jackson to Auction Off Sign From Old Yankee Stadium
description: Like many former Yankees, Reggie Jackson wanted some things to remember the old Yankee Stadium by after its final season in 2008. He bought his old locker. He acquired a section of the black bleacher seats, where he hit the last of three home runs in Game 6 of the 1977 World Series that cemented his reputation as Mr. October.

title: Lew Soloff, Trumpeter for Blood, Sweat and Tears, Dies at 71
description: Lew Soloff, a jazz trumpeter who reached a broader audience with the jazz-rock band Blood, Sweat & Tears, especially with a memorable solo on the original version of the 1969 hit Spinning Wheel, died on Sunday in Brooklyn. He was 71.

title: Bratton and de Blasio Offering Mixed Signals Over Marijuana
description: It was a leading initiative of Mayor Bill de Blasios first year in office: policing the possession of small amounts of marijuana with summonses, not arrests.

title: A New Tack in the War on Mining Mountains
description: Last week, with little fanfare, PNC Financial, the nations seventh-largest bank, disclosed a significant strategic shift. The bank said it would no longer finance coal-mining companies that pursue mountaintop removal of coal in Appalachia, an environmentally devastating practice that has long drawn opposition.

title: Rockies Hope That Once Troy Tulowitzki Recovers, They Will, Too
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  Troy Tulowitzki reported to work on Monday and played a baseball game. He had not done this since last July, before his latest major surgery. It was going to be a good day.

title: Tech Blog GigaOm Abruptly Shuts Down
description: Gigaom, a pioneering technology blog that became a fixture in Silicon Valley and claimed 6.4 million monthly readers, abruptly announced on Monday that it would shut down.

title: Rays Welcome Hot Prospect: A Manager Born in 1977
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Kevin Cash said he was honored to meet Cal Ripken Jr. last week, but he is too young to recall Ripkens sensational rookie season of 1982 or the next year, when the Orioles won the World Series.

title: Budget Office Again Reduces Its Estimate on Cost of the Affordable Care Act
description: WASHINGTON  The Congressional Budget Office on Monday again lowered its estimate of the cost of the Affordable Care Act, citing slow growth of health insurance premiums as a major factor.

title: Fred Wilpon Meets With Terry Collins to Discuss Mets
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  On Monday afternoon, after the Mets were drubbed by the Miami Marlins in an exhibition game, the owner Fred Wilpon dropped by Manager Terry Collinss office for more than 20 minutes to discuss the Mets roster. Afterward, Collins spoke to reporters; Wilpon did not, although that is nothing new.

title: Chunk of New Jerseys Money From Exxon Settlement Is to Go to Legal Fees
description: New Jerseys decision to settle a multibillion-dollar pollution lawsuit with Exxon Mobil Corporation has come under broad criticism, as lawmakers and environmentalists have questioned why the state would agree to accept only $225 million  a small fraction of the $8.9 billion in damages it was seeking in court.

title: Suspect in Etan Patz Case Had Hallucinations, His Daughter Says
description: There was a lady in white who walked around the house and could pass through him like a ghost. There was a muscular man with tattoos who choked him in his bed, then vanished. There were shadows that became menacing figures, and ancient people who stood silently behind his wife and daughter.

title: Typewriter Part
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  You know all those people who say This is not a Tuesday puzzle! and who like to hold newspaper crossword publishers to the strictest letter of the law that supposedly says that crosswords have to progress in difficulty and concept as the week goes on? Well, were going to hear from them today.

title: Safety of Herbal Supplements Pulls Prosecutors Together
description: A group of attorneys general is expected to announce on Tuesday that they are forming a coalition to crack down on fraud and quality control issues in the herbal supplement industry.

title: Lisa Bonchek Adams Dies at 45; Chronicled Fight With Breast Cancer
description: I am waiting for test and scan results, laying low after a busy and stressful week, Lisa Bonchek Adams wrote on her blog in 2013, one of hundreds of posts to go along with thousands of Twitter messages documenting her life after she learned she had breast cancer in 2007, when she was 37.

title: Dustin Johnsons Case Is a Compelling Argument for Transparency
description: DORAL, Fla.  If the PGA Tour needed any more convincing that its lack of transparency in meting out fines and suspensions was hurting its product, Dustin Johnsons news conference after his victory Sunday at the World Golf Championships event at Doral was the clincher.

title: A Battle for Light and Air at an Upper East Side Building
description: On floor plans, the pair of air shafts running down the middle of 1664 Third Avenue in Manhattan look like inconsequential rectangles, barely bigger than a phone booth.

title: New Yorks First Taste of Spring
description: For the first time in months, it seemed as if this frigid winter might actually end. On Monday afternoon, the temperature in Central Park reached 54 degrees, the first time it had risen above 50 since Jan. 4.

title: Iran: U.S. Offers $5 Million for News on Ex-F.B.I. Agent
description: The United States announced Mondaythat it had increased to $5 million its reward for information that could lead to the safe return of Robert A. Levinson, a former F.B.I. agent who disappeared in Iran in 2007. The move comes as the Obama administration appears to be closing in on an agreement with Iran under which Tehran would accept limits on its nuclear program in return for the lifting of economic sanctions. The fate of Americans who have been detained by Iran  or in Mr. Levinsons case who have disappeared there  is not formally part of the talks. Mondaywas the eighth anniversary of Mr. Levinsons disappearance, which occurred during a visit he made to Kish Island, Iran. His family received photographs and a video in late 2010 and early 2011. The F.B.I. offered a $1 million reward in 2012 for information about Mr. Levinson and increased it by $4 millionon Monday. Iran has denied that it knows his whereabouts.

title: 4 Homes Are Badly Damaged in a Brooklyn Fire
description: A fire in southern Brooklyn left four homes on a canal badly damaged and six firefighters injured on Monday, the authorities and neighbors said.

title: Peace Corps Suspends Program in Jordan
description: The Peace Corps has temporarily suspended its volunteer program in Jordan because of regional instability, officials said.

title: Obama Criticizes Walker Over Union Assault
description: President Obama took a direct swipe at Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, a Republican and likely presidential candidate in 2016, for signing a so-called right-to-work bill that will limit the power of private-sector unions.

title: Like Kentucky Men, Princeton Women Close In on Perfection
description: Courtney Banghart, the womens basketball coach at Princeton, believes one pivotal defeat has put the Tigers on the cusp of a historic regular season.

title: Pilots Say Brakes Didnt Slow Jet That Slid Off Runway at La Guardia
description: Runway 13 at La Guardia Airport appeared to be all white to the pilots of a Delta Air Lines jet that skidded off it and through a perimeter fence during a snowstorm on Thursday, they told federal investigators over the weekend.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 9, 2015
description: March 9, 2015

title: New York State Changes Plan to Reduce Its Swan Population
description: In response to public pressure, state environmental officials on Monday released a revised plan to thin out the invasive mute swan population in New York. While emphasizing nondeadly control measures, the new plan would still allow the killing of the birds.

title: Naked Black Man Fatally Shot by White Police Officer in Georgia
description: A naked man who was apparently unarmed was shot and killed by a police officer on Monday at an apartment complex in Chamblee, Ga., northeast of Atlanta, the authorities said.

title: Better Call Saul Recap: I Broke My Boy
description: Season 1, Episode 6: Five-O

title: Biden Condemns Republicans Letter to Iran on Nuclear Talks
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. released a blistering statement that denounced an unusual open letter from 47 Republican senators cautioning Iran against a potential nuclear deal with President Obama, saying that the senators maneuver was beneath the dignity of an institution I revere.

title: China: Dalai Lama Supporter Burns Herself in Protest
description: A Tibetan woman who supported the exiled Dalai Lama set herself ablaze and died in a Tibetan part of southwest China, advocacy organizations abroad said Tuesday. Her self-immolationon Thursdaywas the first such episode reported in a Tibetan area this year, resuming a grim form of protest against Chinese rule that has spread since 2009. The woman, Norchuk, who was in her late 40s, set herself on fire in her home village in Ngaba County, a heavily Tibetan part of Sichuan Province that is next to the official Tibetan Autonomous Region,according to the exiled Central Tibetan Administration, which is based in northern India. Many Tibetans use only one name.

title: Armenian Leaders Establish Rights Award to Commemorate Centenary of Genocide
description: Leaders in the Armenian diaspora, preparing to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Armenian genocide, have collaborated with Hollywood celebrities and human rights advocates to create a prize to be awarded annually to those who put themselves at risk to ensure that others survive.

title: As Redskins Issue Splits Upstate Community, District Is in No Rush to Decide
description: LANCASTER, N.Y.  One week after a community forum intended to promote dialogue over the use of the nickname Redskins for scholastic sports teams, this Buffalo suburb remained divided, with supporters of each side attending a board of education meeting Monday night.

title: French Olympians Among 10 Killed in Helicopter Crash in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES  Ten people were killed, including at least three prominent French athletes, when two helicopters collided in midair on Monday night, an Argentine police official said.

title: De Blasio Said to Seek Donations for Nonprofit to Promote His Policy Goals
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is ramping up a political campaign to promote his housing and education priorities, with an eye toward amassing a financial war chest that can compete with well-financed opponents.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (DirecTV) BILLY & BILLIE Adam Brody plays the reticent Billy and Lisa Joyce is the profanity-spewing Billie, stepsiblings turned lovers in this romance from the playwright Neil LaBute. This second episode finds the couple putting their relationship on standby after a too-close-for-comfort encounter with family members. The premise might seem tabooish  its the basis of a whole subgenre of heavy-breathing romance novels  but Mr. LaBute is going for something more subtle, Neil Genzlinger wrote in The New York Times. Yes, Billy and Billie are trying to figure out how guilty they should feel, but at the same time theyre interacting like feuding brother and sister and like ordinary young people navigating the casual hookup scene.

title: Word of the Day | philanderer
description: philanderer  \f-lan-dr-r\  noun

title: Corrections: March 10, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Violence against women has epidemic proportions, and is present in every single country around the world. Yet it is still not a real priority for most governments.

title: What to Expect on the Seventh Day of Paris Fashion Week
description: Peut-tre le petit djeuner? At its ready-to-wear collections, Chanel has become known for sets of elaborate realism: most recently feminist protesters, and before that Stepford-wife grocery shoppers. This morning Chanel is inviting showgoers to something called la Brasserie Gabrielle (Gabrielle was Cocos real name, pilgrims), so perhaps there will be some Coffee Cups with the brands famous interlocking Cs, distributed at the Grand Palais and eBay-bound, or maybe just some Cute Coasters, with Karl as matre d. ...

title: Why Hedge Funds Still Make Sense for Pension Funds
description: Life for pension funds is getting tough. The race to the bottom in global interest rates has reduced the rate at which funds discount their future liabilities. Life expectancy continues to surge. Deficits have ballooned.

title: Obama at Selma
description: To the Editor:

title: Unsolved, Not Supernatural
description: To the Editor:

title: G.O.P. Insurance Plan
Suffering in Gaza: Who Is to Blame?
The Cost of Relativism
description: One of Americas leading political scientists, Robert Putnam, has just come out with a book called Our Kids about the growing chasm between those who live in college-educated America and those who live in high-school-educated America. Its got a definitive collection of data about this divide.

title: An Elephants Life: Captivity to Retirement
Dont Starve the Census
description: Some Republicans in Congress are calling for cuts to the Census Bureaus budget that would impair the agencys already strained ability to gather basic data.

title: Elusive Justice in Wisconsin
description: If the toxic effects of outsize spending in judicial elections were not already evident, the fiasco playing out in the Wisconsin Supreme Court should erase any doubt.

title: End the Ethanol Rip-Off
description: WITH the collapse in global oil prices, members of Congress are once again pushing to raise the federal gasoline tax, with the proceeds going to new roads, bridges and other infrastructure projects. While some in Congress might be averse to a tax increase of any kind, they might find it more palatable if it came packaged with a tax cut.

title: Stop Spying on Wikipedia Users
description: SAN FRANCISCO  TODAY, were filing a lawsuit against the National Security Agency to protect the rights of the 500 million people who use Wikipedia every month. Were doing so because a fundamental pillar of democracy is at stake: the free exchange of knowledge and ideas.

title: Its Not Always Depression
description: How can it be that a seemingly depressed person, one who shows clinical symptoms, doesnt respond to antidepressants or psychotherapy? Perhaps because the root of his anguish is something else.

title: Was the Burning of Columbia, S.C. a War Crime?
description: When Gen. William T. Shermans troops left Columbia, S.C., on the morning of Feb. 20, 1865, about a third of it lay in ashes behind them, with thousands left homeless. Within weeks, Southerners had begun to publish what they considered evidence of an orchestrated Northern atrocity. Ten years later, the dispute remained so sharp that Sherman felt it necessary to defend himself in his memoirs by accusing Confederates of setting the city on fire themselves. Even today, many neoconfederate websites argue that the burning of Columbia was a Union war crime.

title: Leaving Hospital, U.S. Envoy Vows to Stay Open and Friendly in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The American ambassador to South Korea, Mark W. Lippert, said on Tuesday that he would continue to be open and friendly in his dealings with people here, as he was released from a Seoul hospital five days after a knife attack that raised concerns about his security.

title: College for a New Age
description: Kevin Carey has a 4-year-old girl. Carey, the director of the education policy program at the New America Foundation, has been thinking about the role of universities in American life for virtually his entire career. But after his daughter was born, that thinking took on a new urgency.

title: Matthew Barney Gets Museum Show of His Own in Los Angeles
description: Matthew Barney has often been called the most important American artist of his generation, but last week, he became newly famous as a former boyfriend. The pop singer Bjrk (loudly) bemoans the collapse of her long relationship with him in the survey of her work that opened at the Museum of Modern Art on Sunday. Black Lake, a music video projected onto two large screens in a specially constructed theater, is a breakup ballad in surround sound.

title: Are Same-Sex Colleges Still Relevant?
Test Yourself | That Howling? Just New Yorks Neighborhood Coyotes
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 6 article, That Howling? Just New Yorks Neighborhood Coyotes.

title: 6 Qs About the News | At Museo del Prado, Blind Visitors Can Touch Masterpieces
description: In At Museo del Prado, Blind Visitors Can Touch Masterpieces, Raphael Minder writes about an usual exhibition at a Spanish art museum.

title: Elizabeth Warren Is No Barack Obama
description: Hillary Clinton has already emerged as the inevitable Democratic nominee, a title she aspired to, but could never claim, eight years ago. The closest rival she has this time is Elizabeth Warren  who is no Barack Obama.

title: Royals Hear a Personal Plea to End Violence Against Women
description: SURPRISE, Ariz.  When the main portion of her presentation on the scourge of athletes violence against women was over, when Kathy Redmond opened the floor to the fresh-faced players of the Kansas City Royals organization, a much older man from the minor league coaching staff asked more questions than anyone else.

title: A New Life for Welding
description: Welding is thriving in Texas and the Gulf Coast region, where an industrial revival built around the energy boom continues to spawn petrochemical plants and miles of new pipeline.

title: As Demand for Welders Resurges, Community Colleges Offer Classes
description: HOUSTON  Ryan Gassett had already put in a full day, moving heavy boxes and furniture for $15 an hour, when his introductory welding class began at 10 p.m. By the time he arrived at Lone Star College north of Houston, the highway toll collectors at the exit for the school had closed for the night and the campus janitors were mopping bathrooms.

title: What Do You Remember Best About Being 12?
description: Were collaborating with our friends at WNYC for this question, which grows out of a series they are running called Being 12: The Year Everything Changes.

title: In Relating to Foreign Leaders, Obama Keeps It Mostly Business
description: WASHINGTON  Less than three months into President Obamas first term, a top White House national security official told reporters that the new commander in chiefs diplomacy would be different from the regular-guy friendships with foreign leaders sought by President George W. Bush.

title: The Musical Brain, Stories by Csar Aira
description: A child races giddily from table to table in a crowded caf, accepting objects fashioned by the patrons from paper napkins for her amusement. All are lovingly devised and impossibly elaborate: a plane, a bouquet of flowers, a diorama, a kangaroo with a movable tail, the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, a clown made of paper so fragile a gaze could tear it. As each fantasy falls apart in her eager little hands, it is discarded in favor of the next. The concentrated creative aura enveloping the patrons serves as a mere backdrop for her energetic engagement with the moment that keeps turning into the next moment.

title: Kim Gordons Girl in a Band
description: The way you read a memoir has everything to do with how much you know about the subject going in. If Im reading a memoir by, say, a scientist Ive never heard of, Im likely to swallow whats being fed to me without question, bias and errors included. On the other hand, if the memoir is by a pop culture figure Ive followed obsessively, I might go the opposite way, zooming in on any minor inaccuracies: You say that television special came out in 1978, but I know for a fact it was the tail end of 1977, because the Saturday Night Fever soundtrack wasnt even out yet, and now how can I trust you about anything? Either extreme has its dangers, and both run the risk of putting me in a place where Im not looking at a book with clear eyes.

title: Spring Break for Families
description: Given the scheduling, the long hours spent in cramped spaces and the energy needed to shepherd the herd from place to place, theres a lot that could go wrong on a family trip. So even though spring break is just around the corner for many, you can forgive yourself for not planning your trip yet. Our Getaway column recently tackled last-minute trips for those who want to avoid the crowds. Here are a few suggestions for traveling with your own personal crowd.

title: Apps to Help Navigate Cruise Lines
description: Anyone planning a cruise these days quickly learns that major lines such as Disney, Norwegian and Royal Caribbean have their own smartphone apps to help passengers navigate their floating cities and discover on-board entertainment, spa services and ports of call. And for most travelers, thats more than enough information. But should you wish to immerse yourself in cruise culture, there are a handful of apps that allow you to virtually explore dozens of lines and hundreds of ships, stay on budget, even identify the tropical fish swimming below you and the constellations in the dark sky above. Some of the apps dont even require an Internet connection, so you can play and learn without having to pay for on-board Wi-Fi.

title: Aldermore Is Valued at $982 Million in London I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The Aldermore Group, a so-called challenger bank to Britains traditional financial powers, said on Tuesday that it had priced its initial public offering, valuing the company at 651 million pounds, or about $982 million.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Idle No More
description: Good morning on this bright Tuesday.

title: Daily Report: Using the Apple Watch
description: On Monday, Apple allowed a closer look at its much anticipated watch. Farhad Manjoo gives his impressions of the timepiece on three fronts: the hardware, the interface and the watchs uses.

title: Verisk Analytics Agrees to Buy Scottish Energy Research Firm
description: Verisk Analytics said on Tuesday that it had agreed to acquire the Scottish energy research firm Wood Mackenzie from its private equity owners for 1.85 billion pounds, or about $2.8 billion.

title: Refugee Crisis in Philippines as Peace Deal Is at Risk
description: MANILA  The Philippine military is fighting Islamic militants on two fronts in the countrys south, with recent battles having left dozens dead and driven more than 82,000 people from their homes, according to government officials and international organizations. An aid worker said a growing humanitarian crisis was underway in camps for people who had fled the violence.

title: From Jamaica to Minnesota to Myself
description: I had just left my parents house in Portmore, a suburb outside Kingston, for my own apartment in the city: a one-bedroom studio, barely 600 square feet, with yellow shag carpeting, a tiny terrace enclosed in jail bars, a bedroom looking out on somebody elses bedroom and a ceiling I could reach. I locked myself away from the neighbors with two deadbolts.

title: You and I Change Our Minds. Politicians Evolve.
description: As a general rule, it is difficult for people in public life to change their minds. There is an immediate rush to portray politicians as flip-floppers when they shift position on anything, even if they do so following a careful consideration of an issue rather than a meeting with a pollster. The hecklers will reliably accuse them of lacking the courage of their convictions, of being typical politicians, even though the typical politician actually tries to change his mind as rarely as possible, to avoid the hecklers.

title: Re: My Saga, Part 1
description: It was fun, it was looong, it was frankly somewhat bizarre, it was a wonderful disaster. Our first installment of the Norwegian novelist Karl Ove Knausgaards account of his journey from Newfoundland to Detroit  with lengthy digressions on going bowling, fixing a clogged toilet and a meal at the Pizza Delight in the Viking Mall  was one thing for sure: provocative.

title: Your Passwords Revealed
description: Late last year, I wrote an article for the magazine, The Secret Life of Passwords, in which I looked at the humanity that often hides in a simple string of characters, and reflected on why we imbue these codes with meaning even when were explicitly told not to. A motivational mantra, a swipe at the boss, an ode to a lost love, an inside joke with ourselves, a defining emotional scar  there was something captivating, inspiring even, about these tchotchkes of our inner lives.

title: Today in Politics: Iran Showdown Brings Obama and Congress to New Low
description: Good Tuesday morning from Washington, where the clock is ticking ahead of Hillary Rodham Clintons email news conference and possible Republican presidential candidates are lining up to face the firefighters. The Senate would rather discuss human trafficking than the attorney general nomination of Loretta E. Lynch, but after Republicans in the chamber tried to derail negotiations with Iran, foreign policy is the biggest hot spot between Congress and the White House.

title: For The Times, a New Beginning on Instagram
description: When Bryan Denton saw a woman in Freetown, Sierra Leone, kneel on the ground and cuddle a baby, he was struck by the moments intimacy.

title: Henan Delegates Protest Inequality in University Admissions
description: Henan Province in central China is mostly a flat expanse of fields, towns and villages, whose 100 million or so people are sometimes slurred by others as bumpkins. Adding to the insult, the Chinese government has long skewed opportunities away from Henan in an area of life that matters intensely to many in China: getting their children into universities.

title: Morning Agenda: Credit Suisse Names New Chief
description: CREDIT SUISSE NAMES NEW CHIEF | Brady W. Dougan is stepping down as chief executive of Credit Suisse, the bank said on Tuesday, ending his tenure as one of the longest-serving chieftains of a global banking powerhouse, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Jenny Anderson write in DealBook. Mr. Dougan  an American who has led the Swiss bank since before the financial crisis and has been called the Teflon man for his ability to deflect troublesome issues  will be succeeded by Tidjane Thiam, who heads the British insurance company Prudential, where he has been praised for his leadership.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 3-9, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: 3 French Athletes Are Mourned After Argentine Air Crash
description: PARIS  Florence Arthaud competed in solo trans-Atlantic sailing races at the age of 20. Camille Muffat captured three swimming medals at the 2012 London Olympics, including one in the grueling 400-meter freestyle. Alexis Vastine fought his way to a bronze medal in boxing at the 2008 Beijing Games.

title: President of Harlem School of the Arts to Step Down
description: Yvette L. Campbell, who helped lead the Harlem School of the Arts out of a period of financial struggle as president and chief executive for the last four years, will step down in June, the school is to announce Tuesday.

title: In Performance: Christina Bianco of Application Pending
description: This weeks video features the actress Christina Bianco in a scene from Application Pending, a one-woman comedy about an elite New York City private school. Ms. Bianco, known for her work as an impressionist, plays the schools kindergarten admissions director in addition to over 40 other characters. In his review Neil Genzlinger writes: The speed with which she switches among them as she portrays dozens of characters is remarkable. Must we trot out the phrase tour de force? Yes, we must.

title: Herzog Emerging as Credible Challenge to Netanyahu in Israeli Race
description: JERUSALEM  Isaac Herzog was getting nervous about the traffic as his car crawled north out of Tel Aviv, on the campaign trail, so he instructed his driver to use the tchakalaka  the deep, hornlike siren that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus convoy regularly employs to clear the way.

title: Obama to Appear on Jimmy Kimmel Live
description: The last time Mr. Obama was on Mr. Kimmels show was in June 2008. He was still a senator, and he talked about replacing the White House bowling alley with a basketball court.

description: Dear Diary:

description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Zo Heller and Adam Kirsch debate whether an authors intended meanings matter more than a readers interpretations.

title: Hedge Funds Recorded Strong Recovery in 2014
description: The number of hedge funds hit new heights last year, and the amount of money flowing into the funds was the highest since before the financial crisis. Even so, hedge funds performance lagged the broader stock market.

title: Times Classic Recipes: Billi Bi
description: A fragrant broth is combined with cream, thickened with egg yolk and loaded with mussels.

title: Hillary Clintons Management Paradox
description: Although the controversy over Hillary Clintons email is unlikely to damage her chances to reach the White House, her use of a private account as secretary of state suggests a larger set of concerns about her management approach. How did her staff not warn her about the political and security risks? And why didnt they protect her more effectively once those risks became clear?

title: Craig Claibornes Classic Billi Bi
description: Mussels were hard to come by this winter, at least along the Eastern Seaboard. Ice on inland waters from Long Island north to the Canadian Maritimes made them difficult to harvest and get to market.

title: Biden Rebukes Senate Republicans Over Letter to Iran
description: WASHINGTON  The White House has berated Senate Republicans for writing to Irans leaders warning them against a nuclear agreement with President Obama, saying their letter skirts the Constitution and sends a dangerous and conflicting message.

title: Hillary Clinton Tries to Quell Controversy Over Private Email
description: UNITED NATIONS  Hillary Rodham Clinton revealed on Tuesday that she had deleted about half her emails from her years as secretary of state, saying she had turned over to the Obama administration all correspondence about government business but had erased records of communications about private matters, like yoga routines, her daughters wedding and her mothers funeral.

title: Annoyance Theater Moves Brooklyn Into Comedy Theater Scene
description: My two-week binge at the Annoyance Theater, the first comedy theater in Brooklyn, ended in a pool of sewage.

title: Bain Capital to Buy Security Firm Blue Coat Systems for $2.4 Billion
description: The private equity firm Bain Capital is poised to acquire Blue Coat Systems for $2.4 billion, in a nod to the fast-growing cybersecurity market.

title: Judge Blocking Plan for Immigrants Is Praised as Fair in Texas
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex.  From his bench in a federal courthouse barely a mile from the Rio Grande, Judge Andrew S. Hanen looked over a procession of small-time drug dealers and thieves, each representing a lapse of border enforcement.

title: Women on Boards: Where the U.S. Ranks
description: When Germany passed a law last week requiring public companies to give 30 percent of board seats to women, it highlighted the slow progress of American companies in that regard.

title: 1940: Turmoil After Wagner Played
description: The attempt of the well-known Colonne-Lamoureux Orchestra to play Wagner for the first time since the outbreak of the war led to a tumultuous demonstration at the Chtelet Theater between partisans and foes of the Master of Bayreuth yesterday afternoon. Three Wagnerian numbers were originally listed on the program for yesterday, namely, the Lohengrin overture, the prelude from Tristan and Isolde, together with Isoldes love-death and the overture to Tannhauser.

title: Ambassador Is Released From Hospital
description: Mark W. Lippert, the American ambassador to South Korea, said he felt pretty darn good after he was released from Severance Hospital in Seoul where he was being treated for injuries in a knife attack.

title: Driven | 2015 BMW i3
description: The BMW i3 is a deep dive into what the car of the future should be. It is efficient, sustainable and essentially a think tank on wheels.

title: Ineos to Acquire Stakes in Igas, a Boost to British Shale Gas
description: LONDON  In a deal that could be a lifeline for the gasping British shale gas industry, the private chemical giant Ineos said on Tuesday that it was acquiring a package of stakes in licenses held by Igas Energy, a British onshore oil and gas company.

title: 1965: French Wives Gain Freedoms
description: PARIS  The government announced today that it will emancipate the French wife from tyrannical marriage customs of the Napoleonic Code of 1804. Under a new law that soon will be submitted to parliament and is certain to pass, a wife will be able to open a bank account or go into business for herself  without her husbands consent. The new measure goes so far as to strip from the husband his traditional title of lord and master of the family.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 11, 1965

title: Donna Edwards Announces Bid for Maryland Senate Seat
description: Representative Donna Edwards on Tuesday announced that she would enter the race to replace Senator Barbara A. Mikulski of Maryland, setting up what is likely to be a competitive Democratic primary.

title: Zap! Pow! With Xboxs Help, Mets Black Battles Stress of Spring Training
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  After a long day of throwing and fielding drills, Mets reliever Vic Black retired to his hotel room Sunday afternoon, slouched in a chair directly in front of the television and started playing Destiny, a first-person-shooter video game.

title: The Greatest Bowling Story Ever Told
description: On one ordinary night everything might change for Bill Fong, an underdog bowler, as he begins to get strike after strike. Will he attain the perfect series, or buckle under the pressure?

title: Video Review: The BMW i3 Offers a Glimpse of the Future
description: Generally, there have been two approaches to creating electric automobiles: Stuff batteries and an electric motor into existing gas-power cars, or start from scratch and create a new design. Not satisfied with either of those methods, BMW in a sense used a time machine.

title: Minka: A Farmhouse in Japan
description: A film about place and memory, a farmhouse in Japan, and the lives of the people who called it home.

title: Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson: Male Models of the Moment
description: Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson starred in Valentinos fall 2015 fashion show in Paris today to confirm that Zoolander 2 is happening (and dust off their Magnum poses in preparation). Never has a PR stunt looked so chic.

title: The Journey of a 9/11 Tree
description: A tree that was wounded by the September 11 attacks has regained its health, with the help of a caretaker, and returned to its home.

title: With New Hire, Credit Suisse Sends a Positive Signal
description: So much for the banking brain drain. Credit Suisse is hiring Tidjane Thiam from the British insurer Prudential to replace its veteran chief executive, Brady Dougan. Its a surprising vote of confidence in the Swiss institution, and the industry.

title: The Last Ice Merchant
description: For over 50 years Baltazar Ushca has harvested the glacial ice of Ecuadors Mount Chimborazo. His brothers have long since retired. El ltimo Hielero is a story of cultural change and adaption.

title: Emmylou Harris and Evelyn Glennie Share Polar Music Prize
description: The singer Emmylou Harris and the percussionist Evelyn Glennie will share the 2015 edition of the Polar Music Prize, the award committee announced on Tuesday. Both will be honored by Swedens King Carl XVI Gustaf at a ceremony in Stockholm on June 9, and will receive one million Swedish krona, or about $117,000, in prize money.

title: A Harlem Mothers Anti-Violence Mission
description: Jean Corbett-Parker shared the story of her sons death and her fight to prevent violence on the very streets in Harlem that her son warned others about.

title: Maria Guarnaschellis Ode to a Sicilian Urn
description: Close at Hand celebrates the objects, practical or precious, that cooks find indispensable.

title: Tales From the Worlds Longest Yard Sale
description: Travel down U.S. Highway 127 from Michigan to Alabama and meet the people at the worlds longest yard sale  an annual four-day, 690-mile exchange of not only goods, but also stories.

title: Claude Sitton, 89, Acclaimed Civil Rights Reporter, Dies
description: Claude Sitton, a son of the South whose unwavering coverage of the civil rights movement for The New York Times through most of that tumultuous era was hailed as a benchmark of 20th-century journalism, died on Tuesday in Atlanta. He was 89.

title: Video: The Night Everything Seemed Perfect
description: As a boy I used to bowl in a league. The bowling alley hadnt quite been retrofitted with computerized scoring when I started, so you had to keep score by hand, with a grease pencil and an overhead projector. One day we wanted to figure out what the score would be if you got nothing but strikes. That would be 12 in a row, which we totaled up to a score of 300  a perfect game. For us, getting the ball to stay on the lane without using bumpers was victory enough. Making a strike was usually a result of luck more than skill. To accomplish 12 of those, perfect shot after perfect shot, required a mental sharpness that was difficult to imagine.

title: One Way to Pay a Tax Bill: Donate Churchills Paintings
description: LONDON  Artist isnt the first word that comes to mind when you hear the name Winston Churchill, prime minister of Britain from 1940 to 1945 and then again from 1951 to 1955. But a part-time artist he was, and a collection of 37 of his paintings has been accepted by the British government in lieu of an inheritance tax, and will be displayed at his family home, Chartwell, which has been open to the public since 1966.

title: Living With the Extended Newbornhood of the Premature Baby
description: There was a very good chance that this diary entry was going to be written at 4 oclock in the morning.

title: ISISFinds New Frontier in Chaotic Libya
description: SURT, Libya  The Islamic State has established more than a foothold in this Mediterranean port. Its fighters dominate the city center so thoroughly that a Libyan brigade sent to dislodge the group remains camped on the outskirts, visibly afraid to enter and allowing the extremists to come and go as they please.

title: Ladders
description: The latest incarnations of tone of the oldest designs in the world continue to marry usefulness with beauty of form.

title: Bronx Man Accused of Shining Laser Beam at Planes
description: The weapon was a black tubular laser, small enough to slip into the front pocket of a pair of pants.

title: As Election Day Nears, Benjamin Netanyahu Talks of a Worldwide Effort to Defeat Him
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel told supporters that there was a tremendous effort, worldwide, to topple him as Israelis head to the polls next week, according to an audiotape broadcast Tuesday on Army Radio.

title: An Eyewitness
description: Claude Sittons reporting during the civil rights struggle was frequently that of an eyewitness. On April 3, 1963, he was in Greenwood, Miss., when white police officers began pulling people out of a line of marchers seeking to register to vote and shoving them into a police bus.

title: Irate Democrats Denounce G.O.P on Iran Letter
description: WASHINGTON  Angry Democrats on Tuesday excoriated the open letter sent to Irans leadership warning about a nuclear agreement with President Obama, but the 47 Republicans who signed it remained defiant and unapologetic, saying the president should have seen their opposition coming.

description: Cheerful blossoms to brighten the day.

description: PARIS  The Interior Ministry of Spain said on Tuesday that the police had arrested two men and dismantled a radical Islamist cell that had been plotting an attack in Spain or in neighboring countries.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

description: Senator Ted Cruz drew on familiar themes Tuesday in a speech before a gathering of firefighters, though in a more subdued tone and at a lower volume than during his recent appearance at the Conservative Political Action Conference.

title: Despite Growth, Latin America Struggles With Chronic Poverty
description: Roughly 70 million people in Latin America and the Caribbean managed to earn enough to rise above the poverty line between 2003 and 2012, a period of sustained economic growth that brought prosperity to many corners of the hemisphere and narrowed the regions inequality gap.

description: Senator Lindsey Graham, discussing life in the Senate compared to that of firefighters, and noting that in my business, its hard to find rewards.

description: The French president, the chief executive of the channel TF1, the junior sports minister and the boyfriend of one of the Olympians killed in the helicopter crash in Argentina spoke on Tuesday.

title: Kids Like Me Deserve Something Special. The Risks of Overvaluing Our Young.
description: Before we begin the requisite discussion of this weeks research into how other parents are making grave mistakes in the raising of their children, please answer the following questions. You can respond with completely true, sort of true, not really true and not at all true.

title: The Fall by Petite Noir
description: The video for The Fall, by the musician Petite Noir, whose EP The King of Anxiety is out now.

title: Mystery of the Propeller-Bladed Subway Apparatus
description: Our subway system is chock full of puzzles.

title: As Two Oklahoma Students Are Expelled for Racist Chant, Sigma Alpha Epsilon Vows Wider Inquiry
description: NORMAN, Okla.  As the University of Oklahoma expelled two students Tuesday for leading a racist song that sparked outrage across the country, the fraternity involved said it would investigate incidents at other campuses as it faced questions over the chants use by members at other universities.

title: Iraqi and Shiite Forces Seize Large Parts of Tikrit From Islamic State
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi security forces and allied Shiite militias seized large parts of Tikrit on Tuesday, amid reports that most of the Islamic State militants battling to hold the city had begun retreating, security officials said.

title: A Spare, Minimalist R&B Video Influenced by Marina Abramovic
description: Its been two and a half years since the debut single Till We Ghosts introduced the world to the crooning, beat-heavy brand of indie rock proffered by the Belgian-born, Cape Town-raised, London-based musician Yannick Ilunga, who records as Petite Noir. Since then, hes collaborated with Mos Def, signed with the U.K. label Domino, opened for Solange and been featured on her Saint Heron compilation album. But Ilunga would tell you his most notable achievement to date is coining the term Noirwave, a new, ideologically influenced artistic genre that identifies as African first, and everything else second. The term African music is so overused, Ilunga says, to the point that when some people say it, it just sounds cheesy. Noirwave was always meant to include clothing, art, photography, music obviously  all types of things. Its taking the Africa that we know, turning it upside down and bringing people a new black. Solange is super Noirwave. So is Beyonc. Noirwave is pop culture  its coming, but right now its just boiling.

title: Police Killing of Unarmed Georgia Man Leaves Another Town in Disbelief
description: CHAMBLEE, Ga.  Witnesses to the fatal police shooting of an African-American man gave differing accounts Tuesday. But they all ended with a similar question: Why was it necessary to shoot Anthony Hill, a 27-year-old Air Force veteran who was naked and unarmed?

title: Sri Lanka Grants Bail to Tamil Rights Activist
description: NEW DELHI  A Sri Lankan judge granted bail to a prominent Tamil activist on Tuesday, in a case widely seen as an important test of the new governments willingness to reconcile with the countrys disaffected minorities.

title: Caesarism Without Apology
description: In two recent posts touching onAmericas increasing constitutional decadence, I strove (no doubt only semi-successfully) for evenhandedness, acknowledging the extent to which President Obamas expansive use of executive power is part of a larger trend, shapedby structural forces, etc., and concedingas well the particular challenges of dealing with a Congress thats both incompetent (particular the Republican caucus in the House) and all-too-eager to abdicate its constitutional responsibilities. Thispost, though, will be more straightforwardly partisan and anti-Obama, because I think whatDan Pfeiffer, the outgoing White House advisor, has to sayto Jonathan Chait in this exit interview deserves thescorn of anyone who cares about limits on presidential power.

title: At Funeral for Cardinal Egan, Who Didnt Want Spotlight, Focus Is on the Church
description: In a celebration steeped in ancient tradition and replete with ceremony, Cardinal Edward M. Egan was remembered on Tuesday for a simple virtue: his great love for the church.

title: Inside the Kleiner Perkins Trial: Reporters Notebook
description: During the dot-com boom, reporters could actually gain access to the big stars. I remember Larry Page, at a moment when Google was already revolutionizing search, inviting me to come down and hang out. This time around, Silicon Valley is savvier. Interviews are strictly promotional, and woe unto the writer that ventures off topic.

title: 86 Percent of Health Law Enrollees Receive Subsidies, White House Says

title: Empire Soundtrack: Hip-Hop Thats Ambiguously Modern
description: On last weeks episode of Empire, the Lyon familys music-based company, Empire Enterprises, was under siege. A rival label, Creedmoor, was trying to poach its artists, threatening to undermine Empires coming initial public offering. In the companys conference room, a screen displayed financial information as the tug of war unfolded. Projected revenue: $343,546,002 for Empire; $491,546,002 for Creedmoor.

title: Tribeca Film Festival Announces Immersive Programming
description: Instead of 3-D glasses, the Tribeca Film Festival will add blindfolds to its movie accessory list. At least thats the case with one interactive documentary project that is part of the innovation programming the festival announced Tuesday. The project is called Door Into the Dark, and uses audio and locative technology to take blindfolded participants through an immersive experience of feeling lost. The project is one of five in the festivals Storyscapes program, which employs virtual reality and other means to tell cinematic stories in unusual ways.

title: Emily Weiss: the Beauty Guru for Millennials
description: PARIS  As editors ascended the stairs to the Chlo show at the Grand Palais on Sunday, Emily Weiss was already on her way down.

title: Staging vs. Style: At Chanel, Saint Laurent and Valentino, Which Comes First?
description: PARIS  How much does context matter when it comes to fashion?

title: Review: In The Man of the Hour, Back-Room Politics Is Ageless
description: George H. Broadhursts 1906 political drama, The Man of the Hour, a long-running Broadway hit in its day, has good bones, and the Metropolitan Playhouse does it justice in its current revival. Inspired by the historic cronyism of Tammany Hall, the story, about the temptations facing an honest politician, runs the risk of resembling a civics lecture, which the production nimbly sidesteps. The plays lessons bear repeating, and the actors infuse them with life.

title: Assistant Director Convicted of Manslaughter in Midnight Rider Death
description: LOS ANGELES  Hillary Schwartz, the first assistant director on the film Midnight Rider, on Tuesday was convicted of involuntary manslaughter and criminal trespass in the death of Sarah Jones, who was killed by a freight train last year while working on the film. A clerk of the court in Wayne County, Ga., where Ms. Schwartz had a bench trial on Tuesday morning, confirmed the convictions and said that Ms. Schwartz was sentenced to 10 years probation and will pay a $5,000 fine.

title: Date of Armenias Birth, Given in 5th Century, Gains Credence
description: Movses Khorenatsi, a historian in the fifth century, wrote that his native Armenia had been established in 2492 B.C., a date usually regarded as legendary though he claimed to have traveled to Babylon and consulted ancient records. But either he made a lucky guess or he really did gain access to useful data, because a new genomic analysis suggests that his date is entirely plausible.

title: Two Books Look Back at Fashions Messy Choreography
description: Fifteen years into the new millennium, fashion shows tend to be crisply executed mass-marketed affairs, with invitations beamed to electronic calendars, and the events themselves often occurring in black or white boxes and streamed live on iThings from Peoria to St. Petersburg.

title: At White Oak Pastures, Grass-Fed Beef Is Only the Beginning
description: BLUFFTON, Ga.  Here in the cab of a muddy pickup truck, with a stubby Ranch Hand rifle on the console and windows so fogged its hard to see the ruts in the pasture, you tend to believe anything the driver says.

title: Deployment Is Confusing for Children, Which Makes Children Hard on Parents
description: I recently read somewhere that doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results was not the definition of insanity, but rather, the definition of parenting. The sentiment perfectly sums up bedtime with our 2-year-old: routinely insane. Weve cried it out and cuddled it out. Weve bathed, read and rocked our way into different routines, to no avail. Weve finally settled on good enough which consists of a bath, a story, only two trips to the bathroom, bedtime prayers and a hug and a kiss. In my sons defense, I was (and, lets be honest, am still) the same way. The struggle is real. I dont like going to bed any more than he does.

title: Bolivian Clubs Are at Home in Thin Air
description: Tucked tightly among the high-rises of the Miraflores district of La Paz, Bolivia, the Hernando Siles stadium is one of those great South American dust bowls drenched in character. Yet few stadiums anywhere can match its home-field advantage: Nestled in the Andes at a lung-tightening 11,932 feet, it brings soccer to the very roof of the Americas.

title: Glitz and Glamour at Iris van Herpen
description: There are a lot of things, a lot of shiny things, happening, the makeup artist Inge Grognard says of Iris van Herpens fall 2015 collection. For todays show at the Palais de Tokyo, Grognard balanced out the glitz with barely there makeup, evening out models skin tones, filling in brows and covering up any redness in their lips and cheeks. The hair, on the other hand, was full-on gloss. The stylist Maria Kovacs created what she describes as a futuristic elegance look by pulling hair into a tight ponytail at the nape of the neck, pinning it into a V-shaped twist (to mimic the angles in van Herpens designs) and using layers and layers of hairspray for a slick, lacquered finish. It caught the light on the catwalk in the same way as the models bare arms and legs, which were brushed with a subtle blue and pearlescent sparkle.

title: Target Cutting 1,700 Jobs, Mainly at Headquarters in Minneapolis
description: Target announced in a filing on Tuesday that it was laying off 1,700 employees as part of a cost-cutting drive at its Minneapolis headquarters, the first in a wave of job cuts expected at the retailer over the next two years.

description: The presidency of the Metropolitan Museum of Art is a fund-raising and administrative position that does not require a background in art. But in choosing Daniel H. Weiss to help lead the nations largest art museum, the Met has decided to combine both business acumen and scholarly credentials.

title: Review: Ratmanskys The Sleeping Beauty Has Premiere in California
description: COSTA MESA, Calif.  The wealth of detail that informs American Ballet Theaters new production of The Sleeping Beauty brings to life a classic that has often gone stale. Much more, however, is also achieved: The old ballet has become transformed into something full of surprises. Though the production, staged by Alexei Ratmansky, Ballet Theaters artist in residence, is based on deep research into the ballets original 1890 production and various records from 1890 to 1906, it doesnt feel quaint or dated or archival. It feels loved: The characters and their often unfamiliar steps glow from within.

title: Political Jabs in Ink at Library of Congress
description: The Library of Congress will showcase the power and punch of the political cartoon in the exhibition Pointing Their Pens: Herblock and Fellow Cartoonists Confront the Issues, which opens March 21. Herblock (Herbert L. Block, who died in 2001) was the chief editorial cartoonist for The Washington Post for more than half a century. His work forms the core of the exhibition, which focuses on six subjects that inspired some of his most memorable cartoons: World War II, the McCarthy era, the Cold War, the Vietnam War, Richard M. Nixon and the Middle East. Each will have two cartoons by Herblock (including one, above, from 1968) and three by his contemporaries. The library has more than 14,000 Herblock drawings, donated by the Herb Block Foundation in 2002. The exhibition, in the librarys Graphic Arts Galleries, will also draw on the Art Wood Collection of Cartoon and Caricature, which has more than 17,000 original editorial cartoons, donated to the library in 2001. An online version of the exhibition will be available at loc.gov/exhibits/.

title: Review: In Of Horses and Men, the Animals Often Walk on Two Legs

Life revolves around mares and stallions in the films windswept terrain, but the animals orblike eyes direct us to the many follies of their owners, who are driven by petty desires and, occasionally, courage.

title: Getting the Whole World Online

And while progress has been made in recent years, most of the worlds 7.2 billion people still do not have access to the Internet.

title: Boston Marathon Bombing Jury Sees a Bullet-Pocked Message
description: BOSTON  As he lay inside a homeowners boat in Watertown, Mass., five nights after the Boston Marathon bombing, prosecutors say, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev scrawled in pencil his justification for having taken part in the attack: avenging the deaths of Muslims at the hands of the United States, and his desire to reach the heavenly paradise that he thought his brother, who died hours earlier, had already attained.

title: FergusonCity Manager Cited in Justice Department Report Resigns
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The city manager of Ferguson, whom a Department of Justice report blamed for overseeing the financially driven policies that led to widespread discrimination and questionable conduct by the police and the courts here, has agreed to resign. The announcement came during a City Council meeting on Tuesday, about a week after the scathing Justice Department report was released.

title: Christie, Defending Exxon Deal, Says Environmental Damage Will Be Repaired

Chris Christie on Tuesday defended his administrations decision to settle a multibillion-dollar pollution suit against Exxon Mobil Corporation for a fraction of what the state had originally sought, saying the $225 million deal was on top of the companys obligation to clean up the damage it caused.

title: The Snow Is Melting! But What a Mess It Left Behind

It would be understandable, after this winter that seemed delivered from deepest Siberia, if all city dwellers walked around with upturned faces, basking in the suns rays. But the last throes of winter require having a care for what lies underfoot.

description: Roughly two years ago, when Darrelle Revis was traded by the Jets to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, he insisted he did not want to leave.

title: Review: Josephine and I, a Tribute Show by Cush Jumbo
description: When Cush Jumbo says she has fire inside her, you have no reason to doubt it. Portraying both title characters in Josephine and I, which opened on Tuesday night at Joes Pub at the Public Theater, Ms. Jumbo projects the kind of five-alarm charm that threatens to set rooms ablaze.

title: Getting Out of a Jam
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle by David Steinberg came out of a terrific thing that Michael Sharp/Rex Parker and a bunch of constructors did shortly after the devastation of Hurricane Sandy. Mr. Steinberg tells us the interesting story in his notes below, so I will get right to his puzzle.

title: Gamma Rays May Be Clue on Dark Matter
description: A small, newly discovered galaxy orbiting the Milky Way is emitting a surprising amount of electromagnetic radiation in the form of gamma rays, astronomers reported Tuesday. The finding may be the latest in a long string of cosmic false alarms, they said, or it might be that the mysterious dark matter that permeates the universe is finally showing its face.

title: In Spain, Rapid Rise of Leftists Has a Familiar Ring
description: MADRID  He has promised to restructure the debt. He has said it is time to change laws that allow the rich to keep stealing from us. He has vowed that Brussels cannot threaten us and that we dont want any more heads of government who obey and dont negotiate.

title: Colombia President Halts Bombing of Rebel Camps
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  In a move to accelerate peace talks with the countrys largest rebel force, President Juan Manuel Santos of Colombia on Tuesday said he had ordered a halt to bombings of the groups encampments.

title: Albinos Are Being Hunted in Eastern Africa, U.N. Says
description: The United Nations said Tuesday that at least 15 people with albinism, including children, had been attacked  and in some cases abducted, killed and dismembered  over the past six months in eastern Africa, where albino parts are prized by practitioners of witchcraft. Prince Zeid Raad Zeid al-Hussein, the United Nations high commissioner for human rights, said in astatement that he was horrified at the stunningly vicious attacks, which have surged in Tanzania, Malawi and Burundi. Albinism, a hereditary condition, has been linked by researchers to inbreeding. In Tanzania there is one case per 1,400 people, versus one in 20,000 in the West. The persecution of albinos has been a longstanding problem in the region. Witch doctors will pay as much as $75,000 for a complete set of albino body parts, according to alandmark report from the Red Cross.

title: Maple Leafs Season, Like Fans Discarded Jerseys, Lands in a Heap
description: TORONTO  In the final stretch of a season that flirted with promise but has degenerated into a sideshow, the Maple Leafs arrived here last week for a rare three-game homestand.

title: Patz Trial Jury, in Blow to Defense, Is Told Suspect Was a Longtime Cocaine Addict
description: The man on trial for the murder of Etan Patz used cocaine for two decades and had several physical fights with his wife over money used to buy drugs, a psychiatrist testified on Tuesday.

title: Teacher in Pornography Case Asked Students for Photos, Prosecutors Say
description: The teacher and debate coach at the Bronx High School of Science who was charged last week with enticing teenage boys he contacted online to send him nude or suggestive photographs also asked his own students for photos, prosecutors said during a bail hearing on Tuesday.

title: Senate Vote Expected Next Week on Attorney General Nominee
description: Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, said Tuesday that he expected to bring the nomination of Loretta E. Lynch to be attorney general to the Senate floor for a vote next week. Despite being approved by the Senate Judiciary Committee last month, the nomination of Ms. Lynch, the United States attorney for the Eastern District of New York, has been held up in Congress by Republicans who are angry with President Obama over his executive action on immigration. Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the minority leader, said Tuesday that in his time in the Senate, no one Ive seen is more qualified in experience, education, background and character than Loretta Lynch. He added, Its time that we move forward on this.

title: Yankees Hire Hideki Matsui as Adviser to General Manager
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  Hideki Matsui broke a barrier of sorts when he became the first slugger from Japan to have a successful major league career. Now he is embarking on a new career as an executive with the Yankees.

title: Florence Arthaud, Celebrated Solo Sailor, Dies at 57 in Helicopter Crash
description: Florence Arthaud, the French sailor who died at 57 in a helicopter crash in Argentina on Monday along with nine others, including two French Olympians, was celebrated by the French yachting world as the only woman to have won the Route du Rhum, a grueling solo trans-Atlantic race.

title: Justified Recap: Seeing Ghosts
description: Season 6, Episode 8, Dark as a Dungeon

title: Rangers Cut Islanders Lead on Ice, and in Standings
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  In a jammed Nassau Coliseum packed with the usual tapestry of Islanders and Rangers colors, the longtime rivals and their confluence of fans met Tuesday for their 126th regular-season clash on Long Island.

title: St. Francis Falls Short of Earning First N.C.A.A. Bid
description: The gold ball was at one end of the court, and the St. Francis of Brooklyn players  stunned, drained, devastated  were at the other, walking quickly out of the arena, toward a quiet locker room and another year of longing.

title: D.I.Y. Principles
description: Can I shop at a store whose values I dont support?

title: Recipes From the Ranch in Malibu Bring the Wellness Spa Into Home Kitchens
description: Theres something to be said about wellness being the epitome of true luxury, what with a single, precious green juice costing more than a 12-pack of soda and monthly gym memberships averaging the price of a standard cable subscription. And for the truly elite, spa retreats  fitness-oriented getaways that strip both calories and stressors from ones system, jamming in meditative hikes and vegan, gluten-free everything in their place  are the ultimate spring break destination. One of the most expensive such programs is the Ranch at Live Oak in Malibu, where the likes of Bobbi Brown, Kate Spade and, just last month, Mandy Moore and Minka Kelly escape to detox, reset and rejuvenate. Now, though, the Ranchs culinary secrets are available to the masses in their first, self-titled cookbook. Cue the spring spa staycations!

title: Sporty Suits and Stripes for Spring
description: Among the on-trend set of luxe sportswear in stores now for spring is a beach-ready lot of athletic separates and accessories that are as practical  for a fast game of volleyball or a leisurely dip in the pool  as they look. Loud rugby stripes freshen up sporty shorts and sandals. And with the addition of a terry cloth tunic, toweling off and covering up can all be done in a chic flash.

title: A Chefs Guide to Eating in Paris
description: For a certain set of fashion editors, deciding which brasseries, bistros and cafes to visit during Paris Fashion Week is second only to tracking down their seat assignments. And this season, the new restaurant in the recently opened La Rserve hotel, Le Gabriel, is attracting attention and fashionable appetites thanks to its chef, Jrme Banctel.

title: Word of the Day | molt
description: molt  \molt\  verb and noun

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (BBC America) BROADCHURCH After learning that her husband, Joe (Matthew Gravelle), murdered Danny Latimer, Detective Sgt. Ellie Miller (Olivia Colman, above) returns to Broadchurch to hear what she assumes will be his guilty plea. But then he declares his innocence, forcing a courtroom battle that will re-examine the case. Detective Alec Hardy (David Tennant), meanwhile, finds himself embroiled in an unsolved murder and disappearance from his past. Season 2 is, from the start, an entirely messier, more contingent affair, enjoyable in a different and, to me, more appealing way, Mike Hale wrote in The New York Times. Having Joe plead not guilty enables Chris Chibnall, the shows creator and writer, to keep all the central characters of Season 1 around without the usual implausibility of plunging the town into a new mystery. Its also a device to get Ms. Colmans Ellie Miller back into the center of the story  where she once again steals the show. Shes a wonderful comic actress, and now even more than before Mr. Tennant is her straight man  Miller has had it, and Hardy has to absorb all of her (amusing) petulance and disgust.

title: With Plan to Walk Across DMZ, Women Aim for Peace in Korea
description: UNITED NATIONS  It was the women who helped end the bitter political and ethnic strife that ravaged Northern Ireland in the 1970s. It was the women who said enough to the atrocities in Liberia, peacefully resolving a civil conflict there more than a decade ago. Now, women are turning their attention to the divided Korean Peninsula, where a technical state of war has endured for more than 62 years.

title: What to Expect on the Last Day of Paris Fashion Week
description: What to expect on the eighth day of Paris Fashion Week? Honestly, not a whole heck of a lot. Even God rested on the seventh day, but the French federation, having rather scheduled a mad dash from Chanel to McQueen and points between yesterday, is now left with a dot dot dot.

title: Flight Attendant Sues Korean Air and Former Executive in Nut Rage Case
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A Korean Air flight attendant who said she was abused by an airline vice president in what became internationally known as a case of  nut rage has filed suit in New York against the airline and the former executive, who is serving a prison sentence in South Korea.

description: A fire broke out in a high-rise apartment building overlooking Central Park late on Tuesday, sending heavy smoke into the building and the night sky as dozens of firefighters worked to put it out, according to the Fire Department.

title: Tougher Laws for Safer Streets
description: Lets acknowledge at the outset that this is New York City were talking about, not Mayberry. The code on our streets is pre-emptive aggression. Crowds and cars mix and move to a kind of intuitive, propulsive rhythm that can be terrifying to tourists but somehow is efficient and relatively safe.

title: Is It Sheldon Adelsons World?
description: The symbolism was too powerful to ignore. As anyone who watched Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus speech last week in Congress knows, one of the people prominently seated in the House gallery was the casino magnate Sheldon Adelson, a primary financial backer of both the Republican Party and Netanyahu. As The Washington Posts Colby Itkowitz reported, at one point Adelsons wife, Miriam, accidentally knocked her purse off the House gallery railing and it hit Representative Brad Ashford, a Nebraska Democrat seated below. The Post noted that Adelson had given $5 million to the G.O.P.s Congressional Leadership Fund super PAC, which had spent $35,000 in a failed effort to defeat Ashford in his 2014 race against Representative Lee Terry. Ashford later joked to The Omaha World-Herald: I wish Id opened the purse. Do you think she carries cash?

description: To the Editor:

title: Orthodox Jews and New Yorks Circumcision Rule

title: Feeding Kids Well
description: How the School Nutrition Association became an ally of what you might call the let them eat cake forces is a long story. What matters is that if, like the association, youre taking a stand against the 2010 Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act  from a food perspective, among the two or three most progressive pieces of legislation of the Obama administration  you are simply on the wrong side. Youve pitted yourself not only against better nutrition for current school kids but, even more important, against better nutrition for future students and adults. The School Nutrition Associations position may not be the equivalent of the American Diabetes Association insisting that, say, we serve Coke at all meals, but its in that ballpark.

title: A Sensible Bill on Medical Marijuana
description: Three senators, two Democrats and a Republican, introduced a bill on Tuesday that would allow patients to use marijuana for medical purposes in states where it is legal, without fear of federal prosecution for violating narcotics laws.

title: Memento Mori
description: I would not have chosen A.L.S. at the Pick Your Disease store, but there are worse things that can happen and worse ways for a life to end. The very fact that it was happening to me and not to my family was itself a relief. Navigating ones own pain or fear is much easier than navigating a loved ones.

title: The Carnage of Barrel Bombs in Syria
description: ALEPPO, Syria  MARWAN was on the operating table when the lights blinked and fizzled out. I turned on the headlamp I wear for situations like these, but it flickered, indicating low batteries. The nurse to my left pulled her cellphone from her pocket and turned it on, creating the only light in the pitch-black basement. Others in the room followed suit with their phones, shining the devices at the wound and producing just enough light to allow me to finish repairing the little boys broken body.

description: By planting productive native species, we can create life.

title: The Chickadees Guide to Gardening
description: OXFORD, Pa.  I GREW up thinking little of plants. I was interested in snakes and turtles, then insects and, eventually, birds. Now I like plants. But I still like the life they create even more.

description: William N. Breger, who designed what may be the oddest synagogue in New York, has died at 92. The TriBeCa Synagogue was not his wackiest idea, however. That would have been a circular, automated, Guggenheim-like supermarket.

description: If the best sacred architecture intimates the presence of a higher power, the G-d of the TriBeCa Synagogue is a luminous and soft-spoken one.

description: How often do you read or post in anonymous online social media forums? Why do you think they are so popular? Do you think that kind of online anonymity can be dangerous? Why or why not?

description: WASHINGTON  Anyone who has tried to pry information from the federal government may have been surprised on Tuesday by Hillary Rodham Clintons assertion that in all her emails in four years as secretary of state, she never strayed into the classified realm.

title: Brother Industries Offers to Acquire British Printer Maker for $1.55 Billion
description: LONDON  Domino Printing Sciences said on Wednesday that Brother Industries of Japan had offered to acquire the printer maker in a deal that values the company at 1.03 billion pounds, or about $1.55 billion.

title: A Simple Flashcard Test to Detect Concussions
description: An easy, two-minute vision test administered on the sidelines after a young athlete has hit his or her head can help to reliably determine whether the athlete has sustained a concussion, according to a new study of student athletes, some as young as 5.

description: Good morning on this fine Wednesday.

description: Patrick Maxwell is a former Marine who returned to Iraq in 2014 to fight with Kurdish forces against the Islamic State.

title: Unsettled at Home, Veterans Volunteer to Fight ISIS
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Last fall, Patrick Maxwell, a 29-year-old Iraq war veteran now selling real estate in this bustling city, saw something in news footage of Islamic fighters in Iraq that he never saw as an infantry Marine there: the enemy.

title: Can I Shop at Hobby Lobby?
description: I am an inveterate crafter  I have a crafting room  but ever since the Hobby Lobby decision, I have studiously avoided its stores despite my deep and abiding love of the place. I know there are some decent retail substitutes out there, but none that can match the giant warehouse of glitter and balsa wood that is Hobby Lobby. Would it be ethical to shop there if I were to make a donation to Planned Parenthood every time I did, sort of like buying ethical carbon offsets? If so, what percentage of my total purchase price should I be donating? NAME WITHHELD, AUSTIN, TEX.

title: My Saga, Part 2
description: In Part 1 of My Saga, which was published March 1, the Norwegian novelist Karl Ove Knausgaard journeyed from his home in Sweden to Canada, with the intention of tracing the Viking trail from LAnse aux Meadows, the first European settlement in North America, into the United States and westward to Alexandria, Minn., site of a possibly fraudulent Viking runestone. After several setbacks, and with just days to spare before he had to catch his return flight to Sweden, Knausgaard met the photographer Peter van Agtmael in Cleveland, and the two of them drove to Detroit.

title: Cruising for All Tastes
description: The efforts of cruise lines to meet consumer demand has exploded into an expansive array of vacation options, from intimate yacht-like departures to floating family-friendly theme parks. The 63 cruise company members of the Cruise Line Industry Association estimate passenger volume will grow to 23 million this year, up nearly a million over 2014. Most of the traffic circulates in the Caribbean, but the following trends signal growing wanderlust among cruisers.

title: Reconstructing Marco Polos Journey East
description: In 1269, Niccol Polo returned home to Venice with his brother Maffeo, after an absence of 17 years trading with a confederation of Mongol tribes who had just become the new lords of Southern Russia and several lands beyond.

title: Today in Politics: Both Sides See Political Advantages on Iran
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where Republicans are saying Hillary Rodham Clintons meeting with reporters raised as many questions as it answered, lawmakers need to read their bills more carefully, and President Obama is focusing on domestic issues while Congress locks horns over Iran. For Republicans, at least, an old-fashioned foreign policy dispute is just what was needed to bring the party together.

title: Morning Agenda: Citigroups Resurgence
description: CITIGROUPS RESURGENCE | Seven years after Citigroup teetered on the brink, the banks traders and investment bankers have come roaring back, Peter Eavis writes in DealBook. The banks resurgence on Wall Street, which has involved acquiring huge amounts of derivatives, comes as many of its rivals pull back in the face of new regulations intended to make the financial system safer. But even as the bank has surged ahead, it has not trumpeted its comeback. Instead, its most senior executives have largely emphasized streamlining operations that have little to do with Wall Street, like agreeing to sell a unit that focuses on subprime loans.

title: In Era of Email, Some Senators Do Just Fine Without It
description: WASHINGTON  No single emoji seemed quite adequate to capture the collective flip-out over the admission by Senator Lindsey Graham that he has never, ever sent an email.

title: Early in 2016 Race, Clintons Toughest Foe Appears to Be the News Media
description: With no other powerful Democrats likely to run against her, Hillary Rodham Clintons toughest adversary for her partys presidential nomination in 2016 has now become clear. It is an opponent that challenged her in the early 1980s over her use of her maiden name  and was hectoring her again on Tuesday over her use of personal email for State Department business.

title: Simon Callow Will Be Part of Brits Off Broadway Festival

title: Exporting Europes Stagnation
description: Watch that plunging euro! Actually, its good news for Europe. European growth numbers have been better lately, and the weak euro  which makes EZ manufacturing and other tradables more competitive  is surely a large part of the explanation. Not so good for Japan or the US. But how should we think about this?

title: Boerum Hill, Brooklyn: Urban Energy, Brownstone Charm
description: Boerum Hill, a comfortable, brick-and-brownstone neighborhood just south of Downtown Brooklyn, has long been a popular hunting ground for Brooklyn buyers looking to bag one of the areas coveted 19th-century townhouses. In 2005, less than an hour after a section of a ceiling collapsed onto a childs bed during an open house at a Bergen Street townhouse, offers began rolling in, setting off a bidding war that concluded with a $1.68 million sale (the asking price was $1.595 million).

description: Google is offering a new kind of data storage service  and revealing its cloud computing strategy against Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure.
