description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi government forces and allied Shiite militias began consolidating control over most of the city of Tikrit on Wednesday, declaring they were on their way to a strategically and emotionally significant victory in their nine-day offensive against Islamic State militants there.

title: Daily Report: These Politicians Have No Email Problem, Because They Never Send One
description: The news that Hillary Rodham Clinton used a private email address during her time as secretary of state has cast a light on the email quirks of politicians in recent days  and the fact that a small circle of members of Congress who shape 21st-century policy and legislation but do not actually send or receive email, Ashley Parker writes.

title: Criminal Trials Rose Sharply in Chinas Far West in 2014, Group Says
description: BEIJING  The top court in Xinjiang, the vast western region of China troubled by ethnic violence, has posted statistics online showing that criminal trials there increased 40 percent last year over 2013, according to an analysis released on Wednesday by the Dui Hua Foundation, a human rights advocacy group based in the United States.

title: Imperiled Foxes on California Islands May Come Off Endangered List
description: Four endangered subspecies of fox on the northern Channel Islands off the California coast have recovered so well over the past 11 years that the Fish and Wildlife Service is announcing Wednesday that it is starting to consider taking them off the endangered list.

title: San Diego Opera Names New Director
description: The San Diego Opera, which is reinventing itself as a streamlined, more affordable company after nearly folding last year because of money troubles, announced Wednesday that its next general director would be someone who has shown that opera can succeed on a smaller scale: David Bennett, the executive director of Gotham Chamber Opera in New York.

title: U.S. to Give Ukraines Military an Additional $75 Million in Nonlethal Aid
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Wednesday that it would provide another $75 million in nonlethal aid to Ukraines military. It also imposed sanctions against a handful of pro-Russian separatists and others blamed for fomenting the civil war that has torn apart Ukraines eastern regions.

title: A Manners Manifesto
description: For 4,000 years, humans have implored one another to mind their manners. I am personally invested in the crusade for two reasons. First, my brother and I were raised by a man who, as a child, was sent from the table hungry if he so much as slouched. At my own table growing up, when we small savages a) failed to put our napkins in our laps; b) ate before everyone was served; c) served ourselves first; d) opened our mouths while chewing; e) moved our forks from the left to the right hand; f) ate with our hands; g) failed to say please, thank you or excuse me; h) put our elbows on the table; i) did not ask permission to stand; or j) failed to eat soup properly (a nearly impossible task, requiring always spooning away, sipping noiselessly while sitting bolt upright, obtaining any final spoonfuls by a discreet tip of the bowl), we were ordered to push back from the table and contemplate our philistinism for several monstrous minutes before we could return, rehabilitated, to try again.

title: How It Played: The Tabloids on Hillary Clinton

description: At 7:32 this morning, a traffic alert went out on the Breaking News Network, which sends out notifications from police and fire scanners.

description: A vegetarian diet, especially one that includes fish, significantly reduces the risk of colorectal cancer, a large new study reports.

title: Official Raises Doubts on Confession in Nemtsov Case
description: MOSCOW  A member of the Kremlins advisory council on human rights said on Wednesday that the main suspect in the shooting death of a high-profile opposition figure was most likely forced to confess under duress, and that his two cousins in detention had been tortured.

title: 1915: British Again Sweep Forward
description: LONDON  Following up their splendid advance near La Basse, in the course of which they carried the entire village of Neuve-Chapelle, the British forces have pressed on, driving the disorganized enemy before them, until the only Germans left over an area of a mile and a half to the east of the town are the dead and wounded. The advance is one of the most extensive that has been made by the British since the long siege of the trenches began. That the Germans were completely demoralized by the onslaught at several points is indicated by the comparatively small return fire that was offered.  The New York Herald, European Edition, March 12, 1915

title: Charting Clean-Energy Paths in New York and Beyond
description: On Thursday morning*, we held a Google Hangout, for The Great New York Power Shift  Transitioning to a Low Carbon Future  a discussion of New Yorks energy choices through 2050.

description: At a time of urbanization and connectivity, rodeo and ranching may seem anachronistic, but to the Wright family, they represent the present and the future.

title: 1965: Rights Group Stages Sit-in
description: WASHINGTON  A group of civil-rights advocates today staged a six-hour sit-in demonstration in the White House. The demonstrators said they would remain there on a hunger strike until allowed to see the president. But at 6 p.m. tonight they were removed by police. The demonstrators, white and Negro, entered the building with one of the regular sightseeing tours. Presidential press secretary George E. Reedy said they got as far as the ground-floor hallway when suddenly they plopped to the floor and began chanting: We shall not be moved.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 12, 1965

title: The Future of The Times, as Seen by an N.Y.U. Class
description: Jay Rosen, who does lots of innovative things in his role as journalism professor at New York University, came up with a new wrinkle for the current semester: a whole class on the future of The New York Times.

title: The New West With the Wright Brothers
description: It was mid-July in Wyoming. Rusty and Ryder Wright, from the family of the best saddle-bronc riders in the world, looked at a sheet of paper taped to the wall outside a rodeo arena in Evanston.

title: The Curious Draw of the Battlefield
description: Once a year the streets of Philadelphia overflow with Marines, both active duty and veterans, celebrating the Marine Corps birthday on Nov. 10th. And it was in the City of Brotherly Love that I met a fellow Marine infantry veteran, Patrick Maxwell, last fall. We didnt speak with each other much, but he knew my wars were over. What I didnt know was that his werent.

title: Keep Calm: Kanye Wests Laptop Was Not Stolen, Spokesman Says
description: Somewhere, there is a laptop. It belongs to Kanye West. It probably has a lot of his songs on it. That much is true, or at least highly plausible.

title: Clinton Campaign Still Aimed at April Start, Supporters Say
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton received mixed reviews for her explanation of her use of a private email account while she was secretary of state. But people familiar with her preparations for a 2016 campaign for the White House pushed back against reports Wednesday morning suggesting that the timing of her announcement had changed as a result of the furor.

title: How to Improve Graduation Rates at Community Colleges
description: Community colleges are intended to be gateways to careers or to four-year colleges offering bachelors degrees.

title: Facts & Figures: The Health Care Savings Youre Not Seeing
description: According to a recent report by the Center for American Progress, the growth of health care costs in America is slowing  but individual employees arent seeing the benefits. Their costs continue to go up, as employers require them to pay a bigger percentage of their health expenses.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Louis Vuitton Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanott.

title: A.P. Sues State Department for Hillary Clintons Emails
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton has said that her work emails will be released in due time, but The Associated Press has filed a lawsuit to speed things up.

title: Homeless Former U.N.C. Player Balks at Efforts to Help Him
description: Ryan Hoffman, the former offensive lineman at North Carolina who is now homeless in Florida, is hard to find. I had spent weeks trying to connect with him for a column I wrote last week about his life after football. So when I received an outpouring of offers from people who wanted to help him, I knew it wouldnt be simple for those people to follow through.

title: Device Syncing: Call From Computers and Text From Tablets
description: RECENTLY, I sat next to a woman on a plane with a serious collection of devices: a laptop, a tablet, an iPhone, an Android phone and a BlackBerry. I made a comment to her about all her gadgets, and she sighed deeply and said, Why cant everything just be on all the gadgets, all the time?

title: Paris Fashion Week: Moncler Gamme Rouge Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Fans Petition BBC to Reinstate Top Gear Host Jeremy Clarkson
description: LONDON  A day after the BBC suspended Jeremy Clarkson, the host of the globally viewed car program Top Gear, because of a fracas with a producer, hundreds of thousands of fans rallied to his defense on Wednesday in an online petition seeking his reinstatement.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Moncler Gamme Rouge Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Fossil Tells of 520-Million-Year-Old Creature Like a Giant Lobster
description: A huge arthropod that lived 480 million years ago used spines on its head to filter seawater and to trap tiny particles of food. The lobsterlike animal, six feet long, is one of the earliest giant filter-feeder ever discovered, scientists reported in the journal Nature.

title: Former JPMorgan Executive Blythe Masters Joins Bitcoin-Related Start-Up
description: A prominent former executive at JPMorgan Chase has left the world of commodity trading for the virtual world of digital transactions.

title: Monty Python Mini-Festival at Tribeca
description: No shrubbery or other sacrifices will be need when the Tribeca Film Festival embarks on a quest next month to honor the 40th anniversary of Monty Python and the Holy Grail with special screenings and an appearance by the surviving members of the influential comedy troupe, festival organizers said Wednesday.

title: Italian Court Upholds Berlusconis Acquittal in Sex Case
description: ROME  Former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi has no shortage of legal woes. His conviction on tax fraud was upheld last year, costing him a seat in Parliament. He remains under investigation by one magistrate for witness tampering, while he is also on trial in Naples on charges of political corruption.

title: 36 Hours in Los Cabos, Mexico
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Los Cabos, Mexico, and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Los Cabos
description: Two towns, rowdy Cabo San Lucas to the west and quieter San Jos del Cabo to the east, bookend a 20-mile tourist corridor known as Los Cabos.

title: 36 Hours in Los Cabos, Mexico
description: Cancn meets San Diego on the southernmost tip of Mexicos Baja Peninsula where two towns, rowdy Cabo San Lucas to the west and quieter San Jos del Cabo to the east, bookend a booming 20-mile tourist corridor of lavish resorts, scenic golf courses and blond beaches. Collectively called Los Cabos, or just Cabo, the desert destination was upgraded in 2012 with newly paved roads and a new international airport terminal, much of it undone last fall by Hurricane Odile, the category-3 surprise that ravaged the region and stranded some 30,000 tourists. While evidence of the damage remains in construction crews and shorn palm trees, most of the resorts have reopened; two new golf courses, including the first from Tiger Woods, have debuted; and Delta Air Lines began seasonal direct flights from J.F.K. in December. Though margarita-inspired indolence rules the region, rent a car to explore the peninsulas less explicit charms, including surf breaks, organic farms, the Baja desert and a pair of art-centric colonial towns.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Miu Miu Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Miu Miu Fall/Winter 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Early Retirement in the N.F.L. and at Google, and the Paradox of Success
description: The news in business and sports has been filled with surprising early retirements this week. Four men stepping away from lucrative careers while in their prime show a curious paradox of success.

title: Privacy Pitfalls as Education Apps Spread Haphazardly
description: At school districts across the country, the chief technology officers responsible for safeguarding student data are tearing their hair out.

title: White House Deflects Questions on Clinton Emails
description: The White House on Wednesday parried a barrage of questions about Hillary Rodham Clintons use of a private email account and server during her time at the State Department, referring most of them to her team and other government agencies.

title: Seamus Heaney Work Wins Contest Honoring Irelands Poets and Its Past
description: DUBLIN  Since the days of the bards, when poets served as aides-de-camp to medieval chieftains here, Ireland has built a reputation as a birthing ground for legend and verse.

title: Endo Confirms Bid for Drug Maker Salix, Topping Offer From Valeant
description: Endo International, a big drug firm, has thrown a wrench into Valeant Pharmaceuticals plans to acquire Salix Pharmaceuticals, a maker of treatments for gastrointestinal disorders.

title: Turning Chores Into Habits
description: Entropy has attacked our chore chart. Left to its own devices, the tendency of any system is to descend into chaos, and after a month of inconsistent schedules, travel, snow days and vacation time, it was clear that our descent had more than begun. When we looked around after a particularly challenging bedtime at the end of February, we saw a kitchen full of dishes, homework strewn across the counter, unemptied lunch boxes, cat dishes filled but not set out for the cats and the coats and boots solidly obscuring the mudroom floor.

title: At Louis Vuitton, Alexander McQueen and Miu Miu: Romancing the Individual
description: PARIS  Farewell, autumn/winter. Crocuses are poking through the earth in the Bois du Boulogne, and the thaw has finally hit New York. Even in that bubble known as fashionland, the season has come to an end.

title: First Phillie Phanatic, Grooming Mascots of the Future
description: In the spring of 1978, a big furry green creature with a pot belly and a long snout appeared on a major-league baseball field in Philadelphia and forever raised the bar for the professional team mascot.

title: Reading The Times With Meg Wolitzer
description: Meg Wolitzer is a novelist whose most recent books are The Interestings and Belzhar, a novel for young adults.

title: Jets Acquire Ryan Fitzpatrick; Darrelle Revis Says Return Is Surreal
description: One day after the Jets brought home Darrelle Revis and officially acquired the big-play wide receiver Brandon Marshall, they addressed their need at the ever-troublesome quarterback position.

title: Armed Thieves in France Steal Jewels Worth Millions
description: PARIS  About 15 heavily armed thieves attacked two armored vans carrying jewels overnight on a highway connecting Paris and Lyon, stealing gems valued at about $9.7 million before vanishing, the police and news reports said on Wednesday.

title: Banks May Want to Consider Expiration Date for Top Job
description: Staying power in the corner suite isnt always what its cracked up to be.

title: Seeing Fashion Week With Actual Customers in Mind
description: PARIS  The morning after Hedi Slimane held his Saint Laurent show in the raucous dark of the Carreau du Temple in the Marais, Laura Vinroot Poole wanted to know one thing. Was that  and here she used a slang word for breast  flying out of her dress on purpose, or was it an accident? she asked of the model wearing Mr. Slimanes dramatically asymmetrical Look 54, which she had seen on Instagram.

title: Through the Critical Lens of the 2015 New York Fashion Film Festival
description: [Watch the video on Vimeo.]

title: Did Earths Anthropocene Age of Man Begin With the Globalization of Disease in 1610?
description: As regular readers know, scientists are in a bit of a tussle over what date marks the dawn of Earths age of us  a.k.a. the Anthropocene  even as other scientists and scholars question whether its hubris to think a geological epoch, as strictly defined, can result from human activity.

title: Strange but True
description: Heres one happy result of our nations new Common Core standards: A deluge of good nonfiction picture books are being published, thanks to the requirement that public elementary school teachers use a true balance of fiction and nonfiction literature in the classroom. This means children are getting more exposure to history, not from writers of textbooks or other dreary educational materials, but from picture-book authors and illustrators. In other words, from some of the most interesting, creative people around.

title: Hillary Clintons Email and the Challenges of Data Storage
description: The reason it is difficult to know exactly what happened with Hillary Clintons email during her time as secretary of state (aside from the fact that she has not provided a detailed technical accounting) boils down to this: A culture in which information technology is treated as a service from someone else made it less likely that Mrs. Clinton, her staff or even reporters would ask specific questions about it.

title: Signature Theaters Artistic Director to Depart
description: James Houghton, one of the leading figures in the Off Broadway theater world, is resigning after a quarter-century running the Signature Theater in New York.

title: Nielsen Charts Reach of Video Streaming
description: About two in five American households now subscribe to a video streaming service like Netflix, Amazon Prime or Hulu Plus, according to a new report from the media measurement company Nielsen that tracked the penetration of the digital offerings.

title: Delight or Dread as Euro Falls
description: PARIS  For Herv Montjotin, chief executive of the French trucking and logistics group Norbert Dentressangle, the euros steep plunge against the dollar could not be more welcome.

title: Ebola Outbreak Could Be Ended by Summer, U.N. Says
description: GENEVA  The Ebola outbreak that has claimed nearly 10,000 lives over the past 15 months could be halted by the summer, but only if international financial support is sustained, the World Health Organization said on Wednesday.

title: Readying to Run, Jeb Bush Severs More Business Ties
description: Jeb Bush has sold his stake in two businesses that he started after he was the governor of Florida, severing financial ties as he readies a likely presidential bid.

title: F.T.C. Sues DirecTV, Saying It Misled Consumers About Costs
description: The Federal Trade Commission is suing DirecTV, the nations largest provider of satellite television, saying it deceptively advertised costs of a two-year service promotion to consumers.

title: Family Denies Palestinian Killed by ISIS Was Spy
description: JERUSALEM  Mohamed Musallam can be seen in a video released Tuesday on his knees wearing the familiar orange jumpsuit of an Islamic State captive. Before he is shot in the head by a boy, he admits under obvious duress that he was an agent for the Israeli Mossad.

title: Smash Lives Again, in One-Night Bombshell Concert
description: It was a fictional musical in a failed television show. But now, at least for one starry night, it is coming to life.

title: Ferguson Police Chief, Thomas Jackson, Steps Down Amid Criticism
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The embattled police chief of Ferguson, the focus of bitter complaints of racial discrimination within his department that turned into national protests after one of his white officers fatally shot an unarmed black teenager last August, has stepped down, Mayor James Knowles III said Wednesday at a news conference.

title: From Langham, Less Expensive Hotels
description: Best known for its high-end Langham hotels, including the 1865-vintage Langham London, the Hong Kong-based Langham Hospitality Group plans to extend its appeal to a different, more middle-class customer with a new hotel brand, Cordis Hotels & Resorts, to be introducedin May.

title: Kerry Criticizes Republican Letter to Iranian Leaders on Nuclear Talks
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry sharply criticized a letter from Republican lawmakers to the leaders of Iran in testimony before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee on Wednesday, calling it misleading and irresponsible.

title: A Glass Museum
description: A new wing energizes the Corning Museum of Glass.

title: Known for a Dribble, God Shammgod Crosses Over to Teaching
description: With a name and a game few could forget, God Shammgod carved out his niche on New Yorks playground courts and later at Providence College. In 1997, after his sophomore season, he declared for the N.B.A. draft, a decision his father strongly opposed.

title: Bento Wants to Be Your App Matchmaker
description: If you are like most people, there are but two reasons you pick up your mobile phone. The first is when you want to do something specific, like send an email. The second is when you are bored. Nikhil Chandhok wants to figure out which one it is.

title: A DiCaprio Donation Kickstarts an Expedition and Film Seeking a Solitary Whale
description: After several years of planning and a nail-biting Kickstarter campaign that ended today, filmmakers Josh Zeman and Adrian Grenier have passed their $300,000 financial target, thanks to a $50,000 donation from the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation. (I made a donation, too, although it was a lot smaller!)

title: Kerry Criticizes Republican Letter
description: Secretary of State John Kerry criticized the letter 47 Senate Republicans sent to the leaders of Iran, saying that it contained erroneous assertions.

title: $15 Million Gift for Clark Art Institute
description: The Clark Art Institute in Williamstown, Mass., on Tuesday announced a $15 million gift  one of the largest donations in its history  to support the Clarks campus expansion and programs.

title: Emily Jenkinss A Fine Dessert, and More
description: Margaret Wise Brown firmly believed that home is where the heart is. For nearly 70 years, her classic bedtime story Goodnight Moon has lulled children to sleep with a picture of the warm comforts of home. But if the book is disarmingly heartfelt, it is also undeniably strange. It is set in a mysterious great green room where, page by page, the light grows more weirdly crepuscular. The rooms curious props include a comb, a brush and a bowl full of mush. Its most memorable line, Goodnight nobody, could have been written by Samuel Beckett. It is a brilliant childrens book, but its brilliance lies in its dreamlike oddity. Like a good witch, Brown weaves a kindly spell, and children succumb.

title: The Honest Truth and Wish Girl
description: The Honest Truth, a debut novel by Dan Gemeinhart, and Wish Girl, by Nikki Loftin, both involve kids trying to escape cancer treatment. Each novel features a main character who gets beaten up by other kids and an intense friendship between a boy and a girl. In both books we see children keeping secrets from adults, running away from home and facing nature with little preparation. What should you do when you see what may be your last chance  a potentially dangerous one  to defy your cancer and live the way you want? In these books the characters take that risk. Yet somehow theyre entirely different stories, The Honest Truth an adventure yarn about a boy and his dog, Wish Girl a quietly poetic story about psychological truths.

title: Echo, by Pam Muoz Ryan
description: So, the harmonica. We can probably all picture one in the hands of some 4-year-old, pressed to the childs lips as she makes a wheezy, buzzy racket. Or being played by a convict in an old jailhouse movie as he lies on his bunk. But its not a serious instrument, not something youd associate with real music. Or with words like magic, power or beauty.

title: Hold Tight, Dont Let Go, by Laura Rose Wagner
description: When we are uncertain that the ground beneath our feet will not rumble and shift and swallow us whole, even the very next minute carries with it looming doubt. This is one of the ways Haitians say goodbye: Demen si Dye vle  Tomorrow if God is willing. Tomorrow is not promised, and when it does come, with all its roils and jolts, kenbe fm, pa lage, hold tight, dont let go. That is the title of Laura Rose Wagners debut novel, in which such Haitian idioms abound. This coming-of-age story conveys the countrys deeply entwined faith and fear of the unknown through the eyes of a teenager named Magdalie Jean-Baptiste.

title: 2015: Rubio and Kerry Clash Over ISIS
description: Senator Marco Rubio, a Florida Republican, clashed with Secretary of State John Kerry over whether the United States strategy toward ISIS was influenced by the nuclear talks with Iran.

title: Miu Mius Spunky, Effortless (Dare We Say, Flirtatious) Ponytails
description: T shares the best hairstyles from the runways.

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Turkey, Israel, Iraq and Spain.

title: Global Movie Ticket Sales Rise 1% as China Surges
description: LOS ANGELES  The world movie box office was up 1 percent last year from 2013, but ticket sales in the United States and Canada fell about 5 percent as growth became concentrated in China, the Motion Picture Association of America said on Wednesday.

title: The Truth About Entitlements
description: As part of another project, I was looking at CBO historical budget data, and realized that you can summarize a lot about all those much-denounced entitlements with this figure:

title: March 11, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, Israel, Iraq and Spain.

title: Metropolitan Museum of Art Names an Architect for Its New Wing
description: Opting for a more subdued choice outside the galaxy of starchitects, the Metropolitan Museum of Art has selected David Chipperfield to design its new wing for modern and contemporary art, Thomas P. Campbell, the museums director and chief executive, announced on Wednesday.

title: Kelly Clarkson Hits No. 1
description: This week on the music charts, Kelly Clarkson scored her third No. 1 album and Mark Ronsons Uptown Funk is the top single for the 10th week in a row.

title: Review: Maureen McGovern at 54 Below, Feminism Through Pop
description: Goin to the chapel/and were gonna get married. So goes the triumphant proclamation by the Dixie Cups in Chapel of Love, their blissfully nave No. 1 hit in 1964. Sung by Maureen McGovern at 54 Below on Tuesday evening, it was the finale of a medley of six girl-group hits in her show Sing, My Sisters, Sing!, which celebrates female singers and songwriters.

title: Teenagers and Extremism: Investigating the ISIS Recruitment Pipeline
description: Overview |  Stories of young people leaving their families in places like Colorado, Minnesota, Britain and France, and making their way to join the Islamic State, a terrorist group also known as ISIS, have repeatedly made the news over the past several months.

title: When Values Disappear
description: Back in the 60s and 70s  which I, sad to say, actually remember  there was much talk about the disintegration of the black family and of African-American values more generally, and how that was the root cause of Americas poverty problem. And the social dysfunction was clearly real. But was it cause or effect? William Julius Wilson, in When Work Disappears, famously argued that it was a symptom: good jobs in inner cities, where African-American men could take them, went away, and the cultural changes followed.

title: Chinas Tensions With Dalai Lama Spill Into the Afterlife
description: HONG KONG  Chinese Communist Party leaders are afraid that the Dalai Lama will not have an afterlife. Worried enough that this week, officials repeatedly warned that he must reincarnate, and on their terms.

title: Review: In Memoir, Barney Frank Presses for a Results-Oriented Philosophy
description: The expectations, from both readers and publishers, for a political memoir are that the author will use the book to give what-really-happened insider details, offer a healthy portion of score-settling and provide ample introspection on a life in elected office.

title: Fed's Stress Test of Big Banks: Part Two
description: All U.S. banks passed the annual test. But Bank of America passed only provisionally and Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley had to reduce payouts.

title: Review: Google Chromebook Pixel
description: GOOGLES Chromebook Pixel is a mysterious beast.

title: Richard Bransons Virgin Group Sued by Ex-Partner Over Cruise Line Plans
description: When Richard Branson, the entrepreneurial billionaire, announced the formation of Virgin Cruises in December, he promised to shake up the cruise industry.

title: Video Feature: Pointing the Way to Good Reads, Videos and Music
description: HOW do you sift through all the clutter on the web and find the best stuff to read? And once you find the best stuff, whats the best way to share it with others?

title: App Smart | Discovery on the Social Web
description: Discovery and sharability are key to finding new things online, and there are many apps that can help. Pinterest, which caters to the visually-oriented, might be the most recognizable of this genre.

title: Buccellati Celebrates Its New York Flagship With Art-Inspired Jewels
description: The jewelry houses first female designer, 25-year-old Lucrezia, created five one-of-a-kind designs based on Impressionist and Post-Impressionist works from her husbands private collection.

title: The Senates Email Holdouts
description: Thanks to Hillary Rodham Clintons email problem, we have been reminded that several senators, including Charles Schumer, Democrat of New York, and Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, rarely or never use email. This should perhaps come as no surprise since there is a long tradition of lawmakers resisting technological change.

title: The Originalist, a New Play About Justice Antonin Scalia by John Strand
description: WASHINGTON  In December, after more than a year of research and reflection, Edward Gero went to see an argument at the Supreme Court. He was in the final stages of preparing to portray Justice Antonin Scalia onstage, and it was time to see his subject in his element.

title: Dealing With the Dreaded Bereavement Trip
description: Dealing with bereavement travel can mean grief in more ways than one. Just ask William Shatner.

title: Training the Mind to Ward Off Falls
description: WICHITA, Kan.  The first part of the hourlong Standing Strong exercise class at the Linwood Senior Center proceeds pretty much as you might expect.

title: Retirement Reality Is Catching Up With Me
description: I am an idiot.

title: Odds of Being a Champ at 95? Pretty Good
description: Larry Johnson keeps himself busy in his retirement  90-minute indoor cycling classes three times a week and upper-body workouts on the alternate days, taking Saturdays off. In the winter, he goes into the mountains above his Albuquerque home to ski at least once a week.

title: Two Generations, Retired and Together
description: Almost every morning, Lauri McBride, 62, a retired middle-school science teacher, spends a half-hour chatting with her father, William Fink, 88, while he eats breakfast. Most evenings, Ms. McBride returns for another 30 minutes as her father sips a martini.

title: The Rub: Remodel or Move?
description: Neil Shapiro considers himself within shouting distance of retirement. He and his wife could have sold their home near Chicago and bought a condo in the Sun Belt, long a lure for American retirees.

title: Apps Especially Useful for Retirees
description: Many smartphone applications can be particularly useful to retirees with time to manage their lives and pursuits. The apps listed below can help keep track of finances, plan trips and generally make life in retirement a little easier.

title: Managing Estate Sales Becomes Big Business
description: When Gary Bermans mother died in January, at age 81, leaving behind the two-story house in Forest Hills, Queens, where she had lived for more than 60 years, he and his sister divided the items with sentimental value, then decided they wanted to sell the knickknacks and the big-ticket items, mostly a collection of midcentury modern dining room furniture.

title: Live Long and Prosper? Insurance Might Help
description: For those heading deep into retirement with relatively stable health, rage against the dying of the light often translates into a fear of outliving their nest egg.

title: This Health Account Can Add to a Nest Egg Too
description: As savings vehicles go, Health Savings Accounts, or H.S.A.s, are rainy day funds with generous benefits.

title: U.S. Banks Pass Stress Tests, Some With an Asterisk
description: All the large United States banks passed an annual regulatory test that aims to assess whether they can make it through a financial and economic calamity, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday.

title: Greek Debt Talks Are Tested by Fraying Ties With Germany
description: BRUSSELS  Growing Greek antagonism toward Germany is coming at a bad time for Athens as it seeks a better debt deal with its European partners.

title: Residents Spar Over How to Maintain The Last Free Place in America
description: The residents of Slab City, an unregulated squatter settlement, are divided over what to do if the California State Land Commission sells the land.

title: Talk of a Sale Fills a Hippie Haven With Bad Vibes
description: NILAND, Calif.  Over the decades, the legend of Slab City as The Last Free Place in America has grown, fed by portrayals in magazines and film as an endless Woodstock.

title: Classical Playlist: Stravinsky, Schumann and More
description: STRAVINSKY: Works for Piano and Orchestra; PetrouchkaJean-Efflam Bavouzet, pianist; Yan Pascal Tortelier, conductor; So Paulo Symphony Orchestra(Chandos CHSA 5147; one CD)Stravinsky wrote three ingeniously original works for piano and orchestra. Perhaps its because these pieces are so unconventional that they are seldom performed, a big loss for audiences. The excellent, inquisitive French pianist Jean-Efflam Bavouzet plays all three in bold, incisive performances on this new recording, with Yan Pascal Tortelier, another fine French artist, conducting the impressive So Paulo Symphony Orchestra. There is the flinty, Neo-Classical Concerto for Piano and Wind Instruments; the inventive Capriccio for Piano and Orchestra, a beguilingly strange work drenched in Russian musical styles and colors; and the compact, amazing 12-tone Movements for Piano and Orchestra, heard today mostly at New York City Ballet as a score for a seminal George Balanchine ballet. This recording includes a vibrant account of Petrouchka (1957 version), with Mr. Bavouzet playing the formidable piano part. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Louis Vuittons Wear-All-Season Pointy Black Ankle Boots
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Review: Compagnie CNDC-Angers Dances Cunningham
description: What will happen next? Why is she falling back into his arms when hes sitting there minding his own business? Who would have expected that man with his legs spread eagle on the floor to scurry across it? Why does that group of people stand motionless and then all switch position in a way that transforms them? Why did the mood just change and then change again because of movement alone?

title: A Hitting Partner Switches Sides, From Serena Williamss to Victoria Azarenkas
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  With Serena Williams making her return to Indian Wells after a 14-year boycott, her longtime hitting partner, Sascha Bajin, came to the tournament for the first time this week.

title: Murry Sidlin Conducts Defiant Requiem, a Tribute to Defiance With Verdi
description: In desperate times music has been used by the persecuted as both a means of resistance and as spiritual sustenance. During his internment in Terezin, the concentration camp in Czechoslovakia that the Nazis claimed was a model community for Jews, the conductor Rafael Schchter led an inmate choir in performances of Verdis Requiem that served both as a morale booster and subtle rebellion.

title: Art Sales on the Rise
description: Higher art prices and a greater number of transactions pushed global art market sales up 7 percent last year to 51.2 billion euros (about $68 billion at an average exchange rate for the year), according to the annual report for the European Fine Art Foundation, published Wednesday.

title: Growing Pains Subside for a Reborn Big East
description: Val Ackerman, the commissioner of the Big East, has her own offices now, and a full staff, and an email system, and a host of corporate sponsors, and all of this has made Year 2 of the new league considerably less rocky than the first.

title: Tracing the Route of a Proposed AirTrain to La Guardia Airport
description: Maybe here, Sean Hennessey said, walking in a circle in a snowy parking lot  specifically, Lot P1 at La Guardia Airport.

title: The Tales of Hoffmann, Newly Restored, Opens at Film Forum
description: Admirers and detractors of Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburgers film The Tales of Hoffmann, from Offenbachs opera, are equally vociferous. The newly restored edition, playing at Film Forum Friday through next Thursday, reminds us why. This 1951 film belongs to a bewildering number of categories. Its lip-sync opera, multilayered meta-theater (indeed, a dizzyingly baroque exercise in overt artifice), kitsch extravaganza of luridly colored design (by Hein Heckroth) and keenly musical ballet.

title: Louisiana National Guard on Crash
description: Maj. Gen. Glenn Curtis of the Louisiana National Guard spoke about the crash of a Black Hawk helicopter off the Florida coast during a training mission.

title: The Clinton Emails: Questions Linger
Better Judgment at the Championship Level
description: NEW ORLEANS  The American Contract Bridge Leagues Spring North American Championships are underway here. To lead into our coverage, here is a look at a deal from the final day of the leagues fall championships in Providence, R.I., in December.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Whats Wrong With the Blurred Lines Copyright Ruling
description: Heres how songs, especially hip-hop and R&B songs, are made today : the framework is built in the studio by a producer, working on some combination of keyboard, drum machine, sampler and computer program. Songwriters contribute topline melodies and conceptual ideas, and sometimes all the words. Generally speaking, at the moment of creation, there is no sheet music, no notation thats meant to guide musicians.

title: What I Almost Called My Play
description: Before there was Oklahoma! there was Away We Go! That was the original title of the Rodgers and Hammerstein musical that opened in New Haven in 1943. When it moved to Broadway weeks later, it was renamed after its rousing, now-famous second-act number.

title: Multimedia Works That Explore the State of Nature
description: The artist Nadja Franks practice combines photography, silkscreening and sculpture.

title: Slack, the Office Messaging App That May Finally Sink Email
description: People in the tech industry have been digging a grave for email for more than a decade, but their predictions have always seemed a little out of touch.

title: Juliette Lewiss Beauty Secrets (A Lot of Coconut Oil and Then Some)
description: Juliette Lewis, 41, is known for roles in films like Whats Eating Gilbert Grape, Natural Born Killers and Cape Fear, for which she was nominated for an Oscar. She now plays a flinty detective in the ABC series Secrets and Lies, which had its debut on March 1. Ms. Lewis, who is also a musician, formerly toured with her rock band, Juliette and the Licks, and is set to release a solo album this year. She lives in her native Los Angeles.

title: Republican Idiocy on Iran
description: After helping to ignite a firestorm over a possible nuclear agreement with Iran, Senator John McCain, a former Republican presidential candidate, is now sort of acknowledging his error. Maybe that wasnt exactly the best way to do that, he said on Fox News on Tuesday.

title: Cocktail Hours at the Plaza Hotel
Obama Hands Venezuelan Leader a Cause to Stir Support
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Just a few weeks ago, President Obama was being praised across Latin America for his decision to re-establish relations with Cuba, while President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela appeared increasingly isolated  a wobbly, unpopular leader resorting to ever more aggressive tactics to confront an economic crisis and clamp down on the political opposition.

title: Darrelle Revis Cashes In With Jets as Other N.F.L. Stars Choose to Walk Away
description: Darrelle Revis, who has torn up and rehabilitated a knee in service of the N.F.L., established this winter that his market value was $39 million for five years.

title: Dressing for TED: What to Wear to Go Viral
description: You have something important to say at TED, but your outfit also sends a message.

title: Jeans? Some Boys Shout, No Way!
description: Jackson Schad gave up on jeans in kindergarten.

title: Republicans Iran Letter Ignites Fierce #47Traitors Debate Online
description: The political conversation on social networks in the United States this week continues to be dominated by a partisan debate over the open letter to the leaders of Iran posted online Monday by 47 Republican senators.

title: P.S.G. Survives a Red Card, a Penalty and Two Deficits to Dispatch Chelsea
description: LONDON  A few minutes after the referee blew the final whistle here on Wednesday night, the Paris St.-Germain players ripped off their shirts in the bitter cold, ran toward the end of the field at Stamford Bridge and danced, their arms thrown around one another, in front of a band of giddy, frothy fans.

title: Dinner at Ralphs
description: Just over there, on a banquette beneath an oil painting depicting the racehorses Man o War and Citation in bookend profile, Rihanna and Naomi Campbell sit huddled like sleek and improbably beautiful fillies after a sudden storm.

title: Expulsion of Two Oklahoma Students Over Video Leads to Free Speech Debate
description: NORMAN, Okla.  The University of Oklahomas decision to expel two fraternity members who led a racist chant on a bus provoked criticism Wednesday from several legal experts who said that the students words, however odious, were protected by the First Amendments guarantee of freedom of speech.

title: Distracted Shooting
description: Many college fan sections view themselves as passionate and zany, but some are better than others at making opponents miss from the foul line.

title: John D. Arras, Medical Care Philosopher, Is Dead at 69
description: John D. Arras, a plain-spoken philosopher who preached that doctors should consider fairness and morality, as well as medical issues, in making life-or-death decisions about patient care, died on Monday in Galveston, Tex. He was 69.

title: One Up on the 70s and More Shopping Tips
description: Suede trench coats for spring can be chic or understated; a new label with cool-girl cuts; Cinderella evening sandals by Giamba and more.

title: Goldman Sachs Contributes $2 Million to LaGuardia Community College
description: Last Friday, Gail O. Mellow, the president of LaGuardia Community College, a two-year institution in Queens with 50,000 students, received an unexpected call. It was Lloyd C. Blankfein, the chief executive of Goldman Sachs, who surprised her with the news that the bank was giving the school $2 million. No restrictions applied.

title: Linda McMahon Co-Hosts Christie Event, but Withholds Full Support  for Now
description: Linda E. McMahon, the former professional wrestling executive and active Republican donor who recently hosted an event for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, is not yet prepared to say she has aligned with him in the 2016 presidential sweepstakes.

title: Hate Takes the Bus
description: This week, when video was posted showing members of the University of Oklahomas chapter of Sigma Alpha Epsilon gleefully engaged in a racist chant on a bus, some people were shocked. Others, like me, were not.

title: Secret Service Inquiry Follows Agents Crash at White House
description: WASHINGTON  Two senior Secret Service agents are under investigation for allegations that they crashed a government-issued car into a White House barricade after a night of drinking last week, prompting a new inquiry into personal misconduct by employees of the widely criticized law enforcement agency, officials said Wednesday.

title: Bipartisan Support for Ballet
description: The School of American Ballet held its annual Winter Ball on Monday night, and absolutely no one seemed to mind that it felt more like spring.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: In 1991, Bobbi Brown introduced 10 subtle lipstick shades at Bergdorf Goodman and sold 100 units on the first day. As a nod to this origin story, the makeup guru will be hosting a customer appreciation event at the store on Thursday. Ms. Brown will lead a Bobbi Brown Makeup Master Class at the Good Dish cafe at 9 a.m. At noon, she will sign copies of her book Everything Eyes; youll receive a free copy with the purchase of Bobbi Brown opticals or sunglasses ($349).

title: Liberian Leader Concedes Errors in Response to Ebola
description: The president of Liberia acknowledged on Wednesday that she had erred in ordering a tough security crackdown at the height of the Ebola crisis last year, describing the deadly virus as an unknown enemy that had frightened her.

title: Harper Lees Condition Debated by Friends, Fans and Now State of Alabama
description: MONROEVILLE, Ala.  The doubts arose almost immediately when HarperCollins announced last month that it would release a rediscovered book by Harper Lee: Did Ms. Lee  88, publicity-shy and famously resistant to producing a follow-up to her masterpiece, To Kill a Mockingbird  really want to publish a second novel that she wrote and set aside more than a half-century ago?

title: Around Lake Ontario, Neighbors Debate a Dam, Property Values and Muskrats
description: OFF GRINDSTONE ISLAND, N.Y.  When Jeff Garnsey, a third-generation fishing guide along the St. Lawrence River, looks at the water off Grindstone Island, he notices that it does not move the way it used to.

title: Western Relations Frosty, Russia Warms to North Korea
description: MOSCOW  Russias relations with many Western nations, including the United States, may be at their worst levels since the Cold War, but its relationship with North Korea is blooming faster than the famously lush flower beds of Moscows Alexander Garden.

title: Focus in Brooklyn Subway Shooting Is on Whether Deadly Force Was Justified
description: For nearly everyone on the packed Brooklyn-bound No. 4 train, the Tuesday evening commute began like any other. Bodies crammed together. Tempers contained beneath the fatigue of a long day.

title: Federal Agency Finds No Evidence That Trinity Industries Altered Guardrail Design Again
description: Federal officials released a survey of potentially dangerous guardrails on Wednesday and said that they found no evidence that the guardrails had been quietly changed to make them safer after accusations that earlier changes had made them less safe.

title: Anti-Semitism Against a Student at U.C.L.A.
description: To the Editor:

title: Utah Approves Fraud Registry
description: State Representative Mike K. McKell introduced a bill to establish a registry of white-collar criminals in Utah. While it sailed through the Legislature, some of his colleagues raised concerns.

title: Utah Passes White-Collar Felon Registry
description: With just a point and a click, you can browse a face book of felons, a new government website that will warn of the danger these criminals pose to society.

title: Ferguson Police Chief Thomas Jackson Joins Exodus of City Officials
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The citys embattled police chief, the focus of complaints after a white officer fatally shot an unarmed black teenager here last August, agreed to resign Wednesday, as part of the near-complete shake-up of the citys most senior administrators.

title: Columbia Journalism School to Cut Class Size and Staff Jobs
description: Columbias Graduate School of Journalism is reducing its class size and cutting staff positions as demand for journalism schools across the country dwindles.

title: Aaron Kushner, Entrepreneur With Plans to Lead a California Newspaper Renaissance, Steps Aside
description: If the most familiar story in the newspaper industry is the demise of newspapers, the second is that of the passionate, wealthy entrepreneur wielding a potential solution.

title: Ferguson Police Chief to Resign
description: Mayor James Knowles announced that Fergusons police chief, Thomas Jackson, would be resigning, effective March 19.

title: Photographs: An Iraqi Family Makes a Home in the Bronx
description: Last March, Waleed Al Shok moved his family to the Bronx from Baghdad, where he had been working as an interpreter for the United States military  a job that ultimately put his familys safety at risk.

title: Kleiner Perkins Portrays Ellen Pao as Combative and Resentful in Sex Bias Trial
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The esteemed venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, its star partner, John Doerr, once said, is a family, with occasional disputes.

title: Yonkers Building Evacuated After Mudslide
description: Mayor Mike Spano of Yonkers spoke with displaced residents on Wednesday after a mudslide behind their apartment building, on Walsh Road, forced them to leave. Melting snow was initially blamed. A broken pipe was later said to have been the likely cause.

title: Jeb Bush Sells His Stakes in Remaining Businesses
description: Jeb Bush has sold his stakes in his two remaining business commitments, his spokeswoman said Wednesday, another strong signal that the former Florida governor will embark on a campaign for president.

title: Citing Fear of Neo-Nazi Group, a German Mayor Quits
description: BERLIN  The mayor of a small town in eastern Germany said Wednesday that fear for his family led to his decision to resign his post after the local authorities failed to block an anti-immigration demonstration by neo-Nazis outside of his home.

title: InMobi Plans to Stay Independent, Dismissing Rumors of Talks With Google
description: As technology giants like Google and Facebook slug it out over the $40 billion global market for mobile advertising, smaller players like InMobi have to stay nimble to avoid being trampled in the fight.

title: Senator Behind Iran Letter Is Latest Freshman Republican to Stir Things Up
description: WASHINGTON  First there was Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky, who held up bills, conducted an antidrone talk-a-thon and generally annoyed his colleagues. Next was Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, who whipped up a campaign that shut down the government.

title: 13 Who Defeated Adversity Earn New York Times College Scholarships
description: It was one of those perfect blue-sky days when Mah Noor stepped from the subway station on her way home to her apartment in Queens and spotted the familiar-looking man, sitting on a bench in the shadow of a tree, who appeared mentally ill.

title: Democrats See No Choice but Hillary Clinton in 2016
description: They shrug off questions about Hillary Rodham Clintons email habits. They roll with the attacks on her familys foundation, the big checks from foreign governments, the torpid response of her not-yet-campaign.

title: Jameis Winston Meets With Roger Goodell and Other N.F.L. Officials
description: With less than two months before the N.F.L. draft, Jameis Winston met with Commissioner Roger Goodell and other league officials last week in New York.

title: Impasse With Congress Imperils Authorization to Combat ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas formal request for congressional authorization to fight the Islamic State  once framed by lawmakers as a matter of great constitutional import  is now seriously imperiled because Republicans think it does too little and Democrats think it does too much.

title: Saints Owner Tom Benson Files Suit to Remove Teams from Trust
description: The New Orleans Saints owner Tom Benson wants to remove the Saints and the Pelicans from trusts he set up for his daughter and her children in exchange for promissory notes worth $556 million.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 11, 2015
description: March 11, 2015

title: When Liberals Blew It
description: Fifty years ago this month, Democrats made a historic mistake.

title: On Ferrets, New Yorks Health Board Displays Rare Apathy
description: Protecting the unwary public from dancing bears? Check. Reducing juice consumption, sedentary time and television viewing in day care? Check again.

title: Review: A Happy End, Iddo Netanyahus Play Set in 1930s Berlin
description: In his recent speech to Congress, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel made dire predictions. His younger brother, Iddo Netanyahu, makes some, too. In his play A Happy End, presented by Abingdon Theater Company, a character says earnestly, Our days of peace are numbered. And shes right.

title: Warning Before a Detonation
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  I wont yell out the theme of todays crossword puzzle by Ellen Leuschner and Jeff Chen, lest I get arrested. But its a hot one and you wont want to miss it.

title: Bicyclist Describes Scene of Officers Shooting in Boston Marathon Trial
description: BOSTON  On April 18, 2013, Nathan Harman, then a first-year mathematics graduate student at M.I.T., was where he often was at night: finishing work in his office. A little past 10 p.m., he got on his bicycle to ride home.

title: Alex Rodriguez Hits a Homer, but Chris Capuano Is Injured
description: TAMPA, Fla.  In an eventful day at George Steinbrenner Field, Alex Rodriguez hit his first home run since September 2013 and starter Chris Capuano sustained a Grade 2 strain of the right quadriceps.

title: For Rent: A Hungarian Village, and a Mayoral Title
description: MEGYER, Hungary  Kristof Pajers plan to transform Hungarys smallest village into a rural vacation paradise had not been going as well as hoped. Bookings were light. Renovations were slow. Money was scarce.

title: Hideki Matsui Was Long Coveted by Yankees for Front-Office Job
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Despite Major League Baseballs efforts to diversify its front offices and coaching staffs, former Japanese players have not been included.

title: Broadchurch Season 2, Episode 2 Recap: It Takes Two
description: Perhaps fittingly, Episode 2 of Broadchurch unfolds with a Noahs ark-esque parade of pairs. The creator and writer Chris Chibnall obsesses over dualities, comparisons and parallels, and the way one person can affect and shape another. Here are some of these various duos and what we can learn from them, culminating in the two highest-stakes pairings of all.

title: Matt Harvey Duels Marlins Giancarlo Stanton. Get Used to It.
description: JUPITER, Fla.  Matt Harvey and Giancarlo Stanton were locked in the baseball equivalent of a staring contest on Wednesday. It was the first inning of an exhibition game between the Mets and the Miami Marlins, the count was full, and Harvey hurled a 96-mile-per-hour fastball toward home plate, where Stanton stood waiting, bat in hand.

title: Anti-Abortion Provision May Stop Human Trafficking Bill in Senate
description: A bipartisan Senate bill that would increase penalties for perpetrators and support for victims of human trafficking met potentially fatal resistance Wednesday over an anti-abortion provision. Senate Democrats blocked consideration of the legislation many had supported as recently as Monday, accusing Republicans of sneaking in language that would ban money from a victims fund from being used for abortions. Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the Democratic leader, said his party would not allow it to move forward with that provision. Senator John Cornyn, the Texas Republican who introduced the bill, said Democrats had rejected his suggestion to introduce an amendment stripping out the language. He said the Senate would vote Thursday to end debate on the bill, but it seemed unlikely that he would have the 60 votes needed to overcome Democratic opposition.

title: Illinois: Jess Garcia Gains Backing of Key Black Figure in Chicago Race
description: Willie Wilson, the African-American businessman who won more than 10 percent of the vote in the Chicago mayors race last month, will endorse Jess G. Garcia, who is known as Chuy, over Rahm Emanuel in the runoff on April 7, Mr. Wilson said Wednesday. All the data came in and the community asked me to endorse Chuy over the mayor, Mr. Wilson said, adding that black voters disagreed with Mr. Emanuels decision to close nearly 50 public schools.

title: Cuba: Leader of Dissident Group Retains Her Post After Challenge
description: Cubas most high-profile opposition group, the Ladies in White, voted Wednesday to keep their leader, Berta Soler, in a referendum prompted by complaints that she was autocratic and should resign. The challenge to Ms. Solers leadership exposed divisions within the group as it grapples with the changing relationship between Cuba and the United States and the groups shifting status among Cubas increasingly diverse opposition groups. Ms. Soler said by telephone that she had won 180 of a total of 201 votes cast. Sixteen members of the group voted against her, and the remaining ballots were blank or annulled, she said. More than 30 members did not vote. Several members called for Ms. Solers resignation after a video emerged in which some in the group surrounded a member, Alejandrina Garca de la Riva, in December, waving their fists and chanting, Down traitor. The Ladies in White was formed in 2003 to protest the imprisonment of 75 dissidents. Most of the dissidents have since been released, but the group continues to march weekly to demand democratic reform and freedom of speech.

title: With TV Deals Ahead, Players Reject Salary Cap Limits
description: The players union formally rejected an N.B.A. proposal to artificially limit increases to the salary cap once lucrative new national television deals begin next year, the league said in a statement Wednesday.

title: Canada: U.S. Consulate Attack Was Foiled, Panel Says
description: A man from Pakistan who was a permanent resident of Canada told an undercover officer that he planned to bomb the United States Consulate or the financial district in Toronto, an immigration panel revealed on Wednesday. The man, Jahanzeb Malik, was detained on Monday. A lawyer for the immigration department said that Mr. Malik, who traveled to Canada as a student in 2004, told the undercover officer that he had fought in Bosnia and trained at terrorist camps in Libya. He also said that he had associated with Anwar al-Awlaki, an American cleric who was deemed a terrorist by the United States and killed in a drone strike in Yemen in 2011. The government wants to deport Mr. Malik to Pakistan. He is not facing any criminal charges.

title: Government Transparency Groups Letter to Cuomo
description: Groups that advocate government transparency have been trying to persuade Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to rethink the policy of automatically deleting state workers emails after only 90 days.

title: Fukushima Five Years After Nuclear Disaster
description: Five years after an earthquake and tsunami devastated the northeast Japanese coast, Japan has not fully recovered.

title: Multimedia Works That Explore the State of Nature
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Word of the Day | leniency
description: leniency  \le-ne-n(t)-se, -nyn(t)-se\  noun

title: Utah Passes Antidiscrimination Bill Backed by Mormon Leaders
description: With the backing of Mormon church leaders, the Republican-dominated Utah Legislature passed a bill on Wednesday night that would ban discrimination against lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people in housing and employment, while also protecting religious institutions that object to homosexuality.

title: Marco Rubios Puppies-and-Rainbows Tax Plan
description: Republicans like tax cuts, but for the last couple of years the focus of a lively debate among Republican policy wonks has been on how to cut taxes.

title: A Growing Competitive Circuit
description: A college curling tournament in Wisconsin reflected the camaraderie among teams from around the country, many of which pay to travel to competitions.

title: Swept Up in the Camaraderie
description: Curling is a growing college sport in the United States, though many players pay for the pleasure out of their own pockets.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 10 P.M. (ABC) AMERICAN CRIME Thirty-six hours after the murder of Matt Skokie, his parents, Barb Hanlon (Felicity Huffman) and Russ Skokie (Timothy Hutton), encounter two of the suspects  the drug addicts Carter Nix (Elvis Nolasco) and Aubry Taylor (Caitlin Gerard)  at their arraignment. A third, the teenager Tony Gutirrez (Johnny Ortiz), is placed is juvenile detention, while the fourth, Hector Tontz (Richard Cabral), is told that he will be extradited to Mexico. This series is at heart a murder mystery  someone has been killed, and the show withholds who did it, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times about this limited series, created by John Ridley, the Oscar-winning screenwriter of 12 Years a Slave. But solving the crime isnt the point. What matters is not just what is said but also the prickly sting of what is left unstated, she added. Miscommunication, misunderstandings and, on occasion, a stab of ice-cold reality are all part of the bereavement and also the investigation. American Crime is a depressing story told so skillfully that its almost impossible not to be happy to see it unfold.

title: Richard Glatzer, Co-Director of Still Alice, Dies at 63
description: Richard Glatzer, who helped write and direct the film Still Alice, which brought Julianne Moore an Academy Award last month for her portrayal of a college professor coping with early-onset Alzheimers disease, died on Tuesday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 63.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I may not be enlisted anymore, but Im still a warrior. I figured if I could walk away from here and kill as many of the bad guys as I could, that would be a good thing.

title: Corrections: March 12, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Manhunt Is Underway After Police Officers Are Shot in Ferguson
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The police conducted a manhunt in this tense and battered city on Thursday in search of whoever shot two police officers as they worked at a protest after the resignation of the chief.

title: Syria After Four Years of Mayhem
description: A look at the conflict that has dismembered Syria and inflamed the region with one of the worlds worst religious and sectarian wars.

title: Failure to Thrive
description: In the fall of 2014 the author decided to quit the prescription medications she has been taking to treat her anxiety, depression and insomnia, and began the process of gradually reducing her dosages. In Going Off, a series of Anxiety posts in the coming weeks, she will chronicle the challenges she faces from both the drugs and the withdrawal in her pursuit of a drug-free life.

title: A First Step on Circumcision
description: To the Editor:

title: Dark Money, Blurred Principles
description: Beware the politician who professes a devotion to goodness and idealism, and working for the people while quietly taking unlimited sums of cash from big donors, supposedly because these benefactors love the values he fights for and not the access and influence that buckets of money can buy.

title: Hillary Clinton Comes Back
description: Right now youre probably asking yourself: What am I supposed to do with all this Hillary Clinton stuff? True, I am a concerned citizen, but I have a big deadline at work and a lot of social activities scheduled for the weekend.

title: Stop the Decline of Our Navy, a Congressman Says
description: To the Editor:

title: Lent: Its Not Just for Catholics
description: ARE you a conformist or an individualist? Most Americans believe they are the latter  to be exact, 64 percent of us in 2011, according to the World Values Survey. Perhaps youre a cage-busting entrepreneur, or a transgressive artist. Or maybe youre just a freethinking outlier at your Thanksgiving table. My own nonconformity in early adulthood took the form of religious conversion from Protestant to Catholic, bailing out of college to play avant-garde music, and  most schismatic of all to family and friends  voting Republican.

title: A Failing Relationship With Venezuela
description: By imposing sanctions on seven officials in the Venezuelan government on Monday, the Obama administration took a gamble. The move appears intended to signal to members of that government that persecuting the political opposition and limiting an independent press will have consequences.

title: Unraveling the Church Ban on Gay Sex
description: Last month, Salvatore Cordileone, the archbishop of San Francisco, made controversial changes to a handbook for Catholic high school teachers in his jurisdiction. The changes included morals clauses, one of which forbids those teachers from publicly endorsing homosexual behavior. There are plausible legal and educational objections to this move. But there is a deeper issue, one that raises fundamental questions about Catholic teachings on homosexuality and other sexual matters.

title: Dangerous Trains, Aging Rails
description: A CSX freight train ran off the rails last month in rural Mount Carbon, W.Va. One after another, exploding rail cars sent hellish fireballs hundreds of feet into the clear winter sky. Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin declared a state of emergency, and the fires burned for several days.

title: A New Gay Fairy Tale
description: KOLKATA, INDIA  In the mid 90s, about five years after I had moved to the United States, I got rid of the part in my hair. It was the most daring thing I had ever done to my appearance. That side part, with me since my childhood in India, was the emblem of the well-behaved, well-groomed good boy, and I had carried it diligently into adulthood.

title: NASA Mission to Measure Earths Magnetic Collisions
description: A NASA mission called Magnetospheric Multiscale, scheduled to be launched Thursday night, aims to make the first detailed measurements of a region of colliding magnetic fields about 38,000 miles above Earth. The magnetic collisions, which can potentially disrupt satellites and power grids, are not well understood.

title: Test Yourself | Yoga in the Snow
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 4 article, Frozen Yoga? Its Snowga.

title: What Happens as More States Curtail Labor's Rights?
United Nations Reputation Slips as Four-Year War in Syria Drags On
description: UNITED NATIONS  United Nations experts have painstakingly documented a litany of torture, rape and execution committed in Syria in the past four years. No one has been held accountable.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Disenchanted by Civilian Life, Veterans Volunteer to Fight ISIS
description: In Disenchanted by Civilian Life, Veterans Volunteer to Fight ISIS, Dave Philipps and Thomas James Brennan write about some American volunteers who have offered to take up arms against the Islamic State, working with local militias in Iraq and Syria.

title: How Much Can an Artist Borrow From Earlier Musicians Before It Becomes Stealing?
description: Sam Smith recently agreed to pay Tom Petty royalties and share songwriting credit for his hit Stay With Me because the song resembled Mr. Pettys Wont Back Down. And on Wednesday a jury ruled that Robin Thicke and Pharrell Williams have to pay $7.3 million to Marvin Gayes family for plagiarizing the song Got to Give It Up in Mr. Thickes 2013 hit Blurred Lines. Isnt music all about borrowing and building on the past? Or, is there a line that should not be crossed?

title: Foreign Policy Bridges Republican Divisions
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republicans, struggling in their first months of controlling Congress, have struck upon one unifying force: challenging President Obama on Iran and other aspects of his foreign policy.

title: Cuomos Rule on Purging State Email Roils Albany
description: ALBANY  The legislators were annoyed. The state official testifying before them did not have many answers. And the subject of her appearance  the multiyear transformation of New Yorks information technology system  had been pretty much cast aside.

title: Secrets of Food Porn Photos
description: Every recipe published in The New York Times comes with three components: an introduction to the food; the instructions on how to make it; and a photograph of the dish itself. I spend a great deal of time on the first two briefs. Andrew Scrivani is often responsible for the third.

title: Richmond Player Has Basketball and Perseverance in His Blood
description: His parents met while playing for the Washington Generals, eternal foils of the Harlem Globetrotters, but this is no losers narrative, not by a long shot.

title: Where Beijings Trash Is Reborn
description: Unemployed migrant laborers pick through the trash for recyclables to survive in Beijing.

title: Zuckerberg Lawsuit Documents Show Animosity With Would-Be Neighbor
description: Mark Zuckerberg likes his privacy, but hes in an increasingly public battle with a would-be neighbor in Palo Alto, Calif., that threatens to expose details of his personal life and conduct.

title: My Patient Doesnt Do Vaccines
description: The visit started out ordinary enough: a new patient, a healthy man in his late 30s who hadnt seen a doctor in years. When we got to preventive health, I recommended the flu shot. He politely declined. I dont do vaccines, he said.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Your Local National Parks Are Calling
description: Good morning on this brisk Thursday.

title: Asia Rushes to Lower Rates, but Maybe Not Fast Enough
description: HONG KONG  Central banks across Asia are racing to cut interest rates, but they may not be doing it fast enough to stave off economic malaise.

title: Police Officers Shot in Ferguson, Mo.
description: Two police officers were shot outside the Ferguson police station early Thursday, the St. Louis County police said.

title: Daily Report: Drawbacks to Privacy as Education Apps Spread
description: At school districts across the country, the chief technology officers responsible for safeguarding student data are tearing their hair out, Natasha Singer reports.

title: Spanish Lender Offers to Buy TSB Banking Group of Britain
description: LONDON  TSB Banking Group, the lender spun out of Lloyds Banking Group last year, said on Thursday that it had received a preliminary takeover offer from Banco Sabadell of Spain.

title: Conservationists Denounce Chinese Show Where Celebrities and Wildlife Share Stage
description: A new Chinese television reality show where entertainers hug whale sharks, kiss lions, feed pandas and dress up baby chimpanzees has come under fire from wildlife conservationists who want it taken off the air, saying such activities are cruel and are dangerous for both the humans and animals.

title: A Falcon in the City
description: Im standing on cracked asphalt by a high security fence at the eastern edge of Ireland. The sky is cold pewter, the salt wind bitter. Ive come all the way here to watch wildlife, and I have just turned my back on the only birds I can see. The miles of sand behind me have been washed by the Irish Sea into a perfect blankness, pearled with gulls and flocks of migrant waders. Its beautiful. But my friends Hilary and Eamonn have told me to look instead at Dublins Poolbeg Power Station, a giants play set of brutal turbine halls facing the shining sands. Set amid sewerage works, derelict red-brick buildings, wharves, cranes and shipping containers, this is a bizarre spot for a wildlife pilgrimage. Two decommissioned cooling chimneys tower above us, marked with vertical washes of rust and horizontal bands of red and white. Rising from the horizon, they are your first sight of Ireland if you arrive from the east by sea and the last when you leave. Visible throughout the city, they have come to mean home for a whole generation of Dubliners  and for the peregrine falcons that have nested on them for years.

title: Imagining 2016 Without Hillary Clinton
description: Were on record here at The Upshot as believing that Hillary Clinton is in an extremely strong position to win the Democratic nomination. And as Brendan Nyhan has explained, the furor over her private email account is likely to affect far fewer voters than may now appear to be the case.

title: Sailing to the End of the World in Patagonia
description: In Ushuaia, Argentina, the capital of the province of Tierra del Fuego, where I began a three-night cruise through southern Patagonia, the daily newspaper is called El Diario del Fin del Mundo  The Journal of the End of the World. Its a startling name for a newspaper but an apt description of the cruise, during which it is easy to believe that you have, indeed, sailed to the very end of the earth.

title: Cruising the Past, from Baltimore to Charleston
description: I staggered from my single stateroom into the empty corridor, bilious and desperate. I was aboard the American Glory, a 50-passenger cruise ship that had, for five days, proceeded effortlessly down the Intracoastal Waterway. Until we hit open water north of Charleston, S.C., and I learned, around 2 a.m., that I am uncommonly disposed to seasickness.

title: ITV to Pay Up to $1.2 Billion for The Voice Producer
description: LONDON  ITV, the British television broadcaster and producer, said on Thursday that it had agreed to pay up to 1.1 billion euros, or about $1.2 billion, for Talpa Media, the Dutch producer of the singing competition show The Voice.

title: Today in Politics: As Clinton Wobbles, Black Congressional Leaders Show Support
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington, where the F.B.I. is celebrating a special anniversary and former Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota has started an acting career, of sorts. Congressional oversight has shifted from President Obama to his potential successor, but when it comes to Democrats, Hillary Rodham Clinton appears too big to fail.

title: Was a Patients Arthritis Medicine Making Her Sick?
description: She had been on medication for years. Was it possible that it was actually making her sicker?

title: Morning Agenda: U.S. Banks Pass Fed Tests
description: U.S. BANKS PASS FED EXAM | The Federal Reserve said on Wednesday that all the large United States banks passed its so-called stress tests, which aim to assess whether they can weather a financial storm, DealBooks Peter Eavis writes. Bank of America passed only provisionally and could still fail later this year if it does not fix deficiencies that the Fed identified. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley each had to alter their planned payouts to investors to achieve passing grades. The American units of Deutsche Bank, the German banking giant, and Santander of Spain failed the tests outright.

title: Free-Throw Distraction: The Best Fans in the N.C.A.A.
description: Who are the most effective fans in college basketball  and which fans arent effective at all?

title: A Balancing Act as Iraq Claims Gains in Tikrit
description: BAGHDAD  Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi declared Thursday that victory in Tikrit was near and achieved totally by Iraqi hands as his troops sought to root out Islamic State militants from their last few footholds in the city.

title: The Reach
description: On Jan. 15, 2014, Alex Honnold became the first person to free-solo El Sendero Luminoso (the Shining Path), a climbing route in El Porrero Chico, Mexico.

title: The Grip
description: In a scene from the film Valley Uprising, about the history of rock climbing in Yosemite National Park, Honnold climbs a route in Yosemite called the Phoenix.

title: A Fearless Climber
description: The author Daniel Duane discusses Alex Honnolds free solo climb of Heaven, a 3,000-foot vertical wall with a 40-foot overhang in Yosemite.

title: Asia Gears Up for Art Basel Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  When the third edition of Art Basel Hong Kong, Asias hottest contemporary art fair, opens to the public on Sunday, the atmosphere will be noticeably cooler, for reasons that have less to do with the regions overall economic slowdown than with the shift in the fairs dates from humid May to balmy March.

title: The Heart-Stopping Climbs of Alex Honnold
description: Fifteen miles outside Yosemite Valley, a beeping iPhone alarm awakened Alex Honnold at 4 a.m. in the white Ford Econoline van that he has called home for the last seven years. Honnold, who is 29 and one of the two or three best rock climbers on earth, sat up on his cheap foam mattress and switched on his headlamp in the darkness. The nearby Merced River made a soft rushing sound, and crickets hummed in the grass in the dry heat of June. Honnold rolled back his vans sliding side door to greet his ponytailed friend David Allfrey, who was also 29, emerging just then from an old VW camper van parked 10 feet away.

title: Review: Alex Gibney Takes On Scientology in Going Clear
description: Soon into Alex Gibneys investigative documentary Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief, you hear him lob a question at Lawrence Wright, the author of the 2013 nonfiction book the movie is based on. Scientology is such a subject of fascination for people, Mr. Gibney says off camera. How did you get engaged in the story?

title: At Georgia State, a Father and Son Tread a Fine Line
description: ATLANTA  Four years ago, the high school basketball standout R. J. Hunter entered his mothers bedroom in Indianapolis and interrupted her sleep with some news: He would cast his college basketball lot with Georgia State.

title: Another Ex-Cruz Tactician Joins Pauls Team
description: Ted Cruzs stable of political operatives continues to be a fertile place for Rand Paul to pluck talent.

title: British Inquiry Calls for Overhaul of Surveillance Laws but Clears Spy Agencies
