description: Steven Lutvak, 55, who composed A Gentlemans Guide to Love and Murder, had given up on having a family until he met Michael T. McGowan. He used his talents to thank his fianc with a wedding song.

title: Bill Cunningham |The Return of Happy Days
description: Winters fierce grip was finally broken early this week, and people reacted by shedding their puffy coats and pouring into the parks for lunch. On Fifth Avenue, the police horses pranced joyfully. Men took off their socks and juggling classes began in Bryant Park along with table tennismatches. The winter covers were taken off the carousels and the kiddies rushed on. Even a few bicyclists seemed to jump for joy, balancing on one wheel.And a very stubborn puppy had to be dragged down Fifth Avenue by his owner.

title: Evening Hours | Defrosted
description: Warmer temperatures brought extra cheer to the weeks celebrations.

title: The Strip  2014
description: Cartoons about current affairs from 2014.

title: Bush Says He Has Backbone on the Common Core
description: HUDSON, N.H.  Jeb Bush, making his first visit to New Hampshire as a likely presidential candidate, implicitly criticized his Republican rivals for the nomination for changing their positions on difficult issues.

title: Digging Through the Jewels of the Past to Bring Customers a Morsel of Nostalgia
description: One morning several weeks ago, Libby Diament prowled through the CJS Sales warehouse, in New Yorks garment center, a cardboard box tucked under her arm. Ms. Diament, a jewelry designer based in Washington, D.C., uses vintage parts in her Diament Jewelry line, and she was at CJS Sales, a wholesale liquidator, looking for inspiration in the cartons crammed with closeout crystals, cameos and other components acquired from companies that had gone out of business.

title: Video of Female Arab Anchor Shutting Down Rude Male Guest Amazes Western Viewers
description: When a Lebanese television host, Rima Karaki, abruptly ended a live interview with an old friend of Al Qaedas leader, Ayman al-Zawahri, two weeks ago  cutting off his microphone when he told her to be silent and let him continue  her station, Al Jadeed, was so pleased with her performance that it proudly posted the clip on YouTube, where it earned praise from dozens of her fans.

title: Albert Vecerkas Harlem
description: A photographers view of a neighborhoods changing streetscapes.

title: How Harlem Has Changed: Photographs by Albert Vecerka
description: Albert Vecerka first came to Harlem in 1993 to study architecture at the City College of New York, and he quickly learned two things. The first was that he was more interested in photographing buildings than in designing them. The second was that the neighborhood around him provided a story that could be told visually through its architecture. It was a story of money, which really does change everything: the height of buildings, the people living in them, the light in the morning or evening, the sounds and smells that constitute urban life.

title: Queens Woman Pleads Guilty in Fatal 2012 Subway Shove
description: A Queens woman who pushed a man to his death from an elevated train platform two years ago in what the authorities said was a hate crime pleaded guilty on Friday to first-degree manslaughter.

title: Catholics, Plastic Surgery, and the Truth of the Feminine Self
description: May a good Roman Catholic get a nose job? What about a tummy tuck? Or a breast enhancement? Does the tradition of Pope Francis, which has been getting such enthusiastic attention lately, have wisdom to offer about cosmetic surgery?

title: Oil Prices Drop as Production Hums Along Despite a Brimming Supply
description: LONDON  Just as the oil market appeared to be stabilizing, the price of crude resumed its descent on Friday.

title: An Early History of Blacks on Madison Avenue
description: Q. I was reading about the new Mad Men exhibition at the Museum of the Moving Image, and I got to wondering: When did blacks manage to break down the barriers on Madison Avenue and become ad executives?

title: Pope Francis Predicts His Papacy Will Be Brief
description: ROME  On the second anniversary of the start of his papacy, Pope Francis announced that the Roman Catholic Church would mark an extraordinary Holy Year in December, though he might not be celebrating many more anniversaries in the future.

title: Playing Police Officers, With a Car as Part of the Costume
description: The two men prowled the city after work, looking for targets  preferably someone outside, alone and using a cellphone, the police said.

title: On Rooftops and Trains, Daredevil Stunts in New York Can Turn Deadly
description: For generations of thrill-seeking New Yorkers, the citys landscape of tall buildings and byways has been an obstacle course of adventure, a test of courage and stamina.

title: British Leader Diverges From U.S. on China Policy and Military Spending
description: LONDON  The special relationship with Britain has been a cornerstone of American policy for generations, but in a tough election campaign, David Cameron, Britains Conservative prime minister, has distanced himself from the United States on two critically important issues  military spending and China.

title: The University of Oklahoma Video, and the Problem Fraternities Cant Fix Themselves
description: STORRS, Conn.  WHAT should we do about fraternities?

title: France Charges 2 Suspected of Ties to Gunman in Attacks
description: PARIS  French judges on Friday placed under formal investigation two men believed to have links to Amedy Coulibaly, one of the three gunmen involved in the terrorist attacks in and around Paris in January, the Paris prosecutors office said in a statement.

title: Dell Williams, Founder of Sex Boutique, Dies at 92
description: Dell Williams, who in 1974, after being humiliated by a department-store clerk when she tried to buy a vibrator, was moved to start Eves Garden, the New York boutique widely described as the nations first sex shop catering specifically to women, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 92.

title: Barred Fraternitys Lawyer Seeks to Alter Punishment
description: The fraternity chapter banished from the University of Oklahoma and evicted from its house after members were caught on video singing a racist song is seeking some other resolution to this matter and, failing that, may take the university to court, the groups lawyer said Friday.

title: Satirists, Led by Muslims, Find Much to Mock in ISIS
description: LONDON  Viewed more than one million times on YouTube, the blooper reel shows a knife-wielding executioner fumbling through his prepared text, in one instance mispronouncing circumstances as circumcision.

title: SEC Tournament Is Inundated by Kentucky Blue
description: NASHVILLE  Crowds swarmed through a light drizzle toward Bridgestone Arena, the site of the Southeastern Conference mens basketball tournament.

title: Out of Touch, Then Under the Sheets: A Review of The M Spot in Long Branch
description: Sex has always been on the front burner with us, says Maddie, a comely woman who has been married to Jerry for more than 40 years in The M Spot, a new play by Michael Tucker.

title: Justin Anderson of Virginia Falls, but Its Hard to Keep Him Down
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  This wasnt exactly the way Justin Anderson envisioned returning to the Virginia Cavaliers after a monthlong layoff with injuries.

title: Oil Company Lease Stirs Revolt in Green Seattle
description: SEATTLE  The environmental messaging never stops here, whether from a city-owned electric utility that gets nearly 98 percent of its power from sources untainted by carbon (and is not about to let residents forget it) or the fussy garbage collectors who can write tickets for the improper sorting of recyclables.

title: A Comedian Who Delivers in English, Gaelic and Mandarin
description: Des Bishop, an Irish comedian, looked around a nearly empty restaurant in Queens where a press agent was setting up a cardboard poster of Mr. Bishop, standing on the Great Wall of China, wearing a traditional Chinese robe and affecting a mock-serious kung fu pose while wielding a microphone.

title: Emissions by Makers of Energy Level Off
description: Somebody tapped the brakes.

title: Syracuse, Boeheim and the N.C.A.A.
description: There are few organizations that can make a mountain out of a molehill like the N.C.A.A. Believe it or not, the scathing report it issued last week, accusing Syracuse University and its basketball coach, Jim Boeheim, of a pattern of cheating, is a pretty good example.

title: From Sideline, V.C.U. Point Guard Still Energizes Team
description: For most of Virginia Commonwealth Universitys 70-67 victory over Richmond on Friday afternoon in the Atlantic 10 conference quarterfinals in Brooklyn, Briante Weber sat in a chair next to the V.C.U. bench and leaned against the scorers table.

title: Globe? Warm? Who, Me?
description: This is the time of year when we start to think about global warming. Because the weather is about to get warmer. Please God.

title: Unicef Clarifies Officials Remarks That Appeared to Call for Talks With Militants
description: Unicefs Syria representative touched off a minor tempest on Friday by appearing to propose that governments try to talk to the Islamic State, one of the worlds most violent extremist groups, about allowing aid workers to reach children in areas under its control.

title: Emails Hillary Clinton Said Were Kept Could Be Lost
description: WASHINGTON  As Hillary Rodham Clinton this week defended her use of a personal email account to conduct State Department business, she emphasized that because she was corresponding frequently with other department officials on their government accounts, the messages were preserved on government servers.

title: Forgoing the Pews to Minister to the Big Easts Benches
description: The Rev. Rob Hagan immediately thought of the parable of the barren fig tree. As the chaplain for the Villanova mens basketball team, he had just been on the winning end of a Big East tournament quarterfinal game, feeling the highs of seeing the Wildcats advance to the next round. After his team departed the news conference room, Hagan stayed behind to listen to Marquette, the team Villanova had just defeated.

title: You Try Living on the Minimum Wage
description: Over half a million workers in New York State subsist on the minimum wage of $8.75 an hour. Thats about $18,000 a year for those working 40 hours a week. Anyone who thinks that is generous should try spending just $350 a week on food, housing, gas and heat.

title: Turkeys Drift From NATO
description: The website of Turkeys Ministry of Foreign Affairs acknowledges that NATO has played a central role in the countrys security and insists that Turkey, which became a member in 1952, attaches utmost importance to it. Yet Turkeys commitment to the alliance has never seemed more ambivalent than it does now.

title: U.S. Clinician With Ebola Under Care in Maryland
As Yankees New Roommate, New York City F.C. Is Redecorating Carefully
description: A few players at a time, New York City F.C. trickled into Yankee Stadium, which was receiving a power wash and a good scrub on Friday afternoon. Two days ahead of the home opener for N.Y.C.F.C., one of Major League Soccers two new teams, nearly all the players were getting their first peek at the clubs home for the next three seasons  and perhaps longer.

title: Dont Expect Math to Make Sense
description: BALTIMORE  EACH year, March 14 is Pi Day, in honor of the mathematical constant. Saturday is the once-in-a-century event when the year, 15, brings the full date in line with the first five digits of pis decimal expansion  3.1415. Typical celebrations revolve around eating pies and composing pi-kus (haikus with three syllables in the first line, one in the second and four in the third). But perhaps a better way to commemorate the day is by trying to grasp what pi truly is, and why it remains so significant.

title: A Holocaust Survivor Tells of Auschwitz at 18 and, Again, at 90
description: BUDAPEST  HIGH above the hubbub of Budapests main tourist street, Eva Fahidi flits, birdlike, around her warm apartment, lined with books and plants. The setting is cozy, and the hostess and narrator, at 90, a lingeringly beautiful charmer. So the contrast with the Holocaust horror she is describing is all the more complete.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 13, 2015
description: March 13, 2015

title: Yoan Moncada Heads to Boston From Cuba, Encouraged by a Man Who Knows Both
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  It was an unusually cold day in early February at the Red Sox complex here. A group of men, most of them Bostons top talent evaluators, wore jackets and huddled in the dugout against the sting of the wind, watching Yoan Moncada, a 19-year-old Cuban second baseman, go through his audition.

title: The Final Post-Mortem on Sandy Hook
description: NEWTOWN, Conn.  It is the small detail as much as the horrific event that stands out starkly in a governor-appointed panels final proposals for preventing another massacre like the one that took the lives of 20 children and six school workers in December 2012.

title: What the Rainbow Flag Signifies
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Well, this was a really fun puzzle.

title: Obama Visits Phoenix V.A. Hospital
description: The president spoke about the need to restore trust and confidence in the V.A. system.

title: A $19.69 Liquid Lunch to Honor the End of Mad Men
description: New York is preparing to celebrate the end of the Mad Men era with discounted dining at a select group of restaurants  with a twist or, perhaps, an olive or two.

title: Keep Mom Away From the Pet Rabbit: A Review of The Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds, in Croton Falls
description: Beatrice, who dominates Paul Zindels The Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds, has scarcely taken the stage before she calls her youngest daughter ugly, sick, a stone tied around her neck. Within minutes she threatens to use chloroform on the girls pet rabbit, and you know what Chekhov taught us: If a gun, or in this case chloroform, is introduced in the first act, youd better worry that it might be used by the last.

title: Jeb Bush, a Clinton Critic, Took Time Releasing His Own Emails
description: Jeb Bush has rebuked Hillary Rodham Clinton for her use of a private email account as secretary of state, holding up his own conduct as an example of transparency in government.

title: A Funeral, an Heirloom, and What It All Means: A Review of Bad Jews in New Haven
description: If looks could kill, no one would survive long in Daphna Feygenbaums company. A senior at Vassar, shes supersmart, superconceited and super-self-righteous. And she has no compunctions about flaunting her utter contempt for the lesser beings who cross her path, throwing them hostile glances and baleful stares. In Bad Jews, the corrosive comedy by Joshua Harmon at Long Wharf Theaters Stage II, the objects of her scorn are her cousins, Jonah and Liam, and Liams latest non-Jewish girlfriend, Melody, whom Daphna rightly if rudely describes as having the appearance of something conceived in a Talbots store.

title: Cuba: U.S. Diplomat to Return for Third Round of Talks
description: The United States and Cuba will hold a third round of talks next week about restoring diplomatic ties and reopening embassies as they seek to work through sticking points that have emerged since President Obama and President Ral Castro of Cuba announced a push toward normal relations in December. The talks were abruptly scheduled at the invitation of the Cubans. The United States will be represented by Roberta S. Jacobson, Washingtons top diplomat for the Americas. Ms. Jacobson will travel to Havana on Sunday, and a senior official at the State Department said she would probably stay until midweek. No announcements were expected, but the sides planned to discuss issues holding up plans to reopen embassies before a regional summit meeting in April. Cuba wants to be removed from the State Departments list of nations that sponsor international terrorism and seeks access to banking for its diplomatic posts in the United States. American officials are pushing for an increase in the number of staff members at the planned American Embassy in Havana and unrestricted travel for diplomats on the island. The two sides held talks in Havana in January and in Washington last month, reporting progress but no breakthroughs.

title: Myanmar Warplane Kills Four Farmers in China
description: HONG KONG  Four farmers in southwest China were killed Friday when one or more bombs released from a warplane from Myanmar struck a sugar cane field, as fighting between Myanmars government forces and an ethnic group pressed against the frontier with China.

title: Disputed Foul Helps Villanova Reach Big East Final, Ending Drought
description: There was disconsolation in the Providence locker room, and frustration, and certainly a little simmering anger, and then there was Kris Dunn, who seemed to wipe away the dejection of a 2-point loss like sweat from his brow.

title: At the Iron Skillet in Mattituck, Its Kind of Like Dinner at Grandmas House
description: Bob Hartz was nervous about the three reservations he had taken for the last Saturday night of February.

title: Obama Reinforces Bond With Wounded Veteran at Arizona Home
description: GILBERT, Ariz.  If one relationship embodies the burden President Obama has carried as a wartime commander in chief, it may be the one with Sgt. First Class Cory Remsburg, an Army Ranger who was severely wounded in Afghanistan.

title: Where the Owners Barbecue Skills Are Front and Center: A Review of 360 American Grille in Mamaroneck
description: When Randy Garden took over a restaurant space in Mamaroneck several years ago, he couldnt help noticing the elaborate six-foot firepit left by the previous occupant, a Portuguese establishment called Piri-Q.

description: When we picture George Washington, what image springs to mind?

title: Brandon Marshall Hopes Jets Will Be His Final Stop
description: Brandon Marshall hopes to make the Jets the fourth and final stop of a career marked by a surprising amount of movement for a wide receiver of his caliber.

title: Full Menu, Stuffed Plates: A Review of Aoyama in Wyckoff
description: Ive always been skeptical of long menus. Is it really possible for a restaurant to serve such a large variety of dishes successfully?

title: Portugals Heritage, Soaked in Wine and Garlic: A Review of Primavera Pub in Hartford
description: Years ago I toured a chourio factory in Fall River, Mass., and its owner told me about sending packets of the spicy sausage to soldiers abroad  young men and women from that citys tight-knit Portuguese-American community, serving their country far from home, solaced by a beloved heritage food.

title: Warming Up for Love
description: Its been a winter in which, like worried prehistoric tribesmen, many of us wondered whether the snow and cold would ever end. But now that they have  at least for the moment  people have opened their jackets and their hearts. These poems about love amid the thaw were all found in recent days in the Missed Connections section at newyork.craigslist.org. They are reprinted verbatim with only line and stanza breaks added; their titles are their subheadings.

title: Serena Williams Gets a Win and an Ovation in Her Return to Indian Wells
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Serena Williams was conspicuously absent from the BNP Paribas Open for 13 years, so she could be forgiven for lingering in her return. Making her first appearance at the tournament since the 2001 final, Williams, the world No. 1, defeated Monica Niculescu, 7-5, 7-5, in 2 hours 3 minutes in front of fans so firmly behind her, their cheers were like a wind at her back.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) TAMMY (2014) After losing her car, her job and her husband in a single day, a fast-food worker (Melissa McCarthy) embarks on an adventure of self-discovery in a blue Cadillac with her grandmother (Susan Sarandon), like an intergenerational Thelma and Louise. Tammys journey, as they like to say in movieland, is into self-worth, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about this road movie, written by Ms. McCarthy with her husband, Ben Falcone, who directed. Yet the far more interesting trip here, at least until her self-actualization kicks in, is through an America of lousy jobs, tyrannical bosses, nickel-and-diming poverty and real-looking women. The jokes about Tammys appetite register as both tedious and borderline desperate, Ms. Dargis added, and suggest that Ms. McCarthy may not yet be comfortable in her own skin on screen. But the radicalness of Ms. McCarthys success, she added, is that shes a beautiful, funny, wildly popular female comic with terrific timing, movie star presence and oodles of charm. That she also happens to be fat may be historically notable although it is, finally, the most ordinary thing about her.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: A lady said, I really want to make a perfume that smells like my horse. I said, Whoa. That kind of challenge I dont get every day.

description: There are all sorts of activities required of the people who remodel the homes of tech titans in Silicon Valley. Laying reclaimed-wood flooring, installing ever-tinier bathroom tiles, wiring the network.

description: Reflecting growing anxiety, membership in paramilitary groups in Poland has increased substantially since Russia began interfering in Ukraine last year.

description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  Secretary of State John Kerry on Saturday promised a decision soon about a restoration of military aid to Egypt that was suspended after the military takeover of the country in 2013.

description: CHANDLER, Ariz.  Long after Dan Joness last flight over Vietnam ended in wreckage and blood, his combat tour was never quite complete.

description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

description: When I tell people that macroeconomic analysis has been triumphantly successful in recent years, I tend to get strange looks. After all, wasnt everyone predicting lots of inflation? Didnt policymakers get it all wrong? Havent the academic economists been squabbling nonstop?

description: Tim Duy is having a debate with Scott Sumner, who insists that the strong dollar wont hurt US growth.

title: Happy Pi Day! Or Is It Pie?
description: Today is a magical day for math lovers and pie lovers. Its the date on the calendar that happens once a century  3/14/15  and matches the ratio of a circles circumference to its diameter, otherwise known as pi.

title: City Council Races Offer Change in Ferguson After Months of Upheaval
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  They gathered under the fluorescent lights of the First Baptist Church here one night last week to lay out visions for their battered town, four aspiring politicians, two white and two black, debating the daunting challenges of rebuilding Ferguson.

title: C.I.A. Cash Ended Up in Coffers of Al Qaeda
description: WASHINGTON  In the spring of 2010, Afghan officials struck a deal to free an Afghan diplomat held hostage by Al Qaeda. But the price was steep  $5 million  and senior security officials were scrambling to come up with the money.

title: Iran Negotiators Face Late Obstacles to a Deal
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and Iran are closing in on a historic agreement to limit Irans nuclear program, but are confronting serious last-minute obstacles, including when United Nations sanctions would be lifted and how inspections would be conducted, American and European officials said.

title: Cyclone Hits Island Nation of Vanuatu, Killing 8
description: HONG KONG  A cyclone mauled the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu on Saturday, killing at least eight people, tearing apart many homes and leaving residents to fear even worse death and destruction on remoter parts of the archipelago that remained out of contact.

title: Unfriended and The Final Girls Generate Screams at SXSW
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  On Friday the 13th, the South by Southwest film festival started off with a creepy and occasionally funny bang. Audiences had a variety of horror options, including demon possession dramas, haunted Skype chillers and 80s slasher remixes.

title: Seattles Magic Number for Playoffs? 700 Runs, Manager Says
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  Lloyd McClendon has a figure in mind for the Seattle Mariners, a dream that has eluded this franchise in each of the last seven seasons. McClendon, the Mariners manager and a former hitting coach, wants his team to score 700 runs.

title: Americans Evacuated FromSierra Leone After Possible Ebola Contact
description: The first of a group of 10 American aid workers who may have come into contact with the Ebola virus in Sierra Leone were evacuated on Saturday, American government and aid officials said. They will be the largest group of Americans to have returned home over fears of exposure to the virus since an outbreak in three West African countries was declared last year.

title: Stephen J. Immelt of Hogan Lovells: Raised to Believe You Can Fix This
description: This interview with  Stephen J. Immelt, C.E.O. of Hogan Lovells, an international law firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: S.E.C. Wants the Sinners to Own Up
description: For decades, the Securities and Exchange Commission has allowed companies and individuals to make settlements without admitting any wrongdoing. Even a company committing an egregious sin that cost investors millions of dollars could walk away from the proceedings without ever acknowledging its role.

title: A World Cup Late in the Year Promises Smiles and Headaches
description: Presumably even the credulity-straining organization that is FIFA would have voted for a host other than Qatar if it had been clear the 2022 World Cup was to be held in November and December.

title: A New Look for College?
description: Readers discuss the pluses and minuses of the online learning model.

title: The Church of TED
description: CHANCES are you will not attend TED this year. Tickets to the gathering that begins Monday in Vancouver are sold out, this despite or rather because of the fact that gaining entry to the ideas conference entails more than pulling out your credit card. Theres a velvet rope of an application process, and questions to answer: How would a friend describe your accomplishments? What are you passionate about? Two references have to vouch for you.

title: What My Friends Mean to Me
description: MY phone doesnt ring much anymore. It used to at all hours, but since I stopped answering, most of my friends have stopped calling. Mostly, I receive invitations by email, which is good, as it gives me time to compose my regrets. Im way too busy this week, how about next month? All week I field invitations this way, worried constantly about my schedule being overwhelmed. Then the weekend arrives, and I find myself with nothing to do.

title: Birth of a Freedom Anthem
description: FRESNO, Calif.  FIFTY years ago today, on March 15, 1965, President Lyndon B. Johnson announced plans to submit a new voting rights bill before a joint session of Congress. His speech came after several weeks of violence in and around Selma, Ala., that had taken the lives of two civil rights activists and left dozens of others bloodied. Seventy million Americans watched on television as Johnson, a Texas Democrat who had supported segregationist policies early in his career, proclaimed racial discrimination not a Negro problem but an American problem. It is not, he said, just Negroes, but really it is all of us, who must overcome the crippling legacy of bigotry and injustice. Then, after a pause, he added, And we shall overcome.

title: A Christian Nation? Since When?
description: AMERICA may be a nation of believers, but when it comes to this countrys identity as a Christian nation, our beliefs are all over the map.

title: College Applications and Criminal Records
description: Americans who have criminal histories are often stymied when they encounter college entry applications that ask if they have ever been convicted of crimes. The process, which often brings greater scrutiny to people who answer yes, is driving away large numbers of people who present no danger to campus safety and are capable of succeeding academically.

title: Slaverys Enduring Resonance
description: NEW HAVEN  LAST week, a milestone passed for my family in South Carolina  the 150th anniversary of the last day of slavery. We were the slaveholders.

title: The Strip

title: More and Better Telecom Options
description: Even before the Federal Communications Commission adopted strong net neutrality rules last month, some Republican lawmakers were saying that what the country really needed was an update to the nations main communications law. It is old, they argued, and does not address the ways in which people use the Internet today. Congress should certainly review the law, but it should be careful not to undermine a statute that has contributed to the success of the Internet and wireless telecommunications.

title: To Kill a Chicken
description: IF you torture a single chicken and are caught, youre likely to be arrested. If you scald thousands of chickens alive, youre an industrialist who will be lauded for your acumen.

title: For Poorer and Richer
description: SOME arguments are hard to settle but are too important to avoid. Here is one: whether the social crisis among Americas poor and working class  the collapse of the two-parent family, the weakening of communal ties  is best understood as a problem of economics or of culture.

title: Lessons From a Traffic Light
description: Jeremy will be here in a few minutes. I like Jeremy enormously and really want to help him. But I know how it will go. Hell smile and apologize. Hell talk about feeling weak and inarticulate and unsuccessful. Hell be angry with his father for being dismissive and pigheaded. Ill struggle to find a new way to speak to him about these old issues. Well both sound repetitive and tired. But right now, in these several minutes before his session, I sip my coffee and observe the pedestrians outside my window.

title: How Many Mutual Funds Routinely Rout the Market? Zero
description: The bull market in stocks turned six last Monday, and despite some rocky stretches  like last week, when the market fell  it has generally been a very pleasant time for money managers, who have often posted good numbers.

title: Coaxing a Tight-Lipped Insurer to Speak Up
description: To begin, a quick update from our last episode, which was about Ideal Image, the laser hair-removal chain. In 2013, the company began including skin care products with treatments. The products were promoted as free, but the price for services went up by the same amount as the retail price of those oils and lotions once they were part of the treatment package  adding $250 or more to the bill.

title: An Ever-Bleaker Syria, From All Vantage Points
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Government helicopters rained barrel bombs on villages across Syria last week, killing civilians and demolishing homes. Hundreds of combatants died in battles that failed to move the front lines. And activists spread videos of hungry, war-weary Syrians through social media.

title: Auditioning for the Role of Young Professional
description: Working as an employee can be infantilizing, as I discovered during the two entry-level office jobs I held as a recent college graduate in the late 1980s. Take no more than an hour for lunch and await your biweekly paycheck the way a hatchling anticipates a worm. Request vacation and hope for approval from on high. Learn whether youve been good or bad in your annual review.

Barrow, who championed civil rights for minorities, women, gay people and consumers; opposed the war in Vietnam and apartheid; and mentored generations of community organizers, including a young Chicagoan named Barack Obama, died on Thursday at her home in Chicago. She was 90.

title: Brian Sutton-Smith, Scholar of Whats Fun, Dies at 90
description: Brian Sutton-Smith, a developmental psychologist whose work  prolific, scholarly and precedent-setting  was quite literally childs play, died on March 7 in White River Junction, Vt. He was 90.

description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  Not far from the Sticky Fingers nightclub, three Romanian women were hunched against the cold on a street corner. When a man walked by, the women, in broken Swedish and English, tried to tempt him to buy sex.

title: Breaking Silence, Survivor Sets Out to Meet Holocaust Past

title: Hanley Ramirez Has New Position and Attitude in Return to the Red Sox

title: SXSW 2015: A First Look at Angie Tribeca, Steve Carells New TV Series
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The first five minutes of the pilot for the TBS comedy Angie Tribeca, co-created by Steve Carell, contain more gags than a full episode of most sitcoms. It starts with the titular police officer (Rashida Jones) going through her morning training ritual, which becomes more and more outrageous as the scene progresses. In the tradition of spoof comedy series like Police Squad and Sledge Hammer this new show takes satirical aim at the procedural. The festival showed the first two episodes as part of their Episodic program, which presents television premieres.

title: A Frontier Land Dispute, Circa 2015, Pits Modernization Against the Past
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo.  For five years, a sign has stood on a patch of grass in this small city, beckoning to each passer-by. FREE houses, it reads, along with a phone number.

title: A Scratch, but Little Concern for Zack Wheeler
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Throughout his young career and without the publics knowledge, Zack Wheeler, the Mets right-handed starter, has pitched at times with tenderness in his right elbow. Last year, it flared up more than usual, but he still made every start, threw every bullpen session and had a fine season.

title: One Dies and Three Are Rescued After Tugboat Sinks Near Fire Island
description: One man died when a tugboat sank off the coast of Fire Island on Saturday, said the Coast Guard, which rescued three other members of the ships crew from frigid ocean waters one mile offshore.

title: Late Shot Extends Harvards Run and Yales Drought in Ivy League
description: PHILADELPHIA  It was a throwback game played in a throwback gym, Harvards spellbinding 53-51 victory over Yale on Saturday, a sublime relic of dusty yearning and desperation.

title: Al Rosen, Who Missed Triple Crown by a Step, Dies at 91

Duffy and John M. Duffy of Bloomington, Minn. The Rev. Daniel P. OReilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Corpus Christi Church in New York.

description: Ryann Ashley Engel and Jared Evan Shure were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Roger Ross at the Crystal Plaza in Livingston, N.J.

title: Rachel Grisham, Michael Gapen

description: Heather Higbee Bryant and Bradley Rolison Bailey were married Saturday evening at the Church in the Forest in Pebble Beach, Calif. The Rev. Charles Anker, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Lisa Stroh and Matthew Libbey
description: Lisa Childress Stroh and Matthew Clarke Champney Libbey were married Saturday evening at Coral Gables Congregational Church in Coral Gables, Fla. The Rev. Milan R. Kralik, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony.

title: Erin Haber,  James Preciado III
description: Erin Nicole Levin Haber and James John Preciado III were married Saturday evening at the Hotel Monaco in Washington. Rabbi Harold S. White officiated, with the participation of the Rev. Julia A. Jarvis, a minister of the United Church of Christ.

title: Max Kaplan and Seth Levin
description: Max Avi Kaplan, the son of Grisel A. Kaplan and Michael J. Kaplan of Westfield, N.J., and Dr. Seth Nathan Levin, a son of Bernice K. Levin and Mark L. Levin of Assonet, Mass., are to be married Sunday. Rabbi Katy Allen, staff chaplain at Brigham and Womens Hospital, will officiate at LEspalier, a restaurant in Boston.

title: Ashley Futrell and Fletcher Smith III
description: Ashley Ann Futrell and Fletcher Nathaniel Smith III were married Saturday evening at Allen Temple A.M.E. Church in Greenville, S.C. The Rev. James E. Speed Sr., a pastor in the African Methodist Episcopal Church, performed the ceremony.

title: Mary Gazella,  Gabe Ghearing
description: Mary Christine Gazella and Gabe Ryan Ghearing were married Saturday at the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church in New York. The Rev. Scott Black Johnston, a Presbyterian minister and the senior pastor at the church, performed the ceremony.

title: Stephanie Kane,  Eric Hochberger
description: Stephanie Augusta Kane and Eric Philip Hochberger are to be married Sunday by Cantor Carrie Barry at Casa Marina, a hotel in Key West, Fla.

title: Christine Hew and Dawson Kaaua
description: Christine Mika Pualoke Nyuk Foon Hew and Dawson Kealakekuawela Zenho Kaaua were married Saturday at Kahua Ranch in Kamuela, Hawaii. The Rev. Tom Fernandez, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated.

title: Elizabeth Ackerman,  Matthew LaCasse
description: Elizabeth Warren Ackerman and Matthew Parrish LaCasse were married Saturday at the Big Sky Chapel in Big Sky, Mont. The Rev. Brad Lartigue, a Southern Baptist minister and the chaplain of Big Sky Resort, performed the ceremony.

title: Running and Traveling the World Over
description: Sophia Mengfei Lee and Christopher Alan Suarez were married Saturday at the Edison Park Lutheran Church in Chicago. The Rev. Dr. Michael D. Sparby, a Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Steven Lutvak,  Michael McGowan
description: Steven Jaret Lutvak and Michael Todd McGowan were married Saturday evening at Lafayette Grand Caf and Bakery in New York. Cantor Daniel Neiden officiated.

title: Bus Plunges Off Cliff in Brazil, Killing Scores of Passengers
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A bus plunged off a cliff in the southern Brazilian state of Santa Catarina on Saturday, killing more than 40 people, emergency response officials said.

title: Whats on TV Sunday
description: 10 P.M. (E!) THE ROYALS Elizabeth Hurley and Vincent Regan portray the foul-mouthed Queen Helena and bewildered King Simon, the rulers of a decadent if fictional British dynasty in this nighttime soap, the networks first scripted series. Leading their unruly brood is Prince Liam (William Moseley, above center, with Ms. Hurley and Mr. Regan), the heir apparent after his older brother dies, who angers his mother by sleeping with the daughter (Merritt Patterson) of the queens head of security. Princess Eleanor (Alexandra Park), meanwhile, likes to drink, take drugs, seduce servants and bodyguards, and party in Paris nightclubs without any underwear. The Royals should be a hoot, but it actually gets old, and dull, very quickly, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. It turns out that campy faux queens and princes cant keep up with the real-life Elizabeth II and her progeny  or with reality show royals. The Season 10 opener of Keeping Up With the Kardashians  in which Kim and her husband, Kanye West, have sex in a bathroom, and family members act as if nothing were going on with Bruce Jenner, despite his ponytail and changing face  leads in at 9. Of the two series, the Kardashians are better at keeping up appearances, Ms. Stanley added. The monarchy has survived in Britain for so many centuries partly because it protects its mystique and doesnt bend to reality. The Kardashians have held onto their perch on cable television for 10 seasons for much the same reason.

title: Sex and Violence, Beyond the Script
description: In the summer of 2012 the actress Marin Ireland, a past Tony Award nominee, was dating Scott Shepherd, a fellow theater star. They were in London, preparing to perform as the title lovers in Troilus and Cressida. Offstage, though, they were arguing about their relationship. According to interviews with both, Ms. Ireland slapped Mr. Shepherd one night at their apartment; two nights later he slapped her with enough force that he knocked her to the floor. When Ms. Ireland walked into rehearsal the next morning, she had a black eye.

title: Corrections: March 15, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Myanmar Is Issued Warning by Chinese Premier Over Bombing Deaths
description: HONG KONG  Chinas premier, Li Keqiang, delivered his governments highest-profile warning yet to Myanmar over violence spilling across the border, when he used an annual news conference on Sunday to condemn the deaths of four Chinese farmers he said were killed by a bomb from a Myanmar warplane.

title: Chinese Premier Vows Tougher Regulation on Air Pollution
description: BEIJING  Premier Li Keqiang of China said on Sunday that the government was failing to satisfy public demands to stanch pollution and would impose heavier punishments to cut the toxic smog that was the subject of a popular documentary belatedly banned by censors.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Catch up on the weeks top stories.

title: In Los Angeles, a Street-Smart Art Tour
description: While preparing to teach a contemporary art course last spring, Lizy Dastin found herself exploring urban art sprinkled throughout Los Angeles, be it tucked away in a park, splashed across the side of a building or painted on a sidewalk.

title: Flights Over Vanuatu Are Expected to Reveal Cyclone Devastation
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Struck by a ferocious cyclone, the South Pacific islands that make up Vanuatu were expected to discover widespread destruction and a sharply higher death toll with aerial surveys beginning Monday.

title: I Miss My Daddy. Divorce Stinks.
description: It has been almost a year since my ex-husband and I separated. And today, we walked into a mediators office and got a majority of a divorce agreement drafted. Before you ask how we did that so fast, let me share that we have no property to fight over and no money. We had also already worked out our own custody schedule together, and know we have plenty of time to work out the kinks, at least before our daughter starts elementary school. All we needed to do was deal with the fine print. As sad as it was to have it almost over, I know its for the best and so does my ex.

title: Suicide Attacks on Pakistan Churches Kill 15
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  Suicide bombers attacked two Christian churches here during Sunday services, killing at least 15 people and wounding dozens in the latest attack on religious minorities in the country.

title: Bowling Perfection, Three Times Over
description: Bill Fong wasnt confident he was going to bowl 900 until the last shot. It was a regular Monday night league game at his local bowling ally, where he had practiced many times before.

title: Chicago Candidate With Sunny Attitude Is Cloudy on Specifics
description: CHICAGO  When asked for his position on the pressing issues facing Chicago, Jesus G. Garcia, the man trying to unseat Mayor Rahm Emanuel, often has an answer  and sometimes more than one.

title: Robert Durst of HBOs The Jinx Says He Killed Them All
description: Since his first wife vanished more than three decades ago, Robert A. Durst, the eccentric and estranged son of one of New Yorks most prominent real estate dynasties, has lived under the suspicious gaze of law enforcement officials in three states.

title: Styles Collide to Serve Flamenco
description: When flamenco comes to large theaters, it sometimes gets carried away, with splashy theatrical concepts masking the essence of music and dance. Generations of Gypsy Flamenco, an event at Town Hall, promises the opposite: flamenco for its own sake, danced by three revered practitioners whose roots in the form run deep. Concha Vargas, Pepe Torres and the up-and-coming Gema Moneo, all from the southern Spanish region of Andalusia, belong to different branches of flamencos intricate family tree.

title: Tests of Cholesterol Drugs Offer Hope of Reducing Heart Attacks and Strokes
description: A new class of experimental cholesterol drugs might sharply reduce the risk of heart attacks and strokes, researchers reported on Sunday, citing what they described as preliminary evidence.

title: A Week of Beginnings on Instagram
description: This past weeks @nytimes Instagram launch, seven projects on the theme Beginnings, concludes today with three portraits by Newsha Tavakolian (@newshatavakolian), a photographer in Iran whose work will be featured soon on NYTimes.com.

title: JetBlue Mint to Travel to Caribbean in High-Flying Style
description: JetBlue  which last summer introducedprivate suites,the longest beds in the United States domestic marketand a tapas-style menu as part of its new Mint business-class cabin  plans to announce on Monday that it will expand its Mint service to the Caribbean.

title: 1915: Blind Child Sends Scarf to British Admiral
description: LONDON  All the other blind girls thank you and all the brave sailors and soldiers for defending us, wrote Kathleen Torr, a blind child, living at York, to Admiral Sir John Jellicoe in a letter in Braille, accompanying a scarf she had knitted herself. Kathleen added that if Sir John would accept the gift she would be the happiest little girl in England, and the admiral not only accepted it, but sent a long letter of thanks in reply. Directly the admiral saw your scarf, wrote Sir Johns secretary, he put it on and said: I shall put on dear little Kathleens scarf when I am very cold.

title: Filmmaker Wont Weep for the Cuba He Left Behind
description: Thirty years ago, Leon Ichaso made Crossover Dreams, a heartfelt independent movie that starred a young Ruben Blades as an ambitious salsa singer. Both Mr. Ichaso and Mr. Blades went on to greater success. Unfortunately, the film itself  the actual negatives stored in reels inside cans  has languished in obscurity. Mr. Ichaso has no idea where.

title: Forget the Ball, Cinderella Is the Belle of the Box Office
description: Never underestimate what Disney can do with a princess. Cinderella, a live-action retelling of the classic fairytale with Lily James in the title role, took in $70.05 million at North American theaters over the weekend, a result on par with the initial sum generated by Disneys smash hit Maleficent last year.

title: Advocates Press Cuomo to Take Action on Paid Family Leave Legislation
description: Ask Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo whether he champions the working women of New York and he proudly points to his agenda: his efforts to bolster laws against sexual harassment, domestic violence and salary discrimination, as well as his push to increase the minimum wage.

title: 1965: Martin Luther King Jr. Leads Walk in Selma
description: SELMA, Ala.  City officials lowered the Selma Wall today and the Rev. Martin Luther King led more than 1,500 Negroes and whites to the Dallas County courthouse to honor the Rev. James J. Reeb, fatally beaten here last week. Police and state troopers, under order to give the marchers maximum protection, lined the route to the courthouse, which is only three blocks from the spot where Mr. Reeb was clubbed.

title: Human Trafficking Bill Stands in Way of Pick for Attorney General
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate will not consider the nomination of Loretta E. Lynch to be attorney general until it moves forward on a stalled human trafficking bill, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, said Sunday.

title: Caught by Surprise: One-Second Win in N.Y.C. Half
description: It started as a half-marathon and ended as a sprint.

title: Man, 20, Is Arrested in the Shooting of 2 Officers in Ferguson
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  A 20-year-old suspect was charged Sunday with shooting two police officers during a protest outside Police Headquarters here Thursday. Law enforcement officials said the man, Jeffrey L. Williams, claimed to have been targeting someone other than the officers and shot them by accident from inside a car.

title: Iranian Court Sentences Son of Former President to 15 Years in Prison
description: TEHRAN  An Iranian court handed down a 15-year prison sentence to the son of former President Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, after he was convicted of bribery and embezzlement, a judiciary official said on Sunday.

title: Asia Week Is Highlighted by Robert Hatfield Ellsworth Sale
description: The piece was jade, a cylindrical Chinese cong from the sixth century B.C., and Lu Yizheng, a 33-year-old collector from Shanghai, was all over it. Nose to the stone, he followed the pinpoint beam of his small penlight, looking for imperfections, as four friends pressed against him for a closer view and loudly debated the merits. This is the best of the jade I have seen, Mr. Lu said. The size and the quality are good; so is the provenance of the jade.

title: Review: Death and the Damsel, a Paul Taylor Premiere on Sex Trafficking
description: A man, gripping a womans raised and parted legs by the ankles, presents those straightened legs to us like a V between him and us. Those ankles might be the handlebars of some motorcycle hes riding; her supine torso and head are invisible to us. But hes looking down fixedly at her groin, and theres no doubt shes being used for sex.

title: At Gridiron Club Dinner, Anyone and Everyone Is Fair Game for Obama
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama often seems weary of being a political punching bag. But on Saturday night, he was loose and relaxed-looking as he turned the tables for a few minutes.

title: Courting Favor
description: In a series of articles, Eric Lipton of The New York Times examines the explosion in lobbying of state attorneys general by corporate interests and the millions in campaign donations they now provide.

title: Boston-Area Bridge Duo Win the Baldwin North American Pairs
description: NEW ORLEANS  The first title of the Spring North American Championships, the Baldwin North American Pairs, was decided here on Thursday evening.

title: Review: The Dream of My Return, by Horacio Castellanos Moya
description: There are dozens of moments in The Dream of My Return, the swift, stunning new novel by Horacio Castellanos Moya, when the reader expects its narrative to move toward the surreal. Its a reasonable expectation. His first book published in the United States had the telling title of Senselessness and featured a narrator who began, I am not complete in my mind, then became decreasingly reliable from there.

title: N.C.A.A. Tournament 2015: Villanova, Duke and Wisconsin Join Kentucky as No. 1 Seeds
description: NASHVILLE  CBS broadcast Marylands team at the moment the Terrapins learned where they would be seeded in the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament. The looks on their faces conveyed a mix of punch-drunk disbelief and dread. They had been placed in Kentuckys quadrant.

title: Etsys Success Gives Rise to Problems of Credibility and Scale
description: Depending on whom you ask, Alicia Shaffer, owner of the hit Etsy store Three Bird Nest, is a runaway success story  or an emblem of everything that has gone wrong with the fast-growing online marketplace for handmade goods.

title: Review: iZombie, the Undead as a Force for Good
description: Lets see, whats the right adjective to describe the CW series that begins Tuesday night and is centered on the eating of human brains? Heck, theres no getting around it: Tasty is the word.

title: Review: Martha Graham Dance Company in an Intimate Performance
description: Have you ever wanted to take off your shoes and walk around an Isamu Noguchi set? On Friday night at the 92nd Street Y, this intermission treat came courtesy of the Martha Graham Dance Company. Preceding a performance of Grahams Cave of the Heart, a distillation of the Medea story, audience members were given the rare chance to examine a serpent topped by a wire dress and a series of stones leading to an aorta-shaped sculpture, among the many pieces of dcor that Noguchi designed for Graham.

title: China and the Dalai Lama
description: Chinas Communist party leaders have warned the Dalai Lama that he must reincarnate.

title: V.C.U. Gets the Victory in Showcase of a Legacy
description: Melvin Johnson grew up on West 125th Street in Harlem, dreaming of following in the footsteps of local basketball legends like Kemba Walker and Felipe Lopez by playing at Rice High School.

title: Review: Herb Alpert and Lani Hall Bring Rhythmic Precision toCaf Carlyle
description: A relaxed feeling of enjoyment along with a certainty of being in good hands warmed Caf Carlyle on Friday evening as Herb Alpert and Lani Hall wafted a mood of easygoing optimism into the room. Mr. Alpert, who mentioned that he will soon turn 80, still embodies the musical attitude nicknamed laid-back decades ago, when Southern California was Americas frontier of pleasure.

title: Empac Shrugs Popularity to Promote Creative Liberty in Troy, N.Y.
description: TROY, N.Y.  On Saturday evening, chilly and foggy here, a small group of people stood at the edge of the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute campus and gazed up at the looming facade of the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center.

title: Review: Jamaica Inn on BBC Resurrects a Downton Abbey Star
description: The BBC mini-series Jamaica Inn has a variety of hooks. For readers of Gothic thrillers, its based on a novel by the queen of the form, Daphne du Maurier. For film buffs, its a counterpart to an already well-known adaptation of the book, the 1939 movie of the same title by Alfred Hitchcock.

title: Without Joan Rivers, Fashion Police Is Falling Apart
description: Ever since Joan Rivers died in September, Fashion Police  the E! show devoted to poking holes in celebrity pageantry that she had hosted since its inception  has been collapsing in plain view.

title: American Dance Festival Announces 2015 Lineup
description: The Chinese choreographer and visual artist Shen Wei is in some ways a child of the American Dance Festival, where his blend of aesthetic drama and calligraphic movement was nurtured, and where he started his company 15 years ago. To honor that anniversary, Shen Wei Dance Arts returns to Durham, N.C., this summer to premiere Untitled #12-2, one of 11 commissions that compose the 82nd annual season of the festival, which runs from June 11 to July 25. Mr. Shens new work, inspired by his paintings at Art Basel Miami, is paired with a reimagined version of his 2005 work Map (June 11-13). Other headliners will include the festival staples Pilobolus, which will introduce Thresh|Hold, a world-premiere collaboration with the Venezuelan choreographer Javier de Frutos (June 18-20); and the newly renamed Paul Taylors American Modern Dance, bringing classics from Mr. Taylors six-decade career (July 2-4). As usual, the festival will feature work by North Carolina choreographers, like Kristen Jeppsen Groves and Karola Lttringhaus, who are tackling political and social issues (June 25), and spotlight dance in cinema with the International Screendance Festival, on four consecutive Sundays, starting June 28.

title: Managers Turn to Computer Games, Aiming for More Efficient Employees
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A few days before he testified in a sex discrimination lawsuit that has captivated Silicon Valley, John Doerr, arguably the most famous venture capitalist in the world, was sitting at a conference room table laying out his ideas on good management.

title: Chitchat
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Theres something you should know about me. Im on the petite side. And I dont appreciate being called names, Ian Livengood.

title: A Rare Look Into Ones Life on File in China
description: Whether it is national identification cards embedded with biometric chips or birth permits for expectant mothers, the Chinese are accustomed to authoritarian intrusions into their private lives.

title: In Nationwide Protests, Angry Brazilians Call for Ouster of President
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Hundreds of thousands of protesters took to the streets in cities across Brazil on Sunday to express their ire at President Dilma Rousseff, raising pressure on her as she grapples with an onslaught of challenges including an economy mired in stagnation, a sweeping bribery scandal and a revolt by some of the most powerful figures in her governing coalition.

title: Revival of Ghost Airport Stirs Hope in Spain
description: MADRID  The ghost airport of Castelln on Spains east coast had become a symbol of the countrys reckless spending and its boom-to-bust construction crisis. Could it now turn into an emblem of Spains economic revival?

title: SXSW 2015: Sally Field on Hello, My Name Is Doris
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Perhaps nobody expected the collaboration between Michael Showalter and Sally Field less than Sally Field. The Oscar-winning actress had never crossed creative paths with the director, who has built a career on sketch comedy and screenplays with an off-kilter approach to humor.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of March 16
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: 2 Months After Attack, Paris Kosher Market Reopens
description: PARIS  The shelves were still not fully stocked, and employees were hastily adding price tags, as customers returned to a kosher supermarket in the Porte de Vincennes neighborhood here on Sunday morning for the first time since a Frenchman who claimed allegiance to the Islamic State took hostages and killed four people there on Jan. 9.

title: For the Yankees Other Rodriguez, Little Fanfare but Big Adventures
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  When the Toronto Blue Jays public-address announcer boomed the arrival into the batters box of a Yankees player named Rodriguez on Saturday, there was neither a boo nor a cheer, nor even a single pair of clapping hands from among the 5,511 fans at Florida Auto Exchange Stadium.

title: Assyrian Artifacts to Be Returned to Iraq
description: American officials on Monday are expected to repatriate about 65 objects to the Iraqi government, among them the head of a massive statue that was stolen in 2007 or 2008 from the same ancient Assyrian archaeological site where Islamic State militants have been rampaging in recent weeks.

title: Treasury Department FaultsVeterans Affairs in Feud Over Employee
description: Inside the federal bureaucracy there are 72 inspectors general charged with combating waste, fraud and abuse at their agencies.

title: Corey Kluber, Indians Ace, Rises as Precisely as His Two-Seam Fastball Dips
description: GOODYEAR, Ariz.  As the actor Will Ferrell skipped merrily from camp to camp last Thursday in a madcap Cactus League odyssey, the best pitcher in the American League worked stoically on a back field at the Cleveland Indians training complex. No numbers on the scoreboard, no paying customers, not even an umpire.

title: An N.C.A.A. Bracket for Risk-Takers
description: For this bracket, the more unusual that your picks are, the more points youll receive  so long as those picks are correct.

title: 3 British Teenagers Detained on Suspicion of Plotting Terror
description: LONDON  Three teenagers from Britain have been arrested on suspicion of terror offenses after being detained in Turkey, apparently on their way to Syria, in another case highlighting the attraction of jihadist groups for some disaffected young Europeans.

title: March Madness 2015: Welcome to a Different Kind of Bracket
description: Welcome to The New York Timess N.C.A.A. bracket. You can fill it out just like any other bracket  but its not like any other bracket.

title: Feds Steps on Interest Rates and Data on Housing Starts
description: Here are some of the top business stories to pay attention to in the coming week.

title: Heres How Our N.C.A.A. Bracket Works
description: This post is intended to provide more details about our N.C.A.A. bracket game, which is different from the typical bracket. (Youll find a basic introduction here.)

title: Josh Edgin, Mets Top Bullpen Lefty, Will Have Surgery and Miss Season
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  In the not-so-distant future, the Mets will probably be relying on several pitchers who have had Tommy John surgery.

title: A Nice Little Grocery Store, Long Gone
description: Dear Diary:

title: Arab Alliance Rises as Force in Israeli Elections
description: IBILLIN, Israel  Avigdor Lieberman, Israels nationalist foreign minister, stared coolly at the Arab politician sitting at the opposite end of a glass table during a televised election debate.

title: Irwin Hasen, Comic Book Artist and Dondi Illustrator, Dies at 96
description: Irwin Hasen, the cartoonist and comic-book artist who drew, and helped create, Dondi, the widely syndicated comic strip about a lovable, wide-eyed World War II orphan, died on Friday in Manhattan. He was 96.

title: Bracketologys Birth: Filling In the Blanks, Running on Caffeine
description: Bracketology began with two die-hard college basketball fans in a tiny office watching games, eating junk food, drinking caffeinated beverages, working around the clock and wishing the weekend would never end.

title: Boston Celebrates End of Ban as Gays March in St. Patricks Parade
description: BOSTON  Despite a gray chill and spits of rain that gave way to a downpour and later snow, hundreds of thousands of people celebrated a new chapter in this citys history on Sunday as the storied South Boston St. Patricks Day Parade opened its ranks for the first time to gays and lesbians.

title: Many Buyers for Subprime Auto Loan Bundle
description: Delinquencies on auto loans have been rising, more Americans are losing their cars to repossession, and inquiries have begun into the subprime auto industrys lending practices.

title: Despite Good Intentions, Vacancies in Refugee Camp in Jordan for Syrians
description: AL AZRAQ REFUGEE CAMP, Jordan  Here in Jordans vast northeastern desert, row after row of white steel shelters built specially for Syrian refugees sit empty.

title: Chasm Grows Within G.O.P. Over Spending
description: WASHINGTON  The congressional push this week to secure the first Republican budget plan in nearly a decade is revealing a chasm between fiscal hawks determined to maintain strict spending caps and defense hawks who are threatening to derail any budget that does not ensure an increase for the military.

title: Kentuckys Young, Talent-Laden Roster Benefits From Willie Cauley-Steins Versatility
description: NASHVILLE  In Willie Cauley-Steins first season, the Wildcats lost to Robert Morris in the first round of the National Invitation Tournament after the star freshman Nerlens Noel tore his anterior cruciate ligament.

title: Authorities Closing In on Hackers Who Stole Data From JPMorgan Chase
description: It has become a familiar pattern: The computer system of a big American company is breached, the personal information of tens of millions of customers is stolen and a public outcry ensues. Rarely are the thieves caught.

title: Silicon Valley Investor Warns of Bubble at SXSW
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Rarely has there been a better time for start-ups to raise money from Silicon Valley venture capitalists.

title: Duke, Again Led by Young Players, Hopes to Avoid Last Years Fate
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  A young but talented Duke team entered the Atlantic Coast Conference tournament as a favorite to win. The outcome was not quite what many expected.

title: Putin Says He Weighed Nuclear Alert Over Crimea
description: MOSCOW  After the revolution in Ukraine last year, President Vladimir V. Putin sent military forces to secure Crimea and even weighed putting Russias nuclear arsenal on alert because of his concerns about both anarchy and Western intervention, the Russian leader said in a documentary broadcast Sunday.

title: Q. and A.: David Shambaugh on the Risks to Chinese Communist Rule
description: David Shambaugh, a professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University, is one of the United States most prominent experts on contemporary China. He has also been prominent in China. His books have been translated and published there, and his views citedin the state media. He wasprofiledby the overseas edition of Peoples Daily, and in January researchers at the China Foreign Affairs University, which comes under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs,namedhim the second-most influential China expert in the United States, behind David M. Lampton at the Johns Hopkins School of Advanced International Studies.

title: Villanova Shrugs Off Shortcomings in Recent Tournaments
description: Villanova thought it was ready a year ago. Entering the N.C.A.A. tournament as the No. 2 seed in the East Region, it had already won a Big East Conference regular-season title and 28 games. The thinking went: Breeze through two games in Buffalo, make it to New York for the regional and then on to the Final Four. Except its season ended on Saturday of the first week.

title: Kentucky, No. 1 in Height, Too, Relishes the View From on High
description: Kentucky Coach John Calipari has adopted a somewhat caustic attitude toward the Division I mens basketball selection committee, which last season gave his team what he felt was an overly difficult road to the Final Four (it got there anyway).

title: A Police Gadget Tracks Phones? Shhh! Its Secret
description: A powerful new surveillance tool being adopted by police departments across the country comes with an unusual requirement: To buy it, law enforcement officials must sign a nondisclosure agreement preventing them from saying almost anything about the technology.

title: New York City F.C. Earns Its First Victory as Fans Forge Culture in Temporary Home
description: Just before 3 p.m. on Sunday, Mike Carroll emerged from the D train at 161st Street and embarked on a footpath to Yankee Stadium that he has practiced and perfected over countless baseball seasons.

title: Quid Pro Quo From Cuomo Prompts Battle With Lawmakers Over State Budget
description: ALBANY  There is a curt two-letter word that seems to define this years budget negotiations in Albany: if.

title: Evangelicals Aim to Mobilize an Army for Republicans in 2016
description: DES MOINES  One afternoon last week, David Lane watched from the sidelines as a roomful of Iowa evangelical pastors applauded a defense of religious liberty by Senator Ted Cruz of Texas. That night, he gazed out from the stage as the pastors surrounded Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana in a prayer circle.

title: Kerry Suggests There Is a Place for Assad in Syria Talks
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  Secretary of State John Kerry said in an interview broadcast Sunday that he still believed it was important to achieve a diplomatic solution for the conflict in Syria and that the negotiations should involve President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Giving a Voice to Immigrant Workers in New York
description: It was 8 p.m. last Wednesday inside a Manhattan office building, and Modesta Toribio would not let the men in the room rest. She was directing a presentation about immigration reform for a dozen carwasheros, workers from Latin America who toil in the citys carwash industry.

title: Blurred Lines Lawyer Rocks Music Industry Again
description: Ask Richard S. Busch, the lawyer who last week won a nearly $7.4 million copyright suit against Robin Thicke and Pharrell Williams, why he is so successful, and he will mention the 1997 film The Devils Advocate, in which Al Pacino plays Satan posing as a master lawyer.

title: Wisconsins Offense Is Carried by Frank Kaminsky, a Probable Player of the Year
description: The swing offense Bo Ryan runs at Wisconsin is called that because, seen from above, the movement of the ball and the players is like a swing. But one could read the term another way, because no player can be too committed to his own position; everyone must be ready to swing, so to speak.

title: Chinese Ex-General, Charged With Corruption, Dies
description: HONG KONG  A former top Chinese general who was facing a trial after admitting he took bribes in exchange for promotions and other favors died Sunday of bladder cancer, according to Xinhua, the official Chinese news agency.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 15, 2015
Charges in Ferguson Police Shootings
description: Jeffrey Williams was charged with first-degree assault in the shooting of two police officers in front of the Ferguson Police Department.

title: Girls Recap: Hannah Tries to Enter the Land of Grown-Ups
description: Season 4, Episode 9: Daddy Issues

title: Safety Agency Defends Guardrail Test
description: The federal agency charged with investigating a potentially dangerous guardrail defended its methods of analysis, after it was criticized for giving a guardrail a passing grade in a crash test despite severe damage to the drivers door.

title: Sri Lankas Tamil Minority Grows Impatient With Just Promises
description: JAFFNA, Sri Lanka  There may be no place more beautiful on the breathtaking tropical island of Sri Lanka than the white sand beaches along the Palka Strait, which is why building a luxury resort here made sense.

title: March Madness 2015: The Davids Who Could Thwart a Big Blue Goliath
description: From the opening tip on Nov. 14 against Grand Canyon, Kentucky has been in charge of this season. At 34-0, the Wildcats are the first team from one of the

title: Carey Price Has Montreal Fans in the Palm of His Glove
description: MONTREAL  Compared with the rest of the N.H.L., the Canadiens do not score much, or shoot much, or control the puck much, which would seem to make it awfully difficult for them to win much  let alone 43 times, second most in the league  if not for a very important detail.

title: Leading Role for France as Africa Battles Back
description: NDJAMENA, Chad  Deep in the Sahara, late at night, a Reaper drone silently tracked a six-vehicle convoy crossing the desert into Niger from Libya. Minutes later, French attack planes and helicopter gunships swooped down on the convoy of Qaeda-backed fighters, turning the militant caravan into smoldering wreckage.

title: Huckabee Pursues Unconventional Ways to Fund a Campaign
description: In a wood-paneled study lined with books and framed family photos, the prospective presidential candidate looks into the camera. Im Mike Huckabee, he says with all the folksy charm that propelled a career as a preacher, politician and broadcaster.

title: Metropolitan Museum and Minneapolis Institute to Share Large Collection of Asian Art
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Minneapolis Institute of Arts will announce Monday the details of a much-anticipated gift of Asian art from the estate of Mary Griggs Burke, whose collection of Japanese and other East Asian art ranks among the finest private collections in the world.

title: Review: Doug Wrights Posterity, a Portrait of Ibsen
description: An impeccable performance by the Australian actor John Noble lends gravity and a measure of emotional depth to Posterity, the new play written and directed by Doug Wright about Henrik Ibsen in his later days. With his face fringed in imposing whiskers, his brow stormy with incipient outrage, and a Grinch-like grimace almost cemented in place, Mr. Noble does a formidable job of making a flesh-and-blood figure of Ibsen, renowned for his standoffishness and chilliness in public, if not in private.

title: Review: On the Twentieth Century, With Kristin Chenoweth, Opens on Broadway
description: In the theater, there is overacting, which is common and painful to watch. Then theres over-the-moon acting, which is rare and occupies its own special cloud land in heaven. I am delighted to report that this latter art is being practiced in altitudinous-high style at the American Airlines Theater, where Kristin Chenoweth and Peter Gallagher are surfing the stratosphere in On the Twentieth Century.

title: The Good Wife Recap: Bad-Boy Issues
description: Season 6, Episode 15: Open Source

title: Popular Demand
description: People 18 to 24 trailed the weekly averages for all adults in most media usage categories, except for smartphone use, game console use, and time spent using a multimedia device.

title: Egypts Leader Showcases Plans for Growth
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi knows how to haggle, if he does say so himself.

title: Crackdown in a Detroit Stripped of Metal Parts
description: DETROIT  It was a typical frigid winter night in this city, only now a historic blizzard was on the way. Robert Jones Jr., homeless and jobless for more than a decade, calculated his next move.

title: Inmate Is Slashed at Rikers; Officials Investigate How Knife Was Obtained
description: Investigators with New York Citys Correction Department are trying to determine how an inmate newly arrived at Rikers Island was able to get ahold of a large kitchen knife and slash another inmate, who was taken to the hospital, officials said on Sunday.

title: TV Review: HBOs The Jinx Finale Was Gut-Wrenching, Remarkable Television
description: Spoilers follow for the season finale of HBOs The Jinx.

description: improvident  \()im-pr-v-dnt, -dent\  adjective

title: Facebook Clarifies Rules on What It Bans and Why
description: With 1.39 billion active users worldwide, Facebooks social network is the closest thing we have to a universal communication platform. And people post  or try to post  just about everything you can imagine.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Hawks at Warriors
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 11:20 P.M. (Starz) THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 (2014) Peter Parker (Andrew Garfield, above) pines for information about his deceased parents and agonizes over his relationship with Gwen Stacy (Emma Stone) while attending to his responsibilities as Spider-Man in this sequel directed by Marc Webb. An Oscorp employee turned electrified, unhinged villain (Jamie Foxx) has a debilitating effect on New York City. Peters friend, the Oscorp heir Harry Osborn (Dane DeHaan), desperately seeks to cure the illness he inherited from his recently deceased father, with ghoulish consequences.The film balances blockbuster bombast with human-scale drama, child-friendly comedy and gushers of tears,Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times.There are moments  as when the image freezes on the tucked, airborne Spider-Man, ready to spring into action like an Olympian  in which the movie taps into the giddy freedom and near-unboundedness that the characters physical transformation has brought him. Hints of future villains should please fans.

title: Letter Calls Plea Deal for David Petraeus a Profound Double Standard
description: WASHINGTON  The plea deal given to retired Gen. David H. Petraeus, which spares him prison time even though he gave military secrets to his mistress, reveals a profound double standard in the way the Obama administration treats people who leak classified information, a lawyer for an imprisoned government contractor wrote in a letter to prosecutors.

title: Moved by Mountains and the Sea in Indonesia
description: How do you illustrate the connection between people and nature?

title: New York Traffic Laws
description: To the Editor:

title: Dont Exclude Latinos
description: To the Editor:

title: Israels Gilded Age
description: Why did Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel feel the need to wag the dog in Washington? For that was, of course, what he was doing in his anti-Iran speech to Congress. If youre seriously trying to affect American foreign policy, you dont insult the president and so obviously align yourself with his political opposition. No, the real purpose of that speech was to distract the Israeli electorate with saber-rattling bombast, to shift its attention away from the economic discontent that, polls suggest, may well boot Mr. Netanyahu from office in Tuesdays election.

title: Death Sentences, With or Without a Jury
description: In the states that continue to put their own citizens to death, virtually every part of the process is warped by injustice and absurdity. In Florida and Alabama, death row inmates are challenging perverse state laws on the jurys role in capital trials. The Supreme Court, which has been intervening more often in death penalty cases, last week agreed to review the Florida law.

title: Right to Work Law
description: To the Editor:

title: Culture, Religion and Sex Education
description: To the Editor:

title: In Rural India, Hoping for Jobs and Education in a Growing Economy
description: BHESDA KHURD, India  To begin to understand the hurdles Prime Minister Narendra Modi faces in building India into an economic powerhouse and reducing extreme poverty, the rural village of Bhesda Khurd, about 45 minutes from the western city of Udaipur, is a good place to start.

title: The Kurds Heroic Stand Against ISIS
description: ERBIL, Iraq  THE Islamic State continues to control a huge section of Syria. But in Iraq, its advance has stalled. While Shiite militias and their Iranian allies fight the Islamic State ferociously, the Kurds have held a 640-mile front against the Islamic States advance. Their steadfastness should prompt America to rethink its alliances and interests in the region and to deepen its relationship with the Kurds  who are sometimes described as the worlds largest stateless nation.

title: Medicaid Expansion in Red States
description: A number of states that had previously refused to expand their Medicaid programs for the poor are reconsidering that policy. They would be smart to embrace expansion as soon as possible to cover millions of people who would be left uninsured if the Supreme Court wipes out federal subsidies for low-income people buying insurance on the federal health exchanges.

title: Flash Point Ferguson
description: Ferguson, Mo., is once again a flash point in this nations struggle to come to grips with itself, as its citizens are embroiled in a profound conversation about bias, policing, the criminal justice system, civil rights and social justice.

title: Deciding an Institution's Future
Test Yourself | An Op-Ed on the College Admissions Process
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 13 Op-Ed, How to Survive the College Admissions Madness.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Top Seeds Named in the N.C.A.A. College Basketball Tournament
description: In N.C.A.A. Tournament 2015: Villanova, Duke and Wisconsin Join Kentucky as No. 1 Seeds, Marc Tracy writes about the teams that will appear in this years top college basketball showdowns.

title: China Becomes Worlds Third-Largest Arms Exporter
description: China has surpassed Germany to become the worlds third-largest arms exporter, but the United States and Russia remain the dominant sellers of weapons worldwide, according to statistics released on Monday by a research organization in Sweden.

title: How Often Do You Spend One-on-One Time With Your Closest Friends?
