description: Do you ever not feel like answering your phone, returning a text or leaving a message even for a close friend you like very much? Do you ever find your friends doing the same thing to you, even when there is nothing wrong between you?

title: Battered by Hurricane Sandy, Bought by New York and for Sale for a Song
description: LINDENHURST, N.Y.  Nobody on Pacific Street saw the Atlantic coming.

title: New Demands Endanger a Giant Cement Merger
description: PARIS  The planned merger of Holcim and Lafarge, two European cement-making giants, appears to be on the verge of falling apart after Holcim demanded a revision to the agreed to terms.

title: Haversham Holdings Says Its in Advanced Takeover Talks
description: LONDON  Trading of shares of Haversham Holdings was suspended on Monday morning as the acquisition vehicle said it was in very advanced discussions regarding a takeover.

title: Looking for Parkinsons Sooner
description: The Holy Grail in any progressive disease is to find it early enough to start effective treatment before irreversible damage has occurred. For Parkinsons disease, which afflicts 1.5 million Americans and growing, a new study has brought this goal a little closer.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Standard Chartered Names 3 Advisers to Financial Crime Panel
description: The British bank Standard Chartered said on Monday that it had named three external advisers, including the former president of Interpol, to a new committee to oversee its compliance program, set up to identify and prevent financial crime.

title: New York Today: Pothole Season
description: Good chilly Monday morning to you.

title: GE Capital Agrees to Sell Australia and New Zealand Operations for $6.3 Billion
description: LONDON  GE Capital, the financing arm of General Electric, has agreed to sell its consumer lending business in Australia and New Zealand in a deal that values the business at 8.2 billion Australian dollars, or about $6.3 billion.

title: Daily Report: Etsys Success Opens It to Problems of Credibility and Scale
description: Depending on whom you ask, Alicia Shaffer, owner of the hit Etsy store Three Bird Nest, is a runaway success story  or an emblem of everything that has gone wrong with the fast-growing online marketplace for handmade goods, Hiroko Tabuchi reports.

title: Today in Politics: Democrats to Ramp Up Push for Attorney General Vote
description: Good Monday morning from Washington, where Hillary Rodham Clinton is lining up her fund-raising team and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida is batting back comparisons to his brother. President Obama spent the weekend dusting off his comedy routine, but when it comes to getting his attorney general nominee confirmed, there is not much for him to laugh about. Will the logjam in Congress end this week?

title: SolarCity, a Vocal Critic of the Utility Industry, Joins It
description: As SolarCity, the rooftop solar system provider, has rapidly expanded its reach over the last few years, its executives have pushed hard against the utility industry, criticizing it as a hidebound monopoly standing in the way of change.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 16, 2015
description: Updated: March 17, 2015

title: Should Philosophers Be Loners?
description: Warning: Both participants in this dialogue are figments of the authors imagination.

title: Alcohol or Marijuana? A Pediatrician Faces the Question
description: As my children, and my friends children, are getting older, a question that comes up again and again from friends is this: Which would I rather my children use  alcohol or marijuana?

title: Pardons Elude Men Freed After Decades in North Carolina Prison
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N.C.  In the days leading up to the one last summer when Henry L. McCollum left North Carolinas death row, it seemed that inmates and staff members could not stop talking about what awaited him beyond Central Prison.

title: Why I Am Not a Taxidermist
description: Some years ago, a friend gave me a mangled, stuffed fox for Christmas. And I dont mean a plush toy. I mean a genuine red fox, a once-living creature, reduced to a misshapen carcass. The wizened face had the twisted, brittle look of a mummy. Some teeth were missing. Its limbs were just fur-covered bones.

title: Morning Agenda: Authorities Circle JPMorgan Hackers
description: AUTHORITIES CIRCLE JPMORGAN HACKERS | Federal authorities investigating the attack last summer at JPMorgan Chase  which resulted in hackers gaining access to email addresses and phone numbers for 83 million households and small businesses  are increasingly confident that a criminal case will be filed against the hackers in the coming months, Matthew Goldstein and Nicole Perlroth write in DealBook, citing unidentified people briefed on the investigation.

title: Boston College Seeks to Give Others Pause in the Overhaul of Scholarships
description: BOSTON  On a recent afternoon, snow fell on Boston Colleges tidy campus in suburban Chestnut Hill, piling atop the upper stands of Alumni Stadium and the tennis-style bubble enclosing the football field.

title: Designing Private Cities, Open to All
description: NEW YORK  The world is building more cities, faster than ever before. China used more cement in the last three years than the United States used in the entire 20th century. By 2050, India will need new urban infrastructure to house an additional 404 million people  a task comparable to building every city in the United States in just 35 years. The global urban population is expected to rise to well over six billion by 2050 from 3.9 billion today.

title: Raising Its Bid, Valeant Cinches a Deal
description: Faced with the prospect of letting another deal slip through its fingers, Valeant Pharmaceuticals International substantially increased its bid for Salix Pharmaceuticals on Monday, putting a quick end to a bidding war with Endo International.

title: China Unveils Plan to Bolster Its National Soccer Team
description: The State Council, Chinas cabinet, released details on Monday of a plan for Chinese soccer that calls for cleaning up the administration of the sport and increasing the number of young players. It also recommended that the country compete to host a mens World Cup tournament.

title: ISIS Keeps Hold in Tikrit as Iraq Pauses Offensive
description: BAGHDAD  Islamic State militants on Monday continued to hold parts of the city of Tikrit against a much larger pro-government force after two weeks of battle, as Iraqi officials said they were pausing their offensive to call for reinforcements and to preserve property and civilian lives.

title: Putin Returns After Curious Absence and Shrugs Off Rumors
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia reappeared in public on Monday after a curious absence of more than a week, commenting wryly that things would be boring without gossip.

title: Cameron Promises Another Dose of Austerity as British Elections Near
description: LONDON  The British election campaign now underway here revolves in large part around a single issue: the economy, and whether its rebound is the result of an austerity policy championed by the Conservative-led government, or in spite of it.

title: Life Time Fitness to Be Taken Private in $4 Billion Deal
description: The investment firms Leonard Green & Partners and TPG Capital agreed on Monday to buy Life Time Fitness, a gym operator, for about $4 billion, including the assumption of debt.

title: St. Augustine and Secular Stagnation
description: Brad DeLong reminds me of Simon Wren-Lewiss excellent piece on Eurozone fiscal policy, which emphasizes the extent to which European officials still dont get the basic macroeconomics of their position. I realized, however, that recent discussion of secular stagnation  which seems like a realistic possibility for Europe, even more so than the US  adds a twist to the story, one that Im not sure is widely appreciated.

title: ScienceTake | Bird in the Wind
description: Hummingbirds have a remarkable ability to hover in the midst of turbulence.

title: Tiny Masters of Turbulent Air
description: Big airplanes can power through turbulence, but for smaller planes like drones, shifting winds and air currents can cause more than discomfort. And hovering is particularly complicated.

title: Daughter of Jailed Malaysian Opposition Leader Is Arrested
description: HONG KONG  A daughter of the jailed Malaysian opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim was arrested Monday afternoon over criticism of the countrys judiciary she made during a speech in Parliament, her lawyer said.

title: Netanyahu Says No to Statehood for Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  Under pressure on the eve of a surprisingly close election, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Monday doubled down on his appeal to right-wing voters, declaring definitively that if he was returned to office he would never establish a Palestinian state.

title: Night of Drug Overdoses Jolts Liberal Tradition on Wesleyan Campus
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn.  When a Wesleyan University student who had taken drugs at a party last month began feeling ill, his friends took him to his dorm room, gave him water and Triscuits, and assumed he just needed to sleep it off.

title: Diversification Is the Sane Alternative to Betting Big on One Investment
description: You made a huge mistake last year with your money. You know this now, right? The only investments in your portfolio that did very well were probably United States stocks. Bonds may have held their own, but everything else was just pitiful. International stocks performed horribly and emerging markets werent much better.

title: Could the South Have Won the War?
description: By March 1865, it was obvious to all but the most die-hard Confederates that the South was going to lose the war. Whether that loss was inevitable is an unanswerable question, but considering various what if scenarios has long been a popular exercise among historians, novelists and Civil War buffs.

title: Paying a Price to Play at South by Southwest
description: This week, the Prettiots, a largely unknown, ukulele-led trio of young women, will join more than 2,000 other acts at the annual South by Southwest Music and Media Conference, and like many of these musicians, they will pay a lot for the privilege of playing several shows, mostly for free.

title: Yet Another One: Mets Lose Zack Wheeler
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  Just before Matt Harvey went for a pregame run Monday morning, preparing for his third start of spring training, he checked the Twitter updates on his cellphone and spotted the dismaying news. Zack Wheeler, one of the Mets top pitchers, had a fully torn ulnar collateral ligament in his elbow, which meant he was now facing the same Tommy John surgery that Harvey underwent in 2013 and the same long rehabilitation that would follow.

title: Sothebys Names a New Chief Executive: Tad Smith
description: Sothebys reached outside the art world on Monday to appoint Tad Smith, a businessman with a background in the entertainment, sport and media industries who most recently led the Madison Square Garden Company, to replace the departing chief executive, William F. Ruprecht.

title: The Age of Acquiescence, by Steve Fraser
description: For two years running, Oxfam International has traveled to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, to make a request: Could the superrich kindly cease devouring the worlds wealth? And while theyre at it, could they quit using their financial might to influence public policies that favor the rich at the expense of everyone else?

title: With Bill Buford Around, Its Never Dull
description: There was a thin line of blood on Bill Bufords arm, brimming and bright, too neat for a scratch: a perfect slit, like the narrowest of peepholes into the skin.

title: Putin Laughs Off Rumors of Ill Health
description: After days of unexplained absence, Russian President Vladimir V. Putin appeared with the president of Kyrgyzstan to discuss the integration of the Kyrgyz economy with Russia and its allies.

title: The Summit, by Ed Conway
description: For many people, Bretton Woods stands for that rarest of moments: when governments and experts come together to restore order to a chaotic global economy. After the financial meltdown of 2008, the president of the World Bank and the financier George Soros joined Bill Clintons and Tony Blairs earlier call for a new Bretton Woods. It didnt happen. The world and especially America may yet come to regret that.

title: Bush Sees Benefits, and Drawbacks, From Brotherly Comparison
description: By the end of his first visit to New Hampshire as a likely presidential candidate, Jeb Bush had little appetite to again address the dynasty issue.

title: Get on the Grid
description: The clean, geometric look has been popping up everywhere, giving interiors an updated 80s feel.

title: N.C.A.A. Tournament Schedule
description: The N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament schedule. All times are Eastern.

title: Director of Durst Film Says He Is Relieved About Arrest
description: The director Andrew Jarecki and his co-writer and cinematographer Marc Smerling didnt know what they were getting themselves into when they agreed to interview Robert Durst. The real estate heir contacted them following the release of their 2010 film All Good Things, a thinly veiled dramatization of the 1982 disappearance of Mr. Dursts first wife, Kathleen McCormack. Mr. Durst said he wanted to tell his side of the story. The results of Mr. Jareckis and Mr. Smerlings investigation became The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst, a six-part documentary whose final episode aired Sunday night, one day after Mr. Durst was arrested in New Orleans on charges stemming from an investigation into the murder of his friend Susan Berman in Los Angeles in 2000. In the final episode, Mr. Durst is heard, on a live microphone hes wearing in the bathroom following a formal interview in April 2012 with Mr. Jarecki, seeming to confess to three murders. Mr. Jarecki and Mr. Smerling spoke by phone this morning about the case, The Jinx and its aftermath. Here are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: Robert Durst, Saying He Was Worried, Fled to Familiar Refuge Before His Arrest
description: NEW ORLEANS  Not for the first time in his life, Robert A. Durst had left his home and sought to disappear. And not for the first time, he went to New Orleans.

title: U.N. Monitor Says Iran Is Worsening on Rights, Despite Pledges
description: GENEVA  Irans use of the death penalty is rising and its repression of political critics is worsening despite promises by President Hassan Rouhani of a less restrictive society, a United Nations human rights monitor said on Monday.

title: Looking at the Promise and Perils of the Emerging Big Data Sector
description: There is a certain predictability to media and technology finance. Any company looking for money is inevitably characterized as similar to whatever has recently garnered the highest valuations.

title: For Ruben Gallego, a Ride on Air Force One and a Presidential Aside
description: WASHINGTON  For Representative Ruben Gallego, a freshman Democrat from Arizona, joining the 114th Congress started with a heady ride.

title: Stephen Colbert and George Lucas in Conversation at the Tribeca Film Festival
description: Stephen Colbert once battled Jon Stewart over who could lay claim to the title of biggest Star Wars fan on the planet. Mr. Stewart may have won that round, but Mr. Colberts expertise will be put to the test again when he sits down for a public conversation with George Lucas on April 17, one of several events, including talks with Courtney Love and Harvey Weinstein, announced Monday by organizers of the Tribeca Film Festival.

title: Dollars
description: Our  Day celebration continues this week with a recent pi-related question posed on Quora that has received an astounding 700,000-plus views. Theres no single right answer just fun to think about what youd actually do. And the question is

title: At Oregon Festival, Films About (and on) Bicycles
description: In Portland, Ore., motion pictures are the heart of the Filmed by Bike Festival, screening short films about cycling, often shot from rolling bicycles.

title: Economic Ignorance Blogging
description: We need a name for a syndrome related to, but not quite the same as, the Dunning-Kruger effect. That effect, you may or may not know, shows that truly incompetent people are so incompetent that they believe themselves competent.

title: Taking Care With Calcium Supplements
description: Q. I have been told that women should stop taking calcium supplements after menopause, as there is a danger of heart attack and stroke. Is this true?

title: The Kaisa Bandwagon
description: Excited by Chinas property boom, wealthy investors poured money into the distressed property developer, Kaisa. Those who jumped in later have suffered.

title: New Yorks Sewer, Up Close
description: New York City politics can be unseemly. Sometimes a walking tour of used wet wipes is part of the deal.

title: Beauty Tips for Girls, From Lego
description: My 7-year-old wants to know if she has an oval face. Why? Because oval faces can often have almost any style haircut because almost everything looks great on this face shape! Her sudden concern with her hairstyle looking great comes courtesy of her new Lego Club Magazine, which included Emmas Beauty Tips in the March-April 2015 Lego Club Magazine.

title: The New Optimism of Al Gore
description: NASHVILLE  Al Gore wants to make a point about cellphones, and he has a helpful set of slides on his laptop. Do you want to see that? he asks, and starts to turn the MacBook around.

title: Jessica Lange Says Shes Done With American Horror Story
description: Really, what is there left for one to do after playing a nun in charge of an insane asylum, a powerful New Orleans witch, and the proprietor of a Florida freak show? For Jessica Lange, apparently, not much more.

title: 1940: Limits on Bread and Chocolate
description: Further restrictions regarding the baking and selling of bread, effective April 1, and control of the manufacture of chocolate candy anticipating its removal from the market on September 1 were announced yesterday [March 16] in decrees of the Department of Agriculture published in the Journal Officiel. The law regarding chocolate forbids the manufacture after June 1 of fancy chocolates, chocolate fondant or milk chocolate, or confectionery made with fancy chocolate, permitting only common, unsweetened chocolate used for cooking.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 17, 1940

title: Closing Arguments Begin in Test Cheating Trial of 12 Atlanta Educators
description: ATLANTA  After more than five years of controversy and five months of testimony, a prosecutor used seven words on Monday to recap the accusations against the dozen Atlanta educators seated in a courtroom here.

title: Netanyahu Warns of New Hamastan
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel spoke at a Jewish settlement the day before the Israeli election, warning that his opponents Tzipi Livni and Isaac Herzog would fail to protect residents.

title: Fringe Gone Wild
description: Not the wispy embellishment of days past, but a full-on takeover of a garment by its trim. At last, the ornamental becomes essential.

title: 2 Years On, Cypriots Still Seething Over Banking Crisis
description: A slow recovery is underway and European officials have moved on, but in Cyprus many people are still bitter over the bail-in that was put in place.

title: U.N. Orders Review of 1961 Crash That Killed Dag Hammarskjold
description: LONDON  The plane had flown deep into the African night on a mission for peace. Finally, it drew near its destination in the copper mining region of what is now northern Zambia. The crew radioed for permission to descend. Then there was nothing.

title: As Cyprus Recovers From Banking Crisis, Deep Scars Remain
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  The financial world has pretty much moved on since Cyprus was briefly the epicenter of market anxiety.

title: Russell Page, a Natural Artist
description: This spring, Londons Garden Museum is exhibiting the work of the landscape designer Russell Page, perhaps the leading horticultural talent of the 20th century, who was, by his own account, the most famous garden designer no one has ever heard of. A master of structuring nature with an architects eye, Page, whose clients included Marella Agnelli, Oscar de la Renta and Lady Bird Johnson, created mesmerizing green spaces with clipped shrubs, gleaming ponds and sweeping vistas. For the first time, his personal photographs, notes and unrealized designs have been brought together, shedding light on the passion and process of the late luminary.

title: Color Purple Revival Names Its Celie and Shug
description: A stripped-down production of The Color Purple, the musical adaptation of the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, will feature an up-and-coming British theater star and an Academy Award-winning American actress when it opens on Broadway this fall.

title: Court Strikes on Insider Trading, and Congress Lobs Back
description: Sir Isaac Newtons third law of motion was that for every action there is an equal and opposite reaction. The response from Congress to an appeals court decision in United States v. Newman, which overturned the insider trading convictions of two hedge fund managers, is perhaps more an overreaction.

title: The Moment
description: Pieces for the home that bring elegance of form to the most basic functions.

title: Memories Weaken Without Reinforcement, Study Finds
description: What happens to forgotten memories  old computer passwords, friends previous phone numbers?

title: What Were Reading Now
description: The Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics is rolling out a new nutrition seal, Kids Eat Right, for select foods. However, its unclear what exactly the label implies, since the first food to display the seal is Kraft Singles, a product whose connection to real cheese is so dubious that the FDA ordered the company to stop calling it cheese food in 2002. Bizarrely, the academy insists the seal is not an endorsement but just an advertisement for its Kids Eat Right educational website. No wonder parents think sugary drinks are healthy.

title: Obama Grass-Roots Group Trying to Find a Role for 2016
description: The remnants of President Obamas grass-roots campaign apparatus, Organizing for Action, have been in a period of flux in the last month as the organization tries to find a place among Democratic groups heading into 2016.

title: No Comment Necessary: Sen. Tom Cottons Geography Lesson
description: Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas, who last week wrote an open letter to Iran asserting that its leaders may not fully understand our constitutional system, helpfully noted on Sunday that Iranalready controls Tehran, which is its capital.

title: Angels Maintain Realm Amid a Stars Relapse
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  Matt Joyce joined the Los Angeles Angels in an off-season trade, and his new teammates sometimes amaze him. Joyce made an All-Star team once, for the Tampa Bay Rays, but players like Mike Trout and Albert Pujols seem otherworldly to him in batting practice.

title: Kendrick Lamar on His New Album and the Weight of Clarity
description: LOS ANGELES  Following the success of his major label debut, good kid, m.A.A.d. city, in 2012, the rapper Kendrick Lamar did not indulge in earthly luxuries. Instead, he got baptized.

title: Expansion by Mideast Airlines Sets Off a Skirmish in the U.S.
description: Like many airports around the country, Orlando International in Florida has made efforts to attract foreign carriers in recent years. They have paid off; Orlando now gets more than 40 foreign flights a day from places like Germany, Brazil and Colombia.

title: 1965: Deputies Beat Rights Marchers
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  Mounted sheriffs deputies swinging clubs, canes and ropes charged civil-rights demonstrators today [March 16], injuring at least eight. One of those injured was a white college professor, Donald Hope, 38, of Juniata College, Huntingdon, Pa. He suffered scalp lacerations. The 600 demonstrators, mostly students, were taking part in a march on the Capitol building. Though the mounted police charge broke up the march, the demonstrators later regrouped and reached the Capitol building armed with a parade permit and escorted by city police.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 17, 1965

title: Paying for Hurricane Sandy
description: Victims of the storm rely on complicated government programs to receive money for their damaged homes.

title: Rand Paul Is Capturing an Audience; the Challenge Is Winning Votes
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  While his rivals were slogging their way across New Hampshire this weekend, Senator Rand Paul was here, some 1,700 miles away at the South by Southwest festival, where he was competing for oxygen not with other Republicans but with a Judd Apatow premiere and with Grumpy Cat  the Internet meme, in the fur.

title: Wall Street Prosecutor Will Join WilmerHale
description: A white-shoe law firm has poached another Wall Street prosecutor.

title: Seamus Mullens El Colmado Butchery Fits in the Neighborhood
description: To Shop: A Butcher in the Neighborhood

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Irish Honor, and a Warm Embrace
description: On the eve of St. Patricks Day, Hillary Rodham Clinton was lucky enough to bask in the approval of a crowd of Irish and Irish-American power brokers who gathered in Manhattan for her induction into the Irish America Hall of Fame.

title: In Performance: T. Oliver Reid
description: Mr. Reid, with Lawrence Yurman on piano, sings Take the A Train, a number Mr. Reid performs in his show Drop Me Off in Harlem, on Sunday at the Metropolitan Room.

title: Sale of an Astrix Page Helps Families of Charlie Hebdo Victims
description: PARIS  An original Astrix comic book page fetched 150,000 euros, or about $160,000, at a sale at Christies here, with all the proceeds going to the families of those killed in the attack on the offices of the Charlie Hebdo satirical newspaper in January, according to the auction house.

title: In Performance | T. Oliver Reid
description: Mr. Reid, with Lawrence Yurman on piano, sings the jazz standard Sophisticated Lady, a number Mr. Reid performs in his show Drop Me Off in Harlem, playing on March 22 at the Metropolitan Room.

title: It May Be Time to Lighten Up When Youre Scaring the Kids
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas has made a name for himself by firing up the Republican base with blazing speeches that shred his opponents.

title: Lawyer Doubts Suspects Role in Ferguson Shootings
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  A lawyer for Jeffrey L. Williams, the 20-year-old suspect charged with shooting two officers during a demonstration outside the police station here, said Monday that he did not believe that his client had fired the shots.

title: Retro Striped Knits for Spring
description: With a pair of well-worn, washed-out Levis, these throwback shirts and sweaters are charming, youthful and the best of the season.

title: Care Differs for American and African With Ebola
description: The latest American aid worker to contract Ebola overseas, last week in Sierra Leone, was swiftly evacuated to a specialized treatment center for infected health workers run by the British Defense Ministry in the countrys capital, Freetown, then on to the National Institutes of Health clinical center in Bethesda, Md. Doctors at the center said Monday that his condition had worsened from serious to critical since his arrival on Friday.

title: Haitian Leaders Power Grows as Scandals Swirl
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  With a brisk clap of his hands, Michel Martelly summed up the first steps he would take if he ever left the music business and became the president of Haiti.

title: Behind Closed Doors
description: Bombarded by imagery all day at work, the renowned advertising provocateur Sam Shahid comes home to, well, very little.

title: Imaging the Israeli Settlements
description: Jodi Rudorens recent article on expanding Israeli settlements was accompanied by striking visuals that helped to tell the story of how rapidly the settlements have grown.

title: Houthi Rebels Release Detained Yemeni Ministers
description: CAIRO  Houthi rebels released Yemens former prime minister and members of his cabinet after nearly two months of house detention on Monday, in a sign of some progress toward easing the countrys chaotic political crisis.

title: A New Showcase in Paris Celebrates the Art of Pen and Paper
description: The pen may be mightier than the sword, but it has admittedly lost some of its potency in the Internet age. criture (Writing), a new product showcase at the Paris concept store Merci, aims to celebrate the analog with a display of historic and iconic paper goods and desktop accouterments. Notable wares include those by the century-old Swiss manufacturer Caran dAche, from high-quality Technograph graphite pencils and water-soluble Prismalo colored pencils, both of which the company has been making for 80-plus years, to ballpoint pens in the brands 849 model, which are being sold for the first time outside of Switzerland. Other featured products include notepads and folio cases by the French brand Exacompta and gold ballpoint pens and molded glass pencils by the Danish company Hay.

title: Why Female Athletes Shouldnt Have to Beat Men
description: The mixed martial artist Ronda Rousey has defeated 11 opponents, the most recent one in only 14 seconds. Perhaps predictably, this has led to questions about whether she will fight men.

title: Netanyahu Rules Out Palestinian State
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, in an interview with NRG the day before the general election, said that a Palestinian state would not be created if he remained prime minister.

title: Uniting Arabs in a Race for the Knesset
description: In Ayman Odehs campaign for a seat in the Knesset, he hopes to unite Arab Israeli political factions and boost voter turnout.

title: Decoding the Rules of Conversation
description: PARIS  MY kids have recently picked up a worrying French slang word: bim (pronounced beam). Its what children say in the schoolyard here after theyve proved someone wrong, or skewered him with a biting remark. English equivalents like gotcha or booyah dont carry the same sense of gleeful vanquish, and I doubt British or American kids use them quite as often.

title: Questioning the Value of Health Apps
description: A bodybuilder presses the iPhones camera with a fingertip, and his heart rate and blood oxygen levels appear on the screen. A fellow in pajamas steps onto a scale, peers at his smartphone, and sighs dejectedly. A runner races along the waterfront, a cellphone strapped to her pumping arms.

title: Tool of N.C.A.A. Bracket Ignorance: Your Basketball Smarts
description: There are more than 9.2 quintillion ways to fill out the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament bracket, and as March Madness gets underway, more than 100 million Americans are determined to get it exactly right.

title: Johann Johannssons Drone Mass Bridges Ancient and Modern at Temple of Dendur
description: Audience members wont have to duck their heads at Tuesdays world premiere of Johann Johannssons Drone Mass, and security guards at the Temple of Dendur need not worry about unauthorized surveillance photography. No pilotless aircraft accompanies this oratorio, which the Metropolitan Museum of Art presents in a performance by the vocal group Roomful of Teeth and members of the American Contemporary Music Ensemble, with Mr. Johannsson on electronics.

title: U.S. Oil Prices Fall to Six-Year Low
description: Oil prices fell to six-year lows on Monday in the face of concerns that a glut in the United States was outpacing already-brimming storage facilities.

title: Clever Coastline Coasters
description: Customized coasters  linen squares embroidered with friends names, thick felt cutouts emblazoned with their initials  are so much more than an opportunity to protect the furniture while posing as a thoughtful host. For me and my fellow hypochondriacs, theyre really just a vehicle for containing each guests  germs, especially now that the seasons are changing and warmer days will give way to spring colds and mucous-y allergies. No, no, Emily. Thats not your glass. See? Its sitting on Katherines coaster. Speaking of glasses, hows your pinkeye coming along?

title: Older Really Can Mean Wiser
description: Behind all those canned compliments for older adults  spry! wily! wise!  is an appreciation for something that scientists have had a hard time characterizing: mental faculties that improve with age.

title: Review: Christopher Wheeldons Swan Lake Focuses on the Men
description: PHILADELPHIA  When, oh, when will America acquire an even half-decent staging of Tchaikovskys full-length Swan Lake? Having long had most of the worlds best Nutcracker productions, it now has the worlds two best stagings of Tchaikovskys The Sleeping Beauty: at American Ballet Theater (Alexei Ratmanskys, new this month) and Boston Ballet (Ninette de Valoiss, with supplementary choreography by Frederick Ashton). But what about Swan Lake?

title: Review: In One Big Happy, Its Mom and Dad and Mom
description: Its no longer unusual to find nontraditional families on television and for people in those families to be having babies. Apparently the makers of One Big Happy, an intelligence-insulting sitcom that begins Tuesday night on NBC, havent noticed, because every minute of their show screams: Hey! Weve got a pregnant lesbian! Bet youve never seen that before!

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch
description: This is one of those weeks that build to a terrific finish Sunday. But there will be plenty to watch before then. The Times soccer editor, Andrew Das, a shameless Ajax supporter, suggests what to watch.

title: Seeking Hospitality Outside Its Traditional Realm
description: IM a control freak, and I guess Im proud of that because that means that my clients dont have to worry  Ill do that. Since Im a designer, and principal and founder of Tonychi & Associates, its very important for me to go where the jobs are, and my travels can take me anywhere throughout the United States, Europe or Asia.

title: Smaller Airports Struggle Against Big Airports Lures
description: TUCSON  THERE were so many people booked on the 8 a.m. bus trip to the Phoenix airport the other morning that the Arizona Shuttle company had to call in a bigger vehicle.

title: Preparing for Ebola, but Stopping Lassa Fever
description: Last fall, with the Ebola epidemic raging, the small nation of Benin, a few countries away from the outbreak zone, experienced a cluster of unexplained deaths.

title: At 73, a First TV Job at the Final Four
description: Bill Rafterys summons to call his first Final Four for CBS and TBS next month came at age 73  and was only 32 years in the making.

title: Why Is the Timeline of The Jinx So Confusing?
description: Following Sundays finale of The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst on HBO, questions have arisen about the timeline of events presented in the documentary. (Gawker has a particularly detailed account here.) Whether its because of those unanswered questions or for other reasons, the director Andrew Jarecki has canceled previously scheduled appearances on The Tonight Show and MSNBCs All In With Chris Hayes, as well as with other media outlets.

title: The Writers Room
description: Surrounded by photographs, family mementos and the clamor of everyday life, five authors offer a glimpse into the spaces where they create.

title: A Sixth Season for Community, Rescued by Yahoo Screen
description: Its an insufficiently appreciated fact that for five seasons, televisions most highly conceptual, self-referential, pulverize-the-fourth-wall show was carried by a television dinosaur  NBC, the oldest of the big broadcasters. That show was Community, and while NBC may not have been entirely happy with it  the seasons got shorter and farther apart, and the shows creator, Dan Harmon, was banished for Season 4  the network stuck it out for 97 episodes of sometimes forced but often sweetly hilarious meta-comedy.

title: Neanderthal Jewelry: The Eagle Talon Line
description: Neanderthals may have used the talons of white-tailed eagles to make jewelry 130,000 years ago, long before the appearance of modern humans in Europe, according to a new study published in PLOS One. At an archaeological site in Croatia, researchers discovered the talons, above, with notches and abrasions suggesting they had been made into necklaces or bracelets. Eagle talons may have had symbolic value to Neanderthals, the researchers said.

title: Banco de Madrid Files for Bankruptcy Protection
description: MADRID  Banco de Madrid, a small Spanish bank, filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday after a United States government report last week accused its parent company in Andorra of laundering money on behalf of organized crime groups in China and Russia, as well as for government officials in Venezuela.

title: Cablevision to Offer HBO Now Streaming Service for Internet Customers
description: Cablevision said on Monday that it would offer HBOs new Internet streaming service, HBO Now, becoming the first cable provider to announce plans to distribute the service, which does not require a traditional TV subscription.

title: Why Icicles Look the Way They Do
description: The reason Stephen Morris studies icicles is simple. They are common and beautiful, and they make you wonder. And they are now documented online in all their chilly, wet glory in the Icicle Atlas.

title: Dark Knight
description: Fleeing the sunny Southern gentility of his childhood, a budding film director turns a New York house into a louche fantasy.

title: White House Treading Carefully in Israeli Elections
description: President Barack Obama, whose bitter differences with Prime Minster Benjamin Netanyahu have intensified in recent weeks, will be closely watching the outcome of Israeli elections on Tuesday, in which Mr. Netanyahus power is on the line.

title: Out of Konys Shadow
description: Since 2011, when President Obama sent U.S. Special Forces to central Africa to support the mission to capture warlord Joseph Kony, things on the ground in northeastern Congo have improved: The world has recently celebrated the capture of the top Lords Resistance Army commander, Dominic Ongwen. Violent attacks have declined dramatically. Some folks are farming again, and markets are now packed with rice, vegetables and peanuts.

title: Robert Durst Says He Killed Them All
description: What the hell did I do? Killed them all, of course, Robert Durst whispered to himself in the final episode of the HBO documentary The Jinx.

title: Lost in Transition After Cancer
description: You are being deported, a surgeon announced to me last fall. Thats a scary thing for a child of two immigrants to hear. But he was referring to the removal of my port, a medical device implanted just beneath my right collarbone  a gateway for the dozens of rounds of chemotherapy, antibiotics and blood transfusions that have entered my body since I received a leukemia diagnosis at age 22.

title: Review: The Top of His Game, a W. C. Heinz Sportswriting Collection
description: W. C. Heinz performed so splendidly as a correspondent during World War II that upon reporting home, The New York Sun rewarded him with a long vacation, a handsome bonus and a new assignment. Heinz, 32, had proven overseas that he had an uncommon eye for human interest stories, so he was offered a promotion to the Washington bureau. It was a coveted position at which many of his colleagues would have jumped.

title: The Toll of a Solitary Life
description: Do you like being alone? New research from Brigham Young University shows just how bad loneliness and social isolation, even for people who prefer their own company, can be for health.

title: Dont Flush That Wipe!
description: This is not a particularly savory topic, but the brave people who run modern sewer systems around the world face a growing menace: the flushable wet wipe.

title: U.S. Announces Plan to Combat Illegal Fishing
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has announced a plan to crack down on the multibillion-dollar global black market in seafood, an effort that would try to trace a fishs story from where it was caught to how it was shipped.

title: National Guard Praises Record of 4 Who Died in Helicopter Crash
description: The four Louisiana National Guard members who died last week in a helicopter crash near the Gulf Coast had multiple deployments to war zones and a long record of responding to hurricanes, floods and oil spills, Guard commanders said Monday.

title: Too Much Cardiac Testing
description: The electrocardiogram you got at your most recent physical may have been a waste of time and money.

title: Review: Meghan Trainor Performs at Irving Plaza
description: There were about a dozen items of clothing for sale at Meghan Trainors concert Sunday night at Irving Plaza. T-shirts in loud colors and sweatshirts that trumpeted All About That Bass, after Ms. Trainors breakout hit, took up a large swath of the wall behind the merchandise table, as if theyd been eagerly wheatpasted. Nearby, the tour sponsor, HP, set up a photo booth encouraging fans to Capture Your Meghan Moment.

title: Review: Charles Lloyd Returns to the Village Vanguard
description: Charles Lloyd seemed perfectly at home onstage at the Village Vanguard on Sunday night, working with standard equipment: his tenor saxophone, his quartet, his tunes. Awash in the dimensions of his sound in the room, it was almost possible to imagine that this was a regular visit, a piece of the usual bounty for jazz lovers in New York.

title: The Gardner Masterpieces, Still Missing, But Visible Again Online
description: BOSTON  To mark a somber date, the 25th anniversary of the largest art theft in American history, the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum here, has created a virtual tour of the 13 items, including paintings by Rembrandt and Vermeer, that were stolen from the museum on March 18th, 1990.

title: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Republicans for a Trifecta Against Women
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton scolded congressional Republicans on Monday for mounting a trifecta against women by delaying the nomination of Loretta E. Lynch for attorney general by tying it to stalled legislation on human trafficking.

title: MoMA Lands Jasper Johnss Painted Bronze
description: Its a small work of art  precisely the size of an old Savarin coffee can jammed with artists paintbrushes  but in the history of postwar art and in the career of Jasper Johns, one of the most important artists of the last half century, it looms large.

title: Dreams on Wheels, and Their Unsung Stylists
description: A look at the sketches of artists who worked at Ford, Chrysler and General Motors between 1946 and 1973.

title: Schneiderman Issuing Ethics Plan Aimed at New York Legislators
description: ALBANY  Staking out a broad vision of ethics reform amid a swirl of other proposals in the capital, New Yorks attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, called for an elimination of all outside jobs for state legislators and the end of a widely criticized system of per diem payments.

title: New Albums From Sirens, Zaleski and Miller
description: SLEEPING WITH SIRENS

title: What Patients Prefer to Know
description: If you had a serious illness, how much would you want to know about it?

title: Music in Review: Performances by Sasha Cooke, Escher String Quartet and Ensemble Signal
description: ESCHER STRING QUARTET

title: Letters to the Editor
Valeants Sweetened Bid for Salix May Have Delivered 2 Knockouts
description: The sweetened $11 billion bid by Valeant Pharmaceuticals for Salix Pharmaceuticals may have scored two knockouts. By coming up with an extra 9 percent over its previous offer, the acquisitive drug maker, now backed by the hedge fund executive William A. Ackman, quickly put an end to a rival bid from Endo International. But the extra cash required, and the debt already on its balance sheet, leave Valeants business model looking wobbly.

title: Layoffs at Food Start-Up Hampton Creek
description: Hampton Creek, a high-profile food start-up that has attracted investors and talent from the technology industry, laid off nearly a fifth of its work force last month, just months after announcing it had raised $90 million in funding.

title: Walkabout: St. Patricks Day Parades in Unexpected Places
description: Seeing Green Some say everyone is Irish on St. Patricks Day. Here, several places to watch a parade  including a couple you probably would never expect.(petergreenberg.com)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Tuning Out Digital Buzz, for an Intimate Communion With Art
description: Once upon a time, our big museums were the quiet cars of a fast-track American culture industry. Like libraries, they were places where the volume was low, the energy slow, the technology unobtrusive. You came to them to look, to think and, in the days before museums became the prime social spaces they are now, to be alone in a small, like-minded crowd. You could take a little art home by hitting the postcard rack in the gift shop. But the only way you would retain most of what you saw was by spending time in the galleries and imprinting things on your brain.

title: The Forgotten Man of Bauhaus, Almost
description: The Xanti Schawinsky show is the latest in a series of expositions to reassess the reputations of lesser-known members of the Bauhaus.

title: In Miami Beach, the Faena Forum Is to Open in December
description: MIAMI  In the last few years, the Miami arts landscape has both rapidly expanded and been roiled with upheavals as the region tries to shore up a permanent cultural beachhead in a place better known until recently for an annual art fair and an actual beach. The next entry onto the scene, the Faena Forum, will be unusual in its format, design and leadership, and it wont resemble anything else nearby when it is completed in December in a formerly sleepy section of Miami Beach.

title: Paul Ha Raises the Cultural Profile at M.I.T.
description: CAMBRIDGE, MASS.  Shortly after Paul Ha became director of the List Visual Arts Center at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in late 2011, he was surprised to learn that Joan Jonas, the pioneering performance art and video artist, was a longtime faculty member at the university. He invited her to lunch to introduce himself and reveal his plan: to propose her as the artist representative for the United States at the 2015 Venice Biennale.

title: Archive of Xanti Schawinsky, Bauhaus Artist, Is Exhibited in Zurich
description: How could an artist and designer as prolific, gifted and charismatic as Xanti Schawinsky  a central figure in mid-20th-century avant-garde circles in Europe and the United States  have come close to being forgotten?

title: In Magna Carta: Law, Liberty, Legacy, a Document Resonates
description: LONDON  When King John of England and a group of rebellious barons gathered in a marshy field just outside London in 1215, creating a foundation of modern democracy was not on their minds.

title: Museums Seek to Lure, Then Lock In, Teenage Connoisseurs
description: Walking past Ghirlandaios Old Man With a Young Boy at the Louvre over Christmas break, I listened as my 18-year-old son, Ethan, explained how the artist was among the first to portray eye contact within a portrait; how Leonardo used the color blue to convey distance; how Raphael was a favorite of the Medicis. At the Muse dOrsay, I watched as my 16-year-old daughter, Maya, dragged Ethan over to Manets Le Djeuner sur lHerbe  a painting they had both studied  and then debated its merits.

title: Four Museums Plan Their Centennials
description: Four American museums, established after the first generation of major museums got their start in the 1870s, are observing their centennials this year and next: the Baltimore Museum of Art, incorporated in 1914 and celebrating its anniversary through early summer; the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, opened in 1915; the Memphis Brooks Museum of Art, which opened in 1916; and the Cleveland Museum of Art, which opened in 1916. And, not surprisingly, the centennial celebrations of the four museums look back at their history and the civic leaders who founded them, in many cases using 21st-century ways to engage local communities.

title: A Document That Resonates Far and Wide
description: From original documents to curios, items from the British Librarys exhibition on Magna Carta.

title: At Museum of Arts and Design, a Swan Song for Lowery Stokes Sims
description: Robin Cembalest, an arts consultant and former executive editor of ARTnews, used the Yiddish word haimish to describe Lowery Stokes Sims, the chief curator of the Museum of Arts and Design. Roughly translated, haimish means all the good qualities associated with home: informal, warm, approachable and comforting.

title: A Sly Fusion of Creativity and History
description: Exhibits at the International Museum of the Reformation in Geneva include everything from talking table settings to 16th- and 17th-century sheet music for hymns.

title: A Sampling of Art Exhibitions, From Coast to Coast
description: Leonardo da Vinci, meet Frida Kahlo. Spring 2015 shows at American museums showcase artists from around the world and through the centuries.

title: Museums Showcase Attitudes and Beliefs as Well as Objects
description: Most museums are defined by the objects they display. A fine-arts museum exhibits paintings and sculptures. A history museum shows artifacts and documents. A science museum presents experiments.

title: Reformation Museum in Geneva Blends Humor and Wonder
description: GENEVA  Finding the International Museum of the Reformation is almost as complicated as explaining the historical movement it chronicles.

title: Spring Museum Exhibitions, From Masks to Renoirs
description: Heres a sampling of promising exhibitions around the country this spring.

title: Cedar Grove, Peabody Essex and Other Niche Museums Foray Into Contemporary Art
description: Cedar Grove, the Thomas Cole National Historic Site in Catskill, N.Y., is devoted to the life and art of that Hudson River School painter, who is known all over the world for his richly detailed landscapes.

title: Met Founds Research Institute Centered on Lauders Cubist Gift
description: When the cosmetics magnate Leonard A. Lauder was trying to decide which museum should inherit his $1 billion collection of Cubist art, he asked those he was considering how they would keep the collection alive as a focus of intellectual inquiry and public interest. We wanted to avoid the usual donation, installation, catalog and then what? said Emily Braun, Mr. Lauders longtime curator.

title: Childrens Museum of Pittsburgh Leads Movement to Acquire Tenants
description: Across the country, museums are playing landlord.

title: A Fervid Experiment Recalled
description: Images of Robert Rauschenberg, Merce Cunningham, Josef Albers and others in their Black Mountain heyday.

title: For Lower East Side, Chinese-Americans and Bronts, Museums of Their Own
description: Pushcart peddlers once filled Orchard Street. Early-20th-century Socialists gathered in Straus Square. The streets of the Lower East Side of Manhattan are indelibly stamped with the lives of the immigrants who made them their entry points to the United States. Walking these same streets today can be the best classroom to the citys history, said Annie Polland, senior vice president for programs and education at the Lower East Side Tenement Museum.

title: In the Spirit of Black Mountain College, an Avant-Garde Incubator
description: In the annals of 20th-century American art, few legends loom quite as large as that of Black Mountain College. Founded in 1933 by the classics scholar John Andrew Rice and the engineer Theodore Dreier, it was a progressive institution based in Black Mountain, a small North Carolina town that aimed to place art making at the heart of a liberal arts education. That same year, the Nazis forced the closing of another grand experiment, Germanys Bauhaus school, prompting many of its teachers and students to decamp for the United States. Several landed at Black Mountain, most prominently Josef Albers, who was chosen to lead the art program, and his wife, Anni, who taught textile design and weaving.

title: American Dreaming Celebrates a Heady Era of Car Design
description: Rodell Smith started drawing cars in grade school in the early 1930s. More than 80 years later, at 92, hes still drawing them on the days he feels up to it. Mr. Smith worked nearly 40 years as a professional automotive stylist at Ford and Chrysler, and along with thousands of other mostly unheralded artists and craftsmen, he helped define the look of American progress in an era fueled by 300-horsepower optimism.

title: The Met and RISD Are Among Museums Redisplaying Antiquities
description: For years, the windows of the antiquities galleries at the RISD Museum, at the Rhode Island School of Design, were blocked out with color transparencies of ancient sites. The idea was to immerse visitors in the ambience of antiquity by shutting out external distractions.

title: Museums Flex Their Multilingual, Multicultural Muscles
description: As the Americans who are at least 5 years old and speak a language other than English at home now exceed 20 percent of the population, museums across the country are responding with bilingual and non-English educational programs for all ages.

title: How a Rising Dollar Is Creating Trouble for Emerging Economies
description: In India, it is a leading electric utility, Jaiprakash Power Ventures, selling off facilities and negotiating with lenders to avoid a default, having increasing its debts thirtyfold in six years.

title: Rangers Martin St. Louis Is Expected to Miss 10 to 14 Days
description: The Rangers, who were already without goalie Henrik Lundqvist and defenseman Kevin Klein, said Monday that forward Martin St. Louis was expected to miss 10 to 14 days with a lower-body injury.

title: Photos of the Day: India and Elsewhere
description: India and More  Pictures of the Day

title: March 16, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Israel, Pakistan, Israel and Japan.

title: How to Be Both
description: Vulgar and restrained, loud and retiring, straight-up and mysterious. On the undiminished charisma of Sarah Lucas, the former rude girl of British art.

title: Crowning Preteen Beauty Queens
description: Ilana Panich-Linsman was forced to question her ideas about youth and beauty as she followed one contestant in the world of childrens beauty pageants.

title: Ubers Chief Financial Officer to Leave Company
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Brent Callinicos, the chief financial officer of Uber, plans to leave the ride-sharing company, in what will be one of the highest-level departures yet for the six-year-old start-up.

title: Quirky $200 Million Art Venture Proves Just the Ticket for Tasmania
description: HOBART, Australia  For most of its existence, Tasmania was known as a faraway island at the bottom of Australia, a grim 19th-century redoubt where British colonial officers imprisoned convicts in the harshest of the empires jails and killed much of the aboriginal population.

title: Review: In Buyer & Cellar, a Visit to the Babs Cave
description: Buyer & Cellar, at the George Street Playhouse in New Brunswick, starts off with a warning. Its lone performer announces that the premise is preposterous. The story is fictional, he tells us. You know that, right?

title: Marine Veteran Requests Deportation From Iran
description: Increasingly desperate to return to the United States, a Marine veteran of Iranian descent who has been incarcerated in Iran for three and a half years has renounced his Iranian citizenship, requested deportation and accused Iran of using American prisoners as bargaining chips, his family said Monday.

title: As Cosmos Head to Cuba, Fans May Be Unable to Follow
description: The New York Cosmos will play in Cuba in June, but it may prove difficult for their fans to join them on the trip.

title: Brazil Official Charged in Petrobras Bribery Case
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Prosecutors on Monday filed new corruption charges arising out of the huge bribery scheme at Petrobras, the national oil company, against the treasurer of the ruling Workers Party  putting additional pressure on President Dilma Rousseff at a time when she is fighting calls for her ouster over the burgeoning scandal.

title: Failed by Law and Courts, Troops Come Home to Repossessions
description: Charles Beard, a sergeant in the Army National Guard, says he was on duty in the Iraqi city of Tikrit when men came to his California home to repossess the family car. Unless his wife handed over the keys, she would go to jail, they said.

title: Vanuatu: Cyclone Toll Rises
description: The cyclone thatlashed the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu over the weekendkilled at least 24 people, a United Nations office said, whileon Tuesday relief workers said initial glimpses of the devastation on remoter islands indicated the death toll could rise, perhaps sharply. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said in areport issuedMondayabout Cyclone Pamthat it had confirmed the 24 deaths across three parts of the islands: Tafea, Efate and Tanna. But that count did not include more isolated islands where fierce winds of 160 miles an hour and moreleveled many homes.

title: N.Y.U. Professor Is Barred by United Arab Emirates
description: The United Arab Emirates, where New York University opened a new campus last year, has barred an N.Y.U. professor from traveling to the monarchy after his criticism of the exploitation of migrant construction workers there.

title: Egypt: Militants Claim Ambush
description: Militants identifying themselves as the Sinai Province of the Islamic State said Mondaythat they had captured the engine of an American-made M60 tank from the Egyptian military in an ambush. A spokesman for the Egyptian armed forces said no engine had been taken. The militants, who went by the name Ansar Beit al-Maqdis before they pledged their loyalty last fall to the Islamic State, have killed hundreds of soldiers and policemen in a campaign against the military-backed government. President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi has declared an all-out war on the militants around their base in the North Sinai, but has nonetheless struggled to end their attacks. The militants posted six pictures on Twitter of what appeared to be the engine, describing it as spoils of an ambush on the apostate army.

title: Malcolm Brogdon, Virginia Star, Is Pursuing Masters Ahead of N.B.A.
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  Amid the academic scandals at Syracuse, North Carolina and elsewhere around the N.C.A.A., maybe it just seems unusual these days to find athletes who also happen to be high-achieving students. But consider Malcolm Brogdon, the redshirt junior guard who helped lead Virginia to the Atlantic Coast Conference regular-season title and a top-five ranking for much of this season  all while he was working on a masters degree in public policy.

title: New Jersey Senate Upholds Christies Veto of Port Authority Curbs
description: The New Jersey Senate failed in its effort on Monday to override Gov. Chris Christies veto of legislation aimed at curbing patronage and political interference at the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in the wake of the George Washington Bridge lane closing scandal.

title: G.M. Will Face Further Discovery in Broader Class-Action Case
description: DETROIT  While General Motors has settled one potentially explosive lawsuit related to defective ignition switches, the company still faces the possibility of depositions of its employees in a broader class-action case.

title: German Media Want Greek Finance Ministers Head Over Fingergate
description: Speaking to a small group of Croatian radicals in 2013, an obscure Greek economist suggested that Greece should have simply defaulted on its debts in 2010 and told the German government to deal with the consequences. For emphasis, he used a crude expression and extended his middle finger, in an ancient gesture considered obscene even in the days of Diogenes.

title: Blackstone Group Purchases Landmark Willis Tower in Chicago
description: Jonathan D. Gray grew up in the Chicago suburb of Highland Park, just a 40-minute drive from the Sears Tower, one of the most recognizable office buildings in the world.

title: SXSW 2015: A Look at Raiders!
description: Some fedoras were spotted, but no snakes were present at the premiere of Raiders! at SXSW on Saturday at an Alamo Drafthouse theater in Austin. The documentary tracks the enduring artistic commitment of Chris Strompolos and Eric Zala, two friends who spent their adolescent summer vacations creating a shot-for-shot remake of Steven Spielbergs 1981 thriller, Raiders of the Lost Ark. Now in their 40s, the men reunited in June to shoot the one scene they never completed: the airplane fight sequence that pits Indiana Jones against a brutish mechanic near the blades of a moving airplane. (A camel and a few complicated explosions are also involved.)

title: Curtis Gans, 77, Is Dead; Worked to Defeat President Johnson
description: Curtis Gans, who helped organize a quixotic crusade to depose President Lyndon B. Johnson in 1968 and transformed the movements improbable electoral success into what became a lifelong object lesson in the virtues of voting, died on Sunday in Frederick, Md. He was 77.

title: Data on Health Law Shows Largest Drop in Uninsured in 4 Decades, the U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Monday that 16.4 million uninsured people had gained health coverage since major provisions of the Affordable Care Act began to take effect in 2010, driving the largest reduction in the number of uninsured in about 40 years.

title: Adidas to Exit the N.B.A., Opening the Door to Rivals
description: Adidas said Monday that it will not bid for a new contract with the N.B.A. when its deal expires in 2017, letting slip a high-profile partnership that has allowed it to outfit some of the countrys top athletes.

title: Tour Bus Companies Agree to Settle Antitrust Lawsuit
description: Two of New York Citys biggest tour bus operators have agreed to pay $7.5 million and give up nearly 50 of their stops in Manhattan to settle an antitrust lawsuit brought by state and federal officials.

title: Pointing Fingers in Apple Pay Fraud
description: When Apple was planning its Apple Pay electronic payment system last summer for its iPhones, the nations banks raced to be included among the first credit card issuers associated with the new technology.

title: Iranian Officials Ask Kerry About Republicans Letter
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  Iranian officials questioned Secretary of State John Kerry about a letter that Tom Cotton of Arkansas and 46 other Republican senators issued last week arguing that a potential nuclear accord would not be binding unless it was approved by Congress.

title: Daevid Allen, Guitarist and Singer in Progressive Rock, Dies at 77
description: Daevid Allen, an eccentric Australian-born guitarist, singer and poet who was an original member of the psychedelic rock group the Soft Machine and went on to found Gong, an aggressively avant-garde band whose influence far exceeded its relatively modest success, died on Friday in Australia. He was 77.

title: Mexican Journalist Is Fired After Report About First Lady
description: MEXICO CITY  One of Mexicos best-known journalists, who exposed a possible conflict of interest involving the first ladys purchase of a house from a government contractor, was fired on Sunday in a dispute that defenders see as an act of retaliation and an attack on press freedom.

title: Sharing Files via Dropbox With People Who Dont Have an Account
description: Q. I am having trouble trying to figure out how to send tax files to my parents on Dropbox, but since they are not Dropbox users, I dont know how to share my files with them. How can I do this?

title: Radio Broadcasters Seek Changes in Disclosure Rules for Paid Programming
description: A group of radio broadcasters has asked for changes to federal rules about how stations disclose paid programming, raising fresh concerns about one of the music industrys most enduring scandals  payola.

title: Capturing 46th Title, Hannah Kearney Ends Her Moguls Career on Top
description: Five years after Hannah Kearney won an Olympic gold medal in moguls skiing, her dream came true: She closed out her international career with a victory in Sundays dual moguls event at the F.I.S. Freestyle World Cup finals in Megve, France.

title: Michelle ObamaGoing to Asia to Push Education
description: WASHINGTON  Michelle Obama will travel to Japan and Cambodia this week to kick off the administrations new effort to promote the education of millions of girls worldwide.

title: New York Police Begin Using ShotSpotter System to Detect Gunshots
description: The New York Police Department has started using a detection system that pinpoints the location of gunfire and sends the information to law enforcement, the latest move to modernize the nations largest police force, the department announced on Monday.

title: Intersection | Harajuku Style in Tokyo
description: Mademoiselle Yulia, a fashion designer and style icon with dyed blue hair, is very inspired by the stylish and colorful Harajuku neighborhood of Tokyo.

title: Remarks on Family by Dolce and Gabbana Bring Swell of Criticism
description: What began as a brush fire over the weekend for the fashion designers behind the Dolce & Gabbana label spread quickly across the Internet.

title: House Republican Budget Overhauls Medicare and Repeals the Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans on Tuesday will unveil a proposed budget for 2016 that partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years, challenging Republicans in Congress to make good on their promises to deeply cut federal spending.

title: Irresistible TV, but Durst Film Tests Ethics, Too
description: It was the sort of publicity you cannot buy. The day before HBO broadcast the final episode of the six-part documentary series The Jinx, the subject of the film, Robert A. Durst, was arrested on a murder charge.

title: Utahs Season Is So Sweet, Even the Lockers Smell Nice
description: LAS VEGAS  The locker room was empty except for the Utah mens basketball coach, Larry Krystkowiak, who reached into his bag and pulled out what appeared to be a short section of braided rope. It was black on one end.

title: Police Recall Dodging as Marathon Bombing Suspect Ran Over Brother
description: BOSTON  One of the most shocking details to emerge from the night of mayhem two years ago when the Boston Marathon bombers engaged in a shootout with the police in suburban Watertown was that Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was fleeing the scene, drove over his brother, Tamerlan.

title: Pinterest Valuation at $11 Billion After New Round of Fund-Raising
description: Less than a year after being valued at $5 billion, Pinterest has joined the 11-digit valuation start-up club.

title: State Senate Works to Block Christie From Settling Pollution Lawsuit Against Exxon
description: The New Jersey Senate approved two measures on Monday contesting Gov. Chris Christies attempt to settle a pollution lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corporation for a fraction of the damages that the state had originally sought.

title: Obama on Republican Education Budget
description: While meeting with the Council of the Great City Schools leadership, the president said that there would be a major debate if the Republican budget lowered federal spending on education.

title: Obama Plans to Use Week to Press Economic Case
description: WASHINGTON  With Congress pushing to complete a budget plan this week that reflects the cost-cutting priorities of the new Republican majority, President Obama plans to devote much of his week to laying out an alternative approach that would increase spending on domestic programs such as education and health care.

title: United Nations Workers Accused of Sexual Abuse
description: UNITED NATIONS  United Nations personnel were accused in nearly 80 cases of rape, sexual assault and sex trafficking in 2014 alone, with the bulk of the cases involving peacekeepers deployed to some of the most troubled parts of the world.

title: Trial Opens in Deaths of 2 French Teenagers Fleeing the Police in 2005
description: PARIS  A decade ago, two teenagers were electrocuted when they hid in a transformer at an electrical substation while running from the police. Their deaths set off a wave of unrest that plunged the French suburbs into chaos.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 16, 2015
description: March 16, 2015

title: Womens N.C.A.A. Bracket
description: Womens N.C.A.A. bracket.

title: Iran Sent Arms to Iraq to Fight ISIS, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON  Iran has deployed advanced rockets and missiles to Iraq to help fight the Islamic State in Tikrit, a significant escalation of firepower and another sign of Irans growing influence in Iraq.

title: Connecticut Occupies Usual Perch
description: It has been 20 years since Rebecca Lobo led Connecticut to the undefeated season that started it all for Coach Geno Auriemma and the Huskies. On Saturday, UConn will begin its quest for a 10th title over that span.

title: Review: Placebo, With Carrie Coon, Opens at Playwrights Horizons
description: Pliny the Elder  naturalist, philosopher, warrior and all-around sage of the early Roman Empire  plays an unlikely role in Placebo, the new play by Melissa James Gibson that opened on Monday at Playwrights Horizons.

title: Some Tests
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Its always interesting to hear what inspires people to create. When it comes to crossword puzzles, almost anything can trigger the Oooo! That would make a spiffy puzzle theme! brain response.

title: Hillary Clinton at Irish American Event
description: Former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton spoke at her induction into the Irish America Hall of Fame, recalling an early decision of her husbands in the Northern Ireland peace process.

title: In Accepting Irish-American Honor, Hillary Clinton Recasts Her Role in a Peace Pact
description: The subjects of Ireland and tea made for an unpleasant brew in Hillary Rodham Clintons 2008 campaign for president. Her primary opponent, Barack Obama, once belittled her as having merely had tea with world leaders as first lady. Her husband defended her as a peacemaker, not a tea maker. Then she was accused of overstating her own contribution to the Northern Ireland peace process.

title: For Pawn in Disputed Transfer, a Winning Move
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J.  On her way to helping Seton Hall earn its first berth in the N.C.A.A. womens basketball tournament in two decades, Daisha Simmons had to make a few stops. Literally.

title: Moved by Mountains and the Sea in Indonesia
description: A short visit with a friend led Rony Zakaria to spend years exploring how faith shapes the relationship between people and nature in Indonesia.

title: Bad Luck or Bad Practices? Its Tough for Mets to Tell
description: So extensive is the growing list of Mets pitchers who have needed Tommy John surgery in recent years that even their general manager had difficulty recalling all of them on Monday.

title: Better Call Saul Recap: Every Single Penny
description: Season 1, Episode 7: Bingo

title: Candidates for Mayor Face Off in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  Sparring over pensions, red-light cameras, public education and gang violence, the mayoral candidates Rahm Emanuel and Jesus G. Garcia confronted each other in their first one-on-one debate on Monday, three weeks before the runoff election.

title: The Case for Kentucky as College Basketballs Greatest Defensive Team
description: Kentuckys dominant defense could be the best in N.C.A.A. history.

title: With Hustle and Grit, Manhattans RaShawn Stores Inspires by Defying the Odds
description: RaShawn Stores often prayed alone. At other times, he prayed with family members. They all sought guidance, unsure how to respond when a dream collided with harsh financial reality.

title: A Laid-Back Alternative to Miami Hot Spots
description: A quietly quirky restaurant opens off of the beachs most boisterous strip.

title: Ad-Rock and Num Pang Share a Recipe for Their New, Charitable Banh Mi
description: Food, hip-hop and 90s street style converge at the well-traversed, brightly colored graffiti-tagged sandwich empire Num Pang (established in 2009, the name is Cambodian for bread). This spring, the restaurants co-chefs and owners, Ben Daitz and Ratha Chaupoly, teamed up with the New York native Adam Horovitz (Ad-Rock) of the Beastie Boys to re-engineer pastrami on rye, a sandwich as iconic in New York as the boys behind it. Their creation, a limited-edition banh mi, is on menus at Num Pangs six locations today.

title: Behind Sam Shahids Closed Doors
description: Bombarded by imagery all day at work, the renowned advertising provocateur comes home to, well, very little.

title: Design With a Bit of Drama
description: The British furniture and lighting designer Lee Broom is known both for his clever, often nostalgic creations and the elaborate ways he displays them: In 2012, during the Milan Furniture Fair, he showed inside an old pub that he bought in London, disassembled and rebuilt in Milan. This year, hell return to the prestigious event with a unique take on the department store  Memphis-style chairs and fragmented mirrors in the gents fitting room, fluted tables that furnish the bookstore and tubular fluorescent lamps with cut crystal that illuminate the perfumery. I always try to do something theatrical, he says. And once I learned that the department store was an English invention, I knew I had the right idea.

title: Obama Wades Into Marijuana Debate in Vice Interview
description: President Obama has a number of speaking styles in his repertoire, from soaring oratory to serious policy wonkishness, withering sarcasm and cocky defensiveness. For an interview with Vice News released Monday, he went with optimistic paternalism.

title: Word of the Day | regicide
description: regicide  \re-j-sid\  noun

title: EBay Set to Open New Section on Its Site for Sothebys Auctions
description: EBay, the giant online auction site, sells millions of items to customers all over the world every single day. It wants to sell a whole lot more.

title: Louise Erdrich Wins Library of Congress Award
description: Louise Erdrich, author of the novels Love Medicine and The Round House, will receive the Library of Congress Prize for American Fiction this year.

title: Soccer Sites Set for Rio
description: Matches for the soccer tournament at the 2016 Rio Olympics will be held in six Brazilian cities. The most surprising inclusion was that of Arena Amaznia in Manaus, more than 1,800 miles from the main Olympic park.

title: Tax Cuts Still Dont Pay for Themselves
description: Last week, I wrote about the new tax plan from Senator Marco Rubio and Senator Mike Lee as the Puppies and Rainbows Tax Plan, because its a plan that includes something for everyone. It calls for big tax credits for middle-income families with children, corporate tax cuts and complete elimination of the capital gains tax  and as a result would cost trillions of dollars in revenue over a decade.

title: Playing Where the Money Is
description: Diana Taurasi, one of the top players in womens basketball, is not returning to the W.N.B.A. this season, honoring the wishes of her better-paying Russian team.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (CW) IZOMBIE Olivia Moore (Rose McIver), a formerly driven medical student, becomes depressed and slovenly when she is turned into a zombie. She must now subsist on human brains, culled from the bodies in the morgue where she works, which give her flashes of the memories they contain. She uses them to aid a homicide detective (Malcolm Goodwin) in solving murders in this new series, which counts Rob Thomas and Diane Ruggiero-Wright of Veronica Mars fame among its executive producers. Writing in The New York Times, Neil Genzlinger called the show ridiculously likable.

title: Vanuatu Death Toll Is Likely to Rise as Glimpses of Cyclones Fury Emerge
description: HONG KONG  Initial glimpses of remote parts of the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu, which was lashed by a cyclone over the weekend, indicated widespread devastation, relief workers said Tuesday.

title: Corrections: March 17, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Have you all seen the broken, paralyzed president, who has been kidnapped by generals? Hes only just flown in from Switzerland, where he attended a birth, as you know.

title: No Corrections: March 16, 2015
description: The Times welcomes comments and suggestions, or complaints about errors that warrant correction. Messages on news coverage can be e-mailed to nytnews@nytimes.com or left toll-free at 1-888-NYT-NEWS (1-888-698-6397). Comments on editorials may be e-mailed to letters@nytimes.com or faxed to (212) 556-3622.

title: Crowning Preteen Beauty Queens
description: From Palestinian refugee camps to Brooklyn pizzerias, Ilana Panich-Linsman has documented the lives of teenage girls, finding a common ground from her own youth in western Massachusetts, where she often felt alone and confused.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Welcoming Immigrants
description: To the Editor:

title: A Reformer, on Bias and Broken Windows
description: To the Editor:

title: Economic Progress in Ethiopia
description: To the Editor:

title: Commissioner Bratton, on Police Trends
The Loretta Lynch Confirmation Mess
description: What does the abortion issue have to do with the prevention of human trafficking? Nothing.

title: Gen. Petraeuss Light Punishment
description: Granted, Americans love a comeback story.

title: The Hidden Talent of Steve Jobs
description: The relationship between journalists and Steve Jobs could often be fraught, but there were always a handful of reporters he liked and trusted. They included John Markoff of The New York Times; Steven Levy, formerly of Wired magazine (hes now at Medium); Walt Mossberg, the longtime technology columnist for The Wall Street Journal (hes now at Re/code); and Brent Schlender of Fortune. They had all been on the technology beat seemingly forever, and they had known Jobs for decades.

title: Could Obama Bypass the Supreme Court?
description: CHICAGO  IT is time to talk about President Obamas contingency plan for health care. The Supreme Court heard oral arguments earlier this month in King v. Burwell, a case challenging the provision of tax credits on federal insurance exchanges. While the legal issues are dry lawyers fare  how to interpret several interconnected phrases of the Affordable Care Act  the practical stakes are high.
