The government estimates that millions of Americans will be left without affordable health insurance if it loses.

title: Skills in Flux
description: Several years ago, Doug Lemov began studying videos of excellent teachers. He focused not on their big strategies but on their microgestures: How long they waited before calling on students to answer a question (to give the less confident students time to get their hands up); when they paced about the classroom and when they stood still (while issuing instructions, to emphasize the importance of whats being said); how they moved around the room toward a student whose mind might be wandering.

title: Venture Capitals Boys Club on Trial
description: Venture capitalists are widely considered to be men  and they are almost all men  who can see the future. But there is at least one thing they have not been able to see clearly or willing to do anything about for a long time: A terrible record of hiring and promoting women.

title: A Conversation With My Black Son
description: For generations, parents of black boys across the United States have rehearsed, dreaded and postponed The Conversation. But when their boys become teenagers, parents must choose whether or not to expose their sons to what it means to be a black man here. To keep him safe, they may have to tell the child they love that he risks being targeted by the police, simply because of the color of his skin. How should parents impart this information, while maintaining their childs pride and sense of self? How does one teach a child to face dangerous racism and ask him to emerge unscathed?

title: A Conversation With My Black Son
description: In this short documentary, parents reveal their struggles with telling their black sons that they may be targets of racial profiling by the police.

title: Test Yourself | A Basketball Team Helped by Math
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 14 article, Davidson Math Students Lend a Hand to Basketball Team.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Kendrick Lamar on His New Album and the Weight of Clarity
description: In Kendrick Lamar on His New Album and the Weight of Clarity, Joe Coscarelli writes about Mr. Lamars new album.

title: How Do You Solve a Problem Like Ben Carson?
description: Late in February, Dr. Ben Carson, the celebrated pediatric neurosurgeon turned political insurrectionist, was trying to check off another box on his presidential-campaign to-do list: hiring a press secretary. The lead prospect, a public-relations specialist named Deana Bass, had come to meet him at the dimly lit Capitol Hill office of Carsons confidant and business manager, Armstrong Williams. Carson sat back and scrutinized her from behind a small granite table, as life-size cardboard cutouts of more conventional politicians  President Obama, with a tight smile, and Senator John McCain, glowering  loomed behind each of his shoulders. (The mock $3 bill someone had left on a table in Williamss waiting room undercut any notion that this was a bipartisan zone; it featured Obama wearing a turban.)

title: Are Manners Important?
description: Put your napkin on your lap. Keep your elbows off the table. Chew with your mouth closed. Society imparts all sorts of manners for us to follow at the dinner table, and elsewhere.

title: Labels, Digital Included, Assume New Importance at Museums
description: Like a primatologist observing gorillas in the wild, Judy Rand sometimes prowls around museums to spy on visitors. Ms. Rand, a museum consultant in Seattle and an acclaimed writer of exhibit labels, loves spotting guests reading her work aloud.

title: Diana Taurasi Focusing on Playing in Russia, Where the Money Is
description: YEKATERINBURG, Russia  The noise inside the arena is deafening. Thousands of Russians in off-brand tracksuits and snow pants are shouting and beating inflatable foil batons together as Diana Taurasi, perhaps the greatest womens basketball player in the world, dribbles across the court.

title: For the Walker Art Center, a Shop That Peddles Evanescence
description: Visitors to the gift shop at the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis will soon be able to buy something a little more esoteric, alongside their Chuck Close posters and Pantone mugs. On Mothers Day, the promotion might go, how about a new ringtone calibrated by the composer Nico Muhly, just for stressful family calls?

title: Museums Turn to Technology to Boost Attendance by Millennials
description: If museums face an uncertain future, you wouldnt know it from Henri Matisse: The Cutouts, which recently drew 664,000 to the Museum of Modern Art. The show was so thronged that MoMA kept its doors open round-the-clock on the closing weekend last month.

title: A More Public Option for Investigating Shootings by Police Officers
description: MISSOULA, Mont.  In most places, the actions of the police officer who fatally shot Kaileb Williams, 20, would have been judged in secret, by an anonymous grand jury weighing criminal charges behind closed doors.

title: Streetcar Revival Is Wavering in Some Cities
description: WASHINGTON  First, suburban Arlington, Va., abandoned long-laid plans last fall to build a streetcar line its leaders hoped would help revitalize a neglected corridor.

title: Afghan Militia Leaders, Empowered by U.S. to Fight Taliban, Inspire Fear in Villages
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Rahimullah used to be a farmer  just a normal person living an ordinary life, as he put it. Then he formed his own militia last year and found himself swept up in Americas exit strategy from Afghanistan.

title: Sex-Trafficking Bill, Ensnared by Politics, Is Left in Limbo by a Senate Vote
description: WASHINGTON  Congress headed into another major legislative standoff Tuesday when a measure to create a fund for victims of sexual trafficking failed to clear a procedural hurdle, leaving in peril a bill that once had the support of a majority of lawmakers.

title: Culture Crash, by Scott Timberg
description: In 2010, the Louisville Orchestra filed for Chapter 11 protection. Reader comments generated by a newspaper article on this development, Scott Timberg writes in Culture Crash, gave a sense of the way many people think about culture and the market. Timberg reproduces some of the comments in all their typo-filled glory. Pack up your fiddles and go home boys and girls, one reader advised. Maybe find real jobs. Go to Nashville and vie for some sessions work. Another commenter opined: Sale all of assets to pay these people off, fire them all and get rid of the Orchestra. It isnt popular with the residents or they would have packed crowds and not have to worry about $$$.

title: I.P.O. Could Value Refresco Gerber at Up to $1.36 Billion
description: LONDON  Refresco Gerber, one of Europes largest bottlers of soft drinks and fruit juices, said on Tuesday that the expected price range for its initial public offering could value the company at up to 1.29 billion euros, or about $1.36 billion.

title: Myanmar Sentences 3 to Prison for Depicting Buddha Wearing Headphones
description: YANGON, Myanmar  A bar manager from New Zealand and two Burmese men were sentenced to two years in prison in Myanmar on Tuesday for posting an image online of the Buddha wearing headphones, an effort to promote an event.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get the Morning Briefing in your inbox first thing? Sign up.)

title: Exploring Indianapolis, for the Final Four and Beyond
description: The brackets are filled in, and the betting pools are rich. It must be mid-March.

title: The Virtues of Microadventures
description: Alastair Humphreys adventure-hopped for a decade, starting with a four-year round-the-world bicycle trip after college. From there, the British author, blogger and motivational speaker traversed southern India, rowed across the Atlantic Ocean and trekked 1,000 miles across the Arabian Peninsulas Empty Quarter.

title: Hotels for the Next Generation
description: Longing for alternatives to the conventional, cookie-cutter hotel? Along with crocuses and daffodils, new specialty chains from major hospitality companies including Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt and Carlson Rezidor will be springing up across the globe in the coming weeks and months.

title: In Geneva, Art Thrives Where Watches Were Made
description: When the strikingly redesigned Muse dEthnographie de Genve (Geneva Museum of Ethnography) reopened in October 2014, the Quartier des Bains, the neighborhood thats become Genevas own little SoHo, got a defining new landmark. Bound by the Rhone and Arve rivers in the southern part of the city, this unexpectedly hip gallery- and museum-studded neighborhood in a town best known for banks, international institutions like the Red Cross and luxury watches has emerged as one of the liveliest and most innovative contemporary art districts in Europe.

title: IBM Introduces Twitter-Fueled Data Services for Business
description: When IBM announced its partnership with Twitter last October, the move seemed both promising and logical.

title: Israel Elections: Results and Analysis
Jeb Bush Emails Reveal Foresight on Disclosures
description: With Hillary Rodham Clinton on the defensive over her use of a personal email account as secretary of state, the line between private and official electronic communications has gotten more attention in the past two weeks than perhaps ever before.

title: New York Today: St. Patricks Day Parade (and Protests)
description: Top of the morning to you on this St. Patricks Day.

title: Daily Report: Apple Pay and Banks Tussle Over Fraud
description: When Apple was planning its Apple Pay electronic payment system last summer for its iPhones, the nations banks raced to be included among the first credit card issuers associated with the new technology, writes Andrew Ross Sorkin.

title: Private Equity Firm Permira Sells Last of Its Hugo Boss Stake
description: LONDON  The private equity firm Permira has sold its remaining stake in Hugo Boss after steadily reducing its holdings in the German fashion brand in recent years in anticipation of an eventual exit.

title: Japans Central Bank Warns of Temporary Return to Deflation
description: TOKYO  Over the last two years, the Japanese central bank governor, Haruhiko Kuroda, has accomplished what a string of more cautious predecessors failed to do: reverse a prolonged and damaging slide in the price of goods and services in Japan.

title: Detention of Rights Activists in China Soared in 2014, Report Says
description: The Chinese authorities last year detained more people advocating greater civic rights than at any time since at least the mid-1990s, a United States-based organization said in a new report.

title: A Sucker Is Optimized Every Minute
description: Not long ago, our blockbuster business books spoke in unison: Trust your gut. The secret to decision-making lay outside our intellects, across the aisle in our loopy right brains, with their emo melodramas and surges of intuition. Linear thinking was suddenly the royal road to ruin. Dan Arielys Predictably Irrational tracked the extravagant illogic of our best judgment calls. The Freakonomics authors urged us to think like nut jobs. In Blink, Malcolm Gladwell counseled abandoning scientific method in favor of snap judgments. Tedious hours of research, conducted by artless cubicle drones, became the province of companies courting Chapter 11. To the artsy dropouts who could barely grasp a polynomial would go the spoils of the serial bull markets.

title: The Lost Glove Waves Farewell to Winter
description: Perched on the cusp of spring, we watch the soot-gray snowbanks melt and feel the deep-winter blues flow down the storm drain. In the gutter we see a soggy record of the season left behind: fossil layers of litter, unfrozen unscooped poop and, quite touching, long-lost gloves waving their final goodbyes.

title: Object Lesson
description: In November 2013, thousands of people gathered in Maidan Nezalezhnosti, the central square in Kiev, to protest their governments refusal to ratify an agreement with the European Union. The demonstrations went on for months; when brutal attempts were made to stop them, they only became more popular. The crowds were enormous, containing, at times, more than 100,000 people. Many of the photographs from the protests had the organized disorder of medieval battle scenes: spiky barricades, rows of tents, patches of soil and ash, flashes of color where flags were held aloft, sudden brightness from reflections and fires, a great swirl of angry humanity and dark-helmeted riot police massed behind shields, all of it set against backdrops of smoke, fog or falling snow. So epic and cinematic were the photographs from the Maidan that it took some effort to remember that they were first and foremost news images, unstaged depictions of real, ongoing human suffering.

title: A Blurred Line in Copyright Law
Today in Politics: As Hillary Clinton Tests the Waters, Who Pays?
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton has a growing team of campaign staff members-to-be, but how some of them are getting paid has been something of a mystery.

title: Morning Agenda: Blame Game in Apple Pay Fraud
description: BLAME GAME IN APPLE PAY FRAUD | When Apple was planning its Apple Pay electronic payment system last summer for its iPhones, the nations banks rushed to be included. Now, some of the banks are privately complaining that Apple Pay may not be so great after all, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. But the banks may largely have themselves to blame, he adds. A raft of headlines over the last week about unusually high fraud rates from thieves using stolen credit numbers on Apple Pay has exposed what many of the banks privately acknowledge they have been trying to fix for months.

title: Chinese Developer Evergrande Gets $16 Billion Lifeline Amid Slump
description: HONG KONG  Chinese banks have extended $16 billion in credit lines to shore up one of the countrys largest and most heavily indebted home builders, as pressure mounts on developers short of cash in a slumping property market.

title: South Korea Tells China Not to Meddle in Decision Over Missile System
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Tension between Seoul and Beijing over Washingtons desire to deploy a ballistic missile defense system in South Korea intensified on Tuesday as South Korea made an unusual public retort to China, asking it not to meddle in its defense policy.

title: Harajuku Style in Tokyo
description: Rarely does a neighborhood influence a fashion movement as distinctly, yet diversely, as does the Harajuku district of Tokyo. Often all mixed together, the elements of Harajuku style include manga-inspired baby-doll dresses and pigtails, goth makeup and platform shoes, and kimonos.

title: British Regulators Bar Former Rabobank Trader in Libor Inquiry
description: LONDON  British regulators said on Tuesday that they had barred a former trader at the Dutch lender Rabobank from the securities industry after he pleaded guilty to criminal charges in the United States last year related to a conspiracy to manipulate a global benchmark interest rate.

title: Secret Service Wants a Fake White House to Help Protect the Real One
description: WASHINGTON  Stung by accusations that it cannot adequately protect the White House, the Secret Service wants to spend $8 million to build another White House in Beltsville, Md.

title: Spoilers, Embargoes, Disclosures and Jinx
description: Updated. For some of those enthralled with HBOs documentary series The Jinx, the Sunday night news alert from The Times was the very definition of a spoiler.

title: In Performance: T. Oliver Reid
description: This weeks video features the singer T. Oliver Reid, with Lawrence Yurman on piano, singing the jazz standard Sophisticated Lady, a number Mr. Reid performs in his cabaret show Drop Me Off in Harlem. The song was composed as an instrumental piece by Duke Ellington, who introduced it on record in 1933; the lyricist Mitchell Parish later added the words.

title: Iowa State Doesnt Take Its Heart-Pounding Comebacks Lightly
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  It takes a delicate touch to joke about your bosss heart attack without appearing callous. The palpitations that the Iowa State basketball team gave its boisterous fans throughout the Big 12 tournament lend themselves to such risky humor, especially from Coach Fred Hoiberg, whose own heart problems prematurely ended his N.B.A. career.

title: Fluent in Journalese
description: This week, a guest lament from my colleague Patrick LaForge, on the stubborn persistence of journalistic clichs:

title: Secret Service Chief Criticized in Congress Over Agents Latest Lapse
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers from both parties lashed out at the newly appointed director of the Secret Service at a hearing Tuesday, accusing him of doing little to restore the publics faith in an agency jolted by embarrassing scandals and security breaches.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 10-16, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Family Drama Entangles Hong Kongs Leader
description: Hong Kongs leader, Leung Chun-ying, denied his daughters allegations on Tuesday that her mother had abused her and confined her to the familys residence.

title: Macerich Rejects Takeover Offer From Simon, a Rival Mall Owner
description: One of the major mall operators in the country, the Macerich Company, on Tuesday rejected an unsolicited offer from its largest rival, the Simon Property Group, and took steps to defend itself against a hostile takeover.

title: Patrik Ervells Campaign With No Clothes
description: The mens wear designer Patrik Ervells latest ads will feature only the work of the late photographer Peter Hujar. The earliest of the never-before-seen photos  a mix of black-and-white portraits and still lifes  were shot in 1981, the year after Ervell was born. His images are timeless, says Ervell of Hujar, who, like his controversy-courting peer Robert Mapplethorpe, captured iconic pictures of downtown fixtures such as Susan Sontag and Candy Darling. They could have been taken for me last week.

title: Missing a Friendly Stranger
description: Dear Diary:

title: Chris Borland, Fearing for Health, Retires From the 49ers. At 24.
description: It is an off-season like no other in the National Football League. Young players, with many games and millions of dollars potentially ahead of them, are walking away from the countrys most popular sport.

title: Our N.C.A.A. Bracket Contest Rewards Risk
description: Today were highlighting the comment magnets of recent days.

title: Do Money Woes Spur Creativity or Stifle It?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Rivka Galchen and Mohsin Hamid discuss the role of money troubles in a creative life.

title: 3 European Powers Say They Will Join China-Led Bank
description: BRUSSELS  Ignoring direct pleas from the Obama administration, Europes biggest economies have declared their desire to become founding members of a new Chinese-led Asian investment bank that the United States views as a rival to the World Bank and other institutions set up at the height of American power after World War II.

title: House Republicans Propose Budget With Deep Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans called it streamlining, empowering states or achieving sustainability. They couched deep spending reductions in any number of gauzy euphemisms.

title: CFDA Award Nominees Are Announced
description: In the past, the Council of Fashion Designers of America has bestowed its Eugenia Sheppard Award for media on a wide range of journalists: newspaperpeople (Teri Agins, Patrick McCarthy); magazine editors of various stripes (Paul Cavaco, Candy Pratts Price); photographers (Bill Cunningham, Bruce Weber); and bloggers (Scott Schuman and Garance Dor).

title: Remains in Madrid Are Believed to Be Those of Cervantes
description: MADRID  In a discovery that could create a new venue for literary pilgrims, Spanish investigators said on Tuesday that they might have located part of the remains of Cervantes, whose novel Don Quixote has enthralled readers over centuries with stories of its eponymous knight and his servant, Sancho Panza.

title: First Draft Focus: The White House Sees Green
Netanyahu Sees Threat From Arab Votes
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel posted a video to social media on Tuesday urging Israelis to vote. He said right wing rule was threatened by Arab voters.

title: Clip: Get Hard
description: A scene from the film featuring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.

title: Clip: Amour Fou
description: A scene from the film.

title: Breast Biopsies Leave Room for Doubt, Study Finds
description: Breast biopsies are good at telling the difference between healthy tissue and cancer, but less reliable for identifying more subtle abnormalities, a new study finds.

title: Jeb Bushs Pick to Win It All, and Its Not Kentucky
description: Regional and partisan differences aside, President Obama, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida have at least one thing in common: All are filling out N.C.A.A. tournament brackets this week.

title: A Wireless Baby and a Father, Getting Wired In
description: It was just a trip to our favorite frozen yogurt shop, but it was incredible, and it wasnt because we came in time for the buy-one-get-one-free happy hour. It was incredible because for the first time, Rachel and I had a guest with us while we had our taro and peanut butter froyo sundaes.

title: Reviews: Aasif Mandvis No Lands Man and Maz Jobranis Im Not a Terrorist, but Ive Played One on TV
description: Theres a loaded moment in Maz Jobranis new memoir, Im Not a Terrorist, but Ive Played One on TV, in which this Iranian-American comic finally catches a break in the stand-up world. Its 1999, and hes been invited by Mitzi Shore, owner of the Comedy Store in Los Angeles, to become a regular at her venerable club.

title: St. Patricks Day Parade Includes First Gay Group, but Dismay Remains
description: As the St. Patricks Day Parade wound down Tuesday afternoon, gray clouds gathered above and most spectators straggled away. But that did not diminish the enthusiasm of one group that proudly marched up Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, spangled with green sashes, to make history in the emerald tide: It was the first, and only, gay organization allowed in the parade.

title: Case Closed: Sherlock Special Will be Set in Victorian Times
description: LONDON  It was the Mystery of the Historical Costume: to promote a a coming season of Sherlock, the BBC last year released an image of Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman in Victorian clothing. Then the two stars were recently seen in similar outfits while filming the new Sherlock series. Speculation  never in short order where Sherlock (or Sherlock) is concerned  abounded.

title: Readers React to Republicans Letter to Iran
description: Nancy Wartik is a news assistant and comment moderator for The Times.

title: As Argentina and Hedge Funds Battle, Citigroup Bows Out
description: The nasty battle between Argentina and a group of New York hedge funds has claimed another victim: Citigroup.

title: Apple Said to Plan Limited, Low-Cost Streaming Service
description: Apple has held talks with a number of leading television groups to offer an Internet-based TV service for its iPhone, iPad and Apple TV set-top box, according to people briefed on the companys plans.

title: Eleven Madison Park
description: Daniel Humm and Will Guidara pull out all the stops with food and service.

title: Restaurant Review: Eleven Madison Park in Midtown South
description: Can a restaurant still succeed when it fails at what it says it wants to do?

title: Left and Right, Family and Economics
description: My Sunday column weighed in on the latest (and presently very intra-Timesian) version of the neverending does culture or economics explain family breakdown? debate. Responding, in part,to the critics of my colleague David Brookss earlier column on morals and the social fabric, I made the case that there just hasnt been the kind of significant increase in privation (or the kind of cuts to welfare programs; quite the reverse) that some writers on the left invoke as an explanation forwhy todays poor and working class Americans are so much less likely than in prior eras to have children within wedlock and stay married when they do. Instead, notwithstanding all the burdens they bear and challenges they face, downscale Americans have somewhat more income and a much stronger safety net than their grandparents and great-grandparents did. So as much as economic burdens clearly play a role in family instability, and would be plausible explanations for the existence of a persistentrich-poor family-structure gap, they seem like weaker explanations for why out-of-wedlock birth rates have gone up so rapidly over the last half-century, not only among the underclass but increasingly in Middle America as well.

title: Jeb Bushs Bracket: Iowa, Virginia and a Dash of Ohio
description: Filling out an N.C.A.A. bracket isnt just about basketball prognostication. Its also about personal preferences. In this regard, Jeb Bushs bracket  obtained by our colleague Nick Corasaniti  is a delight. (Weve created a version of Mr. Bushs bracket in The Timess bracket contest.)

title: As California Drought Enters 4th Year, Conservation Efforts and Worries Increase
description: LOS ANGELES  The rainy season drove into California in December with wet and windy promise: soaking rain, snow, dark gray skies and a flash of hope that the drought that has scorched this region had run its course. And then came January  with record high temperatures and record low rainfall.

title: Germany to Join Asia Infrastructure Bank
description: Wolfgang Schuble, the German finance minister, announced Tuesday that Germany, with France and Italy, would become a founding member of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank.

title: Joel McHale on the Latest Revival of Community and Being O.K.  With Reference Humor
description: Apologies to Tina Fey and Robert Carlock, but evidence suggests that Community is actually the most unbreakable comedy on television, even though its technically not on television anymore. The shows new season debuted on Tuesday at Yahoos video site, Yahoo Screen.

title: Israels Election: The Rare Actual Tossup
description: Pundits love to refer to elections as tossups, but most are not. By the time Election Day arrives, one candidate tends to be a strong favorite, even when the polls are fairly close. But todays election in Israel is the rare exception: Its close to a true tossup.

title: Jeb Bush, 20 Years After Conversion, Is Guided by His Catholic Faith
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla.  He arrived a few minutes early  no entourage, just his wife and daughter  and, sweating through a polo shirt in the hot morning sun, settled quietly into the 14th row at the Church of the Little Flower.

title: 1890: Strike Takes Riotous Turn
description: LIVERPOOL  The most critical stage in the history of the great dock strike was reached to-day [March 17], when the refusal of a large proportion of the carters to cease work in order to strengthen the hands of the dock laborers culminated in an alarming riot. The disturbance began by those teams-men who had ceased work in defiance of the grace remonstrance by the treasurer of the Union, falling upon those in charge of the horses, knocking them about, and tearing bales of cotton off their carts. A large body of police was hurriedly marched to the scene, and after much trouble the rioters were dispersed.  The New York Herald, European Edition, March 18, 1890

title: Grimm Associate Is Sentenced to 3 Months in Prison
description: An associate of former Representative Michael G. Grimm received a surprisingly harsh sentence on Tuesday for violating campaign finance law, a signal that Mr. Grimm may face tough consequences when he is sentenced later this year for tax fraud.

title: If Only G.E. Had an Activist Investor Who Cared
description: Almost nothing General Electric does registers with its stockholders. A big asset sale? Shares hardly budge. A multibillion-dollar acquisition? Yawn. Aggressive shrinkage of its irritating financial business? Crickets. It seems investors no longer care about the company, a $254 billion conglomerate run by Jeffrey R. Immelt. If only G.E. had an activist who cared.

title: Intriguing Sketches Reveal the Depths of Geoff McFetridges Quirky, Beautiful Mind
description: The artist, who illustrated visuals for Spike Jonzes Her and has created everything from Nike sneakers to a stop-motion music video filled with toast, shares 30 drawings in a new zine.

title: Republicans Raise Pressure Over Hillary Clintons Emails
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton might be hoping to turn the page on her email controversy, but Republicans are doing their best to keep the story in the spotlight.

title: Deep Wounds and Lingering Questions After Israels Bitter Race
description: JERUSALEM  Benjamin Netanyahu was poised to return to power. But there was a cloud over his apparent turnaround, the result of an increasingly shrill campaign that raised questions about his ability to heal Israels internal wounds or better its standing in the world.

title: Review: In Remote New York, an Unseen Tour Guide Calls the Shots
description: I am but a member of the horde, a cipher among countless ciphers. We swarm through the citys streets and subways, moving together like parts in a machine. We are replaceable, we are erasable, we are disposable. Soon no one will know we existed.

title: Last-Ranked Bhutan Stuns Sri Lanka a Second Time
description: THIMPHU, Bhutan  Inside a monastery high up in the hills that surround Bhutans capital city, the players on the countrys national soccer team were consulting the dice.

title: This Time, Robert Durst Faces a Murder Charge in the Capital of Celebrity Trials
description: The dead man lay on the floor, the defendant testified, killed accidentally as the two struggled over a loaded gun. What to do next came to him in a haze of drugs and Jack Daniels: He carved up the body until he was swimming in blood, he testified, wrapped the parts in garbage bags and dumped them in Galveston Bay.

title: Nintendo Forms Partnership to Develop Mobile Games
description: For years, Nintendo had insisted that it would not take its beloved cast of video game characters, including Mario and Zelda, to the smartphones and tablets that tens of millions of people now use to play games.

title: Syrian Activists Say Chlorine Gas Attack Kills 6 in Idlib Province
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Anti-government activists in Syria said Tuesday that a chlorine bomb attack by government forces on a northwestern village overnight had killed six people and filled clinics with choking victims.

title: Driven | 2015 Volvo V60 Cross Country
description: Aside from the user interface in the dash, finding fault with Volvos V60 Cross Country takes concentration.

title: Video Review: Volvo V60 Cross Country, Good for the Long Haul
description: ARE luxury automotive brands banned from using comprehensible names? It would explain the baffling alphanumeric monikers that Acura, Audi, BMW, Infiniti, Lexus and Mercedes use. Volvo forks off this trail with the newest V60 variant by adding two actual words: Cross Country.

title: For St. Patricks Day Parade, Shamrocks and Green Eyeshadow
description: Performers converged on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan for the annual celebration of Irish culture, and it was the first time an openly gay group marched in the event.

title: Exchange Rates and Balance Sheet Effects
description: Neil Irwin writes about concerns that a rising dollar will damage developing countries where corporations have borrowed in dollars; as he says, this raises echoes of the Asian crisis of the late 1990s and the Argentine crisis of 2002.

title: Works Sighted: Female Amputees Deserve Better
description: Most prosthetics are designed for men, meaning female amputees can struggle with moving comfortably, finding shoes that fit, or holding a child. Things are changing, but slowly.

title: Iran and U.S. Differ on Optimism About Nuclear Talks
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  Iran and the United States issued contrasting assessments Tuesday on their progress toward an agreement to limit Irans nuclear program as Energy Secretary Ernest J. Moniz met here with his Iranian counterpart.

title: Retro Striped Knits for Spring
description: Nautical tends to be the go-to stripe for the spring and summer months; but this season, the best mens striped knits, from polos to pullovers, are instead retro in nature. In burnt oranges, acid greens and electric blues, they feel as charmingly youthful as one of the boys captured in a Daniel Meadows photograph circa 1973 especially when paired with well-worn, washed-out Levis.

title: Lawyer: Durst Did Not Kill Susan Berman
description: Dick DeGuerin, the lawyer for Robert A. Durst, said that Mr. Durst did not kill his friend Susan Berman and that the murder charge was based on a television show and not on fact.

title: Sources of Slow Recovery
description: The other R&R  Christina and David Romer  have an interesting new paper questioning the other Reinhart-Rogoff result, the claim that financial crises consistently lead to deep, sustained slumps. Im not ready to referee this one, at least not yet. Romer and Romer clearly have done an impressively systematic job of identifying financial distress in an objective way; but I wonder, very tentatively, if theyre looking at the wrong variable. My sense is that the aftermath of credit and housing bubbles is consistently remarkably bad  Alan Taylor and colleagues have been documenting this proposition  and that may not be well captured by reports of credit-market distress.

title: Springtime in California
description: Mark Bittman embraces the vegetables of the season.

title: Springs Opening Act
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Back in the 80s, I resented the existence of Meyer lemons and anyone who championed them. Those groovy Bay Area people would write recipes calling for Meyer lemons, as if anyone could find them, and insist that a regular lemon just wouldnt do.

title: Lone Star State of Mind
description: Will Butler of Arcade Fire [and its a different Will Butler! You see, Im on a panel with the AF Butler brothers Thursday, so I just assumed ] has a somewhat downbeat piece about the corporatization of SXSW. And I have just arrived in Austin to do some investigative reporting on the scene, remaining clearly focused on the socioeconomic issues  that is, aside from the concerts and the parties, which I will of course attend purely for research purposes. The same for my beer consumption.

title: At Chicago Hotel, an App About the Art and Architecture
description: A new digital application is designed to give guests a better understanding of the wavelike, Jeanne Gang-designed Aqua Tower in Chicago, where the Radisson Blu Aqua Hotel is located.

title: 1940: Nazi Planes Bomb Naval Base
description: LONDON  Fourteen Nazi warplanes last night [March 16] bombed units of the British fleet at Scapa Flow in the second raid on the naval base since war started, damaged at least one warship and killed eight men, including one civilian, the first killed on British soil. One German plane was shot down and others were damaged, the official British report said. The air raiders previously made a brief reconnaissance flight over the Orkney Islands. The German communiqu said three British battleships and one cruiser were badly damaged during the raid.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 18, 1940

title: Congress Scrutinizes F.C.C. Following Release of New Internet Rules
description: Nearly three weeks after the Federal Communications Commission voted to regulate broadband Internet like a public utility, Congress is putting the agency and its new rules under the microscope.

title: Aaron Schock, Facing Questions on Spending, Is Resigning
Results at Jefferies Expose the Banks Weaknesses
description: Jefferies is rubbing salt into its own wounds. The Wall Street firm managed to avoid a second straight quarterly loss, but only barely.  Net income for its first quarter was a dismal $12.5 million as the three months to February exposed some of the investment banks weaknesses.

title: Northern Tiger Set to Open Downtown
description: Headliner

title: Intriguing Sketches Reveal the Depths of Geoff McFetridges Quirky, Beautiful Mind
description: Like most artists, Geoff McFetridge relies on early drawings to inform his final works. An illustrator based in Los Angeles, the 43-year-old creates graphic images in fine lines and bold colors, and his output is as prolific as it is varied: He has produced skateboard decks and album covers, cleaning product packaging and beer bottle labels, often collaborating with high-profile names like Spike Jonze and Nike. In one memorable stop-motion film, for the fun-loving alt-rock band OK Go, McFetridge burned illustrations into 2,430 pieces of toast. I am always interested in creating work that lies between image and language, he says.

title: Facebook Announces a Payments Feature for Its Messenger App
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Facebooks instant messaging service isnt just for sending smiley faces and photos anymore. Now you can use it to send money instantly to your friends.

title: Neville Wakefields Many Muses
description: From the toy sailboats he made as a boy to the large-scale installations hes overseen in his career, the art world curator credits his rural childhood and his own children for sharpening his keen aesthetic.

title: Behind the Poster: Into the Woods
description: For its new production of the musical Into the Woods, Theater Latt Da in Minneapolis didnt look to fairy tales for inspiration. It went for something with more oom-pah: a German beer hall.

title: Beyond Pop
description: A revival of interest in the iconic 1960s and 70s work of the French designer has revealed an artist whose career was more varied and extensive than most realize.

title: SXSW Music 2015: Early Show-Hopping, Taking In Known and Unknown Bands
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The sprawl of the South by Southwest Music and Media Conference gradually shifts today toward the festivals original core: music.

title: Where the Republican Budget Plan Meets Reality on Health Care
description: The budget proposal released by House Republicans on Tuesday promises it can repeal Obamacare and save the government a lot of money in the process. But the document relies on some vague accounting to justify this claim.

title: The Columbus Theatres Folk Revival
description: The happy saga of a vaudeville-turned-movie-turned-porn venue.

title: To Butlers Delight, Roosevelt Jones Finds Way to Score
description: When Matthew Graves was an assistant at Butler, he was known as a shooters coach. Graves believed that all players, from the point guard to the big men, needed a perimeter game. So when he called the former Butler coach Brad Stevens in the fall of 2009 and said that he had just scouted a unique talent, Stevens thought Graves had stumbled upon a phenomenally gifted shooter.

title: U.S.-Cuba Talks on Restoring Diplomatic Ties End Abruptly
description: MEXICO CITY  The United States and Cuba have ended their third round of talks on re-establishing diplomatic relations as abruptly as the meeting was announced, with no breakthrough on sticking points and in an atmosphere of rising tension over Venezuela.

title: Self-Justifying Swedes
description: One fundamental principle in the years since the financial crisis, with all the bad judgments and policy missteps weve seen, is that nobody ever admits having been wrong about anything. And it turns out that people can not admit error in Swedish, too. Lars Svensson has the details on the Riksbanks deputy governor Jansson.

title: SXSW 2015: Will Ferrell Discusses Fraternities, Get Hard and More
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The actor and comedian Will Ferrell arrived here on Monday with Kevin Hart to present the comedy Get Hard. Last week, we asked readers to submit questions for Mr. Ferrell. He sat down with us at the Four Seasons to answer some of them. Here are his responses:

title: Review: In Running Away From the One With the Knife, a Suicide Pondered
description: Percolating coffee drips into a pot at the front of the Chocolate Factory stage. Boiling grounds are a familiar scent, burbling water a familiar sound, the sort of routine you reach for when the world seems inexplicable, unmoored.

title: Hungary Without Two Thirds
description: A guest post from my Princeton colleague Kim Lane Scheppele, head of the Law and Public Affairs program:

title: After I.V.F.: Pregnant, but Still Stuck in the Past
description: Every time I tell someone Im pregnant, the first thought that grips my heart in terror is, What if I have to tell them that it didnt work?

title: Drugs on Campus: A Reporters Challenge
description: Whats a young reporter to do when shes assigned to investigate a college drug scene after a series of overdoses? Try to blend in. Tatiana Schlossberg realized recently that its harder than one might think.

title: Netanyahu Soundly Defeats Chief Rival in Israeli Elections
description: TEL AVIV  After a bruising campaign focused on his failings, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel won a clear victory in Tuesdays elections and seemed all but certain to form a new government and serve a fourth term, though he offended many voters and alienated allies in the process.

title: S.E.C. Chief Voices Support for Higher Advice Standard for Brokers
description: PHOENIX  The chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission announced on Tuesday that she planned to explore setting a higher standard for brokers in dispensing investment advice, putting the agency in the middle of a potential fight between the Obama administration and the financial industry.

title: Cultivating Genius
description: Cy Twombly painted some of the 20th centurys great works in the hilly Italian coastal town of Gaeta. All the while, Nicola Del Roscio, who watched over him, quietly created his own Eden.

title: Voting for Israels Next Prime Minister
description: As the results of Israels tight election roll in, Israelis reflect on the issues they hope the next prime minister will make priorities.

title: Air Force Veteran From New Jersey Tried to Aid ISIS, U.S. Charges
description: An Air Force veteran from New Jersey, recently fired from his job as an airplane mechanic, has been charged with trying to support the Islamic State by seeking to join the group.

title: Review: Pierre-Laurent Aimard and Tamara Stefanovich in All-Boulez Program
description: Pierre Boulez emerged in the late 1940s in Paris as a combative modernist, the brash new leader of the avant-garde. By 1952 he declared that any musician who had not felt the necessity of the dodecaphonic language was of no use. Despite subsequent decades of winning over mainstream classical music audiences through his work as a conductor with lucid, colorful performances of everything from Wagner operas to Mahler symphonies, Mr. Boulez, who turns 90 on March 26, has never shaken his early reputation for writing pieces of off-putting complexity.

title: So Glad You Could Make It, Mr. Mayor
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio was late again this morning. The Daily News reported that he arrived 15 minutes behind schedule to a St. Patricks Day Mass at St. Patricks Cathedral. This was after he somehow managed to be equally late to a St. Patricks Day breakfast and reception in his own house, Gracie Mansion.

title: Obama Takes St. Patricks Day-Themed Swipe at Republicans
description: The White House fountain was running green and a green tie-wearing President Obama was full of St. Patricks Day puns when he blasted Republicans newly unveiled budget on Tuesday.

title: Taxes Take Away, but Also Give Back, Mostly to the Very Rich
description: Get your billions back, America, the tax preparer H&R Block urges in television advertisements.

title: Eleven Madison Park
description: Daniel Humm and Will Guidara pull out all the stops with food and service.

title: Men, Money and the Marriage Crisis
description: As promised in my last entry, this will be the first of two posts on the theme of whether economic trends largely explain post-1960s family breakdown (my answer: no), addressing counterarguments that I didnt have room to discuss in Sundays column. The first counterargument is about men: It concedes that there is a modestupward post-60s trend in household income, rather than a steep decline, but it argues that focusing on the general trend ignores a collapse in earnings for low-skilled men, which since it takes two to tango, and marry suffices to explain why its become harder for working class males to successfully fill the roles of husband and father  especially since, with women entering the workforce, they arent as economically dependent on men as they once were and dont need to settle for a guy whose wages keep on falling.

title: Review: Paul Taylor Troupes Dizzying New Palette Takes Shape
description: A year ago, on the cusp of its 60th anniversary, the Paul Taylor Dance Company announced its new identity as Paul Taylors American Modern Dance. On Saturday night at the David H. Koch Theater, one aspect of the troupes expanded mission  to preserve modern dance masterworks by artists other than Mr. Taylor  began to take shape, with the presentation of Doris Humphreys 1938 Passacaglia and Fugue in C Minor.

title: Patching Up the Social Safety Net
description: Few people played as critical a role in the construction of the American social safety net as Wilbur Cohen.

title: A Villa With Caribbean Views
description: The house, set on two and a half acres above Plum Bay, is on the market for $3.9 million.

title: Injuries Leave Rangers Reduced but Not Diminished
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The list of Rangers who have played in every game this season is short, and it will shrink by one on Wednesday, as Martin St. Louis will not suit up against the Chicago Blackhawks because of a lower-body injury.

title: Cleveland Clinic Grapples With Changes in Health Care
description: CLEVELAND  In downtrodden East Cleveland, a three-story family health center has replaced the citys full-service hospital. Seven thousand miles away in Abu Dhabi, a gleaming 24-story hospital is preparing to admit patients this year.

title: Iowa G.O.P. to Walker: Drop Adviser Who Trashed State
description: Iowas Republican leadership blasted Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin on Tuesday for hiring a senior adviser who has mocked the states caucus and its voters, and called on Mr. Walker to fire her.

title: Coming of Age as a Guide at Ground Zero
description: Annalee Tai, a 16-year-old junior at Bard High School on Manhattans Lower East Side, has only the sketchiest recollection of planes smashing into the World Trade Center in 2001.

title: So, Print Is Dying? Dont Tell the Megazine
description: Like chocolate bars and Arctic ice caps, printed periodicals have shrunk over the last decade. The Wall Street Journal, Rolling Stone, The New York Times and dozens more have reduced their physical dimensions to maintain fiscal fitness.

title: Trips for Cyclists Who Want to Sample the Tour de France
description: For cyclists who want to crank more than coast, two American tour operators are offering cycling trips highlighting the Alpine Ltape du Tour (French for stage of the Tour).

title: Pictures of the Day: Pakistan and Elsewhere
description: Pakistan and More  Pictures of the Day

title: What You Get for  $1,200,000
description: This weeks properties include a condo in Missouri, a contemporary in Los Angeles and a townhouse in Philadelphia.

title: March 17, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Pakistan, Israel, London and the United States.

title: General Motors Stock Buyback Follows a Worrying Trend
description: General Motors announcement that it will buy back $5 billion worth of stock raises the question of whether the stock buyback has turned into a shareholder activist shakedown.

title: Review: In Lucia di Lammermoor at the Met, Singing Through Sickness
description: Whatever glamour and passion there is in the Metropolitan Operas blandly efficient revival of Donizettis Lucia di Lammermoor hovers around Joseph Calleja. Though he was announced at Mondays performance as recovering from the flu, and had the wear in his tone and coughs to prove it, this invaluable tenor nevertheless sang Edgardo with plangent vigor. The characteristic sob in his throat, dimmed only slightly by his illness, was both affecting and exciting.

title: Criminal Complaint Against Mr. Pugh
description: An 11-page complaint that sets forth the United States charge that Tairod Nathan Webster Pugh attempted to provide material support and resources to ISIS.

title: Empire, the Meteor That Never Fell to Earth
description: The plotlines of Empire, Foxs hip-hop prime-time soap opera, tell a complicated tale of family rivalry and skulduggery. The text messages exchanged by Fox executives as the shows success improbably grew week by week told a more succinct story.

title: New Directors/New Films Festival Gives Spotlight to Youth
description: Like the first buds on the trees and the hint of springtime softness in the air, New Directors/New Films is an annual sign of renewal. The program, a joint presentation of the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art, dispels the lingering post-Oscar malaise and imports some energy and novelty from Sundance. Its geographically and stylistically wide-ranging selection of first and second features and short films emphasizes youth  (mostly) young protagonists and (mostly) young filmmakers navigating obstacles and seizing opportunities.

title: Review: In Richard Maxwells The Evening, Going Gentle Into the Night, or Not
description: Everybody knows that life ends in death. And for much of our waking hours, we do our best to push this awareness to the very back of our minds. There are times, though, when such kindly amnesia isnt possible. And then everything we look at is suddenly and abruptly heightened by the sense that existence is defined by extinction.

title: Review: Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter, Inspired by an Urban Legend
description: The real-life story that inspired Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter was too good to be completely true, but that doesnt diminish the film, a delicate, haunting study of a woman who has in several senses lost her way.

title: A Conversation With James Wacht of Lee & Associates
description: Mr. Wacht, 59, is the president and an owner of Lee & Associates NYC, a commercial real estate brokerage firm affiliated with Lee & Associates Commercial Real Estate Services, which has its headquarters in Newport Beach, Calif. He is also an owner of Sierra Real Estate, a property management company, and the Cogswell Lee Development Group, which specializes in property acquisitions.

title: Review: Amour Fou, About the Woman in a Poets Suicide Pact
description: Romantic longing takes a beating in Amour Fou, an eccentric, coolly deadpan story of love, including that of the self. Set in Germany in the early 19th century, it tells of a middle-class woman, Henriette (Birte Schnoeink), who, to her great surprise, catches the eye of an insistently gloomy young poet, Heinrich (Christian Friedel).

title: Kendrick Lamar, Emboldened, but Burdened, by Success
description: Calling mainstream hip-hop a series of compromises is unfair, but the genre is far from where it was even a decade ago. Its still a privileged space for black expression, but has also become extremely conscious of everyone else listening in. Broadly speaking, it has reframed its concerns as universal, not specific. It is, by and large, polite  a warm and welcoming host.

title: Review: A Darker Pinocchio Strays From Disneys Wholesome Take
description: The truths in the retelling of Pinocchio now at the New Victory Theater are more contemporary than were used to hearing. Bearing shadows truer to Carlo Collodis 19th-century tale than Walt Disneys version, this family-friendly show, from the Windmill Theater and the State Theater Company of South Australia, manifests robust energy, visual flair and an aversion to modern-day phoniness.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Kendrick Lamars New Album, To Pimp a Butterfly, Is a Streaming Hit
description: Since its surprise release on Sunday night, the rapper Kendrick Lamars highly anticipated album To Pimp a Butterfly (TDE/Aftermath/Interscope) has been insta-analyzed and tweeted about constantly, generating high praise from Kanye West, among many others.

title: Living In Sunnyside, Queens
description: In western Queens, an old-fashioned neighborhood of squat prewar apartment buildings, rowhouses and bustling shopping streets.

title: Orange Seeks Foreign Partner for Video Site Dailymotion
description: The chief executive of Orange, the big French telecommunications company, said on Tuesday that he was seeking a foreign partner for Dailymotion, the Web-based video-sharing service that is Frances answer to Googles YouTube.

title: The Future of TV Streaming
description: Consumers should be very happy with the news that Apple could soon sell a streaming-TV service that will offer a number of networks including CBS, ABC, Fox and ESPN.

title: Breast-Feeding May Have Benefits Decades Later
description: Breast-feeding has well established short-term benefits, but now researchers have found that its advantages may persist into adulthood.

title: Ryanair Dangles Possibility of Ultracheap Trans-Atlantic Travel
description: PARIS  Nearly a decade after it first floated the idea of $10 flights between London and New York, Ryanair, Europes largest discount airline, is once again dangling the possibility of ultracheap travel across the Atlantic.

title: White House Response to Israeli Election
description: The White House press secretary, Josh Earnest, said President Obama was confident the strong ties between the United States and Israel will endure, regardless of the victor in Israels election.

title: Alan Moores Novel  Jerusalem Coming in 2016
description: Alan Moore, best known for his graphic novels, including Watchmen and V for Vendetta, is set to publish his second non-graphic novel, Jerusalem, next year. If past interviews with Mr. Moore are any indication, the book could clock in at more than one million words.

title: Bangladeshs Third Gender
description: A Bangladeshi photographer has been documenting the lives of hijras, men who sexually identify as women and live under the watch of a guru.

title: Environmental Report Details Heats Costly Escape Through Elevator Shafts
description: It is a common winter phenomenon in New York City: As you try to pull open a lobby door, it seems soldered shut. Wrestle it open, and you are greeted by a shrill whistle and a blast of air.

title: In Paris, Glittering Debuts
description: Haute joaillerie houses unveiled their spring 2015 collections during fashions Couture Week.

title: In Paris, Jewelry for Springtime
description: Luxury houses, including Boucheron, Chanel and Chopard, unveiled their spring 2015 collections in January during Couture Week. The semiannual event was added to the couture calendar in 2010 by its organizer, the Fdration Franaise de la Couture, in an effort to link the jewelers collections to the fashion events staged by couture houses such as Christian Dior, Chanel and Givenchy.

title: Puzzlement Over Killing of 3 Girls in Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  In the afternoon confusion of South Delhi, it seems, nobody took notice of the wraithlike woman struggling uphill to the place local people call the forest, one young daughter held in the crook of each arm and a third, a little girl in pigtails, scrambling behind.

title: An Uneasy Coalition for Israel
description: If the Israeli election was above all a referendum on the leadership of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, he prevailed. After accumulating nine years in office over three terms, that is a measure of his political guts, however limited his political achievements.

title: Taliban Faction Kills Lawyer
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  A lawyer who had represented the Pakistani doctor who helped the C.I.A. hunt Osama bin Laden was shot dead Tuesday in northwestern Pakistan, the local police said.

title: Huayi Brothers, Chinese Film Company, Courts Hollywood Again
description: LOS ANGELES  Huayi Brothers Media, a Chinese movie company with international aspirations, has publicly linked arms twice in the last three years with a Hollywood company only to have the deals fall apart at the last minute.

title: United NationsPanel to Share Details on War Criminals
description: GENEVA  United Nations investigators monitoring the conflict in Syria said Tuesday that they would share details on suspected war criminals with judicial authorities in countries preparing to prosecute them, calling it a first step to ensuring accountability.

title: Gulf Carriers Strike Back at U.S. Campaign to Re-examine Open-Skies Agreements
description: WASHINGTON  With their airlines prospects in the United States being threatened, top officials from Emirates and Etihad Airways, the mega-carriers based in the Middle East, defended their businesses on Tuesday and shot back at American rivals who had accused them of unfair competition.

title: 2 Charged With Murder in Stabbing of Man as He Left Stamford McDonalds
description: STAMFORD, Conn.  It was unusual when Antonio Muralles, 52, did not show up for work on Thursday morning.

title: Pearson Under Fire for Monitoring Students Twitter Posts
description: Is it corporate due diligence or spying on children?

title: Largest Presbyterian Denomination Gives Final Approval for Same-Sex Marriage
description: After three decades of debate over its stance on homosexuality, members of the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) voted on Tuesday to change the definition of marriage in the churchs constitution to include same-sex marriage.

title: No Record That Hillary Clinton Signed That She Had No Documents
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department said Tuesday that it had no record of Hillary Rodham Clinton, or the two secretaries of state before her, signing a form stating that they had no government records in their possession when they left office.

title: A Durst Sibling Recounts the Violent Ripples Below a Charming Surface
description: At age 7, Robert Durst deliberately shoved his younger brother, Douglas, onto the ice at a skating rink, according to Douglas. He broke his wrist. That was their life, as boys and men: a low-grade menace that swelled as they grew up.

title: Gunmen Kill Health Workers From Pakistan Polio Drive
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Gunmen killed two female health workers and one police guard in northwestern Pakistan in the latest attack on people involved in a polio immunization campaign.

title: New Bribery Evidence Adds a Year to Biomets Probation
description: Life was supposed to return to normal for Biomet, the giant medical devices manufacturer accused of foreign bribery, when its federal probation expired next week. But on Tuesday, Biomet disclosed that prosecutors would extend its probation another year as they investigate new evidence of wrongdoing at the company, the Justice Departments latest attempt to stem a widening pattern of corporate recidivism.

title: William B. Ewald Jr., Eisenhower Aide and Revisionist Author, Dies at 89
description: William B. Ewald Jr., who was a White House speechwriter for Dwight D. Eisenhower and wrote several revisionist histories to help redeem the former presidents reputation, died on Monday at his home in Greenwich, Conn. He was 89.

title: Penn State Fraternitys Secret Facebook Photos May Lead to Criminal Charges
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  Within the Kappa Delta Rho fraternity at Pennsylvania State University, the Facebook page and its photographs  of drugs, hazing and nude, unconscious women  were supposed to be among its brotherhoods secrets.

title: Lance Armstrong Is Said to Meet With Usada Chief in Bid to Cut Ban
description: Lance Armstrong recently met with a longtime nemesis, the head of the United States Anti-Doping Agency, in an effort to have his lifetime ban from sports overturned, according to a person familiar with the meeting.

title: Breakaway Party Leader Stays Mum on Where Hell Throw Support After Israeli Elections
description: The Israeli political leader who could prove key to determining who becomes the next prime minister is a popular right-leaning former member of Parliament, and was a longtime member of Benjamin Netanyahus party.

title: Part of New Jerseys Bias-Intimidation Law Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that the states unusual bias-intimidation law was unconstitutional, dealing a potential reversal to one of the most well-known hate crime prosecutions in recent history.

title: An Israeli Election Turns Ugly
description: Israels election has done a lot to reveal the challenges facing the country and the intentions of the men who seek to lead it. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus outright rejection of a Palestinian state and his racist rant against Israeli Arab voters on Tuesday showed that he has forfeited any claim to representing all Israelis.

title: Personal Triumph for Thad Matta, but a Trying Year for Ohio State
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Thad Matta, who had just secured the most victories in Ohio State mens basketball history, was celebrated at halfcourt inside Chicagos United Center after a flawed but gutsy victory against Minnesota in the Big Ten tournament Thursday.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 17, 2015
description: March 17, 2015

title: Lawyers for Suspect in Boston Marathon Bombing SteerBlame to Brother
description: BOSTON  The lawyers trying to spare the Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev from the death penalty have so far been stymied from telling jurors much about their main defense: that his 26-year-old brother, Tamerlan, cajoled him into participating.

title: Serena Williams Defeats Sloane Stephens to Advance at Indian Wells
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Renewing a rivalry that fizzled when the bright hope began to fade, Serena Williams again asserted her brilliance Tuesday afternoon with a 6-7 (3), 6-2, 6-2 victory over Sloane Stephens in the fourth round of the BNP Paribas Open.

title: Voters in Nazareth Cheer Gains by Arab Alliance
description: NAZARETH, Israel  Choruses of beeping horns echoed through this Arab city in northern Israel as word spread that an alliance of Arab parties had received 14 seats in the next Parliament, making it the third-largest bloc.

title: Letter Bound for White House Tests Positive for Cyanide
description: WASHINGTON  A letter intended for the White House tested positive for cyanide at an off-site mail screening facility on Tuesday, according to a statement from the Secret Service.

title: Where to Find the Ends
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Its very rare that I am able to decide exactly which video I am going to end a post with before I even finish solving a puzzle. Usually, I solve it and stare at the completed grid, waiting for inspiration. Not today.

title: Cuomo Gains Support for Ethics Policies
description: ALBANY  With a budget deadline two weeks away, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Tuesday that he had come to an agreement on new ethics policies with the State Assembly, which his fellow Democrats control, though a deal with the Republicans who lead the State Senate was not secure.

title: Sandy Alderson Defends Mets Handling of Zack Wheeler
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Sandy Alderson, the Mets general manager, generally appears calm and measured when he addresses the news media, even when the questioning gets a little intense. He is, after all, both an Ivy League graduate and a former Marine who served in Vietnam.

title: How the Obama and Republican Budgets Compare
description: Charts showing how G.O.P budget proposals for 2016 contrast with President Obamas.

title: Outcry Over Pink Sculpture Intersects With Broader Questions in Long Island City
description: When New York Citys cultural czars revealed the choice of a new piece of public art for Long Island City late last year, the response was swift and withering.

title: Demise of Gigaom Doesnt Faze Its Rivals
description: In the week and a half since the technology news site Gigaom stopped publishing, it has been held up as a cautionary tale for media in a go-go era. Here was a news organization that once looked promising, but collapsed so unexpectedly that its reporters were working on articles right up to the moment they were told they were out of jobs.

title: Brigade Takes On ISIS Allies in Libya
description: CAIRO  Fighters aligned with the Islamic State who control the Libyan city of Surt have begun clashing with a brigade from the neighboring city of Misurata that is trying to drive them out, according to news reports on Tuesday, and a leading Tunisian militant was killed in the battle.

title: Missouri Executes Killer Who Had Brain Injury
description: A Missouri man who was missing 20 percent of the frontal lobe of his brain was executed on Tuesday, after the United States Supreme Court declined to delay his death and order a test of his mental competency.

title: Egypt to Charge Officer in Killing of Shaimaa el-Sabbagh
description: CAIRO  Egyptian prosecutors said Tuesday that they were charging a police officer with a type of manslaughter in the shooting of a poet and activist whose killing at a peaceful demonstration made her the latest symbol of police abuse.

title: After 4 Years, Florida Police Are Cleared in Shooting
description: MIAMI  After a four-year investigation, Miami-Dade prosecutors said on Tuesday that they would not charge 12 police officers who unleashed more than 100 bullets at a reckless driver who crashed into several cars in Miami Beach, drove on a sidewalk and nearly ran over several officers on bicycles.

title: Justified Recap: Raylan and Boyd, Hanging at a Pizza Party
description: Season 6, Episode 9: Burned

title: Good Basketball Elsewhere Holds Lessons for Knicks
description: In an exercise that continued to defy rational human behavior, paying customers again filled Madison Square Garden on Tuesday night for the Knicks game against the San Antonio Spurs. It had been about nine weeks since my last visit to the Garden, and the Knicks were still entrenched in last place and still hoping to unearth some confidence and still trying to solve the riddles of the triangle offense.

title: Picking Israels Next Premier
description: The votes are in, but Israelis may not know who will be their next prime minister for days.

title: C. C. Sabathia, Pitching for Yankees, Has Nerves but No Complaints
description: TAMPA, Fla.  C. C. Sabathia had not stood atop a mound in a major league game since last May, so there were manifold questions and concerns on Tuesday night: about his surgically repaired right knee, his arm strength, his control, his velocity, his stamina.

title: Syria: Reports Claim Downing of a U.S. Surveillance Drone
description: The Syrian state news media reported Tuesday that the countrys air defense systems had shot down an American surveillance plane near the northwestern city of Latakia. American defense officials confirmed that United States military controllers had lost contact with an unarmed, remotely piloted craft  an MQ-1 Predator  over northwestern Syria but said they had no information to corroborate that it had been shot down. They said they were investigating. Syrian state television showed footage of what it said were the remnants of the plane being loaded into a truck by soldiers. If confirmed, the downing would be the first of an American aircraft in Syria since a United States-led coalition began bombing Islamic State extremists there last year.

title: Ladders That Stand Apart
description: The latest incarnations of one of the oldest designs in the world continue to marry usefulness with beauty of form.

title: A Cricket Match, With Politics in the Spotlight
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  No social function on this island is as important as the recent annual Royal-Thomian cricket match, but this years event was particularly special because of what has become known here as the Royalist coup.

title: Go Ahead, Ruin My Day
description: As the saying goes, to err is human, to forgive is divine, to which Id add: to ignore is even more human, and the results rarely divine. None of us would be human if we didnt occasionally get so wedded to our wishes that we failed to notice  or outright ignored  the facts on the ground that make a laughingstock of our hopes. Only when the gap gets too wide to ignore does policy change. This is where a lot of U.S. policy is heading these days in the Middle East. Mind the gaps  on Iran, Israel and Iraq. Were talking about our choices in these countries with words that strike me as about 10 years out of date. Alas, we are not dealing anymore with your grandfathers Israel, your fathers Iran or the Iraq your son or daughter went off to liberate.

title: American Express to Start Multi-Business Loyalty Program
description: American Express, looking to broaden its influence after recent setbacks with its core charge card business, is set to introduce a new, broad-based customer loyalty program that works regardless of how shoppers pay.

title: Biggest Advertisers Are Sending Their Dollars to Digital
description: The countrys largest marketers are slashing their advertising budgets as they shift a larger portion of their spending to digital, according to new figures released on Wednesday.

title: Word of the Day | bawdy
description: bawdy  \bo-de\  adjective and noun

title: Minor Issue
description: Do you tell a friend that his young daughter is sexually active with her boyfriend?

title: N.C.A.A. Appeal of Ruling in OBannon Case Is Heard
description: Hours before mens basketball players suited up and got the N.C.A.A. tournament underway, N.C.A.A. lawyers were in San Francisco asking a federal appeals court to overturn last summers landmark decision that said such athletes could be paid.

title: Minor Issue
description: Do you tell a friend that his young daughter is sexually active with her boyfriend?

title: BuzzFeed Editor Meets Brother Orange, the Chinese Man Who Received His Stolen iPhone
description: He lost a phone, but gained a friend in China. The BuzzFeed editor Matt Stopera, who chronicled the theft of his iPhone in a New York bar and the bizarre series of images that began appearing in his photo stream, has finally met the Chinese man who received his stolen device.

title: A Nigerian Link Among Top American Athletes
description: Nigerian immigrants and their descendants are excelling at all levels of sports in the United States.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It is often thought that getting the biopsy will give definitive answers, but our study says maybe it wont.

title: Corrections: March 18, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Bangladeshs Third Gender
description: Shahria Sharmin had gone to her husbands factory in Dhaka, Bangladesh, looking to tell a positive story about the garment industry, one that would offset negative public perceptions. What she found, instead, was an even more challenging topic: the lives of five hijras, the local term for the culture of men who identify as women. By day, they presented themselves as men, but at night they dressed as women and kept a home for their boyfriends.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (ABC) THE UNTOLD STORY OF THE SOUND OF MUSIC Diane Sawyer travels to Austria with Julie Andrews in this 20/20 special celebrating the 50th anniversary of the film The Sound of Music, and explores its cultural impact during a time of unrest in the United States. In Salzburg they trace the steps of the von Trapp family, who inspired the movie; tour the former home of Maria von Trapp, the character Ms. Andrews portrayed; visit the train station where the family escaped the Nazis; and speak with the Mother Abbess of the Nonnberg Abbey, where Maria was a postulant after World War I. Christopher Plummer, who played Captain von Trapp, also shares his recollections of the film and his relationship with Ms. Andrews, who chimes in about a few of her favorite things.

title: On the Use of Antipsychotics for Dementia Patients
description: To the Editor:

title: Leaving Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: Unions for Grad Students
description: To the Editor:

title: Time for Sanity in College Admissions
A Way Out on Immigration Reform
description: THE goal of fixing our broken immigration system is further away than ever. President Obamas executive orders  which would allow up to five million of about 11 million illegal immigrants to stay in this country have been challenged in the courts, and Republicans, a majority in the new Congress, have held up appropriations and confirmations in retaliation.

title: How Best to Strengthen Chemical Regulations
description: Two bills were introduced in the Senate last week to reform the Toxic Substances Control Act, which by most accounts has been a miserable failure at ensuring the safety of chemicals used in consumer products. The bills take vastly different approaches and raise the troubling question of whether to settle for a reasonable compromise or strive instead for a stronger reform.

title: The House Budget Disaster
description: If the budget resolution released on Tuesday by House Republicans is a road map to a Stronger America, as its title proclaims, its hard to imagine what the path to a diminished America would look like.

title: George Osborne Offers Tax Breaks to British Voters in Budget Statement
description: LONDON  With British elections approaching, George Osborne, the chancellor of the Exchequer, used a budget statement on Wednesday to claim credit for the economic recovery and to offer some relief to hard-pressed voters.

title: Test Yourself | Virtual Reality Games
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 8 article, Virtual Realitys Potential Displayed at Game Developers Conference.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Alcohol or Marijuana? A Pediatrician Faces the Question
description: In Alcohol or Marijuana? A Pediatrician Faces the Question, Aaron E. Carroll looks at studies and data to assess risk.

title: More Nigerian-Americans Are Reaching Highest Levels of Sports
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  At Arizona States recent Senior Day celebration, guard Promise Amukamara was escorted onto the basketball court by her four sisters, whose mellifluous names spoke of royalty and hope: Peace, a teammate, along with Princess, Precious and Passionate.

title: As Chinese Tourism Increases, American Museums Adapt
description: Its now easier for mainland Chinese to visit the United States, thanks to relaxed visa rules instituted late last year, allowing 10 years before visa renewal rather than one year. The change is expected to increase Chinese tourism and real estate investment, but it will also have a less obvious beneficiary: American museums.

title: Considering a Counterintuitive Path to Escape a Fire: The Elevator
description: In case of fire, use elevators.

title: Louisiana Parish Fights Plan to Burn Tons of Propellant No One Wants
description: MINDEN, La.  Just before midnight on Oct. 15, 2012, Sheriff Gary Sexton of Webster Parish was driving home from the airport when the sky lit up like midday. He flipped on his walkie-talkie to hear everyone asking: What on earth were those big booms?

title: Gyorgy Kepes, Wizard of Light and Motion, Comes Back Into Focus
description: LONDON  Whenever he had free time, the Hungarian designer Gyorgy Kepes would disappear into a makeshift darkroom at the Institute of Design, an experimental school he had founded with a group of friends in Chicago in 1939, to create abstract, often surreal images of familiar objects like stones, leaves and slices of bread.

title: For Alice in Wonderland Milestone, a Stampede Down the Rabbit Hole
description: While the Alice of Lewis Carrolls Alices Adventures in Wonderland was a fictional British character, she has touched the hearts of young and old worldwide, particularly in the United States.

title: How Often Do You Engage in Fat Talk?
description: How often do you complain about your body  or overhear others doing so? Have you been known to say, Im so fat to your friends?

title: Afghan First Vice President, an Ex-Warlord, Fumes on the Sidelines
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The security meeting was almost at a close when the first vice president of Afghanistan, the former warlord Abdul Rashid Dostum, began crying.

title: Japans Businesses Respond to Abes Push for Higher Wages
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan has been putting unusually strong pressure on his countrys businesses to raise workers pay, a crucial but still missing piece of his economic growth plans.

title: The Age of Cryptocurrency, by Paul Vigna and Michael J. Casey
description: Money, The Age of Cryptocurrency explains, is a medium of exchange, a unit of account and a store of value. But for Schopenhauer it was human happiness in the abstract, and for Dostoyevsky coined liberty. These passion metaphors reflect the febrile excitement about Bitcoin that Paul Vigna and Michael J. Casey, both of The Wall Street Journal, share in their wide-ranging, interesting account of the origin, past and possible future of this virtual-money wannabe.

title: Bill Browders Red Notice
description: The grandson of the head of the American Communist Party commits the ultimate act of rebellion: He gets a business degree from Stanford. From there, he goes on to build the biggest hedge fund in Russia. After exposing widespread government corruption, he gets expelled from the country. While hes gone, the Kremlin raids his fund and perpetrates an elaborate financial fraud. The lawyer investigating the crime is tortured and dies in prison. He avenges his lawyers death, exposing a cover-up at the highest levels of the Putin regime.

title: How to Get Your Spouse to Exercise
description: Spouses influence each others exercise habits, for better and worse, more than is often recognized, according to an interesting new study of the workout habits of middle-aged couples. The study found that changes in one spouses routine tend to be echoed in the others, highlighting the extent to which our exercise behavior is shaped not just by our personal intentions but by the people around us as well.

title: Beck, Dave Grohl and John Legend to Perform at Rock Hall of Fame Ceremony
description: Beck, Dave Grohl and John Legend will perform at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony on April 18 in Cleveland, it was announced on Wednesday. Several current Hall of Fame members will be on hand to induct the newest crop: Stevie Wonder will induct Bill Withers and Patti Smith will induct Lou Reed, who died in 2013.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get the Morning Briefing in your inbox first thing? Sign up.)

title: The Health Concerns in Wearable Tech
description: EDITORS NOTE APPENDED
