title: Outlook for Solar Gets a Bit Brighter
description: LONDON  Here is a trick question: Which country led the European Union last year in putting new solar panels on rooftops and in countryside energy parks? If you chose sunny Spain or balmy Italy, you were wrong. Britain, the green and pleasant land often shrouded in cloud, was the leader, according to the market research firm I.H.S.

title: Win in Israel Sets Netanyahu on Path to Rebuild and Redefine Government
description: JERUSALEM  Israelis emboldened Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu with a clear mandate in balloting on Tuesday, paving the way for him to lead a right-leaning and religious coalition that could be far easier to control, since his own party holds many more seats now.

title: Germans Protest European Austerity Measures
description: FRANKFURT  Protesters set cars on fire and clashed with police officers on Wednesday as they marched toward the European Central Banks new headquarters in a demonstration against austerity and capitalism that took on a markedly more heated tone than past protests.

title: Edinburgh International Festival, Under New Director, Sets Lineup
description: LONDON  A focus on big international stars and more diverse musical programming characterizes Fergus Linehans first Edinburgh International Festival, which will run Aug. 7-31. Mr. Linehan, who was the director of the Sydney festival, then head of the contemporary music program at the Sydney Opera before coming to Edinburgh, succeeded Jonathan Mills as director.

title: New York Today: Growing Up With Robert Durst
description: Good morning on this cold and windy Wednesday.

title: Aid Trickles to Vanuatu as Relief Workers Report Vast Cyclone Damage
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Aid was slowly reaching Vanuatus storm-devastated outlying islands on Wednesday, including the remote southern island of Tanna, which was believed to have been crossed by the eye of Tropical Cyclone Pam as it tore across the small Pacific nation last weekend.

title: Daily Report: You Can Now Send Your Friends Money on Facebook
description: Facebooks instant messaging service isnt just for sending smiley faces and photos anymore. Now you can use it to send money instantly to your friends.

title: The Invisible Primary Means No TV Ads. For Now.
description: Theres a reason the early part of the presidential nomination contest is called the invisible primary: There are no television ads yet. Voters in key states should enjoy the lull while it lasts, which could be until summer or maybe even longer.

title: Charles C. W. Cooke Can Fend for Himself
description: You were born in England and moved here in 2011 to work for National Review. What made you decide to resettle in the colonies? Id spent a lot of time in America. We have family friends in California and Arizona. I always had great love for America. I even had an Apollo 11 lunchbox.

title: Alabama Shakess Soul-Stirring, Shape-Shifting New Sound
description: In the upstairs dressing room at the Georgia Theater in Athens, Ga., in January, Alabama Shakes was getting restless. The band was about to perform songs from its second album, Sound & Color, for the first time, and the room was full of distractions. Friends and relatives had driven over from Alabama: cousins and uncles, wives and girlfriends, crying babies and unrestrained toddlers. Sippy cups and spilled Cheerios were scattered everywhere.

title: Do You Tell a Friend His Daughter Is Sexually Active?
description: A man told me he was approached by his best friends daughter, a minor, who confided that she and her boyfriend had become sexually active. She wanted his opinion on birth control. The man says he would want to know if it were his daughter, but to tell the parents would violate the girls trust. What do I tell him? NAME WITHHELD, CONNECTICUT

title: Today in Politics: Washington Responds to Netanyahus Victory in Israel
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where March Madness is already starting to get political, and even St. Patricks Day could not bring President Obama a lucky budget from Republicans. The resignation of Representative Aaron Schock of Illinois is still the talk of the town, but Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin may have found himself a headache in Iowa. Yet for now, the biggest electoral drama is the result in Israels vote.

title: How to Be Misled by Polls, Hillary Clinton Email Edition
description: Has the controversy over Hillary Clintons use of a personal email account hurt her in the polls?

title: Hotel Review: The Godfrey in Chicago
description: Doubles from $109.

title: Restaurant Report: Low Country Kitchen in Steamboat Springs, Colo.
description: For Brian and Katy Vaughn, owners of two restaurants in Steamboat Springs, Colo., its all about family. Before settling for good in Steamboat Springs, where the couple met, the Southern-born Vaughns took a major detour back through the South, she to attend architecture school and he to work for the chef Norman Van Aken in Miami. When they wanted to settle down and raise a family, home turned out to be the mountains of Colorado.

title: A Pioneer for Death With Dignity
description: More than two decades before Brittany Maynards public advocacy for death with dignity inspired lawmakers in Washington, D.C., and at least 16 states to introduce legislation authorizing the medical practice of aid in dying for the terminally ill, Senator Frank Roberts of Oregon sponsored one of the nations first death-with-dignity bills.

title: Noam Chomsky on the Roots of American Racism
description: This is the eighth in a series of interviews with philosophers on race that I am conducting for The Stone. This weeks conversation is with Noam Chomsky, a linguist, political philosopher and one of the worlds most prominent public intellectuals. He is the author of many books, including, most recently, On Western Terrorism: From Hiroshima to Drone Warfare, with Andre Vltchek.

title: Iraqi Forces and Militias Said to Loot Sunni Towns
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi militias and security forces destroyed and looted the property of displaced Sunni civilians after reclaiming the town of Amerli from Islamic State militants last year, according to a Human Rights Watch report issued Wednesday.

title: Serbia Arrests Eight Suspected in 1995 Srebrenica Massacre
description: LONDON  Prosecutors in Serbia said on Wednesday that eight men suspected of having participated in the 1995 Srebrenica massacre, Europes bloodiest slaughter since World War II, had been arrested. The arrests were described by prosecutors as the first by the Serbian police of anyone accused of doing the killing at Srebrenica, where 8,000 Muslims died.

title: Morning Agenda: More Scrutiny for Biomet
description: MORE SCRUTINY FOR BIOMET | The giant medical devices manufacturer Biomet, which was accused of foreign bribery, disclosed on Tuesday that prosecutors would extend its probation another year as they investigate new evidence of wrongdoing at the company, Ben Protess reports in DealBook. The Justice Department is investigating whether Biomet helped bribe government officials in Mexico and Brazil, a reminder of an earlier bribery case that Biomet settled in 2012. To resolve the first case, Biomet paid $17 million and struck a so-called deferred prosecution agreement that withheld criminal charges as long as the company behaved during three years of probation.

title: French Court Blocks Airbus Insider Trading Trial
description: PARIS  A French court on Wednesday blocked an insider trading trial of seven current and former executives of the Airbus Group, as well as two of its former shareholders, arguing that the defendants had already been cleared by stock market regulators, making any further prosecution of the case a violation of European double jeopardy rules.

title: N.C.A.A. Bracket Conundrum: To Pick Kentucky or Not to Pick Kentucky?
description: Participants in our interactive N.C.A.A. bracket, which rewards correct picks based on their overall popularity among readers, have reached a consensus: Not surprisingly, Kentucky is the team to beat. More than half of Times readers pick the Wildcats to reach the national championship, and 41 percent have chosen them to win the title.

title: If a Woman's Place Is on the 20
Fortescue, Big Iron Ore Miner, Pulls $2.5 Billion Debt Sale
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Fortescue Metals Group of Australia, the worlds fourth-largest iron ore exporter, has pulled a $2.5 billion debt sale amid a 48 percent plunge in the price of iron ore that prompted investors to demand better terms than Fortescue was willing to offer.

title: Obama May Find It Impossible to Mend Frayed Ties to Netanyahu
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel had a poisonous relationship long before Mr. Netanyahu swept to victory on Tuesday night in elections watched minute-by-minute at the White House.

title: College Basketball Is an Attraction. Is It Pretty? Well ...
description: A word of caution to those excited for the N.C.A.A. tournament: Prepare to be a bit disappointed.

title: Microsemi to Acquire Vitesse Semiconductor for $389 Million
description: The Microsemi Corporation announced on Wednesday that it had reached an agreement to acquire Vitesse Semiconductor for $389 million, furthering a drive toward consolidation in the chip-making inudstry.

title: A Polite Bit of Road Rage
description: Dear Diary:

title: Sunnyside, Queens, Mayberry Near Midtown
description: Sunnyside, in western Queens, is a stark contrast to the gleaming glass residential towers rising in nearby Long Island City. Here is an old-fashioned New York neighborhood of squat prewar apartment buildings, rowhouses and shopping streets that still have mom-and-pop businesses.

title: Law School Proximity Matters for Partner Prospects, Study Finds
description: Elite law schools are not always a glide path to becoming a partner at a big law firm. A new study of partners academic pedigrees shows that a large number of graduates who reach the top rung at a law firm do not necessarily come from the top-ranked law schools.

title: Tunisia Museum Attack Is Blow to Nations Democratic Shift
description: CAIRO  Gunmen in military uniforms killed 19 people on Wednesday in a midday attack on a museum in downtown Tunis, dealing a new blow to the tourist industry that is vital to Tunisia as it struggles to consolidate the only transition to democracy after the Arab Spring revolts.

title: $1.2 Million Homes in Los Angeles, Philadelphia and Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, MO.

title: House Hunting in ... St. Martin
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM VILLA IN TERRES BASSES

title: E!s Fashion Police Is Put on Hiatus Until Fall After Hosts Exit
description: Ever sinceJoan Riversdiedin September, Jon Caramanica wrote in The New York Times this week, Fashion Police  the E! show devoted to poking holes in celebrity pageantry that she had hosted since its inception  has been collapsing in plain view.

title: Make Rice Pudding Without a Recipe
description: Amanda Hesser and Merrill Stubbs of Food52 show you how to make three variations of rice pudding, all without a recipe.

title: The Tallest Tree in the Forest, a Play About Paul Robeson
description: The extraordinary life and career of Paul Robeson  the athlete, actor, singer and civil rights activist  is brought to dramatic life in The Tallest Tree in the Forest, written by and starring the talented actor Daniel Beaty, the author and star of Emergence-SEE! at the Public Theater.

title: Lisa Howard on Her Latest Broadway Show, It Shoulda Been You
description: Being told youre too tall or short for a role is hard enough. Being told youre too heavy would seem downright excruciating. But Lisa Howard has heard that plenty of times and nevertheless managed to persevere in a career that includes one Twilight movie and four Broadway shows.

title: Netanyahu on Likuds Great Victory
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel spoke after his ruling Likud Party scored a sound victory in the countrys election.

title: Ben Miles Takes On Wolf Hall Onstage
description: If you stroll over to the Frick Collection, as the cast of Wolf Hall, Parts One & Two recently did, you can see Hans Holbeins 1530s portrait of Thomas Cromwell, the court consigliere at the center of the Royal Shakespeare Companys stage adaptation of Hilary Mantels prizewinning novels.

title: Clashes in Frankfurt Near E.C.B.
description: Protesters and the police clashed in Frankfurt on Wednesday as thousands demonstrated against the European Central Banks austerity measures.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: A Splash of Flash
description: In a season of underdone hair, a little adornment can make all the difference.

title: An Uber Service Is Banned in Germany Again
description: BERLIN  A judge in Frankfurt dealt a setback to Uber on Wednesday, ruling that drivers for its ride-sharing service UberPop must hold the official permits required of taxi drivers to operate in Germany. The ruling reinstates one of the most severe legal restrictions faced by the company anywhere in the world.

title: City Ballet Announces 2015-16 Season
description: World premieres: Seven. Balanchine ballets: 28. Dancers: 94. Composers danced to: 47, including Ellis Ludwig-Leone of the band San Fermin and Bryce Dessner of the National, who were commissioned to write scores.

title: Sweden Cuts Key Interest Rate to Minus 0.25%
description: The Swedish central bank on Wednesday again cut its main interest rate, bringing it deeper into negative territory to head off deflationary pressures.

title: Mayor de Blasio Emerges as an Unexpected Champion of Religion
description: Growing up, Mayor Bill de Blasio was the only child on his block who did not attend Mass on Sundays. Everyone else was at church, and I wasnt, he recalled in an interview last week. Some of the kids envied me.

title: Interview: Amy Schumer
description: Amy Schumer discusses writing and starring in Trainwreck, a comedy directed by Judd Apatow.

title: Harry Reid Pauses to Offer a Word of Thanks to Rand Paul
description: Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the Democratic leader, took a minute on the Senate floor on Wednesday to do something unusual: thank a Republican.

title: Visitors Flee Scene of Tunisia Attack
description: Scenes from Tunisian state television showed confusion outside an art museum and Parliament on Wednesday after gunmen attacked.

title: SXSW 2015 Video: Amy Schumer on Trainwreck
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The comedy Trainwreck, written by and starring Amy Schumer and directed by Judd Apatow, received an enthusiastic response at its screening here on Sunday. In this video interview recorded at the festival, Ms. Schumer discusses her role in the movie, how her screenplay drew from personal experiences, and how she finds the comedy in tragic situations.

title: Insider City Tours From InterContinental Hotels
description: Guests at InterContinental hotels in Tel Aviv, Paris and London can now take part in the companys Secrets of the City, a program that offers specialized tours of each city.

title: Clippers Doc and Austin Rivers Try to Balance Their Many Roles
description: LOS ANGELES  Spend a few moments with Austin Rivers, and it becomes clear soon enough that he is a chip off the old Doc.

title: Deal Makers Less Upbeat About M.&.A. Growth
description: NEW ORLEANS  Last year was by all accounts a banner year for mergers. But as one of the takeover industrys main conferences prepares to begin here, a new survey has found that significantly fewer deal makers believe that 2015 will prove any better.

title: Obamas Bracket Is Just a Bit More Daring This Year
description: President Obama has made his annual N.C.A.A. bracket projections, and he is going with the consensus favorite, Kentucky, to win it all.

title: The Brooklyn-Born-Raised-and-Based Artist Who Dripped Her Way to Chanel Sneakers and Car Service
description: Joyce Pensato, a 70-something-old breath of fresh air whose current and fourth solo show is currently on view at Petzel Gallery, explains her slow rise to painterly fame.

title: 36 Hours in Dubai
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Dubai and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Dubai
description: Dubai has emerged as an ethnically diverse metropolis where the worlds populations mingle in markets, galleries and international restaurants, both humble and high-end.

title: 36 Hours in Dubai
description: Dubai is impossible to ignore. As its leaders and property developers proudly trumpet, the city-state along the Persian Gulf has the worlds highest building (the Burj Khalifa), the worlds tallest hotel (JW Marriott Marquis Dubai), the worlds largest artificial island (the Palm Jumeirah) and the worlds biggest mall (Dubai Mall).

title: Better Sleep for a Better Sex Life
description: A good nights sleep may be important for a womans sex life, a small study suggests.

title: Jeb Bush Picks Up a New Supporter for a Run: His Mother
description: Barbara Bush, often the most outspoken member of the family, put an early damper on the thought of Jeb Bushs running for president with a verbal eye roll, suggesting that maybe some other American clans could produce presidential candidates.

title: Japan Investigates Death Threats Against Caroline Kennedy, U.S. Ambassador
description: TOKYO  The police in Japan are investigating telephoned death threats to the United States ambassador, Caroline Kennedy, the daughter of President John F. Kennedy, and to an American diplomat in Okinawa, Japanese and international news agencies reported on Wednesday.

title: For Perfect Pasta, Add Water and a Vigorous Stir
description: On a clear fall day in Rome, I was sitting outside at Flavio al Velavevodetto, a restaurant in Testaccio, in a neighborhood that was once the citys slaughterhouse district and is now inhabited by both older working-class people and gentrifying youngsters. Flavio de Maio, an elegant, middle-aged businessman turned chef, sat across the table from me; a translator sat between us. I had come at the recommendation of a friend, the Rome-based journalist and historian Katie Parla, who told me that if I was looking for the epitome of Roman pasta, this was the place.

title: The Art of the Tantrum
description: No one does cranky with quite as much panache as the French. Two picture books about bad moods, both written by Francophone authors and offered in English translations for the first time, demonstrate what may be the secret. Both take an approach that many parents struggle to master: The less you fight it, the more likely it is that irritability will give way on its own to something else  sometimes, even something charming.

title: Goodfellas Will Help Close Tribeca Film Festival
description: You and a date probably wont be able to attend closing night of the Tribeca Film Festival by entering through the basement, wending your way through labyrinthine hallways and perhaps a kitchen, greasing several palms and having seats set up in the front row. But if youre willing to settle for buying tickets and walking through the front doors, you can watch that famous tracking shot and other memorable scenes in a newly remastered version of the Martin Scorsese gangster film Goodfellas, organizers announced Wednesday.

title: Wolf Hall, a Six-Part TV Series, Tackles Hilary Mantels Books
description: OXFORDSHIRE, ENGLAND  Thomas Cromwell was rolling a cigarette. Henry VIII was sitting on a chair amid a stretch of green lawn, eyes closed, face turned to the summer sunlight. A gaggle of ladies-in-waiting swept across the gardens. A courtier popped his head apologetically around the door of Broughton Castle. Five minutes, he said.

title: Sonys PlayStation Vue Is Introduced in 3 Cities
description: Television fans who want to break free from a traditional TV subscription now have more options than ever to pay for what they want to watch, and how they want to watch it.

title: Palestinian Official on Israeli Election
description: Wasel Abu Yousef, a senior Palestinian official, said on Tuesday that the Likud partys victory in the Israeli elections would mean a continued block in the political situation.

title: Suddenly, Plenty of Options for Cord Cutters
description: Here are some prominent services offering live TV,  la carte networks and other on-demand streaming options in the United States.

title: What Your N.C.A.A. Brackets Teach About Investing and Bias
description: The main draw of the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament begins Thursday, and the New York Times bracket is a fun way to test your predictions in a system that, like financial markets and most forms of sports betting, rewards you for taking an against-the-grain pick that proves accurate.

title: Sometimes a Cardboard Sled Is All You Need
description: Duct tape. Cardboard boxes. Enthusiasm.

title: Wind-Blown Plywood Kills Woman in Greenwich Village
description: Tram Thuy Nguyen came to New York about eight months ago to be with her fianc, her former boss said, and her favorite topic in recent months had been her coming marriage.

title: New Global Fund to Help Countries Defend Smoking Laws
description: Bloomberg Philanthropies and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announced on Wednesday that they had started a global fund to help low- and middle-income countries fight legal challenges to their smoking laws by the tobacco industry.

title: After ISIS Retreats in Iraq, Evidence of Shiite Retaliation
description: Dozens of Iraqi villages that were under the control of the Islamic State suffered from looting and extensive property destruction after being retaken by pro-government forces, a study says.

title: Named Next President of N.Y.U., Oxfords Leader Inherits Challenges From John Sexton
description: New York University, which has become known for its global aspirations as much as its enviable home in Greenwich Village, named the head of one of the worlds most prestigious universities as its 16th president on Wednesday.

title: For Wearables, Design Leads Tech
description: Wearables are leading a revolution to combine design with ingenuity to make new products. During development of Nikes Fuelband, for example, many details, from material to font, came from designers.

title: National Gallery in London Appoints New Director
description: LONDON  Ever since last summer, when Nicholas Penny, the director of the National Gallery here, announced his plans to retire, speculation and rumors about who might succeed him abounded. On Wednesday, the National Gallery announced that Gabriele Finaldi, the deputy director for collections and research at the Prado museum in Madrid, would take up the post. The appointment was confirmed by the British prime minister, David Cameron.

title: Netanyahu at Risk of Isolating Israel, Palestinian Envoy to U.N. Warns
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is putting Israel on a collision course with its allies, the Palestinian ambassador to the United Nations said Wednesday, warning that if Mr. Netanyahu succeeded in forming a new government, he would further isolate his country.

title: Neither Simon Nor Macerich Can Claim High Road in Mall Bid
description: American operators of fancy retail complexes are showing similarities to far-flung bazaar traders. The mall owner Macerich rejected an unwanted $22 billion takeover bid from a larger rival, the Simon Property Group. The premium offered may be less valuable than claimed. Even so, the target companys response is the more disingenuous.

title: First Draft Focus: All Aboard
Syracuses Athletic Director Resigns; Jim Boeheim to Retire in 3 Years
description: A major figure in the N.C.A.A. report on infractions and academic misconduct at Syracuse gave up his job Wednesday, but it was not Jim Boeheim, the mens basketball coach, who will remain on the teams bench for three more seasons.

title: Air Force Veteran Pleads Not Guilty in ISIS Case
description: An Air Force veteran from New Jersey accused of trying to support the Islamic State pleaded not guilty on Wednesday in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

title: Flowers in Vases, Illustrated
description: From a series for T in which the artist Leanne Shapton makes new artworks from pictures in old books.

title: 1915: Women Called to War Service
description: LONDON  An important step has been taken by the Government in calling upon women to register themselves for paid employment in the nations service, to fill up ranks which are at present without sufficient labor, and also to release men for the fighting line.

title: A 3-D View of a Chart That Predicts The Economic Future: The Yield Curve
description: The current flatness of the curve shows investors expect mediocre growth.

title: Judge Sends Rowland, Ex-Connecticut Governor, Back to Prison
description: NEW HAVEN  Former Gov. John G. Rowland of Connecticut is going back to prison.

title: 1965: Russian Walks in Space
description: A French television report on the first spacewalk, by the Soviet cosmonaut Alexei A. Leonov. ina.fr

title: Inquiry Into Rape of Indian Nun Is Sent to Federal Agency
description: NEW DELHI  With no arrests yet in the rape of a nun  and the robbery of a convent school last week in the Indian state of West Bengal, the states leader on Wednesday delegated the case to the federal investigating agency.

title: Why Cant We Stop Watching Empire?
description: What is it about Empire, the Fox series about a family of music moguls that wraps up its first season this week, that makes the show so addictive? It might be the juicy plotlines; Taraji P. Hensons ferocious and charming portrayal of Cookie Lyon, the estranged matriarch of the family; the so-bad-its-almost-good soundtrack, produced by Timbaland; or some combination of all three. The soapy drama, which debuted in January, was the highest-rated new series on television this season. Its ratings and audience numbers have risen each week the show has aired  a phenomenon that is practically unheard-of. Fox has already renewed the series for a second season.

title: Wayne Odesnik Barred From Tennis After Second Doping Violation
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  The International Tennis Federation and the United States Anti-Doping Agency announced Wednesday that the American Wayne Odesnik had been barred for 15 years after urine samples he submitted in December and January tested positive for multiple banned substances. It was Odesniks second doping offense in five years.

title: Praying With Jeb Bush
description: Michael Paulson will soon begin reporting on theater for The Times, but for his penultimate article as a national religion reporter, he wrote about the role that Catholicism plays in Jeb Bushs life.

title: Survivors on Aftermath of Vanuatu Storm
description: Survivors tried to rebuild on Wednesday after a cyclone lashed out over the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu last weekend.

title: Kansas, a No. 2 Seed, Limps Into the N.C.A.A. Tournament
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  At the end of a brief practice the day before the Big 12 tournament quarterfinals at Sprint Center here, Kansas forward Cliff Alexander, a freshman, left the court with his gray T-shirt drenched in sweat. Alexander, embroiled in an eligibility issue with the N.C.A.A., had no reason to hold back because he would not be playing in the tournament.

title: A Perfectly Simple Herms Watch Thats Simply Perfect
description: The new Slim dHerms is an expression of luxurious minimalism. Unlike timepieces designed to measure your steps while tracking your pace, the French house has created a line of watches for both men and women  its first series in over 20 years  that marks the passing of time in the most spare and elegant way. Enclosed in a slender rose gold case, the luminescent dial of the watch shown here features numerals custom-created by Philippe Apeloig, a well-regarded French graphic designer. (Apeloig is also behind the signage for Jean Nouvels upcoming Louvre Abu Dhabi.) A sapphire crystal case back reveals the ultrathin automatic movement, manufactured at the prestigious Swiss watchmaker Vaucher, now owned in part by Herms. As befits a company that started out making leather harnesses for European noblemen in 1837, the hand-stitched Havana alligator strap receives the same attention to detail as does a Kelly bag. Valuing creativity and craftsmanship above all, Herms shows how perfect simple can be.

title: Car Bomb Targeting Afghan Officials Kills 7 Civilians
description: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan  A huge car bomb rocked the capital of Helmand Province late Wednesday morning, killing seven people and wounding more than 45 in an attack aimed at a gathering of officials in a secure Afghan government compound.

title: Do Conversations About Race Occur Where You Work?
description: This week, Starbucks encouraged its baristas to engage customers in discussion about race relations while serving up lattes. The campaign has touched off a lot of discussion on social media, and it makes me wonder:

title: SXSW Music 2015: Lines Everywhere, but Space on the Dance Floor
description: SXSW is recognizably more safety-conscious this year after a deadly incident in 2014, when a drunken driver crashed through a barrier and killed four people waiting in line on the street outside a club, and injured others. There are more barricades, more police officers and more streets closed to traffic.

title: Africa Center Post Gives Michelle D. Gavin a Chance to Show Diplomatic Skills
description: After a rocky start, the luxury condominiums at One Museum Mile, the 19-story, Robert A. M. Stern-designed tower anchoring the northeast corner of Central Park, are all occupied now.

title: Scenes From SXSW
description: Timbaland and Tink, Meg Mac, Future, Kate Tempest and others performed at the music festival in Austin, Tex.

title: Myanmar Shows Signs of Democratic Reversal, U.N. Official Says
description: GENEVA  Myanmar is reversing democratic reforms at an accelerating rate in an election year that will define its future, a United Nations investigator monitoring developments in the country said on Wednesday.

title: Dieudonn Mbala Mbala, French Comedian, Convicted of Condoning Terrorism
description: PARIS  The provocative French comedian Dieudonn Mbala Mbala was found guilty on Wednesday of condoning terrorism after a Facebook message he posted in January suggested sympathy with one of the gunmen in the attacks that killed 17 people in Paris.

title: Starbucks Initiative on Race Relations Draws Attacks Online
description: Scrawled on Starbucks cups, the words Race Together were intended to stimulate conversations about race relations in America, beginning just days before the companys annual shareholders meeting on Wednesday. But the coffee companys campaign has instead unleashed widespread vitriol and derision.

title: For the Love of Watches
description: Andrew Luffs collection is focused on timepieces made by small watchmakers, and the color orange.

title: Lindsey Vonn Wins World Cup Title in Downhill
description: Roughly a year ago, at home in Colorado, Lindsey Vonns mornings were devoted to grueling gym sessions rehabilitating her twice rebuilt right knee. Vonns afternoons were spent with the leg enveloped in ice, a routine that had kept her out of consecutive racing seasons.

title: T-Mobile Aims to Make Phone Plans Easier for Businesses
description: Since T-Mobile USA introduced its simplified phone plans for consumers in 2013, the carrier has significantly grown its customer base. Now it has another target: business subscribers.

title: A Nation on the Move: Exploring the Promise of the First Transcontinental Railroad
Fed Creeps Closer to Higher Rate That May Not Arrive for Months
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve on Wednesday moved to the verge of raising interest rates for the first time since the economy fell into recession more than seven years ago, even as officials suggested that the Fed might not pull the trigger until well into the second half of the year.

title: Good News for Medical Marijuana
description: A bipartisan Senate bill that would permit the medicinal use of marijuana in states that allow it is slowly gaining support among lawmakers. The latest to sign on is Senator Barbara Boxer, Democrat of California, who became a co-sponsor of the bill on Tuesday.

title: Suspect Is Captured After Rampage in Mesa, Ariz., Leaves One Man Dead
description: MESA, Ariz.  After an argument in a motel, a gunman went on a deadly rampage through a quiet neighborhood here early Wednesday, leaving one man dead and at least five others wounded before being captured, the authorities said.

title: Study Reveals Genetic Path of Modern Britons
description: In A.D. 410, Roman authority in Britain collapsed and Romano-British society disappeared from history under the invading tides of Angles and Saxons from northern Europe. Historians have been debating ever since whether the Romano-British were wiped out or survived by adopting their conquerors language and culture.

title: Netanyahus Day, and Israels Future
Video Feature: Design Gains Importance as Devices Get More Personal
description: THERES how a product looks and how you interact with it, and both of those things come down to design. In tech, it is the design that separates a successful product from a dud.

title: Dana Farouki on Where to Eat, Shop and Gallery-Hop in Dubai
description: The art collector, adviser and booster Dana Farouki moved from New York to Dubai almost five years ago, cementing a relationship with the city that began with family when she was a child and has continued through her nearly 10 years as a curator and champion of arts organizations and initiatives in the UAE, including the Guggenheim Abu Dhabi. She has served on the Board of Patrons for Art Dubai, the ninth edition of which begins today and runs through Saturday, since the fair began in 2007. Shes also on the jury for the Abraaj Group Art Prize, whose winners (all artists from the Middle East, North Africa or South Asia) will be showcased at the fair this week.

title: Senate Republicans Rebuff House Colleagues With Their Budget Plan
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans on Wednesday released an austere budget that maintains strict caps on military spending and cuts trillions of dollars from health care and welfare, sending a rebuff to their House colleagues.

title: The FaceTime Babysitter
description: One recent Saturday afternoon, when Rafi Fletcher was home alone with her nearly 1-year-old son, the Minneapolis mom wanted to get some work done on her womens clothing start-up, Tibby & Finn.

title: Valentin Rasputin, Russian Writer Who Led Village Prose Movement, Dies at 77
description: MOSCOW  Valentin Rasputin, a patriarch of the so-called village prose writers who emerged in the Soviet Union in the 1960s to address moral and environmental issues and depict the remains of a rural Russia about to be consumed by industrialization, died here on Saturday. He was 77.

title: Grant Hill, Former Duke Star, Now an Analyst for Turner Sports
description: Duke is the top seed in the South Region in the 2015 N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament and may have a chance to derail Kentucky. While Christian Laettner made the Shot to defeat Kentucky in the 1992 East Regional final, he never would have had the chance without the Pass, an 80-foot inbounds toss from Grant Hill.

title: App Smart | Tech Your Way To Fitness
description: There are numerous calorie counters and exercise tracking apps available. Let your phone be your guide to better fitness and nutrition.

title: Video Feature: Apps for Tracking Fitness and Losing Weight
description: LIKE many of you, Im trying to shake off the winter doldrums, so Ive discovered a few apps that help turn fitness into a quantifiable part of daily life.

title: No Business Like Show Business (Personal)
description: Im at SXSW; saw my first couple of sets last night. And right away I had a demonstration of why you want to see live performances.

title: After Aide Quits, Walker Faces Some Conservative Criticism
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is being criticized by some conservatives after his digital aide Liz Mair resigned over intemperate Twitter posts about the sacred status of the Iowa caucuses in the presidential nominating process.

title: Crowdfunded Entrepreneurs, Tripped Up by the Taxman
description: Jenny Wecker, a fledgling Salt Lake City entrepreneur, had a hit on her hands at the end of December: She collected $42,000 in pledges from the crowdfunding site Kickstarter for more than 300 orders of a stylish diaper bag she had designed.

title: Modern and Postmodern Recessions
description: As I mentioned yesterday, Romer and Romer have a new paper questioning the claim that recoveries are always slow after financial crises  and certainly slow recovery isnt inevitable.

title: Why Does Dick Cheney Keep Talking?
description: As I read the incredibly long interview with Dick Cheney published by Playboy Magazine yesterday, filled with his usual rewriting of history and sneering attacks on President Obama, the big question that came to mind was: Why do an interview with Mr. Cheney at this point at all? And, relatedly: Why does Mr. Cheney feel this endless need to maintain a public profile?

title: SXSW Music 2015: The First Days Worthy Showcases
description: Some worthy showcases from the first day of the SXSW Music festival:

title: Pope Francis to Speak at U.N. During Annual Gathering of World Leaders
description: Pope Francis, an outspoken advocate for the rights of the poor, will visit the United Nations during its annual conclave of world leaders in September, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon announced Wednesday. Francis will be the fourth pope to visit the United Nations in its 70-year history.

title: PlayBuzz Rides Quizzes and Lists to $16 Million in Financing
description: PlayBuzz, a website and online platform for creating quizzes, lists and surveys, which has been ranked as one of the most shared sites on Facebook, said on Wednesday that it had raised $16 million in a fresh round of financing.

title: Dissident Journalist in Yemen Is Shot and Killed
description: CAIRO  One of Yemens best-known dissident journalists, who survived beatings and imprisonment under the former authoritarian government, was shot and killed on Wednesday by unidentified gunmen outside his home in the capital, Sana, according to witnesses and officials.

title: Both Sides in Blurred Lines Copyright Suit Signal a Continuing Battle
description: The Blurred Lines case has resulted in one of the biggest jury verdicts in the history of music copyright, and its not closed yet.

title: Review: Hunchback of Notre Dame at Paper Mill Playhouse
description: MILLBURN, N.J.  Granted, I didnt actually tally them up, but the words Kyrie eleison  thats Greek for Lord have mercy  seem to be sung more frequently in the musical version of The Hunchback of Notre Dame at the Paper Mill Playhouse here than they are in many a Mass. Which is saying something, if youve heard a few Masses in your day.

title: Nicole Najafis Marfa Myths Encounters, From Dev Hynes to a New Tequila Drink
description: The founder of the year-old brand with a cult following, Industry Standard, shares pictures from her weekend adventure in West Texass picturesque high desert city.

title: Janet Yellen Isnt Going to Raise Interest Rates Until Shes Good and Ready
description: The key words in Janet L. Yellens news conference Wednesday were rather pithy, at least by central bank standards. Just because we removed the word patient from the statement doesnt mean we are going to be impatient, Ms. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said.

title: Corners of American Life
description: The playwright Lisa DAmour is busy all over the country.

title: Facts & Figures: New Yorkers Punishing Commutes
description: New York City has earned a dubious honor: Its residents spend more time commuting, on average, than residents of any other major city in the country, according to a report issuedby the city comptrollers office. This news comes just a few weeks after New Yorkers learned that subway delays had increasedmore than 45 percent between 2013 and 2014.

title: Review: Kate Tempest, a Young Poet Conjuring Ancient Gods
description: A wunderkind rapper and spoken word performer equally influenced by Wu-Tang Clan and Joyce, Bukowski and Blake; an English poet whose musical sense of language bridges the worlds of rap and traditional lyric verse; a fan favorite at the Glastonbury music festival who became the youngest winner of the Ted Hughes poetry prize. Such dichotomies not only attest to the 29-year-old Kate Tempests gift for shattering  and transcending  convention and conventional genres, but they also underscore the tensions and contradictions that fuel her dynamic art.

title: Mets Are Looking Like Lumberjacks (With Smoother Swings)
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Over the off-season, like any man on hiatus from work, Noah Syndergaard did not shave every day. He had some stubble when he came here in January to train with a group of Mets. Then he saw Bobby Parnell and Josh Edgin and their substantial beards, and Vic Blacks beard on social media, and he decided to commit to growing his own.

title: Fed Removes Promise to Be Patient
description: Janet L. Yellen, chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, said that while it was unlikely that the Fed would raise a key interest rate at its next meeting in April, there might be increases later.

title: Federal Employee Will Not Face Criminal Charges in Drone Crash at White House
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department said Wednesday that it would not criminally charge a federal employee who was operating a hobbyists drone that crashed on the South Lawn of the White House in January.

title: Artek Celebrates the German Harpsichord
description: Bachs music, played on a harpsichord representing his time and place: as natural as this may seem, it is an infrequent event, at least in New York. The Artek ensemble made that point strongly over the weekend with Harpsichords of Germany, a little festival of concerts, workshops and discussions at Immanuel Lutheran Church on the Upper East Side.

title: Who Should Lead the New York Philharmonic? Readers Respond.
description: The classical music critics of The New York Times recently pondered who should take over as music director of the New York Philharmonic after Alan Gilbert steps down in 2017.

title: At the Prague Marathon, History Is a Spectator
description: The Prague International Marathon starts in Staromestske Namesti, or Old Town Square, in the heart of the city, directly between Old Town Hall, with its famous astronomical clock, built in the early 15th century, and the weathered bronze monument of Jan Hus and his followers. Hus, the Charles University philosophy professor and preacher who was burned at the stake as a heretic in 1415, stands stately and tall in the center of the square. You half expect to see a starters pistol in his hand.

title: In Israel, Opera Echoes From Rocks and Ruins
description: When Eitan Campbell, the director of Israels Masada National Park, first came to work at the promontory in 1972, he was taken by a small etching of a sailboat on one of the fortresss ancient stone walls. Perhaps it was a bored Herodian soldier, sitting atop the mountain in the hot sun of 30 B.C., who spied the vessel afloat in the nearby Dead Sea and painted its likeness to pass the time.

title: European Union Moves to Limit Special Tax Deals
description: BERLIN  European Union officials on Wednesday proposed new rules to try to discourage tax-avoidance deals with multinational corporations, which critics say give some countries unfair business advantages.

title: The Brooklyn-Born-Raised-and-Based Artist Who Dripped Her Way to Chanel Sneakers and Car Service
description: The biggest change in Joyce Pensatos life since her recent ascent to painterly panacea? Oh, I only take car services now, she giddily boasts. Thats also discounting the Chanel high-tops she splurged for recently at Barneys, but hey, she only bought them because they were comfortable. Well, I got two pairs, she confesses. In fact, that Uber is Pensatos greatest quotidian extravagance at the age of 70  or somewhere in that ballpark, a lady never tells  is revealing of a painter who not only remained in the New York art scenes periphery until recently, but, like many women, took years to find the confidence to really be herself. I was really isolated, I wasnt connected to any scene, I felt so alone, she says. It could be easy to lump Pensato into the art worlds growing trend of discovering artists in their golden years. But her big, brash, bold canvases of Batman, Bart Simpson and other pop-cultural totems, which have become instantly recognizable, actually are not simply the byproduct of some advanced-style fad. In fact, her current and fourth solo at New Yorks Petzel Gallery, open until March 28, features the caricature motifs shes been working in since as long as she can remember (as well a surrealist Pop-culture series of photographs shes just beginning to explore). Though Pensato has been drawing her whole lifetime, her tale is one of a personal journey of self-expression and finding her own unbeaten path  even if I never got off the L train, she jokes.

title: Scott Walkers Bracket: More Conservative Than Jeb Bushs
description: Scott Walkers bracket is even more conservative than Jeb Bushs.

title: Pictures of the Day: Israel and Elsewhere
description: Israel and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Review: Ailey II Displays Acrobatic Tussles Between the Sexes
description: Across a foggy stage, illuminated from the sides, dancers run past like extras in a disaster movie, anxiously looking in every direction. This is the start of a work called Breakthrough, but if the dancers or their audiences are searching for an artistic one, they will search in vain.

title: Winners in Norman Kay Platinum Pairs in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS  The Norman Kay Platinum Pairs is one of the toughest events to win at the Spring North American Championships. Every entrant has to have amassed a number of platinum master points, which are awarded only in the top national championships. After two days of play, just 28 pairs qualify for the final two sessions.

title: March 18, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Israel, Tunisia, South Sudan and the United States.

title: SXSW Music 2015: Playing Unpaid, and Driving for Lyft (for a Paycheck)
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Like so many other musicians, Kervens Joseph, an aspiring rapper known as Acafool, came to the South by Southwest Music and Media Conference here to make contacts in the industry by playing a handful of unpaid concerts. Just for the exposure, he said on Wednesday, as the music portion of the festival kicked into gear following the film and interactive events.

title: Surprise in Israel Election as Exit Polls Falter
description: JERUSALEM  Israelis woke up to a surprise on Wednesday morning, having gone to bed the night before with the results of their national elections in a near tie.

title: Philippine Airlines Resumes Flights to New York
description: After a nearly 18-year hiatus, Philippine Airlines, also known as PAL, has restored service between Manila and New York City.

title: Empire vs. Madonna in Battle for No. 1
description: What counts as a No. 1 album? These days the answer  or at least the way the music industry tries to spin the question  is sometimes open to interpretation.

title: Microsoft Backs Further Away From Selling Software
description: Microsoft dismantled another piece of its old way of doing business on Wednesday.

title: Nicole Najafis Marfa Myths Encounters, From Dev Hynes to a New Tequila Drink
description: I dont know what it is, but the sky there is just legendary, says Nicole Najafi about Marfa, Texas. Its so blue and so clear. Of course the founder of the year-old denim brand Industry Standard noticed the cobalt-colored heavens above West Texass artist-populated high desert city: Blue is, predictably, her favorite color. Najafi is just back from her first trip there, for the three-day Marfa Myths Festival, curated by Ballroom Marfa and the record label Mexican Summer, that took place Friday through Sunday. I think what makes Marfa so special, besides being a tiny town bursting with fine art and culture in the middle of nowhere, is that it is so hard to get to the nearest airport, El Paso, is three hours away. Festivals tend to evolve into these huge, multi-faceted events that get inundated with people and morph into something totally different from what they started as. I had just assumed that would eventually be the case with Marfa; but the more I spoke to people who have been coming for many years, I learned that Marfa hasnt changed very much. I love that.

title: Pakistan Steps Up Executions of Convicts, but One Gets Reprieve
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan hanged nine prisoners on Wednesday as part of a broader acceleration of executions that has drawn loud protests from human rights groups.

title: William Pope.L Makes Statements From the Fringes
description: LOS ANGELES  It was a plaintive sight: a monumental American flag drooping so low on its pole that it would touch the ground were it not for a wood platform. The artist William Pope.L was tending to the flag carefully. He lifted the tail end, where the stripes were separated at the seams, and spread them apart, the way you might separate a girls long hair before braiding it.

title: Pentagon Confirms Strike Killed Shabab Militant Leader in Somalia
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon said Wednesday that airstrikes last week against the Shabab extremist group were successful, and that Adan Garar, a senior member of the group, had been killed in a drone strike on his vehicle.

title: For Tug Captain, Job That Runs in Family Turns Deadly Off Long Island
description: There was rain, thick fog and an ocean swell  in other words, just another day on the water for Donald Maloney, 60, as the Sea Bear, the tugboat he was captaining, traveled along the South Shore of Long Island on Saturday.

title: Review: Paul Taylors American Modern Dance at David H. Koch Theater
description: Among the endlessly interesting aspects of the performing arts is the matter of physical projection. Why is it that this dancer (or singer or actor) stands and moves in a way that doesnt read beyond a few rows of the auditorium, whereas another seems to effortlessly exude presence and legibility fit for a stadium? In dance, the difference is often more striking among companies.

title: Brain Swelling Tied to Deaths From Malaria
description: When children die from a severe form of malaria, swelling of the brain is often what kills them, a new study finds.

title: Natalia Osipova in the Royal Ballets Swan Lake
description: New York has seen the sensational Russian ballerina Natalia Osipova in a wide range of ballets  but, curiously, never in the illustrious double role of Odette-Odile in Swan Lake. This now changes, but on screen, not onstage. Now in her second season as a principal of the Royal Ballet in London, she recently danced the role three times at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden; the last of these, performed on Tuesday, is to be streamed to American cinemas in HD, starting tonight in East Coast theaters. (West Coast streamings occur later this month.) I saw the first, on Feb. 21, during a trip to London.

title: Dolce & Gabbana Comments Trigger Public Outrage ... and Uncomfortable Silence
description: Over the last 30 years, Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana have dressed Madonna, designed costumes for Baz Luhrmann movies and fended off one of the most convoluted tax evasion cases in recent business history.

title: Goldwyn Heirs to Sell Art and Hollywood Hills Mansion
description: LOS ANGELES  The art collection and Hollywood Hills mansion that for decades were a physical representation of the Goldwyn dynastys staying power in film are being sold following the death of Samuel Goldwyn Jr.

title: Mercedes-Benz to Sponsor U.S. Version of Rock in Rio
description: For Mercedes-Benz, the decision to sponsor a pop festival came down to toilets, dirt and mud.

title: Fashions Love Affair With the 70s
description: Some stylish options to evoke the 70s.

title: In Time for Spring, Sailor Pants and More
description: Sailor pants from Kenzo, Ace & Jig and more; Donald Duck and Mickey Mouse motif printed scarves; NikeLabs collaboration with Sacai; and Maison Margielas sweet daisy jewelry.

title: The 70s Are Back in Fashion. Again.
description: What did the 70s feel like? As recalled by Bebe Buell, a singer and onetime habitu of that fabled hipster magnet Maxs Kansas City: Everybodys eyelids were very heavy. I used to chuckle to myself, thinking, Thats the cannabis eye, the quaalude eye  the look people get when theyre feeling no pain.

title: Before Empire, a Foundation Laid by Platinum
description: A family-run hip-hop label is under siege: First there are the competitors, who are stealing the labels artists; then there are the artists themselves, who are unreliable and prideful; and finally, theres the internal strife between brothers.

title: Math Professors N.C.A.A. Bracket Tests the Value of Predicting Upsets
description: The upsets are always the tricky part of the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament. The methods we have developed at Davidson College often uncover several upsets in the first round, giving us leverage in the online bracket competitions we have participated in.

title: Cheap Thrills at Neiman Marcuss Cut-Price Outlet Store
description: An outlet store is an awkward stepchild. It has to be close enough to the parent brand to leech some of the elders prestige, but not close enough to devalue it. It must attract the right customers without offending the wrong ones. Its appearance should deftly suggest, with things like paint color and lighting, a haven of cheap thrills with the possibility of hidden treasures.

title: SXSW 2015: George Miller on the Evolution of Mad Max
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  When the director George Miller was announced and came onstage to introduce a 35mm screening of Mad Max: The Road Warrior here on Monday, the crowd rose instantly to their (happy) feet. Mr. Millers 1981 film built a grungy, postapocalyptic world that has often been imitated (and at this festival with the movie Turbo Kid, humorously saluted), but not quite duplicated. It is arguably the most discussed in the franchise by critics and audiences, with its blistering airy landscapes, sparse dialogue, inventive camerawork and amplified action. At the screening, the first audience member to ask a question was the director Robert Rodriguez. He kept his inquiry simple: How the hell did you do it?

title: Facials for Those Who Cant Hide All Day After
description: With the success of blowout specialists like Drybar and DreamDry, its scarcely surprising that similarly minded salons are proliferating, each focusing on just one service. The newest additions focus on fuss-free facials, often with unisex appeal. As with the hair services, convenience and expertise are emphasized, with prices set to encourage regular patronage, not an occasional splurge.

title: Why a Spielberg and a Goldwyn Passed Over Their Dads Hollywood for Snapchat
description: When your last name is Spielberg (as in Steven) or Goldwyn (as in John, Samuel Jr. and Samuel Sr.), finding a gig that lets you work on feature-length projects headed for the silver screen neednt be difficult.

title: Capturing the Night in Digital Photos, Spectacularly
description: VINCENT LAFORET remembers the moment he realized that digital cameras had surpassed the human eye. It was late in 2009, and Mr. Laforet, a photographer who worked for The New York Times for many years, was shooting in Los Angeles with the EOS 1D Mark IV, a Canon camera that he had gotten as an early prototype.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Fifty Years On, a Pioneering Leather Shop (Not for the Uptight) Stands Strong
description: A sign on the front door warns: Must be 21 to Enter. It doesnt portend a traditional shopping experience.

title: French Parliament Debates Weight Standards for Fashion Models
description: PARIS  France, which often seems to have style and elegance written into its genetic code, is again confronting one of the dark sides of fashion: the glamorization of too-thin women.

title: In Taryn Simons Paris Show, a Look at How a Hidden Hand Organizes Reality
description: PARIS  World Press Photo, the renowned journalism prize organization, rescinded a top award this month amid controversy over whether a documentary photographer had crossed the line into staged art. The American artist Taryn Simon pushes the boundaries in the opposite direction, creating art photographs that draw on painstaking reporting.

title: Social Media Images of Antiterrorism Rally in Tunis
description: Tunisians rallied against terrorism Wednesday night, hours after an assault by militants on a museum in the center of the capital, Tunis, left at least 19 people dead, mainly foreign tourists.

title: Police Shooting Tests New Wisconsin Law
description: A new law in Wisconsin might offer a model for the nation in how police-involved killings are investigated.

title: In Wisconsin, a Trial Run for a New Law
description: Since the deaths of Michael Brown Jr. in Ferguson, Mo., and Eric Garner on Staten Island, police use of deadly force against unarmed black men has become a topic of national discussion.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: The handbag designer Anya Hindmarch is bringing her British whimsy to Barneys. On Friday, shell open a pop-up on the stores first floor for the Sticker Shop, her spring collaboration with Charlotte Stockdale of Chaos Fashion. Selfie aficionados can take a picture in an Instabooth complete with oversize AH sticker props. There will be several store exclusives, like a silver high-shine Have a Nice Day featherweight Ebury bag ($1,550), as well as a range of leather stick-on letters ($55) and symbols ($75) for those who prefer to personalize their message.

title: TK
description: Tktktktk

title: Obama Criticizes Republican Budget
description: President Obama, speaking in Cleveland, said that the Republican budget failed to address the needs of the middle class and only offered prosperity for those who have already prospered.

title: Underground Wrestling in Moscow
description: Far from the pageantry and money of American pro wrestling, Russian grapplers exist in the shadows, where the bad guys wear red, white and blue.

title: Mascaras That Are Better for Batting
description: My eyelashes are truly pitiful. Theyre so wimpy even extensions look ludicrous, yet a fake eyelash strip feels gauche. A liquid liner and coats of mascara are as good as it gets. And when it comes to mascara, I like mine gloppy  that is, a formula and brush that generously load product onto my lashes with minimal effort. If youre the sort who prefers a natural lash look, read no further. But if you werent a winner in the genetic eyelash lottery, one of these mascaras may be for you.

title: Warnings Raised of a Greek Exit From the Euro
description: PARIS  Just a few weeks ago, fears that Greece might exit the euro union subsided when Europe extended its financial bailout. But as a new war of words escalates between Athens and its creditors, talk of a Grexit is heating up.

title: Treating Exotic Pets
description: The patients at one Manhattan hospital tend toward the exotic: animals usually found in the wild but now kept as pets.

title: Netanyahus Win Is Good for Palestine
description: WASHINGTON  IF anyone doubted where Benjamin Netanyahu stood on the question of peace, the Israeli prime minister made himself clear just before Tuesdays election, proclaiming that there would never be a Palestinian state on his watch. Then he decided to engage in a bit of fear-mongering against Palestinian citizens of Israel in hopes of driving his supporters to the polls. The right-wing government is in danger, Mr. Netanyahu announced on Election Day. Arab voters are heading to the polling stations in droves.

title: G.M. Exiting Russia, for the Most Part
description: MOSCOW  General Motors on Wednesday announced plans to largely withdraw from the Russian market by the end of the year, becoming the most prominent company to date to express a lack of confidence in the deeply troubled economy.

title: Investment Firm Buys Stake in Activist Hedge Fund Jana Partners
description: The private equity unit of Neuberger Berman Group has bought a stake in the activist hedge fund Jana Partners, underscoring the growing popularity of investors who rattle the boards of corporate America.

title: Sales of Streaming Music Top CDs in Flat Year for Industry
description: The American market for recorded music was flat in 2014, but income from streaming services like Spotify and Pandora has quickly grown to become a major part of the business, eclipsing CD sales for the first time, according to a report released Wednesday by the Recording Industry Association of America.

title: Islamic Scholars Promote Sharia as an Alternative to Extremism
description: MECCA, Saudi Arabia  To combat extremist ideologies, Islamic scholars and researchers meeting in Mecca last month urged Muslim governments to tackle poverty, overhaul school curriculums  and get back to religion.

title: Ex-Promoter in Haiti Charged in Kidnapping Ring
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  A former music promoter with ties to the Haitian president, Michel Martelly, was indicted this week, accused of running a kidnapping ring said to be responsible in the killing of a police inspector and the abductions of 17 people.

title: Why Israels Exit Polls Were So Off
description: A look at how inaccurate exit polls contributed to the surprised reaction Wednesday morning that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had defeated his main rival decisively.

title: State Department Is Asked to Explain Handling of Hillary Clintons Emails
description: WASHINGTON  The National Archives and Records Administration has asked the State Department to explain how Hillary Rodham Clintons emails were managed when she was secretary, and to say what was being done to retrieve any federal records that may have been lost because she communicated over a private email server.

title: Rory McIlroy Commits to Practice and to Father-Son Rounds
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Rory McIlroys repeated absences from the Arnold Palmer Invitational became a symbol of his divided loyalties. He turned down invitations from Palmer, the tournament host, for three years, including twice when he was ranked No. 1, to spend time with his globe-trotting girlfriend, the tennis player Caroline Wozniacki, who was competing in back-to-back events in California and Florida.

title: Eike Batista Is Fined by Brazilian Regulator Over Securities Violations
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Eike Batista, the onetime Brazilian billionaire who is on trial on insider trading charges, is facing sanctions from a government regulator.

title: Target Plans to Raise Pay to at Least $9 an Hour
description: Target said on Wednesday that it would increase the pay of its workers to at least $9 an hour, joining retailers like Walmart and TJX in raising its hourly wage in a more competitive job market and facing pressure from labor groups.

title: Palestinian Leaders See Validation of Their Statehood Effort
description: JERUSALEM  Under most circumstances, an Israeli leaders frank admission that he would never agree to a Palestinian state would be a disaster for the Palestinian leadership. But when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said precisely that in the heat of the recent election campaign, it seemed to have the opposite effect, validating the unilateral approach the Palestinians have decided to follow.

title: A New Effort to Rescue Runaways in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  A team of Cook County sheriffs deputies starts each morning in a small office in the juvenile court building here, poring over a list of children missing from state-run foster care and group homes and searching for clues to their whereabouts.

title: Former Employee Sues Facebook for Sex and Race Discrimination
description: As the Ellen Pao sex discrimination trial continues to captivate Silicon Valley, the law firm representing Ms. Pao has filed a bias case on behalf of another woman against an even bigger target: Facebook.

title: A Year After Seizing Crimea, Putin Celebrates as Ukraine Seethes
description: MOSCOW  As President Vladimir V. Putin led Russia in celebrating the first anniversary of its annexation of Crimea on Wednesday with a rally and concert, Russian-backed separatists in eastern Ukraine warned that a cease-fire there was at risk of collapsing because of a dispute over political autonomy for regions in the war zone.

title: Chicago Offers 2 Choices for Obama Library Site
description: CHICAGO  Should President Obama decide to have his namesake library built here in the city where his political career began, he will have his choice of two sprawling plots of South Side parkland.

title: BlackRocks New Breed of Exchange-Traded Bond Fund Prizes Stability Over Swagger
description: SAN FRANCISCO  You will not see Scott Radell on CNBC. Nor does he inhabit a jaw-dropping mansion.

title: Patrick McDarby, Sport Logo Designer, Is Dead at 57
description: Some of the most prominent sports logos in America began with a pencil and a railroad.

title: U.A.B. Moved Forward as Fan Support Slipped Away
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  When the University of Alabama-Birmingham, citing rising costs, decided to drop its football program, fans there took to the streets to protest. They marched, waved signs and called for the university president to be booted off campus.

title: Chinese Drywall Firm to Pay Damages
description: Elizabeth Heischober has been waiting nearly five years for a Chinese company to honor a court judgment for contaminated drywall that upended her life, made her sick and wrecked her finances. Until now, she wondered if it would ever happen.

title: Obama Chides G.O.P. Over Proposed Program Cuts
description: CLEVELAND  President Obama on Wednesday denounced the Republicans latest budget as stingy and shortsighted, taking them to task for proposing to cut domestic programs that he said would yield more jobs and economic benefits for working people who are struggling financially.

title: Manchester City Was Ready for Lionel Messi, or So It Thought
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The moment that encapsulated the game came after about 40 minutes. Lionel Messi, Barcelonas wizard in residence, had the ball near the sideline. James Milner, a sturdy Manchester City midfielder, approached.

title: Inquiry Into Deadly East Harlem Explosion Focuses on Con Eds Plastic Pipes
description: Federal investigators studying the deadly gas explosion that leveled two buildings in East Harlem a year ago are focusing on the plastic pipes that Consolidated Edison installed beneath Park Avenue three years before the blast, documents released on Wednesday revealed.

title: A Vineyard Dispute, $800,000 in Cash and Two Dead in Napa
description: YOUNTVILLE, Calif.  Perhaps it began with the red Adidas gym bag stuffed with $800,000 in cash.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 18, 2015
description: March 18, 2015

title: Ebola Cases Increase in Guinea
description: The World Health Organization said Wednesday that 95 new cases of Ebola had been confirmed in Guinea in the week that ended last Sunday, the highest weekly total for that country so far this year. The other two West African countries that have been ravaged by Ebola  Sierra Leone and Liberia  showed continued improvements for the week. Sierra Leone reported 55 confirmed new cases but that was the countrys lowest weekly total since last June. Liberia reported no new confirmed cases for the third consecutive week. Wednesday was the 12th day since the last known Ebola patient in Liberia had a negative test. Forty-two days must elapse after that test before transmission of the highly contagious Ebola virus is considered to have ended in Liberia. The weekly update by the W.H.O. also said a total of 10,154 people had died from the Ebola epidemic so far, almost all of them in the three worst-affected countries.

title: Paperwork
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Since you are reading this, I will assume that you, like me, are a word nerd.

title: Samuel Charters, Foundational Scholar of the Blues, Dies at 85
description: Samuel Charters, whose books and field research helped detonate the blues and folk music revival of the 1960s and 70s, died on Wednesday at his home in Arsta, Sweden. He was 85.

title: Netanyahu Will Make History
description: Well, its pretty clear now: Benjamin Netanyahu is going to be a major figure in Israeli history  not because hes heading to become the longest-serving Israeli prime minister, but because hes heading to be the most impactful. Having won the Israeli elections  in part by declaring that he will never permit a two state-solution between Israelis and Palestinians  it means Netanyahu will be the father of the one-state solution. And the one-state solution means that Israel will become, in time, either a non-Jewish democracy or Jewish non-democracy.

title: In Ethics Push, Cuomo Strays From His Formula
description: ALBANY  In more than four years as governor of New York, Andrew M. Cuomo has traveled all over the state, from frozen Buffalo to the rocky tip of Long Island.

title: Dayton Relishes Role as a Longtime Tournament Host
description: DAYTON, Ohio  It is conceivable that Archie Miller has walked up, down, back and forth across the court at University of Dayton Arena hundreds of times. But during his teams practice Tuesday inside this old but famed gymnasium off the banks of the Great Miami River, Miller, Daytons coach, casually paced about with his hands folded in front of him and surveyed his surroundings as if to inspect every square inch like a visitor.

title: Back at Garden, Brad Richards Makes Himself at Home
description: The Rangers and Chicago Blackhawks are old Original Six rivals who came within an overtime bounce last June of meeting in the Stanley Cup finals for the first time.

title: Christie Administration Deal With Exxon Was Years in the Making
description: In summer 2012, lawyers for Exxon Mobil Corporation gathered in a state office building in Trenton, ready to hear what the State of New Jersey might be willing to accept in exchange for making a long-running environmental pollution case go away.

title: Broadchurch Season 2, Episode 3 Recap: The Revenge of Sharon Bishop
description: Well get it right this time.

title: Everyone's N.C.A.A. Bracket Predictions, Round by Round
description: Aggregate picks from New York Times readers, three statistical models and two popular public brackets.

title: Arthur A. Hartman, U.S. Ambassador to Soviet Union, Dies at 89
description: Arthur A. Hartman, who was Washingtons longest-serving ambassador to the Soviet Union and the Reagan administrations point man in Moscow during a succession of delicate Cold War crises, died on March 16 in Washington. He was 89.

title: In Long Shot, Ex-Closer Tries to Make the Yankees
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  When he was attending Wagner College, Andrew Bailey and a few buddies would occasionally take the Staten Island Ferry to Manhattan, hop on the train to Yankee Stadium and sit among the bleacher creatures.

title: Fire Engulfs a Block of Homes in Queens
description: Fire swept through a residential block in Woodhaven, Queens, on Wednesday night, spreading rapidly through a row of attached two-story homes.

title: Battle Ready: The Symbolism of Black Eyeliner
description: Whether smudgy and disaffected or strong and defined, it transforms the entire face, making a warrior of any woman.

title: David Brandon Geeting Finds Irreverence in the Everyday
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Dark Knight
description: Fleeing the sunny Southern gentility of his childhood, a budding film director turns a New York house into a louche fantasy.

title: Bergdorf Goodman Shares Recipes for Fashionable Fetes at Home
description: Bergdorf Goodman, the globally renowned retailer with one fashionable Fifth Avenue address, belongs to a rare set of iconic New York City institutions that appeal not only to tourists, but also to the most elite of locals. And theres one floor where the department stores casual window shoppers and seasoned regulars converge seamlessly: the seventh, in the Kelly-Wearstler designed BG Restaurant. If its powder-blue walls could talk, the fashion sets secrets  divulged there over uptown fare, classic cocktails and afternoon tea  could probably fill a book. Instead, BG is releasing a chic little tome filled with recipes ($35, out March 24 from Harper Design). Some are from its own kitchen, and others come courtesy of the fashion designers, editors and stylists who eat there.

title: Word of the Day | reminiscence
description: reminiscence  \re-m-ni-sn(t)s\  noun

title: Defamation Lawsuit by Roger Clemenss Ex-Trainer Is Settled After 7 Years
description: It would have created a huge distraction for Major League Baseball  Roger Clemens on the witness stand in federal court in Brooklyn just as the World Series was being decided.

title: Allen Jerkens, Giant Killer of Horse Racing, Dies at 85
description: Allen Jerkens, the Hall of Fame thoroughbred trainer who was known as the Giant Killer for springing some of horse racings greatest upsets, died on Wednesday in Aventura, Fla. He was 85.

title: Buddy Elias, Cousin of Anne Frank and Guardian of Her Legacy, Dies at 89
description: Buddy Elias, the closest living relative of Anne Frank and an ardent guardian of her legacy, died on March 16 at his home in Basel, Switzerland  a house whose attic yielded a cache of long-forgotten letters from Anne and her family that formed the basis of a recent book. He was 89.

title: Sweden: At Least Two Are Killed as Gunfire Erupts in Restaurant
description: Several people were shot and at least two died inside a restaurant in a suburb of Swedens second-largest city, Gothenburg, on Wednesday night in what the police said might have been an act of gang-related violence. Ulla Brehm, a spokeswoman for the Gothenburg Police Department, said the shootings took place on the island community of Hesingen, an area with a history of difficulties with youth gangs, drugs and violent criminals. She said two people died in the shooting and several more were wounded and taken to hospitals. Ms. Brehm added that there was nothing indicating that this was terrorism at all. Not at all. The police said the shooting occurred around10 p.m.in a popular local restaurant called Var Krog och Bar, which means our tavern and bar in Swedish, that is on a bustling square.

title: Empire Finale Review: A Sizzling End to Season One
description: It seems like a violation of Chekhovs gun rule to put Naomi Campbell in the first act and not have her throw a phone at someone in the third. (She tore up a check instead.) But other than that, the first season of Empire, which ended on Fox on Wednesday, was pretty perfect.

title: Celebrity Picks on a Bracket With a Twist
description: Several celebrities, including Eli Manning and Billy Bush, filled out our market-based bracket that rewards risky predictions.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 7 P.M. (HBO) ADMISSION (2013) Tina Fey portrays Portia Nathan, an admissions officer at Princeton who seems to take a special kind of glee in controlling the fate of students applying to the university. She also has a goal of her own: to succeed the retiring dean of admissions (Wallace Shawn) and beat out her office rival (Gloria Reuben) while reclaiming Princetons place at the top of the U.S. News & World Report rankings. But just as her smug English-professor boyfriend (Michael Sheen) dumps her for an aggressive Virginia Woolf scholar (Sonya Walger), a fellow Dartmouth alum (Paul Rudd) comes along with an unusual student (Nat Wolff) he wants Portia to consider. How could anyone make light of the brutal, capricious system by which our young people are judged and sorted? A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this comedy from Paul Weitz, adapted from the novel by Jean Hanff Korelitz. I must confess that I dont know whether to be relieved or disappointed that Admission, which had the potential to be a sharp, satirical jab at the soft belly of middle-class anxiety, chose instead to be a warm and wacky fable of wish fulfillment.

title: The Americans Recap: Tire Fire
description: Season 3, Episode 8: Divestment

title: SXSW Music 2015: An Empire Writer Tries to Make His Way in the Real-World Music Business
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  As scruffy, if striving, bands descended here for the annual South by Southwest Music conference on Wednesday, a twisted fairy-tale version of the music business was playing out simultaneously on the season finale of Empire, the hit TV show on Fox.

title: Hampton Hopes for Divine Intervention Against Kentucky
description: DAYTON, Ohio  As a reward for beating Manhattan, 74-64, here on Tuesday night, Hampton will play undefeated Kentucky, the top overall seed in the N.C.A.A. Division I tournament, on Thursday night in Louisville.

title: Harvard Looks to Surprise North Carolina
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  The fight song Ten Thousand Men of Harvard blared across the court, setting a collegiate mood as the Harvard Crimson began a crisp and vocal practice Wednesday.

title: Northeasterns Turnaround Leads to Tournament
description: PITTSBURGH  Walking to class at Northeastern on Tuesday, Quincy Ford faced a barrage of high-fives. The Huskies had not reached the N.C.A.A. tournament in 24 years, but their campus knew how to react.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Just because we removed the word patient from the statement doesnt mean were going to be impatient.

title: Corrections: March 19, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: In Japan, a Farmhouse Becomes a Journalists Elegy
description: In late 2007 I read Minka: My Farmhouse in Japan, a memoir by the retired Associated Press foreign correspondent John Roderick. Its story began 40 years earlier, when Mr. Roderick became the unlikely owner of an enormous rundown farmhouse, or minka.

title: An A.C.C. Breakthrough for Notre Dame
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  From 1997 to 2011, Duke and North Carolina combined to win 14 of 15 Atlantic Coast Conference tournament championships in mens basketball. It was their league  good luck to any team that wanted a piece of it.

title: Behind Texas Southern, a Lowly Conference Rides High
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Among the few constants in college basketball is the Southwestern Athletic Conferences position at the bottom. The conference, consisting of historically black colleges, is perennially the lowest-rated league in the country.
