Of the 351 teams ranked in the Basketball Power Index, only one SWAC team is higher than No. 261.

title: V.C.U. Seeks Another Run Without the Shock
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Shaka Smart will not fill out your tournament bracket, but four years after leading Virginia Commonwealth to the Final Four, he had some thoughts on what it takes to be the next small-name basketball program to last deep into March.

title: Underground Wrestling in Moscow
description: In America, World Wrestling Entertainment spectacles draw countless fans, easily sell out stadiums and cost as much as $60 just to watch costumed celebrities grapple on television. But in Russia, professional wrestlers pound mats in dingy Moscow basements, small clubs or any other place willing to look the other way for cash.

title: Poll on Health Care Law Shows Increased Support
description: WASHINGTON  The gap between Americans who view the Affordable Care Act favorably and those who do not is smaller now than at any time since the fall of 2012, a year before the laws disastrous rollout, according to a monthly poll that has tracked attitudes about the polarizing law since President Obama signed it five years ago.

title: Unions and Wages
description: To the Editor:

title: Job Hunting With a Criminal Record
description: There is no dispute that far too many Americans carry the burden of a criminal record  at least 70 million, by recent estimates  or that the easy accessibility of these records in the information age imposes debilitating obstacles, especially when it comes to finding a job.

title: Oh, No! Its a New Senate Low!
description: The United States Senate is worse than ever.

title: Abetting Egypts Dictatorship
description: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt was full of swagger as he was the host to entrepreneurs and senior diplomats in Sharm el Sheikh for an investors conference last weekend. The event at the Red Sea resort town was meant to show that the Arab worlds most populous country had shaken off the turmoil of the 2011 popular uprising that briefly put Egypt on a path toward democratic reform. Postrevolutionary Egypt is open for business, Egyptian officials announced proudly.

title: Turkeys Challenge
description: To the Editor:

title: Americas Freight Railroads Are Investing in Safety
description: To the Editor:

title: Deadliest Country for Kids
description: LUBANGO, Angola  This is a country laden with oil, diamonds, Porsche-driving millionaires and toddlers starving to death. New Unicef figures show this well-off but corrupt African nation is ranked No. 1 in the world in the rate at which children die before the age of five.

title: More Emojis? No Thanks
description: To the Editor:

title: An Ancient Civics Lesson
description: ANCIENT Greek and Roman politics rested on a conundrum. Lest they undermine social peace, the poor could not routinely threaten the lives or property of the rich. But unless the laws were fair enough to the poor, why should the plebs respect them?

title: Cervantes and the Purpose of Literary Idolatry
description: Investigators in Madrid say they have found bones that probably include those of Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra, better known as Cervantes, the creator of Don Quixote. That the discovery should come just in time for the 400th anniversary of the writers death helps explain what otherwise might have seemed a quest better suited for the knight-errant of La Mancha.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Deep Wounds and Lingering Questions After Israels Bitter Race
description: The questions below refer to the following Times articles reporting on Tuesdays Israeli election: Deep Wounds and Lingering Questions After Israels Bitter Race, Breakaway Party Leader Stays Mum on Where Hell Throw Support After Israeli Elections and Voters in Nazareth Cheer Gains by Arab Alliance.

title: Japans Recovery Is Complicated by a Decline in Household Savings
description: TOKYO  Takazumi Fukuoka should be exactly what Japan needs to get its economy moving again.

title: Nancy Dubuc | The Necessity of Failure
description: Nancy Dubuc, chief executive of A&E Networks, has made her mark on cable television by taking big risks. But for every success, Ms. Dubuc says, she has learned from important failures.

title: Test Yourself | The Rise of Empire
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 17 article, Empire, the Meteor That Never Fell to Earth.

title: Nancy Dubuc of A&E: Mixing Doers, Thinkers and Feelers
description: This interview with Nancy Dubuc, the chief executive of A&E Networks, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Whistle for N.C.A.A. Tournament Is Instrumental to the Game
description: Susan Mueller, a flutist and the chairwoman of the Nevada-Las Vegas music department, examined the referees whistle in her hand. She closed her office door after warning those outside that she was about to make a loud noise. She put the whistle to her lips and blew.

title: Lisa DAmour Juggles Airline Highway and Milton, a Tale of Five Towns
description: Lisa DAmour could not resist the Wobble. Its a dance anthem set to Southern rap, made Internet-famous by a sure-footed New Orleans detective during a Mardi Gras parade last year. When Ms. DAmour set out to write a play about New Orleans, her beloved hometown, she knew the Wobble would have to figure in. So a few weeks ago, she had it blasting in a rehearsal room, her big cast two-stepping along.

title: How Good Are You at Coming Up With Witty Comebacks?
description: Many of us have dreamed of delivering the perfect comeback at the right moment. Yet all too often we dont think of anything good to say until minutes  or even hours  later.

title: Chechens Ties to Putin Are Questioned Amid Nemtsov Murder Case
description: GROZNY, Russia  Ramzan A. Kadyrov, the strongman leader of Chechnya, has been at the center of intrigue surrounding the murder of Boris Y. Nemtsov, a prominent critic of the Russian president, Vladimir V. Putin. So before a busy weekend that included a night out with the boys to watch cage fighting, Mr. Kadyrov wanted to clear something up. I am utterly devoted to Vladimir Putin and ready until the end of my life to resist the enemies of Russia, he wrote on Instagram.

title: As China Prospers, the Military Recruiters Job Gets Harder
description: Who could possibly bemoan rising prosperity, greater economic freedom, a declining birthrate and increasing university enrollment?

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get the Morning Briefing in your inbox first thing? Sign up.)

title: Militants, ISIS Included, ClaimTunisia Museum Attack
description: CAIRO  The Islamic State and other extremists on Thursday sought to claim responsibility for the deadly attack that killed at least 21 people at the National Bardo Museum in Tunis. The authorities there arrested at least nine people suspected of being accomplices as major cruise lines indefinitely suspended stops in Tunisia, a sign of the looming toll on the crucial tourist industry.

title: Philips to Spin Off Lighting Business in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Philips, the Dutch electronics giant, said on Thursday that it planned to spin off its lighting business through an initial public offering next year.

title: New York Today: The Man Who Loved Port Authority
description: Good morning on this winterish Thursday.

title: Obama Orders Cuts in Federal Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama signed an executive order on Thursday to set new goals for reducing the greenhouse gas emissions of federal agencies, his latest use of his executive authority to address the root causes of climate change and press private companies and foreign governments to follow suit.

title: Secret Service Chief Rebuts Car Crash Reports
description: WASHINGTON  The head of the Secret Service told lawmakers on Thursday that news accounts of two agents crashing a car into a White House barricade this month were overblown and exaggerated.

title: Battle for Aden Airport Stokes Fears of Wider Conflict in Yemen
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  In a major escalation of Yemens civil conflict, rival factions in the southern city of Aden fought for control of the international airport and a security base, leaving at least three people dead, according to Yemeni officials.

title: Auto Trader Group Is Valued at $3.5 Billion in London I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Auto Trader Group, the British website for buying and selling used cars, said on Thursday that it had priced its initial public offering, valuing the company at 2.35 billion pounds, or about $3.5 billion.

title: Ayaan Hirsi Ali: By the Book
description: The author of Infidel,Nomad and, most recently, Heretic read a lot of romance novels and Jackie Collins growing up: We didnt discriminate between good and bad. It is now difficult to imagine that we had so few books.

title: Indonesia Postpones Drug-Case Executions Amid Legal Challenges
description: JAKARTA  An Indonesian court on Thursday postponed a hearing for two Australians facing execution for smuggling heroin, as government officials said it could take months to resolve legal appeals by the men and several other people sentenced to die for drug crimes.

title: Throwback Thursday | The Space Race
Today in Politics: Hillary Clinton Looks to Secure Labor Support
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington, where royalty will be paying a rare visit to the White House. Congress remains logjammed in many respects, but a warm moment between Senator Harry Reid of Nevada and Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky showed the Senates softer side. Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is facing a backlash from conservatives over the handling of one of his aides, while two other would-be presidential front-runners are moving ahead with their pre-campaign machinations.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Nardwuar the Human Serviette
description: My favorite journalist is a shrieking British Columbian who dresses like an exploded 1970s Soviet golf catalog. He was born John Ruskin, but changed his name to Nardwuar the Human Serviette. (Serviette is Canadian for napkin.) He hosts a weekly radio show on CiTR Vancouver, 101.9 FM, but his best work is done on camera, in chaotic interviews with musicians that he posts on YouTube.

title: The Brains Empathy Gap
description: Nyiregyhaza (pronounced NEAR-re-cha-za) is a medium-size city tucked into the northeastern corner of Hungary, about 60 miles from the Ukrainian border. It has a world-class zoo, several museums and universities and a new Lego Factory. It also has two Roma settlements, or Gypsy ghettos. The larger of these settlements is Gusev, a crumbling 19th-century military barracks separated from the city proper by a railway station and a partly defunct industrial zone. Gusev is home to more than 1,000 Roma. Its chief amenities include a small grocery store and a playground equipped with a lone seesaw and a swingless swing set. Theres also a freshly painted elementary school, where approximately 60 students are currently enrolled. Almost all those students are Roma and almost all of them live in Gusev.

title: Raising Teenagers: The Mother of All Problems
description: My daughter complains that she cant sleep. Sometimes I pass her room at 11 oclock, at midnight, and see the light still on under the door. Inevitably, if I go in, I find her propped up in bed with her laptop, the blue haze from the screen on her face.

title: Fergusons Other Shooter
description: Last Wednesday night when two police officers were shot in front of the Police Headquarters in Ferguson, Mo., Heather De Mian was on the sidewalk across the street. The headquarters has been the site of regular demonstrations since Michael Brown, 18, was killed by a Ferguson police officer, Darren Wilson, last August. Protesters had gathered to celebrate the resignation of Fergusons police chief after a Department of Justice report detailed systematic bias against black residents by his officers, and De Mian was broadcasting live video of the rally to the Internet from her cellphone.

title: The Scrutiny Phase: Hillary Clintons Negativity Challenge
description: Sometimes, no news really is good news  or at least its the best news you can expect. This is especially true when you are being publicly scrutinized by a keen group of observers. Such is the dilemma of Hillary Clinton, who  before her email woes began  was being criticized for not saying enough about what shes been up to and then for saying too much. The criticism has only intensified.

title: Identity Crisis
In Berkeleys Warehouses, Foodies Find a New Home
description: West Berkeleys warehouse district has long been known for high-end lumberyards, tile shops and other stores serving creative homeowners, a kind of D.I.Y. answer to the upscale showrooms of San Franciscos Design District. Recently, the areas large, relatively affordable spaces have begun attracting a different creative crowd: innovative culinary entrepreneurs looking to spread their wings. Even some big boys are jumping in. Last June, the Bay Area-based specialty chocolatier TCHO moved its headquarters to a 49,000-square-foot facility here. This new wave of good food purveyors is making the neighborhood a draw for foodies as well as design lovers.

title: How I Buy Weed
description: His place is in one of those New York City neighborhoods thats run-down but not dangerous. Theres no intercom in the building, so to open the downstairs door, you have to have your own key. He doesnt take phone calls on either landline or cell. He doesnt use the Internet. He stays off the grid.

title: Stop Playing the Race Card Card
description: So, Starbucks chief executive, Howard Schultz, wants us to serve the country coffee and a race dialogue.

title: Testing a Few Good Women for Combat
description: This month, the Marine Corps began a historic experiment at its base in Twentynine Palms, Calif., to test womens performance in combat arms. This Ground Combat Element Integrated Task Force uses high-tech tools to measure the physical performance of both men and women after a federal mandate to integrate women into all military occupational specialties  or request an exception  by January 2016. This differs from the past two decades, in which combat performance has only been measured in large-scale desert exercises. As a former Marine who was encouraged by the camaraderie of gender-integrated training, I look forward to this studys promise to increase force readiness in a corps that is not quite 7 percent female.

title: Morning Agenda: Jana Partners Sells Stake
description: JANA PARTNERS SELLS STAKE | Dyal Capital Partners, the private equity unit of Neuberger Berman Group, agreed on Wednesday to buy a 20 percent stake in the activist hedge fund Jana Partners, Alexandra Stevenson writes in DealBook. The stake will be passive, meaning Dyal will not have a say in Jana Partners day-to-day operations.

title: N.C.A.A. Tournament 2015 Live Blog
Paying for Workers' Training
China Issues New Guidelines to Reduce Logging
description: China will reduce logging on planted forests and eventually end logging on natural forests, under a plan published this week by the State Council, Chinas cabinet.

title: Karole Armitages New Dance Work Traces Steps for a Greener Path
description: It takes a committed bunhead to spend eight hours hiking over a mountain with a 13,000-foot peak just to get to ballet class. It also requires one devoted to nature. Karole Armitage is both. As a child, she spent summers at Rocky Mountain Biological Laboratory in Gothic, Colo., a former ghost town from the silver mining period where her father, a biologist, did research.

title: GoDaddy Sets Price Range for I.P.O.
description: GoDaddy, the Internet services provider known for its provocative television commercials, said on Thursday that it planned to sell shares in its initial public offering priced between $17 and $19 a share.

title: Introducing the N.C.A.A. Bracket Comparison Table
description: If youre playing our risk-adjusted N.C.A.A. bracket game, you still have a precious few hours before the games begin to find the best bargains on upsets you think others have overlooked.

title: Daily Report: Suddenly, Lots of Streaming Options for Cord Cutters
description: Television fans who want to break free from a traditional TV subscription now have more options than ever to pay for what they want to watch, and how they want to watch it, Emily Steel reports.

title: Neighbors Help Chase an Ex-Boyfriend
description: Dear Diary:

title: Wanted: Manhattan Roommates and Space to Entertain
description: Gillian Morris disliked her living situation. She paid almost $1,000 a month for a storage locker and a crash pad in Brooklyn with two roommates, many roaches and a tedious commute to Manhattan. Almost as bad, the place was so small it was difficult to entertain guests there.

title: 2 Associates of Ex-Security Chief to Face Trial Over Bribery in China
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese Communist Partys push to extinguish the political network of a man who was once one of its most powerful officials entered a new phase on Thursday when the government announced that two of his associates would soon face trial on charges of bribery.

title: What Not to Worry About in Teaching Young Children to Read
description: The importance of reading to children from birth. Kindergarten readiness. The various approaches to teaching reading. All of those issues have been much in the news of late (and theyre never far from the minds of parents of young children), so my Parent-Teacher Conference email folder is full of questions about early literacy. Fortunately, Daniel T. Willinghams new book, Raising Kids Who Read, was published this month, and it addresses every single one of them.

title: Block by Block | Union Square
description: Union Square is centrally located, conveniently reached by public transportation and its park is bustling seven days a week.

title: Block by Block: Union Square (Video Series)
description: Union Square is the focus of the next video in our new monthly series, Block by Block. Watch for future installments from neighborhoods around the city.

title: Iran Nuclear Talks Lag, With Status of New Centrifuges Another Hurdle
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  A dispute over what limits should be placed on the development of new types of centrifuges has emerged as a major obstacle as negotiators try to work out an initial accord on Irans nuclear program, Western officials said on Thursday.

title: United Nations Investigators Accuse ISIS of Genocide Over Attacks on Yazidis
description: GENEVA  United Nations human rights investigators on Thursday leveled accusations of genocide and war crimes at the Islamic State, citing evidence that the extremist groups fighters had sought to wipe out the Yazidi minority in Iraq.

title: Raising Teenagers: Inevitably a Problem?
description: Rachel Cusk is a chronicler of rich, if sometimes bleak, inner lives  sometimes her own, but more often those of her fictional characters. Now, in Raising Teenagers: The Mother of All Problems for The New York Times Magazine, she describes her experience of watching her children evolve into people with rich inner lives of their own. These are not the inner lives of children, into which adults are sometimes welcomed, but the inner lives of teenagers, eternal protagonists in a continuing war against the old  a group that she has, in their eyes, joined.

title: The Next Frontier: The Great Indoors
description: In 1962, the ecologist Robert Whitaker set out to categorize the different realms of life on Earth. Some were deserts, others tundra, still others tropical forests. He coined a word for these inhabited environments, one that scientists have used ever since: biomes.

title: David Brandon Geeting Finds Irreverence in the Everyday
description: The photographers new monograph, Infinite Power, collects his joyful, surreal contemporary depictions of the mundane.

title: In Netanyahus Next Knesset, a More Compatible Coalition
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his Likud party achieved a surprisingly strong victory in Tuesdays election. Now, he is likely to build a right-wing coalition of 67 of the 120 members of the Knesset, Israels Parliament.

title: Lincoln and the Jews Explores Bonds With a Nations Growing Minority
description: ON Sept. 20, 1862, Abraham Lincoln had a lot on his mind. The Civil War was raging, and just days later he would issue the preliminary draft of the Emancipation Proclamation.

title: Rubio Ally to Lead Super PAC Backing His Candidacy
description: As Senator Marco Rubio, Republican of Florida, and his advisers prepare for an all-but-certain presidential run, they will have a close ally managing the super PAC supporting his candidacy.

title: Well Book Club: Better Than Before
description: Every day of your life is shaped by your habits. Are you a morning or evening person? Messy or tidy? Do you eat breakfast or skip it? Drive or commute? Pack a lunch or dine out? Exercise or watch television?

title: Day 2 of Live March Madness Coverage Begins
description: Were back for another full day of N.C.A.A. mens tournament games. The New York Times has reporters fanned out across the country for comprehensive coverage.

title: 1940: Chamberlain Says No Peace
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain dropped a large lump of salt today [March 19] on all palaver about a peace offensive, which is emanating from the Continent in the wake of yesterdays Alpine rendezvous of Benito Mussolini and Adolf Hitler.

title: Haldi
description: The cooking of Kolkata in Curry Hill

title: In Curry Hill, a New Kid on the Block
description: On the menu it is called an egg roll, but what arrives looks more like an elongated turnover, with squared-off ends as sharp as hospital corners. The crepelike wrap is crisp but doesnt crackle, so that all the attention goes to the interior: lamb minced fine but still juicy and shot through with just enough chile to warm, not scar you.

title: New Chairman for El Museo del Barrio
description: El Museo del Barrio, the oldest museum in the United States devoted to Latino art, is appointing a new boardchairman. It said Michael J. Garcia, a former United States attorney who has served on the board since 2010, will succeed Tony Bechara, who is stepping down after leading the museums board for 15 years.

title: Japan and China Inch Toward Mending Ties
description: TOKYO  In a small step toward a possible thaw in relations, officials from Japan and China on Thursday held their first meeting on security issues in four years, discussing the creation of a hotline to ease tensions in the East China Sea.

title: Kasich Looks to Republican Primaries, Ohio Story in Hand
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Gov. John R. Kasich was sipping coffee in the sun-drenched garden room of his official residence, boasting about his Ohio story of economic recovery, when he was told that some Republicans thought a fellow Midwestern governor, Scott Walker of Wisconsin, was more conservative. He bolted upright.

title: The Politics of Tweets, Candor and Corn in Iowa
description: Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walkers intense focus on the Iowa caucus as his launching pad for the White House has been severely jolted by mocking comments about the states ballyhooed political process and iconic corn crop  observations rather proudly made by Liz Mair, a respected campaign advisor who was hired this week but then driven to resign a day later.

title: Jeb Bush Meets Ludacris
description: Jeb Bush was in Georgia on Thursday, speaking to state lawmakers about education. But before delivering his remarks, Mr. Bush met the rapper Ludacris, who was being honored by the Legislature for his work with the Ludacris Foundation.

title: A British Proposal to Help Control Bankruptcy Costs
description: Beginning next October, corporate reorganization professionals in Britain are going to have do something quite amazing: At the start of a case, they are going to have to estimate what their total fees will be. And if they exceed that amount, they will have to go back to the creditors and obtain further approval.

title: A Kentucky Team and Its Star Seek Their Own Fame
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich.  The top-ranked, undefeated team from Kentucky arrived at the Final Four, wearing familiar blue and white, but the charter was a bus, not a plane. The trip took nine hours with a stop at Arbys and a gym for practice. The team hotel is not five-star plush but Holiday Inn utility.

title: True West
description: The purist Mark Haddawy would no sooner tweak a Haston gown than alter a great 70s house. Even one he lives in.

title: Boehner Says Aaron Schocks Resignation Stunned Him
description: Speaker John A. Boehner tends to have a good feel for his caucus, but he acknowledged on Thursday that he was surprised by the abrupt resignation this week of Representative Aaron Schock of Illinois, who had faced questions over his adherence to spending rules.

title: $10 Million Settlement in Target Data Breach Gets Preliminary Approval
description: A federal judge on Thursday gave preliminary approval to a $10 million settlement of a lawsuit brought by customers of Target, which experienced an online attack involving confidential customer data during the holiday season in 2013.

title: Small Dreams and Long Odds on N.C.A.A. Tournaments First Day
description: Shortly after Hampton University defeated Manhattan on Tuesday night in the first game of the N.C.A.A. tournament, Hamptons president, Bill Harvey, was on the phone, more proud than excited.

title: Survivor Recounts Tunisian Museum Attack
description: An Italian survivor of a deadly attack on Wednesday recounted the ordeal from her hospital bed in Tunis.

title: Advice on Being Left Out of Family Photos
description: When I met my boyfriend, his aunt instituted a rule that girlfriends and boyfriends not be included in family portraits until the couples are engaged. Eighteen years later, we are still together, but have decided not to marry. His aunt apologized to me ages ago. But my boyfriends brother still insists that I not be included in family photos. My boyfriend stood up to him, and this brother is no longer welcome in our home. But when we attend family functions, he acts friendly to me. How should I handle this?

title: Israels Netanyahu Reopens Door to Palestinian State, but White House Is Unimpressed
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Thursday tried to backtrack from his pre-election declaration that no Palestinian state would be established on his watch, but his new assertions appeared to do nothing to assuage an infuriated Obama administration.

title: Classical Playlist: Tchaikovsky, Handel, John Adams and More
description: TCHAIKOVSKY: IolantaAnna Netrebko, Sergey Skorokhodov, Alexey Markov and other singers; Slovenian Philharmonic Orchestra, Emmanuel Villaume, conductor(Deutsche Grammophon 479 3969; two CDs)Just in time for the Metropolitan Operas new production of Tchaikovskys final opera, Iolanta, Deutsche Grammophon has released a winning live 2012 recording from the Philharmonie Essen in Germany featuring Anna Netrebko, the star of the Mets production, in the title role. This tender, rich one-act fairy-tale opera tells of a young princess who has been raised by her overprotective father so that she does not realize she is blind, though something about her constricted world seems off to her. Ms. Netrebko brings an engrossing combination of aching vulnerability and vocal charisma to Iolanta. The whole cast is excellent. Best of all may be the glowing, warm playing that the conductor Emmanuel Villaume draws from the Slovenian Philharmonic Orchestra. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: On Location | London
description: A newly renovated London apartment is reminiscent of the Spring Street loft the owner had lived in during the 1980s.

title: Powerful Afghan Police Chief Killed in Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Matiullah Khan, whose rise from local militia commander to powerful regional police chief left him one of the wealthiest and most powerful men in southern Afghanistan, was killed on Wednesday in a targeted suicide bombing in Kabul, officials said on Thursday.

title: Hands-On Law School
description: The University of New Hampshire School of Law offers second- and third-year students the opportunity to serve a legal residency, a kind of apprenticeship that lets them participate in legal activities under supervision. Those who pass a review of their work can skip the bar exam.

title: Bar Exam, the Standard to Become a Lawyer, Comes Under Fire
description: For decades, law school graduates have endured a stressful rite of passage, spending the first 10 weeks after classes end taking cram courses in the arcane details of the law before sitting down for the grueling, days-long bar exam. Those who do not pass cannot practice law, at least in nearly all the states and the District of Columbia that consider the exam the professional standard.

title: SXSW 2015: Films That Were the Talk of the Festival
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  From intimate indies to blockbuster debuts, this years South by Southwest film festival was again a place for discoveries.

title: At Corison Winery, the Focus on Napa Cabernet Never Blurs
description: Napa Valley is not known for its reserve, subtlety and understatement. Flamboyance, yes, as well as grandiosity, weight, excess and the wines that epitomize these traits. Yet before Napa wineries began to take architectural cues from Las Vegas, the Valley was largely a quiet agricultural center that let its wines speak for themselves.

title: Empire Finale Draws Season-High Viewership
description: After last weeks episode of Empire, a Fox teaser warned viewers: Dont miss the two-hour finale, or youll almost certainly risk being spoiled.

title: Japanese Police Arrest Man Accused of Threatening to Bomb U.S. Embassy and Base
description: TOKYO  The Japanese police said on Thursday that they had arrested a 52-year-old man on suspicion of threatening to bomb the United States Embassy in Tokyo and an American military base on Okinawa.

title: Review: In Hierba Mala Nunca Muere, Castro Rails Against Change
description: The old bird is understandably confused. When he was a boy, Havana was sometimes called the Paris of the Caribbean. He thought he had put an end to that capitalist decadence, but now that hes in his late 80s, some guy is suddenly trying to open Cuba back up again. And the guy is black.

title: Frank Kaminsky Leads the Wisconsin Badgers
description: The teams top scorer, rebounder and playmaker is a 7-footer who developed himself from a gawky teenager to a national player of the year candidate.

title: Senior Banker Predicts Robust Deal-Making Will Continue
description: NEW ORLEANS  If the opening comments from one of the senior deal makers at the Tulane Corporate Law Institute here are to be believed, the good times for mergers and acquisitions will continue to roll.

title: Curtain Call | Womens Fall 2015
description: To mark the conclusion of the Womens Fall 2015 shows, T catalogs the bows of some fashion visionaries.

title: My Choice, My Voice: Lauren
description: tk

title: Karly Kochs Voicing My Choices
description: tk

title: Fatal Attraction
description: Images from two exhibitions of works by the artist Piotr Uklanski.

title: Review: In Fatal Attraction, Piotr Uklanskis Unblinking Gaze
description: As bad-boy artists go, Piotr Uklanski has always been fairly elusive. During his 20-year career he has tended to do something startling  if not shocking  and then lie low, reappearing after a decent interval. And when he does, he is often somewhere else entirely, doing something unlike anything hes done before.

title: Scientists Solve a Puzzle: Cosmic Dust Comes From Supernovae
description: Cosmic dust containing elements like iron, carbon or oxygen plays an important role in the formation of planets and stars. But early galaxies consisted only of gas, and the dust appeared later. Where the dust came from has long been a mystery.

title: The First Signs of Spring
description: Plants in bloom and Mister Softee trucks straining at the leash mean spring is around the corner.

title: Loosening a Founders Iron Grip
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: A Jewelry Journey Through Rome
description: Adventures in Art, a New York City company specializing in art and jewelry excursions, has a new getaway to Rome highlighting the citys jewelry traditions: Rome: From Etruscan Gold to Bulgari Gems, a three-night trip from June 4 to 7.

title: Russell Simmons Plans Musical on Early Days of Hip-Hop
description: The pioneering rap impresario Russell Simmons is aiming to bring a hip-hop revue to Broadway late next year. The musical, currently titled The Scenario, will feature renditions of classics from the 1980s and 90s.

title: S.E.C. Chief Sees Virtue in Activist Investors
description: NEW ORLEANS  For several years, much of the debate at the big deal maker conference here has been whether shareholder activism is a blight on the corporate landscape.

title: FIFA Confirms Winter World Cup for 2022
description: FIFA confirmed that the 2022 World Cup in Qatar would be played in the winter, announcing Thursday that its governing executive committee had set the date of that years final for Dec. 18.

title: Wisconsins Frank Kaminsky Takes Pride in Growing Up
description: LISLE, Ill.  A faded school crest overlooks the A-frame Catholic school gymnasium where exposed metallic heating ducts and off-white bricks run the length of the basketball floor below.

title: Syracuses Jim Boeheim Says Penalties Are Unduly Harsh
description: In his first news conference since the N.C.A.A. penalized his program on March 6, Jim Boeheim, the mens basketball coach at Syracuse, took responsibility for some of the transgressions revealed in a 94-page N.C.A.A. report, but he also lashed out at the penalties, which he called unduly harsh.

title: Will Republicans Still Support a Two-State Solution Even if Netanyahu Doesnt?
description: For the last decade and a half, Democratic and Republican politicians have, at least officially, agreed on the broad contours of what an end to the decades-long, on-again-off-again peace process in Israel and the Palestinian territories should look like. The two-state solution, as its called, was formally endorsed by George W. Bush early in his presidency and was formally agreed to by Israeli, Palestinian and American officials in 2007. Even the Republican Party platform declares, We envision two democratic states  Israel with Jerusalem as its capital and Palestine  living in peace and security.

title: Restoration Politics
description: The Continental chic of Camelot in the 60s, the gilded splendor of the Reagan-era 80s  but what about a new take on the unique charms of Gerald and Betty Fords 70s Southern California dreaming?

title: Dante de Blasio, Mayors Fast-Talking Son, Is a State Debate Champion
description: In a classroom in Lower Manhattan, two pairs of debaters fired off a rapid rat-tat-tat-tat-tat of ideas, battling it out before a panel of judges for the mantle of state champion in varsity policy debate.

title: Ex-Trader Sentenced to 19 Months for Insider Trading in London
description: LONDON  Julian Rifat, a former trader arrested nearly five years ago in what was then described as the largest crackdown on insider trading here, was sentenced to more than a year in prison on Thursday after he pleaded guilty in November to insider trading.

title: A Look at Revolution
description: The Singapore-based watch magazine, which has the largest print circulation in the world, says it has to keep advancing on the digital front, too.

title: Recipe Lab: Roast Lamb
description: Julia Moskin roasts lamb slathered in a mixture of butter, anchovies, rosemary and garlic.

title: The Designers of Fall/Winter 2015 Fashion Week Take Their Bows
description: Designers project their personalities not only through their collections but also in their appearances at the end of their runway shows. To mark the conclusion of New York, Milan and Paris Fashion Weeks, we catalog the bows  some proud, some playful, some humble, some all of the above  of 31 fashion visionaries.

title: Verbatim: Just Wanna Have Fun
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, speaking in Atlantic City at an event for camp professionals.

title: A Tech Column on Wearable Gadgets Draws Fire as Pseudoscience
description: Nick Bilton writes a tech-related column called Disruptions, but the name might have been changed to Eruptions this week, given the way readers and others reacted.

title: First Draft Focus: The Prince Meets the President
description: President Obama offered Prince Charles a warm greeting at the White House, telling his guest how beloved he and his family are in the United States.

title: Notre Dame Breaks Through, Holding Off Northeastern
description: PITTSBURGH  There is a perception about the Notre Dame mens basketball program, and it is steeped in fact. It is that, come March, come the N.C.A.A. tournament, the Fighting Irish cannot figure out how to win.

title: French Proposal on Models Weights Clashes With Labor Laws, Opponents Say
description: PARIS  Lawmakers on the French Parliaments health committee said Thursday that they had rejected two provisions of an anorexia prevention measure but left open the possibility that an amended version could win approval when the provisions are debated anew by the full National Assembly in early April.

title: Scientists Seek Ban on Method of Editing the Human Genome
description: A group of leading biologists on Thursday called for a worldwide moratorium on use of a new genome-editing technique that would alter human DNA in a way that can be inherited.

title: Lindsey Vonn Wins World Cup Super-G Title to Tie Career Record
description: Lindsey Vonn bought a house last year in her longtime home, Vail, Colo. After moving in, she asked a contractor to build a trophy case above the fireplace for her collection of World Cup crystal globes, the hefty decorative awards given to the winners of season-long ski racing championships.

title: Body of David Bird, Missing Wall Street Journal Reporter, Is Found
description: A body pulled from the Passaic River in New Jersey this week was identified on Thursday as that of a reporter for The Wall Street Journal who disappeared in January 2014 while out walking near his home, officials said.

title: No. 14-Seeded U.A.B. Surges to Stun Iowa State
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Jerod Haases last game as a college player was in Birmingham, Ala., in 1997 in the N.C.A.A. tournaments round of 16. His Kansas team was 34-1, with its only loss having come in double overtime against Missouri, but the Jayhawks were stunned by a nine-loss Arizona team in the tournament, 85-82. Haase knows all about the sting of defeat and the sudden, unexpected packing of bags in March.

title: Letters: The Content of Character
description: The Content of Character

title: Putting a Breakup of Bank of America to a Shareholder Vote
description: The idea of big American banks breaking up will finally get input from the public.

title: Touch Time, for the Blind and Everyone Else
description: LONDON  Serving in Afghanistan, Lt. Bradley Snyder, working in a United States Navy bomb-disposal squad, stepped on an improvised explosive device while trying to aid two victims of another blast. The explosion robbed him of his sight.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Marriage, Memory and Sex
description: Take the Quiz

title: Yankees Pinstripes May Be Slimming, but a Nutritionist Helps
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The most famous player in Yankees history had the most infamous diet. Babe Ruth was said to subsist, at least in part, on hot dogs and beer, the fuel that added to his legendary persona as a charismatic, fun-loving superstar.

title: Objects of Discretion
description: The exceedingly private philanthropist Maja Hoffmann shares fragments of her exquisite personal collection of art and design.

title: Hamilton Off to Hot Start at Broadway Box Office
description: Hamilton, the buzzy musical biography of an American founding father, is off to a strong start at the Broadway box office.

title: SXSW Music 2015: Ancient Songs With a Rocking Beat
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  What may have been the oldest music at SXSW rocked as hard (if not as loudly) as anything newer. It had deep, unstoppable beats, instantly grasped melodies and vocals with a fervent bite. It was a Wednesday night set by Mai Dhai, a singer from rural Pakistan performing ancient songs she learned from her mother. She drummed as she sang, along with two more drummers and a harmonium player whose counter-melodies darted constantly around her voice. Ms. Dhai is a member of the Manganiyar tribe from the Tharparkar desert, with an Islamic culture that has a long tradition of female musicians performing at shrines and festivities.

title: Elon Musk Says Self-Driving Tesla Cars Will Be in the U.S. by Summer
description: For many drivers who commute long distances, the prospect of owning a self-driving car  where a driver takes his hands off the wheel and feet off the gas  has been an elusive dream.

title: The Judges Decision to Keep Garner Evidence Sealed
description: In a 12-page decision, Justice William E. Garnett of State Supreme Court decided against releasing evidence, testimony and instructions presented to the grand jury in the Eric Garner case.

title: Ride in Mercedess F 015 Driverless Car
description: A sneak peek inside the Mercedes F 015 concept car, the companys vision of a driverless future. The design turns the car into a shared social space where any passenger can interact with the vehicle.

title: In Eric Garner Case, Judge Rules Against Releasing Grand Jury Evidence
description: A judge ruled on Thursday against releasing the evidence presented to the grand jury that decided not to indict a New York police officer in the chokehold death of Eric Garner.

title: Video Feature: Inside the F 015, Mercedess Self-Driving Car
description: ALAMEDA, Calif.  AUTONOMOUS car technology is now so far along that some auto executives have said they expect a completely self-driving car  one that requires no human intervention  to appear in public use within five years.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Kumiko
description: David Zellner and Nathan Zellner discuss their film Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter, starring Rinko Kikuchi.

title: Big in Japan, Tokyobike Gets a Permanent New York Home
description: He just wanted to buy a bike. Thats the short answer to the question of how Dean Di Simone, the founder of the New York digital agency Tender Creative, and his wife, the model-slash-marketer Juliana Rudell Di Simone, became the Stateside keepers of Tokyobike, which celebrates the opening of its first permanent shop at the corner of Bowery and Prince tomorrow. Di Simone first became acquainted with the brand on a trip to Tokyo in 2003. Six years later, he tried to buy one of the lightweight, custom-fit bikes at an outpost in Londons Shoreditch neighborhood, but was promptly turned away. At the time, it was frustrating, says Di Simone; company policy held that no customer should assemble his own two-wheeler. (Which, in turn, means no overseas shipments.)

title: Monica Lewinsky Is Back, but This Time Its on Her Terms
description: Monica Lewinsky was sitting in a Manhattan auditorium last month, watching teenage girls perform a play called Slut. Ms. Lewinsky was in blue jeans and a blazer, her hair pulled out of her face with a small clip. She was wiping away tears.

title: Google and Intel to Team Up with TAG Heuer on a Luxury Smartwatch
description: Generation after generation, computers have become smaller, faster and cheaper. If technology companies have their way, they will soon be smaller and astronomically expensive.

title: Walker Reassures S. Carolinians That Raising Money Wont Be a Problem
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Whenever he meets a new room of Republican voters, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin usually starts off by thanking them for their prayers. He did so on Thursday afternoon, during his first swing through South Carolina as a potential presidential candidate  but he also thanked them for their money, and bragged a bit in case anyone doubted his ability to raise funds nationally for a White House bid.

title: FIFA Awards 2019 Womens World Cup to France
description: FIFA awarded the 2019 Womens World Cup to France on Thursday, rewarding a rising power in womens soccer with the chance to win the title on home soil.

title: Spring Is So Close You Can Almost Taste It
description: ITS official. April is no longer the cruelest month. February moves into the top spot. Any nay votes? I thought not. And March has been no bargain, either, up to and including the first day of spring.

title: The Zellner Brothers Narrate a Scene From Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter
description: In this video, Nathan Zellner and David Zellner discuss a sequence from their drama Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter, starring Rinko Kikuchi as a Japanese woman who is obsessed with the movie Fargo and believes the money buried in the film actually exists. She sets out on a quest to the Midwest on a search for it. In this scene, before her departure, she says goodby to her beloved friend, a pet bunny Bunzo.

title: Shows at Q.E.D. in Queens, and a New York Public Library Show on Photography
description: After-school activities at the Misers junior high were a mixed bag. There was that fly-tying class that has never come in handy, for example, but at least it was a chance to try something new.

title: Weekend Entertainments From the Archives of The New York Times
description: 77 YEARS AGO

title: Text to Text | Speak and Waking Up to the Enduring Memory of Rape
description: In this Text to Text we feature an excerpt from Speak, a 1999 National Book Award finalist that is regularly taught, and regularly challenged, in schools across the country.

title: Huge Day of N.C.A.A. Upsets, Not to Be Taken Sitting Down
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  The N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament, that annual rite that delivers agony in the form of a bracket, has produced many darlings over the years. The one who emerged from a thrilling opening day Thursday might be the unlikeliest yet.

title: Alfredo Jaar: Shadows
description: This is the second project in a trilogy by Alfredo Jaar exploring the power and politics of famous images. The first installation focused on a 1993 Pulitzer Prize-wining photograph of a starving child in Sudan; here Mr. Jaar has chosen the Dutch photographer Koen Wessings Estel, Nicaragua, September 1978 (1978), which shows two women at the moment they learn their father has been murdered.

title: Junior House-Hunter
description: 15-year-old Max Srulowitz helps hunt for an East Hamptons house.

title: The Importance of Sitting With Patients
description: I had never seen someone so yellow.

title: Betty Parsons: A Life in Art
description: This show has a big title for being fairly small: a total of 19 gouaches and painted-driftwood sculptures by Betty Parsons (1900-1982), the revered New York art dealer, advocate of Abstract Expressionism and an artist in her own right. Five of the pieces were seen in a larger show in 2010 at the recently closed Spanierman Gallery. But that show was the first sizable one in New York devoted to Ms. Parsonss work since the 1980s, and who knows when another will come along.

title: Arizona Shoots Past Texas Southern
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The weight of national championship aspirations did not slow second-seeded Arizona on Thursday, as the Wildcats breezed to a 93-72 victory over No. 15 Texas Southern.

title: Bank of New York Mellon Will Settle Currency Trade Case for $714 Million
description: The Bank of New York Mellon will pay $714 million to settle accusations that it cheated government pension funds and other investors for more than a decade, federal and state authorities announced on Thursday. It is part of a deal requiring the bank to dismiss some employees and make fuller public disclosures of its foreign exchange operation.

title: Vera Iliatova: For Now, at Once
description: In her dreamy paintings of girls in verdant landscapes, Vera Iliatova toys with conventional associations of nature, femininity, childhood and innocence. The foregrounds of her pictures are occupied by lush, colorful floral bouquets; forests, meadows, hills and dales fill the backgrounds. Ms. Iliatova paints these with a deft, brushy touch that gives the surfaces of her canvases a sensuously tactile presence.

title: Bank of New York Mellon's Foreign Exchange Settlement
description: The bank will pay $714 million to settle accusations that it cheated government pension funds and other investors for more than a decade.

title: 1982-92 | An Earlier Durst Run on Page 1
description: David W. Dunlap is a Metro reporter and writes the Building Blocks column. He has worked at The Times for 40 years.

title: Michael Oreskes Leaving Associated Press to Join NPR
description: Michael Oreskes, a former senior editor at The New York Times and The Associated Press, has been appointed senior vice president and editorial director at NPR, the public broadcaster announced on Thursday.

title: Argentine Prosecutor Urges Reopening of Case Against President
description: BUENOS AIRES  An Argentine prosecutor asked an appellate court on Thursday to overturn a judges decision to dismiss allegations filed against President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner and her political supporters by another prosecutor, Alberto Nisman, days before his mysterious death from a gunshot wound to the head.

title: The Porcelain Thief Chronicles a Trip to Unearth Chinese Heirlooms
description: JOURNEY TO UNEARTH A FAMILY TREASURE

title: Pictures of the Day: Belgium and Elsewhere
description: Belgium and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Mike MaccagnanSays Jets Upgraded With Ryan Fitzpatrick
description: Mike Maccagnan, the Jets new general manager, said he believed he upgraded the quarterback position with the newly acquired Ryan Fitzpatrick. Of his willingness to enter training camp with Fitzpatrick vying with Geno Smith for the job, he said, As it stands right now, absolutely.

title: Sothebys to Team Up With Drake
A Site for Sophisticated Family Travelers
description: The growth of niche travel websites meets the explosion of family travel in the introduction of Feather+Flip, a hotel booking site and destination guide aimed at sophisticated parents of under-10-year-olds.

title: Together Always, in Darkness and in Light
description: There is no good way to tell a new guy in your life that youre going blind. I chose the best of lousy options: I broke the news after sex, and I packaged it right.

title: Fears of Greek Debt Default Overshadow European Union Gathering
description: BRUSSELS  A day before nearly $2 billion in debt becomes due for repayment by Greeces nearly bankrupt government, European leaders gathered in Brussels on Thursday for a long-planned summit meeting now overshadowed by the mounting risk of a Greek default and revived fears about the future of Europes common currency.

title: March 19, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Belgium, Switzerland, Greece and South Africa.

title: Carolee Schneemann: Part One
description: Established in 2010 by Hunter College, the Artists Institute is a combination of exhibition gallery, historical laboratory and studio space dedicated to meditating on the work of one contemporary artist at a time for roughly one semester. Artists whove been in the spotlight  or under the microscope  have included Jo Baer, Jimmie Durham, Rosemarie Trockel and Haim Steinbach. Carolee Schneemann is the subject of attention this spring, and a richer one would be hard to find.

title: Remains of 9/11 Victim at World Trade Center Are Identified
description: Matthew David Yarnell, a 26-year-old employee of Fiduciary Trust Company International, has been positively identified as a victim of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attack on the World Trade Center.

title: Review: Paint Your Wagon, Starring Keith Carradine, Opens at Encores!
description: Men in weathered woolens and suspenders roister vigorously around the stage, hungry for booze, gold and women  not necessarily in that order  in the jovial production of Paint Your Wagon being presented as part of the City Center Encores! series. Theres but a single gal in the gold-mining encampment where the show takes place, at least until the end of the first act, when a stagecoach brings a bevy of working (and dancing) girls to town and the boys throw out a lusty cheer.

title: Suzan Frecon: Oil Paintings and Sun
description: Suzan Frecon came to Minimalism late, but she has persisted and her work has a deeper, quieter kind of originality: a sense of unassailable integrity and the fullness of form. Now in her early 70s, Ms. Frecon has for over three decades been homing in on one or two simple shapes seen against one color. Her newest paintings have two panels whose division forms a kind of horizon line, while the shapes themselves imply curved hillocks, small mountains, crystalline ponds, low-hanging clouds and rising or setting suns. Despite the use of Sun in this shows title, her colors, which she grinds and mixes herself, tend toward dark. Rust, blues and greens prevail here with results that seem like nocturnes. They combine Rothkos color at its most winey and most somber with the carefully modulated geometries of Ellsworth Kelly, but are always clearly handmade, painted with a meditative quality that evokes Morandi.

title: Op-Talk: How Domestic Violence Costs Women Money
description: Campaigns to fight domestic violence typically focus on the physical and psychological effects of such violence. Now a new study highlights another area that both public officials and employers need to consider: the impact of domestic violence on survivors finances.

title: Marsha Cottrell at Eleven Rivington
description: Born under another sign, Marsha Cottrell might have been a consumer tester for laser printers rather than an artist. Instead, she has created a body of work that harnesses the power of office equipment, treating it like a paintbrush or master printers tool.

title: Peter Dundas Appointed as Creative Director of Roberto Cavalli
description: The Norwegian-born designer Peter Dundas will be the new creative director of Roberto Cavalli, the company announced today.

title: Free Online Courses Keep Retirees in the Know
description: Mary Lou Russell has a passion for learning. Since retiring 10 years ago, the 79-year-old former grant maker has taken more than a dozen classes on subjects including classical music and appreciating Andy Warhol. She has attended most of her classes from her Manhattan living room.

title: Not Digital Art, but Art Learned Digitally
description: Having worked as an art teacher for 50 years, Lois DeWitt decided to try offering drawing and painting classes online. So in 2008 she established a website  Free Online Art Classes  that now attracts about 15,000 visitors a month from places like Indonesia, Africa and Germany to courses that include instruction in watercolors, oil painting and artful lighting. (Ms. DeWitt also happens to work in the lighting department of a Home Depot store on Sundays.)

title: Managing Student Loan Debt as an Older Adult
description: Continuing your education is a lofty pursuit, but it could become an albatross if you get too deep into student loan debt.

title: Anyone Can Be a Teacher at Skillshare, an Online School
description: Susan Orlean was considering giving up teaching. She had taught courses at New York University and at the Bread Loaf Writers Conference at Middlebury College but was finding it difficult to maintain a consistent class schedule while fulfilling her obligations as a staff writer for The New Yorker.

title: 25 Minutes of Silence in the City of Angels
description: LOS ANGELES  Its early afternoon in the citys Westwood section, a neighborhood known for its youthful U.C.L.A. energy and horrendous traffic. Near the busy intersection of Wilshire and Westwood Boulevards, nearly 200 locals have gathered to tune out the distractions of modern Los Angeles  and tune into themselves.

title: Turning to Education for Fun
description: In a 2013 episode of 60 Minutes, Charlie Rose visits Bill Gatess office to get a sense of where the billionaire philanthropist draws intellectual inspiration. First, Mr. Gates shows Mr. Rose the Codex Leicester, a 500-year-old Leonardo da Vinci manuscript that Mr. Gates bought in 1994 for $30 million.

title: Luring Working Executives to M.B.A. Programs
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Conshohocken Curve, a bend in Interstate 76 west of Philadelphia, is one of those traffic-report designations with a plethora of nightmare rush-hour delays. Through much of the winter, nearby St. Josephs University took advantage of the inevitable delays to place a billboard promoting its executive M.B.A. program along the curve.

title: In the Age of Information, Specializing to Survive
description: Jonathan Haber majored in philosophy at Harvard University. And Yale. And Stanford. He explored Kants The Critique of Pure Reason with an Oxford don and Kierkegaards insights into Subjectivity, Irony and the Crisis of Modernity with a leading light from the University of Copenhagen.

title: More Options for Comics Artists
description: Anyone who remembers the 1970s Tippy the Turtle Draw Me advertisements on matchbooks, in magazines and on television would be amazed how much times have changed. Then, amateur artists would mail their submissions to the Art Instruction Schools in Minneapolis and could begin a correspondence class to learn still life drawing.

title: Obama Calls Netanyahu to Offer Congratulations
description: Like this? Get First Draft delivered to your inbox.

title: A Look at Jauja
description: Images from the film.

title: Review: Jauja, a Desperate Odyssey in the Argentine Desert
description: The films of the Argentine director Lisandro Alonso often feel longer than they are. That isnt a bad thing, necessarily. Too many movies hurtle forward on fast editing and breathless plotting, and too much of life goes by in a blur. The characters in four of Mr. Alonsos features  La Libertad, Los Muertos, Liverpool and now Jauja  undertake difficult journeys, at least partly on foot, across hostile terrain. Following them through long takes and static shots accompanied by abundant silence and sparse dialogue and music, the viewer feels the weight of time. This can be uncomfortable, but the risk of tedium can deliver a special kind of intensity, a slowing of the metabolism and an awakening of the senses.

title: Butler Wins Few Style Points but Defeats Texas
description: PITTSBURGH  If their game on Thursday were a Dr. Seuss book, Butler and Texas would have taken shots in a house; they would have taken shots with a mouse. They would have shot from here or there; they would have shot from anywhere.

title: Obama Hosts Prince Charles
description: President Obama met with Prince Charles at the White House and told him that the American people like the British royal family more than their own politicians.

title: Review: Yuja Wang and the London Symphony Get Jazzy
description: You might know that Yuja Wang is one of the best young pianists around. Youve probably heard something about her fashion sense. Well, I can report that shes a natural page turner, too.

title: Sphinx Organizations Aaron P. Dworkin Will Go to University of Michigan
description: Since the violinist Aaron P. Dworkin founded the Sphinx Organization nearly two decades ago to encourage diversity in the stubbornly homogeneous field of classical music, he has held competitions and tours to showcase young black and Latino musicians, started educational programs and urged conservatories and orchestras to be more inclusive.

title: Review: Jill Alexander Essbaums Hausfrau, a Good Wife, With a Few Caveats
description: Have you heard the one about the only time a Swiss train runs late? Punch line: When someone jumps in front of one. That bit appears on the second page of Jill Alexander Essbaums Hausfrau, and I wish it were supposed to be funny only when considering what she really intends. Ms. Essbaum has named her married, dissatisfied heroine Anna, as in Karenina. So the train reference qualifies as an earnest literary allusion. And like all the rib-elbowing indications that this Anna has destructive traits, from promiscuity to pyromania, it qualifies as one of this graceless books ideas of foreshadowing. Big time.

title: Victor Moscoso, Psychedelic Drawings, 1967-1982
description: Andrew Edlin Gallery

title: When You Must Take Money Out of Your I.R.A. or 401(k)
description: The 15th isnt the only significant tax deadline in April.

title: Arab Alliance in Israeli Legislature Sees Unity as Vehicle for Progress
description: JERUSALEM  Leaders of Israels newly united, newly empowered Arab political faction have some demands:

title: Takahiro Iwasaki, In Focus
description: Asia Society

title: Public Pension Cuts Exempt Police and Firefighters
description: In recent weeks, Gov. Bruce Rauner of Illinois has traveled the state promoting his proposal for more than $2 billion in cuts to pensions for public employees. All public employees, that is, except police officers and firefighters.

title: Review: Bloodline, on Netflix, Depicts a Family With Nasty Secrets
description: At first glance, Bloodline looks ominously like a poignant family drama: Members of a close-knit Southern clan gather at a gracious seaside retreat to celebrate their formidable but aging patriarch. There are anniversary cookouts and multigenerational beach volleyball, and it looks awful.

title: Review: In The Gunman, Sean Penn Plays a Remorseful Sniper on the Run
description: Its not a hard and fast rule, but in general when the main character, sometime in the third act, says, I did some bad things ...  and stares off into the middle distance, the implied end of the sentence is including this movie. I take no particular pleasure in reporting that this is the case in The Gunman, a globe-trotting action thriller and also, in passing, a melodrama of male sexual jealousy, an indictment of Western meddling in Africa and a concussion-awareness public service announcement.

title: Review: Richard Estes: Painting New York City Features Works in Abstract Realism
description: Painting used to be as much a craft as an art. That began to change in the late 19th and early 20th centuries as artists like van Gogh, Picasso and countless others shifted the focus from technical virtuosity to the expression of individual sensibility and intellect. Bravura skills with the brush, like those of Bouguereau and other academicians, became anathema for the early Modernists.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, March 22 to 28, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: In Congress, a Double Standard for Email
description: Members of Congress who accuse Hillary Clinton of failing to properly preserve her government emails are largely free themselves from any requirement to keep their own emails and records open for posterity and official inquiry.

title: 'The Divergent Series: Insurgent' Creates New Worlds
description: The second film in the series includes new designs.

title: Theater Listings for March 20-26
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: U.C.L.A. Edges S.M.U. With Late Goaltending Call
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  U.C.L.A.s Bryce Alford let his 3-pointer fly and immediately knew the ball was off line. It was veering right, he said. He just hoped a teammate might snatch the rebound and put the ball back in the basket with the Bruins trailing Southern Methodist, 59-57, with 13 seconds to play.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, March 22 to 28, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Comedy Listings for March 20-26
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Movie Listings for March 20-26
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, March 22 to 28, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Jazz Listings for March 20-26
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Review: Backcountry, a Wilderness Survival Thriller
description: For most of its 91 tense, uneven minutes, Backcountry plays on your nerves like a kid flicking you with a rubber band. You feel the sting (thwack, thwack), but it doesnt bother you. Over time, though, the kid grows meaner, and the flicks grow harder, faster, too, and you realize that theyre keeping time with the thudding of your heart (thump, thump). The writer and director Adam MacDonald was born in 1977, two years after Jaws (chomp, chomp) forced everyone out of the water. Hes set out to have you now steer clear of the lovely, dark and deep woods, too.

title: Clinton Talks Fun Deficit (Apparently in Jest) and Partisanship (in Earnest)
description: ATLANTIC CITY  Bringing her career as a paid speaker to an apparent close, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Thursday addressed a convention of camp owners and professionals and jokingly warned of a huge fun deficit in America and suggested camps for adults as a cure.

title: Things to Do in Westchester, March 22 to 28, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Dance Listings for March 20-26
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Classical Music & Opera Listings for March 20-26
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for March 20-26
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Review: Insurgent Brandishes a Tougher Shailene Woodley
description: Tighter, tougher and every bit as witless as its predecessor, The Divergent Series: Insurgent  the second segment in the cycle  arrives with a yawn and ends with a bang. In between, bodies run, leap and fall amid nuzzling lips, blasting bullets and periodic story turns that make the movie a modest cultural artifact if one largely devoid of aesthetic interest. At this point, the heroine, Tris Prior (Shailene Woodley), can easily lock and load, having been trained by a thuggishly stylish faction, Dauntless, whose members wear the usual blah-blah black, tats and piercings and guard this dystopian world. Theyre our protectors, our soldiers, our police, Tris says of them in the first movie, if also crazy.

title: Spare Times Listings for March 20-26
description: Around Town

title: Spare Times for Children for March 20-26
description: The Magic Garden, or, The Princess Who Grew Antlers

title: Honda Expands Takata Airbag-Related Recalls
description: Honda Motor is expanding a national recall of vehicles with Takata-made airbags to include more than 104,000 cars, including one model that had not been included in previous recalls for the defect. Takata airbags can deploy violently and send metal fragments at passengers.

title: Monica Lewinsky Breaks Her Public Silence With a TED Talk
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Youre looking at a woman who was publicly silent for a decade.

title: Review: Al Pacino in Danny Collins Plays a Dissolute Pop Star
description: In Danny Collins, Al Pacino injects a zany charge of adrenaline into the title role of a rich, dissolute pop star belatedly seeking redemption for four decades of excess and wasted talent. This bogus character, introduced in a prologue set in 1971 as an intense, hungry young folk singer with a resemblance to the young Bob Dylan, is the latest in a lengthening Hollywood roster of rambunctious old goats.

title: Pastrami Piled as High as New York, With Prices to Match
description: Short on dismal news? Have a look at this notice, taped to the counter at the Yankee Tavern on 161st Street in the Bronx.

title: Clip: Growing Up and Other Lies
description: A scene from the film.

title: Bloodshed in Tunisia
description: With their massacre of at least 20 people from five countries at the National Bardo Museum in Tunis, the gunmen who carried out the rampage on Wednesday struck at Tunisias economic lifeblood, the tourism industry; its government; and the international community. The attack lays bare the extent to which extremists who are spreading through the region now threaten Tunisia, the only success story of the Arab Spring.

title: Ryanair Retracts Trans-Atlantic Plans
description: PARIS  In a surprising turnabout, the board of the Irish budget airline, Ryanair, said that, in fact, it had not approved plans to offer ultracheap flights between Europe and the United States.

title: Review: Growing Up and Other Lies Stares Down the Advent of Adulthood
description: Growing Up and Other Lies, the story of four friends in their 30s who walk from the northern tip of Manhattan to the Battery (with detours), is nominally a buddy comedy. But the movie, written and directed by Danny Jacobs and Darren Grodsky, is so steeped in angst that you share its characters deep-seated dread of a future that looks anything but rosy. The prospect of parenthood is especially daunting.

title: Verbatim: Respect the Voters, Walker Says
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, speaking at a South Carolina Republican Party dinner fund-raiser in Greenville, about the resignation of one of his aides this week.

title: This Weeks Movies | March 20, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review The Gunman, The Divergent Series: Insurgent, and Backcountry.

title: Anemic Support Greets Potential Olympic Bid in Boston
description: BOSTON  Public support for Boston to host the 2024 Summer Olympics was already on the downslope, but it has plunged even further in the last month.

title: How English Ruined Indian Literature
description: NEW DELHI  A BOATMAN I met in Varanasi last year, while covering the general election that made Narendra Modi prime minister of India, said, When Modi comes to power, we will send this government of the English packing.

title: DAngelo Russell and Ohio State Squeak Past V.C.U.
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  DAngelo Russells supporting cast at Ohio State did just enough Thursday to help him push the Buckeyes past Virginia Commonwealth with a 75-72 overtime victory.

title: Republican Budgets in Both House and the Senate Add to Military Spending
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional defense hawks seized the upper hand in their fight with deficit hawks on Thursday, securing billions of dollars for the Pentagon in a victory that presages a broader revolt against tight spending limits.

title: Sam Saunders, a Descendant of a King of Golf, Carves His Own Path
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The starter on the 10th hole, Butch Cronon, took particular delight in announcing the first player in the final threesome of the morning wave Thursday at the Arnold Palmer Invitational. From Fort Collins, Colo., Cronon intoned, please welcome home, Sam Saunders.

title: Review: In Eugne Greens La Sapienza, a Search of Ideals of Civilization
description: The characters in La Sapienza, Eugne Greens new film, tend to look directly into the camera when they speak, to speak clearly and grammatically, and to refrain from interrupting one another. The rhythm of the editing is similarly deliberate: The camera looks at one person, then another, and patiently surveys a landscape or the interior of an old and magnificent building. This graceful, unhurried style, with its blend of austerity and artifice and its roots in classical French theatrical traditions, is Mr. Greens signature. American by birth and ardently European by residence and vocation, he elevates formal decorum to a moral principle. La Sapienza, quiet and conversational as it seems, is a passionate defense of  and perhaps also an elegy for  an old and dignified ideal of civilization.

title: Amazon Wins Approval to Test Delivery Drones Outdoors
description: SEATTLE  Federal regulators have given Amazon a green light to begin testing drones, but it will most likely take years before the online retailer can start delivering packages from the air to peoples homes.

title: Clip: Shes Lost Control
description: A scene from the film.

title: Take Google to Court, Staff Report Urged F.T.C.
description: The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday faced renewed questions about its handling of its antitrust investigation into Google, after documents revealed that an internal report had recommended stronger action.

title: Varoufakis Says Video Was Doctored
description: Greeces finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis, denied making an obscene gesture in reference to Germany during a 2013 lecture in Croatia, saying video of the talk was doctored.

title: Accusations of Sex Crimes Unnerve Venice High School
description: LOS ANGELES  Since the arrests of a dozen students here on suspicion of sex-related crimes, members of the Venice High School community have been doing some soul-searching about what they could have done to prevent the assaults  some of which the police said took place on campus  and what they can do to try to ensure that nothing similar happens again.

title: Review: In Shes Lost Control, Crossing Boundaries in Pursuit of Intimacy
description: Shes Lost Control, Anja Marquardts chilly portrait of a behavioral psychologist who works as a sexual surrogate, is so studiedly bleak it will pour ice water on anyones fantasies of earning a living as an erotic healer.

title: T-Mobile Policy Violated Labor Law, Judge Rules
description: A National Labor Relations Board judge ruled on Wednesday that the employment policies of the wireless carrier T-Mobile violated United States labor law by restricting workers ability to organize and other rights, setting a potentially important precedent for unions.

title: Crowds and Long Delays Fray Subway System and Riders Nerves
description: Fares are about to go up. Delays are driving riders to distraction. And on a recent evening, Ian Nolans train was out of service.

title: Amazon Letter to the Federal Aviation Administration
description: This letter describes Amazons plans for a drone delivery system.

title: Port Authority Agrees on the Need to Replace Its Bus Terminal, but Little Else
description: The commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey agreed on Thursday that the 65-year-old bus terminal in Manhattan that their agency operates is an overcrowded eyesore that cries out to be replaced. And there the consensus ended.

title: McConnell Urges States to Help Thwart Obamas War on Coal
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky has begun an aggressive campaign to block President Obamas climate change agenda in statehouses and courtrooms across the country, arenas far beyond Mr. McConnells official reach and authority.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 19, 2015
description: March 19, 2015

title: Black Mans Body Found Hanging From Tree in Mississippi
description: NEW ORLEANS  Federal, state and local law enforcement agencies are investigating the death of a black man who was found hanging from a tree in a small Mississippi town on Thursday morning.

title: Review: Lost and Love (Shi Gu) Stars Andy Lau as a Man Searching for His Lost Son
description: Peng Sanyuans Lost and Love could ably serve as a travelogue of China: glowingly verdant trees, winding roads, fishing shacks, ribbonlike bridges, cafes and grubby city intersections, all shot by Mark Lee Ping Bin, the cinematographer who has helped the great director Hou Hsiao-hsien sculpt time in images.

title: More U.S. Troops Seen Staying in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is nearing a decision to keep more troops in Afghanistan next year than it had intended, effectively upending its drawdown plans in response to roiling violence in the country and another false start in the effort to open peace talks between the Taliban and the Afghan government.

title: Director of the Clark Art Institute to Retire
description: Michael Conforti, director of the Sterling and Francine Clark Art Institute in the Berkshires since 1994, who spent almost 15 years reimagining the museum through a renovation and expansion, announced on Thursday that he would retire in August.

title: In Video, Obama Appeals to Iranian Youth on Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Two weeks after Senate Republicans issued a letter to the Iranian leadership warning that any nuclear agreement Iran signs with the administration may be temporary, President Obama has issued a missive of his own: A video directed at Irans young people, urging them to pressure their leaders to accept the deal on the table.

title: Villanova Overwhelms Lafayette
description: PITTSBURGH  By halftime, seven Villanova players had each scored at least 5 points. The only starter who had not, Ryan Arcidiacono, was the Big East player of the year.

title: Israel Election Result Complicates Life for Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus victory in this weeks Israeli elections has reverberated through American politics, reinforcing Republican faith in the political wisdom of a hawkish foreign policy, worsening his relationship with President Obama, and energizing liberal critics of Israels government. But mostly it has complicated the life of Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Clip: White God
description: A scene from the film.

title: A Burst of Upsets, and Confidence, to Shake the N.C.A.A. Tournament Up
