On Sundays, Mr. Gunn, 61, who lives on the Upper West Side, turns his focus inward in order to heal and repair.

title: Review: The Feast Plumbs the Depths of a Troubling Toilet
description: Ever had a leaky faucet? Or a clogged drain? Cory Finleys The Feast at the Flea is the sort of play to make you grateful for such mundane plumbing problems. Matts wonky W.C. is a whole lot eerier.

title: By Land and Sea, Curaao Seeks to Sustain Its Coral Bounty
description: WILLEMSTAD, Curaao  I apologize for the prolonged blog silence (I have withdrawal symptoms!), but this week has been devoted to filming, not writing. Since my move to Pace University five years ago, Ive been working each spring with a colleague, Prof. Maria Luskay, to focus a long-running documentary production course on environmental stories.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Home Work
description: Stylish and practical ideas for furnishing a home office.

title: Tesco and British Land Agree to Swap $1 Billion in Properties
description: LONDON  The real estate investor British Land and the British supermarket operator Tesco said on Friday that they had agreed to swap properties worth 733 million pounds, or about $1 billion.

title: In Winter, Harbor Seals Become New Yorks Beach Bums
description: As a naturalist in New York City, I have learned that a call about a sick dog on the beach is more often not about a dog. Increasingly, the beaches we abandon at the end of summer are resorts for seals in winter.

title: Exploring the Occupy Protest
description: The self-described radical tour guide Michael Pellagatti plans on telling stories of his Occupy Wall Street experiences on a new tour of Wall Street and surrounding areas.

title: SXSW Music 2015: Sometimes a Bands Equipment Can Make You Stick Around
description: They started late, but the equipment they were setting up looked promising, so I stuck around.

title: Form Holds as Northern Iowa Ousts Wyoming
description: SEATTLE  About halfway through the first half, Seth Tuttle, Northern Iowas star senior forward, crashed toward the basket during an inbound play, received the ball midair and missed the easy basket. No matter. He got his own rebound and tossed the ball a few feet to the junior guard Paul Jesperson, who made the layup.

title: TAG Heuer Smartwatch Is the Talk of Baselworld
description: BASEL, Switzerland  No one knows what it will look like. No one knows what it will cost. But the forthcoming  and thus far nameless  smartwatch announced by TAG Heuer, Google and Intel on Thursday became the watch to watch at the giant Baselworld watch fair.

title: The Music, Revelry and Personalities of SXSW
description: The photographer Jackie Lee Young documents scenes from the South by Southwest festival.

title: Henrik Lundqvist Loses Practice Time but Gains a Daughter
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Henrik Lundqvist, who was cleared to return to practice with the Rangers this week, was not at the teams workout Friday because his wife, Therese, was close to giving birth to their second child.

title: The Best Roast Lamb for Your Easter Feast
description: Apparently, Im eating for 30.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
description: A visiting prince, stalled confirmation hearings and a Womens History Month reception.

title: Adult Children of AIDS Victims Take Their Memories Out of the Shadows
description: On a Thursday night in January, the atmosphere at the Housing Works Bookstore Cafe in SoHo was heavy with nostalgia. More than 100 people mingled, drank wine and swayed in place to hits of the 70s and 80s, featuring songs by Lou Reed, David Bowie, Elton John and the B-52s.

title: Online Swatting Becomes a Hazard for Popular Video Gamers and Police Responders
description: Practical jokers have delighted for years at tormenting celebrities at home by calling in bogus reports of violence and provoking huge police responses.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
Urging Treatment for Activist in Jail in China, 16 Are Briefly Detained Themselves
description: HONG KONG  Sixteen people who went to a Beijing detention center on Friday to push for medical treatment for one of five detained womens rights activists were themselves taken into custody, according to one of the 16 detained and a website that documents rights violations. They were all released by 3 a.m. Saturday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Russia and Elsewhere
description: Russia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: $200 Million to Help Food Stamp Recipients Find Jobs
description: Washington  The Obama administration announced on Friday that it would give $200 million to 10 states for pilot projects to help food stamp recipients find jobs, part of a larger effort to reduce the rolls of a program that provides assistance to nearly 50 million Americans.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Pierre Paulin: Beyond Pop
description: A revival of interest in the iconic 1960s and 70s work of the French designer has revealed an artist whose career was more varied and extensive than most realize.

title: A Love That Braved the Cold
description: Tina Zanetti and Tyler Forsyth were married on March 14 in the Ice Chapel at the Htel de Glace in Quebec.

title: The Waiters Wear Tuxedos
description: The fine-dining experience at Le Prigord, a French restaurant at 52nd Street and First Avenue in Manhattan, has barely changed over 50 years.

title: Cold Enough to Warm the Heart
description: Its hard to avoid the irony: A woman who thwarted her boyfriends plan for a marriage proposal because of the cold is married in a chapel made of snow and ice in Quebec, with a blizzard as a bonus.

title: Tituss Burgess on a Role Tailor-Made for Him on Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt
description: Looking for a wannabe Broadway actor, broke, down on his luck, who lives in Harlem in a basement apartment, said Tituss Burgess, who was recently sitting in a cafe down the street from his former Harlem basement apartment. He was remembering the casting call for what would turn out to be the second lead on Netflixs Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt. It was basically him. Sure, Titus, the character on the show, lacked the additional s in his name. But, otherwise, the similarities  gay, black, fabulous  were undeniable. I thought, Is this a joke or am I about to get a job? Mr. Burgess said with a laugh.

title: At Le Prigord, Few Changes Since Burton and Taylor Dined There in 64
description: On a recent chilly evening, when the weather called for a comforting meal and warm ambience, Le Prigord was as welcoming as ever. The restaurants 78-year-old owner, Georges Briguet, wearing a tuxedo, stood at the entry of his fancy French restaurant, greeting customers either with a handshake or a kiss on both cheeks, a ritual more than 50 years old.

title: Bill Cunningham | The Gales of March
description: The new style of floppy wide-brimmed felt hats is a problem in the windy streets, especially on 23rd Street and Fifth Avenue, a corner thats said to have been known in the 1920s as 23 Skidoo because of the admonishment police would shout at men who waited there to see the wind lift the skirts of female passers-by.

title: Bill Cunningham | The Gales of March
description: The new style of floppy wide-brimmed felt hats is a problem in the windy streets, especially on 23rd Street and Fifth Avenue, a corner thats said to have been known in the 1920s as 23 Skidoo.

title: 49 Fouls Later, West Virginia Outlasts Buffalo
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  The windows of opportunity were left wide open, as if to beg 12th-seeded Buffalo to jump through them and escape its first N.C.A.A. tournament game with something to show for it.

title: Narita, Japan: A Flight Crew Secret
description: Layovers at Narita International Airport mean time to visit this historic city.

title: The Good Host, but Bad Bookseller, of Brazenhead Books
description: The tenement building on East 84th Street does not have a sign or a label on the downstairs buzzer for the apartment housing the secret bookstore.

title: New York City Starts Car Loan Program to Curb Abusive Practices
description: When Hurricane Sandy destroyed her car, Rhoda Branche was desperate for another. But just a year later, she could not wait to get rid of the one that replaced it.

title: March 20, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Russia, Mexico, Yemen and Turkey.

title: How to Manage Media in Families
description: Parents have a love-hate relationship with firsts. Some they like: the first smile, the first steps, the first sleeping through the night. Others they dread: the first flu, the first tantrum, the first broken bone. As children get older, the firsts become more nuanced, generating both joy in our childrens independence and fear of their slipping away: the first summer away, the first date, the first drivers license.

title: A Visit to Vu Linh, Vietnam
description: The village includes a lodge that celebrates the culture of Dao, one of the countrys ethnic groups.

title: Rules for Teen and Tween Cellphone Use: Unspoken, or Printed and Signed?
description: Last month, my 13-year-old bought his first mobile phone. In keeping with our familys general electronic gadgetry policy, he saved up for it himself, and hell make the monthly payments himself, although he gets a good deal because he is on my brand-new family plan. If he referees two hockey games a month, he can cover it. (He has other income-making plans for spring and summer, and enough savings that Im confident I wont ever have to float him).

title: Rand Paul Calls on Hillary Clinton to Return All Foreign Gifts
description: Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, appears to be trying to turn one of Hillary Rodham Clintons greatest strengths into a weakness, implicating her in a war on women because of gifts she has received from foreign countries.

title: Evening Hours | Vibrant Celebrations
description: Celebrating activism, the arts and education.

title: Death of a Muse: Manuela Pavesi, Miuccia Pradas Close Collaborator
description: Manuela Pavesi was a passionate archivist of her own past, hanging on over time to cherished mementos of a life in style. Not long ago, she reminisced about the pinafore she wore as a schoolgirl in her native Mantua. I still have it, she said.

title: The Age of Frozen Certainties
description: The Times has an interesting headline here: Richard Fisher, Often Wrong but Seldom Boring, Leaves the Fed. Because entertainment value is what we want from central bankers, right? I mean, Janet Yellen is such a drag  she just keeps being right about the economy, and that gets old really fast, you know?

title: Lena Dunham and the Man Who Drew Eloise
description: A few years ago, Hilary Knight, the illustrator best known for Eloise, was talking with a builder he knows in East Hampton. The guy had just read a profile in New York Magazine of Lena Dunham, which mentioned she had an Eloise tattoo. I was unaware of Lena Dunham, Mr. Knight, 88, said recently.

title: Young Mixed Pair Wins Lebhar Imp Title
description: NEW ORLEANS  The Vanderbilt Knockout Teams, the premier event at the Spring North American Championships here, will have new champions after Sundays final. Last years winners, Nick Nickell, Ralph Katz, Bobby Levin, Steve Weinstein, Jeff Meckstroth and Eric Rodwell, lost in the Round of 32 to Gaylor Kasle and Larry Kozlove playing with four Europeans, Joris Lankveld and Berend Van Den Bos from the Netherlands and Bartosz Chmurski and Piotr Tuczynski from Poland by 94 international match points to 92.

title: Review: New York Philharmonic Performs Esa-Pekka Salonens Nyx
description: Set the rumor machine to overdrive: Esa-Pekka Salonen appeared with the New York Philharmonic at Avery Fisher Hall on Thursday.

title: The Math of March Madness
description: THE N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament started Thursday, but for most Americans the real action began days before, as they pored over brackets, competing to make the most accurate predictions  for money, or just office glory. These days, when statistical algorithms can figure out what breakfast cereal you want based on your browser history, stats-minded hoops fans have thrown lots of complex analysis at the problem of picking winners.

title: A History of the First Mass-Produced Baseball Card
description: Q. While waiting endlessly for Opening Day, I got to wondering: What was the first baseball card?

title: The Problem With Egg Freezing
description: Nobody really knows how well egg freezing works. Despite that, the practice has received significant media attention, thanks in part to a startup that now hosts egg-freezing parties. And while it may turn out to be effective for some women, the current discussion underscores an enduring fact: When it comes to having and caring for children, women are all too often on their own.

title: Hillarys Eternal Quest for Relatability
description: This morning, I found myself in one of those overcaffeinated, overendorphined, what could possibly go wrong? states as I perused my Twitter feed. Dangerous! Soon I found myself talking back to certain tweets, usually in my head. But sometimes not. I hate Twitter.

title: Mets Hopes May Be Dashed, but Not by the Loss of Zack Wheeler
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  When Zack Wheeler learned on Monday that his job had changed from pitcher to patient, he hung up the phone and returned to the Mets clubhouse in a daze.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Virginia Pulls Away Late Against Belmont
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Craig Bradshaw lofted a 3-point shot that banked off the glass and into the net with 4 minutes 37 seconds left as No. 15-seeded Belmont closed the Bruins to 2 points behind No. 2 Virginia in their first-round East Region game. Belmont was on a run, and Virginia was in trouble.

title: An Imaginary Battle Comes to Life at the Hudson River Museum
description: Bonnie Prince Johnnie, flamboyant pharaoh of New York; Francesca, a.k.a. Tisiphone, Native American assassin; Maurits de Wolff, former slave and soldier extraordinaire; Akosua Van Der Zee, wrathful feminist and malicious schemer.

title: Exploring Married at First Sight, Surviving Marriage and Neighbors With Benefits
description: Love is a feeling, to be sure, but love is also a choice  the choice to let someone in, and to get inside someone else.

title: Wichita St. Withstands 3-Point Fest by Indiana
description: OMAHA  It took several anxious moments in the second half, and one jarred tooth, but basketball fans in Kansas will get exactly what they wanted: a cross-state matchup of Kansas and Wichita State in the N.C.A.A. tournaments round of 32 on Sunday.

title: Sebastio Salgados Journey From Brazil to the World
description: In a wide-ranging interview, Sebastio Salgado discusses a new documentary that tracks his path from childhood in Brazil to witnessing some of the greatest stories of his age.

title: A Governor Faces Down the Gun Lobby
description: The power of the gun lobby overstatehouse politicians has led toa raft of laws dear to gun rights adherents, from a measure allowing concealed firearms on college campuses to one legalizing the open carrying of holstered pistols for those who like to swagger into restaurants and coffee bars. The growing question of whether the lobby had nullified all serious political resistance was answered Friday when West Virginia Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin, usually a reliable supporter of the National Rifle Association, vetoed a bill to scrap the current law that citizens have to get a permit and take gun safety lessons in order to legally carry a concealed weapon in the state.

title: Undoing the Ruins Once Wrought by Vesuvius
description: POMPEII, Italy  Despite its name, the Villa of the Mysteries, arguably the best-known monument at the archaeological site here buried by Vesuvian fury in A.D. 79, has something to reveal.

title: Crime Scenes, as Seen by the Police
description: A trove of photographs taken by the New York Police Department will soon be made available to the public.

title: Dusting Off a Police Trove of Photographs to Rival Weegees
description: The picture, of a coat and a hat, was one of seven taken that afternoon at the Latin Lounge. But why?

title: Why Not Utopia?
description: SOME quake in terror as we approach the Terminator scenario, in which clever machines take over the world. After all, it isnt sci-fi when Stephen Hawking says things like, The development of full artificial intelligence could spell the end of the human race.

title: Review: The Joyce Unleashed Series, With a Middle Eastern Flavor
description: Is there anything more sentimental than a home video of a little kid dancing? What if you extracted only the motions and put them in a different body, on an empty stage? Helga and the Three Sailors, a richly detailed dance by Netta Yerushalmy, begins with an exercise in that vein. Alongside short, looping clips of herself as a child, Ms. Yerushalmy does again what she did back then, but with no emotional inflection. The physical facts of flailing in the living room or wobbling along a garden path, it turns out, make for compelling choreography.

title: Infinite Possibility From an Iranian Artist
description: The works of Monir Shahroudy Farmanfarmaian are on exhibition at the Guggenheim. At 91, she is having her first solo show at a major New York museum.

title: Movie Review: Insurgent
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews The Divergent Series: Insurgent.

title: A Day After a Killing, Afghans React in Horror, but Some Show Approval
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The mentally ill woman, her face covered in blood, rose to her feet and looked out across the mob. She pleaded. But these men meant to kill her.

title: Monir Farmanfarmaian, Iranian and Nonagenarian, Celebrates a New York Museum First
description: The artist Monir Farmanfarmaian used to visit the Guggenheim museum in the early 1950s, when it was still in a townhouse and still known by its ponderous first handle, the Museum of Non-Objective Painting. She was there the day in 1956 when ground was broken for Frank Lloyd Wrights concrete spiral. And the other evening, at the age of 91, she stood in the rotunda of that spiral, using a reporter to help her fend off a crowd of admirers pressing in from all sides.

title: Movie Review: The Gunman
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews The Gunman.

title: Crimescenes, as Seen by the Police
description: A trove of photographs taken by the New York Police Department will soon be made available to the public.

title: What They Did in the War: Two Japanese Actresses Propaganda Work
description: American moviegoers may know Setsuko Hara: symbol of the quiet strength of the Japanese woman in films from the 1940s and 50s, especially Yasujiro Ozus Late Spring, Early Summer and Tokyo Story. And we know Shirley Yamaguchi: a spitfire whose career included starring roles in Samuel Fullers House of Bamboo and King Vidors Japanese War Bride.

title: Scott Walkers Path
description: Highlights of the political career of Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, a candidate for the Republican presidential nomination in 2016.

title: For 2016 Run, Scott Walker Washes Wiscahnsin Out of His Mouth
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Out on the presidential campaign trail, Gov. Scott Walker has left Wiscahnsin back home in Wisconsin. He now wants to strengthen the economy, not the ecahnahmy. And while he once had the ahnor of meeting fellow Republicans, he told one group here this week that he simply enjoyed talkin with yall.

title: Do the Democrats and Israel Have a Future Together?
description: Last September, on the afternoon of Rosh Hashana, the beginning of the Jewish High Holy Days, Elliott Abrams sat cross-legged on a basement carpet in Virginia playing marbles with his grandson. The former George W. Bush administration official, who supervised U.S. policy in the Middle East, is the father-in-law of a young rabbi at a reform synagogue in Washington that had been torn between its love of Israel and its loathing of Benjamin Netanyahus right-wing government.

title: Louisvilles Guards Outmaneuver U.C. Irvines Big Men in a Close Victory
description: SEATTLE  Through almost all of Louisvilles 57-55 win Friday, U.C. Irvine had the tallest player on the floor. In the first half, the Anteaters put in either the 7-foot-6 center Mamadou Ndiaye, a sophomore from Senegal, or the 7-2 center Ioannis Dimakopoulos, a sophomore from Greece.

title: Bartolo Colon, Michael Cuddyer and Curtis Granderson Pace Mets
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Although their baseball odometer shows a lot of mileage, Bartolo Colon, Michael Cuddyer and Curtis Granderson showed for at least one day that there was still a lot of life left in their game.

title: Tolstoys Home
description: The one-time estate of Leo Tolstoy is now a Russian state museum.

title: In Putins Nationalist Russia, a Tolstoy as Cultural Diplomat
description: YASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  On a sunny winter afternoon here, Vladimir Tolstoy, a great-great-grandson of Leo Tolstoy and an adviser on cultural affairs to President Vladimir V. Putin, strode up the birch-lined path that leads to the bucolic family compound where his forebear wrote War and Peace and Anna Karenina. It is now a state museum. At each step, he was greeted by staff members heading home for the day.

title: Scott Walkers Accent Then and Now
description: As Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin gets ready for a presidential campaign, his regional accent seems to be softening.

title: Woman Breaks Through Chains of Forced Marriage, and Helps Others Do the Same
description: NEWARK  One day in March 2011, Fraidy Reiss went to her lawyers office to close on a house. The prosaic routine of paperwork somehow diminished her sense of accomplishment. Not even the seller was present to hear what she yearned to say.

title: Friday Night Music: SOAK
description: I saw a lot of great stuff at SWSX  San Fermin, Alvvays, Courtney Barnett, and more. Also ate and drank too much to make up despite some lovely long runs along the river.

title: Robert Kastenmeier, Liberal Voice in House for 32 Years, Dies at 91
description: Robert W. Kastenmeier, a Wisconsin Democrat who in 32 years in the House was an early opponent of the Vietnam War and in 1976 earned the gratitude of authors when he managed the first general revision of copyright law since 1909, died on Friday at his home in Arlington, Va. He was 91.

title: Aging Bridge in California Needs All the Support It Can Get
description: ALBION, Calif.  Sometimes, a bridge is more than a way to get from here to there.

title: A Car-Free Day on San Fernando Valley Roads
description: Californias San Fernando Valley is hosting the bike-centric event called CicLAvia for the first time on Sunday, March 22.

title: Maryland Fends Off Valparaisos Upset Bid
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  In a skirmish of 3-pointers, Maryland slipped past Valparaiso, 65-62, and thwarted a furious bid to end its season Friday at Nationwide Arena.

title: Cuba: Split in Dissident Group
description: The daughter of Laura Polln, founder of the dissident group Ladies in White, has split from the organization, signaling divisions over the rapprochement between Cuba and the United States and, perhaps, the end of an era in which the white-clad women symbolized the fight for political freedom. Ms. Pollns daughter, Laura Maria Labrada, announced on Thursday that she would leave the group because of differences with its leader, Berta Soler. She said the Ladies in White could no longer use Ms. Pollns name or her house, which had been the groups headquarters. Ms. Polln died in 2011. Tensions within the group have sharpened since the Dec. 17 thaw between Cuba and the United States, which Ms. Soler opposes and Ms. Labrada supports. Members this month accused Ms. Soler of being autocratic and called for her to resign, leading to a vote on her leadership, which she won.

title: In Tunisia, Taking Stock of the Dead, and the Survivors
description: TUNIS  Still shaken on Friday by a brazen attack that killed 23 people at the National Bardo Museum in the heart of the capital two days before, Tunisian officials spent their Independence Day  a public holiday here  evacuating dead and wounded foreign tourists and burying their own.

title: Defending a Tax Analysis
description: To the Editor:

title: Florida Justices Reject 70-Year Sentence for Juvenile, Likening It to Life Term
description: The Florida Supreme Court has ordered a new sentencing hearing for a man who received 70 years in prison without parole for an attempted murder at the age of 14. The court agreed with lawyers for the defendant, Shimeek D. Gridine, that his sentence violated the limits on juvenile penalties set by the United States Supreme Court.

title: Poland: Priests Abuse Trial Opens
description: A Polish priest accused of sexually abusing minors in Poland and in the Dominican Republic, where he led a parish for almost a decade, offered to serve a seven-year jail sentence as his trial opened on Friday, according to a spokeswoman for a regional court in Warsaw. The priest, the Rev. Wojciech Gil, is charged with committing 10 crimes, most of which relate to the molestation of boys under the age of 15. If convicted, he could serve up to 15 years in prison. During the trial, Father Gil for the first time since his arrest did not deny the charges, the court spokeswoman said, but it is unclear whether he pleaded guilty. Under Polish law, a defendant can offer to serve a jail term for some crimes without admitting to any guilt. The trial resumes on Wednesday.

title: Morgan Hoffmann, a Pilot, Handles Pressure as He Seeks His First PGA Win
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Morgan Hoffmann, pro golfer and amateur pilot, was performing touch-and-go maneuvers on a Stuart, Fla., runway when a vulture flew into his line of sight. Worried that the bird was on a collision course with the propeller, Hoffmann swiftly pulled up his aircraft, a six-seat Piper Lance turboprop.

title: Cuomo Focuses on Ethics Reform, Not on Funding It
description: ALBANY  Though Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo made expanding oversight of public officials a centerpiece of his agenda this year, none of New York States commissions or agencies specifically charged with policing ethical lapses received an increase in funding in his proposed budget.

title: Canada: Men Found Guilty of Terrorism
description: Two men who plotted to derail a passenger train traveling from New York to Toronto were convicted on Friday of various terrorism charges, including terrorism-related conspiracy to commit murder. Most of the evidence against the men, Chiheb Esseghaier, a Tunisian graduate student in Montreal, and Raed Jaser, a stateless Palestinian with previous criminal convictions, were recordings secretly made by an F.B.I. agent who posed as a wealthy American businessman who held radical political and religious views. The two men are to be sentenced next month.

title: A Real-Time Peek at Traffic to U.S. Government Websites
description: The federal government is offering the public a window into its web traffic. On Thursday, it introduced a new sitethat gives real-time insight into how many people are navigating to many government websites.

title: In a Good Sign, Alex Rodriguez Hits a Home Run
description: LAKELAND, Fla.  As Alex Rodriguez rounded first base on Friday, his eyes fixed on right field, he turned back toward the bag, uncertain where to go.

title: Netanyahu, the Palestinians and the Election in Israel
description: To the Editor:

title: Cincinnati Has a Bald, 5-Foot-8, Frenzied Coach. No, the Other One.
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  When he became ill, Mick Cronin, the head coach at Cincinnati, did not hand the reins of the basketball program to just any coach. He handed them to his twin, to his equivalent, to a man who shares Cronins doctrine of maniacal basketball. Cut them open, and Cronin and the interim coach Larry Davis are the same man.

title: Is a Streetcar Still Something to Desire?
description: To the Editor:

title: Walter Channing Jr., Vintner and Sculptor, Dies at 74
description: Walter Channing Jr., who combined careers as a venture capitalist, sculptor and well-regarded vintner on Long Island, died on March 12 in Southampton, N.Y. He was 74.

title: McConnell and Coal
description: To the Editor:

title: Tinder Appoints Chief Executive to Replace Sean Rad
description: Tinder, the mobile dating application, said on Friday it had appointed Christopher Payne chief executive, a step toward building the two-and-a-half-year-old company into a booming business.

title: Skills in the New Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: Slaughterers of Srebrenica
description: To the Editor:

title: Robert Dursts Papers Are Seized From a Hudson Valley Cellar
description: The authorities moved swiftly to search the home of Robert A. Durst in Houston as well as a hotel room in New Orleans after his arrest on first-degree murder charges there a week ago.

title: Shermans Last Stand
description: By the final months of the Civil War, a combination of geography and human agency began to break down the long-standing distinction between the Eastern Theater, consisting of operations in and around Virginia, and the Western Theater, which encompassed everything between the Appalachian Mountains and the Mississippi River. In fact, in one of the wars great ironies, the closing act of the Western Theater occurred in east central North Carolina.

title: U.S. May Stay in Afghanistan After '16
description: WASHINGTON  A White House official on Friday appeared to leave open the possibility that American troops could remain in Afghanistan after President Obama leaves office, in what would be a marked shift from the administrations insistence that only a small force based at the embassy in Kabul would remain after 2016.

title: Officials Urge Patience as Hanging of Black Man Is Investigated in Mississippi
description: PORT GIBSON, Miss.  Approximately 30 federal, state and local law enforcement agents have descended upon this small Southern town to investigate the death of a black man whose body was found hanging from a tree. But two federal law enforcement officials said Friday that preliminary indications suggested that the man might have committed suicide, and the local sheriff said that there was no indication that racism had played a role.

title: A Womans Place Is on the $20
description: You may have heard that theres a movement afoot to kick Andrew Jackson off the $20 bill and replace him with a woman. Finally, weve got a current event thats not depressing.

title: Notre Dame Rides a Streak With Shoes Like Highlighters
description: PITTSBURGH  In the second week of February, a shipment from Under Armour arrived at Notre Dame. Mixed in with hats and jumpsuits and T-shirts were the boxes that Harold Swanagan, the coordinator of basketball operations, was expecting.

title: Bill Raftery-Grant Hill Analyst Team Has a Bland Debut but a Better Sequel
description: Casting a three-announcer booth is rarely easy. You need a play-by-play announcer who can get the best out of two analysts, not the usual one. You need two analysts with different perspectives who can provide complementary commentary without each repeating what the other has just said. And you need those analysts to accommodate each other  and not fight for airtime between plays.

title: Mexico: Elite Police Officers Slain
description: A new, elite federal police unit intended to be a premiere force against drug gangs suffered its biggest loss this week when five members were killed in an ambush, federal officials said Friday, raising questions among analysts about the units training. The ambush, in Jalisco State on Thursday, left five other people dead, including two civilian bystanders and three of the presumed attackers, officials said. The officers belonged to the Gendarmerie, a 5,000-officer division of the federal police formed last year by President Enrique Pea Nieto to go after organized-crime groups hurting economic interests in various trouble spots in an effort to ease foreign investors concerns about safety. The officers were in a convoy patrolling an industrial corridor in Ocotlan when they came under gunfire from more than a dozen vehicles. It was unclear what prompted the attack.

title: Philadelphia Commissioner Steps Into Fray Between Police and Public
description: PHILADELPHIA  When Police Commissioner Charles H. Ramsey and District Attorney R. Seth Williams appeared at a town hall meeting here on Thursday, they were prepared to explain why criminal charges had not been filed against an officer who in December fatally shot a young black man in the back of the head.

title: Georgia States Sixth Man Has Four Wheels and Countless Fans
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  A celebrity deserves better. Fame, even for 15 minutes, should carry some cachet. Maybe an upgraded suite with plush carpeting, designer seat coverings, a comfy corner to rest weary wheels? How about a place behind a fancy desk, if just for one night?

title: Duke Shows Robert Morris It Should Be Careful What It Wishes For
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Gleeful Robert Morris fans chanted We want Duke in the final seconds of their N.C.A.A. tournament play-in victory against North Florida on Wednesday in Dayton, Ohio. So the fans got what they wanted.

title: How to Make Landslides Less Deadly
description: SEATTLE  IN the year since 43 people died in a landslide in Oso, Wash., we have often been asked, as researchers who investigated this tragedy, how many other potential landslide disasters exist around the country.

title: The Greece Issue Breeds Brinkmanship in the Eurozone
description: Nobody expected that the discussions between Greece and the rest of the eurozone about a new loan agreement would go smoothly. But things seem to be going even worse than expected, with both sides sniping at each other and refusing to engage in meaningful negotiations.

title: Overtime Pay for Overworked People
description: More than a year has passed since President Obama directed the Labor Department to revamp the nations outdated rules on overtime pay, which are basically stuck in the 1970s. A February deadline is long gone and there has been no proposal.

title: Backsliding on Reform in Myanmar
description: This is an important year for Myanmar. Parliamentary elections are scheduled for November, and the military-dominated government of President Thein Sein promised they would be free, fair and inclusive. That promise is looking increasingly tenuous, as signs that Myanmar is retreating on democratic reform multiply.

title: Cedar Lake Contemporary Ballet Plans to Close
description: Cedar Lake Contemporary Ballet seemed like the dance company that had it all: a wealthy benefactor, generous contracts and benefits for its dancers, and a snazzy Chelsea home.

title: It Comes Before Iyar
description: SATURDAY POST  Todays puzzle by Frederick J. Healy will be reviewed by editor Will Shortz today, because 1) he has a lot to say about it, and 2) he is a nice person and knows that I havent had a day off in a very long time.

title: Evicted Tenant Started Queens Fire, Officials Say
description: A fire that raced through a block of homes in Woodhaven, Queens, on Wednesday night was started by an angry tenant just minutes after his landlord evicted him from his apartment, the authorities said on Friday.

title: Chris Christies Fair Housing Problem
description: The Supreme Court of New Jersey has finally run out of patience with Gov. Chris Christies attempts to nullify its groundbreaking, three-decades-old decision in the Mount Laurel fair housing case, which prohibits wealthy towns from excluding affordable housing and requires them to write zoning laws that allow such housing to be built.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 20, 2015
description: March 20, 2015

title: Oregon Shoots Down Oklahoma State
description: OMAHA  Dana Altmans return to Nebraska, where he grew up and coached for 16 years at Creighton, has been extended by two more days.

title: See No Junk Food, Buy No Junk Food
description: FROM urban ghettos to declining inner-ring suburbs to destitute rural areas, Americans with little money live in food deserts where it is hard to find fresh fruits and vegetables.

title: Obama Calls Nominee Hostage of Trafficking Dispute
description: President Obama on Friday said that Republicans were holding Loretta E. Lynch hostage to a legislative disagreement unrelated to her nomination as attorney general. She is eminently qualified  nobody denies it, Mr. Obama said in an interview with The Huffington Post. Even the Republicans acknowledge shes been a great prosecutor. Republicans have said they will not hold the vote until a dispute with Democrats over a measure to create a fund for victims of sexual trafficking is resolved. You dont hold attorney general nominees hostage for other issues, Mr. Obama said. He blamed Senate dysfunction and stubbornness by Republicans about approving any of his nominees.

title: A Life Upended After an IV Glucose Treatment Popular Among Asian Immigrants
description: SEOUL, South Korea  On a Thursday in late February, Myung Hwa Jang swung her feet off her bed and gingerly placed her pink Nike sneakers on the floor. With effort, she balanced on her artificial limbs and stood. It had been two years since both of her legs were amputated below the knees, along with her right arm and most of her left hand, after an infection raced through her body following a glucose injection she received in a storefront clinic in Flushing, Queens.

title: Taxi Jumps Curb, Killing Pedestrian in the Bronx
description: A taxi killed one pedestrian and critically injured two others in the Bronx on Friday when it jumped a curb and careered onto the sidewalk on a snowy night, the police said.

title: Iowas Height Shuts Down Davidsons 3-Point Game
description: SEATTLE  Time and again Friday night, one of Davidsons guards  Jack Gibbs, perhaps, or Brian Sullivan, each 5 feet 11 inches  took the ball down the court and was met by a humid jungle of arms. Iowas lengthy, lithe forwards were outstretched, blocking passing lanes, ready to put a hand in the Davidson players face.

title: Panic at New Orleans Airport as Police Shoot Man Who Attacked T.S.A. Officers
description: NEW ORLEANS  A 63-year-old man attacked Transportation Security Administration officers with wasp spray and a machete Friday night before he was shot by a law enforcement officer at a security gate to a busy concourse at Louis Armstrong International Airport outside New Orleans, the authorities said.

title: Jason Kidds Past Meets, and Beats, His Present (and Future)
description: The juxtaposition of the Nets and the Milwaukee Bucks on Friday provided more evidence of the capriciousness of sports fates, the fallibility of best-laid plans and the peculiarity of the Eastern Conference.

title: Oklahoma Sputters but Holds Off Feisty Albany
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Midway through the first half of Albanys game against Oklahoma, Peter Hooley planted his feet, calibrated his hips and launched a 3-point attempt high into the air.

title: Roosevelt Jones of Butler Is Cleared to Play
description: Butlers second-leading scorer, Roosevelt Jones, will be available to play against Notre Dame on Saturday.

title: Ron Hunter Says Sorry After a Poke at the President
description: Occasionally at the tournament, coaches go on entertaining tangents during their off-day news conferences.

title: Northern Iowa Player Aims to Follow Brothers Path to Final Four
description: SEATTLE  In 2001, Gordy Bohannon drove his three older sons from their home in Iowa to the Final Four in Minneapolis. After watching Duke defeat Arizona for the national championship, they drove back, and the sons told themselves that their goal was to one day play in the Final Four.

title: Readers Respond to Starbucks Race Together Initiative
description: Its early and a line of sleepy folk who just want to grab a soy latte and get to work snakes through Starbucks. But first, the barista behind the counter needs to broach a sensitive subject.

title: Suddenly Hot-Shooting San Diego State Frustrates St. Johns
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  DAngelo Harrison had just exhausted himself on the offensive end, trying to help St. Johns come back from a double-digit second-half deficit. Walking toward the raucous contingent of Red Storm fans, he shook his head back at them.

title: Gonzaga Bears Down for Win After North Dakota States Strong Start
description: SEATTLE  Gonzaga began the game pressing North Dakota State, and the Bison, the heavy underdogs, passed right through it, getting ahead of Gonzagas defenders to sink two 3-pointers. Nearly three minutes into the game, they led by 9-4.

title: Wisconsin Prevails as Coastal Carolina Fades After Strong First Half
description: OMAHA  Coastal Carolina, the No. 16 seed in the West Region of the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament, hit just enough shots to hang with top-seeded Wisconsin for the first 13 minutes of their game in the round of 64 on Friday.

title: Serena Williams Withdraws From Indian Wells With Knee Injury
description: Serena Williams withdrew from the semifinals of the BNP Paribas Open, citing a knee injury. Her withdrawal gave Simona Halep a walkover into the final.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 9 P.M. (IFC) INGLOURIOUS BASTERDS (2009) This revisionist history by Quentin Tarantino takes place during World War II as Lt. Aldo Raine (Brad Pitt) leads a special unit of Jewish American soldiers, dedicated to scalping Nazis, on to a plot to kill Hitler. Shosanna Dreyfus (Mlanie Laurent) escapes the murder of her family by Col. Hans Landa (Christoph Waltz) and his men and runs a movie theater in Paris. When the Nazis choose her theater for the premiere of a propaganda film, Shosanna begins scheming. For more Tarantino, Kill Bill: Vol. 2 plays at 8 on Showtime. The film follows Beatrix Kiddo (Uma Thurman) as she takes revenge on the Deadly Viper Assassination Squad. Mr. Tarantinos movies are about loss and betrayal, and Kill Bill Vol. 2 is a double-burger helping of those motifs, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The New York Times. It is rich, substantial and sustained, yet also greasy kids stuff.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Well, I guess the question is, which one?

title: Editors Note: March 21, 2015
description: STYLES

title: Dayton Upsets Providence in Front of Raucous Ohio Crowd
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  To earn a spot in the main portion of the N.C.A.A. tournament, Dayton slipped by Boise State this week in a play-in contest that was a virtual home game for the Flyers. When the team traveled an hour east to Columbus, it was as if the Flyers had moved from their living room to their kitchen.

title: Chinese, Japanese and South Korean Ministers to Resume Three-Way Talks
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In their first trilateral meeting in three years, the foreign ministers of South Korea, Japan and China recognized on Saturday the urgent need to stop North Koreas nuclear weapons program, South Korean officials said.

title: Movie Review: Backcountry
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Backcountry.

title: A Bustling Day on Board
description: As cruise ships grow larger, the employees attention to detail and planning have become more necessary.

title: A Luxury Liner Docks, and the Countdowns On
description: Once a week, after touring the Caribbean, the cruise ship Oasis of the Seas calls into its home port in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., for what is called turnaround day.

title: Brooklyn Fire Kills 7 Children, Citys Worst Toll Since 2007
description: A hot plate warmed food in the darkened kitchen in Brooklyn, allowing an Orthodox Jewish mother to feed her family while observing the Sabbath prohibition on lighting a flame. Upstairs, she and eight children slept.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photographers featured on @nytimes, our Instagram account, took viewers to Manhattans St. Patricks Day parade and offered a look from Air Force One.

title: Hotel Gardens Go (and Grow) Local
description: Botanists and horticulturists are being hired by hotels to help their gardens grow, with an increasing focus on indigenous flora.

title: Philadelphia Meeting Erupts Into Chaos
description: Protesters at a community meeting became disruptive and threw chairs after a district attorney announced that two police officers had been cleared in the shooting death of Brandon Tate-Brown.

title: Kerry Pushes Iran Nuclear Deal Timetable Amid Differences With France
description: LONDON  Stressing that it was time to make tough decisions, Secretary of State John Kerry said Saturday that negotiators should stick to their goal of completing an initial accord limiting Irans nuclear program by the end of March.

title: Breaking Up Is Hard for Renters
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: From Minneapolis to ISIS: An Americans Path to Jihad
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Reading back over Abdi Nurs Twitter feed, his chilling progression from the basketball courts of South Minneapolis to the battlefields of Syria is clear.

title: A Tough Business
description: Heres a writeup of the panel that brought me to SXSW. As you might expect, the Butler brothers from Arcade Fire are really well-spoken and interesting; basically, Im pretty sure they could do my job, whereas theres no way I could do theirs.

title: Review: In the Comic Baskerville at the McCarter Theater Center, Sherlock Holmes Investigates a Curse
description: The mystery inside the mystery of Baskerville is why this fairly amusing play isnt funnier. Indeed, so many of the elements are first-rate  skilled actors and a clever staging at the McCarter Theater Center in Princeton among them  that it can feel downright puzzling when jokes miss their marks. Sure, there are laughs. But it often seems that they should be louder.

title: Fatal Fire in Brooklyn
description: Seven children died in a two-alarm fire at a house in the Midwood neighborhood that was caused by a hot plate.

title: Carter Burwell, Writing Music to Watch Corpses By
description: What kind of movie music best suits a psychopath?

title: Variety: A Constrained Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  It is debatable whether the CORSET will ever regain the popularity it seems to have had during the VICTORIAN era, but there is still a contingent of women  and drag queens  who enjoy the shape it gives to their figures.

title: In The Pianist of Willesden Lane, Holding On to Her Mothers Memories
description: After performances of her one-woman show, Mona Golabek said, people sometimes ask her, Why wasnt I warned to bring more handkerchiefs?

title: Izola Ware Curry, Who Stabbed King in 1958, Dies at 98
description: Izola Ware Curry, the mentally ill woman who in 1958 stabbed the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. at a Harlem book signing  an episode that a decade later would become a rhetorical touchstone in the last oration of his life  died on March 7 in Queens. She was 98.

title: This Time, Serena Williams Is Cheered as She Leaves Indian Wells
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  In a stark change from 2001, Serena Williams was cheered upon her exit from the Indian Wells tournament on Friday night. Unlike 2001, when she was booed mercilessly, she did not win the tournament, but had to withdraw from the semifinals of the BNP Paribas Open with an injury to her right knee.

title: At Kenta in Melville, the Menu Is Adventurous and Fun
description: Few Asian restaurants on Long Island have the firepower of Kenta, a newcomer offering food described as modern Asian with Japanese influences.

title: Chuck Bednarik, Eagles Man of Concrete, Dies at 89
description: Chuck Bednarik, the Philadelphia Eagles Hall of Fame center and linebacker, one of the last N.F.L. players to commonly play on both offense and defense and a legendary football tough guy, died Saturday in Richland, Pa. He was 89.

title: A Maven of Money Law
description: Obrea Poindexter is a lawyer at Morrison & Foerster in Washington.

title: Bringing African Shoppers to the Global Mall
description: Last year, when Tunde Adebayo needed three inflatable bouncy castles for KidzPlay, his event-planning business in Lagos, Nigeria, he turned to an online shopping service called MallforAfrica.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: A High School Where a Student Might Letter in Polo
description: When the billionaire William I. Koch spent $60 million to start the Oxbridge Academy in West Palm Beach, Fla., he vowed to teach children how things get done in the real world.

title: Ways to Put the Bosss Skin in the Game
description: Life is not fair, I know, but this is getting ridiculous.

title: Writing My Way to a New Self
description: I stared at the head counselor with a mixture of defiance, annoyance and heartbreak. She had just informed me that she was demoting me. Gone was the prestige position of senior counselor for a group of 13-year-old girls, and in its place, a midlevel position as a co-counselor for a group of 11-year-olds.

title: Under Health Care Act, Many Tax Filers Are Discovering Costly Complications
description: PITTSBURGH  When he signed up for health insurance through the Affordable Care Act last fall, J. C. Ciesielski estimated his income at $19,400, qualifying him for a federal subsidy that cut his premiums in half. But Mr. Ciesielski, an actor, earned an extra $2,340 from a voice-over job in December, and that welcome bit of income proved problematic when he did his taxes this month.

title: Princeton Remains Unbeaten as Obama Watches
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md.  They were undefeated at 30-0 and perhaps under-respected, too, with a low seeding that left them feeling like the oddest underdogs in recent N.C.A.A. tournament memory.

title: Scottish Party May Prove Crucial to Future of Britains Nuclear Fleet
description: FASLANE, Scotland  Britains aging nuclear-armed submarines, the force that keeps the nation in the first tier of global powers, have been the target of spirited if largely ineffectual protests by antiwar activists for more than three decades here in the fleets home port.

title: The Curious (and Vital) Power of Print
description: WHO buys the print edition of the newspaper? Just a few Luddites who wouldnt know a smartphone if their horse-drawn buggy crushed it on the cobblestones? Octogenarians and their older brothers?

title: Second Person Dies After Taxi Jumps Curb in the Bronx
description: A 5-year-old girl who was among four people struck by a taxi that jumped a curb in the Bronx on Friday night has died, making her the second person killed in the crash, the police said on Saturday.

title: Angry Protest Over New Bishop in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Hundreds of demonstrators dressed in black barged into a cathedral in a city in southern Chile on Saturday and interrupted the installation ceremony for the citys new Roman Catholic bishop, Juan Barros, whom they accuse of complicity in a notorious case of clerical sexual abuse, blocking his passage and shouting, Barros, get out of the city!

title: Riled Herpetologists Press Obama Administration to Protect Americas Salamanders from a Fungal Threat
description: The herpetologists Ive met over the decades tend to be a retiring lot. Explore the website of the Herpetologists League to get the idea. They hunker down and probe under rotting logs and leaf litter for salamanders or prowl deserts to study tortoises and lizards. Some study ancient specimens in dusty jars. That was the case with the first herpetologist I got to know, during a junior semester abroad in London in 1977. I approached Garth Underwood (yes), at Londons Natural History Museum about undertaking a line of independent study. Underwoodset me to work dissecting water snakes, some more than a century old, to look for differences between the sexes. (He passed away in 2002.)

title: Why Health Care Tech Is Still So Bad
description: LAST year, I saw an ad recruiting physicians to a Phoenix-area hospital. It promoted state-of-the-art operating rooms, dazzling radiology equipment and a lovely suburban location. But only one line was printed in bold: No E.M.R.

title: For College Basketball Players, Skin Is No Longer In
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  In a game with so many tall people, you might expect a little more leg.

title: ISIS Urges Sympathizers to Kill U.S. Service Members It Identifies on Website
description: WASHINGTON  In a new online threat to American military personnel, the Islamic State has called on its members and sympathizers in the United States to kill 100 service members whose names, photos and purported addresses it posted on a website.

title: Its a Whole New Paranoid World
description: THERE is probably nothing about me that is not in the hands of hackers.

title: No Seasonal Fix for the Economy
description: Some economic forecasters have pinned their hopes for an improvement in the economy on this years early Easter to boost consumer spending after a brutal winter.

title: Gregory Doran
description: Gregory Doran is the artistic director of the Royal Shakespeare Company in Stratford-upon-Avon, England.

title: Brazils Dim Voice on the World Stage
description: When Dilma Rousseff was elected president of Brazil in 2010, industry was thriving and her goal of stamping out poverty in the worlds seventh-largest economy appeared within reach. Many Brazilians hoped that Ms. Rousseff, a former political prisoner, would establish a legacy as a transformational head of state at home and abroad.

title: Two Women, Opposite Fortunes
description: LUANDA, Angola  THIS is the tale of two women, each an emblem, in her own way, of one of the worlds most corrupt and dysfunctional nations.

title: A Football Players Safe Exit
description: It takes a special kind of professional football player to walk away from cheering crowds and multimillion-dollar paychecks. But that is what Chris Borland, a star rookie for the San Francisco 49ers, felt compelled to do in the face of mounting evidence that the games repetitive head trauma could leave him gravely and permanently damaged. I just thought to myself, What am I doing?  the 24-year-old defensive player explained in an interview with ESPN.  Is this how Im going to live my adult life, banging my head, especially with what Ive learned and know about the dangers?

title: Why Jeb Bush Might Lose
description: IF youre keeping score during the endless 2016 preseason, this was a pretty good week for Jeb Bush.

title: Our Immigration Policy
description: Readers discuss whether undocumented immigrants should be legitimized and integrated into the United States economy.

title: In College and Hiding From Scary Ideas
description: KATHERINE BYRON, a senior at Brown University and a member of its Sexual Assault Task Force, considers it her duty to make Brown a safe place for rape victims, free from anything that might prompt memories of trauma.

title: Whats New, Pussycat? Meerkat!
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  PITY the poor cat.

title: Just How Nepotistic Are We?
description: THERE is a very real chance that the presidential election in 2016 will pit Jeb Bush against Hillary Clinton. According to oddsmakers, this is the likeliest outcome.

title: What Begat What
description: IN a recent Daily Beast article, we learned that the two-way wrist radio worn by the cartoon character Dick Tracy helped pave the way for Apples new smartwatch, which can make and receive phone calls. I have been wanting to do this since I was 5 years old, said Apples chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, referring to 1965 when he became besotted with the fictional detectives gizmo.

title: Renewing Call to End Turkey Conflict, Kurdish Rebel Leader Hails New Era
description: ISTANBUL  The jailed Kurdish rebel leader Abdullah Ocalan on Saturday renewed a call for his fighters to disarm and end a long conflict with Turkey, hailing a new era in relations between Turks and Kurds.

title: A Changing Los Angeles
description: Gentrification comes to areas of the city.

title: Viva Gentrification!
description: LOS ANGELES  FOR years, our family journeys have taken us from our hillside home, in the multiethnic Mount Washington district of northeast Los Angeles, into the flatlands of the Latino barrios that surround it.

title: Review: Ariana Grande Leaves Nickelodeon in the Rearview Mirror
description: The first time Ariana Grande cried on Friday night at Madison Square Garden was a little before the halfway mark of her show.

title: U.C.L.A. Romps Past U.A.B. With Unselfish Play and Domination in the Paint
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  This time, pluck was no match for pedigree, as U.C.L.A. turned to one extraordinary offensive player after another on Saturday to thwart another upset bid by the University of Alabama at Birmingham.

title: A 50-Year Party, A Legend Revised
description: The ever-innovative Meredith Monk, a composer, dancer, singer, choreographer, director and filmmaker, is celebrating the 50th anniversary of her professional career. On Sunday at Carnegie Hall, she is joined by her acclaimed Vocal Ensemble  which champions her distinctive technique  and a host of musicians from the classical, jazz and D.J. worlds. Those colleagues will include the Bang on a Can All-Stars, Lukas Ligeti, John Zorn, Missy Mazzoli, Jessye Norman and DJ Spooky, performing an all-Monk program. (3 p.m., Zankel Hall, carnegiehall.org.)

title: A Toxic Wasteland Called Home
description: Since he was a college student, the Houston artist Trenton Doyle Hancock has been drawing into existence a world that might be what Texas would look like if all of the states oil were to bubble up and turn it into a toxic zombie wasteland. Populated by creatures called Mounds, the work seems to be the residue of a postmodern fever dream, borrowing as much from museum walls (Peter Saul, Mike Kelley) as from comic-book pages (Basil Wolverton, Spain Rodriguez).

title: On TV, That Thing With Feathers
description: Masterpiece isnt a word to be thrown around lightly, but theres no denying that Mark Morriss LAllegro, il Penseroso ed il Moderato is thrillingly that. Choreographed in 1988, when Mr. Morris was the director of dance at the Thtre Royal de la Monnaie in Brussels, this production, at long last, has been preserved on film by Great Performances and can be seen on PBS on Friday night. (Check local listings.) Set to Handels 1740 oratorio based on Miltons pastoral poems, this performance by the Mark Morris Dance Group was recorded in 2014 at the Teatro Real in Madrid. Using dance, music, poetry and visual design  Adrianne Lobels series of color planes, inspired by watercolors of William Blake, moves right along with the dancers  the production, as the host, Mikhail Baryshnikov, summarizes, reveals joy, abandon, restraint, dignity and pride for humankind.

title: The Lengths to Go for Love
description: You, there  you are worthy of love. How would you like to be loved this week? There are two options  two that count, at least.

title: Eloise and Hilary, Together Again
description: Her hair was in perpetual disarray, her stomach hung over her skirt, and the things that came out of her mouth werent always very nice. But Eloise, that 6-year-old imp running amok at the Plaza Hotel, inspired the fantasies of many a precocious child and more than a few adults  not least Lena Dunham of Girls renown, who had Eloises likeness tattooed on her back at 17.

title: A Mothers Clutch Makes Its Mark
description: Perspectives from a local and international standpoint distinguish the fifth annual New Voices in Black Cinema, running Thursday through next Sunday at BAMCinmatek. The festival begins with the world premiere of Knucklehead, the writer-director Ben Bowmans drama about a mentally disabled youth (Gbenga Akinnagbe, from The Wire) who struggles to survive life in Brooklyn public housing after the shooting of his brother and the predations of his abusive mother (a terrifying Alfre Woodard). Mr. Bowman and Mr. Akinnagbe field questions after the screening.

title: Democratic Booms
description: Everyone in the Republican Party knows that Reagan presided over an economy that has never been equalled, before or since. When I was on TV with Rand Paul, he confidently declared

title: Yankees Squint and Flail Under the Dim Lights of Their Spring Training Stadium
description: TAMPA, Fla.  As the sun set behind George M. Steinbrenner Field on Thursday night, the lights atop the eight towers strained to illuminate the baseball game below.

title: Threats by Yemens Warring Parties Escalate Crisis
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  From sparring seats of power across an increasingly divided country, Yemens president and the Houthi rebels who forced his government into exile traded ultimatums and threats on Saturday, escalating tensions after days of unrelenting violence.

title: Myanmars Fight With Rebels Creates Refugees and Ill Will With China
description: BEIJING  When rumors spread around the sugar-cane farms in northern Myanmar that the army was advancing, Li Jiapeng and his family packed some clothes, grabbed some cash and joined a long line of people fleeing in cars and on foot. Everyone was heading for safety on the other side of the border in China, just six miles away.

title: With History as Their Guide, Ducks Are on a Tempered Roll
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  The Anaheim Ducks have a young roster, an enviable salary-cap situation, immense resilience to adversity and the N.H.L.s best record, yet none of that seems to matter in their dressing room.

title: Anthony Davis Is Unstoppable, Except on the Road to His First Playoffs
description: It may seem odd to suggest that the clock is ticking for Anthony Davis to make the playoffs in just his third season. But when a player as talented as Davis comes around, the wait for the postseason is generally rather short.

title: ATP Tour Officials Seek Ways to Heighten the Profile of Doubles Players
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  The BNP Paribas Open has long been known for the strength of its doubles field, and this year was no exception, with nine of the top 10 singles players entered. But few ATP Tour events are as fortunate.

title: Chocolates: Reviews of Holstens in Bloomfield, Chocodiem in Clinton and the Fudge Shoppe in Flemington
description: Poor Tony Soprano. When he visited Holstens in the final episode of The Sopranos, he ordered only the onion rings.

title: White Sox Open Checkbook After Once Being Tight With Bullpen Budget
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  The strategy sounds wise, because each point behind it is sound. Relief pitchers are notoriously unpredictable. With shrewd scouting and coaching, teams can find effective, low-cost bullpen arms. Therefore, it is foolish to spend big on relievers.

title: A Review: At Coals in Bronxville, Pizzas on the Grill
description: Good pizza has been easy to find in Westchester for years. Beyond the traditional New York-style pizza available on virtually every streetcorner, there is the Neapolitan puffy-crusted version from places like Zero Otto Nove in Armonk, wonderful experiments with toppings like the white clam pie at Frank Pepes in Yonkers and numerous interpretations of flatbread pizza across the county.

title: Curtain Rises on a Spanish Second Act
description: Making a great first impression in a community, never mind maintaining it for more than a decade, is a coup for any chef. But when a culinary ace has built a reputation with a particular restaurant, planning a second act presents its own challenges. How best to follow up, when your opening set has already been so well received?

title: In Just Kids From the Bronx, Famous Names Recall Their Roots
description: Real New Yorkers never tire of tales about Brooklyn, but for 20th-century nostalgia, the Bronx ranks a close second. Reinforcing that point, Arlene Alda has collected more than 60 evocative oral histories in Just Kids From the Bronx: Telling It the Way It Was (Henry Holt and Co.).

title: Assailant Shot at New Orleans Airport Is Dead
description: NEW ORLEANS  The machete-wielding man who attacked officers at a security checkpoint at the New Orleans airport on Friday night and was shot by a sheriffs deputy died on Saturday, law enforcement officials said.

title: Documentaries Are the Go-To Players of Sports Television
description: You have probably seen many of the films. There was The Fab Five, about the rise and fall of a fabled Michigan basketball recruiting class, and The U, which told the story of Miami football so well that its director made a sequel. More recently, Of Miracles and Men described the 1980 Olympic hockey tournament from the less familiar Soviet teams point of view, and Duke-loathing basketball fans were treated to the analytic probing of I Hate Christian Laettner.

title: Giants Sign Defensive End George Selvie
description: The Giants continued their understated accumulation of free agents Friday by signing the former Dallas Cowboys defensive end George Selvie to a one-year, $1.4 million contract. Selvie is the seventh free agent the team has acquired in the last 10 days, a list that includes signed the former Jets defensive tackle Kenrick Ellis.

title: Unstated Factor in Iran Talks: Threat of Nuclear Tampering
description: WASHINGTON  In late 2012, just as President Obama and his aides began secretly sketching out a diplomatic opening to Iran, American intelligence agencies were busy with a parallel initiative: The latest spy-vs.-spy move in the decade-long effort to sabotage Tehrans nuclear infrastructure.

title: Deadly Fire in Brooklyn Renews Concerns Over a Weekly Ritual
description: In the hours after a malfunctioning hot plate started a fast-moving blaze that killed seven brothers and sisters in an Orthodox Jewish neighborhood of Brooklyn on Saturday, a Fire Department official went door to door at nearby homes handing out pamphlets titled Fire Safety for Jewish Observances.

title: Upsides
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Hey, whats UP? Everyone having a good spring so far? Here, in the Northeast, we are celebrating the arrival of spring not by dancing around a maypole or planning a picnic, but by shoveling snow. As my parents used to say, life is not always fair, but it is almost always interesting. The UPSIDE to a frosty spring weekend is that we can hole UP with a spicy hot chocolate and the Sunday puzzle.

title: Arrests Made in Attack on Tunisian Museum
description: TUNIS  The Tunisian authorities have arrested more than 20 people in the investigation into Wednesdays attack at the National Bardo Museum in Tunis, including 10 the authorities say were directly tied to the deadly assault, a spokesman for the Ministry of the Interior said Saturday.

title: Kentucky Doesnt Crack, Even as Cincinnatis Defense Raises the Pressure
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Kentucky center Willie Cauley-Stein sat on a bench in the Wildcats locker room wearing a T-shirt featuring the menacing face of the Incredible Hulk and talked about Cincinnatis menacing play.

title: Yankees Cross a State to Play Against a Crosstown Rival
description: TAMPA, Fla.  C. C. Sabathia chuckled at the almost apologetic question: Would it mean anything to him to be starting Sunday against the Mets and their ace Matt Harvey when the Yankees travel across the state to play their crosstown rivals?

title: Gonzaga Becomes a Melting Pot for Recruits From Across the Globe
description: SEATTLE  During Gonzagas 86-76 victory against North Dakota State on Friday night, forward Domantas Sabonis was fouled hard under the basket. He lay on his stomach for a moment until guard Byron Wesley ran over and stuck his hands beneath him as if lifting a piece of furniture.

title: Study Suggests That Hitters Production Dips After They Return From Concussions
description: Concussions are not as common in Major League Baseball as they are in professional football, but they happen often enough, with players getting hit by pitches, running into walls or catching a knee in the head sliding into a base. Catchers are particularly at risk  a foul tip off the mask will snap the neck back and give the brain a solid rattle. Collisions at the plate take a toll, too.

title: For a St. Francis Player, UConn, Long an Inspiration, Turns Rival
description: STORRS, Conn.  When Sarah Benedetti moved to Canton, Conn., as a fifth grader in 2004, she almost immediately started rooting for the University of Connecticuts basketball teams. That year, UConn became the first Division I university to win the national titles in mens and womens basketball.

title: Oklahomas Spotty Road Record Doesnt Worry Buddy Hield
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  The Oklahoma star guard Buddy Hield sat in his teams locker room on Saturday afternoon picking at a bag of Cheetos. His snack was interrupted by a gaggle of reporters who entered the teams lair with questions about an upcoming game against Dayton, which will play in what is essentially its third home game in five days in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Chicago Mayors Race Is Cast as a Test of Liberalism
description: CHICAGO  Mayor Rahm Emanuel had just finished the quintessential municipal politics photo op, briefly inspecting a dusty street-paving project on a block of the South Side lined with tidy brick bungalows.

title: An Illegal Boxing Club in the Bronx
description: Though unsanctioned, BX Fight Club aims to foster respect and redirect aggression among young men in the rougher sections of the Bronx.

title: Duke and San Diego State Share a Long History
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The last time Duke Coach Mike Krzyzewski and San Diego States Steve Fisher faced each other in an N.C.A.A. tournament game, it was the 1992 national championship game in Minneapolis, and Fisher was coaching the Fab Five of Michigan. Of course, Krzyzewski and Duke won that game for their second consecutive title.

title: Andalusia Election a Measure of Spains Disillusionment
description: SEVILLE, Spain  Spains Socialists have run Andalusia, the countrys largest region, for 33 years, a bastion built on the partys role in transforming the farming region by ushering Spain into the European Union in the 1980s.

title: A San Diego State Forward Is Monitored by His Coach and an Implant
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  When San Diego State forward Dwayne Polee II collapsed in the middle of a game against U.C.-Riverside on Dec. 22, it could have meant the end of his basketball career. But an irregular heartbeat that requires a monitor implanted in his chest hasnt stopped Polee or his team.

title: Gone Spearfishin
description: The sturgeon spearfishing season at Lake Winnebago, the largest lake in Wisconsin, attracts ice fishermen to the lake and relatives and neighbors to the check-ins.

title: The Groups That May Decide the Chicago Mayoral Election
description: Who Rahm Emanuel needs to win over to keep his seat in the April 7 runoff.

title: Arizona Goes Long to Defeat Ohio State
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  In a game featuring soon-to-be N.B.A. players and beefy big men, it was Arizonas long-bombing guards who led the Wildcats to the round of 16 with a 73-58 victory over Ohio State.

title: Jeb Bushs Team Plots Vast Effort to Win Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  The political apparatus surrounding former Gov. Jeb Bush, determined to avoid embarrassment in a state that has vexed his party and family in national elections, is plotting a vast operation aimed at turning Florida into a bulwark for his presidential campaign, according to dozens of interviews.

title: Obama Says He Told Netanyahu That Talk Before Election Hurt the Peace Process
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said he has told Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the Israeli leaders remarks in the closing days of his re-election campaign had upended the Israeli-Palestinian peace process and ran counter to the very nature of Israeli democracy, an unusually forceful and public condemnation of the top official of a vital United States ally.

title: Double Eagle Bolsters Daniel Berger, a Rookie, at Bay Hill
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  After a 300-yard drive on Bay Hills par-5 sixth hole on Saturday, Daniel Berger had a downhill lie and a difficult decision. The 540-yard hole wraps around a lake like a backward C, and if Berger wanted to try for the green, his second shot would be flirting with the water.

title: As Three Alfords Lead U.C.L.A., a Fourth Anchors the Family
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  At one point during U.C.L.A.s victory on Saturday, the blonde behind the Bruins bench stood just feet behind Coach Steve Alford, and was almost his mirror image.

title: Rematch in the Desert for Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  One dominating with returns, the other with serves, Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer marched on toward another meeting in the desert.

title: Before Judges, the Godfathers Become Sick Old Grandfathers
description: Not long ago, Thomas DiFiore cut an intimidating figure. For a time, he was the highest-ranking member of the Bonanno organized crime family not behind bars, despite a long record of arrests on charges of kidnapping, assault, promoting gambling and extortion. Even at 70, Mr. DiFiore did not seem to falter when challenging another aging Bonanno leader in 2013 for more than his share of a loan payment, according to prosecutors account of a government wiretap.

title: Xavier, No Stranger to Upsets, Prevents One by Georgia State
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  The Xavier Musketeers were once N.C.A.A. tournament darlings, a plucky program and bottom-bracket seed looking to make a name. They understood the ride 14th-seeded Georgia State wanted to continue Saturday night and knew an upset lurked here at Jacksonville Veterans Memorial Arena.

title: Kansas and Wichita States Unfulfilled Rivalry Receives a Little Help
description: OMAHA  They had one conversation about it. One. And it was not even formal.

title: North Carolina State Adds to Its Lore by Shocking Top-Seeded Villanova
description: PITTSBURGH  Around North Carolina States program, its 1983 national title comes up from time to time. Coach Mark Gottfried makes sure it does. One of his top assistants, Dereck Whittenburg, played on that team, and he, too, reminds the current players of the Wolfpacks brush with glory.

title: Wisconsin Forward Plays Word Games
description: OMAHA  Wisconsin forward Nigel Hayes calls himself a lover of words, especially long, unusual ones. Saturday, at Wisconsins off-day news conference before the Badgers round of 32 game with Oregon, Hayes playfully tested the spelling skills of the stenographer transcribing his words for the news media.

title: Mets Demote Steven Matz, a Top Prospect, After a Solid Outing
description: LAKELAND, Fla.  Everything about Steven Matzs spring had an air of expectation.

Kaminski of Orchard Park, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel P. Metzger, a Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony at Old Zion Lutheran Church, of which he is the pastor.

The third-seeded Fighting Irish proved as much Saturday night, escaping a tussle with sixth-seeded Butler to prevail, 67-64, in overtime, at Consol Energy Center to advance to the Midwest Regional semifinals in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Ted Cruz Hopes Early Campaign Entry Will Focus Voters Attention
description: The venue has little personal significance for him, but the timing of Senator Ted Cruzs formal entry into the 2016 presidential field on Monday is full of meaning, as he seeks to catapult to the forefront of an increasingly competitive cluster of conservatives vying for the Republican nomination.

title: Corrections: March 22, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 12:30 P.M. (13) IL BARBIERE DI SIVIGLIA Lawrence Brownlee sings the role of the love-struck Count Almaviva; Isabel Leonard is Rosina, the feisty doctors ward who has captured his heart; and Christopher Maltman, making a spectacular entrance atop a traveling barber shop pulled by admirers, is Figaro in this Metropolitan Opera revival of Rossinis comic classic. The production, staged by Bartlett Sher, conducted by Michele Mariotti and presented here by Great Performances at the Met, delivers a heady fizz, Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim wrote in The New York Times. And it has stars, she added  among them, Mr. Brownlee, who made a dashing Almaviva, singing with a focused, ardent tenor; Ms. Leonard, a pitch-perfect Rosina, cute but sharp-clawed; and Mr. Maltman (above right, with Mr. Brownlee and Ms. Leonard), who oozed sex appeal during his opening aria, Largo al factotum, wearing a magnificent red Phrygian cap like a royal insignia.

title: Melody Hwang and Craig Muhlrad
description: Melody Hwang, a daughter of May Hwang and Andrew B. Hwang of South Pasadena, Calif., was married Saturday to Craig Scott Muhlrad, the son of Patricia Samuels Muhlrad and Dr. Jeffrey S. Muhlrad of Old Field, N.Y. Rabbi Arthur Rosenberg officiated at Calamigos Equestrian Terrace, an event space at the Los Angeles Equestrian Center in Burbank, Calif.

title: Brianna Serrano,  Jason Pierce
description: Brianna Kay Serrano and Jason Matthew Pierce were married Friday at Twin Oaks Garden Estate in San Marcos, Calif. Bethel Nathan, a pastor in the Church of Spiritual Humanism, officiated.
