description: Residents in the town of Pahoa on Hawaiis Big Island talk about what its like to live in the path of a very, very slow-moving natural disaster.

title: A Musical Plea for Immigration Reform
description: Immigration reform, once such a hopeful subject, is now stuck in a scorched and barren place. Legislation is dead in Congress. The 2016 presidential primary race is about to re-energize the Republican Partys nativists, as candidates  following the example set Monday by the hard-right Senator Ted Cruz  start lining up to denounce unauthorized immigrants and pledge their allegiance to the fantasy of a sealed border. Meanwhile, President Obamas program to give deportation relief to some unauthorized immigrants has been stymied, nationwide, by a hostile federal district judge in Texas.

title: How to Avoid the Sex-Trafficking Bills Surprise
description: A once-popular bill to help victims of sex trafficking was derailed in the Senate recently when Democrats discovered that language restricting funding for abortions was in the bill  sneaked in, they charged, by Republicans.

description: No one would mistake Courtroom Nine in the federal courthouse, where the Boston Marathon bomber trial is underway, for a piano bar.

title: Flurry of Freight Spurs New Commercial Building Construction in Georgia
description: GARDEN CITY, Ga.  The business of marine transport here at the nations fourth-largest container port is a study in numbers.

description: The Airbus A320 operated by a budget subsidiary of Lufthansa crashed while en route to Dsseldorf from Barcelona.

title: Slack Said to Be in Talks to Raise Money at More Than $2 Billion Valuation
description: Slack, the San Francisco start-up that makes a workplace collaboration app, is back on the fund-raising trail and is in talks to raise money at a valuation of more than $2 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter. The talks come just four months after Slack, which is run by the entrepreneur Stewart Butterfield, raised $120 million at a valuation of more than $1 billion. The valuation could change because the talks are still occurring, according to this person, who requested anonymity because of continuing ties to the company.

title: Ted Cruz Recruits Some Rand Paul Supporters in Iowa
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, whose path to the Republican nomination requires a breakout performance in Iowa, has quickly recruited more than a dozen party leaders for his statewide campaign, who are to be announced in coming days, according to people told of the choices.

title: As Arizona Struggles to Fix Foster System, Children Suffer the Consequences
description: PHOENIX  She was just 5 months old the first time she and her siblings were taken from a mother struggling with addiction and placed in the care of the state. At times, she was separated from her brothers and sisters. She received neither the glasses she needed, nor the orthopedic shoes, leaving her with a limp. Now 10, she has spent more than half her life in foster care, having been returned to her mother only to be removed again, a routine that has been repeated multiple times.

title: $20 Million Gift to Expand National World War II Museum
description: The National World War II Museum is to announce on Tuesday a $20 million gift that will be used to add a Canopy of Peace to the New Orleans campus as part of the museums expansion.

title: Review: Daniel Beaty as Paul Robeson in The Tallest Tree in the Forest
description: The lives of actors often contain heady highs and dispiriting lows, so fragile is their hold on the publics imagination and their access to the levers of power in the industry. But the story of Paul Robeson, the great African-American performer who achieved international fame in the 1920s and 30s, only to be condemned for his political beliefs and branded a Communist during the witch hunts of the 50s, is a particularly egregious example of a star falling at warp speed.

title: Former Fed Board Member to Advise Hedge Fund
description: As a member of the Federal Reserves board, Jeremy C. Stein raised concerns about areas of frothiness in the financial markets.

title: Commemoration of Death of Lincoln Features Report From a Doctor in the House
description: The National Archives in Washington is commemorating the 150th anniversary of the death of Abraham Lincoln with a series of book talks, a panel discussion and the exhibition of a key document relating to the assassination: a copy of the death report drafted a day after the shooting by Charles A. Leale, a doctor in the audience at Fords Theater.

title: Memo by Democrats for Education Reform Looks Ahead to 2016
description: Joe Williams, the executive director of Democrats for Education Reform, wrote to board members about polling conducted for the group, presumably in an attempt to set the terms for a policy discussion with candidates.

title: Hillary Clinton Caught Between Dueling Forces on Education: Teachers and Wealthy Donors
description: The last time she ran for president, Hillary Rodham Clinton did not have to take a position on the Common Core, Race to the Top or teacher evaluations in tenure decisions.

title: Stubborn Pay Gap Is Found in Nursing
description: Male nurses make $5,100 more on average per year than female colleagues in similar positions, researchers reported on Tuesday.

title: Ocwen to Sell Servicing Rights on $25 Billion in Mortgages to Nationstar
description: Ocwen Financial, the mortgage servicing firm under regulatory scrutiny, disclosed on Tuesday that it planned to sell loan servicing rights for $25 billion in loans to another firm, Nationstar Mortgage.

title: Scene City: Mad Men Toasts Its Final Season
description: On Sunday night, the stars of Mad Men celebrated the shows final season with a party at the Museum of Modern Art. For better or for worse, its not only the longest job Ive ever had but certainly the career-defining one, to say the least, Jon Hamm said. Yeah, I will definitely miss it.

title: Cocktail Table Service Thinks Big
description: Whenever the bartender Pamela Wiznitzer goes home to Ohio at Thanksgiving, her family naturally enlists her to make drinks.

title: 1915: Ankles Baffle Court Witness
description: The ankles of Mrs. Claudia Carlstedt Wheeler, once a New York stage favorite, were not recognized by a witness brought to testify against her in the Supreme Court yesterday [March 8]. Neither was her face or figure. Judson Rogers, night clerk of the San Remo Hotel, decided that she was not the woman with whom Walter W. Green had registered as man and wife. Mrs. Wheeler appeared before Justice Greenbaum and a jury to contest the action for divorce brought by Albert Gallatin Wheeler, Jr., son of the builder of the Chicago elevated railroad.  The New York Herald, European Edition, March 25, 1915

title: Trusted Aide Declines Formal Role in a Clinton Campaign
description: Cheryl D. Mills, an adviser to Hillary Rodham Clinton who has been closer to her than perhaps any other over the last six years, will not be playing a formal role in her soon-to-be-announced presidential bid, according to people in direct discussions with the campaign.

title: Why Wall Streeters Defections to Silicon Valley Are Good News for the Economy
description: Its easy to understand why Ruth Porat, the chief financial officer of the venerable investment bank Morgan Stanley and one of the most powerful women on Wall Street, would want to head west to become C.F.O. of Google.

title: Festival Dressing at SXSW
description: The South by Southwest festival in Austin, Tex., marks the beginning of the music festival season, and the start of springtime weather and fashion. Outside of Red7, music fans show off their bleached and dyed locks and denim.

title: After a Babys Arrival, Some Visit, and Others Stay Away
description: Since our daughter Evy got the go-ahead to be in the world, the parade of visitors hasnt stopped. Yes, we had visitors before she was strong enough to be in public, but we kept things small, limiting visits to one or two people, and no children allowed, because of their germiness. It was tough to say that to people, but thanks to Skype and FaceTime, children on both sides of the family got a chance to see Evy for themselves, even if it was via webcam.

title: Liberals, Conservatives, and Jobs
description: Just about everything I write evokes vituperative reactions from the usual suspects, but never so much as when I point out awkward facts. So there was a lot of mud-slinging when I pointed out last summer that Californias economy  which conservatives said was doomed by tax increases and generally liberal policies  was in fact experiencing an impressive recovery.

title: A Simple Recipe for Pasta With Mussels
description: Pasta with mussels is one of those complex-tasting dishes that is simple to make. Steam mussels in white wine with chopped shallot and crushed garlic for a few minutes, just until they open. Set mussels aside, then strain and reserve some of the briny broth, which will enrich a light marinara sauce.

title: Radio and TV Mart, U.S. Broadcasters to Cuba, Emerge From Cold War Past Facing Uneasy Future
description: MIAMI  The rat-a-tat Cuban-inflected Spanish of the two Radio Mart hosts ricocheted back and forth during Revoltillo, a show laced with humor that airs classified ads posted in Cuba on a Craigslist-style website called Revolico.

title: 2015 James Beard Award Nominees
description: Nominees for the annual James Beard Awards, which honor chefs, restaurants, writers and other professionals in the world of American food, were announced Tuesday morning. The list of restaurant and chef nominees is below; the winners will be announced in Chicago on May 4. A full list of nominees in print, broadcast and other categories can be found on the James Beard Foundation website.

title: Live Chat With Amy Klein: Tuesday, March 24, 9 P.M. Eastern Time
description: Amy Klein will be answering questions about her journey from infertility treatment to pregnancy here tonight (Tuesday, March 24, 2015) at 9 Eastern Time, and Ill be moderating quickly so that conversation can flow fast and furious.

title: Hausfrau, by Jill Alexander Essbaum
description: Anna Benz, the heroine of Jill Alexander Essbaums frequently engrossing first novel, is a very bad girl indeed: indiscriminate in her philandering, highly specialized in secrets and lies and deeply invested in her own misery. Worst of all, she cant even come clean to her shrink. When will you trust me enough to tell me everything? wonders her exasperated psychiatrist, Frau Doktor Messerli.

title: Little Park
description: Andrew Carmellinis latest restaurant in TriBeCa

title: Restaurant Review: Little Park in TriBeCa
description: It is as colorful and otherworldly as a coral reef, this row of fried cauliflower knobs in purple, ivory and marigold yellow. Wrapping each floret is a pale-gold skin of batter. Its almost invisible, but you feel it as you bite, its soft snap reinforced by the full-on crunch of chopped almonds. Poached before it is fried, the cauliflower is nicely salted all the way down to its tender core, but it is still cauliflower, so it needs a little support. This is supplied by a lush green tomatillo, pistachio and fresh herb sauce that gets in a quick, peppery jab before it signs off.

title: Joseph Kanons Leaving Berlin
description: Heroes in espionage fiction tend to fall into two categories: the world-weary professional and the rank amateur. Milo Weaver, the killer-spook of Olen Steinhauers The Tourist, and John le Carrs MI6 agent George Smiley are cynical veterans of the spying game, old hands at duplicity and betrayal. At the other end of the spectrum is the mild-mannered engineer of John Buchans The Thirty-Nine Steps, Richard Hannay, who stumbles across a German spy ring and finds himself framed for murder.

title: Israel Denies Spying on Iran Nuclear Talks
description: JERUSALEM  Three top Israeli ministers on Tuesday denied a report that their intelligence services had spied on the closed-door negotiations over Irans nuclear program, as tensions continued to mount between Washington and Jerusalem.

title: Jemima Kirkes Workout Thwarts The Usual Fitness Trends
description: The Girls actor let T into a personal training session at Brooklyn Strength, where she engages in a mix of Pilates and kettlebell work to get strong  not skinny.

title: Night at the Fiestas, by Kirstin Valdez Quade
description: In 1985, a Yale professor named Jaroslav Pelikan published Jesus Through the Centuries, a book he described as not a life of Jesus ... but a series of images portraying his place in the history of culture. These notions of Christ have been irreconcilably varied over 2,000 years, sometimes bolstering the powerful and sometimes consoling the powerless: the rabbi, the light of the gentiles, the king of kings, the cosmic Christ, the son of man, the monk who rules the world, the bridegroom of the soul, the universal man, the prince of peace, the teacher of common sense, the liberator, the man who belongs to the world.

title: Review: James Corden Is Amiable, if Not Particularly Special, in Late Late Show Debut on CBS
description: Cant act. Slightly bald. Also dances.

title: Senator Coats, Republican of Indiana, Wont Seek Re-election
description: Senator Dan Coats of Indiana announced Tuesday that he would not seek re-election in 2016, ending a political career that has spanned more than three decades and setting up a potentially competitive race in what had been thought to be a safe Republican seat.

title: Fringe Gone Wild
description: Not the wispy embellishment of days past, but a full-on takeover of a garment by its trim. At last, the ornamental becomes essential.

title: The X-Files to Return for Six-Episode Limited Series
description: Thirteen years after it went off the air, The X-Files is coming back to Fox.

title: Cuomo Drops Dream Act and Education Tax Credit From Budget
description: After Republican and Democratic leaders could not agree on a proposal that linked immigration reform with an education tax credit in Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos proposed budget, the governor said on Tuesday that both would be dropped as negotiations continued.

title: Gelso & Grand Comes to Little Italy
description: Headliner

title: A New Look for a Laguna Beach Hotel
description: The Laguna Beach House, formerly known as Laguna Cliffs Inn, will reopen April 1 after a $1.5 million renovation to update all 36 guest rooms and public spaces, including an expanded lobby and pool deck.

title: T. C. Boyle: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Harder They Come is mad about nature writing: I want to get inside the head of every creature in the world, even ants.

title: Cruz Campaign Begins With Round of TV Appearances
description: As the newly minted  and only  declared candidate for president in 2016, Senator Ted Cruz, Republican of Texas, has been a popular television guest in the last 24 hours.

title: White House Names Biden Adviser as Message Strategist
description: WASHINGTON  Shailagh Murray, a former political reporter who has spent the last four years as a senior adviser to the vice president, will move to the West Wing as the top message strategist for President Obama, the White House announced on Tuesday.

title: Readers Turn: The Marijuana Debate
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots weekly newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Details Offered in Germanwings Crash
description: The managing director of Germanwings, Thomas Winkelmann, said the Airbus A320 rapidly lost altitude for more than eight minutes before crashing in the French Alps on Tuesday.

title: Rangers Henrik Lundqvist Expects to Play This Weekend
description: The Rangers have been on a roll with goalie Cam Talbot in net, winning 17 of 24 games since he became their starter in early February.

title: 1940: Inventor of Radio Wave Dies
description: Dr. Edouard Branly, one of Frances greatest scientists and forerunner of Guglielmo Marconi in the development of wireless telegraphy, died at his home in Paris yesterday [March 24]. He was ninety-six years old. At the outbreak of the war he left Paris for Haute-Vienne and had returned to the city only recently. Although he was relatively unknown to the general public, scientific colleagues recognize that his experiments in the field of wave transmission by a park coil made possible the perfection of wireless by Marconi a few years later.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 25, 1940

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: Closed Captions on Times Videos
description: A reader, Sebastian Barrett St.Troy, likes The Timess video offerings, but wonders about one feature that, so far, is missing.

title: Ted Cruz on How 9/11 Changed His Taste in Music
description: Senator Ted Cruz, Republican of Texas and a declared candidate for president, explained on CBS how the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, turned him from a lifelong classic rock fan into a country music fan.

title: The Mother-Daughter Thing
description: You could never tell from the intriguingly opaque work of the poet Susan Howe and the artist R.H. Quaytman that the two women are related. Then you sit down with them.

title: Ex-Gov. Rick Perry of Texas Wont Discuss Cruz Candidacy
description: HOUSTON  Rick Perry, the former governor of Texas who is considering a second run for the White House after his politically disastrous 2012 campaign, sought to show off his domestic and foreign policy chops at a breakfast with reporters here on Tuesday. But he was silent when asked about Senator Ted Cruz, the conservative firebrand who announced his campaign for president on Monday.

title: Aging Ex-Mafia Boss Fails in Bid for Leniency on Jail Time
description: High blood sugar, stress, swelling of kidneys, swelling of skin, lung problems, vision issues: These were some of the medical problems enumerated by lawyers for Thomas DiFiore, a 71-year-old Mafia member, at his sentencing on Tuesday in Brooklyn.

title: Yale Researchers to Study Learning Game Apps
description: A three-year-old learning games company wants to raise the bar on how education technology start-ups measure and market the effectiveness of their products.

title: Video of Most Recent Secret Service Incident Is Shown
description: Representative Jason Chaffetz, the chairman of the House Oversight Committee, publicly aired the surveillance footage at the center of the most recent Secret Service controversy.

title: Google Should Feel Lucky in Its Finance Chief Hire
description: Google should feel lucky about its search for a new chief financial officer.

title: Grading Teachers by the Test
description: In 2004, the Chinese government decided there were too many accidental deaths. Chinas safety record, it decreed, should be brought in line with those of other middle-income countries. The State Council set a target: a decline in accidental deaths of 2.5 percent per year.

title: What Happened on the Germanwings Flight
description: Maps and timeline of what is known about the crash.

title: Arctic Ice Reaches a Low Winter Maximum
description: The winter ice covering the Arctic has reached its annual peak, but the extent this winter is smaller than it has been at the end of any since 1978.

title: A Few Words From Bill Belichick After a Super Bowl Win. Very Few.
description: PHOENIX  The coaches round table is an annual ritual at the N.F.L. owners meeting. Reporters have an hour to meet new coaches, become reacquainted with veteran ones and try their best to draw something out of New England Patriots Coach Bill Belichick.

title: Braised Brisket
description: Melissa Clark braises brisket and pairs it with a bright horseradish gremolata.

title: Rhapsody in Blue to Open 92nd Street Y Season
description: The 92nd Street Y will open its 2015-16 season in October with Gershwins Rhapsody in Blue in its original jazz band arrangement, pairing the pianist Kirill Gerstein with Vince Giordano & the Nighthawks, it announced Tuesday. Other pairings planned for the season will juxtapose Beethovens violin sonatas with contemporary works, and visual art with music.

title: Video of Secret Service Barricade Mishap
description: A March 4 surveillance video released by the House Oversight Committee shows a car driven by Secret Service agents lightly knocking a barricade around a potential bomb in front of the White House.

title: Gremolata Gives Passover Brisket a Brighter Side
description: Osso buco is one of Italys most celebrated dishes. But the soft, wine-braised veal shanks wouldnt be nearly as sublime without those vivid flecks of piquant, herbal gremolata on top. The gremolata, a jumble of parsley, garlic and lemon zest, adds its own bright notes, and functions as a contrast to the dark sauce, relieving its heady intensity.

title: No Bad Questions
description: Kids pose questions during a new sex-ed class that uses openness and humor to make The Talk less dreadful.

title: In Reversal, Boston 2024 Wants Vote on Olympic Bid
description: BOSTON  Stung by recent polling that showed only a third of Boston residents want the city to host the 2024 Summer Olympics, the group organizing the bid has reversed itself and now supports a voter referendum on the proposal, an inauspicious development for an already shaky bid.

title: Justices Rule Opinions May Sometimes Be Basis for Securities Fraud Suits
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled that statements couched as opinions may sometimes be the basis for securities fraud suits.

title: The Thorny Task of Advocating Good Corporate Behavior
description: In the war to control corporations, the California Public Employees Retirement System, the $300 billion pension fund, has decided that it is willing to actively press companies to emphasize the environment, diversity and good corporate governance, perhaps even at the expense of profitability. It may save the planet by changing the way companies are run, but will it lead to the returns Calpers desperately needs?

title: Review: On Crackle, Dead Rising: Watchtower Offers Second Helpings to Video Game Fans
description: The zombie movie Dead Rising: Watchtower might hold rewards for people who have spent hours immersed in the video game series on which its based. Judged as a free-standing film, though, its a time waster devoid of the wit and depth of other walking-dead fare currently available  see, for instance, the new CW series iZombie.

title: Angelina Jolie: More Common Than Any Celebrity Would Like to Be
description: I know Im not the only person thinking about Angelina Jolie today.

title: Review: In Lonesome Traveler, a Folk Music Journey Unfolds
description: Lonesome Traveler is full of familiar songs prettily sung, a sort of jukebox folk musical. Too bad it didnt aspire to be more; still, it sounds great.

title: Femininity With a Point
description: Michelle Obama, who opted for clothes that recalled the 50s during her Asia tour, may have been confronting stereotypes about femininity and power.

title: Air Pollution Raises Stroke Risk
description: Air pollution  even for just one day  significantly increases the risk of stroke, a large review of studies has found.

title: Second Day as a Candidate, Cruz Jabs at Bush Over Immigration
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas hasnt wasted much time in seeking to distinguish himself from his potential rivals for the Republican presidential nomination, taking issue with Jeb Bush on Tuesday for his position on immigration and implicitly criticizing the former Florida governor for treating voters as children.

title: Kimmy Schmidts Revolutionary Approach to Pain
description: You can stand anything for 10 seconds, says Kimmy Schmidt. Then you just start on a new 10 seconds.

title: Pictures of the Day: Spain and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Spain, Afghanistan, Singapore and Somalia.

title: For Michelle Obama, Girlie Clothes That Lean In
description: I admit: I was startled last week when I saw the first photos of Michelle Obama debarking in Japan at the beginning of her five-day Asian tour to promote the Let Girls Learn education campaign.

title: A Modern House With Views of Jungle and Ocean
description: In a gated community three miles from Manuel Antonio National Park, the four-bedroom home is on the market for $2.39 million.

title: Wynn Resorts Board Raises Objections to a Co-Founders Re-election
description: The battle between the co-founders of the Wynn Resorts casino company escalated on Tuesday, when the company urged stockholders in a lengthy letter to reject a bid by Elaine P. Wynn to remain on the board on grounds she was self-serving and ineffective, and had ceased to act in the companys best interest.

title: Inquiry Finds Homeland Security Official Intervened in Visa Cases
description: After an investigation lasting more than two years, the inspector general of the Department of Homeland Security has found that Alejandro Mayorkas, the deputy secretary, intervened directly to gain fast-track consideration of visas for foreign investors connected to Democrats when he was the head of the visa agency.

title: March 24, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Spain, Afghanistan, Singapore and Somalia.

title: In the Kitchen With Jackson Pollock
description: Everyone knows we eat with our eyes, and that the worlds best chefs, despite their origins or cuisine, turn out dishes as visually arresting as any work of art. But what happens when an artist, say Jackson Pollock, wears the apron? Thanks to his iconic drip masterpieces, the late painter has become a household name. And today, with the release of a new book stemmed from the contents of his former kitchen, Pollock begins his second legacy: as a foodie with a penchant for baking.

title: Obama to Slow Withdrawal in Afghanistan
description: President Obama, in an appearance with the Afghan president, Ashraf Ghani, said that delaying the withdrawal of the 9,800 American troops stationed in Afghanistan would be well worth it.

title: Review: Richard Alstons Carmen in Fort Lauderdale
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.  Richard Alstons one-act Carmen, recently performed by Miami City Ballet at the Broward Center here, is the best Carmen ballet Ive seen. That is less a compliment than it sounds: Most Carmen ballets are clunkily melodramatic and choreographically dismal.

title: A Clean Getaway at St. Lucia Resort
description: Sugar Beach, a Viceroy property on the Caribbean island of St. Lucia, will ease at least one re-entry chore for some departing guests: the laundry.

title: Jeb Bush Returns to the Washington Fund-Raising Well
description: WASHINGTON  Im not an expert on the ways of Washington, Jeb Bush told conservatives last month when he was asked about a funding dispute in Congress.

title: March Madness, the Politics Edition
description: To the delight of those who see politics as sport, Senator Ted Cruz and his aides have taken to describing the Republican primary constituencies in terms of March Madness brackets, with Final Four spots for the Establishment, Libertarians, Evangelicals and the Tea Party.

title: Manhattan Area Codes Multiply, but the Original, 212, Is Still Coveted
description: For Kelli Parker and her husband, Andy Lippitt, finding a place to live in Manhattan was secondary to obtaining what they thought would instantly identify them as New Yorkers: his-and-hers cellphone numbers with 212 area codes.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: What You Get for  $2,200,000
description: This weeks properties include homes in Colorado, New Hampshire and Chicago.

title: Will Homebuyers Come Through This Spring?
description: In real estate, the spring selling season is something of a misnomer. It gets underway around now and lasts until back-to-school season in September.

title: YouTubes Sunshine Girl Comes to Print
description: Nearly five years ago, a chirpy, animated 16-year-old named Paige McKenzie uploaded a 68-second video to YouTube. Hey everybody, so, I know this is a little strange, she says, then confides that her house is haunted and she aims to capture the ghost on camera.

title: Netflix, Amazon and Hulu No Longer Find Themselves Upstarts in Online Streaming
description: Netflix, Amazon and Hulu have suddenly found themselves playing a new role: the establishment.

title: Review: The Kidnapping of Michel Houellebecq Blurs Fiction and Reality
description: The crumpled, ashen-faced man on screen stands on a corner in Paris alone and seemingly ignored. The world is not paying attention to Michel Houellebecq, save for the off-screen movie crew and us, of course. This probably doesnt happen often to Mr. Houellebecq (pronounced WELL-beck), the French novelist whose putatively scandalous work touches on subjects  despair, sex tourism, cloning, Islamic political power, despair again  that seem calculated to provoke, especially, the humorless. A typically vulgar caricature of him was on the cover of the magazine Charlie Hebdo on Jan. 7, the day that two jihadists entered its Paris offices and set about slaughtering 12 people.

title: From Cho Junglae, a Film on Japanese Wartime Brothels
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The painting showed Japanese soldiers taking young women who had been forced to work in Japans military brothels to a burning pit. When he saw it, the Korean filmmaker Cho Junglae said, he was shocked  and inspired to make a feature film about the so-called comfort women of World War II, many of whom never made it home.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Leon Bridgess Retro Festival Style
description: Leon Bridges, a soul singer from Forth Worth, Texas, who made a splash at last weekends South By Southwest festival in Austin, talks about his high-waisted pants and the Dapper Rebels.

title: Walkers Troubles With Vetting Staff Members
description: Gov. Scott Walker faced criticism last week after a newly hired aide to his fledgling presidential campaign resigned under pressurefor derogatory remarks she had made about Iowa and its first-in-the-nation nominating contest. But the incident wasntthe first time Mr. Walker had run into a problem over an apparent lack of vetting of a staff member.

title: A Tour of Le District
description: An Eataly-type market for French food is set to open in the financial district.

title: Afghan Protesters Demand Justice for Woman Killed by Mob
description: Hundreds of Afghan protesters marched to the nations Supreme Court on Tuesday, demanding justice for a woman who was beaten to death by a mob last week after being falsely accused of burning pages from the Quran.

title: First Draft Focus: Emotional Day for a Golf Legend
Ukraine Tells Bondholders to Expect Some Losses
description: Moscow  Holders of Ukrainian bonds, already beleaguered by the last year of war and upheaval in that country, should expect to lose some of their principal in negotiations with the government, Ukraines finance minister said Tuesday.

title: Living in Mott Haven, the Bronx
description: The waterfront enclave, a mix of industrial and residential properties, is undergoing a gradual reinvention.

title: Hearing and Feeling What Photographers Are Saying
description: Chuck Kelton says most printers can get 90 percent of an image right. But that final 10 percent is where a printers darkroom skills draw out a photos magnificence.

title: Notes on the Hip-Hop Messiah
description: The hip-hop messiah is both real and not real. He  and with the possible exception of Lauryn Hill, it has always been a he  is real in the sense that every five years or so, whenever hip-hop feels too boring, or, worse, too corporate, an artist will be appointed as the spiritual future of the form.

title: In German Town, a School-Year Highlight That Ended in Disaster
description: HALTERN AM SEE, Germany  It had to have been one of the happiest experiences of their lives, people said.

title: Cruz, Critic of Health Care Law, Now Seeks to Sign Up
description: Senator Ted Cruz helped lead an effort to shut down the government in 2013 in an attempt to defund President Obamas health care law. Now the Texas senator, a newly announced Republican presidential candidate, is signing up for coverage under it.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: A Conversation With Rick Chandler, New York Citys Buildings Dept. Chief
description: Mr. Chandler, 54, is commissioner of the New York City Department of Buildings. Before his appointment last summer by Mayor Bill de Blasio, he was the assistant vice president for facilities at Hunter College.

title: At Kleiner Discrimination Trial, a Battle Between Legal Powerhouses
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Silicon Valley is usually measured on its products and profits. Now, in a rare turnabout, it is about to be judged on its behavior.

title: Italys Highest Court Set to Rule in Amanda Knox Case
description: ROME  More than seven years after an American undergraduate student, Amanda Knox, and her Italian boyfriend were accused of murdering a British exchange student, Italys highest court is set to issue a final ruling, one that could push the issue of her extradition from the United States.

title: For Durst Family, Arrest Brings a Tremendous Sense of Relief
description: For one man, the Robert A. Durst chronicle is not only about unsolved deaths from the distant past.

title: Peets Introduces a Fresh Take on Cold Coffee
description: A storm is brewing in the world of cold coffee.

title: Gays Targeted in a California Initiative
description: LOS ANGELES  Even in a state known for its far-reaching and sometimes outlandish voter initiatives, the one proposed by a Huntington Beach lawyer seems stunning: the Sodomite Suppression Act, mandating, among other things, that any person who has sexual relations with someone of the same gender be put to death by bullets to the head.

title: Conflict, Courage and Healing in Gaza
description: Heidi Levines coverage of the Gaza conflict earned her the Anja Niedringhaus Courage in Photojournalism Award, which honors the Associated Press photographer killed in Afghanistan.

title: 3G Capital, Co-Owner of Heinz, Is Said to Be in Talks to Buy Kraft Foods
description: Two of the best-known American food brands may soon unite in a deal that could reshape the industry  thanks in part to the efforts of a Brazilian investment firm with a penchant for deals.

title: A Water Dilemma in Michigan: Cloudy or Costly?
description: FLINT, Mich.  Depending on the day, Melissa Mays says, the water flowing out of her homes faucets might have a blue tint. Or it might smell like mothballs. Or it might fill her home with the scent of an overchlorinated swimming pool.

title: Video of the Germanwings Crash Site
description: This video from the French Interior Ministry shows the scene of the Germanwings Airbus A320 crash in the French Alps.

title: Bipartisan Deal on Health Care Issues Hits a Snag Among Senate Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  The deal is as politically remarkable as it is substantive: a long-term plan to finance health care for older Americans, pay doctors who accept Medicare and extend popular health care programs for children and the poor. It was cobbled together by none other than House Speaker John A. Boehner and Representative Nancy Pelosi, the leader of House Democrats, who rarely agree on anything, with the apparent blessing of a majority of their respective members.

title: Eva Burrows, Salvation Armys Peoples General, Dies at 85
description: Gen. Eva Burrows, who was only the second woman to lead the international Salvation Army and who carried its banner back to Eastern Europe after the fall of Communism, died on Friday in Melbourne, Australia. She was 85.

title: Rebukes From White House Risk Buoying Netanyahu
description: JERUSALEM  Giora Eiland, a former Israeli national security adviser, is hardly an advocate for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Chiara de Blasio Is Face of Youth Counseling Initiative
description: The students were perched around a table inside Millennium High School in Brooklyn, listening intently as their guest spoke of the maladies and pangs of adolescence.

title: Emirates Has Plans to Make Orlando Its 10th U.S. Destination
description: Emirates, the largest airline in the Middle East, said Tuesday it would start flying to Orlando this year, adding a 10th United States destination at a time when American airlines are lobbying the administration to freeze new flights from the three Persian Gulf giants.

title: Lyle Gramley, 88, Inflation Tamer in White House and at the Fed, Dies
description: Lyle E. Gramley, who served as a White House economic adviser and a Federal Reserve governor in the late 1970s and early 1980s, as the economy fought exceptionally high inflation and a deep recession, died on Sunday at his home in Potomac, Md. He was 88.

title: In Nuclear Talks, Iran Seeks to Avoid Specifics
description: PARIS  If an agreement to limit Irans nuclear capability is reached by deadline in the next seven days, one thing may be missing: an actual written accord, signed by the Iranians.

title: Yankees Brian Cashman Relishes Kentucky Connection
description: When he was a boy in Lexington, Ky., Brian Cashman never had visions of becoming the Yankees general manager. He was not from the Bronx. He was being raised in bluegrass country, where basketball is king and children daydream of playing for the University of Kentucky.

title: Experts BackAngelina Jolie Pitt in Choices for Cancer Prevention
description: Cancer experts said Tuesday that the actress and filmmaker Angelina Jolie Pitt was wise to have had her ovaries and fallopian tubes removed last week because she carries a genetic mutation, BRCA1, that significantly increases the risk of ovarian cancer, a disease so difficult to detect that it is often found only at an advanced, untreatable stage.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 24, 2015
description: March 24, 2015

title: Wall St. Stars Join Silicon Valley Gold Rush
description: One of the countrys largest banks, Morgan Stanley, is losing its chief financial officer to Google in the most visible example yet of the flow of talent from Wall Street to Silicon Valley.

title: Brett Gardner Is Yankees Great Homegrown Hope
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Brett Gardner is the kind of player who makes everyone in an organization happy. The Yankees, quite clearly, need many more like him.

title: Bronx Police Officer Charged With Raping a Teenage Girl
description: A New York police officer was arrested in the Bronx on Tuesday and charged with raping a teenage parishioner of the church they both attend, the authorities said.

title: Same-Sex Benefits Survive a Vote
description: An attempt by Russia to annul an expansion of benefits to United Nations employees who are spouses in same-sex marriages failed Tuesday in an 80-to-43 vote of the General Assembly committee responsible for the budget. The United States joined the effort to defeat a Russian proposal that would have invalidated the benefits expansion, which Secretary General Ban Ki-moon approved last July. Under the expansion, gay and lesbian employees are entitled to the same marriage benefits as heterosexual employees if they were wed in a jurisdiction that considers their union legal. Previously, gay and lesbian employees were granted benefits only if their home countries deemed such marriages legal.

title: Greece: Ex-Official Avoids Prison
description: A former finance minister, George Papaconstantinou, was found guilty on Tuesday of tampering with a list of about 2,000 Greeks with Swiss bank accounts, but he was spared prison time. A court found that Mr. Papaconstantinou, 53, had removed the names of three relatives from the list. The list was given to him in 2010 by Christine Lagarde, then the French finance minister, in an effort to help curb tax evasion. The court reduced the first charge against him, doctoring a document, to a misdemeanor from a felony, and imposed a one-year suspended prison term. He was cleared of a second charge of attempted breach of faith. The failure of the authorities to investigate the so-called Lagarde list, a potential source of much-needed tax revenue, fueled widespread anger in Greece during years of austerity.

title: Canada: Role Against ISIS to Grow
description: Prime Minister Stephen Harper asked Parliament on Tuesday to extend and expand the countrys military mission against Islamic State militants by another year. Canadas involvement in the operation, which began last October, was scheduled to last just six months and has consisted of airstrikes against the Islamic State group, also known as ISIS or ISIL, in Iraq and the use of troops for training and support in Iraq. Mr. Harper said that he wanted to extend the air forces role to include strikes on targets in Syria. Opposition lawmakers say that Mr. Harper did not fully reveal the extent of the ground troops role last year. The criticism increased this month after Kurdish forces mistakenly killed a Canadian military adviser in Iraq. Opposition leaders said that they did not support the extension, but Mr. Harpers Conservatives hold a majority in the House of Commons.

title: Egypt: Forensics Official Dismissed
description: Egypts Medical Forensics Authority on Tuesday dismissed its spokesman after he said last week that a poet and activist killed by police birdshot had died from her wounds only because she was too thin. State news media reported Tuesday that the Justice Ministry was opening an investigation to determine whether or not it was true that more body fat might have obstructed the pellets that pierced her heart and lungs, the injuries that coroners said had caused her death. The poet and activist, Shaimaa el-Sabbagh, 31, was taking part in a march to lay flowers in Tahrir Square on Jan. 24 when the police fired birdshot and tear gas from a few yards away. Prosecutors charged a police officer with a form of manslaughter in the shooting but have not named the officer. The spokesman for the medical examiner, Hisham Abdel Hamid, said in a television interview on Saturday that other marchers that day survived similar blasts of birdshot but that Ms. Sabbagh died because she was too skinny.

title: Pulitzer-Winning Author Says He Has a Debt to Pay
description: In recent decades, Gloversville has tried three times to raise funds to modernize its library. Now the town has turned to its most famous son, a Pulitzer-Prize winning writer.

title: Richard Russo, Pulitzer Winner, Tells Gloversville Library Thanks for the Memories
description: GLOVERSVILLE, N.Y.  In 1904, Andrew Carnegie donated $50,000, then a princely sum, to this upstate community so it could build a new library. Now, 111 years later, that stately, domed Beaux-Arts structure has fallen on hard times, much like the black-and-blue, blue-collar town that surrounds it.

title: Pakistani Christians Fight Back
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  LAST Monday, this city was briefly overrun with bands of sloganeering, stick-wielding youths. The demonstrators threw stones at police officers, burned car tires and smashed windows. One gang even plundered a 7Up truck, guzzling its goods before transfixed TV cameras. (I watched the footage  slow-mo jets of sparkly liquid, with strains of horror-movie music playing in the background  that night on the Internet.) There was a euphoric edge to the riots, apparent even when they took a grotesquely violent turn with the lynching of two men.

title: Head of Economic Development Corporation Is Leaving
description: Kyle Kimball, who as the president of the Economic Development Corporation navigated the shift of New Yorks focus from commercial development to affordable housing, plans to step down, officials said on Tuesday.

title: A Picasso Is the Center of Attention at Christies Auction
description: A Picasso painting valued at about $140 million is the centerpiece of a new type of auction at Christies, combining Modern and contemporary artworks spanning 100 years, that will kick-start its postwar and contemporary sales in New York in May.

title: What Subjects and Verbs Must Do
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  You knew the shaded squares were meant to be a STAIRCASE, right? Raise your hands if you knew what to expect in terms of what was DESCENDING it.

title: Ukraine President Dismisses Billionaire Ally From Governors Role
description: MOSCOW  In the latest move in a dispute that has threatened to fracture Ukraines government, President Petro O. Poroshenko early Wednesday dismissed the billionaire governor of Dnipropetrovsk, an important industrial region that has been a bulwark against the advances of pro-Russian separatists.

title: Uncertain Future for New York Housing Program That Helps Mentally Ill Homeless People
description: John Beyhl did not have to gloss over his homeless years on the street when applying for an apartment at the Brook, a modern rental building in the South Bronx with a rooftop garden, a computer room, a live-in superintendent and 24-hour security.

title: Christian Pastor in China Gets One-Year Prison Term in Battle Over Crosses
description: BEIJING  A Christian pastor who defended local churches when the Chinese authorities removed church crosses was sentenced to one year in prison on Tuesday night by a court in Zhejiang Province.

title: Jose Pirela Says Hes Fine, but Yankees Are Wary
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Two days after crashing into an outfield wall and being taken to a hospital, Jose Pirela sat in the dugout in shorts and a T-shirt as the Yankees worked out before their game against the Detroit Tigers on Tuesday night.

title: Justified Recap: Misdirection Every Which Way
description: Season 6, Episode 10: Trust

title: Home Opener? Mets Are Hoping for Big Crowd the Night After
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Ever since he became the Mets general manager after the 2010 season, Sandy Alderson has generally taken three approaches in discussing the teams financial limitations.

title: Kings Awake From Slumber Against Rangers
description: The Los Angeles Kings have scuffled through a Stanley Cup hangover this season, but in a rematch of the Cup finals on Tuesday, the Kings looked more like the team that dispatched the Rangers in five games last spring than the one that has struggled for months to earn a postseason bid.

title: Exposure Concerns Grow in Liberia After Diagnosis of First Ebola Case in Weeks
description: Worries have widened in recent days over the number of people in Liberia who may have been exposed to the countrys first Ebola case in more than two weeks, a street vendor who lived in a one-bathroom house shared with 52 others in a Monrovia suburb and who had sold food at a school where more than 1,900 students are enrolled.

title: Behind a Veil of Anonymity, Online Vigilantes Battle the Islamic State
description: They use screen aliases like IS Hunting Club, TouchMyTweets and The Doctor. They troll Twitter for suspected accounts of Islamic State fighters, recruiters and fund-raisers. Then they pounce.

title: Must I Drive My Friend to Have an Abortion?
description: The ethicists answer reader questions about squaring religious beliefs with friendship.

title: An Artistic Reinterpretation of Chinas Century of Humiliation
description: When history intersects with nationalism, there is often little patience or appetite for nuance. Instead, broad brushstrokes are preferred. Take, for example, the period from the end of the First Opium War in 1842 to the victory of the Chinese Communist Party in 1949. This period  a time of wars, invasions, occupations and revolutions in China  is often summed up by Chinese political leaders as their countrys century of humiliation. Although more than six decades have passed, this narrative of humiliation at the hands of foreign powers continues to set the tone for Chinas interaction with much of the outside world.

title: Stepping Into the 70s for Spring
description: A sturdy pair of platform clogs plays up the retro vibe of the season.

title: The Writers Room
description: Surrounded by photographs, family mementos and the clamor of everyday life, seven authors offer a glimpse into the spaces where they create.

title: Mary Russells Moment in Time
description: In an era when private moments were in fact private and snapshots truly intimate, the fashion reporter and photographer partied with and documented Europes beau monde. For T, she opens her rarely seen archives from the 1960s and 70s and speaks about those days.

title: The Anti-Bully Backpack
description: It used to be that the only way to make a backpack look remotely cool was to wear it off of one shoulder, projecting the vibe of someone only halfway committed to going to school. But this is no longer the case, thanks to MadPaxs eccentric, cartoonish bags, which are alternately spiked, bubble-covered or block-shaped, and occasionally appear to be dipped in a rainbow of sprinkles. In 2010, the companys co-founder Tina Huber tested a prototype by putting it on her son, a second grader, and sending him to school. At the end of the day he got back in the car, and I was like, Tell me everything, Huber says. And he goes, I seriously felt like Jesus. Everybody wanted to touch me. Before long, Willow Smith started wearing one, as did the children of Ben Affleck, Hugh Jackman and Heidi Klum. While the backpacks come in many different styles, all of them look instantly iconic, combining elements of sci-fi, exotic wildlife and Memphis design  and all of them can be worn comfortably, and with confidence, on both shoulders.

title: Distracted Teenagers Behind the Wheel
description: A sampling of videos showing the six seconds leading up to a crash caused by distracted teenage drivers. Researchers analyzed almost 1,700 such videos to study the causes of such traffic accidents.

title: Word of the Day | acme
description: acme  \ak-me\  noun

title: Car Crash Videos Highlight Risk of Multitasking With Phones
description: Memo to parents: Distracted driving by teenagers is riskier than previously thought, particularly when it comes to multitasking with a cellphone.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 5 P.M. (Flix) TENDER MERCIES (1983) Robert Duvall, in an Oscar-winning role, plays a down-on-his-luck rambler trying to rebuild his life while staying at a ramshackle Texas motel whose proprietor, Rosa Lee (Tess Harper), he just cant quit. Only after tying the knot with her guest does Rosa Lee learn that he used to be Mac Sledge, a country singer who drank his career to death. This drama  directed by Bruce Beresford and written by Horton Foote, who won an Oscar for best screenplay  follows Macs relationships with his ex-wife (Betty Buckley), his daughter (Ellen Barkin), his new bride and her son, weaving them into a sadly contemporary vision of family life and heading toward a final note of affirmation, Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times. This is a small, lovely and somewhat overloaded film about small-town life, loneliness, country music, marriage, divorce and parental love, and it deals with all of these things in equal measure. Still, the absence of a single, sharply dramatic story line is a relatively small price to pay for the plainness and clarity with which these other issues are defined.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: To come home from Afghanistan and be killed by someone whos supposed to protect you  that I dont understand.

title: Corrections: March 25, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Hearing and Feeling What Photographers Are Saying
description: In his 35-year career as a master black-and-white printer, Chuck Kelton has held some of the most important negatives in history: from Ansel Adamss Moonrise, Hernandez, New Mexico to Alfred Eisenstaedts V-J Day in Times Square. So it makes sense that when he is in his darkroom with his chemicals and classical music, nobody can  or should  disturb him.

title: Library of Congress Opens Its Doors to the Doors
description: The first album by the Doors  The Doors, released in 1967  and the 1964 Righteous Brothers ballad Youve Lost That Lovin Feelin have been added to the National Recording Registry at the Library of Congress, along with 23 other titles at least 10 years old that have been deemed culturally, historically or aesthetically significant. The registry, established by an act of Congress in 2000 to preserve the nations audio legacy, now has 425 recordings dating back to wax cylinders of the late 19th century.

title: Shifting Away From Meat
description: To the Editor:

title: The Gray Area in Breast Biopsies
description: To the Editor:

title: Run, Rubio, Run
description: MIAMI  FOR nearly 20 years, Florida politicos watched Jeb Bush groom Marco Rubio for power. In the late 1990s, Mr. Bush, then a new governor, handed his young protg Mr. Rubio, then a West Miami city commissioner, his political and financial network, asking friends like Al Cardenas  until recently the head of the American Conservative Union, which puts on the Conservative Political Action Conference  to give Mr. Rubio the connections and money he needed to ascend.

title: Look Before Leaping
description: I can think of many good reasons to go ahead with the nuclear deal with Iran, and I can think of just as many reasons not to. So, if youre confused, let me see if I can confuse you even more.

title: Stop Making Us Guinea Pigs
description: The issues surrounding G.M.O.s  genetically modified organisms  have never been simple. They became more complicated last week when the International Agency for Research on Cancer declared that glyphosate, the active ingredient in the widely used herbicide Roundup, probably causes cancer in humans. Two insecticides, malathion and diazinon, were also classified as probable carcinogens by the agency, a respected arm of the World Health Organization.

title: Algorithms Cant Adapt
description: To the Editor:

title: Nominations for a Woman on the $20 Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Bypassing the Questions and Delays at Passport Control
description: Second perhaps only to visits to the dentist, the form of human interaction I dreaded most over the years was passport control upon arrival to the United States.

title: Republican Budget Games
description: Congress generally has little trouble achieving broad agreement on defense spending. One reason is a well-established and, indeed, almost reflexive belief that throwing more money at the Pentagon will solve the security challenges that America faces. That general inclination is still there; what is not there is agreement, especially among the ruling Republicans, on how to do it this time.

title: Schools Need Albanys Help, Now
description: The State Legislature ended decades of feudalism, corruption and chaos in the New York City school system when it gave Mayor Michael Bloomberg direct control in 2002.The law allowed the mayor to bring stability to a system where chancellors once flew in and out the door and to clear away the bureaucratic underbrush that had defeated his predecessors.

title: Test Yourself | A Chinese Festival in California
description: Here are several paragraphs from a March 23 article, Bok Kai Festival in Marysville Brings Touch of 19th Century to 21st.

title: 6 Qs About the News | No Need to Run in Hawaii: The Lava Is Coming, but Very Slowly
description: In No Need to Run in Hawaii: The Lava Is Coming, but Very Slowly, Diane Cardwell writes about a town threatened by a slow-motion disaster.

title: GermanwingsPilot Was Locked Out of Cockpit Before Crash in France
description: PARIS  As officials struggled Wednesday to explain why a jet with 150 people on board crashed amid a relatively clear sky, an investigator said evidence from a cockpit voice recorder indicated one pilot left the cockpit before the planes descent and was unable to get back in.

title: Keeping Fires Burning in Eastern Ukraine
description: Avdiivka Coke and Steel in eastern Ukraine has been hit 160 times by rockets and artillery fire, but it is a vital plant and cannot close because of the prohibitive cost of restarting.

title: A Close-Up of Unfolding Unrest in Yemen
description: I arrived in Yemen days after a group of Houthi rebels took control of the capital in January. They forced the president and cabinet to resign, and many of them, in mismatched army uniforms, tried to bolster their tenuous authority, rallying their supporters and setting up checkpoints around the capital, Sana.

title: M.L.S. Takes the Next Step, but Its Fans Are One Ahead
description: Three weeks into the M.L.S. season, two New York teams are leading the Eastern Conference.

title: Campaign Finance Reform Turns to Reward and Punishment
description: It isnt easy to reform the campaign finance system. Ask Lawrence Lessig, the Harvard law professor who last year raised $11 million to elect candidates who favored restrictions on unlimited contributions and spending only to find hed become the issues latest Don Quixote. But hes back with a new plan, and other groups are trying new lines of attack, hoping to change the behavior of candidates and lawmakers through rewards and punishments.

title: A Ukraine Factory That Cant Close, and Workers Who Wont Quit
description: AVDIIVKA, Ukraine  The armored Mercedes-Benz pulled up to a factory chimney discharging an endless column of milk-white steam and out stepped Musa Magomedov, the broad-shouldered, bespectacled 45-year-old general director of the Avdiivka Coke and Steel plant.

title: A Brief Resurrection for a Mural Recalling the Garment Industrys Heyday
description: The shadows of West 40th Street had suddenly given way to the sunny glow of the 1950s with the uncovering of an exuberant mosaic mural at the base of the 5 Bryant Park office tower.

title: What Local Microadventures Would You Like to Go On?
description: In the Travel section last weekend, an adventurer who has trekked, rowed and and biked all over the world extolled the virtues of just taking simple trips close to home. They, too, can help you shift perspective and feel happier, he says.

title: Ambassador Tries to Bridge Gap With U.S., but on Israels Terms
description: WASHINGTON  Over an elegant dinner at his official residence Monday night, Ron Dermer, the Israeli ambassador to the United States, tried to reassure a group of congressional Democrats that the dramatic public break between President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was nothing more than a passing disagreement.

title: Among Germanwings Crash Victims, Opera Singers and Newlyweds
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Outside the Liceu opera house in Barcelona on Wednesday, staff members gathered at noon for two minutes of silence to honor two singers who had recently performed there.

title: Where You Go Is Not Who Youll Be and The End of College
description: If you have sat through a high school commencement ceremony in the past 25 years, you may have endured an earnest recitation of the last book written by Dr. Seuss, Oh, the Places Youll Go! The book is a popular gift to graduates from grown-ups who have forgotten how late adolescents feel about condescension. Here are two deeply felt, intentionally provocative alternatives for college applicants worried about getting into their first choice and parents worried about paying for it: Frank Brunis exhortation to go elsewhere and Kevin Careys invitation to go online.

title: Shermans Ghosts, by Matthew Carr
description: This thought-provoking and at times frustrating volume is really three books rather awkwardly spliced together. The first part, roughly half of Shermans Ghosts, analyzes Gen. William Tecumseh Shermans destructive marches through Georgia and the Carolinas in the last months of the American Civil War. The next part discusses the supposed impact of Shermans actions on subsequent wars through Vietnam. In the final section, the ghosts of Sherman largely disappear as the journalist Matthew Carr leads us through a maze of conflicts from the ouster of Manuel Noriega in Panama to the continuing blood baths in the Middle East and drone attacks in Afghanistan and Pakistan. The dominant theme here is Americas appetite for military intervention since World War II, which has left a trail of death, destruction and chaos and produced very few positive results.

title: How Exercise May Aid Cancer Treatment
description: In a new study involving mice, aerobic exercise slowed the growth of breast cancer tumors and made the cancer more sensitive to chemotherapy. The results raise the possibility that exercise may change the biology of some malignant tumors, potentially making them easier to treat.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Citigroup Names New Head of China Investment Banking
description: HONG KONG  Citigroup has hired a longtime China banker from Bank of Americas Merrill Lynch unit to be head of its investment banking in the country.

title: New York Today: What Would You Do for a 212?
description: Good morning on this warmer Wednesday.

title: Daily Report: Trying to Sway the Jury in Kleiner Perkins Discrimination Trial
description: Silicon Valley is usually measured on its products and profits. Now, in a rare turnabout, it is about to be judged on its behavior.

title: 2 Indian Naval Officers Missing After Plane Crashes in Arabian Sea
description: NEW DELHI  An Indian-made naval plane crashed in the Arabian Sea off the coast of the southern state of Goa on Tuesday night during a routine training mission. Two officers are missing, while the flight commander, a seasoned pilot, was rescued by fishermen.

title: Saudi Arabia Leads Air Assault in Yemen
description: WASHINGTON  Saudi Arabia announced on Wednesday night that it had begun military operations in Yemen, launching airstrikes in coordination with a coalition of 10 nations.

title: Today in Politics: Afghan President Addresses Congress
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where Republicans have been partying with former Vice President Dick Cheney while Congress is nearing a budget breakthrough. March Madness is getting increasingly political as the tournament rolls on, and President Obama is using the anniversary of the Affordable Care Act to take a victory lap, of sorts. Victories have not come easy in Afghanistan, however, but the countrys new president is in town to offer a status report.

title: Kraft and Heinz to Merge in Deal Backed by Buffett and 3G Capital
description: First it was Budweiser beer. Then came Burger King Whoppers. Next up was Heinz ketchup.

title: Swiss Private Bank Vontobel Buys Majority Stake in British Asset Manager
description: LONDON  The Swiss private bank Vontobel said on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy a majority stake in TwentyFour Asset Management of Britain and that it was in talks over the potential acquisition of a German asset manager owned by Bank of New York Mellon.

title: Bearing Witness
description: As excruciating as it can be to bear witness when a loved one is at the end of life, I highly recommend it to everyone given the chance. The things Ive learned from being in the room with souls whose journeys happen to be winding down are nothing less than sublime gifts given by the person on the bed, separated from me by a thin sheet and a trillion words, most unspoken. At this stage, sometimes theres a suction tube. And sometimes there truly are no words. There are other ways to listen, though.

title: How Poor Are the Poor?
description: There is a consensus among poverty experts that over the past 50 years there has been some improvement in the condition of the poor.

title: Restaurant Report: Dstage in Madrid
description: When Spain became an avant-garde culinary destination at the end of the 1980s, it was mostly thanks to chefs in the Basque Country and Barcelona. Today, however, the countrys post-molecular-cooking gastronomic credentials are being won by a constellation of nervy young chefs working in Madrid. Theres been a 360-degree change here, said Diego Guerrero, the chef who just won a star in the 2015 Michelin guide for his new restaurant, Dstage. Today, the city is filled with young people taking chances.

title: In Hong Kong, PMQ Serves Up Food and Art
description: The image of a police officer is spray-painted on a wall at Sohofama, a Chinese restaurant in Hong Kong that sticks to its blue-collar roots with home-style dishes served on outdoor wooden tables and benches. The picture pays homage to both a founders father, a local officer, and the establishments location at PMQ, a 1950s Police Married Quarters that once housed hundreds of families and is now home to dozens of restaurants, studios and boutiques run by local artisans and designers, including Vivienne Tam.

title: Lets Talk (Frankly) About Sex
description: Reasons Why I Shouldnt Have to Go Tonight: If I wanted to talk about it, I would. / Its my body. / Its a waste of time. / Its a waste of money. / I know what I need to know. / It sounds pretty stupid to me. / Its so stereotypical because obviously I know this happens to everyone. / Considering I took the time out of my morning to write you these extremely reasonable and great reasons not to make me go (and it took forever because I cant type very well), and the fact that I really, really, really, really ... really, really, really strongly dont want to go, please dont send us to this horrible torture.

title: Must I Drive My Friend to Have an Abortion?
description: My closest friend just got pregnant and is in no way ready to take on motherhood at 18. She has already committed to her dream school and received a scholarship. She wants to get an abortion out of state and is asking me to drive her. She would do the same for me if the roles were reversed, but my religion prohibits acts like these. Ive been putting it off for weeks, making up excuses as to why I couldnt take her. Is it ethical for me to drive hours away,without her parents consent, for an abortion, when that is regarded as very shameful in my church?Name Withheld, New Jersey

title: Anti-Keynesian Delusions
description: I forgot to congratulate Mark Thoma on his tenth blogoversary, so let me do that now. Its hard to imagine what current economic debate would look like without the incredible job Mark does in assembling and discussing the most important new work, every day; for sure it would be vastly impoverished. Live long and prosper, Mark.

title: Did My Great-Grandfather Beat Robert E. Lee?
description: Griffin Stedman was 26 years old when he died from wounds suffered during the siege of Petersburg, Va., in August 1864. His monument on the field describes him as a Typical Volunteer Soldier, before noting a meteoric rise in the military: the Connecticut native and Trinity College graduate was commissioned as a captain in 1861, and died a brigadier general just three years later.

title: Morning Agenda: Kraft Foods and Heinz to Merge
description: KRAFT FOODS AND HEINZ TO MERGE | The Brazilian investment firm that teamed up with Warren E. Buffett two years ago to scoop up H.J. Heinz has struck another blockbuster deal for an American food icon, DealBook reports.

title: Eurobounce
description: A lot of the recent data coming in show a substantial acceleration in European growth. And you know what will be coming next: claims that this (a) vindicates austerity and (b) shows that there is no reason to worry about Japanification.

title: Wisconsin Bank Robbery Suspect and Trooper Die in Shootout
description: CHICAGO  An afternoon of gunfire and fear in eastern Wisconsin ended Tuesday with a devastating toll: Two banks robbed, a bystander shot dead and a rookie state trooper, on his first day patrolling solo, slain in a firefight while confronting and killing the suspect.

title: Tono Studios Helps Marketers Reach Hispanics With Culturally Authentic Ads
description: From his spot in the control room at Tono Studios, Jaime Zapata has a window into the growing influence, and nuance, of the Hispanic market. In the last month, his Santa Monica, Calif., commercial audio company has brought sound to advertisements for such organizations as Alaska Airlines, Acura, the Humane Society and Universal Studios. All of these spots are in Spanish.

title: A Turner Scene on the East River
description: Dear Diary:

title: Challenges Weigh Heavily on Recovery Efforts in Germanwings Crash
description: SEYNE-LES-ALPES, France  This mountain village was a remote place, a haven for holiday hikers and seasoned rock climbers, until this week, when it became a place of incomprehensible tragedy for the families of the passengers on a routine German flight.

title: Mott Haven, the Bronx, in Transition
description: Mott Haven, in the South Bronx, has heard it all before: Its dangerous, barren and a place to pass through en route to somewhere else. But the neighborhood, a waterfront enclave with a mix of industrial and residential properties, is no longer defined by those old stereotypes. It is undergoing a gradual reinvention, with restaurants opening, scruffy buildings getting spiffed up and apartments being built on gap-toothed lots. Plans are in motion for hundreds of rental units along a stretch of the Harlem River where Jordan L. Mott, for whom the area was named, once made iron stoves and other items.

title: Lee Radziwill on Discovering the Coats of Martin Grant
description: The style icon recalls her first encounter with the designer.

title: Q. and A. With Feds Dennis Lockhart: The Year to Raise Rates
description: Dennis Lockhart just entered his ninth year as president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, and during that time he has never voted to raise interest rates. He took the job during the very early days of the financial crisis, and he has never really had the chance. But that is about to change. Mr. Lockhart said in an interview Monday that he expected he would vote to start raising rates by September at the latest.

title: $2,200,000 Homes in Chicago, Colorado and New Hampshire
description: LITTLETON, COLO.

title: House Hunting in ... Costa Rica
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM HOUSE WITH VIEWS OF JUNGLE AND OCEAN

title: Selfie Sticks and Other Selfie Gear Go Mainstream
description: WE simply cant see enough of ourselves, or so it would seem from todays selfie craze.

title: HarperCollins Releases Cover for New Harper Lee Novel
description: HarperCollins released the cover for Harper Lees highly anticipated new novel, Go Set a Watchman, on Wednesday, and hinted at new details about the book. The cover  a classic and melancholy image of a dark tree with sparse yellow leaves against a dusky blue sky, with a train approaching from the distance  is emblematic of the opening of the book, which begins with a grown-up Scouts train ride from New York to her childhood home of Maycomb, Ala.

title: Report Credits F.B.I. With Progress Since 9/11, but Says More Is Needed
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. has made great strides since the Sept. 11 attacks but urgently needs to improve its intelligence capabilities, hire more linguists and elevate the stature of its analysts to counter the rapidly evolving threats to the United States, according to a report released on Wednesday.

title: Making Miso Soup Without a Recipe
description: Kristen Miglore and Erin McDowell of Food52 show you how to make miso soup without a recipe.

title: French: Terror Attack on Plane Unlikely
description: Bernard Cazeneuve, the French interior minister, said Wednesday that terrorism was not a privileged hypothesis at the moment in the Airbus A320 crash.

title: Car Bomb Kills Several Near Kabul Taxi Stand
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber detonated a car full of explosives on a busy road in downtown Kabul on Wednesday afternoon, killing at least seven people and injuring 36, the Afghan Interior Ministry said.

title: Could Ted Cruz Win?
description: No, I dont think he will  not the nomination, not the presidency. Butsince thats what just about everyone thinks, lets play around a little and try to imagine how Cruz could at least imitate Barry Goldwater and become the G.O.P. nominee. Heres The Federalists Ben Domenech with three reasons why the conventional wisdom on Cruz might be wrong:

title: Cuba:  Travel Section Plans for an Emerging Hot Spot
description: Cuba! As the Obama administration eases up on travel restrictions to Cuba, the Travel editor, Monica Drake, is thinking about how the section will cover the new destination. Some insight into her thinking:

title: Why New TV Comedies Are Choosing Plot Over Jokes
description: Big Time in Hollywood, FL, a hyperactive new series about deluded brothers with moviemaking dreams, is packed with startling twists  sudden murders, unlikely romance and even a Cuba Gooding Jr. performance that reminds you why he won an Academy Award. But the biggest surprise may be that its a comedy in which every episode ends not with a joke but a cliffhanger.

title: With Sugar on Top
description: Im not from Italy or Spain, where you can talk about the food for hours, Jasmina Bojic said, her cooks darting into the refrigerator beside her. Shes the executive pastry chef at the Four Seasons Hotel in New York, where she makes extravagant cakes fit for oligarchs, but, she said, my country is small. Its homey, nothing fancy about it, so Im nervous to tell you about our food. She was referring to Montenegro, a rough diamond set on the Adriatic, surrounded by Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Kosovo and Albania  more borders than Ithought a country the size of Connecticut couldhave.

title: Clinton Appoints a Digital Team, Crucial for a Campaign
description: For all the attention paid to how Hillary Rodham Clinton will structure her communications team it is her digital staff, which will deal with outreach on social media platforms, marketing and online fund-raising, that will be acritical component of her future campaign.

title: 1940: Tracking 2 British Liners
description: PANAMA CITY  The mystery of the whereabouts of Britains two super liners, the 81,235-ton Queen Mary and 35,739-ton Mauretania, which slipped out of New York Harbor for an unknown destination five days ago, was partially cleared today [March 25] when it was reported that the Mauretania would reach Cristobal tonight to pass through the Panama Canal. Both ships were last reported off the coast of New Jersey. Although a number of rumors circulated concerning their destination, it was considered most likely that they will be employed to transport troops from Australia and New Zealand to points either in the Near East or France.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 26, 1940

title: Ford Issues 3 Safety Recalls
description: Ford Motor issued three safety recalls on Wednesday morning, the largest aimed at about 213,000 Ford Explorers and its law enforcement sibling, the Ford Police Interceptor utility vehicle.

title: Opening New Iraq Front, U.S. Strikes ISIS in Tikrit
description: BAGHDAD  American warplanes began airstrikes against Islamic State positions in Tikrit late Wednesday, finally joining a stalled offensive to retake the Iraqi city as American officials sought to seize the initiative from Iran, which had taken a major role in directing the operation.

title: Where the Sex Talk Can Be Fun
description: What if there was a sex education class where you sit with your parent and learn all about puberty and sex and pubic hair and menstruation? What if it was fun, funny and interactive, and included (for boys) the singing of The Penis Opera? That class is out there. Read more in the Magazine.

title: States Consider Awarding Lottery Winners Something Else: Anonymity
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  If you are lucky enough to win the lottery here, there is one thing you are virtually certain to lose: your privacy.

title: Biggest Banks Absent From Biggest Deal of Year
description: The biggest banks on Wall Street were shut out of the biggest deal of the year.

title: A Guide to Angkor Park, in Words and 3-D Images
description: Being that it is one of the most visited historical sites in the world, there is no shortage of travel guides to Cambodias Angkor Archaeological Park and its network of temples, spiritual centers and moat-bordered capital cities of the Khmer empire.

title: First Draft Focus: Ghani Gets a Warm Welcome
Rekindling a Love for Cooking With Subscription Meal Kits
description: There came a moment, about two weeks after my first child was born, when I worried he might starve. Nursing wasnt going well, and I was so tired I thought I could feel my eyeballs vibrating. When he squawked and squirmed and bucked his little head against the arm of the rocking chair, I began to panic. I had just one job to do, to feed my baby, and I couldnt do it. The more I tensed up, the harder it became for him to latch on, and the more both of us cried. We were quite the disastrous pair.

title: Paul McCartney and Metallica to Headline Lollapalooza
description: Top billing on the festival circuit in 2015 is leaning hard toward legacy acts as Paul McCartney and Metallica will headline the first two nights of Lollapalooza in Chicagos Grant Park. Those classic acts will join the likes of AC/DC (Coachella) and Billy Joel (Bonnaroo) in prime time slots at outdoor mega-concerts across the country this summer.

title: 1965: Astronauts Assess Flight
description: CAPE KENNEDY  Astronauts Virgil I. Grissom and John W. Young reported today [March 25] that the flight of their Gemini-3 spacecraft turned out to be even better than we expected. Maj. Grissom is the first man in history to make two separate trips into space. We felt great, he said. At the separation of the spacecraft from the rocket, there was a sudden drop from six Gs (the force of gravity) to one-half g, he said. There was a fair amount of debris flying around. I think it sort of gave John a jolt.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 26, 1965

title: Violations by John Caliparis Teams? Dont Look at Him
description: The University of Massachusetts has put a magical punctuation on a magical season for Coach John Calipari.

title: 10%? 20%? Apps Are Changing How We Tip
description: Apps like PayPal, Square, Breadcrumb, Apple Pay and Facebooks new payment feature are supposed to be making paying for things easier. Want to figure out a complicated dinner tab among five friends? Just tap a few buttons on your smartphone.

title: Supreme Court Seems Split on What Is Appropriate in Setting Clean Air Costs
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday seemed closely divided over the fate of one of the Obama administrations most ambitious environmental initiatives.

title: 36 Hours in Palm Beach, Fla.
description: Palm Beach may be known for its extravagant mansions, tony retailers and fancy nightspots, but it also has its own brand of small-town charm.

title: 36 Hours in Palm Beach
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Palm Beach, Fla.
