Oddly, however, he seems to suggest that this episode weakens the case I and others have been making for a higher inflation target. Actually, it strengthens that case.

title: Morning Agenda: Auto Loans to Minorities Under Scrutiny
description: AUTO LOANS TO MINORITIES UNDER SCRUTINY | The Justice Departments civil rights division is examining whether auto dealerships are steering minority borrowers to the most expensive loans, a practice known as reverse redlining, Michael Corkery and Jessica Silver-Greenberg write in DealBook. In particular, the federal authorities are looking at whether dealer markups, in which dealers add additional interest onto a borrowers loan, are being used to charge minority customers higher rates than white borrowers with similar credit profiles.

title: Meatpacking Districts Next Act Includes an Influx of Office Space and More
description: The meatpacking district in Manhattan is about to grow even busier, as office towers and Samsung move in and add a layer of transformation to an area that once reeked of slaughterhouses and literally vibrated with railway commerce.

title: Fleeting Stability for a Woman Charged With Killing Her Son
description: With the birth of her second son nearly two years ago, friends say, Latisha Fisher, a woman who had always lived as though she had nothing to lose, had begun life anew. No more sitting on her stoop on the Lower East Side of Manhattan at 2 a.m., sipping from a bottle. No more marijuana and cocaine. No more of the violence that sent her to Rikers Island and no more of the turmoil that landed her in the files of New York Citys child welfare agency.

title: When It Comes to Reading, Is Pleasure Suspect?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Anna Holmes and Benjamin Moser debate whether pleasure in reading is trivial or vital.

title: Pretty in Punk
description: Rocker embellishments with a softer side.

title: Andreessen Horowitz Invests Another $52 Million in Network Start-Up Tanium
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Last summer, Andreessen Horowitz turned heads when it poured $90 million  one of its biggest investments ever  into Tanium, a start-up aimed at helping companies manage their computer networks.

title: The Sound of Friendship
description: Dear Diary:

title: Mystery Surrounds Disappearance of Xinjiang Article and Related Apology
description: The article, about a Muslim couple in the western Chinese region of Xinjiang being sentenced to prison for growing a long beard and wearing a burqa, appeared in state news media on Sunday. By Monday morning, it had vanished.

title: Endurance Specialty Holdings to Acquire Bermuda Reinsurer
description: LONDON  The Bermuda insurer Endurance Specialty Holdings said on Tuesday that it had agreed to acquire the property and casualty reinsurer Montpelier Re Holdings for $1.83 billion.

title: Charter Communications Bid for Cable RivalBright House Networks Among Last Merger Wave
description: In the cable business, the big keep getting bigger.

title: Readers Turn: Hissing About Moving to the South
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots weekly newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Comedy Central Stands Behind Trevor Noah, New Daily Show Host, Amid Scrutiny
description: Within hours of the announcement that he had been named the new host of The Daily Show, the comedian Trevor Noah was subjected to the full scrutiny of the Internet. As potential audience members scoured his past work and social media presence for more clues to Mr. Noah, a South African comedian, they uncovered many posts on his Twitter account that they deemed offensive to women or Jews.

title: Melissa Clark: By the Book
description: Melissa Clark, a Times food writer, discusses books with Pamela Paul, the Book Review editor.

title: Mary Norris Muses on a Lifetime of Literary Vigilance in Between You & Me
description: No one else  not the author, not the editor, not the fact checker  caught it, but to Mary Norris, the offending word might as well have been wearing leather hot pants and doing the cancan right there on the page. And so she rescued a colleague from the special circle of mortification reserved for writers for The New Yorker who confuse flour with flower.

title: Aid for Yemen Dwindles as Need Rises Amid Chaos
description: CAIRO  The United Nations human rights chief warned on Tuesday that Yemen was on the brink of collapse, as health officials in the southern port city of Aden described a medical system failing after weeks of urban warfare that had left scores dead and hospitals overflowing with bodies.

title: 1890: Misery in Rome
description: ROME  A group of pale men surrounded two rude graves in today [March 28], and tenderly laid clumsy laurel wreaths upon them. Thirteen months ago there were riots in Rome. Hundreds of workingmen demanded the means of life. The Kings troops poured around them, a bristling sea of steel. Over two hundred prisoners were taken. Next day, all were released but thirty-four. These men have been in the prison ever since, and were only tried this week. Twenty-nine were declared innocent after more than a years suffering. In the meantime two of the poor fellows died and the men who crowned their dust today were the released prisoners.  The New York Herald, European Edition, April 1, 1890

title: Yoox and Net-a-Porter Combine for Big Data Fashion Domination
description: Tuesdays merger between Net-a-Porter and Yoox, which will create the largest and most powerful luxury e-commerce group in the sector, has a lot of interesting implications for us online shoppers, some good and some that perhaps should give us pause.

title: Aaron Hernandez Trial: The Defense Rests
description: The prosecution at the first-degree murder trial of the former Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez in Fall River, Mass., took more than two months with 131 witnesses.

title: The Travel Selfie: I Was Here, Give Me a Discount
description: SelfiePal, a steel stick with a clamp to secure a smartphone, arrived in the mail on a recent afternoon along with some advice.

title: Not an Adoption Diary. Yet.
description: Here is a good indication of how much things have changed since I started writing this diary 10 weeks ago: The other night, I was carrying my baby daughter, Evy, around our condo, trying to get her to burp after feeding her. Evys a difficult burper, to say the least; no matter how much we rub and pat her back or put her down and pick her up, she rarely lets out a burp, no matter how much she wants to. So as I walked her around the house, rubbing her back, I said a sentence I never thought Id say in my life:

title: 15 Bodies Pulled From Home Hit by Landslide in Northern India
description: NEW DELHI  Rescue workers have recovered 15 bodies from a house that collapsed after being hit by a landslide caused by torrential rains in the Indian-administered state of Jammu and Kashmir in the north.

title: Politicians Books Came From Libraries Across Italy, Police Say
description: PARIS  The authorities pursuing a thread in one of the biggest rare book heists in Italian historysaid this week that some of the 20,000 books seized two years ago from the private Milan library of Marcello DellUtri, a former senator in prison for Mafia association, had been removed from public libraries and religious institutions across Italy.

title: Getting a Good View of the Boston Marathon
description: The world looks at the Boston Marathon as a prestigious event for elite athletes  you have to qualify to run  but Boston looks at it as a big block party.

title: Bills on Religious Freedom Upset Capitols in Arkansas and Indiana
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  The Arkansas legislature on Tuesday passed its version of a bill described by proponents as a religious freedom law, even as Indianas political leaders struggled to gain control over a growing backlash that has led to calls to boycott the state because of criticism that its law could be a vehicle for discrimination against gay couples.

title: Warburg Pincus to Invest $500 Million in Oil and Gas Firm I.R.M.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Warburg Pincus, armed with its first-ever energy investment fund, has not let low oil prices deter it from seeking out deals in the petroleum sector.

title: Fueled by Market Rally in China, GF Securities Raises $3.6 Billion in I.P.O.
description: HONG KONG  Ordinary Chinese investors are doubling down on stocks, pushing the Shanghai market to seven-year highs  and their brokers are cashing in.

title: The Enigma of Haute Couture
description: These clothes couldnt look any more modern  dramatic silhouettes, dark colors, floral appliqus  yet they are created in the most traditional manner. Is custom-made fashion a treasure or a relic?

title: In Nigerias Election, Muhammadu Buhari Defeats Goodluck Jonathan
description: KANO, Nigeria  With anger swelling over corruption, inequality and a devastating Islamist insurgency in the nations north, Nigerians by a wide margin chose an austere former general who once ruled with an iron hand to be their next president, according to election results on Tuesday.

title: Duke Is Still Standing Despite a Lack of Experience
description: HOUSTON  The Blue Devils looked tentative under the basket, milling about in such a way that they seemed to need Coach Mike Krzyzewskis guidance on what to do next. A ladder was set up. A net hung above them. Aside from being told not to run with those scissors in their hands, they were on their own.

title: Could Another Democrat Beat Hillary Clinton? Strategists Offer a Blueprint
description: She has been called inevitable. The cant-be-stopped candidate. Hillary Rodham Clinton is such an overwhelming favorite in presidential primary polls that most prominent Democrats are taking a pass on challenging her.

title: Queens Woman, 70, Fatally Shot at Her Door, Police Say
description: The pounding at the front door came in the middle of the night, when most of those living in the gray, two-story home in Queens were asleep.

title: Verbatim: Pence Looks to Clarify Indiana Law
description: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana, asking that a fix to the law be sent to him by the end of the week and saying I abhor discrimination.

title: In Italy, Matteo Renzi Aims to Upend the Old World Order
description: ROME  In a tailored black suit, Prime Minister Matteo Renzi stood before the Italian Senate recently and applauded lawmakers for taking some tough votes on reforms that he boasted would jump-start the countrys economy after the longest slump in its modern history.

title: House Panel Seeks Private Talk With Hillary Clinton About Email
description: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the House committee investigating the Benghazi attacks asked Hillary Rodham Clinton on Tuesday to appear for a private interview about her exclusive use of a personal email account when she was secretary of state.

title: 1940: Inquiry Sought Into Nazi Book
description: WASHINGTON  Whatever the German government may have had in mind in publishing the White Book of alleged Polish diplomatic papers, wherein the United States appeared to have egged the Allies on to war against the Nazi Reich, the reaction here today [March 31] was distinctly in the tone of Secretary of State Cordell Hulls official denial of the authenticity of views set forth in the documents. Even outside the Administration the White Book was regarded as an attempt at propaganda.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, April 1, 1940

title: The Iran Nuclear Deal  A Simple Guide
description: A guide to help you navigate the deal between global powers and Tehran.

title: Daily News Said to Get Bids From Cablevision and Billionaire Grocer
description: The billionaire owner of the Gristedes grocery chain and the owner of Newsday and the Madison Square Garden Company have both submitted bids for The Daily News in New York, according to news reports and two people familiar with the negotiations.

title: 9 New York Doctors Are Accused of Defrauding Medicaid Using Homeless People
description: Free sneakers, shoes and boots today, Bernard Rorie shouted, standing outside a soup kitchen in East New York, Brooklyn, where he was being recorded by investigators

title: Raid to Rescue Hostage in Istanbul Ends in Death
description: ISTANBUL  A prominent Istanbul prosecutor, held for hours by two leftist extremists in the main courthouse here, was killed Tuesday evening after Turkish special forces stormed the building, setting off a barrage of gunfire and explosions, in a desperate attempt to rescue him. The militants were also killed.

title: Michael Angelakis to Step Down as Comcast Finance Officer
description: Michael J. Angelakis, who helped steer Comcast through its acquisition of NBCUniversal and also was instrumental in the attempt to take over Time Warner Cable, is leaving his post as chief financial officer to lead a new Comcast-backed company with $4 billion in firepower for strategic investments.

title: Rolling Stones to Tour North America This Summer
description: Once again, the Rolling Stones will spend the summer in stadiums across America.

title: The Healing Power of Your Own Medical Records
description: Steven Keatings doctors and medical experts view him as a citizen of the future.

title: Analyzing Your Twitter Life
description: Q. Aside from seeing retweets and favorites, how can I tell if anybody is looking at my Twitter posts?

title: At Robertas, Pizza and a Broken Partnership
description: It all got rolling in the middle of 2007, when the national economy was faltering and the graffiti-tagged, barbed-wired lots of Bushwick, Brooklyn, seemed like a perfectly apocalyptic place in which to start a never-ending party.

title: A Texas Ban on Gambling That Doesnt Quite Work
description: SULLIVAN CITY, Tex.  Casino gambling with cash payoffs is illegal in Texas. But on a drizzly Tuesday afternoon in February, you could not tell it by the scene inside a former tire shop near this Rio Grande Valley border town: a few dozen men and women gambling on 75 slot machines in windowless rooms.

title: Japan, Sticking With U.S., Says It Wont Join China-Led Bank
description: TOKYO  Japanese leaders indicated on Tuesday that their nation would not become a founding member of a new Chinese-led Asian development bank but instead remain loyal to the United States, which has urged its allies to refrain from joining.

title: 2007: First Presidential Campaign Speech
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton made her first appearance as a presidential candidate in January 2007 in Des Moines . She addressed rising economic inequality and being a female candidate.

title: Why More Education Wont Fix Economic Inequality
description: Suppose you accept the persuasive data that inequality has been rising in the United States and most advanced nations in recent decades. But suppose you dont want to fight inequality through politically polarizing steps like higher taxes on the wealthy or a more generous social welfare system.

title: New Lawsuits Emerge in HPs Long-Running Autonomy Dispute
description: Hewlett-Packard says it is suing the founder of Autonomy, a data intelligence company that HP bought four years ago in what is now seen as a disastrous acquisition. In return, the founder says he will also sue.

title: Lufthansa Says Germanwings Pilot Reported Deep Depression
description: DSSELDORF, Germany  The co-pilot at the controls of the German jetliner that crashed in the French Alps last week informed Lufthansa in 2009 that he had suffered from severe depression, the company said Tuesday.

title: Indiana Governor on Confusion Over Law
description: Gov. Mike Pence, Republican of Indiana, says that the religious freedom law passed in the state was never intended to give a license to discriminate against gay and lesbian couples.

title: The Risks of Jay Zs New Venture
description: It was probably only a matter of time before Jay Z got into the streaming-music business given its growing popularity. Whats interesting about his plans for Tidal, the service that he bought for $56 million, is that he wants to structure it as a cooperative of sorts by giving shares in it to other musicians.

title: A Stew That Makes the Most of Spring Greens
description: I think in green in early April. Its too early for some of the brighter spring vegetables, but dark green collards, light green fennel and bright jalapeo are all available at my local supermarket. And in my pantry, theres a bag of very pale green dried flageolet beans; this early spring stew is a perfect home for them.

title: Belarus Free Theater Returns to New York With Trash Cuisine
description: The Belarus Free Theater troupe, banned from its homeland for its politically charged works, will be returning to New York this spring with the American premiere of the original play Trash Cuisine. The work addresses capital punishment and opens on April 29 at La MaMas Ellen Stewart Theater. It runs through May 17.

title: 2004: Hillary Clintons D.N.C. Speech
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton introduced her husband, former president Bill Clinton, at the Democratic National Convention held in Boston in July 2004.

title: U.S. Dance Troupes to Tour Overseas
description: In 1954, the Limn Dance Company was one of the first American dance troupes to be sent on a government-sponsored tour, to South America, under a new cultural diplomacy directive from President Dwight D. Eisenhower. Now the company will once again assume the role of cultural ambassador. On Tuesday, the Limn company was announced as one of three companies selected for the fifth iteration of DanceMotion USA, an initiative of the State Department, produced in partnership with the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Joining the Limn company are Dance Heginbotham and Bodytraffic, a Los Angeles troupe.

title: Verizon Wireless Customers Can Now Opt Out of Supercookies
description: Verizon Wireless customers now have the ability to completely opt out of the phone carriers controversial ad-targeting program that tagged users with undeletable tracking codes, which critics called supercookies.

title: Charters Deal May Not Be the Last Word on Bright House
description: The United States cable puzzle is starting to take shape. None of the pieces is a snug fit just yet, though.

title: Exercise Beats Vitamin D for Injury Prevention
description: Exercise and vitamin D supplements may help prevent injurious falls in older adults, a randomized trial found.

title: Angel Investors Lend Expertise as Well as Cash
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Like many tech entrepreneurs, Joshua Reeves says he thinks his company can change the world. It may do it, too  with the way it was financed, as much as by the product itself.

title: New York Times Develops an Apple Watch App
description: The New York Times said on Tuesday that it had developed an app to provide brief news reports for the Apple watch when it is released next month.

title: Small Plates Grow Up
description: We live in a messy revolutionary period for restaurants. The old rules for going out to eat, under which Mom and Dad ambled down a predictable path from appetizer to main course to dessert, with Mom pausing halfway through dinner to ask about Dads veal chop, were repealed some time ago.In place of rules, we got small plates, and anarchy.The last decade has been the era of messy tables, of gonzo pacing, of menus that came with a spoken introduction, of senseless plating, of endless instructions to share dishes that collapsed into rubble when you tried.

title: Clinton Team Nabs McAuliffe Adviser to Focus on Iowa
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton appears determined to put to rest questions about whether she will aggressively compete in the Iowa caucuses.

title: Whats the First Thing You Should Do When You Get into College?
description: Defer.

title: A New Exhibition Memorializes the Madness of Jean Paul Gaultier
description: The Grand Palais in Paris will celebrate Jean Paul Gaultier this spring with an extensive show featuring 175 haute couture designs, select ready-to-wear pieces and, of course, Madonnas iconic cone bra  all presented on mannequins topped with dramatic wigs by the hairstylist Odile Gilbert. Along with sketches, film costumes, famous red-carpet looks and videos (including clips from Eurotrash, the talk show Gaultier co-hosted in the 90s), there will be a section showcasing the former Herms creative directors rich corsetry, and a hi-tech installation that projects his ensembles onto visitors so that, says the curator Thierry-Maxime Loriot, everyone can be a Gaultier model.

title: Saudi Arabias Ominous Reach Into Yemen
description: The Saudi-led military intervention in Yemen threatens to turn what has been a civil war between competing branches of Islam into a wider regional struggle involving Iran. It could also destroy any hope of stability in Yemen. Even before the Saudis and their Arab allies started the bombing, Yemen was in severe distress; on Tuesday, the United Nations high commissioner for human rights warned that it is now on the brink of collapse.

title: Iraqi Claims That Tikrit Has Fallen Is Disputed
description: BAGHDAD  The prime minister of Iraq claimed that his countrys security forces had reached the center of Tikrit on Tuesday. A subtitle crawling across TV screens tuned to the official Iraqiya television network went further: Tikrit has fallen to us, it said. On YouTube, an Iraqi flag was shown flying atop a downtown government building.

title: Blithe Spirit
description: A true aesthete with a taste for imperfection, Victoria Press creates her decorating masterpiece  frayed carpets and all  in a storied London townhouse.

title: Recipes for Health: Passover
description: Recipes for Passover.

title: Campaign Finance Complaints Filed Against 4 Presidential Hopefuls
description: WASHINGTON  For months, White House hopefuls from both parties have been raising millions in unlimited contributions at upscale fund-raisers from Manhattan to Palm Springs, Calif.  all without officially declaring themselves candidates and becoming subject to federal caps on contributions.

title: Obama Rejects Republican Bid to Overturn New Union Rules
description: WASHINGTON  In his latest confrontation with Congress, President Obama on Tuesday blocked Republican efforts to overturn new union-friendly federal regulations issued by his administration.

title: Obama Removes Weapons Freeze Against Egypt
description: WASHINGTON  Seeking to repair relations with a longtime ally at a time of spreading war in the Middle East, President Obama on Tuesday lifted an arms freeze against Egypt that he had first imposed after the military overthrow of the countrys democratically elected government nearly two years ago.

title: Old Hat
description: The baseball cap is ubiquitous but not anonymous; with a tilt of the bill or a curve of the brim, it communicates a definite point of view.

description: Headliner

description: tk

title: Soho House Lets the Public In With Turkish Baths
description: Soho House, the members-only social club that beganin London and has since built additional outposts around England and the United States (plus one in Berlin), opens the doors of its newest location, in Istanbul, next month. The venue was constructed ina 19th-century mansion, Palazzo Corpi, which housed the U.S. Embassy for 100 years (until 2003) and was originally builtas a home for a wealthy shipbuilder, Ignazio Corpi. The propertys original Italian frescoes and marble floors remain intact.

title: AshLeigh McHales Wishes
description: Ms. McHales document.

title: Investing Early On for Insights, Not Profits
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The small office on the edge of the financial district here serves as a kind of listening post for a giant Spanish bank.

title: Jets to Stay in Florham Park for Training Camp
description: Following a leaguewide trend, the Jets announced Tuesday that they would hold training camp at their headquarters in Florham Park, N.J.

description: Karly Kochs document.

title: How Lauren Weller Sidorowicz Wanted to Be Remembered
description: Lauren Weller Sidorowiczs wishes.

title: 1993: A Healthcare Reform P.S.A.
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, in a public service announcement released while she was first lady, outlined proposed reforms to the healthcare system.

title: South Carolina, Once a Doormat, Is Now a Step From a Final
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  Aleighsa Welch wore a basketball net around her neck like treasured family jewelry as she stood in the locker room Sunday afternoon at the Greensboro Coliseum. South Carolina had just defeated Florida State, 80-74, to advance to the Final Four of the womens N.C.A.A. tournament for the first time in program history. Welch was savoring the moment  until a giddy teammate ran over and asked her for the net they had just cut down in celebration.

title: Republican Abolishment Threats? Just Politics, I.R.S. Chief Says
description: The demolition of the Internal Revenue Service  a perennial punching bag for many conservatives  has become a rallying cry for Republicans who are thinking about running for president in 2016.

title: Making Mac and Cheese Without a Recipe
description: Amanda Hesser and Merrill Stubbs of Food52 show you how to make macaroni and cheese without a recipe.

title: Blue Note Jazz Festival to Mark Fifth Anniversary With a Wide-Ranging Lineup
description: The Blue Note Jazz Festival will celebrate its fifth anniversary in June, with headliners including the pop-R&B singer Natalie Cole, the blues legend Buddy Guy and the venerable South African jazz pianist Abdullah Ibrahim. The festival runs all month long with shows at a handful of venues in Manhattan; details are at bluenotejazzfestival.com.

title: Small Plates Grow Up
description: The shrunken-portions revolution has won, as top chefs enter the fray and start shaping the new rules of dining.

title: Nasdaq Builds Nursery for Start-Ups
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Nasdaq OMX Group has long courted technology companies as they seek to go public.

title: Food For Thought
description: I once had a conversation with some Times people about reader interests, which are something the paper knows much more about than it did in the pre-digital age. And what they said, ruefully, was that what readers really seem to care about is food  sure, they may email a hard-hitting column or a revelatory piece of investigative reporting, but the sure-fire stuff is about eating (and health, and using animal training techniques on your husband).

title: Religious Freedom and Political Lies in Indiana
description: One of the most popular rejoinders to the charge that so-called religious freedom laws, such as the one enacted last week in Indiana, are little more than vehicles for anti-gay discrimination is that no one ever uses them to discriminate.

title: Japanese Fabric, Illustrated
description: From a series for T in which the artist Leanne Shapton makes new artworks from pictures in old books.

title: Review: The Lizzie Borden Chronicles, a Lifetime Series Starring Christina Ricci
description: What, you ask, became of Lizzie? Turns out she stayed very busy. Call the cops, alert the warden. No ones safe around this Borden.

title: What You Get For ... $1,695,000
description: This weeks offerings include a log house in California, Southwestern style in Arizona and an 1844 house in Georgia.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Quantity Time Begets Quality Time, and Parents Spend Enough of Both
description: The quality, not quantity trope about the time parents spend with children has been around for decades. Its a good one, when it helps parents (particularly mothers) to release their guilt about not spending Little House on the Prairie amounts of time with their children. New research, well described by Brigid Schulte in The Washington Post, supports the idea that such maternal omnipresence isnt necessary for children. In fact, it appears the sheer amount of time parents spend with their kids between the ages of 3 and 11 has virtually no relationship to how children turn out, and a minimal effect on adolescents, according to the first large-scale longitudinal study of parent time to be published in April in the Journal of Marriage and Family, she writes. The finding includes childrens academic achievement, behavior and emotional well-being.

title: Hillary Clintons Pennsylvania Roots
description: While the future Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton grew up in Illinois, her family ties are in many ways stronger in Scranton, Pa.

title: After Horror in Libya, Christians Grief in an Egyptian Village
description: When Islamic State militants in Libya killed 21 Egyptian Christians, Jonathan Rashad went to the village many called home to understand the impact.

title: Review: Don Carlo Gets a Gripping Revival at the Met Opera
description: A solid cast with no weak links and a probing conductor. Thats what it takes, even more than superlative individual performances, for the profundity of Verdis Don Carlo to come through. Thats what the Metropolitan Operas revival offered on Monday when the director Nicholas Hytners 2010 production, which combines traditional and contemporary imagery and was last seen here in 2013, returned to the house.

title: OAS, Brazilian Engineering Company, Seeks Bankruptcy Protection
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The corruption scandal  surrounding the petroleum giant Petrobras of Brazil has claimed another victim: The countrys third-largest engineering and construction company, OAS, requested a bankruptcy courts protection on Tuesday.

title: Review: Alt-J at Madison Square Garden
description: Cryptic with a crisp beat: Thats how Alt-J keeps its songs, letting listeners choose how much to decipher and how much to enjoy more simply. Its a strategy the band probably learned from Radiohead; Alt-J also shares Radioheads broad but particular eclecticism and now its arena-sized audiences. On Monday night, Alt-J sold out Madison Square Garden. (On Apple keyboards, Alt-J produces the symbol for delta, used in equations to represent change.)

title: Law Schools and Industry Show Signs of Life, Despite Forecasts of Doom
description: Law school enrollment has plummeted to the lowest level in decades. If a bottom has been reached, is now a good time to go to law school?

title: Review: American Odyssey, a New NBC Series, Stars Anna Friel
description: Casting directors are the quartermasters of the TV and movie industries  theres not a lot of glory or recognition for their work, but its vital nonetheless.

title: Court in Turkey Acquits Military Officers of Trying to Overthrow Government
description: ISTANBUL  An Istanbul court on Tuesday acquitted 236 military officers who had been convicted of trying to overthrow the government after the prosecutor said that evidence in the case had been forged.

title: Review: Paul Lewis and Lisa Batiashvili, Recital Partners at Alice Tully Hall
description: Paul Lewis, the Liverpudlian pianist renowned for his solo Beethoven and Schubert, is fastidious in his choice of recital partners. His work with the tenor Mark Padmore has been a recent touchstone in Schuberts lieder cycles. In piano duets, his steady temperament has beautifully complemented artists like Imogen Cooper and Steven Osborne.

title: Strikes in Argentina Bring Transportation to Standstill
description: BUENOS AIRES  The taut political climate in Argentina came under new strain on Tuesday as strikes by transportation workers and others brought the country to a halt.

title: The False Hope of a Limited Government, Built on Tax Breaks
description: In the early years of the Reagan Revolution, Senator Robert Packwood, then the powerful Republican chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, offered a robust  if unusual  defense of the tax exclusion for employer-provided health insurance: It prevented the government from getting bigger.

title: Pictures of the Day: Nigeria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Nigeria, the United States, the Netherlands and Germany.

title: U.S. Delays Deportation of Salvadoran Ex-OfficialAccused in 80s Killings
description: After a 16-year legal battle, the Obama administration has received court approval to deport a former defense minister of El Salvador accused of participating in human rights abuses by his troops when he was a top military commander in the 1980s.

title: Where Wall Street and Silicon Valley Intersect
description: Entrepreneurs and venture capitalists try to resist Wall Streets entreaties, but a new relationship has lead to new fund-raising methods.

title: Obama Commutes Long Sentences of 22 Drug Offenders
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama commuted the prison sentences of 22 people on Tuesday, part of an effort to correct a disparity among inmates who received lengthy sentences under laws passed during the crack epidemic of the 1980s and 90s.

title: March 31, 2015 Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Nigeria, India, the United States and the Netherlands.

title: Review: Woman in Gold Stars Helen Mirren in Tug of War Over Artwork
description: Woman in Gold rests heavily on the squared shoulders of Helen Mirren, whose character, Maria Altmann, is a proud, elderly Austrian Jewish woman who fled the Nazi scourge to settle in California. Reawakened to the past by the death of her sister, at whose 1998 funeral she is first observed, Maria wages a protracted legal battle to regain possession of a priceless canvas stolen from her family by the Nazis 60 years earlier.

title: Orbital Publishing Accused of Fraud in Selling Subscriptions
description: Top prosecutors in several states accused an Oregon company on Tuesday of overcharging consumers for subscriptions to newspapers, magazines and other periodicals.

title: Review: In Hal Hartleys Ned Rifle, Closure for a Son and a Series
description: Hal Hartley is no longer as dominant a figure in independent cinema as he was in the 1990s, when his deadpan humor was a mainstay in art-house theaters. His magnum opus remains Henry Fool (1998), whose title character (Thomas Jay Ryan), a rogue with a criminal past, inspires Simon Grim (James Urbaniak), a garbage man in Woodside, Queens, to write poetry. As a poet, Simon finds worldwide success.

title: Plan to Keep 1,700 RadioShack Stores Open Is Approved
description: A bankruptcy judge gave his blessing on Tuesday to a plan that would keep about 1,700 RadioShack stores open, saying he would approve the plan over a higher cash bid that would probably have liquidated the retailer but raised more money for its creditors.

title: Supreme Court Weighs Overruling a 1964 Patent Decision
description: WASHINGTON  The dispute before the Supreme Court on Tuesday concerned a toy made up of a glove with a valve and a canister of pressurized foam. It was designed, Marvel Enterprises told the court in its brief, to evoke Spider-Man, Marvels iconic superhero renowned for his spider superpowers and web-slinging.

title: John Krasinski vs. Anna Kendrick
description: In this exclusive clip from the new Spike TV show, Lip Sync Battle, John Krasinski and Anna Kendrick compete for the top spot.

title: Living in Peekskill, N.Y.
description: The city in northwest Westchester County is being discovered by those looking for housing bargains and a reasonable commute.

title: Player Ratings: Switzerland (1) vs. United States (1)
description: Another game, another late goal for the United States national team, which tied Switzerland, 1-1, on Tuesday in Zurich.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Excerpt: Planet of the Apes
description: A scene from Planet of the Apes, with Charlton Heston.

title: Etan Patzs Mother Testifies at Murder Trial
description: Julie Patz, the mother of Etan Patz, the 6-year-old boy who disappeared while walking to his school bus stop in 1979, testified on Tuesday that she did not recall the man whom defense lawyers for Pedro Hernandez cast as an alternate suspect in the boys death as having ever been in her apartment.

title: On Spike TV, Celebrities Clash Where Everyone Can Watch Their Lips Move
description: John Krasinski was driving on Route 101 to Los Angeles with some friends about two years ago when the global beats of Lionel Richies All Night Long (All Night) took over the car. The actor and comedian, known for playing Jim Halpert on The Office, grabbed an air microphone and started lip syncing.

title: Just Dont Call Them Bling
description: Gold watches are catching on with a street-smart crowd.

title: This Will Get The Lonely Goatherd Out of Your Head
description: An Editorial Observer piece I wrote on Monday suggested that the 1965 movie The Sound of Music could be improved upon, as recent theatrical revivals of Rodgers and Hammerstein musicals have been. My point was that by removing some of the Hollywood artificial sweetener, and perhaps darkening and deepening the themes already in the text, a more satisfying, more human, less mockable musical might result.

title: Syracuse to Drop Fossil Fuel Stocks From Endowment
description: Syracuse University is dropping all fossil fuel stocks from its endowment, the university announced on Tuesday.

title: A Conversation With Veronica Mainetti of the Sorgente Group of America
description: Ms. Mainetti, 36, is president of the Sorgente Group of America, one of three holding companies of the Sorgente Group of Rome, which is run by her father, Valter Mainetti, the majority shareholder and chief executive.

title: A Presidents Best Friend
description: A brief history of presidential pets, from Franklin D. Roosevelt to Barack Obama.

title: Scott Walker, Allergic to Dogs, May Run Against Political History
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin and his wife, Tonette, had planned to spend a recent Friday night at the Nashua home of Jennifer Horn, the New Hampshire Republican chairwoman.

title: Activist Links More Than 26,000 Twitter Accounts to ISIS
description: A cybersecurity activist who recently helped publicize 9,200 Twitter accounts that were said to be linked to the Islamic State released a roster of 26,382 accounts on Tuesday, the biggest such list yet.

title: A Presidents Best Friend
description: A brief history of presidential pets, from Franklin D. Roosevelt to Barack Obama.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Buhari Supporters Celebrate in Nigeria
description: Supporters of the former military ruler, Muhammadu Buhari, celebrated his victory over the incumbent, Goodluck Jonathan, in the presidential election on Tuesday.

title: Gary Dahl, Inventor of the Pet Rock, Dies at 78
description: It was a craze to rival the Hula-Hoop, and even less explicable. For a mere three dollars and 95 cents, a consumer could buy ... a rock  a plain, ordinary, egg-shaped rock of the kind one could dig up in almost any backyard.

title: Etsy Sets Price Range for Its I.P.O.
description: Etsy, the online marketplace beloved by makers of handmade jewelry and yoga bags, is hoping that Wall Street investors will be equally ardent fans.

title: In Canada, Unabashed Wooing of Commercial Drones
description: OTTAWA  It didnt take long for Canadas transport minister to exploit the promotional possibilities of Amazon testing its drone delivery service in the country  testing that the company confirmed on Monday.

title: GoDaddy Said to Price I.P.O. Above Expected Range
description: San Francisco  Nearly four years ago, GoDaddy was an Internet registration company with a history of risqu advertising.

title: Group Linked to Islamic State Claims Responsibility for Tunisia Attack
description: TUNIS  A day after the Tunisian government said it had killed the orchestrator of the massacre at the National Bardo Museum and rounded up most of those involved, another group of militants declaring themselves to be members of the Islamic State operating inside Tunisia claimed responsibility for the attack and threatened more in the future.

title: Carlos Falchi, 70, Dies; Turned Exotic Animal Skins Into Coveted Handbags
description: Carlos Falchi, a Brazilian-born accessories designer famous for his amiably rumpled, highly coveted handbags made of the skins of exotic animals, died on Friday in Durham, N.C. He was 70.

title: Hollywood Reporter Signs Content Deal With Tencent, Chinese Online Giant
description: LOS ANGELES  Pushing to broaden its international readership  even if that means the occasional censored article  The Hollywood Reporter said on Tuesday that it had signed an expansive content deal with the Chinese online giant Tencent Holdings.

title: Defense Rests in Boston Marathon Bombing Trial After Just 4 Witnesses
description: BOSTON  After questioning just four witnesses over five hours, the defense for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev in the Boston Marathon bombing trial rested its case on Tuesday.

title: Silicon Valley Leaders, New to Social Issues, Come Together Over Indiana Law
description: The technology industrys leaders have found their collective voice on a social issue in the last week, rallying with great intensity against a new Indiana law that will allow businesses, they predict, to discriminate against gay couples. The heads of Apple, Salesforce.com, Yelp and Square have all publicly criticized the law, as have some leaders from other industries.

title: Gas Utilities Reduce Leaks of Methane, Study Finds
description: Utilities are making progress in reducing leaks from their natural gas distribution networks, a new study has found, but the industry and regulators can do more.

title: Amazon Dash Aims to Be a Push-Button Substitute for the Supply Run
description: Amazon has built a booming business of making it easy to buy things online. It has a patented one-click ordering mechanism. It offers subscription-style services. And on Tuesday, Amazon unveiled a pilot program that allows customers to order items with the push of a single physical button.

title: In Advertising Technology Deal, Rubicon Buys Chango
description: The advertising company Rubicon Project said on Tuesday that it had agreed to buy the Canadian start-up Chango for about $122 million, in the latest sign that the advertising technology industry is consolidating.

title: Man in Fatal Encounter With N.S.A. Is Identified
description: The F.B.I. on Tuesday identified a man who was fatally shot by the police at the National Security Agency as Ricky Hall, 27, of Baltimore, who had a criminal record that included convictions for prostitution, theft and assault. A passenger in the vehicle that Mr. Hall was driving, Kevin Fleming, 20, also of Baltimore, remained hospitalized for gunshot wounds. Law enforcement officials said the men were picked up by a 60-year-old Baltimore man early Monday and driven to a motel in Elkridge, Md. They stole his Ford Escape and sped down a highway exit, apparently unintentionally, that is reserved for the N.S.A. Agency police shot the men as Mr. Hall drove toward a parked police car, the N.S.A. said.

title: Tired of War, Yemeni Bloggers Say, Enough
description: As the death toll mounts in Yemen, and airstrikes make life in the capital, Sana, a nerve-racking ordeal, Yemeni bloggers continue to post firsthand dispatches on social networks, frequently tagged with the Arabic word kefaya, meaning enough.
